{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","title":"The Competitive Advantage of a Mobile-Enabled Workforce","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170294","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/16/the-competitive-advantage-of-a-mobile-enabled-workforce/\" title=\"The Competitive Advantage of a Mobile-Enabled Workforce\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/The-Competitive-Advantage-of-a-Mobile-Enabled-Workforce-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"remote workforce\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/The-Competitive-Advantage-of-a-Mobile-Enabled-Workforce-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/The-Competitive-Advantage-of-a-Mobile-Enabled-Workforce-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/The-Competitive-Advantage-of-a-Mobile-Enabled-Workforce-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/The-Competitive-Advantage-of-a-Mobile-Enabled-Workforce.jpg 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Even before we made a dramatic pivot to favoring remote work due to coronavirus (COVID-19), there was a shift to mobile workforces and BYOD underway. According to research conducted in October 2019, as many as 70% of U.S. employees were no longer sitting behind a desk every day, and there were already more than 92 million mobile-enabled workers in the United States. Here is the competitive advantage of a mobile-enabled workforce.</p>\n<h3>The mobile-enabled workforce had grown 11X faster than the total workforce from 2005 to 2019.</h3>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/photo-of-man-using-laptop-4049459.jpg\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-170295\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/photo-of-man-using-laptop-4049459-300x200.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"587\" height=\"391\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/photo-of-man-using-laptop-4049459-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/photo-of-man-using-laptop-4049459-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/photo-of-man-using-laptop-4049459-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/photo-of-man-using-laptop-4049459-1536x1024.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/photo-of-man-using-laptop-4049459.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 587px) 100vw, 587px\" /></a></p>\n<p>Employers were exploring the extent of this change and how it was impacting the business and bottom line. Those instituting mobile workforce plans believed they would ultimately be at a business advantage (though none could have foreseen how quickly that would manifest).</p>\n<p>Beyond the qualitative benefits of workplace flexibility, it was estimated that employers could save $11,000 per year for every mobile-enabled worker when taking into account workspace leases, amenities, and more.</p>\n<p>Clearly, not every business or employee can do their job or be <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/14/how-to-ensure-high-productivity-of-your-remote-workers/\">fully productive</a> when they work remotely. Perhaps they need a particular piece of equipment to perform their job duties or don’t have an acceptable space to use for work. But groups that often work in the field, mainstream office employees, and people in leadership roles should be enabled to work remotely. What’s more, they can be just as productive working remotely as they are in the office.</p>\n<h3><strong>Acting Short Term While Thinking Long Term</strong></h3>\n<p>Namely, these businesses experience a less severe drop in productivity, efficiency, and output.</p>\n<p>It’s important to remember, the advantages of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/27/remote-access-solutions-overcoming-the-challenges/\">having a sizeable mobile-enabled workforce</a> are not limited to situations such as the once-in-a-generation type response to COVID-19. Even lesser disruptions, like a power outage affecting an office or inclement weather making travel to the office slow or dangerous, are situations where being mobile-enabled is an advantage.</p>\n<h4>For business leaders looking to expand their mobile workforce’s numbers – either immediately or in the longer term – there are <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/05/remote-working-culture-the-facts-business-owners-need-to-know/\">cultural and structural changes</a> that should be top of mind.</h4>\n<p>Culturally, organizations must find ways to limit the need for onsite attendance as the norm. The preparation should involve increasing the use of communication tools for collaborative work sessions and facilitate quick questions or back-and-forth discussion. Furthermore, businesses must set achievable goals when it comes to shifting the focus from staying at work during work hours to completing work during work hours.</p>\n<p>Structurally, the first and most apparent employee needs are <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/19/5-actionable-strategies-for-boosting-employee-productivity/\">devices and tools</a> that will enable them for mobile work. Those devices must be secured appropriately for remote work and extended periods away from the office, which could present challenges for IT and regular activities such as patching.</p>\n<p>For those who can work from home, employees should be provided with what they need by the employer, or the expenses to pay for coverage at their home address – i.e., reimbursement for mixed-use assets – must be legally taken into consideration.</p>\n<p>Reimbursement is vital and will be an exciting development to follow as businesses and the economy adjust to this <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/29/how-to-prepare-for-a-future-of-remote-teams/\">period of increased remote work</a>. Over the past few years, emerging trends in employment law have required employers to recognize even small tasks performed by employees on their own devices as work.</p>\n<p>Employee work includes quick duties like clocking in or out – amounts of time that would have been considered too small to track in the past. As a result, unpaid <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/09/26/byod-is-more-than-a-trend-heres-how-to-encourage-it-while-still-keeping-your-network-safe/\">BYOD programs</a> have recently exposed employers to lawsuits. In the recent rush to remote work, those legal considerations may be taking a back seat to the physical constraints preventing remote work &#8212; whether that continues to be the case as businesses see a return to standard remains to be seen.</p>\n<p><strong>Creating Flexibility Where You Have Control</strong></p>\n<p>There are issues outside a company’s control, and those are creating dramatic impacts during this outbreak. The making and shipping of goods, for example, is an area where companies are experiencing massive disruption, even those that pulled away from China before the spread of coronavirus began. The disturbance throughout global supply chains is unlike anything we have seen before. Tourism and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/20/travel-industry-building-its-immunity-with-artificial-intelligence/\">travel industries</a> are also among the most directly impacted during the height of the viral spread.</p>\n<p>Still, there are some issues a company can control. That’s where businesses can gain an advantage by focusing their efforts and creating flexibility. Implementing a reimbursement program can help encourage employees to upgrade their home internet service, so they have <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/28/4-video-lead-generation-strategies-for-more-engagement/\">better video quality</a> in virtual meetings.</p>\n<p><strong>Companies can reduce employee stress over this period of change by communicating clear expectations and guidelines for conducting work in a remote setting.</strong></p>\n<p>Having a mobile-enabled workforce can ensure better business continuity in spite of office closures.</p>\n<p>Once a company has established a mobile-enabled approach, the business benefits are clear. In the near term, a mobile-enabled workforce can work through a health crisis without close physical proximity to coworkers that might put them at higher risk. But the advantages also extend to increased flexibility in multiple situations.</p>\n<h4>Conclusion</h4>\n<p>If you haven’t ironed out y<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/09/5-post-pandemic-changes-to-expect-in-the-workplace/\">our mobile workforce plan yet</a>, be sure to take the structural and cultural aspects of a good plan into account and keep state labor laws and reimbursement regulations on your radar. Once the current health crisis ends, your <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/30/3-ways-you-can-empower-your-remote-employees/\">business will be more resilient</a> and in a better position to thrive in the future.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Ketut Subiyanto; Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/16/the-competitive-advantage-of-a-mobile-enabled-workforce/\">The Competitive Advantage of a Mobile-Enabled Workforce</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 16 Jun 2020 23:26:54 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/The-Competitive-Advantage-of-a-Mobile-Enabled-Workforce.jpg","linkMd5":"978c4496d5d34fbc4caa1c8eb68f6a56","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn8@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-25-516_d8483ac10fab38b2.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/The-Competitive-Advantage-of-a-Mobile-Enabled-Workforce.jpg","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":853,"sourceBytes":148510,"destBytes":66884,"author":"Ken Robinson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/The-Competitive-Advantage-of-a-Mobile-Enabled-Workforce-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn59@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-16-758_293b0e3fab8f71c3.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/photo-of-man-using-laptop-4049459-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn80@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-20-565_ccb5672a80cfd68b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195875435},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","title":"Fundraising Now? Remember Morality Impacts Valuation","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=172595","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/15/fundraising-now-remember-morality-impacts-valuation/\" title=\"Fundraising Now? Remember Morality Impacts Valuation\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"177\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Remember-Morality-Impacts-Valuation-300x177.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"morality impacts valuation\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Remember-Morality-Impacts-Valuation-300x177.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Remember-Morality-Impacts-Valuation-900x531.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Remember-Morality-Impacts-Valuation-260x153.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Remember-Morality-Impacts-Valuation-1536x906.png 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Remember-Morality-Impacts-Valuation.png 1600w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Startup founders are trying to figure out how to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/01/startup-funding-a-comprehensive-guide-for-entrepreneurs/\">fundraise</a> through a pandemic and economic <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/01/recession-startup/\">crash</a>. New talk of capital <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/30/charting-a-course-between-two-extremes-of-startup-cash-management/\">efficiency</a> is gratifying, but there was another lesson from pre-COVID-19 valuation struggles. Morality matters.</p>\n<h3><strong>Venture capitalists and early-stage <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/31/vc-funding-in-2020-what-investors-look-for-in-startups/\">investors</a> have told all of us, founders are critical to a startup’s valuation. </strong></h3>\n<p>These investors also tell you the founder’s role cuts both ways. As a unicorn approaches an exit, the balance sheet needs to make sense. But importantly, headlines around WeWork, Uber, and Juul that may be fading into memory too fast were a signal.</p>\n<p>These companies were a signal for founders and their early investors to reexamine their understanding of morality and valuation.</p>\n<h2><b>“Morality” is it too strong a word?</b></h2>\n<p>Most of us almost never use the word morality when talking about entrepreneurialism. It is a strong word driving deep into what’s in the soul, and publicly at least we work to avoid judging others. Like many of us, I’d rather focus on my own actions, and associate with others who I can learn from, and who I admire.</p>\n<p>That’s probably why we don’t hear <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/22/what-small-businesses-and-entrepreneurs-can-learn-from-the-college-admission-scandal/\">morality</a> used often at business events. It’s a high stakes word. But we do hear it quietly standing behind other words we use more frequently, like reputation, purpose, brand, optics and litigation risk.</p>\n<p>WeWork’s founder was been accused of self-dealing, which in turn has thrown the company’s IPO into question. Investors saw the enterprise’s nearly $50 billion valuation eroded right as they were headed to the public markets.</p>\n<p>The founder stepped aside. Juul and its $38 billion valuation came under the spotlight after deaths and illnesses connected with vaping. Juul’s founder resigned.</p>\n<p>Uber is still living down reports of its founder’s past behavior, and California pushed to treat drivers like full-time employees and take on the associated costs.</p>\n<p>When the pandemic finally evolves into something more predictable, we can only wait for cannabis startups to find their way back into the news.</p>\n<p>Whether we believe a company is moral, or not, actually matters. As Marie Ekeland, founder of venture capital firm Daphni has suggested, it matters if a company represents what you want <a href=\"https://medium.com/@bibicheri/the-new-european-dream-44aeeb5bcd68\">the future</a> to look like. Alternatively, if a company is seen as faking it, tremendous value can evaporate. The conversation boils down further to whether the leaders of these companies can be trusted.</p>\n<h2><b>What people say behind your back</b></h2>\n<p>Amanda Hesser, the founder of Food52, has talked about this saying when we think about reputation, it’s kind of how people speak about you when you’re not in the room. Columbia University professor Sheena Iyengar has called out authenticity as being at the root of whether a customer, partner, or investor will do business with you.</p>\n<p>Iyengar suggests if you know who you are, and why you want to do what you’re doing, then you’re better at explaining it, and also you’re better at being more concrete about what <a href=\"https://www.bi.team/choice-authenticity-with-hanna-rosin-sheena-iyengar/\">choices</a> need to be made and what you’re looking to do when you make each choice.</p>\n<p>These ideas are right. Will people vouch for your <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/06/04/purpose-balance-and-interface-are-keys-to-successful-teams/\">character</a> based on what they have seen of your actions. Do they believe you are transparent about your motivations and consistent in honoring what’s at your core?</p>\n<p><strong>A cynic can point to the fact that despite headline-grabbing behavior at Uber, the company continues.</strong></p>\n<p>Juul got far before events caught up with it. WeWork still does not appear on the verge of folding. The leaders who have caught the spotlight, have not seen their wallets hurt in any substantial way that we can see.</p>\n<p>That may be true.</p>\n<p>But what&#8217;s the logical conclusion of that lesson? Maybe it doesn’t hurt that much to push the line on ethical questions after all. In fact, the founders involved could argue, as could investors, that by pushing the line when others weren’t willing, much was gained. And the founders are only martyrs for the investors they made money for. And they are compensated for their troubles after stepping down.</p>\n<p>This may also be true… up to a point.</p>\n<h2><b>Investors step in</b></h2>\n<p>Investors balking at companies right now, that appear to be morally compromised are not wrong, and there is an alternative. Companies that prompt employees to speak up about ethical lapses <a href=\"https://hbr.org/2018/11/research-whistleblowers-are-a-sign-of-healthy-companies\">tend to be more profitable</a>. Companies ranked by <a href=\"https://www.worldsmostethicalcompanies.com/honorees/\">Ethisphere</a> as among the most ethical, outperform the large-cap sector over five years by more than 14 percent.</p>\n<p>As <a href=\"https://www.barrons.com/articles/wonder-women-capitalizing-on-gender-equality-1499490243\">Jerome Dodson</a> of Parnassus Investments, Jane Gladstone of Evercore, <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/26/these-investments-aim-for-workplace-diversity-and-gender-pay-equity.html\">Julie Gorte</a> of Pax World Funds and others have suggested &#8212; there&#8217;s tons of <a href=\"https://hbr.org/2019/05/the-investor-revolution\">research</a> that show companies that care about<a href=\"https://hbr.org/2019/02/research-when-gender-diversity-makes-firms-more-productive\"> gender</a>, equality, who care about diversity.</p>\n<p>These companies care about the environment and they actually perform better. Because the research is so compelling, the largest investors, <a href=\"https://www.cgdev.org/blog/blackrock-just-committed-climate-smart-investments-can-gender-smart-be-next\">BlackRock</a>, Vanguard, <a href=\"https://www.institutionalinvestor.com/article/b1b4fh28ys3mr9/State-Street-to-Turn-Up-the-Heat-on-All-Male-Boards\">State Street</a>, who are all the stewards of index funds — now represent the top three holders of almost every company. These companies have now started voting in sync with that because that&#8217;s just what&#8217;s best for their shareholders.</p>\n<h2><b>Fintech steps up</b></h2>\n<p>There are <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/27/covid-19-jobs-data-and-machine-learning/\">fintech</a> companies that are especially well equipped to help best practices and morality rise to the top. I’ve had the chance to work with many of them to see it firsthand.</p>\n<p>Harmonate, based in San Jose has developed private fund <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/17/3-people-reveal-a-formula-for-hedge-fund-data-operations/\">data operations</a> tailored to the complexities of tracking social impact investing. One of their investors, <a href=\"https://www.jtcgroup.com/\">JTC Group</a> has developed a specialty in this arena through a recent acquisition.</p>\n<p>Trust also comes into play supporting bankers who are now moving vast amounts of stimulus funds out to communities. They are trying to avoid getting it into the wrong hands. Fraudsters, organized crime, and others are stepping up to the trough.</p>\n<p>Banks need to weed them out but do so in a manner that does not hurt small businesses. Enterprise AI firm <a href=\"https://www.ayasdi.com/\">Symphony AyasdiAI</a> has developed a capability to reduce trust-eroding false positives to ensure the money that can have a social impact doesn’t get siphoned away or the wrong person is pilloried.</p>\n<p>Property technology company <a href=\"https://gracehill.com/\">Grace Hill</a> in South Carolina has refined digital training for multifamily housing teams to not just make it through the COVID-19 pandemic with <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/03/share-other-health-data-in-real-time-like-its-a-pandemic/\">health</a> intact &#8212; but by building better <a href=\"https://gracehill.com/blog/another-timely-and-actionable-report-may-covid-19-resident-sentiment-survey-issue-2/\">relationships</a> with renters.</p>\n<p>The action includes training in the full range of customer service skills that bring in revenue. And that includes a better understanding of how to cut out discrimination, sexual harassment, and biases that can destroy the reputation and moral purpose.</p>\n<h2>Impact</h2>\n<p>We all have been talking about impact investing for some time. And maybe we’ve been talking about it for so long that we’ve stopped taking it too seriously. Founders building their venture from the ground up, and the venture capitalists that back them as angels and seed investors, should not pay lip service to reputation, brand, or morals.</p>\n<p>Economics should not be the driver for morality… but if that’s what it takes. We live in an age where powerful people appear to get away with trying to obscure the truth. But that can be ripped out into the open more than you expect. Bank on it.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/15/fundraising-now-remember-morality-impacts-valuation/\">Fundraising Now? Remember Morality Impacts Valuation</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 15 Jul 2020 16:37:37 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Remember-Morality-Impacts-Valuation.png","linkMd5":"ee1a4851966e520672f6173b656e2751","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn72@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-27-010_049bbc0aacd5663c.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Remember-Morality-Impacts-Valuation.png","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":944,"sourceBytes":946535,"destBytes":89794,"author":"Chris Gale","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Remember-Morality-Impacts-Valuation-300x177.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn31@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-12-712_2fd93a4e0bcfa634.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195872013},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","title":"Does Your Business Really Need an AI Solution?","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=165811","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/13/does-your-business-really-need-an-ai-solution/\" title=\"Does Your Business Really Need an AI Solution?\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Does-Your-Business-Really-Need-an-AI-Solution-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"ai solution\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Does-Your-Business-Really-Need-an-AI-Solution-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Does-Your-Business-Really-Need-an-AI-Solution-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Does-Your-Business-Really-Need-an-AI-Solution-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Does-Your-Business-Really-Need-an-AI-Solution-1536x1023.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Does-Your-Business-Really-Need-an-AI-Solution.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>There is an incredible amount of hype about AI today. Businesses across various industries continue to adopt this technology to receive a competitive advantage over others, reduce operating costs, and improve customer experience. But does your business really need an AI solution?</p>\n<p>Some businesses have said that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/27/demystifying-ai-whats-fiction-and-whats-worth-fanfare/\">Artificial Intelligence</a> is nothing but a waste of time and money. Also, some organizations face particular barriers to AI initiatives. <a href=\"https://www.gartner.com/smarterwithgartner/3-barriers-to-ai-adoption/\">Gartner&#8217;s</a> research showed the most common obstacles are a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/27/understanding-todays-it-hierarchy/\">lack of skilled specialists</a>, a small amount of data, and the inability to measure results. </p>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-165813\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/CTMKT_754603_AI_Adoption_Challenges_GRAPHIC_R1B-587x719.png\" alt=\"AI/ML adoption\" width=\"505\" height=\"618\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/CTMKT_754603_AI_Adoption_Challenges_GRAPHIC_R1B-587x719.png 587w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/CTMKT_754603_AI_Adoption_Challenges_GRAPHIC_R1B-245x300.png 245w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/CTMKT_754603_AI_Adoption_Challenges_GRAPHIC_R1B-131x160.png 131w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/CTMKT_754603_AI_Adoption_Challenges_GRAPHIC_R1B.png 665w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 505px) 100vw, 505px\" /></p>\n<p>Not all companies are ready to make AI a part of their corporate strategy. Does AI suit your particular business? To find the answer, we reviewed AI business usages and signs of whether a business is ready to integrate AI. </p>\n<h2>Artificial Intelligence for Business</h2>\n<p>Artificial Intelligence is a special algorithm that allows virtual machines to learn from experience automatically by recognizing patterns in the data, and adapt new information to solve particular business problems. AI includes the following sub-fields:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/10/why-multicultural-marketing-needs-machine-learning-and-facial-tracking/\">Machine Learning</a> applied neural network and statistical analytics to receive insights from data. </p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/12/how-mastering-natural-language-processing-can-boost-your-bottom-line/\">Natural Language Processing</a> allows the machine to analyze, understand, and generate human language.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/26/3-ways-deep-learning-can-help-your-sales-team-thrive/\">Deep learning</a> empowers virtual machines with <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/06/21/top-10-actionable-ways-to-optimize-mcommerce-with-artificial-intelligence-in-2018/\">self-learning capabilities</a> and many layers of processing units. In this way, the algorithm develops self-learning capabilities, applied to image and speech recognition.   </p>\n<h3>Benefits of AI for Business </h3>\n<p>Companies that leverage AI for their business operations said about the following improvements: </p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://www.pwc.com/us/en/services/consulting/library/artificial-intelligence-predictions.html\">54%</a> of business executives claim AI solutions increased their business productivity </li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://www.pwc.com/CISAI?WT.mc_id=CT1-PL52-DM2-TR1-LS4-ND6-BPA1-CN_CIS-AI-AIsocial\">72%</a> decision-makers said the use of AI in business helped their employees to concentrate on more meaningful tasks</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://hbr.org/2018/01/artificial-intelligence-for-the-real-world\">51%</a> of executives apply AI and a value-added solution for their products</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://www.pwc.com/us/en/advisory-services/assets/ai-predictions-2018-report.pdf\">59% of </a>executives say that AI improves the use of big data</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>AI Business Applications</h3>\n<p>Businesses apply AI for the following tasks: </p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Detecting Fraud</b>. AI compares millions of transactions and distinguishing the difference between <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/04/06/7-ways-your-business-should-be-using-machine-learning-today/\">legitimate and fraudulent transactions</a></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/08/02/how-to-improve-digital-security-for-your-business/\"><b>Improve Data Security</b></a>. The algorithm identifies patterns in data access, reporting anomalies, and predicting security breaches</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>E-commerce recommendation engines</b>. AI analyzes the buyer purchase history and determining one&#8217;s preferences</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Provide better customer support</b>. <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/14/which-type-of-chatbots-will-have-a-positive-impact-on-your-businesses/\">AI-powered chatbots</a> that can help users solve simple tasks and answer simple queries</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Predict stock inventory supply</b>. Smart <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/23/ai-learning-algorithms-find-your-new-target-groups/\">algorithms analyze</a> users purchases and finding out about the most popular products</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Lead scoring</b>. By analyzing leads activity, AI prioritizes them and predicts the amount of profit each client might bright. </li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Facilitating better management of financial resources</b>. AI machines analyze patterns in <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/14/consumer-behavior-is-shifting-business-models-how-industries-adapting/\">buyers&#8217; behavior</a> to predict income and cash-flow. </li>\n</ul>\n<p>With this in mind, let&#8217;s find out whether you can apply AI for business and what challenges you will face during AI adoption. </p>\n<h2>Does My Business Really Need Artificial Intelligence? </h2>\n<p>The first thing to bear in mind is that not all companies are ready to leverage AI. If you want to find out <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/18/why-your-business-needs-custom-internal-communication/\">whether AI suits your business</a>, consider the following. </p>\n<h3>Well-established Data Collection </h3>\n<p>Artificial intelligence requires a large amount of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/06/the-artwork-behind-building-recommendation-engines-with-big-data/\">high-quality data</a> collected in the right way. Moreover, gathering high-quality data is an essential struggle for all AI specialists and data scientists. In this case, we talk not about the data accessible on the internet, but rather about data your company collects. </p>\n<p>But, there is no particular answer to how much information your AI solution will need since. It depends on the complexity of your business problem and the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/26/link-building-services/\">complexity of the AI algorithm</a> you are going to build. </p>\n<p>Thus, if you decided to hire data scientists to build an <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/23/ai-learning-algorithms-find-your-new-target-groups/\">AI algorithm</a>, you need to make the following preparations:</p>\n<p><b>Check out errors in the data</b>. While AI algorithms can <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/06/its-time-to-truly-consider-the-privacy-implications-of-iot/\">find insights from big data</a>, they could not generalize the data format. For instance, if you did several misspells in a client&#8217;s name and still conclude that this is the one person, the AI algorithm doesn&#8217;t. In this case, AI machines will classify spelling variations as different persons, which impacts negatively on predictions. </p>\n<p><b>Keep the data up to date</b>. If you want your AI algorithm to make precise predictions and get really valuable insight, you should keep your data updates. It means that before using data for AI training, you need to delete all old and irrelevant information. Also, be sure that your data has no gaps, including missing outliners and values.  </p>\n<p><b>Use the unified format for data storing</b>. To enable AI algorithms to learn from your data, you need to keep all the inputs in one format. If your business keeps data in different formats, like PDFs, Word docs, or physical documents, you need to convert it in the form of a searchable database. </p>\n<h3>Particular Business Problem to Solve </h3>\n<p>If you have maintained the way your business collects and stores data, the next step is to figure out what you want from an AI algorithm. It means that you need to define what business problem you want AI algorithms to solve. To give you a clue about the area you can improve with AI, we listed the three most common AI usages. </p>\n<p><b>Bring value to existing products</b>. The example is how Netflix <a href=\"https://netflixtechblog.com/netflix-recommendations-beyond-the-5-stars-part-2-d9b96aa399f5\">leverages AI and Machine Learning</a> for their recommender system. Machine Learning algorithms analyze the watching history of other users with similar tastes to recommend you the most exciting content. With such an approach, the company increased the number of paying users because users received more engaging experience.  </p>\n<p><b>Make data-driven business decisions</b>. You can apply AI to receive insights on how to control rent prices, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/15/how-ai-is-revolutionizing-global-logistics-and-supply-chain-management/\">optimize resource planning</a> and demand forecasting, and even predict when a piece of equipment might break. </p>\n<p><b>Automate business processes</b>. Artificial Intelligent Algorithms are perfect for routine tasks automation because they analyze all available data for one specific task, and they are good at it. If you want to find out what processes you can automate with AI, think about your business processes that are rich in data. Also, consider processes when your employees have to search through and analyze significant amounts of data. </p>\n<h3>Culture of Innovations </h3>\n<p>The culture of your company also defines whether you are ready to implement AI or not. For example, industry leaders such as Facebook, Netflix, Spotify, and others that leverage AI, have a track record on innovations. Thus, you need to value your data as a driver of changes.  </p>\n<p><b>AI-friendly corporate strategy.</b> Some businesses want to implement AI just for AIs&#8217; sake without having a well-though corporate strategy. In this case, enterprises receive long, drawn-out projects that never bring actual value. To avoid this, you need to be sure that your business strategy is flexible to make AI a central element.  </p>\n<p><b>Measurable results</b>. Before implementing AI technology, you should think about the way you will evaluate the efficiency and results of AI algorithms. In this way, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/10/why-multicultural-marketing-needs-machine-learning-and-facial-tracking/\">setting metrics</a> will demonstrate the technology&#8217;s return on investment. </p>\n<p><b>The margin for error</b>. It would be best if you considered that sometimes Artificial Intelligence does not work in the way it should. Thus, you should rely on AI algorithms from the very implementation and be okay with spending extra budget on data scientists who will maintain the algorithm during the post-launch period. </p>\n<h2>Key takeaways</h2>\n<p>AI is a great tool that might bring many benefits to the business. However, it is not a &#8220;one size fits all&#8221; solution.  </p>\n<p>Before considering AI for small business, you should consider the following: </p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If your business produces very little data, AI is not your tech solution of choice. To learn, work properly, and give you valuable insights, AI needs a vast amount of data. </li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> Artificial intelligence and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/04/06/7-ways-your-business-should-be-using-machine-learning-today/\">Machine Learning</a> is not magic, but math. Thus, do not consider those technologies as silver bullets to make your business earn more. </li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If you have a small company that does not produce big data, you should not think that an AI algorithm will help you to earn more. </li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">To adopt AI to your business, you need to have structured data, clearly defines business problems, and flexible corporate strategy. </li>\n</ul>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/13/does-your-business-really-need-an-ai-solution/\">Does Your Business Really Need an AI Solution?</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 13 Mar 2020 15:00:06 into big-business in the recent COVID times. The US ranks 17th in education performance and 7th as the most literate country in the world. The literacy rate has increased up to 86% in the US. Primary, secondary and higher studies are seeing great improvements, and breaking records almost every year. Here is how AI is transforming the education tech space.</p>\n<h2>The method of teaching and learning has changed rapidly.</h2>\n<p>Some people are of the belief that there is nothing like classroom teaching. It&#8217;s true that classroom teaching and learning are wonderful &#8212; to an extent. But traditional learning comes with its own flaws. It is more general, constant and does not emphasize a self-development method, as much as is needed, nowadays.</p>\n<h4>Some students do not understand the purpose of learning topics that don’t interest them.</h4>\n<p>Not learning topics that interest a person has long been the contention of schools. Some think it hinders the whole point of learning in the first place. Especially kids believe that only using individual interests helps them get clear about their ambitions.</p>\n<h4>Thankfully, this is being changed by artificial intelligence.</h4>\n<p>As the traditional way of doing things changes rapidly, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2014/01/28/open-online-education-and-the-trend-towards-legitimacy/\">AI is increasingly becoming a part</a> of daily lives. AI learning is to an extent says its global revenue is expected to be at US$90B by the year 2025.</p>\n<p>The education tech space has turned progressively useful and customized because of AI for education.</p>\n<p>AI leads to personalized, engaging, and master learning. It has changed the manner in which learning takes place. Useful study material is now available through smart devices. It is now possible to take online tutoring (https://www.tutoreye dot com) classes and improve grades to a great extent.</p>\n<p>The percentage of AI will grow by 47.50% until the year 2021. The figure is based on a report published by the Artificial Intelligence Market in the US Education Sector. This percentage is reflective of a complete change in the education industry.</p>\n<h2> H<b>ow AI is transforming the education tech space</b>.</h2>\n<p>1.<b> THE TRANSFORMATION</b>: Around 16 million students prepare for exams on a yearly basis in the US. They are always on the lookout for useful study material on the internet. Although the internet provides plenty of help, yet the learning outcomes continue to suffer.</p>\n<p><strong>Learning depends largely on the quality of education that is delivered to the students.</strong></p>\n<p>Mostly, they don’t find regular online content to be useful. This is because it is just a copied version of traditional textbooks. This content is neither engaging nor interactive.</p>\n<p>Finding an effective solution to this problem, artificial intelligence has come into play. It is an impactful and engaging way of controlling the online education space better than ever. It bridges all the gaps where traditional learning used to lack. In addition to being cost-effective, it has improved the learning standards immensely with its benefits.</p>\n<p><b>2. BETTER LEARNING:</b> Artificial Intelligence is connected to education principally because of some tools that help in enhancing skills. The development of education tools has improved the process of teaching and learning to a big extent.</p>\n<p>With the help of AI, almost all aspects of traditional education have changed. The virtual classroom offers immersive education in an exciting way. Due to its learning benefits, AI for the education industry will reach a market share of US$ 2 Billion by 2023.</p>\n<p>It has lead to a productive, personalized, and optimized process of learning. This allows the teachers to offer a better understanding of the topic to students. Utilizing the qualities of teachers and technology, the AI in education aims to create an enhanced learning scenario for the students.</p>\n<p><b>3. PERSONALIZED LEARNING:</b> The <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/03/new-wave-of-online-education-helping-quiet-children-flourish/\">most important priority of all teachers</a> is to ensure that students understand concepts better. However, in a class of 25-30 students, this becomes difficult. This is where AI comes into the picture and allows an edge over traditional teaching methods.</p>\n<h4>To learn anything in a better way, the students need to understand the importance of what they are being taught.</h4>\n<p>Personalized learning inspires the students and convinces them that the information is worth learning. Since the year 2018, personalized learning has improved the grades of many students significantly. Reports suggest that between the years 2018-2023, personalized learning will change the education completely.</p>\n<p>Elearning platforms utilize AI to develop platforms that offer assistance to school and college-going students. One of the best benefits of personalized learning is the easy recognition of learning gaps. This helps in improving learning by understanding the topics better.</p>\n<p><b>4. INTELLIGENT CONTENT:</b> AI and education are closely related. The modern teaching methods are all that is needed to make sure that students achieve maximum academic success. Engaging and useful content is of primary importance when it comes to learning. Engaging content includes interactive videos, lectures, study material, etc. which helps in grasping the subjects in a better way.</p>\n<p>Smart content, right from digitized textbooks to personalized learning interfaces are proving to be useful for students. Companies like Netflix learning and Content Technologies Inc., are creating automated business content for primary and secondary education. Practice exercises, useful digitized content and constant feedback process help in getting a quality education.</p>\n<p>The traditional textbooks are taking a completely different turn with AI. Custom textbooks are created for different subjects to help students. The visual medium is used with new and improved learning interfaces to improve the grades of students.</p>\n<p><b>5. GLOBALLY AVAILABLE:</b> Education must not be limited by any boundaries. Artificial Intelligence has transformed the learning scenario by becoming globally available. It is now possible to learn any course from any part of the world. In addition to this, students with impairments can also learn with the help of AI. Problems like illnesses or different languages are not a problem anymore because AI-enabled technology offers new ways to educate everyone.</p>\n<p><b>6. EASY MANAGEMENT:</b> A teacher spends a good period of time in checking the homework, projects and assignments of students. This is where Artificial Intelligence steps in to simplify these tasks. It provides suggestions on how to bridge gaps in the learning process. The machines have been reviewing numerous OMR tests for a long time. Taking this forward, the option of checking written tests is also becoming possible now.</p>\n<p>With AI stepping into management tasks, the teachers will be able to spend more time with students. There is an increased potential to make teaching and learning processes proficient.</p>\n<p><b>7. TEACHER SUPPORT:</b> The whole process of teaching and learning is becoming increasingly advanced because of AI. In fact, very soon there will be a lot more available ranging across different types of learning styles.</p>\n<p>AI has immense potential in teaching students, helping them with their homework and preparing for tests. To put it in simple words, it helps the teachers to play the role of learning motivators very effectively.</p>\n<p><b>CONCLUSION:</b></p>\n<p>Keeping a track of present trends, AI will become an even more important part of education in the coming times. It has already started to show its advantages in many ways. A report by Market Research Future says that AI for education market share will expand at 38% CAGR till 2023. Going by this, there will be a major improvement in the learning experience.</p>\n<p>The benefits of this technology will be experienced by both the school and college-going levels. New and engaging learning systems with better methods are being and will be used to improve the learning encounters. Artificial Intelligence assists by finding a suitable career path based on the specific interests of students<b>. </b>Education might cope up gradually but AI will change it forever.</p>\n<p>&#160;</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/23/how-is-ai-transforming-the-education-tech-space/\">How is AI Transforming the Education Tech digital economy has led to a growth in digital nomads in the modern visual workplace. Could the contemporary workplace come with a couch, chips, and Netflix?</p>\n<h2>The Future of Remote Work</h2>\n<p>In a recent <a href=\"https://www.getcloudapp.com/blog/7-trends-shaping-remote-and-collaborative-work\">survey </a>of 1000 U.S. based office workers aged 18-60, <a href=\"http://www.getcloudapp.com\">CloudApp </a>found that 57% of Gen Z are working the majority of the week remotely. 50% of Millennials were following suit, and even 46% of GenXers said they prefer the comfort of remote work.</p>\n<h4>The numbers alone show a generational shift in the modern workplace.</h4>\n<p>For the last 20 years, tech and other companies like Google, Facebook, and Apple (which opened its new headquarters in 2017) have prided themselves on their HQ.</p>\n<p>The Googleplex based in Mountain View features a 24/7 gym, onsite doctor, dry cleaners, and a bevy of eating options. The newish Apple HQ was estimated to cost around <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2017/10/09/how-much-every-inch-of-apples-new-5-billion-campus-cost-to-build.html\">$5 billion</a> and looks like something from a sci-fi movie.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_165934\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-165934\" style=\"width: 1200px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/5d8cf864ace5c7997381160e_nCIhql515Tk58lds0ZGBd5Ve2vsfQgcn6IYO3nHAqfjZcOZMsgHmtNIBKEH8Gce-2PLp-1Ih2hSzjMqIqcfwegOZhXpHFUYDdC7KtCEvM4r22niinkY9iCDko4jufUVRZSmFEBRw.jpeg\"><img
