https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Apply-IoT-in-the-Oil-and-Gas-Industry-1-1.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>The Internet of Things has found its way into various industries: automotive, agriculture, green energy. One of the areas that IoT is about to conquer is the oil and gas world. Today, companies hire plant managers, machine operators, and field personnel to predict when machines need maintenance and upkeep. These managers monitor IoT to keep employees safe in the work environment and to improve production.</p>\n<h3>McKinsey Global Institute&#8217;s research indicates that IoT has the potential to attract $11.1T by 2025.</h3>\n<p>Mining and the oil and gas companies have a potential economic impact of $930B within the next decade. As such, it doesn&#8217;t surprise anyone that the Oil and Gas industry is interested in leveraging IoT?</p>\n<h2>Why use IoT in the oil and gas industry?</h2>\n<p>In the Oil and Gas industry, the advantages of oil and gas IoT applications lie in creating value through an integrated deployment strategy. IoT will allow the industry to digitize, optimize, and automate processes that were previously unconnected to save time, money, and increase safety.</p>\n<p>IoT is the technology that allows devices, machinery, and other equipment to communicate with each other. It lets oil and gas companies manage and store data, create applications, and set security protocols.</p>\n<h3>Preventive Maintenance</h3>\n<p>Companies hire plant managers, machine operators to predict when machinery needs maintenance. With IoT, you can accurately predict when maintenance has to be done, and you can keep your employees safe while improving production.</p>\n<p>For oil and gas companies, IoT run software tells the manager when to repair the machinery, and alerts them when something is likely to break. It is essential in the Oil and Gas industry to protect all equipment &#8212; including watching out of any leaks and even minor breaks. IoT can handle all alerts. Just lean back and let the Internet of Things do its thing.</p>\n<h3>Remote Services</h3>\n<p>Oil and Gas are generally found in the remote areas of the globe that are hard to reach areas. The isolated terrain leads to problems with the upkeep of equipment, and any extraction needs from the sites in remote locations cause increased risks. IoT helps with:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Safety needs of both the employees and the equipment.</li>\n<li>High prices for maintaining equipment.</li>\n<li>Saves on the high expenses for the workers.</li>\n<li>It provides less chance of human error.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>What IoT allows for is that oil and gas companies are being able to remotely manage everything on their plants at any time. IoT can help manage and provide alerts for issues from minor leaks to system breakdowns. Companies can set the monitoring devices on their machines to take care of everything.</p>\n<h3>The biggest threat to all industries.</h3>\n<p>The most significant threat to all industries &#8212; one that makes companies lose billions of dollars every year, is Non-Productive time (NPT).</p>\n<p>When workers and employees are not required to be on-site observing equipment and monitoring issues it saves vast amounts of time and money. That&#8217;s what IoT has done for the Oil and Gas industry.</p>\n<h3>Safety</h3>\n<p>Oil and gas sites are generally dangerous for workers’ well being and safety. Included with the oil and gas industries is water. Another high-cost area of service. Some reservoirs are up to 3,000 meters deep and many are far offshore. Dangerous circumstances are always involved in the water industry, as well as in oil and gas.</p>\n<p>Using IoT in these areas at remote sites can prevent health issues, injuries, or even save lives.</p>\n<h2>Case study: Applying IoT in the oil, gas, and water industries.</h2>\n<p>The digitalization of IoT in the oil, gas, and water industries. IoT has saved a lot of money and provided greater protection for remote workers and employees who have to remain far from civilization without support.</p>\n<h3>Before IoT &#8212; there was only the desktop app.</h3>\n<p>Of course, desktop apps are still a thing, but not as much for remote maintenance cases. Desktop solutions work for in-house needs, where either security matters, or that involve end-to-end tasks.</p>\n<p>The businesses of the client revolved around RFScada units. These data delivery devices work great for industrial areas. RFScada units comprise the desktop app and phone apps that took over 16 years to develop. These devices are used for tracking and gathering data.</p>\n<p>The first desktop app contains a whole lot of functionality and was super detailed, and too complex. The computer with the app had to be connected to the monitored gateway at all times. The portal, online, could be connected to a number of machines.</p>\n<p>However, to see the data and track if anything was outside the expected ranges &#8212; a person would have to look on the screen and watch the tracking. This process was not very convenient. Remote locations, nighttime, and problems when monitoring moving cargo &#8212; all were issues that had difficulties to solve.</p>\n<p>Finally, the request was made to turn the entire system into a web platform that brings the best of IoT to oil, gas, water, and other industrial areas.</p>\n<h3>Turning the constraints into advantages.</h3>\n<p>From a business standpoint, RFSCADA is a great system for enterprises, but it had a hard start in development. The solution took some considerable constraint and workarounds but came out with a legacy system with a mix of cutting-edge IoT offerings.</p>\n<h4>The beginning challenges.</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>Design scalable and easy maintainable architecture for the platform.</li>\n<li>Simplify the flows for different user roles yet maintain in-company and in-system security.</li>\n<li>Developed a user-friendly way for updating firmware via UI.</li>\n<li>Wrote a compatibility script on Lua that generates configuration updates for firmware based on changes a user makes.</li>\n<li>Found a reliable gateway to process data and relay that data to and from the needed devices.</li>\n<li>The RFScada gateway system also works with cellular traffic.</li>\n<li>Able to analyze what is needed and cut all unneeded data.</li>\n<li>Data has been prioritized for the simplicity of the users.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>With limited time, this system went through the MVP approach. All functionality was sorted, and the main component was selected for the main components that would be used for future platforms. The primary purpose has always been to make this IoT system adoption as easy as possible to work with.</p>\n<h3>IoT web platform for monitoring and managing plants remotely</h3>\n<p>With a minimalist design concept, one of the main perks of using IoT in oil, gas, or any other industry lies with minimum effort for the user. In the system, you configure everything once, and you&#8217;re done &#8212; you&#8217;ll get notifications when needed. You only need to return when making configuration updates, and most of these are simple, time-saving, and automated.</p>\n<h4>The new digitized IoT system includes:</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>Registered number of users with individual access rights</li>\n<li>Ability for the lead engineers and plant owners to configure the needed monitoring.</li>\n<li>Regular workers have the ability, if given access, to track the plants they’re assigned to.</li>\n<li>Configuring sensors attached for each unit.</li>\n<li>Specific parameters (including hierarchy, measuring frequency, and type) and conversions in common measurement units.</li>\n<li>Text message and call alarms.</li>\n<li>Users receive a timely alert in case of spikes on any sensor. The user acknowledges the receipt of the warning so the system can shut down if needed.</li>\n<li>All data and events are logged, as well as the complementary configurations.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>For each sensor, the user can configure the acceptable, risk, and danger range and also set up impressions for tracking. This variety leaves parameters created in the flexible dashboard and allows differing widget types.</p>\n<h2>Conclusion</h2>\n<p>IoT handles a lot of routine scenarios for everything. That’s why we love applying it to simplify work and leisure &#8212; making time for more intellectual pursuits.</p>\n<p>Thanks for reading. Please feel free to write a word of two of what topics you’d like to read about.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/23/how-to-apply-iot-in-the-oil-and-gas-industry/\">How to Apply IoT in the Oil and Gas Industry</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 23 Feb 2020 16:00:13 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Apply-IoT-in-the-Oil-and-Gas-Industry-1-1.jpg","linkMd5":"a7cd3c385d646b15c818136dc4abde4d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn36@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-24-196_a8eff4d9c8e61aa6.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Apply-IoT-in-the-Oil-and-Gas-Industry-1-1.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1280,"sourceBytes":288937,"destBytes":269590,"author":"Vova Shevchyk","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Apply-IoT-in-the-Oil-and-Gas-Industry-1-1-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn60@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-15-463_c817aac4f91ebc25.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195880479},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"Are Foam Mattresses Safe?","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169295","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/08/are-foam-mattresses-safe/\" title=\"Are Foam Mattresses Safe?\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Are-Foam-Mattresses-Safe-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"foam mattress\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Are-Foam-Mattresses-Safe-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Are-Foam-Mattresses-Safe-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Are-Foam-Mattresses-Safe.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>A foam mattress can provide superior comfort and pressure-free support. These beds mold to the curves of the body for a weightless sleep that allows your muscles time to repair and rebuild properly. Here are some thoughts about &#8212; are foam mattresses safe?</p>\n<p><strong>When resting on the right foam mattress, you will experience little to no pressure points, better posture, and fewer aches and pains in the morning.</strong></p>\n<p>Because of extreme comfort and less pain, foam beds are often recommended by chiropractors and orthopedic specialists for those who suffer from chronic pain.</p>\n<h2><strong>But, are these mattresses safe?</strong></h2>\n<p>The question is one many people have when considering a foam bed &#8212; and it&#8217;s an important thought to address. The truth is &#8212; most high-quality foam mattresses are safe. In the US and Europe, several third-party certifications test these mattresses to ensure they&#8217;re healthy for us, and for the planet.</p>\n<p>However, cheaper foam mattresses rely on poor quality foam, and some companies don&#8217;t always obtain certifications &#8212; leaving you to guess what type of materials were used during construction. Low-quality mattresses may contain hidden chemicals that could cause respiratory and skin irritations once they&#8217;re indoors.</p>\n<p><strong>To take the guesswork out of purchasing a foam mattress, we put together this guide so you can quickly identify a safe, non-toxic foam mattress from one that could compromise your health. </strong></p>\n<h2>Different Types of Foam Mattresses</h2>\n<p>As you shop, you will find most mattresses feature either poly-foam, memory foam, or latex foam. Most beds on the market today contain some percentage of foam in their comfort layer.</p>\n<p>An all-foam mattress will contain several different types of foam &#8212; each ranging in firmness to give you a combination of comfort and support. A hybrid mattress has a base of wrapped spring coils but also features at least 2 inches of foam in the top layer.</p>\n<p>Some innerspring mattresses also feature a small amount of foam; however, it is usually only about one-inch thick. To help you recognize the difference between each type of foam, here is the breakdown of the construction and materials of each type below.</p>\n<h3><strong>Poly-Foam</strong></h3>\n<p>Poly-foam (polyurethane foam) is the cheapest and lowest quality foam on the market. This foam contains 100 percent petroleum-based chemicals that can irritate allergies and skin sensitivities. Poly-foam is often used in the comfort layer of innerspring beds, but because poly-foam collapses quickly under pressure, it does not offer the same contouring or targeted support as memory foam and latex foam.</p>\n<p>The density of poly-foam may vary depending on where it is used in the mattress. However, even high-density poly-foam lacks the durability of memory and latex foam. Some low-density poly-foam has been known to develop sagging and indentations after just one year of use.</p>\n<h3><strong>Memory Foam</strong></h3>\n<p>Memory foam (viscoelastic foam) was created for NASA to protect astronauts during flight. But since its invention in the 60s &#8212; memory foam has become much safer and more advanced.</p>\n<p>Although traditional memory foam relies on petroleum-based oils, there are now less toxic options available. By using eco-friendly manufacturing methods, many companies are creating memory foam that is cleaner and healthier for us to rest on but still offers the same pressure-relieving support.</p>\n<h4><strong>Memory foam, regardless of density, is also durable &#8212; lasting as long as ten years. </strong></h4>\n<p>Here are the various types of memory foam you may come across.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Traditional Memory Foam:</b> Traditional memory foam is made with 100 percent petroleum-based chemicals and infused with compounds that give it a slow spring back—making it the perfect material to hug and support joints. However, traditional memory foam relies on only petroleum-derived materials and also tends to trap heat.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Plant-Based Memory Foam:</b> To create a cleaner, less toxic sleep environment, some companies rely on plant-based memory foam. To create this foam, they replace a large portion of the petroleum-based chemicals with vegetable-derived oils (castor oil). This process results in eco-friendly material that is healthier for human contact. Plus, plant-based foams are more breathable and more responsive, so you never have to worry about overheating or sinking too far down when resting on plant-based memory foam.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Gel-Infused Memory Foam:</b> To combat heat retention, many companies incorporate cooling gels into their foam. These gels wick away body heat and push warm air out of the bed, keeping you cool and preventing heat retention.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>We should mention, all memory foam used in mattresses has an open-cell structure. During your search for a new bed, you may see foam advertised as being better or more advanced because it’s open-cell &#8212; all this is is a marketing gimmick. Some brands, however, will design their foam with an <i>advanced</i> open-cell structure, and this means their foam is more breathable and porous than other foams used in mattresses.</p>\n<p>For the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/18/best-memory-foam-mattress/\">best memory foam mattress</a>, look for one that features an advanced open-cell structure and plant-based foam. This is the combination you are looking for &#8212; offering the best of both worlds &#8212; less toxicity and more breathability.</p>\n<h3><strong>Latex Foam</strong></h3>\n<p>Latex is a durable and natural material derived from the sap of rubber trees. Once gathered, the latex sap is whipped into a foam and baked to create its shape. Latex is also eco-friendly and sustainable because rubber trees don&#8217;t have to be cut down during harvesting, only tapped.</p>\n<p>Latex mattresses are notably durable, with most of these mattresses lasting around 10 to 12 years. This foam provides a comfort level similar to memory foam but with a slight bounce.</p>\n<p>Most latex foam is entirely natural; however, some latex may be infused with toxic chemicals to increase responsiveness and breathability. Therefore, it is best to look for all-natural Dunlop or Talalay latex foam when shopping for a safer mattress.</p>\n<h2>Components of Poly-Foam and Memory Foam</h2>\n<p>When it comes to construction, each mattress company uses their own &#8220;recipe&#8221; and manufacturing process. Therefore, it&#8217;s essential to research the materials and construction process for each brand you consider.</p>\n<p>Reputable companies will be fully transparent in every detail of development. If you are unable to locate this information on the company&#8217;s website, it is best to look elsewhere.</p>\n<p>Here is a list of materials frequently used in poly-foam and memory foam mattresses.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Polyols:</b> Polyols are binding agents that also add bulk to the foam. These ingredients are usually derived from petroleum-based oils, but may also have a botanical source such as castor bean or soybean oils.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Diisocyanates:</b> Diisocycantes are organic isocyanates that react to polyols and blowing agents to increase the flexibility of the poly-foam. The three most commonly used diisocyanates are MDI (methylene diisocyanates), TDI (toluene diisocyanates), and HDI (hexamethylene diisocyanates). Of the three, MDI is considered the safest and least hazardous. When in their raw form, these ingredients can produce respiratory tract and skin irritation and are considered toxic. However, after manufacturing, they are not reactive and pose a lower health risk. If a mattress is made with one of these agents, they may give off an odor when brought indoors—this is called &#8220;off-gassing.&#8221; In some cases, off-gassing may produce breathing problems or headaches.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Blowing Agents:</b> These agents create the cellular structure of the foam. Traditionally, harmful CFCs (chlorofluorocarbons) were used for this process, but today many manufactures use water or HFC.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2>Potentially Dangerous Byproducts and Ingredients</h2>\n<p>Since poly-foams and traditional memory foams are derived from petroleum-based oils, they can contain chemicals and compounds that are unsafe. Many of the ingredients listed below have been banned or are now screened by third-party testing for safety.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Formaldehyde:</b> Although formaldehyde is not typically used in foam mattresses, it may be a byproduct of the chemical reaction. Formaldehyde is a known carcinogenic and is believed to cause leukemia and cancer of the nose, throat, and sinuses.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Methylene chloride:</b> This solvent is known to irritate the mucous membrane. Due to current pollution regulation, it is rarely used today.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Acetone:</b> Can be toxic when inhaling in large quantities, but shows little health risk in low amounts.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Dimethylformamide:</b> When exposed to this compound during manufacturing, it may cause organ damage.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Vinylidene chloride:</b> During manufacturing, this ingredient may irritate the eyes, respiratory tract, and internal organs.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Methylenedianiline/MDA:</b> This compound is often used in household products and shows little risk in low amounts. However, exposure during manufacturing could result in eye and skin irritation, as well as thyroid and liver damage.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>1,1,1,2 Tetrachloroethane:</b> This ingredient is known to cause organ damage after long-term exposure. It is now rarely used in the US or Europe.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs):</b> This blowing agent is a harmful pollutant, and environmental regulations now restrict its use.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2>Flame Resistance</h2>\n<p>In the US, every mattress sold must pass flame resistance testing—this means it must be able to withstand an open flame for 70 seconds. To pass these tests, many manufacturers rely on toxic materials. Therefore, something intended for safety ends up causing us harm.</p>\n<p>Petroleum products are naturally flammable, so these foams must be treated with a flame-resistant chemical, or they must contain a fire barrier. But because companies are not required to state how they provide flame protection, it is often difficult to find this information.</p>\n<p>Companies using safe methods of fire resistance are generally happy to disclose this information; however, those using toxic methods may choose not to.</p>\n<p>The following is a list of commonly used fire-resistant materials and chemicals:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Brominated fire retardants and PBDEs (polybrominated diphenyl ethers):</b> This group of substances was commonly used for fire resistance, but was phased out of use in the U.S. for being a known carcinogenic.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Chlorinated tris (TDCPP):</b> Tris is a commonly used flame retardant chemical that has been shown to cause neurological damage and disruption to the endocrine system. It has recently become less popular due to its toxicity.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Treated Cotton:</b> On its own, cotton is not flame resistant, but it can be treated with boric acid to achieve fire protection. However, boric acid has been shown to cause organ damage.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Modacrylic fiber:</b> This manufactured synthetic fiber is known to be toxic due to the use of antimony oxide in its construction.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Melamine resin:</b> This resin contains formaldehyde and is, therefore, carcinogenic.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Alessandra fabric:</b> This fiberglass material may be safe on its own; however, it often contains modacrylic fiber and antimony oxide.</li>\n</ul>\n<h4><strong>Safe Fire Protection Materials: </strong></h4>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Wool:</b> Wool is a natural material that can act as a fire retardant on its own. However, wool is not typically used in an all-foam mattress.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Kevlar:</b> This human-made fiber is strong, durable, and non-toxic.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Raylon treated with silica:</b> Both materials are non-toxic and safe for sleepers. Rayon is derived from bamboo, and silica is a naturally occurring compound found in sand.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2>Risk of VOC Emissions</h2>\n<p>Most of the materials mentioned above pose little health risks once the manufacturing process is complete. However, some VOCs (Volatile Organic Compounds) may remain in the mattress and can leach into the air inside your home—causing breathing issues, headaches, and allergic reactions.</p>\n<p>The term for this action is, &#8220;off-gassing.&#8221; It&#8217;s often described as a &#8220;new&#8221; smell and accompanies many products containing polyurethane such as paint, furniture, clothing, and other household cleaners. These compounds are volatile because they break down gradually and at various temperatures—releasing an odor as they do so.</p>\n<p>Certain sources produce VOCs that are more harmful than others. Plants and humans release VOCs that are low risk. However, chemicals such as toluene, benzene, and formaldehyde have been shown to release VOCs that cause respiratory issues, throat irritation, dizziness, headaches. Prolonged exposure could also lead to allergic reactions or other sensitivities.</p>\n<p>Adhesives and fire-resistant chemicals can also create a strong, unpleasant smell. But by opting for a mattress made with a natural flame retardant and safer manufacturing methods, the mattress will have minimal off-gassing.</p>\n<p>To ensure your safety, you can also look for a third-party certification that tests the mattress for VOCs. A CertiPUR-US® certification will guarantee the bed is made with no ozone-depleting substances, toxic flame retardants (such as PBDEs, TDCPP, or TCEP), mercury, lead (and other heavy metals), formaldehyde, or any harmful phthalates. Plus, it will also ensure the mattress is low in VOCs.</p>\n<h2>Choosing a Safe Foam Mattress</h2>\n<p>To find the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/21/best-mattress/\">best mattress</a> for you, we have put together a checklist of mattress safety tips. These points will help you find a bed that is less toxic and safe to bring into your home.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Look for third-party certifications such as CertiPur-US® and OEKO-TEX®</b>. These third-party organizations have set standards on VOC levels and product safety.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>When considering memory foam, opt for a plant-based foam</b>. These foams are more natural and will release little to no VOC emissions when brought indoors.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Find out the type of isocyanates (reactive) is used in the construction of the foam.</b> MDI is considered to be less toxic than TDI and HDI.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Consider the type of blowing agents used in the construction of the foam.</b> Gasses such as CFCs and HFCs contribute to air pollution and may cause excessive off-gassing.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Find out what type of materials or chemicals were used for flame resistance.</b> Rayon treated with natural silica and kevlar is the safest and least toxic option.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Consider the density of each foam layer.</b> Higher-density foams contain more polymers and may create more off-gassing.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Find out where the foam layers were manufactured.</b> The US and Europe both have regulations in place to ensure mattress safety.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Eco-friendly brands go to great lengths to reduce their carbon footprint.</b> They often rely on healthier manufacturing methods, shipping processes, and are made in the U.S. In most cases, these mattresses are safer for you and the environment.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Foam mattresses can provide you with a healthy, non-toxic, comfortable, and supportive sleep space. However, purchasing a mattress is similar to buying a car &#8212; a little research will help you understand exactly what you&#8217;re getting. After all, you spend a third of your life in bed, so what you rest on each night can affect your health.</p>\n<p>Our guidelines above will make the process of purchasing a safer foam mattress less complicated, so you can find a better night’s sleep.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/08/are-foam-mattresses-safe/\">Are Foam Mattresses Safe?</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 08 Apr 2020 16:00:51 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Are-Foam-Mattresses-Safe.jpg","linkMd5":"6bfd04b8b1efb00793a3e88e9aeaf56b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn60@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-24-507_8b4e867d1e5223ae.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Are-Foam-Mattresses-Safe.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":37514,"destBytes":23002,"author":"Brad Anderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Are-Foam-Mattresses-Safe-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn51@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-22-854_ea11594fa23f9e5d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878642},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"Eleven Personal Financial Apps to Keep Your Budget in Check","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=168087","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/28/eleven-personal-financial-apps-to-keep-your-budget-in-check/\" title=\"Eleven Personal Financial Apps to Keep Your Budget in Check\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"177\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Eleven-Personal-Financial-Apps-to-Keep-Your-Budget-in-Check-300x177.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"personal financial apps\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Eleven-Personal-Financial-Apps-to-Keep-Your-Budget-in-Check-300x177.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Eleven-Personal-Financial-Apps-to-Keep-Your-Budget-in-Check-900x530.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Eleven-Personal-Financial-Apps-to-Keep-Your-Budget-in-Check-260x153.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Eleven-Personal-Financial-Apps-to-Keep-Your-Budget-in-Check-1536x905.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Eleven-Personal-Financial-Apps-to-Keep-Your-Budget-in-Check.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>From paychecks to automatic online transfers, finances have come a long way. What hasn’t changed much is budget planning. Making a budget plan can be an unnerving task that can sometimes gets out of hand. Taking advantage of the latest technology, many reach out to the alternatives to replace the traditional <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/07/15/thinking-about-borrowing-money-heres-what-you-need-to-know/\">money borrowing</a> and budget system.</p>\n<p>If you’re one of the techies looking out to explore the domain of personal finance, here are a few apps steamrolling the market due to their competitive edge.</p>\n<h2>You Need A Budget (YNAB)</h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.youneedabudget.com/\">You need a budget (YNAB)</a> is a budget and finance app that helps you control your finances. Of all the famous app, this one enables you to be accountable and flexible regarding your budget and handle your finances with dynamic responsibility. YNAB allows you to step out of your usual paycheck living and help develop a controlled finance system that will enable you to budget with great ease.</p>\n<p>Here, you need to set a budget goal and link your account. Your banking information will automatically transfer to your YNAB account. Also, you can create categories and allocate specific amounts to them. However, you only get to enjoy a trial of 34 days, after which you can continue using the app by paying $11.99/month or $84/year.</p>\n<h2>Mint</h2>\n<p>Yet another famous personal finance app trusted by thousands, <a href=\"https://www.mint.com/\">Mint</a> gives its users leverage of creating a seamless budget. The app has an upper-hand in helping you generate budget plans quickly, track your expenses, and receive credit scores.</p>\n<p>Like YNAB, you need to link your bank account and have your data synced to the app. When your account is synced, the app uses the information to categorize your spending into different personal and non-personal expenses. Mint also allows you to see how much you can save in various categories.</p>\n<p>It also gives you insights and recommendations about how you can pay your debt off, create investment opportunities, and manage your debt. Plus, the app is free to use.</p>\n<h2>My EasyFi</h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://myeasyfi.com/\">My EasyFi expense tracking software</a> is yet another savvy web app that lets you boost your budget skills. It allows users to create budgets by syncing their accounts. After connecting your account, you can add your expenses and designate them into three main categories. List your bills and payments, and the app will notify you before the due date. My EasyFi keeps tracks of your budget and analyzes your data of the previous six months, keeping your savings, ideal goals, and debt repayment options intact.</p>\n<p>The best part is that it offers an affiliate program with a 50% commission per referral. The membership plan consists of basic (free) and paid ($100) plans where basic members can use the affiliate program to generate a one-time payment. The paid members, however, can use the app’s features along with the affiliate program for one year. The members get paid for every paid referral they bring.</p>\n<h2>EveryDollar</h2>\n<p>Mainly a budgeting app, <a href=\"https://www.everydollar.com/\">EveryDollar</a> has been the North Star for those looking for practical ways to create healthy budgets and pay their debts with constant determination. As you create an account, you are required to link your account, so the app automatically learns what your finances look like. The income you make can be used to create a simplified budget.</p>\n<p>You can create unlimited budgets and track your transactions as you go. The app uses a zero-based budgeting method put forward by money genius Dave Ramsey. Once you create a budget, you can adjust the budget throughout the month.</p>\n<p>Split your expenses into budget categories and check in on the spending and saving at the same time. With budget management as its forte, EveryDollar also connects you with finance experts and bolstered support. The app’s free for both iOS and Android, but can be upgraded at $129.99/year.</p>\n<h2>Pocket Guard</h2>\n<p>Like the basic features of all the other finance apps, <a href=\"https://pocketguard.com/\">Pocket Guard</a> allows you to connect your credit cards, checking and savings accounts, investments, and loans &#8212; all in one place. When you’ve linked your accounts, the app monitors every transaction that occurs and updates and categorizes it. Pocket Guard also gives you a ‘pocket’ where you can view and spend the leftover money from your budget, savings, and debt goals.</p>\n<p>What differentiates Pocket Guard from the others is its automatic yet personalized budgets. This smart app aligns your income, budgets, spending, and goals to set the perfect plan for you. Moreover, Pocket Guard gives you real-time estimates to save your money and enhance your financial health by discovering ways to negotiate lower bills and land more interest in your savings accounts.</p>\n<h2>Mvelopes</h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.mvelopes.com/\">Mvelopes</a> is the perfect partner for those who prefer the conventional budget envelop system. You designate your money in digital envelopes, separated by categories. Starting at $6 a month, you can create an online envelope budget, import your account details, monitor every transaction sync, get interactive reports. If you’re planning to upgrade, you unlock more features, such as a personal finance trainer, debt reduction tools, learning center, setup assistance $19/month.</p>\n<p>Mvelopes has much more in store for those wanting to explore the app entirely. Including all the features listed above, the complete plan offers monthly sessions with personal finance trainer, accountability and motivation, a customized plan, and a trainer-guided financial education. All these plans can be availed at a trial of 30 days.</p>\n<h2>Albert</h2>\n<p>Apart from the usual budget-creation, <a href=\"https://albert.com/\">Albert</a> is your smart money analyzer that tracks how your money flows from your account to your savings, expenses, goals, and debt repayment and investment options. It uses its unique algorithms to dig down into your current financial situation and analyzes how you can become better at saving every month. The most delightful bit is that the saved money automatically transfers into Albert Saving, the app’s saving account.</p>\n<p>You can transfer about $30 to $50 twice or thrice a week. Also, the account can hold up to $250,000 if you’re keen on saving for something big and gives you a 1% annual cash bonus. However, Albert also helps you draw instant cash of $100 straight into your bank account if you’re using Albert Instant.</p>\n<h2>Personal Capital</h2>\n<p>If you’re more into investing your money and need expert supervision with a custom touch, <a href=\"https://www.personalcapital.com/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Personal Capital</a> steps up the investment game with intelligent hybrid advising models. Sign up to access the app’s free dashboard, where you can explore the apps budgeting features in detail.</p>\n<p>It analyzes your investments, assets, and other details and gives you free, automated reports. While Personal Capital inclines more towards the investment side, budgeting and spending track aren’t as convenient as the others, but they can still give you a complete financial check and plans for your future.</p>\n<h2>Clarity Money</h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.marcus.com/us/en/clarity-money\">Clarity Money</a> is an AI-integrated finance app that’s 100% free to use and backed by Goldman Sachs. Using this app, you can open a high-yielding Marcus online savings account in a matter of minutes. Once the account is active, you can earn a 1.70% annual percentage yield (AYP) with conditions applied. You can track your spending by organizing them by category and check them whenever you want.</p>\n<p>Need to save money on subscriptions? Connect your apps and cancel the gym membership or the streaming service you don’t use anymore. Looking for a banking app alternative? Clarity Money can be your ultimate finance manager.</p>\n<h2>Simple</h2>\n<p>Like the one above, <a href=\"https://www.simple.com/\">Simple</a> plays both budget and bank account manager. It creates the seamless interaction between your account transactions and your budget, hence shedding the hassle of manual account checking.</p>\n<p>Simple offers a Safe-to-Spend feature that keeps a continuous check on your budget and your additional expenses. As you keep saving, the app motivates you through constant encouragement. However, since simple is tracking your income and budget, it will help pinch your spending, save you time from creating annual entries for each budgeting step.</p>\n<h2>Goodbudget</h2>\n<p>This great app allows you to create portions of your income and put them into envelopes designed to serve different categories. As the month goes by, you can take the money out of spending. Just make sure you keep a check on how much you’re spending, so you don’t end up running the envelope empty.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://goodbudget.com/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Goodbudget</a> is your virtual envelope budget system that gives you the ease of handling money efficiently. If you’re using the free version, you can get ten envelopes, debt tracking, 1-year history, and community support. Upgrading the plan by purchasing at $6 monthly or $50 annually will give you unlimited envelopes, unlimited accounts, multiple device usage, debt tracking, 7-year history, and email support.</p>\n<p>Money is regarded as the root of most problems in the world – primarily when it’s not used with care and caution. With apps like above, anyone can learn to manage their personal finances and develop a good understanding of how money can be appropriately managed. It’s time you choose a personal finance assistant to walk out of the money clutter.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/28/eleven-personal-financial-apps-to-keep-your-budget-in-check/\">Eleven Personal Financial Apps to Keep Your Budget in Check</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 28 Apr 2020 18:00:10 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Eleven-Personal-Financial-Apps-to-Keep-Your-Budget-in-Check.jpg","linkMd5":"8ad3525808291211fc7d60a448887d0e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn52@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-26-859_52343438461774aa.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Eleven-Personal-Financial-Apps-to-Keep-Your-Budget-in-Check.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1131,"sourceBytes":147310,"destBytes":135680,"author":"Loius Martin","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Eleven-Personal-Financial-Apps-to-Keep-Your-Budget-in-Check-300x177.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn64@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-14-382_ed3acf84e0697531.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878180},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","title":"Performance Management in the Gig Economy","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173670","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/13/performance-management-in-the-gig-economy/\" title=\"Performance Management in the Gig Economy\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Performance-Management-in-the-Gig-Economy-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"management in gig economy\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Performance-Management-in-the-Gig-Economy-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Performance-Management-in-the-Gig-Economy-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Performance-Management-in-the-Gig-Economy.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Unlike the remote employee who operates in the gig economy, many employees working in traditional settings, and annual performance reviews are a normal part of their work-life as coffee breaks and paid time off. </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">However, these annual performance reviews have proven to be highly ineffective and painful for both managers and employees. </span></p>\n<blockquote><p><strong><em>Performance management in the gig economy is worlds different than performance reviews. It includes making your employees feel included, giving recognition, and encouraging open discussions, among other things. </em></strong></p></blockquote>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As a result, many companies are slowly replacing them with other forms of performance assessment, such as regular </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/05/how-to-tactfully-communicate-tough-feedback-to-remote-workers/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">employee feedback</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. According to The Washington Post, roughly 10% of Fortune 500 companies have abandoned annual performance reviews.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">But there&#8217;s one group of employees who don&#8217;t benefit from either annual performance reviews and regular feedback. They&#8217;re the gig workers or the independent contractors who work on <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/02/do-apps-that-support-side-gigs-help-or-hurt-the-economy/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">side gigs</a>. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If once the term &#8220;gig&#8221; was associated with jazz musicians, today, that term is used to describe external professionals across all industries, such as software engineering, graphic design, SEO specialists, and more. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Estimations tell that roughly 150 million workers in North America and Western Europe have quit their 9-to-5 lives to join the </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/02/the-gig-economy-and-how-to-leverage-it-in-2020/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">gig economy</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The tech giant Microsoft, for example, has </span><a href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2015/06/13/in-the-future-employees-wont-exist/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">two-thirds as many contractors as employees</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. Uber, the ride-hailing company, has 160,000 contractors but only 2,000 employees. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As gig workers are becoming the new normal, companies that employ this kind of talent often report having issues with improving engagement and productivity. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If you&#8217;re in the same situation and are looking for a solution, the answer is that what your gig employees need is on-point performance management.  </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Here&#8217;s how you can implement it in your company: </span></p>\n<h2><b>Make Gig Workers Feel Included</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There&#8217;s something called &#8220;social pain&#8221; and neuroscientists think it&#8217;s crucial for people&#8217;s happiness to take care of their social pain. Social pain can be caused due to rejection or feeling excluded from social activities. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Meaning, if your external <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/15/5-work-culture-trends-that-improve-employee-productivity-and-satisfaction/\">employees feel like they’re not part of your company</a>, their engagement and productivity might suffer.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For that reason, it&#8217;s crucial that you make your gig workers feel included and as a relevant part of your workforce. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Share with them all news and relevant information about the business. Whenever you have a big meeting, invite them to take part virtually. Apart from being present, make sure you give them a voice in meetings. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Treating them like you do everyone else will be a form of appreciation.</span></p>\n<h2><b>Encourage Open Discussion</b></h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-1.jpg\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-173671 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-1.jpg\" alt=\"remote conference remote work\" width=\"512\" height=\"341\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-1.jpg 512w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-1-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-1-240x160.jpg 240w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 512px) 100vw, 512px\" /></a></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Open discussion is a powerful method for performance management, ensuring employees are expressing their ideas, views, and concerns.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">To avoid dealing with issues only after they become serious, encourage your gig workers to communicate their views and concerns without fear of being punished or ignored. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If employees see that the company is open to hearing those concerns, they will feel comfortable speaking out loud. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Schedule regular one-on-one meetings, as well as team meetings, where everyone will get the chance to express themselves. Frequent check-ins also leave room for giving recognition and acknowledgment of what each employee is working on and how they&#8217;re contributing to the team. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Maintain an environment with several channels of communication. Touching base with more than one platform will allow your <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/05/securing-the-digital-workplace-amidst-the-covid-19-pandemic/\">external employees to communicate</a> with you in the best way for them, whether via Slack, email, or Zoom. </span></p>\n<h2><b>Maintain Effective Two-Way Feedback</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Managers must remember that feedback is a two-way street. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Instead of only managers giving feedback to employees, there should be room for employees to provide feedback to their managers.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Here are a few suggestions for avoiding one-way feedback scenarios:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Ask the gig workers what they did right this week. Let them give more details.</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You, as the manager, give your own feedback about what you think the employee did right. Try to provide examples.</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Discuss what the employee can do differently next time.</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You, as the manager, talk about what you can do differently next time. </span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Ask the employee what he thinks you can do differently next time. </span></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This type of two-way feedback can help the employee build confidence and be challenged to try new and different ways of doing things.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For the manager, it helps them become more active listeners, be more receptive to constructive criticism, and be willing to adjust their supervisory style. </span></p>\n<h2><b>Have the Right Managers Supervising the Gig Workers</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Every company that employs an external talent must ensure that it has the right manager/supervisor to monitor the gig workers and their work. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">But <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/08/7-tools-that-support-remote-team-collaboration-and-communication/\">what makes an effective supervisor</a>?</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In a nutshell, the effective supervisor is someone:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Employees are comfortable taking to without fear or shame;</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The team trusts. Supervisors must stay true to their words and maintain a high level of transparency. Otherwise, the team might become lose respect and work without giving their 100%;</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Who invests in the development of every employee. They want to see each employee grow as an individual. They enhance a team&#8217;s strengths and improve upon their weaknesses;</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Who is held accountable for their actions, even when things go right and when they go wrong. When employees see this, they will be inspired to be more accountable and more mindful of their role on the team.</span></li>\n</ul>\n<h2><b>Give Recognition Where Is Due</b></h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-2.jpg\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-173672 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-2.jpg\" alt=\"employee recognition\" width=\"512\" height=\"341\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-2.jpg 512w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-2-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-2-240x160.jpg 240w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 512px) 100vw, 512px\" /></a></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Team morale is an essential ingredient of every company culture. Regardless of whether you&#8217;re a small startup or an enterprise company, you have to show your employees their work is valued and appreciated to boost productivity and engagement. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In fact, employees who do not feel recognized are </span><a href=\"https://www.gallup.com/workplace/236441/employee-recognition-low-cost-high-impact.aspx#:~:text=Workplace%20recognition%20motivates%2C%20provides%20a,company%2C%20leading%20to%20higher%20retention.\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">twice as likely to say they&#8217;ll quit</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When an employee feels that their work is valued, their satisfaction levels rise, and they become motivated to work towards improving their work quality even more.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Employee recognition is a low-cost performance management method but has a high impact. And if you thought that money is the only or the top form of recognition, you would be wrong.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">A small personal note, a public recognition via a Slack chat, or promotion are all fantastic forms of recognition that employees love. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">But apart from how the employee is recognized, another important part is who is doing the recognizing. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In a Gallup workplace survey, employees were asked to say who gave them the most meaningful recognition. Around 28% said their most meaningful recognition came from a manager, 24% said it came from a high-level leader or CEO, 12% said it came from a manager&#8217;s manager, and 9% said it came from peers. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">So, the next time one of your gig workers does an amazing job, make sure you let them know their work is valued and appreciated. Doing so can lead to many positive workplace outcomes.</span></p>\n<h2><b>Create Virtual Water Coolers</b></h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-3.jpg\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-173673 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-3.jpg\" alt=\"remote worker working from home\" width=\"512\" height=\"255\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-3.jpg 512w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-3-300x149.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-3-260x129.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 512px) 100vw, 512px\" /></a></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Human beings crave relationships and close connections. They want to feel like part of a group, and when they do, their overall well-being significantly improves.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As </span><a href=\"https://lp.buffer.com/state-of-remote-work-2020\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">20% of remote employees</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> are battling loneliness, companies that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/07/remote-first-why-isnt-every-company-boundaryless/\">hire remotely should exert double the effort</a> to help create a sense of community. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In-office teams have their trust falls and watercooler conversations. Thanks to tools such as Slack and Zoom, gig workers can have their own virtual team-building activities. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Some great ways to bond when working remotely include:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">playing online games</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">dedicating regular meetings for personal sharing</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">hosting a virtual book club</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">hosting themed events</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If you have a community manager at your company, encourage them to think of fun and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/26/how-can-small-and-medium-businesses-smbs-thrive-in-uncertain-times/\">engaging ways to bring the employees together</a>, whether that is for a virtual coffee meeting or a company trivia session. </span></p>\n<h2><b>Final Word</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The popularity of the gig talent is on the rise and doesn&#8217;t show any signs of stopping. Eager to hire more rapidly and cost-effectively, companies worldwide are reaching out to external experts.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">However, hiring an external expert is only one step closer to your goals. In order to experience the full benefits of employing a gig worker, companies must implement effective performance management to ensure gig talent is fully engaged and productive. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">To do so, simply use the steps we outlined below. Encourage open discussions, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/09/a-step-by-step-guide-to-protect-and-enable-your-remote-workforce/\">assign good managers</a>, and give recognition where is due. Taking these steps can lead to content and motivated workforce who&#8217;s invested in the company&#8217;s success and wants to see it flourish.</span></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/13/performance-management-in-the-gig-economy/\">Performance Management in the Gig Economy</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 14 Aug 2020 00:10:58 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Performance-Management-in-the-Gig-Economy.jpg","linkMd5":"8b29be9c541fab2342872ed5f879fdac","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn47@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-22-017_a823b893911099b1.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Performance-Management-in-the-Gig-Economy.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":47718,"destBytes":36058,"author":"Tosho Trajanov","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Performance-Management-in-the-Gig-Economy-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn27@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-17-878_2f5af2ecfc388f8e.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn3@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-19-371_6fd6879f5dd6fe26.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn71@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-18-292_18d8b7e7c9964cd2.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Image-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn16@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-14-108_3b50dc5ba8d1a016.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195870536},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","title":"10 Entrepreneur Podcasts Every Founder Should Listen To","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173310","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/25/10-entrepreneur-podcasts-every-founder-should-listen-to/\" title=\"10 Entrepreneur Podcasts Every Founder Should Listen To\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"182\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/10-Entrepreneur-Podcasts-Every-Founder-Should-Listen-To-300x182.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"podcast\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/10-Entrepreneur-Podcasts-Every-Founder-Should-Listen-To-300x182.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/10-Entrepreneur-Podcasts-Every-Founder-Should-Listen-To-900x546.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/10-Entrepreneur-Podcasts-Every-Founder-Should-Listen-To-260x158.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/10-Entrepreneur-Podcasts-Every-Founder-Should-Listen-To-825x500.jpg 825w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/10-Entrepreneur-Podcasts-Every-Founder-Should-Listen-To.jpg 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><div>Podcasts are one of my favorite content mediums, and I know I’m not alone. Podcasts are inexpensive, typically free, they’re incredibly diverse, they’re usually updated on a daily or weekly basis, and you can listen to them while doing other things—like driving, doing chores, or exercising. Here are ten entrepreneur podcasts every founder should listen to.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>As an entrepreneur, podcasts are even more important, since they’re perfect ways to feed your ever-growing hunger for more information. But with more than a million podcasts with more than 30 million individual episodes, it’s hard to know where to begin if you’re looking for an entrepreneur podcast to help guide your entrepreneurial endeavors.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>I’ve assembled this list of my top 10 favorite podcasts for entrepreneurs.</div>\n<h2>Top Entrepreneur Podcasts</h2>\n<div>These are some of the best podcasts for entrepreneurs currently available:</div>\n<div></div>\n<div><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-173358\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/EntrepreneurCast-300x300.jpg\" alt=\"Entrepreneur Cast\" width=\"600\" height=\"600\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/EntrepreneurCast-300x300.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/EntrepreneurCast-719x719.jpg 719w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/EntrepreneurCast-160x160.jpg 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/EntrepreneurCast-1536x1536.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/EntrepreneurCast.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></div>\n<h3>1. The Entrepreneur Cast</h3>\n<div>The <a href=\"https://theentrepreneurcast.com/\"><em>Entrepreneur Cast</em></a> is an aptly named entrepreneur podcast hosted by renowned marketing experts Jayson DeMers and Sam McRoberts. Both have started multiple businesses, and they tend to focus on entrepreneurship from a marketing perspective, while also often diving into relevant aspects of psychology, such as persuasion and incentive.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>They give a firsthand perspective on the biggest challenges new entrepreneurs face, and they offer a fresh, front-line perspective as business owners who have both created (and sold) successful businesses, authored best-selling books, and are currently active in their own businesses.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-173366\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/TimFerrissShow-300x150.jpg\" alt=\"Tim Ferriss Show\" width=\"600\" height=\"300\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/TimFerrissShow-300x150.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/TimFerrissShow-900x450.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/TimFerrissShow-260x130.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/TimFerrissShow.jpg 1024w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></div>\n<h3>2. The Tim Ferriss Show</h3>\n<div>Consistently one of the top-rated and most popular podcasts in the world, the <a href=\"https://tim.blog/podcast/\"><em>Tim Ferriss Show</em></a> features Tim Ferriss, the author of The 4-Hour Workweek. Ferriss often talks with special guests, including rockstar entrepreneurs from Silicon Valley, professional athletes, and even politicians—all sharing their perspectives on success, productivity, and living well.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-173364\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/MarketingSchool-300x300.jpg\" alt=\"Marketing School\" width=\"600\" height=\"600\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/MarketingSchool-300x300.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/MarketingSchool-719x719.jpg 719w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/MarketingSchool-160x160.jpg 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/MarketingSchool-1536x1536.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/MarketingSchool.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></div>\n<h3>3. Marketing School</h3>\n<div>The podcast, <a href=\"https://marketingschool.io/\"><em>Marketing School</em> </a>is hosted by well-known marketing experts Neil Patel and Eric Siu. Episodes are released daily, and each episode usually ranged from 4-8 minutes. Truly, straight-forward, bite-sized content.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>Neil and Eric pack a ton of useful content into each episode, cutting out all the fluff until all that’s left is pure, dense, knowledge from the minds of two marketing experts.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-173359 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/EntrepreneurialThoughtLeaders.jpg\" alt=\"Entrepreneurial Thought Leaders\" width=\"600\" height=\"600\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/EntrepreneurialThoughtLeaders.jpg 600w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/EntrepreneurialThoughtLeaders-300x300.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/EntrepreneurialThoughtLeaders-160x160.jpg 160w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></div>\n<h3>4. Entrepreneurial Thought Leaders</h3>\n<div>The term “thought leadership” gets thrown around a lot, but Stanford University’s podcast series, <a href=\"https://ecorner.stanford.edu/series/etl/\"><em>Entrepreneurial Thought Leaders</em></a> attempts to explore it right. With it, you’ll hear one-hour speeches from Stanford faculty, venture capitalists, and of course, entrepreneurs. It’s a perfect length of time for a workout or long commute.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-173369\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/PlanetMoneyTheIndicator-300x300.jpg\" alt=\"Planet Money The Indicator\" width=\"600\" height=\"600\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/PlanetMoneyTheIndicator-300x300.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/PlanetMoneyTheIndicator-160x160.jpg 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/PlanetMoneyTheIndicator.jpg 700w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></div>\n<h3>5. Planet Money: The Indicator</h3>\n<p><em>Planet Money</em> is a great podcast by itself if you’re interested in learning more about the economy, but <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/podcasts/510325/the-indicator-from-planet-money\"><em>The Indicator</em></a> is even better for entrepreneurs. Every weekday, you’ll get a bite-sized chunk of content, which can include interviews, news, and even interactive games.</p>\n<p>No matter what, you’ll walk away with a better understanding of the current economy, and some new things you can try as a business leader.</p>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-173367\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/SmartPassiveIncomePodcast-300x158.png\" alt=\"Smart Passive Income\" width=\"600\" height=\"315\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/SmartPassiveIncomePodcast-300x158.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/SmartPassiveIncomePodcast-900x473.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/SmartPassiveIncomePodcast-260x137.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/SmartPassiveIncomePodcast.png 1200w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></p>\n<h3>6. Smart Passive Income</h3>\n<div>Do you think passive income is just a buzzword, or an urban myth? Try listening to <a href=\"https://www.smartpassiveincome.com/listen/\"><em>Smart Passive Income</em></a>. Hosted by passive income millionaire Pat Flynn, Smart Passive income will help you learn marketing, business. You&#8217;ll also get investment tricks you can use to increase your income and reduce your number of working hours.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-173362\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/HowToStartaStartup-300x203.jpg\" alt=\"How to Start a Startup\" width=\"600\" height=\"405\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/HowToStartaStartup-300x203.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/HowToStartaStartup-900x608.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/HowToStartaStartup-237x160.jpg 237w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/HowToStartaStartup.jpg 1000w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></div>\n<h3>7. How to Start a Startup</h3>\n<div>In one of the most aptly named podcasts on this list, <a href=\"https://startupclass.samaltman.com/\"><em>How to Start a Startup</em></a> teaches you&#8230; well, you can probably guess. Hosted by Sam Altman and a variety of other people from noted incubator Y Combinator. The podcast isn’t regularly updated—but there are 20 informative lectures you can listen to from years back, and they definitely hold up to current standards.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-173363\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/JamesAltucherShow-300x300.jpg\" alt=\"James Altucher Show\" width=\"600\" height=\"600\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/JamesAltucherShow-300x300.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/JamesAltucherShow-719x719.jpg 719w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/JamesAltucherShow-160x160.jpg 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/JamesAltucherShow-1536x1536.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/JamesAltucherShow.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></div>\n<h3>8. The James Altucher Show</h3>\n<div><a href=\"https://jamesaltucher.com/podcasts/\"><em>The James Altucher Show</em></a> is one of the most popular podcasts in the world and has been host to business leaders like Mark Cuban, Richard Branson, Arianna Huffington, and Peter Theil. You&#8217;ll hear personalities and entertainers like William Shatner, Coolio, and Tony Hawk.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>It’s all about achieving greatness, establishing financial freedom, and finding your own path.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-173368\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/HowIBuiltThisPodcast-300x300.jpg\" alt=\"How I Built This\" width=\"600\" height=\"600\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/HowIBuiltThisPodcast-300x300.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/HowIBuiltThisPodcast-160x160.jpg 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/HowIBuiltThisPodcast.jpg 700w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></div>\n<h3>9. How I Built This</h3>\n<div>Another great podcast from NPR, <a href=\"https://www.npr.org/podcasts/510313/how-i-built-this\"><em>How I Built This</em></a> is hosted by Guy Raz, who takes deep dives to explain how some of the best-known companies in the world got to where they are today.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>It’s always a great way to remind yourself that amazing companies and entrepreneurs often have humble beginnings and there are solid lessons to learn from each episode.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-173360\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/GaryVeeAudioExperience-300x300.jpg\" alt=\"Gary Vee Audio Experience\" width=\"600\" height=\"600\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/GaryVeeAudioExperience-300x300.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/GaryVeeAudioExperience-719x719.jpg 719w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/GaryVeeAudioExperience-160x160.jpg 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/GaryVeeAudioExperience-1536x1536.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/GaryVeeAudioExperience.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></div>\n<h3>10. The GaryVee Audio Experience</h3>\n<div>Hosted by entrepreneur Gary Vaynerchuk, the <a href=\"https://www.garyvaynerchuk.com/podcast/\"><em>GaryVee Audio Experience</em></a> is a podcast that explores the startup mentality, motivation, and practical advice for entrepreneurs. It’s a nice blend of interviews, speeches, and fireside chats, so try a few episodes to get a feel for the format.</div>\n<h2>Discovering New Content</h2>\n<div>These entrepreneur podcasts should get you started on the right track, but if you’re like most listeners, they’re going to whet your appetite for more.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div>Ask for podcast recommendations from your colleagues, and keep an ear out for exciting new podcasts as they start getting distributed. Please write in and let me know the real hidden gems out there we all are still waiting to discover.</div>\n<div></div>\n<div><em>Image Credit: Andrea Piacquadio; Pexels</em></div>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/25/10-entrepreneur-podcasts-every-founder-should-listen-to/\">10 Entrepreneur Podcasts Every Founder Should Listen To</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 25 Jun 2020 21:01:11 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/10-Entrepreneur-Podcasts-Every-Founder-Should-Listen-To.jpg","linkMd5":"fe333c50e8731732acd712f0b3865cb3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn63@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-25-208_b724a3264a13945f.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/10-Entrepreneur-Podcasts-Every-Founder-Should-Listen-To.jpg","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":777,"sourceBytes":96345,"destBytes":38706,"author":"Deanna Ritchie","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/10-Entrepreneur-Podcasts-Every-Founder-Should-Listen-To-300x182.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn60@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-21-369_bf3d0220c0c686a5.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/EntrepreneurCast-300x300.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn76@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-15-271_2471630f90711f99.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/TimFerrissShow-300x150.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn4@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-13-150_bf14b6629b7d2ccf.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/MarketingSchool-300x300.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn40@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-15-802_d3b8d853b72a5e61.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/EntrepreneurialThoughtLeaders.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn87@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-18-470_03e910729f48b96b.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/PlanetMoneyTheIndicator-300x300.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn83@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-10-757_054222bacb7926aa.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/SmartPassiveIncomePodcast-300x158.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn31@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-15-715_96bc9f92d39de991.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/HowToStartaStartup-300x203.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn50@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-18-793_e3258941922a3c3c.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/JamesAltucherShow-300x300.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn80@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-15-368_2570a290d4209d99.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/HowIBuiltThisPodcast-300x300.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn7@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-16-230_a2769bc8ea48737a.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/GaryVeeAudioExperience-300x300.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn36@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-12-638_00a821e3453e41ef.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195874525},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","title":"How to Ensure Data Privacy in the Time of Coronavirus","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171132","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/22/how-to-ensure-data-privacy-in-the-time-of-coronavirus/\" title=\"How to Ensure Data Privacy in the Time of Coronavirus\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Ensure-Data-Privacy-in-the-Time-of-Coronavirus-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"privacy time of coronavirus\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Ensure-Data-Privacy-in-the-Time-of-Coronavirus-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Ensure-Data-Privacy-in-the-Time-of-Coronavirus-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Ensure-Data-Privacy-in-the-Time-of-Coronavirus-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Ensure-Data-Privacy-in-the-Time-of-Coronavirus-1536x1024.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Ensure-Data-Privacy-in-the-Time-of-Coronavirus.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>The Coronavirus <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/14/how-will-the-pandemic-impact-the-future-of-work/\">pandemic</a> has brought about disruptive technology solutions to slow the spread of the virus and minimize its impact. Contact tracing utilizing mobile technology is one promising but controversial solution that has been tested in some countries and proposed in the United States.</p>\n<p>The Washington Post reports that millions of people around the globe have already been placed under some form of surveillance in an effort to <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/cellphone-monitoring-is-spreading-with-the-coronavirus-so-is-an-uneasy-tolerance-of-surveillance/2020/05/02/56f14466-7b55-11ea-a311-adb1344719a9_story.html\">monitor people’s movements and attempt to trace the spread</a> of COVID-19.</p>\n<p>Of particular note, at least 27 countries have already started using data from cell phones to track the movements of their citizens. While this approach has a great potential to benefit the public good, the implementation and adoption of such technology raise important questions about transparency, AI ethics, and data privacy.</p>\n<h2><strong>Fighting the spread of COVID-19 with smart technology.</strong></h2>\n<p>Contact tracing can be one of the most effective ways to contain an outbreak.
