&#8211; Coronavirus is not stopping, but it has stopped all the activities in the world. There are many efforts put in by all the governments to control these situations and make things easy for people. Most of the businesses are completely at a halt and have no way of earning revenue at this time. Students are stuck inside their homes, many of them have not even been given their exams. Here are the impact of COVID-19 on sustainability and technology.</p>\n<h3>It seems that everything is mismanaged and there are still things that are scaring everyone around the world.</h3>\n<p>Talking about sustainable resources we get to know that they are not being properly utilized and because of that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/22/rise-of-scams-after-coronavirus-outbreak/\">there will be negative impacts</a>. All the stations that generate energy will shut down way early as they will not be able to circulate the extra energy. There will be an accumulation of resources and that will create disbalance.</p>\n<h2>Understanding the impact of COVID-19 on the technology sector.</h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Impacts-of-COVID-19.jpg\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-171144 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Impacts-of-COVID-19.jpg\" alt=\"Impacts of COVID-19\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Impacts-of-COVID-19.jpg 800w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Impacts-of-COVID-19-300x169.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Impacts-of-COVID-19-260x146.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 800px) 100vw, 800px\" /></a></p>\n<h3>Impact of COVID-19 over Industry</h3>\n<p>Many people are thinking about how COVID is affecting all industries. If we <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/01/5-conversational-ai-companies-tackling-covid-19/\">look at the enterprises that deal with these resources</a> we will get to know the loss they are facing. No petroleum company is getting any revenue other than LPG. Transportation and Industries are at a halt and hence, electricity and fuel are not getting used &#8212; all of these happenings affect the sustainability of that industry.</p>\n<p>There is one thing that is still giving relief to organizations and people around the world “Technology.” Without technology, everything would have been ten times harder for all of us right now. Many enterprises are being able to continue work by working from home. People who can provide services digitally are working, schools and colleges are working.</p>\n<p>There are only a few <a href=\"https://www.theodysseyonline.com/impact-of-coronavirus-on-business\">types of enterprises that are at complete halt</a> otherwise most of them are working. Almost all enterprises can utilize this time for marketing as most people are using the internet. <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/09/digital-marketing-coronavirus/\">Digital marketing</a> is at its rescue. There are so many things that technology has done for people in this hard time. It is providing ways to learn new things, entertainment as well as all the important news.</p>\n<h3><b>Technology and sustainability are being the part of well being of providing solutions of COVID-19</b></h3>\n<p>Technology can only be beneficial to the environment only if it goes hand in hand with sustainability. There are people who are confined to their houses and not able to leave. In this scenario, only technology is helping them to work and connect with each other.</p>\n<p>People all around the world are learning new and very different lifestyles. Such as the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/15/new-data-shows-covid-shifts-newly-remote-work-behavior/\">remote style of working</a> and its challenges, remote and online schooling of children, and a whole different lifestyle in general due to the crisis happening worldwide.</p>\n<p>Technology is greatly helping in coping up with stress and dealing with this new lifestyle. But when it comes to sustainability and climate change challenges, it is well-known that the virus has not spared political, geographical or religious boundaries. But like every cloud has a silver lining, this virus too has made some positive changes as per technology and sustainability perspective.</p>\n<h3><b>Role of technology in coronavirus crisis.</b></h3>\n<p>With the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/03/share-other-health-data-in-real-time-like-its-a-pandemic/\">help of technology</a>, the world is running all of its businesses and other services. Advanced technology is helping to get reliable information about the happenings of the world. Other than that, people rely on technology to connect with their family, friends and loved ones.</p>\n<p>Nowadays, it has become the only source of entertainment as there are no ways to go out during nationwide lockdowns. People all around the world are learning new skills, getting updated, checking on to close people, and doing all that is necessary through technology only. Thus, it is being observed that it is providing extraordinary support to mitigate the negative effects of coronavirus in today’s scenario.</p>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<h4><b> Good health and well-being.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Technology is helping people with treatment at home. There are many IoT applications that are allowing healthcare companies to check and provide treatment to people remotely. People can also order medicines and test kits to their home and get treatment for most of the things. <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/16/thanks-covid-remote-work-is-now-mandatory/\">Remote treatment facilities have been improved</a> and this is all because of the innovation and advancement in technology during the pandemic.</p>\n<p>Scientists and developers are still working hard to offer people and healthcare companies with solutions that can help to keep everyone healthy in these hard times. It would never have been possible without the collaboration of healthcare services and technology.</p>\n<p>There are many things that people have realized and there are many more to come. After this pandemic, most of the people will keep using these and there will be many benefits to both doctors and patients because of this. This will solve the problem of waiting for patients and crowded hospitals.</p>\n<ol start=\"2\">\n<li>\n<h4><b> Quality education.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>There is no denial about the fact that there are many bad effects of closing down the educational institutes. Not just because children are not getting the education they need but also because of other things. There are many schools and colleges that provide shelter and food to many poor students, these are the places where many refugees stay.</p>\n<p>All those people needed to vacate them and now they are struggling to stay alive, they do not have anything to survive on. But there are many positive impacts too and no one can ignore them. Colleges and schools have realized that they can teach no matter what happens.</p>\n<p>Online lectures and examinations are working and that is keeping the flow going. There are many institutes that have created interactive courses that students can study at their own time and at their own pace, just like online course websites did. Most of the people have realized the importance of online courses and certifications. It is very easy to study remotely, although it is no replacement to in-class study still, it is a way to keep things going in the hard times.</p>\n<ol start=\"3\">\n<li>\n<h4><b> Responsible usage and production.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Responsible usage and production are some of the things that would not have been possible without this pandemic. There are so many retailers and traders who will have to re-plan their supply strategies.</p>\n<p>There are many products that they discard or don’t pay attention to as they go out of trend or are not as usable as they were in the past, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/14/iot-and-commerce-how-new-technology-is-shaping-the-way-we-shop/\">these products get wasted</a> and so does the resources and material used to make them. In this time all these products can be used.</p>\n<p>There are chances that in the times to come these products can be on the high demand lists. This will improve the reusability and the way people use things. There will be a balance in production activities too.</p>\n<p>More old material and products will be reused to make the new ones. The <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/10/how-blockchain-is-revolutionizing-the-supply-chain-industry/\">supply chain will also see a change</a> as there will be all the products that people didn’t buy in the past. This is now the time when people need things in any way possible.</p>\n<p>Producing new things will take time and also money and both of them are not available the way people want. This is a good opportunity to recover the losses and manage the way the sales activities take place in the future. The government is also paying attention to these types of options. It will help them in managing things and there will be no scarcity of resources.</p>\n<ol start=\"4\">\n<li>\n<h4><b> Partnerships among enterprises.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>It is a very smart step taken by many enterprises already that they <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/06/17/10-effective-marketing-tips-to-promote-your-product-on-instagram-in-2019/\">have collaborated with other</a> enterprises that helps them in working remotely. This is the time that provides people with so many partnership opportunities and it is all for the good.</p>\n<p>Both consumers and businesses will get benefits from these kinds of partnerships. There are companies that can create 3D and AI-based applications that can help their clients and consumers understand things in a better way. These solutions are empowering enterprises to grow exponentially.</p>\n<p>With each other’s help and constant hard work, enterprises in the world can reach the places that will help them a lot after all this ends. Many enterprises need solutions to deploy their services and products in the market. It is needed that they collaborate with some enterprise that can help.</p>\n<p>The way partnerships are being made and the opportunity that is still left is something that will make things better for everyone. The government is also asking for partnerships with enterprises that can help them and the country in this hard time.</p>\n<h3><b>Impact of COVID-19 on sustainability</b></h3>\n<p>Above mentioned are the positive results that coronavirus brought to humans. The virus has also created a fresh and unimaginable impact on the nature and sustainability of the resources. The only way to prevent the virus from spreading is physical distancing.</p>\n<p>For practicing physical distancing, countries have opted for lockdown in which only essential duties will be followed and the rest of the people will stay in quarantine and work remotely.</p>\n<p>Due to distancing, there has been a drastic change in the way of living. Though people are still adjusting to this new lifestyle, it has been a boon for mother nature. There has been a significant drop in the consumption of electricity, gas and oil. <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/04/what-truckers-know-about-the-oil-price-trend-and-its-impact/\">Vehicles are being used less</a> which is why energy is being consumed less and the pollution levels are decreased at significant levels.</p>\n<h5><b>Conclusion</b></h5>\n<p>Sustainable development can only happen if there is a perfect balance between technology, sustainability, and consumption. One must understand that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/22/rise-of-scams-after-coronavirus-outbreak/\">even after this pandemic ends</a>, it is important to be cautious about saving the energy for future generations and using renewable resources as much as possible.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/06/the-impacts-of-covid-19-on-sustainability-and-technology/\">The Impacts of COVID-19 on Sustainability and Technology</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 06 Jun 2020 18:00:44 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/The-Impacts-of-COVID-19-on-Sustainability-and-Technology.jpg","linkMd5":"234e51f5add4b3d0c9ce433816ecad36","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn91@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-25-574_aeabaee32379fbfd.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/The-Impacts-of-COVID-19-on-Sustainability-and-Technology.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":76963,"destBytes":71060,"author":"Dharmendra Chahar","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/The-Impacts-of-COVID-19-on-Sustainability-and-Technology-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn52@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-11-329_9094d0aeb51b796e.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Impacts-of-COVID-19.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn67@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-16-017_bbdcb9d8fe9cd5b2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195876268},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:56","title":"The Biggest Cybersecurity Mistakes Businesses Are Still Making","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=172105","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/29/the-biggest-cybersecurity-mistakes-businesses-are-still-making/\" title=\"The Biggest Cybersecurity Mistakes Businesses Are Still Making\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"149\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Biggest-Cybersecurity-Mistakes-300x149.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"The Biggest Cybersecurity Mistakes Businesses Are Still Making\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Biggest-Cybersecurity-Mistakes-300x149.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Biggest-Cybersecurity-Mistakes-260x129.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Biggest-Cybersecurity-Mistakes.jpg 747w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Despite evidence of multi-billion-dollar cybersecurity vulnerabilities in some of the world’s most trusted organizations, businesses still aren’t taking cybersecurity seriously. Big corporations are finding reasons to skimp on their cybersecurity budgets, cutting costs rather than investing in their infrastructure, and small business owners are simply negligent of the threat that cybersecurity issues present.</p>\n<p>So why is cybersecurity still so underutilized and underappreciated, and what are the most common mistakes business owners are making?</p>\n<h3>Failing to Take Cybersecurity Seriously</h3>\n<p>One of the biggest issues here is that business owners continue to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/24/cybersecurity-best-practices-7-ways-to-secure-your-data-in-2020/\">not take cybersecurity seriously</a>—or at least not take it seriously enough. For big businesses, this is due to a combination of factors. For example, they may already be spending millions of dollars on IT teams and cybersecurity tools, and they may not have a barometer for whether or not this investment is “enough.” They may also struggle to see the results of their investments; after all, if your cybersecurity strategy is working, you won’t be the target of any major attacks or hacks.</p>\n<p>On top of this, big organizations often struggle with departmental silos. Cybersecurity experts find themselves isolated from the rest of the organization, unable to provide direction or advice or limited in their abilities to influence the organization. Accordingly, people in other departments don’t give cybersecurity much thought.</p>\n<p>For small businesses, the prevailing attitude is “we’re too small to be a target,” even though small businesses are some of the most common targets for cybercriminals. When faced with a steep bill for even the most basic cybersecurity measures, small businesses are disinclined to spend the money.</p>\n<p>In any case, if a business doesn’t treat cybersecurity as important, they aren’t going to do enough to protect themselves.</p>\n<h3>Treating Cybersecurity Reactively Instead of Proactively</h3>\n<p>For cybersecurity to be effective, it needs to be done proactively. You need to put in the work long before you suffer from a data breach or opportunistic attack; if you wait until you know for sure you’re a possible victim, it will already be too late.</p>\n<p>This is the difference between proactive and reactive cybersecurity. After suffering a data breach, companies are much more keen to invest in the infrastructure necessary to prevent another, similar attack in the future; but if they had done this in the first place, they could have saved millions, if not billions of dollars.</p>\n<p>It’s much better to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/30/how-to-create-an-effective-cybersecurity-routine/\">make cybersecurity a routine</a>—something you invest in and improve continuously, even when things seem quiet.</p>\n<h3>Establishing Cybersecurity as a Separate Department</h3>\n<p>It’s tempting to think of cybersecurity as its own department, or as a subsection of your IT department. This approach allows you to hire experts in the field, and funnel funding specifically toward this cause. While this isn’t necessarily a bad strategy, this can be misleading—and possibly leave you open to attacks in other areas.</p>\n<p>Instead, cybersecurity is something that’s best executed with teamwork and collaboration. For example, <a href=\"https://resources.whitesourcesoftware.com/blog-whitesource/3-devops-security-challenges-how-to-overcome-them\">teams employing DevOps practices</a> often work hard to ensure that security is incorporated into every stage of the development process—and isn’t simply shoehorned in at the end.</p>\n<p>The big problem you’re trying to solve is that security vulnerabilities exist everywhere, in every department of your organization and with every individual. Only by working together will you be able to reduce these vulnerabilities to a minimum.</p>\n<h3>Implementing Bad Password Practices</h3>\n<p>Speaking of individual vulnerabilities, too many modern organizations still suffer from bad password practices. The majority of cyberattacks and digital breaches aren’t because of an insanely skilled hacker, but instead are due to an individual (possibly an unskilled one) finding, guessing, or stealing a password. With the right login credentials, anyone can be considered a “hacker.”</p>\n<p>Password strategies can go wrong in many ways. Your people may choose weak or easy-to-guess passwords, like those that feature common words or predictable series of numbers. They may fail to update those passwords on a regular basis. Or they may have bad habits related to password storage; for example, they may keep a list of passwords written down on a sticky note by their desk.</p>\n<p>Some organizations also use organization-wide passwords, copying and pasting the same sequences for all people across all platforms. This leads to a massive vulnerability.</p>\n<h3>Choosing the Wrong Software</h3>\n<p>There’s also something to be said for choosing the “right” software for your organization. Most companies need a variety of different tools to operate effectively, including CRM platforms, project management platforms, and communication platforms. Each of these is going to represent a potential point of vulnerability; these apps store information related to your business, and if breached, could represent a real problem for you.</p>\n<p>Accordingly, you’ll need to think carefully about the tools you use. Pay attention to the reputation of the developers, and find out what kind of security measures are available; for example, some apps will employ features like <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/21/artificial-intelligence-a-tool-or-a-threat-to-cybersecurity/\">AI designed for cybersecurity</a>, or robust encryption standards.</p>\n<h3>Failing to Update Consistently</h3>\n<p>No matter how skilled a developer is, no software is perfectly coded. No matter what, there are going to be security vulnerabilities and issues with long-term integrity. If and when someone figures this out, they can take advantage of the flaw.</p>\n<p>Fortunately, most development teams and open source communities are constantly on the lookout for new potential threats—and when they find one, they implement a patch to fix it.</p>\n<p>Here’s the thing—the patch only works if you download it. Yet, many organizations fail to update their software or devices consistently. The easiest approach here is to mandate automatic updates, but many businesses simply allow their employees to update as they see fit—which isn’t as often as it should be.</p>\n<h3>Pinning Hopes on a Single Solution</h3>\n<p>There are several products and services that can minimize your security vulnerabilities, including firewalls, antivirus software, and virtual private networks (VPNs). However, too many business owners pin all their hopes on a single solution. They believe that since they’re using a firewall, they’re practically bulletproof.</p>\n<p>However, complete data protection requires you to pay close attention to a number of potential threats, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/24/the-key-to-improving-global-cybersecurity-is-data-science/\">studying the landscape</a> and employing unique solutions to guard against them. If you’re only using one or two techniques, you’re probably leaving yourself open to attack in some other way.</p>\n<h3>Neglecting Personal Device Vulnerabilities</h3>\n<p>Most businesses these days have some variant of a bring your own device (BYOD) policy. This works well for both businesses, which can save money on purchasing employee devices, and employees, who can exercise more control over what type of devices they use and how they use them. However, personal devices brought onto your network can pose a major security risk if your employees aren’t managing their devices correctly.</p>\n<p>Additionally, employees may use their devices (with company accounts) or company devices on public Wi-Fi networks that are unsecured—a major risk for attacks.</p>\n<h3>Failing to Train Staff</h3>\n<p>One of the most common reasons for small business cyberattacks is simple employee mistakes. Most cybercriminals aren’t sophisticated hackers, but instead are opportunists—looking for ways to exploit basic ignorance or errors. For example, they may try to trick your employees into giving up their login credentials, or they may simply wait for an opportunity to conveniently learn more about your organization through social engineering. The better informed your staff members are, and the more trained they are in cybersecurity practices, the fewer vulnerabilities you’ll face. Unfortunately, most business owners neglect this.</p>\n<p>There’s no easy way to get business owners to take cybersecurity seriously, especially when there are already many examples of businesses losing billions of dollars because of lax security habits. However, the more you know about the common failings of cybersecurity in businesses, the more proactively you’ll be able to work to prevent such disasters from happening to you.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/29/the-biggest-cybersecurity-mistakes-businesses-are-still-making/\">The Biggest Cybersecurity Mistakes Businesses Are Still Making</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 29 May 2020 13:55:43 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Biggest-Cybersecurity-Mistakes.jpg","linkMd5":"c35d179e531838cfeb5c4622b7082898","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn23@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-24-849_7dc286e9be85391d.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Biggest-Cybersecurity-Mistakes.jpg","destWidth":747,"destHeight":371,"sourceBytes":43606,"destBytes":22538,"author":"Frank Landman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Biggest-Cybersecurity-Mistakes-300x149.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn91@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-10-686_fe0da8235fb86872.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195876625},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","title":"5 WhatsApp Business features to Elevate Customer Experience","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=172349","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/17/5-whatsapp-business-features-to-elevate-customer-experience/\" title=\"5 WhatsApp Business features to Elevate Customer Experience\"><img width=\"300\" wp-post-image\" alt=\"new whatsapp features\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/5-WhatsApp-Business-features-to-Elevate-Customer-Experience-300x200.jpg 300w, out an additional feature called interactive message template a month back for WhatsApp Business API. As the name suggests, this feature allows one to include interactive components to messaging like a button. WhatsApp Business Account users can now build two types of pre-defined buttons:</p>\n<ol>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Call-To-Action</b>: The call-to-action button enables users to either call a phone number or visit a website.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Quick-reply</b>: The quick reply allows users to respond with a simple text message.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>WhatsApp Business was rolled in 2018 for small to medium businesses, and WhatsApp Business API became accessible to WhatsApp trusted partners for building <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/02/messaging-based-sales-4-reasons-businesses-should-leverage-it/\">chatbots</a> so enterprises could leverage automated conversation with their customers. A revolutionary step in the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/15/how-will-iot-improve-the-way-startups-do-business-in-2020/\">business engagement</a> world. Let us look at some cool features of WhatsApp Business account, which makes it now the oxygen of business world:</p>\n<h2>Business Profile</h2>\n<p>The business profile gives the company a familiar “face” and identity that helps in gaining faithful customers. To have a “Verified” badge next to your company name, WhatsApp has to confirm first that this is a verified business account. You can create messaging templates that are much needed if you want to send messages to your customers. But most crucial, it aids your customers to get information like</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Business name</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Business hours</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Store/business address</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Corresponding location pin</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Email ID</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Website links</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Contact details</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Brief business description</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>To edit your business profile:</h3>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Open WhatsApp Business &#62; Tap Settings &#62; your business name.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Tap on any field to make an update &#62; Save.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2>Quick Replies</h2>\n<p>WhatsApp is the new advanced SMS system. <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2015/01/06/whatsapp-700-million/\">WhatsApp</a> platform is preferred by over <a href=\"https://www.livemint.com/technology/tech-news/whatsapp-announces-2-billion-users-worldwide-11581516342061.html\">2 billion</a> people across the world. The Quick Reply feature by WhatsApp lets you save a lot of energy and time. You can set up often, send messages to answer frequently asked questions in a jiffy. You can add texts and emoji’s in your quick replies.</p>\n<h3>How to set up a Quick reply?</h3>\n<p>To set up a quick reply, follow these steps:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Go to settings&#62;Business Settings&#62; Quick Replies.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Click on the plus(+) icon, on the top right corner to create the reply.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Click under message to add your message.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Set your keywords to locate the messages easily.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Click- Save</li>\n</ul>\n<h2>Label</h2>\n<p>Whenever a customer sends you a message, and you wish to save the chat, utilize this cool feature &#8220;Label&#8221; by WhatsApp. You can set up Labels to your chats, to help you remember and organize your messages.</p>\n<p>Labels can be set up according to your preferences, such as order, location, new customers. You can even add cool colors to differentiate your labels. WhatsApp allows you to create up to 20 Labels.</p>\n<h3><strong>Applying a WhatsApp Label</strong></h3>\n<p>Tap and hold a message or a chat &#62; Tap Label &#62; You can add an existing label or a new label.</p>\n<h3><strong>Finding a WhatsApp Labeled Content</strong></h3>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Go to your Chats screen &#62; More Options &#62; Labels &#62; tap a label.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Alternatively, from your Chats screen, you can also tap on a contact&#8217;s profile photo or group icon to see all labels associated with that chat.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3><strong>Managing WhatsApp Label</strong></h3>\n<p>To manage your labels, go to your Chats screen &#62; More options &#62; Labels.</p>\n<p>Here you can:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Take actions over labeled items. Tap a label &#62; Tap and hold an item &#62; Choose an action on the top bar,</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Edit a label: Tap the label &#62; More options &#62; Edit label.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Add a color: Tap the label &#62; More options &#62; Choose color. If more than two color-coded labels are applied to a chat, they&#8217;ll be stacked one over the other. When stacked, the color of only the most recent label will be displayed.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Delete a label: Tap the label &#62; More options &#62; Delete label.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Create new broadcast: Tap the label &#62; More options &#62; Message customers.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3><strong>Creating a broadcast list from labels.</strong></h3>\n<p>You can create broadcast lists for select audiences from your labels. To create a broadcast list from labels:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Go to More options &#62; Labels.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Select the Label you want to create a broadcast for.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Go to More options &#62; Message customers.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Tap the green checkmark on the bottom right of the screen to draft your message.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The broadcast message will be individually sent to all the chats tagged with that label.</p>\n<h3><strong>Greeting Messages</strong></h3>\n<p>WhatsApp allows you to set up automated greeting messages for your customers when they message you the first time or after 14 days of inactivity.</p>\n<h3>Setting up WhatsApp greeting messages:</h3>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Tap More options &#62; Settings &#62; Business settings &#62; Greeting message.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Turn on Send greeting message.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Edit the message by tapping on it.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Under Recipients, tap and choose between:\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Everyone: to send the greeting message to anyone who messages you after business hours.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Everyone not in the address book: to send the greeting message to numbers that aren&#8217;t in your address book.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Everyone except: to send the greeting message to all numbers except a select few.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Only send to: to send the greeting message to select recipients.</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Tap SAVE.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2><strong>Automated Messages</strong></h2>\n<p>Set up automated messages on the WhatsApp business account, such as greeting messages, FAQs, and much more. This helps your customer to connect with your business and get answers quickly leading to customer satisfaction.</p>\n<p>WhatsApp is the clear winner in terms of cost, efficiency, interface, and customer preference. You can set up WhatsApp<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/30/artificial-intelligence-can-improve-business-growth/\"> Chatbot</a> with the help of WhatsApp partners such as Yellow Messenger. With the help of WhatsApp Chatbot, you can automate all your business engagement and reduce any redundancy.</p>\n<p>The WhatsApp chatbot platform is designed to integrate with CRM, ERP, and various other business systems and enables seamless communication between businesses and customers and promising enhanced customer experience.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Alok Sharma; Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/17/5-whatsapp-business-features-to-elevate-customer-experience/\">5 WhatsApp Business features to Elevate Customer Experience</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 17 Jul 2020 15:01:04 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/5-WhatsApp-Business-features-to-Elevate-Customer-Experience.jpg","linkMd5":"ea167c5d1f8007579afe9ebe6092420b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn76@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-22-409_4b13f6c04bfa2dee.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/5-WhatsApp-Business-features-to-Elevate-Customer-Experience.jpg","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":853,"sourceBytes":96833,"destBytes":39850,"author":"Aarti Nair","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/5-WhatsApp-Business-features-to-Elevate-Customer-Experience-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn76@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-19-932_1fb2c79fc4a8eb80.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195872202},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:56","title":"Why IoT Needs an Open Ecosystem to Succeed","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170045","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/26/why-iot-needs-an-open-ecosystem-to-succeed/\" title=\"Why IoT Needs an Open Ecosystem to Succeed\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Why-IoT-Needs-an-Open-Ecosystem-to-Succeed-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"iot open ecosystem\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Why-IoT-Needs-an-Open-Ecosystem-to-Succeed-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Why-IoT-Needs-an-Open-Ecosystem-to-Succeed-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Why-IoT-Needs-an-Open-Ecosystem-to-Succeed.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Imagine if the internet had been built as a closed ecosystem controlled by a small set of organizations. It would look very different from the internet we know and rely on today. Perhaps this alternate version would run on a pay-per-use model, or lack tools and services that have been developed over the years by independent contributors and scrappy startups. Here is why IoT needs an open ecosystem to succeed.<br />\n</span></p>\n<h2>The Open Internet</h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Instead, of a closed internet &#8212; we mostly enjoy an open internet. This is in part due to its origins: the internet was built to be fundamentally open, and this is what has allowed it to grow, change, and be adopted as quickly as it has been. In fact, the trend of an open approach propelling innovation is one that we see repeatedly for emerging technologies.</span></p>\n<h4><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>When it comes to the Internet of Things (IoT), we’re at the precipice of a similar innovation boom as witnessed with the internet.</strong> </span></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">IoT is slated for explosive growth: by 2021, Gartner expects that </span><a href=\"https://www.gartner.com/en/newsroom/press-releases/2018-11-07-gartner-identifies-top-10-strategic-iot-technologies-and-trends\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">25 billion connected things will be in use</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, enabling our smart homes, factories, vehicles, and more. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As more and more IoT devices come online, </span><a href=\"https://medium.com/zededa/why-iot-needs-edge-computing-to-realize-its-full-potential-3600de77b38f\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">edge computing will become a necessity.</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> Edge computing enables data to be processed and analyzed in real-time for </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/24/how-ai-at-the-edge-other-iot-trends-are-transforming-every-industry/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">business-critical use cases</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, such as self-driving cars, safety and security, and industrial automation.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As with the internet, we need an open, consistent infrastructure foundation for IoT and edge computing in order for these technologies to reach their full potential. While the challenges of building an open IoT are different than those we faced with building an open internet, this is an important problem for our industry to solve now, before we witness further fragmentation and vendor lock-in.</span></p>\n<h2><b>Where we are today with IoT<br />\n</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">We’re currently in what I like to call the “AOL stage” of IoT—the phase of getting devices connected at scale, and working through the balance of proprietary vs. open approaches. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Back in the 1990s, America Online opened up <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/11/how-a-nearly-forgotten-rip-physicist-shaped-your-internet-access/\">access to the internet</a> to the masses with an easy-to-use CD; by </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">popping it in</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, anyone could easily sign up and get connected. However, the tradeoff for this simplicity was getting locked into the AOL ecosystem as the conduit for communication and search. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Over time, users became savvier, realizing they could connect to the internet directly through their ISPs and access more powerful search capabilities (Google, for example). As more people came online through their medium of choice, innovation picked up speed, giving birth to the internet boom and the ecosystem we know today.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>IoT is inherently heterogeneous and diverse, made up of a wide variety of technologies and domain-specific use cases.</strong> </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">To date, the market has created a dizzying landscape of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2017/09/12/when-youre-thinking-iot-expansion-think-horizontal/\">proprietary IoT platforms</a> to connect people and operations, each with wildly different methods for data collection, security, and management. It’s like having many different “AOLs” trying to connect devices to the internet—needless to say, this fragmentation has resulted in unnecessary complications. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Companies beginning their IoT journeys are locked in with the vendor they start with, and will be subject to additional costs or integration issues when they look to scale deployments and take on new use cases.</span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Simply put, IoT’s diversity has become a hindrance to its own growth. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">To avoid going down this path, we must build an open ecosystem as our foundation for IoT and edge computing. It’s only when open standards are set that we can scale the commercialization of offerings and services, and focus on realizing ROI.</span></p>\n<h2><b>Open ecosystems facilitate scale</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">What would an open ecosystem for IoT look like? When creating an ecosystem, there’s a spectrum of approaches you can take, ranging from closed to open philosophies. Closed ecosystems are based on closely governed relationships, proprietary designs, and, in the case of software, proprietary </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2016/03/29/connected-things-pl2/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">APIs</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The tight control of closed ecosystems sometimes referred to as “</span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2014/12/11/go-swift-hack-corporate-languages-new-lock-in/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">walled gardens</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">,” can provide great customer experience, but come with a premium cost and less choice. Apple is a widely cited example of this approach.</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> </span></p>\n<p><strong>There are open approaches that offer APIs and tools that you can openly program.</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> The open approach tools enable an ecosystem of products and services where the value is derived from the sum of its parts. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Open-source software like Android is an example; it’s a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/07/these-three-industries-are-about-to-be-hit-by-aiot/\">key driver of a truly open</a>, vendor-neutral ecosystem because of how it empowers developers. Having an open standard like Android’s operating system for developers to build upon not only promotes further innovation but also bolsters a network effect. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">To fully grasp the business trade-offs of closed vs. open ecosystems, let’s compare Android and Apple’s iOS. While Apple provides a curated experience, Android device makers have less control over the overall experience through deep software/hardware integration, and therefore need to find other differentiators. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Nevertheless, openness facilitates choice and scale—Android has </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">over 70 percent of the global mobile OS market share</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. Even with Android’s openness, providers like Samsung have still been able to carve out market share by investing in innovation and a broader device ecosystem strategy.</span></p>\n<h2><b>An open future for the IoT</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The IoT can have as great of an impact as the internet has had, but generating hundreds of closed, siloed ecosystems dictated by vendor choice is not the path to scale. A </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/17/iot-in-2020-its-all-coming-together/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">bright future for IoT</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> is dependent upon our ability to come together as an industry to build an open ecosystem as our foundation. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Across hardware, operating systems, connectivity, applications, and cloud, we must bridge key elements and unify, rather than reinvent, standards in order to empower developers to focus on value creation. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Commercial offerings built on top of that open foundation may very well take a more “closed” approach; however, starting development with an open foundation will always provide the most scalability, flexibility, and transparency to maximize options for the long term.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/15/top-25-slack-alternatives-for-team-communication-and-collaboration/\">Open-source collaboration</a> is an excellent accelerator for this open foundation. The Linux Foundation’s </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">LF Edge</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> and</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> Kubernetes IoT Edge Working Group</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">,</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> and the Eclipse Foundation’s </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">IoT</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> and </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Edge Native</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> Working Groups are just a few of the initiatives exploring architectures and building frameworks to unite industry efforts and enable IoT and edge computing ecosystems to scale. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As they say, the whole can be greater than the sum of its parts, and I look forward to seeing the immense potential of becoming a reality when we have a common foundation to innovate on.</span></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/26/why-iot-needs-an-open-ecosystem-to-succeed/\">Why IoT Needs an Open Ecosystem to Succeed</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 26 Jun 2020 15:01:00 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Why-IoT-Needs-an-Open-Ecosystem-to-Succeed.jpg","linkMd5":"3495492a2e3f898819385305815f0bb6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn23@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-27-313_2ec2428a4f23fa01.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Why-IoT-Needs-an-Open-Ecosystem-to-Succeed.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":23489,"destBytes":19584,"author":"Jason Shepherd","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Why-IoT-Needs-an-Open-Ecosystem-to-Succeed-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn11@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-14-654_6f09295065c1d081.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195876386},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","title":"Why Data Scientists are Becoming Future Marketers","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=172346","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/14/why-data-scientists-are-becoming-future-marketers/\" title=\"Why Data Scientists are Becoming Future Marketers\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Why-Data-Scientists-are-Becoming-Future-Marketers-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"data scientist marketers\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Why-Data-Scientists-are-Becoming-Future-Marketers-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Why-Data-Scientists-are-Becoming-Future-Marketers-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Why-Data-Scientists-are-Becoming-Future-Marketers.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>The law of success in business states: the quicker you accept and welcome innovations, the further behind you leave your competition. That&#8217;s the reason why technical enhancements seem to be as frequent as coffee breaks. Here is why data scientists are becoming future marketers.</p>\n<h3>As <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/10/big-data-and-its-impact-on-business-and-mobile-apps\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">big data</a> is changing the status quo, the marketing sector is not lagging behind.</h3>\n<p>On the contrary, data scientists have shown that big data adapts data-driven methods to make smarter decisions.</p>\n<p>Not to mention, the shift that is being caused by increasing accessibility to unprecedented amounts of publicly available information, which spurs data scientists to pick up the role of marketers.</p>\n<p>Not surprisingly, in the face of the information revolution, marketers say that data is their company’s most under-utilized asset. The biggest challenge to data-driven marketing success is the lack of data quality and completeness.</p>\n<h3>Here is the bridge the knowledge gap between modern marketers and data scientists.</h3>\n<p>What type of data is actually useful and how do you use it? My goal is to make sure that after reading this article &#8212; you will be able to:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Understand why the ability to use big data in the marketing sector is essential for business survival.</li>\n<li>Get a good grip on how to obtain the “right” high-quality information to craft an effective marketing strategy.</li>\n<li>Learn 4 ways how company giants are using data gathering right now to stay in leadership positions.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2>Statistics predict the future of marketing</h2>\n<p>The value of using data science and analytics in marketing has been increasingly recognized. Currently, about <a href=\"https://www.gartner.com/en/documents/3883171\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">3 out of every 4 marketing leaders (76%)</a> base decisions on data analytics. Globally, the budgets for data-driven marketing has also been increasing rapidly.</p>\n<p>In 2019 reaching its <a href=\"https://cmosurvey.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/15/2019/02/The_CMO_Survey-Highlights-and_Insights_Report-Feb-2019.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">highest point in six years</a>. The overwhelming majority <a href=\"https://www.mediamath.com/blog/resource/the-global-review-data-driven-marketing-and-advertising/#sthash.YxrsCjSA.dpuf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">(73%) of marketing associations agree</a> that this trend is expected to continue in the future.</p>\n<p>This trend has been echoed by executives and CEOs worldwide. They confirm that data-driven marketing is crucial to success in a hyper-competitive global economy, as Forbes Insights and Turn report reveal.</p>\n<h2>Lessons from the best of the best</h2>\n<p>What do Disney, Apple, Uber, and Amazon have in common?</p>\n<p>Apart from all being at the top of their game, these companies place customer experience as their top priority. Equally, findings from global market studies worldwide show that consumers are more likely to pay more for better customer experience. As a matter of fact, they even tend to prioritize trusting brand relationships over product quality.</p>\n<p>Following this tendency, most successful businesses move from communication to conversation. And to catch this wave, I will tell you exactly how data-driven marketing can help companies get there.</p>\n<h2>Advantages of data-driven marketing</h2>\n<p>For someone who has been working in the business of information for over a decade, it is evident that data analytics is the backbone of marketing automation.</p>\n<p>To develop any successful marketing strategy, there is a need for large amounts of information on the target audience. For example, their attitudes, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/11/how-to-use-behavioral-data-to-inform-marketing-decisions/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">behavior</a> and experiences. Also, activities such as monitoring brand reputation, search engine ratings, and competitors’ behavior should be a part of marketing strategy development.</p>\n<p>All of these goals are simplified ten-fold by automated data gathering. There are few data extraction tools available, most of which rely on web-crawling. It automizes long hours of manual labor spent on researching information. Also, it drastically reduces labor costs and expenses, while at the same time increasing productivity, quality, and the process itself.</p>\n<h2>How does web crawling work?</h2>\n<p>Web crawling, also known as web scraping, is the process of retrieving data from a website. It revolutionizes mundane, mind-numbing tasks of manually extracting data. Instead, web scraping uses well-calculated automation processes to retrieve valuable data from the internet.</p>\n<p>Considering all the advantages that web-scraping offers, it comes as no surprise that this practice is growing in popularity. In fact, marketing is not the only department reaping the benefits. For instance, cyber-security, retail, and travel industries, among others, have been taking advantage of what data can offer.</p>\n<p>The fascinating aspect of web scraping is that it is continually evolving. Indeed, industry leaders continually come up with more and more ways to use big data to reach their business goals. I am certain that there are still unexplored ways of how web crawling can aid companies across the globe to automate their processes and gain valuable insights.</p>\n<h2>4 Fool-proof ways to use data collection</h2>\n<p>Real-time public data scraped from the web has multiple uses and goals to simplify the marketing strategy. Here is to name a few:</p>\n<h3>Make your clients happy</h3>\n<p>Listen, listen, listen. In general, the needs and desires of the customer are the guiding stars for every successful business. In truth, people are giving valuable feedback to companies everywhere on the web: social media, personal blogs, news articles, comment sections, or discussion boards.</p>\n<p>Unfortunately, most of this information never reaches the marketers’ eyes. Uninformed decisions then lead to the creation of products or services that people don’t really care about.</p>\n<p>By effectively tapping into a constant stream of publicly available information, businesses can continually <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/05/marketing-automation-and-customer-service-how-are-they-connected/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">shift their marketing strategy</a> responding to the latest industry trends. This gives a chance to adjust communications appropriately, offer products and services which clients genuinely want, and improve the overall customer experience.</p>\n<h3>Strengthen your brand</h3>\n<p>What are the highest valued companies in the market? The answer? The same companies carrying best-recognized brands in the world. I hope it is evident for everyone that it is no coincidence.</p>\n<p>Strong and well-regarded brands are the result of not only great promotional strategies but robust defense systems against such possible threats as counterfeiting or copyright infringement.</p>\n<h4>Brands suffering from counterfeiting globally.</h4>\n<p>In 2017 alone, the estimated losses the brands have suffered from counterfeiting globally have amounted to staggering 323 billion dollars. Sadly, this grim trend is rising, according to the Global Brand Counterfeiting Report.</p>\n<p>Data-driven marketing can support the<em> c</em>onstant brand vigilance efforts to diminish the damages. As a response to the situation, luxury brands are employing proxies to crawl e-commerce websites, auction sites, and relevant marketplaces to spot the fraudsters.</p>\n<p>Massive-scale web crawling also can support the prosecution process against these illegal activities by collecting all necessary data.</p>\n<h3>Know your competition</h3>\n<p>Being able to obtain and process large amounts of information about your market competition, gives an enormous competitive advantage. The traditional methods of doing market research, including the interviews, surveys, and focus groups, are quickly turning into a thing of the past, giving way for more time and cost-efficient web crawling.</p>\n<p>Automating the market research for such routine processes as tracking changes in pricing, auditing the product line, observing presence online, public engagement, and other promotional activity through various communication channels gives an opportunity to react quicker and more accurately.</p>\n<h3>Be searchable</h3>\n<p>Visibility online is everything. Sadly, statistics are cruel on this matter. According to Protofuse, less than 10% of people advance to page 2 on search engines. This means that even the best products or services available will never reach the eyes and ears of the potential client. The regrettable fact is that the majority of businesses are struggling in this regard.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/01/how-to-do-keyword-research-for-seo/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">SEO (Search Engine Optimization)</a> is the process that allows improving the visibility of the website among the search engine results. Not surprisingly, the web crawling tool is essential for monitoring changes in these ratings. Getting hands-on real-time and location customized data can serve the company to come up with the most effective strategies for increasing exposure instantly.</p>\n<h2>As the game is changing rapidly</h2>\n<p>The use of big data has been in the marketing world for a while now, and it is not going anywhere anytime. On the contrary, the data-driven approaches will continue to shape marketing, along with other industries. To emphasize this point, the global demand for data analytics has been continually increasing and is expected to rise in the future, as pointed out in the Oxylabs 2020 Trend Report.</p>\n<p>In 2019, the market value has reached $49 billion. Concluding from the steady growth rate, it is expected to double in just seven years, reaching an impressive $103 billion by 2027.</p>\n<p>It is fair to say that future data scientists will contribute their skills and technical knowledge in more diverse business sectors.</p>\n<p>The trend is a serious signal for all market players to adapt and embrace the ongoing innovations. However, if they shy away from using the powerful insights from the big data, their competitors will outsmart them in every move, by betting on data-backed decisions.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/14/why-data-scientists-are-becoming-future-marketers/\">Why Data Scientists are Becoming Future Marketers</a> appeared first on <a
