Cerniauskas","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Why-Data-Scientists-are-Becoming-Future-Marketers-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn56@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-13-838_3d31d7ff6a610886.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195874143},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","title":"3 CAD Functions to Understand for Building Your Prototype","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173797","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/07/3-cad-functions-to-understand-for-building-your-prototype/\" title=\"3 CAD Functions to Understand for Building Your Prototype\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/3-CAD-Functions-to-Understand-for-Building-Your-Prototype-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"building your prototype\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/3-CAD-Functions-to-Understand-for-Building-Your-Prototype-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/3-CAD-Functions-to-Understand-for-Building-Your-Prototype-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/3-CAD-Functions-to-Understand-for-Building-Your-Prototype.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Understanding the basics of CAD (Computer-Aided Design) modeling was crucial in building my first working <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/08/death-by-prototype-why-just-getting-started-isnt-enough/\">prototype</a>. At this point, I&#8217;m close to filing a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/01/how-to-save-money-filing-patents/\">patent</a>. None of it would have been possible, though, without understanding three crucial functions present in a lot of the software available out there. Here are three CAD functions to understand for building your prototype.</p>\n<p>Once you understand the following 3 CAD modeling functions, your ideas will come to life sooner than you think.</p>\n<h3>Quick Insights On Prototyping with CAD</h3>\n<p>Using CAD for engineering has <a href=\"https://www.scan2cad.com/cad/cad-evolved-since-1982/\">been around</a> since the late 1950s. It wasn&#8217;t until the mid-1990s, though, that producing 3D models on a personal computer became widely available.</p>\n<p>The best alternative before doing it yourself was contracting with a design firm (unless you had access to the resources that they did). Well-known entrepreneurs like Joy Mangano spent small fortunes bringing their products to life back when they were starting out.</p>\n<p>In Mangano&#8217;s case &#8212; it was $100,000 for the <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2001/02/11/nyregion/cleaning-up-in-business-with-a-mop.html\">development process</a> of the Miracle Mop &#8212; clear back in the early &#8217;90s.</p>\n<h3>Things Are Different Now</h3>\n<p>The good news is that now there are a ton of free open-source software options on the internet for CAD modeling.</p>\n<p>Some commercial-grade software even has a free option until you hit a certain revenue threshold with your product (like the one I use).</p>\n<p>These software options work great if you&#8217;re on a shoestring budget and need to build something yourself.</p>\n<p>Plus, this is a near risk-free approach compared to borrowing a bunch of money and having deadlines to pay people back.</p>\n<h3>Real-Life CAD Example</h3>\n<p>David Barnett, the inventor of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/28/25-gifts-with-mom-in-mind-a-mothers-day-gift-guide/\">PopSockets</a>, leveraged a partial DIY strategy in the early days of his company. After working through 60 prototypes by himself, he eventually saw the product take-off (not without a few ups and downs along the way, though).</p>\n<p>Barnett used a design firm for a phone case that was part of an early Kickstarter campaign.</p>\n<p>That cost him a little over $100,000. However, he perfected the PopSocket accordion mechanism (the backbone of the product) by himself with the CAD program Solidworks.</p>\n<p>Today, Barnett&#8217;s company has seen years where revenues have reached as much as $200 million (2018). In this <a href=\"https://mixergy.com/interviews/popsockets-with-david-barnett/\">interview with Mixergy</a>, he briefly touched on how simple it was to draw out a sketch and get started.</p>\n<h3>Sketch</h3>\n<p>A sketch lays the groundwork for your CAD models. If you want to build something similar to the many widely available consumer products on the market, start with a sketch. Plus, you probably already have a few doodles in your notebook of what <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/09/06/20-exciting-business-ideas-that-you-can-start-for-10k-or-less/\">your ideas</a> are.</p>\n<p>It&#8217;s just a matter of drawing them out on-screen and deciding the specific measurements. Don&#8217;t worry if you aren&#8217;t great at math. I personally struggled through geometry until the last painful final exam in my sophomore year of high school.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_173800\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-173800\" style=\"width: 473px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ToothbrushheadSketch-1024x532-1.png\"><img class=\"wp-image-173800\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ToothbrushheadSketch-1024x532-1-300x156.png\" alt=\"CAD Toothbrush Head Sketch\" width=\"473\" height=\"246\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ToothbrushheadSketch-1024x532-1-300x156.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ToothbrushheadSketch-1024x532-1-900x468.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ToothbrushheadSketch-1024x532-1-260x135.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ToothbrushheadSketch-1024x532-1.png 1024w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 473px) 100vw, 473px\" /></a><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-173800\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><em>Toothbrush Head Sketch I Started To Make In Fusion 360</em></figcaption></figure></p>\n<p>&#160;</p>\n<h3>Creativity Finds A Way</h3>\n<p>It may sound funny or weird, but, if you have the idea clear enough in your head, your brain will probably figure out how to navigate most CAD software.</p>\n<p>Plus, there are plenty of available tutorials on the internet. The sketching just involves clicking and dragging, anyway. Use a 12-inch ruler with millimeters on it to figure out the current dimensions of the sketches in your notebook.</p>\n<p>Using your ruler will make drawing your designs out on the screen a lot easier.</p>\n<p>Once you have a digital sketch that looks like what you need, you can start experimenting with making that sketch three dimensional.</p>\n<h3>Extruding A CAD Model</h3>\n<p>When you create a virtual 3D object out of a sketch, you are &#8220;extruding&#8221; it.</p>\n<p>There might be other words for the same action in different software toolbars, like &#8220;press pull&#8221; or &#8220;push-pull,&#8221; for example.</p>\n<p>&#8220;Extrude&#8221; means &#8220;to force or push something out of something,&#8221; according to <a href=\"https://www.oxfordlearnersdictionaries.com/us/definition/english/extrude\">Oxford Learner&#8217;s Dictionary</a>. The nice thing about everything being virtual is that you can extrude shapes from your sketches at whatever distance you want and make changes immediately if things don&#8217;t look the way you thought they would.</p>\n<p>Any shape can be extruded, as long as the sketch is drawn appropriately. Multi-faceted objects will require a more complex sketch to create, though.</p>\n<h3>Sketch In, Sketch Out</h3>\n<p>You can draw sketches within other ones (for those complex objects) and choose to extrude very specific tiny parts if needed.</p>\n<p>For example, if you were designing a toothbrush head, there would likely be a large oval sketch with many tiny circle sketches inside of it for the bristle holes. After extruding the main brush head whichever distance makes sense, you can decide the depth for extruding each hole.</p>\n<p>My thoughts for the drawing are to extrude the same amount of depth for each hole all at once. Here&#8217;s what that would look like:</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_173802\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-173802\" style=\"width: 404px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/CAD-Extruding-Toothbrush-Head-Holes-1024x592-1.png\"><img class=\"wp-image-173802\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/CAD-Extruding-Toothbrush-Head-Holes-1024x592-1-300x173.png\" alt=\"CAD Toothbrush Head 3D Object\" width=\"404\" height=\"233\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/CAD-Extruding-Toothbrush-Head-Holes-1024x592-1-300x173.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/CAD-Extruding-Toothbrush-Head-Holes-1024x592-1-900x520.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/CAD-Extruding-Toothbrush-Head-Holes-1024x592-1-260x150.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/CAD-Extruding-Toothbrush-Head-Holes-1024x592-1.png 1024w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 404px) 100vw, 404px\" /></a><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-173802\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><em>Extruding my main sketch and then the small holes for bristles.</em></figcaption></figure></p>\n<p>After you arrive at a design that you think works to 3D-print and play around with, it&#8217;s time for the last step.</p>\n<h3>Save the CAD As &#8220;.STL&#8221;</h3>\n<p>If you have a 3D-printer or know where to send your object (like a printing service) you will need to save it in the &#8220;.STL&#8221; format and send it there.</p>\n<p>Some CAD software may have a menu option that says you can print directly, but, I&#8217;ve found it easier to just save the file.</p>\n<p>The .STL file format stands for &#8220;Stereolithography&#8221; and is the <a href=\"https://www.loc.gov/preservation/digital/formats/fdd/fdd000504.shtml\">standard format</a> for desktop 3D printing. The file will need to be opened in the software that controls your 3D-printer.</p>\n<h3>There are a lot of free options out there for that, too.</h3>\n<p>The printer software will convert the STL file to G-code so your printer can understand it. G-code is the <a href=\"https://whatis.techtarget.com/definition/G-code\">standard language</a> used by 3D-printers.</p>\n<p>Since each CAD modeling software and 3D printing software will be a little different, each will have its own unique parts to navigate. The 3D printers menus should be pretty straightforward, though, and it will probably be quick and easy getting your design sent to a printer. I usually ask someone who has done this before to help me set up. </p>\n<p>Depending on the complexity of your design, I can&#8217;t promise the printing of the object itself will be a quick process. Even reasonably simple designs take time to print in those 3D printing beasts &#8212; but it is so fun and rewarding to see the finished product.</p>\n<h3>Sacrificing Time For Money</h3>\n<p>Even if it takes a long time to print (8+ hours is long to me), 3D printing is still by far the best way to build a prototype without <a href=\"https://www.thiscollegelife.com/finance/make-money/67-places-to-make-money-online/\">much money</a>.</p>\n<p>Contracting with a professional firm could cost anywhere from $10,000 and up, as past entrepreneurs have experienced. If your goal is to build a prototype that works enough to prove the concept, this is the way to go.</p>\n<p>However, I&#8217;ve printed some fun stuff by just asking around who owns a 3D printer and have been able to use one in a friend&#8217;s office. Ask around and try to find one. </p>\n<h3>Tying It All Together</h3>\n<p>Once you understand the basics of CAD modeling, you will be well on your way to making <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/02/9-best-project-management-software-tools-of-2020/\">your own project</a>.</p>\n<p>Sketching it out, extruding, and saving the file in &#8220;.STL&#8221; format are the basic steps to take in order to get something tangible off the bed of a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/22/how-to-use-tech-to-lower-your-production-and-operating-costs/\">3D printer</a>.</p>\n<p>If you do create a physical prototype of something unique and new that solves a problem, make sure to take the time for filing a patent (or at least a provisional patent) before telling the market about it.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/07/3-cad-functions-to-understand-for-building-your-prototype/\">3 CAD Functions to Understand for Building Your Prototype</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 07 Aug 2020 15:00:02 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/3-CAD-Functions-to-Understand-for-Building-Your-Prototype.jpg","linkMd5":"a703acf0399b027df540d83e8d1c27be","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn20@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-26-725_48d62bcc332d20b5.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/3-CAD-Functions-to-Understand-for-Building-Your-Prototype.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":67367,"destBytes":60578,"author":"Bob Buckley","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/3-CAD-Functions-to-Understand-for-Building-Your-Prototype-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn48@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-10-658_23e9565f2cebd9c6.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ToothbrushheadSketch-1024x532-1-300x156.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn4@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-13-989_fb24c5394f1c91c9.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/CAD-Extruding-Toothbrush-Head-Holes-1024x592-1-300x173.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn51@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-15-865_1573952aae9f5b5a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195870363},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"How Smart Cities Can Help Build a Better Post-Pandemic World","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169183","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/22/how-smart-cities-can-help-build-a-better-post-pandemic-world/\" title=\"How Smart Cities Can Help Build a Better Post-Pandemic World\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/How-Smart-Cities-Can-Help-Build-a-Better-Post-Pandemic-World-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"smart cities pandemic\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/How-Smart-Cities-Can-Help-Build-a-Better-Post-Pandemic-World-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/How-Smart-Cities-Can-Help-Build-a-Better-Post-Pandemic-World-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/How-Smart-Cities-Can-Help-Build-a-Better-Post-Pandemic-World.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>If we look back on the past five years, we would find many breath-taking tech advancements. Smart cities, micro-drones, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/02/demystifying-8-core-myths-that-surround-the-internet-of-things/\">Internet of Things</a>, connected logistics, artificial intelligence, etc. have put us on a platform where pride comes naturally. We can talk about the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/11/5-digital-health-technologies-helping-to-stop-the-coronavirus-pandemic/\">coronavirus pandemic</a> and lockdowns all we want. However, we shouldn’t forget one thing. Technology has empowered us with numerous advantages to fight this crisis.</p>\n<p>We are in this together. It’s not just a statement, it’s a fact. Let’s pause for a minute and evaluate the ‘tomorrow’ beyond the current pandemic. When we do get through this tunnel, we should endeavor to build a better and more connected world together.</p>\n<p>In this article, we would talk about: why this is important; what we can improve; and how we should go about doing it.</p>\n<h2><strong>How global cities measure up during this pandemic.</strong></h2>\n<p>We kept speaking about <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/20/how-6-tech-giants-are-giving-smbs-a-hand-in-the-pandemic/\">disruption and innovation</a> for years. The starting point for both was ‘need identification’. Where are the gaps, and why aren’t they being filled? Let’s look at some of these points.</p>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<h3><strong>Information overload with minimal applications.</strong></h3>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>The world has been consuming information and data at an extravagant rate. Hence, the current slowdown (in all news other than the pandemic) has pushed people into consuming coronavirus updates like candy. This, inevitably, pushes us towards information overload.</p>\n<p>This has led to misinterpretations, misinformation, and misrepresentations. In short, there’s too much information that doesn’t lead anywhere. It doesn’t have any application or doesn’t solve anything. It’s just noise.</p>\n<ol start=\"2\">\n<li>\n<h3><strong>Multiple</strong><strong> labor and logistics bottlenecks.</strong></h3>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Lockdown and travel restrictions have prioritized essential services (medical, food supply, utilities, etc.) over all other goods or people&#8217;s movement. This sounds good on paper. However, there have been problems with getting the right people and the right supplies to where it’s most needed.</p>\n<p>Some cities and states have shut down their borders. Shutting down borders further hinders the smooth logistics movement. There are (understandably) multiple checks and balances. Checks and balances, also delay the delivery and availability of essential goods and services.</p>\n<ol start=\"3\">\n<li>\n<h3><strong>Longer reaction times due to inertia.</strong></h3>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>The above points (and many intermediate ones) culminate into longer reaction times. The authorities get stuck with firefighting and decision inertia. These decisions, in turn, lead to food and supply insecurities among the masses, especially the poor. Another point of worry with decision inertia is the inadequate or delayed testing, reporting, and isolation of possible infections.</p>\n<h2><strong>The Smart City Approach: What it means and how it can help</strong></h2>\n<p>Let us now develop a scientific approach towards the crisis management. What are the facts and how do we proceed? The underlying, and inherent benefits of smart cities, here, turn into essential tools.</p>\n<p>The ‘Smart City Approach’ is when authorities within the city leverage real-time insights and updates. With this, they streamline their crisis response, plan for process improvements, and ensure <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/19/break-the-mold-with-real-world-logistics-ai-and-iot/\">seamless logistics</a>.</p>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<h3><strong>Detection and reporting: Fast and decisive action.</strong></h3>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>We need better ways to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/05/securing-the-digital-workplace-amidst-the-covid-19-pandemic/\">detect and report possible Covid-19 cases</a>. Moreover, we also need better reporting for other emergencies relating to the operations and governance of major cities. Cities like New York, London, Singapore, and Mumbai have been global travel hubs for decades. These globally-connected cities need faster case (or emergency) detection and reporting.</p>\n<ol start=\"2\">\n<li>\n<h3><strong>A collaborative approach from cities, states, and nations.</strong></h3>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Cities and countries need to be on the same page with the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/30/big-data-as-a-double-edged-sword-in-the-fight-against-covid-19/\">fight against this unprecedented crisis</a>. We have discovered common threads of empathy and compassion that have connected us all, across demographics. We want this to continue beyond the pandemic. The connectivity and collaboration will help us recover, as companies and cities, faster.</p>\n<ol start=\"3\">\n<li>\n<h3><strong>Stakeholder mapping and planning.</strong></h3>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>The crisis has thrown many curveballs. It seems like when cities solve one issue, another rears its head. There are migrant workers and homeless people who stand to be worst affected by the lockdowns. The people on the frontline of the crisis: the doctors, nurses, police, utility, and sanitation personnel, etc. need more attention. They need to be protected with the timely <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/08/what-are-the-benefits-of-gps-tracking-in-the-supply-chain/\">deliveries of necessary equipment</a> and supplies.</p>\n<ol start=\"4\">\n<li>\n<h3><strong>Real-time tracking and information.</strong></h3>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Overall, the cities need to function as one. Each development, each shortage, each victory needs to be tracked, recorded, and utilized. Smart cities cover all these aspects with aplomb. These cities have the power to handle live information and turn them into key insights.</p>\n<h2><strong>The Application: How smart cities can be better equipped.</strong></h2>\n<p>We have talked about improving the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/26/iot-and-home-automation-is-it-the-future/\">connectivity and conditions</a> of our cities by turning them into truly ‘smart cities’. The current crisis is unprecedented in every way. We are at a point where we need to minimize the damage, protect the assets (people and economies), and revitalize our operations (in cities).</p>\n<p>We must learn and adapt using the intrinsic smart city concepts to better equip all cities.</p>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<h3><strong><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/23/what-the-drones-of-future-can-do/\">Drones</a> as a catalyst for better visibility.</strong></h3>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Many cities in China, the United States, India, etc. are either planning to use small or micro-drones or are already using them. These drones primarily help:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>gather intel with regular lockdown surveillance (spotting suspicious activities or simply supervising local operations);</li>\n<li>spray disinfectant in areas with active Covid-19 cases (reported);</li>\n<li>detect elevated body temperatures of random people on the streets (used in <a href=\"https://youtu.be/2NyU0bHujiU\">Hunan, China</a>);</li>\n<li>deliver essential medical supplies (especially masks or sanitizers), etc.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Drones can help local city authorities build situational awareness. The mayor or emergency service officials can view live video updates of sensitive (quarantined) zones without putting on-ground forces in harm’s way.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/30/cybersecurity-ensuring-sanity-in-smart-cities/\">All information is encrypted</a> and transmitted back to a central repository for current or future use. The drones also ease the pressure on the overworked essential forces within the city.</p>\n<ol start=\"2\">\n<li>\n<h3><strong>Connected logistics and contactless deliveries.</strong></h3>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>People under different levels of lockdowns depend on their local stores for their groceries and essentials. Hopefully, we are past the initial frenzy and panic buying. Now, the essential goods and equipment must move seamlessly within and outside the cities.</p>\n<p>Many retailers and e-commerce players within major cities have, previously, reaped the benefits of a real-time package and shipment tracking. They used route-planning software to identify <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/22/how-iot-will-play-an-important-role-in-traffic-management-for-smart-cities/\">short and ideal travel routes</a>. This gave them the cumulative benefits of speed, cost, and end-customer satisfaction.</p>\n<p>We need to extend this AI-enabled route planning and live shipment tracking to ensure that all essentials are evenly distributed across districts. Retailers and foodservice providers, along with the local authorities, should engage with this technology as equal collaborators. We will cover more on this in the next point.</p>\n<p>People have been confined to their homes and have become more and more dependent on hyperlocal deliveries of food and groceries. <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/10/customer-experience-vs-customer-service/\">Delivery service companies</a> have stepped up their response with contactless deliveries where prepaid orders can be left at the doorstep.</p>\n<p>The entire ‘proof of delivery’ is conducted in-app. The delivery person sends the receiver a photo of the package (at the receiver’s doorstep). The receiver, then, confirms the delivery. The network interconnectivity within smart cities is the linchpin for such sharp adaptability within delivery companies.</p>\n<ol start=\"3\">\n<li>\n<h3><strong>Centralized city info-system for essential services.</strong></h3>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Local and central governments are keeping a close eye on all relevant developments within cities (and the nation as a whole). Smart cities have been historically more adept at collating and pushing actionable insights. These insights have been critical in effective decision making.</p>\n<p>The authorities, now, must scale and interconnect all related services in the city into one central info-system. It will:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>give the exact cluster map of active and suspect Covid-19 cases (with live health and status updates)</li>\n<li>show live drone-surveillance through key-areas giving real-time intel about select or sensitive areas</li>\n<li>enable retailers and suppliers to update their stock-levels as they depreciate in real-time\n<ul>\n<li>This will trigger automated delivery requests.</li>\n<li>The authorities can track delivery trucks in real-time, through in-vehicle trackers, and direct them to the shops with lower supplies.</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>help plan and execute structured disinfecting of different areas in the city</li>\n<li>ensure proper law and sanitation upkeep through automated and regular drone-surveillance</li>\n<li>ensure on-time food packet deliveries to the elderly, homeless, and needy (this can be enabled through interconnected community-based reporting)</li>\n</ul>\n<p>A connected and centralized info-system ensures effortless smart city management. This leaves the authorities with enough insights (as they study cluster patterns) to tackle and overcome the pandemic.</p>\n<h2><strong>Beyond the crisis: Recovery and rebuilding.</strong></h2>\n<p>According to sources, we are in the midst of a recession. We will understand the full extent of the economic backlash once we emerge from the current crisis. However, we have our work cut out for us.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/17/what-the-interconnected-inside-sales-landscape-will-look-like-in-5-years/\">Technology and connectivity </a>have helped us fight this pandemic. Smart cities with emerging and innovative tech applications have witnessed faster and effective testing and reporting. These cities have set the benchmarks for adaptability and recovery. We must embolden more cities with smart and connected technology. This will strengthen us and hasten the rebuilding phase for our communities.</p>\n<p>Future generations would read about this pandemic in their history books. Let’s turn our response to it, as a global community, into something that would motivate them for years.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Gerd Altmann; Pixabay</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/22/how-smart-cities-can-help-build-a-better-post-pandemic-world/\">How Smart Cities Can Help Build a Better Post-Pandemic World</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 22 May 2020 15:00:32 Shaikh","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/How-Smart-Cities-Can-Help-Build-a-Better-Post-Pandemic-World-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn71@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-23-404_778568d0cb7b25ea.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877364},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"Know Your Customer Regulations in Crypto Exchanges","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=168093","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/20/know-your-customer-regulations-in-crypto-exchanges/\" title=\"Know Your Customer Regulations in Crypto Exchanges\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Know-Your-Customer-Regulations-in-Crypto-Exchanges-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"regulations in crypto exchanges\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Know-Your-Customer-Regulations-in-Crypto-Exchanges-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Know-Your-Customer-Regulations-in-Crypto-Exchanges-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Know-Your-Customer-Regulations-in-Crypto-Exchanges.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Over the past few years, buying top digital currencies such as Bitcoin and Ether is common in off-exchange trading. The utilization of digital assets at a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/16/10-crypto-gurus-you-have-to-follow/\">corporate level is quite promising</a>. The cash management is revolutionizing, which is revamping the conventional payment flows using blockchain. Here is how to know the &#8220;know your customer&#8221; regulations in the crypto exchanges.</p>\n<h3>Corporate banking entities use a distributed ledger where all the transactional information is stored.</h3>\n<p>An end-to-end process pledges a level of assurance to all the parties that have participated in the fund pool and their security. Digital currency services have eliminated the intermediaries and reduced the cost of all the payment transfer infrastructure for transaction records and security.</p>\n<p>Before diving deep, let’s look into the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/15/top-25-blockchain-and-cryptocurrency-speakers/\">types of exchanges active today in the crypto market:</a></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/16/crypto-banking-traditional-bankings-competition-or-ally/\">Crypto exchanges</a> are divided into two major groups: “fiat-to-crypto” and “crypto-to-crypto” exchanges.</p>\n<h3><b>Fiat-to-Crypto Exchanges </b></h3>\n<p>The exchanges perform ‘due diligence measures’ as they deal with the fiat money. The exchanges are required to conduct business with financial institutions.</p>\n<p>It&#8217;s therefore required to perform stringent KYC procedures to ensure a clean customer base before doing business with the entities. In fiat-to-crypto exchanges, fiat money enters into the market of cryptocurrency.</p>\n<p>The exchanges allow exchanging the fiat currency with the supported digital assets. For exampl,e dollars for ether.</p>\n<h3><b>Crypto-to-Crypto Exchanges</b></h3>\n<p>The crypto-to-crypto exchanges allow the users to exchange one cryptocurrency for the other. These are online platforms like stock/currency exchange. Here, buyers and sellers trade are performed based on the current price in the cryptocurrency market.</p>\n<p>Exchanges play as a middle-man. One cryptocurrency is exchanged with another type of cryptocurrency to get profit.</p>\n<p>Other than the Bitcoin and Ether, there are other altcoins, and to buy them, people will need a crypto exchange. The exchanges are an important component of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/14/transparency-in-the-cryptocurrency-ecosystem-with-james-giancotti/\">the whole crypto market</a>. The investments, buying, and selling take place through a crypto exchange as an intermediary.</p>\n<p>Investors and stakeholders are facilitated through exchanges. Now, most of the time unknowingly, bad actors participate in the crypto network and perform financial crimes such as money laundering and other malevolent activities.</p>\n<p>The global regulatory scrutiny has pinpointed the crypto exchanges to undergo stringent ‘customer due diligence’ measures to deter the risk of financial frauds.</p>\n<p>The fifth Anti Money Laundering Directive (AMLD5) has clearly declared the need for identity verification measures of each customer opt to participate in the crypto exchanges. AMLD5 obligations include Know Your Customer (KYC) compliance, Anti Money Laundering (AML), and Combating the Financing of Terrorism (CFT) compliance.</p>\n<p>Crypto exchanges across the globe are required to verify each onboarding customer against the identity verification parameters to make sure that no bad actor is facilitated. Such critical concerns make KYC and AML compliance mandatory for the crypto exchanges that ensure a filtered clean customer base.</p>\n<h2><b>Components of Know Your Customer</b></h2>\n<p>KYC refers to a set of processes and procedures adopted by businesses to identify and verify the identity of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/13/digital-onboarding-the-first-step-of-your-banks-digitalization/\">onboarding customers</a> to deter the risk of fraud and final crimes. KYC fundamentally incorporates four elements: identification procedures, acceptance policy, risk management, and transaction monitoring.</p>\n<p>The concern of the KYC verification process in cryptocurrency is as a result of money laundering. Through stringent identity verification procedure, crypto exchanges can fight against the acts of terrorism and money laundering. KYC verification includes verification of an individual against the collected information such as name, address, date of birth, etc.</p>\n<h3><b>How crypto exchanges approach regulatory obligations?</b></h3>\n<p>As per regulatory compliance, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/05/kyb-and-aml-screening-what-is-it-and-why-is-it-significant-for-business/\">KYC verification</a> needs to be done throughout the customer lifecycle. A distributed ledger or blockchain is a complex infrastructure that holds the record of all transactions.</p>\n<p>Using strong cryptography, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/08/detecting-and-protecting-against-ransomware-best-practice-for-2020/\">the blocks are encrypted</a> to make it hard for an unauthorized entity to access it or temper it. There are a total of four levels in which KYC verification is divided. These are:</p>\n<p><b>Customer Acceptance Policy (CAP):</b> In this stage, a company makes a document containing the details on the basis of which customer is allowed to make a relationship with its customers. The company selects a customer only if their identity is credible and is found appropriate after assigning a risk rating in the process of customer due diligence.</p>\n<p><b>Customer Identification Program (CIP):</b> This is a stage in which customer identification is done to ensure that a company can <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/16/does-artificial-intelligence-help-fight-financial-fraud/\">continue financial transactions</a> with a customer.</p>\n<p><b>Risk Management: </b>Customer identification is done and a rating is given to the profile as per the risk associated with the customer.</p>\n<p><b>Continuous Transaction Monitoring:</b> Throughout the customer lifecycle, transactions should be monitored continuously to identify suspicious transactions if any.</p>\n<h2><b>The current state of regulatory compliance in Crypto Exchanges</b></h2>\n<p>With respect to compliance, the current situation in crypto exchanges is not that satisfactory or we can say it is not according to the obligations of regulators. It is studied that two-third of crypto exchanges fail to strongly comply with the regulations. They have a vague understanding regarding molding the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/11/online-id-verification-a-primer-for-fintech-businesses/\">operations according to the requirements</a>.</p>\n<p>Crypto exchanges ask for name, email address, and contact number, nothing else, which is not enough information for customer verification. This is the reason that banks and financial institutions prefer not to work with crypto exchanges.</p>\n<p>After the evaluation, it is found that some <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/01/is-blockchain-winning-or-losing-4-stages-of-blockchain-evolution/\">crypto exchanges now ask primary documents</a> from the customers such as a photograph, passport, and a written certificate. However, these pieces of information might not be enough to conduct a proper KYC procedure.</p>\n<p>Some exchanges perform low-level compliance, for example a crypto exchange, Binance asks its customers to provide a passport at the time of sign-up. With this, security concerns about user <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/12/19/4-things-spotify-can-teach-you-about-data-sharing/\">personal data collection are raised</a>. However, some exchanges do not even ask for this information.</p>\n<h2><b>Reasons why crypto exchanges overlook compliance procedures</b></h2>\n<p>Regulatory scrutiny has shown a lack of adoption of regulatory demands in cryptocurrency exchanges. Following are the reasons why crypto exchanges do not take into account regulators:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>The crypto market is in full swing.</strong> The competition between the pool of exchanges disregards the regulatory obligations. Ther customers find KYC procedures cumbersome due to which exchanges prefer not to include them in their operations.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>KYC compliance is a time taking process.</strong> It takes hours for crypto exchanges, just like commercial <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/05/kyb-and-aml-screening-what-is-it-and-why-is-it-significant-for-business/\">banks to perform customer due diligence</a> that increases customer drop-out rate.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>The cost to undergo KYC procedures</strong> in an organization is too much. Banks are already spending millions of dollars every year <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/23/is-technology-artificially-engineering-panic/\">on ‘due diligence’ measures.</a> The similar norms to take into account as compliance costs for crypto exchanges can become critical.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>There are vague statements.</strong> Crypto exchanges find hard times in analyzing the requirements of KYC and AML regulations in the light of virtual assets. Whether the industry is supposed to undergo KYC compliance, exactly the banks do or there s some leverage.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>Regulatory bodies such as FATF and AMLD5 enforce the adoption</strong> of KYC/AML/CFT compliance on virtual currency service providers that perform ‘customer due diligence’ measures. For example, from identity verification to transaction monitoring and record-keeping to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2013/04/12/3-ways-the-irs-is-tracking-you-online/\">reporting suspicious transactions</a>. Further elaboration for <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/20/is-cryptocurrency-the-new-target-for-cyber-criminals/\">crypto exchanges is required</a> by regulators to act accordingly.</li>\n</ul>\n<h4><b>Conclusion</b></h4>\n<p>The highly complex financial <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/01/is-blockchain-winning-or-losing-4-stages-of-blockchain-evolution/\">infrastructure of blockchain</a> is out of the scope of regulators who face a hard time understanding the flow. However, the anonymity factor in the cryptocurrency paves the paths for criminal activities for whom the platform is not less than a haven.</p>\n<p>Similarly, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/27/3-amazing-strategies-that-will-burst-cybercrimes-in-2020/\">financial crimes</a> such as money laundering and terrorist financing are facilitated through them due to which crypto exchanges are under the red zone of regulatory scrutiny. As per regulatory requirements, there is a need for proper KYC/AML procedures in the crypto industry to make it transparent in the whole financial market.</p>\n<p>Crypto exchanges are in need of the right direction and clear testaments by regulatory authorities with respect to the compliance requirements. However, another challenge of balancing the high compliance costs can be solved by utilizing the third-party compliance solutions that align according to the requirements of global and local regulators.</p>\n<p>If one <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/10/15/cryptocurrency-fraud-is-the-exception-not-the-rule/\">crypto exchange takes the initiative</a> of adherence to compliance, to maintain the reputation, other cryptocurrency platforms would definitely contribute their devotion and cost to such measures.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/20/know-your-customer-regulations-in-crypto-exchanges/\">Know Your Customer Regulations in Crypto Exchanges</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 20 Apr 2020 18:00:39 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Know-Your-Customer-Regulations-in-Crypto-Exchanges.jpg","linkMd5":"357bac3c3697b66f4817efe773f81e6a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn67@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-09-724_19fa490135774b60.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Know-Your-Customer-Regulations-in-Crypto-Exchanges.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":61514,"destBytes":57940,"author":"James Efron","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Know-Your-Customer-Regulations-in-Crypto-Exchanges-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn92@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-23-068_1e3b86f4eb798885.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878346},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"75 Billion Reasons to Talk About Cybersecurity","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169188","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/21/75-billion-reasons-to-talk-about-cybersecurity/\" title=\"75 Billion Reasons to Talk About Cybersecurity\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/75-Billion-Reasons-to-Talk-About-Cybersecurity-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"cybersecurity\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/75-Billion-Reasons-to-Talk-About-Cybersecurity-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/75-Billion-Reasons-to-Talk-About-Cybersecurity-900x601.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/75-Billion-Reasons-to-Talk-About-Cybersecurity-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/75-Billion-Reasons-to-Talk-About-Cybersecurity-1536x1026.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/75-Billion-Reasons-to-Talk-About-Cybersecurity.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Recent events have reminded all of us how much we rely on smart connected devices to accomplish daily tasks, get work done, and stay in touch with our families and friends. It’s very likely that many of these experiences will remain as examples for us in the future.</p>\n<p>It’s a good time to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/30/cybersecurity-ensuring-sanity-in-smart-cities/\">revisit the topic of cybersecurity.</a> Specifically, we need to look at the current forecasts that say we will have 75 billion devices connected to the Internet of Things by 2025. The sheer numbers are beyond comprehension. We should work together <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/12/developing-a-secure-fintech-app-best-practice-for-2020/\">to seek better standards</a> with adequate certification schemes, including harmonized safety and security provisions to be designed directly into those devices <em>before </em>they arrive in markets.</p>\n<h4>Do the numbers understate the potential growth in the amount and, more importantly, the use of connected devices?</h4>\n<p>Devices that can sense, think, connect and act will enable a world to do many tasks that are anticipated.  Automation will be making everyday activities “smarter” in ways we can only now imagine. The plethora of devices will not only sense the world, but they also will physically act on the planet. Globally, we should all be safer, and all things more sustainable for individuals and businesses.</p>\n<p>Using our devices more often for more things could also make us more vulnerable as we depend on processing and zettabytes of data utilized through increased edge computing (locally, in those devices), along with a growing reliance on the cloud. We must, therefore, step up and assume increased security measures as a core function of these smart devices.</p>\n<p>We’ll only realize the full potential of smart, connected devices if we can trust and rely on them to be safe and secure. Here’s what it’ll take:</p>\n<h3><strong>Shared Standards</strong></h3>\n<p>Currently, services like payments and eGovernment rely on ecosystems that follow globally accepted and implemented security standards, which are supplemented by strong and continually updated commonly trusted certification schemes.</p>\n<p>IoT is still in its early stages where products do not interoperate easily, and such standards and certifications are missing, but we can learn from markets with high-security standards. Another brick in the wall that’s missing is standards that entail the appropriate combination of safety and security. IoT standardization has to learn from Healthcare, Automotive, Industrial, and Critical Infrastructure standards.</p>\n<p>The trust in future IoT is to be based on independent, economically acceptable assessments and applicable to any type of IoT vertical. NXP advocates here a certification standard called “Security Evaluation Scheme for IoT Platforms” (SESIP), grounded in the Common Criteria certification scheme for highly secure components but covering the full span of IoT devices from low-end low-resources ones to the powerful edge-computing gateways.</p>\n<p>In addition, IoT devices will have unmanaged lifetimes. Absolute security does not exist; this implies that we need standards defining ways to recover some baseline functionality in case a system is compromised: resilience is key, and this is where safety and security meet each other. If some level of control can be regained there, is less incentive for it to be attacked again.</p>\n<p>IoT devices will be part of large complex systems; this implies that not only devices but also system security requirements standards are to be defined as well, globally with a focus on local requirements. Mutual recognition of security standards is needed to ensure scalability in the industry.</p>\n<p>Last but not least, in addition to security and safety, a third pillar is to be considered: privacy. IoT devices are accumulating huge amounts of personal data that needs to be protected in a secure way.</p>\n<p>For all those reasons, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/18/what-can-we-expect-for-iot-in-2020/\">governments and industry</a> need to redouble their work to develop and embrace <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/10/wifi-range-hacks-2020/\">common security standards</a> and certification schemes for this next phase of IoT growth. One such mechanism for this collaboration is the Charter of Trust, which NXP co-founded with Siemens and other leading technology businesses. The Charter serves as a common ground for exploring the needs <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/03/tackling-the-challenge-of-iot-software-updates/\">for shared standards,</a> a way to collaboratively develop them, and a platform from which companies can adopt them.</p>\n<h3><strong>Anticipatory Development </strong></h3>\n<p>In our era of rapid and continual change, it’s only smart to anticipate that devices will need to either accommodate <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/08/iot-and-healthcare-when-technology-comes-into-play-to-improve-lives/\">multiple security requirements</a> and adopt to new ones as they’re developed and deployed. This challenges businesses to consider how to make devices and entire solutions more addressable and flexible too, and by those changing needs.</p>\n<p>For instance, there are currently multiple standards for vehicle-to-infrastructure communications (or “V2X”), which is core to enabling smart cars to function as part of integrated, constantly learning, and real-time networks. Add access to all of the less mission-critical functions and services, such as entertainment content and shopping, and it’s vital that designs for new vehicles take into account the likelihood that multiple standards may apply now, and perhaps change in the near future.</p>\n<p>This means designing for multiple standards; think product labels in North America that often include descriptions in English, Spanish and French, so the same products can be marketed on shelves in different countries (and made accessible to different users). It also means focusing on the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/05/7-actionable-tips-to-secure-your-smart-home-and-iot-devices/\">secure connectivity of those devices</a>, not just their functional safety and security, so that devices can be updated (over-the-air, or “OTA”) when needed.</p>\n<p>Again, to stretch the language analogy a bit more, many countries use different algorithms to implement similar methodologies to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/11/ai-startups-need-data-and-the-government-needs-help/\">protect against the same sort of security risks</a> (i.e., attacks can be agnostically identified and ranked by likelihood, frequency, potential impact, etc.). Anticipatory development challenges developers to see these common or shared requirements and address them.</p>\n<h3><strong>Security by Default</strong></h3>\n<p>Ultimately, security is not only a functional attribute of a product or network but rather an aspect of the design itself; security is something that is inherent, “built-in” versus “added on.” Security and safety are holistic system properties. A key strategy to address the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/27/these-mistakes-can-derail-a-legacy-software-conversion/\">emergent security challenge</a> of 75 billion connected devices will be to continue to produce them with security by default</p>\n<p>One way to do this is to physically insert a small component into a device that provides an identifier key and a secure execution environment. Such hard-wiring of one end is what you could call “a secure handshake” (also known as a “root of trust”) makes it incredibly difficult, if not impossible, to hack or trick the device (unless an evil-doer possessed the proper identifier). It’s not a software overlay.</p>\n<p>We possess potent tools to address the emergent <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/04/cyber-security-modern-technology-and-business-threats/\">cybersecurity challenge</a> ahead of us: Pursuing shared standards, anticipating multiple requirements and changes, and building secure components into devices themselves can, when taken together, empower businesses and ultimately individuals and businesses to benefit from the immense productivity and quality of life advances that continued growth in smart, connected IoT devices will bring.</p>\n<p>And we have at least 75 billion reasons to build a safer IoT world.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/21/75-billion-reasons-to-talk-about-cybersecurity/\">75 Billion Reasons to Talk About Cybersecurity</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 21 May 2020 15:00:27 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/75-Billion-Reasons-to-Talk-About-Cybersecurity.jpg","linkMd5":"cfabbe8ce8f07c16a71a0f4799c46607","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn43@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-27-577_fcf7a94c31e2d2b1.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/75-Billion-Reasons-to-Talk-About-Cybersecurity.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1282,"sourceBytes":174666,"destBytes":111684,"author":"Lars Reger","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/75-Billion-Reasons-to-Talk-About-Cybersecurity-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn8@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-21-591_f823ca5aa1f8570b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877731},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"Refocusing Your Agency’s Media Operations During the Pandemic Will Lead to Long-Term Growth","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169186","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/07/refocusing-media-operations-during-pandemic-long-term-growth/\" title=\"Refocusing Your Agency’s Media Operations During the Pandemic Will Lead to Long-Term Growth\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"198\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-31-at-10.28.00-AM-300x198.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-31-at-10.28.00-AM-300x198.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-31-at-10.28.00-AM-242x160.png 242w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-31-at-10.28.00-AM.png 879w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>During the COVID-19 crisis, not many sectors of the economy are growing, including the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/30/invoking-emotional-advertising-to-engage-your-audience/\">advertising</a> industry. In fact, many advertising agencies are looking for ways to trim back as clients postpone projects or cut advertising dollars. This crisis has also caused agency owners to rethink their company structure and to find ways to trim expenses by outsourcing their media department.</p>\n<p>To help agency leaders capitalize on these outsourced cost savings, I sat down with Jack Miller. Miller is CEO of <a href=\"https://www.truemediaservices.com/\">True Media</a>, a media strategy and communications firm that helps corporate clients develop efficient, effective advertising plans. True Media specializes in traditional, digital, social, and mobile media throughout the United States and Canada.</p>\n<p>Miller’s take? It’s the ideal time to bring in new resources through partnerships.</p>\n<h1><b>Crises Highlight Challenges</b></h1>\n<p>Crises like the coronavirus outbreak have a way of bringing existing issues to the forefront. The growing complexity of media is a great example.</p>\n<p>“As media has become more fragmented over the past several years and data has become a bigger piece of the puzzle, it has become harder for full-service agencies to do it all,” Miller says. “Agencies’ media teams are struggling to keep pace with staffing, software research, and analytics needs.”</p>\n<p>As agencies look to trim overhead, they’re having to make hard choices: Should they scale back on SEO experts, or should they instead make cuts to the creative department budget? Which media research subscriptions are worth keeping, and which can be done without?</p>\n<p>Larger cuts aren’t always better, Miller cautions. He brings up <a href=\"http://www.brethertonday.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/09/Learning-To-Love-Recession.pdf\">McKinsey research</a> that shows companies that succeed in recessions aren’t those that tightened their belts the most; they’re the businesses that accept lower short-term profits for long-term gain.</p>\n<p>In other words, successful leaders refocus rather than merely react.</p>\n<h1><b>Refocusing Your Resources</b></h1>\n<p>To Miller, refocusing is a two-step process: “Slash expenses associated with research tools, subscriptions, platforms, and other technology. At the same time,” he recommends, “broaden access to resources and tools available by partnering with a media agency like True Media.”</p>\n<p>The data backs Miller up. A <a href=\"https://cmosurvey.org/who-outsources-marketing/\">CMO survey</a> found that companies that report the greatest increases in profit, sales, and customer acquisition also report the greatest boost to marketing outsourcing.</p>\n<p>Start with areas outside your specialty, Miller suggests. Most agencies were created and developed around their creative prowess and understanding of branding.  Very few were developed around media planning and buying. Agencies should use this time to double down on their core expertise and partner with other firms who have focused expertise in complimentary services.  “We’ve even created partnerships with agencies where we have embedded media personnel into their office so it feels like you still have an “in-house” media department,” Miller said.</p>\n<h1><b>Steering into the Curve</b></h1>\n<p>According to Miller, now is the time to steer into the curve: Identify the media channels that will drive business once the pandemic passes.</p>\n<p>News media is doing well, in particular. Visits to news sites spiked from 417 million in early February <a href=\"https://www.comscore.com/Insights/Blog/Media-Consumption-during-the-Coronavirus-Pandemic\">to 523 million</a> in mid-March of this year. Local network television viewership in the nation’s top 25 markets grew by a similar 11%.</p>\n<p>In addition to television and digital news media, Miller suggests social networks. “The time is now for your brand to make a splash on social media. People have come out of the woodwork on platforms like Twitter and Instagram.”</p>\n<p>Influencer marketing experts attribute <a href=\"https://www.campaignlive.com/article/coronavirus-sparks-huge-jump-social-media-use-study-finds/1677276\">double-digit increases</a> in social media activity to the coronavirus. Between Q4 2019 and Q1 2020, Instagram campaign impressions rose by 22%, while TikTok engagement jumped by 27%.</p>\n<p>Mobile is also faring well during the pandemic. Compared to the same time last March, mobile phone data usage has grown by <a href=\"https://www.comscore.com/Insights/Blog/In-Home-Data-Usage-Increases-During-Coronavirus-Pandemic\">more than 50%</a>. “Think of it this way: You’re going to get 50% more from the same mobile ad spend,” Miller explains.</p>\n<h1><b>The View From the Other Side</b></h1>\n<p>Refocusing your agency’s resources now may be painful. But if you do, you’ll be in a prime position once the economy rebounds.</p>\n<p>“Outsourcing helps agencies run more profitably,” Miller says. “It lets them provide their clients with deeper resources.”</p>\n<p>Those advantages don’t disappear once the crisis does. Larger profit margins leave more room to grow the team, chase leads, and invest in new technologies. A broader bank of resources lets agencies cater to a wider range of client needs.</p>\n<p>“In every economy, including this one,” Miller says, “the best policy is proactivity.”</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/07/refocusing-media-operations-during-pandemic-long-term-growth/\">Refocusing Your Agency’s Media Operations During the Pandemic Will Lead to Long-Term Growth</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 07 Apr 2020 07:00:44 There is a day-to-day struggle in businesses currently using artificial intelligence, which is made more difficult because of sequential technologies.</p>\n<p>Many businesses are intrigued by the idea of turning to artificial intelligence for help in the sales process. AI is certainly capable of finding your best-qualified sales leads. AI can give you efficient issue resolution, and systems that feed actual data back in for future process and product improvements. However, most enterprises do not know where or how to get started with their &#8220;new&#8221; company AI.</p>\n<p>Systems and data must connect to allow full use of capabilities as if all information were native to each. And also, edgeways to present information to end-users, though data is evolving on a constant basis. The environment requires specialized insight and know-how to ensure a smooth and continuous integration that&#8217;s both relevant and current.</p>\n<p>The intelligent experience is all about leveraging AI to derive predictive insights that can be embedded in the workflow. Companies seeking <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/15/marketing-targets-achieved-with-the-help-of-artificial-intelligence/\">competitive advantage</a> must find ways to make their business operations more intelligent.</p>\n<h2><b>It Starts With a Shift In Focus</b></h2>\n<p>AI functionality is poised to be a game-changer, exploring possibilities and opening up new roles and more business-central activities. However, it&#8217;s important to first understand how intelligent experience can help improve? It starts with a shift in focus.</p>\n<p>Artificial intelligence is edging into business processes across organizations, however, when an organization interacts with the use of AI correctly, that shouldn’t be a sign AI is running the experience behind the scenes.</p>\n<p>AI has the power to make customers feel they are making their choices, but it&#8217;s the machine learning and the algorithms that are handling those decisions.</p>\n<blockquote><p>The most useful sense, when it comes to shifting in focus, is vision — keeping track of the ability to give suggestions on how to improve.</p></blockquote>\n<p>Artificial Intelligence is going beyond the senses and going straight to the source – the brain. The very reactive tactic, oftentimes, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/20/improving-customer-service-using-artificial-intelligence/\">companies are late, identifying customers</a> likely when it&#8217;s too late. This is because there is a major difference between predicting significant changes in the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/23/5-ways-artificial-intelligence-technology-is-transforming-the-financial-markets/\">economy and a financial sign</a> that becomes apparent only after a large shift has taken place.</p>\n<p>Artificial Intelligence aims to heavily impact a number of industries worldwide — shaping online customer experience models. The AI technology will take hold across many industries over the coming decade, and businesses firmly need to decide how AI will help them to optimize conversions.</p>\n<p>Automating most internal processes, the operational effort involved in maintaining and controlling devices is reduced. However, simultaneously shifting focus, the marketplace, significantly allows configuration.</p>\n<p>More cost-efficiency is rising from artificial intelligence, so customers can focus on increasing the quality and operations of their processes with just an increase in resources.</p>\n<p>It is crucial to assess the landscape of the acquisition time period. This often is where perceptive relations start to form. Customers are going to be comparing their initial experience to the expectations entrepreneurs set during the sales process.</p>\n<h2><b>Examination; Plug Opportunity</b></h2>\n<p>Processes of Artificial Intelligence are making significant progress in reducing several walks of life problems. It also provides automation of not-get interpretation and grasping, restructure the information.</p>\n<p>With AI, as per the market, you can spur on processes, get value from data, and provide clients with a better experience. All those benefits can help drive sales and boost revenue.</p>\n<p>The application of the AI system may now be defined in considerable detail. As of a rule, the cost of Artificial Intelligence requires intelligence on the work being done for proactive development. The development work is usually split into several feasibility studies and set business and project objectives.</p>\n<blockquote><p>However, if Artificial intelligence claims to be a plug-and-play canned legacy, you need to be highly suspicious. You need to have someone trained to take care of this system. (source: coseer.com.)</p></blockquote>\n<p>The sufficient algorithm performance is a key cost-effective factor, as often a high-quality algorithm requires a round of tuning sessions. To decide between various algorithmic approaches towards businesses, one needs to understand how exactly inculcation takes place under the hood, and what can be done to obtain competency.</p>\n<p>If it is not clear up-front, one may end up in a situation of not-more-performing. AI is certainly exciting, but business owners cannot jump into it without first laying the foundation with basic analytics.</p>\n<h2><b>Odds Of Probability</b></h2>\n<p>With so many possibilities for applying AI across an organization, in all likelihood, deploying an AI system must be effective. AI is often considered solely from a technology perspective and little wonder since its capabilities rely on—and continually improve through—technical innovations.</p>\n<p>Deploy with quick-witted positioned skills and a variety of tools to create AI algorithms that can be inserted into enterprise applications. Quick wins bring an added bonus. Meaning that getting the most out of AI is about validating AI’s ability to spark value, keeping momentum and funding, and going for longer-term projects.</p>\n<p>AI doesn’t thrive in a vacuum. Businesses that generate value from AI deal with it as a major business transformation initiative that requires non-similar parts of the company to come together and work with probable expectations. AI is the <a href=\"https://www.businessnewsdaily.com/9402-artificial-intelligence-business-trends.html\">future of business operations</a>.</p>\n<p>When contemplating an investment in AI, be sure you have pragmatic predictions and have a setup that will allow you to embed insights into the daily workflow of your organization. Through the power of AI, you can start blurring the lines between sales, service, and marketing.</p>\n<p>The power of artificial intelligence needs a hard edge at business processes and the majority of resources. From there, your company can use AI in a way that actually helps your business grow and ultimately boost your bottom line.</p>\n<p><em>Image Source: Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\"
