Experience</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 04 Aug 2020 17:31:36 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Best-Competency-With-Artificial-Intelligence-is-by-Having-Intelligent-Experience.jpeg","linkMd5":"f3dc525b408279ad3e04e62891f37a1f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn76@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-09-701_a2992d2331669b9b.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Best-Competency-With-Artificial-Intelligence-is-by-Having-Intelligent-Experience.jpeg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":55178,"destBytes":46754,"author":"Adedeji Omotayo","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Best-Competency-With-Artificial-Intelligence-is-by-Having-Intelligent-Experience-300x185.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn84@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-16-183_c7ad87cad6c631af.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195872544},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","title":"!Important: When an App is a Literal Lifesaver","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=174550","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/14/important-when-an-app-is-a-literal-lifesaver/\" title=\"!Important: When an App is a Literal Lifesaver\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"158\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Important-300x158.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"Important\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Important-300x158.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Important-900x473.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Important-260x137.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Important-1536x807.png 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Important.png 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>As pedestrians, cyclists, motorcyclists, and the differently-abled know, sharing the road has inherent risks. Distracted drivers, car doors that suddenly swing open, vehicles making abrupt lane changes, and now automobiles and trucks with no drivers at all.; they all put us at risk. It doesn&#8217;t matter how vigilant a person is, every time you head out onto the streets, you&#8217;re putting your life in the hands of people and technology over which you have no control.</p>\n<p>But now, entrepreneur and inventor, Bastien Beauchamp, has set out on a mission to change this paradigm and potentially save a million lives over the next decade. His new app, !<a href=\"https://www.important.com/\">important</a>, is the first of its kind and could be a revolution in on-road safety if he achieves his objective of having the technology integrated into a significant number of vehicles.</p>\n<h3><strong>A Game Changer for Pedestrian, Bicyclist and Motor-Cycle Safety</strong></h3>\n<p>The app&#8217;s premise is smart but simple; notify drivers and autonomous vehicles that you&#8217;re in the vicinity. The !important app communicates the user&#8217;s location to nearby connected vehicles. The technology alerts drivers to your presence and can even trigger vehicles&#8217; brakes automatically to prevent a collision with an approaching person, bicyclist, or motorcyclist.</p>\n<p>&#8220;Until now,&#8221; says Bastien, the founder and CEO of !important, &#8220;aside from being vigilant, or using high-visibility clothing or accessories, there has been little non-vehicular travelers could do to protect themselves on the road. My app is a bit like a digital safety-belt. !important provides drivers with an early-warning system, alerting both human operators as well as AI-controlled vehicles to the presence and precise location of hard to see and less predictable travelers.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Today, whether you&#8217;re a driver interested in reducing the risk that you&#8217;ll be involved in a collision, or a pedestrian, cyclist, or motor-cycle enthusiast who believes in taking proactive steps to remain safe, !important&#8217;s new application can be a game-changer.</p>\n<h3><strong>Future Plans</strong></h3>\n<p>In addition to announcing its free app release on both the App and Google Play stores, the company is taking its first steps towards integration into our transportation system.</p>\n<p>The company announced a pilot program starting in 2021; the technology will be implemented in vehicles on the roads of Reno, Nevada (USA) as part of the Intelligent Mobility (IM) initiative in collaboration with the Nevada Center for Applied Research (NCAR) at the University of Nevada in Reno.</p>\n<blockquote><p>The Director of NCAR, Carlos G. Cardillo, remarked that <em>&#8220;The !important app will increase the safety of vulnerable road users and the acceptance of autonomous vehicle infrastructure by minimizing potential dangers.&#8221;</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>!important is also working with several automotive and truck manufacturers to integrate their technology into vehicles that have semi or fully-autonomous systems. Integrating !important&#8217;s technology into cars will allow vehicles to receive input directly from the app, alert them to pedestrians and other travelers, and where necessary, automatically applying the vehicle&#8217;s brakes when the systems sense a potential collision.</p>\n<p>Tara Andringa, Executive Director of Partners for Automated Vehicle Education (PAVE), summed it up well: <em>&#8220;… a key issue is how we will ensure pedestrian safety in an automated vehicle (AV) world. !important is tackling this problem of pedestrian safety, and their mobile app seeks to enhance road safety by improving communication between pedestrians and other road users.&#8221;</em></p>\n<p>When asked what inspired the idea for this life-protecting product, CEO Bastian Beauchamp says, &#8220;When I heard about the <a href=\"https://www.autoblog.com/2018/03/19/uber-autonomous-volvo-fatality/\">fatal accident</a> where the autonomous Uber vehicle hit a bicyclist, it woke me up. I kept thinking about the victim&#8217;s friends and family. Then I realized that there were hundreds of thousands of self-driving vehicles on the road within a few years. I thought that someone should do something, and then I decided that someone should be me.&#8221;</p>\n<p>The !important app is free for download from the Google Play Store and the App Store or directly from <a href=\"https://www.important.com/application-download\">!important</a></p>\n<p>&#160;</p>\n<p><strong>About</strong>:</p>\n<p>!important was nominated by Alibaba Jumpstarter 2020 in the Top 30 Startups of Silicon Valley. !important is a company backed by groups of medical doctors and is part of the University of California Berkeley Skydeck and Ann Arbor SPARK accelerator programs. It collaborates with 12 universities.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/14/important-when-an-app-is-a-literal-lifesaver/\">!Important: When an App is a Literal Lifesaver</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 15 Jul 2020 02:27:02 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Important.png","linkMd5":"51ab78abecfaf2108c76c8b71d8ebd52","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn19@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-20-780_d682119f11671544.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Important.png","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1009,"sourceBytes":2165685,"destBytes":145522,"author":"Brad Anderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Important-300x158.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn60@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-12-609_ae86abcb6b9c08d5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195873868},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","title":"How Legal Tech Companies Are Re-Shaping the Legal World","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=174790","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/23/how-legal-tech-companies-are-shaping-the-legal-world/\" title=\"How Legal Tech Companies Are Re-Shaping the Legal World\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-Legal-Tech-Companies-Are-Re-Shaping-the-Legal-World-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"legal tech\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-Legal-Tech-Companies-Are-Re-Shaping-the-Legal-World-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-Legal-Tech-Companies-Are-Re-Shaping-the-Legal-World-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-Legal-Tech-Companies-Are-Re-Shaping-the-Legal-World-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-Legal-Tech-Companies-Are-Re-Shaping-the-Legal-World.jpg 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Legal tech includes software and other tools that help attorneys and their support staff to provide legal services to clients. Many new applications empower reputable firms to improve their efficiency and adapt to mobile working environments. Here&#8217;s how legal tech companies are re-shaping the legal world.<br />\n</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Legal tech also gives small firms and individual practitioners a chance to compete with larger competitors. It grants them access to powerful research tools. And, the right tech tools are essential for <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/28/lawyers-land-more-clients-with-these-5-marketing-strategies/\">law firms</a> that want to stay competitive. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Understanding and embracing these </span><a href=\"https://www.lsc.gov/meetings-and-events/tech-conference\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">innovations in technology</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> can be the key to success in today’s legal profession. </span></p>\n<h2><b>What are Companies Considered Legal Tech Companies?</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While there are many legal tech companies in the world, what we are looking for is to be provided with technology that genuinely stands out in a crowded market. For instance, Relativity gives specific technology to lawyers. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With the Relativity tech, lawyers can store and search for documents, automate contract reviews, and perform other regulatory work and due diligence. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Major U.S. law firms use the service. Some large firms and in-house corporate legal departments have hired experts from Relativity to help them set up eDiscovery departments. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Other essential legal tech companies are Apttus, Everlaw, HighQ, and iManage. These companies produce software that simplifies the way companies manage their sales processes and contracts, collaborate on litigation, and handle important documents. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The legal technology allows lawyers to focus on their cases and reduce their time in document review and management. </span></p>\n<h2><b>How Have These Developments Affected the Legal Profession?</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Technology has caused a revolution in the legal profession that has reshaped its culture, composition, delivery, skill sets, and priorities. These developments have not only bolstered departments within law firms but have also improved their reputations. </span></p>\n<h3><b>Firms go global</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Firms are now able to operate globally, collaborate with other lawyers, and improve service delivery. They are no longer stuck in the limited geographic markets established long ago by significant law firms. Now lawyers can provide services to clients on a more global scale, which benefits clients who conduct business internationally. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The expansion of law firms into global markets has also made legal services somewhat more uniform. Furthermore, clients can now review their lawyers online, forcing attorneys to perform at a consistently high level. </span></p>\n<h3><b>Customer satisfaction and AI move to the front.</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Additionally, this new technology has given </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">lawyers</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> and law firms new service models that are customer-centric and that meld human resources with tech to optimize performance. In these new models, profit flows from customer satisfaction rather than hours billed. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Lawyers are no longer tasked with brute force labor. They can rely on <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/07/the-automation-boom-is-coming-will-the-internet-be-ready/\">automation</a> to maximize their resources. Technology has replaced the repetitive tasks of a lawyer&#8217;s work with new software. This can make lawyers more efficient and save both clients and firms money.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The arrival of technology in the legal world is transforming the profession from a pedigree-centric, tradition-bound, labor-intensive field into something entirely different. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Tech has made legal services more flexible and given lawyers access to effective automation. With new delivery models and methods, practices are shrinking while clientele is expanding. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The result is the promotion of efficiency, risk prediction, enhanced value, and cost reduction. With this expansion comes the availability of legal services to everyone. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Furthermore, technology makes both primary and secondary legal source materials easier to access. For example, </span><a href=\"https://news.harvard.edu/gazette/story/2015/10/free-the-law-will-provide-open-access-to-all/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Harvard Law School decided to digitize</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> their collection of 40 million pages of case law and give everyone free online access to them. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Moreover, the use of legal tech and software can automate many parts of a lawyer&#8217;s job. Many legal tech tools have begun incorporating artificial intelligence, cloud computing, legal research and automation. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The rise in automation has caused some lawyers to fear it&#8217;s only a matter of time before tech disrupts the delivery of legal services. Despite this worry, thus far, legal technology has not taken jobs from human attorneys. Instead, it has improved the work for those who are willing to accept it. </span></p>\n<h2><b>What Is a Legal Tech Incubator?</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">A general tech incubator involves a larger business providing support and mentorship to small start-up tech companies. Legal tech incubators include well-established law firms creating space for the rapidly increasing number of start-ups providing legal tech. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For instance, global law firms such as Allen &#38; Overy, Clifford Chance, and Mischon de Reya have each created incubator programs for up and coming legal tech companies. These incubators help member businesses grow and succeed.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">However, that success requires more than just space and positive intentions. Successful incubators must focus on solving issues commonly faced by law firms. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Focusing on the issues is often accomplished by <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/29/5-benefits-attracting-tech-talent-to-your-startup/\">providing human resources</a> and mentorship. In these programs, the host company regularly teaches smaller companies to face their problems. The teaching, training, and mentorship are accomplished through meticulous planning, organization skills, a technical focus, and consideration of consumer opinions. </span></p>\n<h2><b>What Are Some Legal Tech Start-Ups?</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In addition to the established legal tech companies, there are many start-ups as well. Legal start-ups rose in popularity in recent years. Some examples include Luminance, Libryo, Lexoo, CrowdJustice, Alacrity, and Advokatguiden. </span></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://www.luminance.com/\"><b>Luminance</b></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> is a relatively new company that provides artificial intelligence for the legal profession. </span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://libryo.com/\"><b>Libryo</b></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> offers software that helps individuals in any organization to understand applicable legal obligations. </span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://www.lexoo.com/\"><b>Lexoo</b></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> is an online platform that gives individuals access to international lawyers and is also used by companies to compare and recruit lawyers for their in-house legal departments. </span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://www.crowdjustice.com/\"><b>CrowdJustice</b></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> is a crowdfunding platform for public interest litigation. </span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://alacritylaw.com/#section1\"><b>Alacrity</b></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> is a web-based platform that lets major corporations and law firms connect and improve their service delivery. </span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://www.advokatguiden.no/sted/oslo-advokat\"><b>Advokatguiden</b></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> is a Norwegian website that publishes client reviews of lawyers and firms. Advokatguiden.no has forced transparency onto the legal profession and gives individuals insight into a lawyer&#8217;s pricing, skills, and track record. </span></li>\n</ul>\n<h2><b>Embracing Legal Tech</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The rising popularity of legal tech has contributed to the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/14/6-tech-trends-that-will-dominate-the-new-decade/\">globalization of legal practice</a>. The implementation of legal tech has also created new delivery models that focus on efficiency and the customer. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Legal tech opened these services to a broader client base and led to the adoption of automation. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While some are concerned about this new technology, other firms are embracing it. Legal tech incubators now help startups provide new legal technology to the profession. </span></p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: August de Richelieu; Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/23/how-legal-tech-companies-are-shaping-the-legal-world/\">How Legal Tech Companies Are Re-Shaping the Legal World</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 23 Jul 2020 15:01:00 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-Legal-Tech-Companies-Are-Re-Shaping-the-Legal-World.jpg","linkMd5":"62432b4b5b63bab5886f45b9713d584e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn92@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-20-675_abfb41eefc87fb75.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-Legal-Tech-Companies-Are-Re-Shaping-the-Legal-World.jpg","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":854,"sourceBytes":176035,"destBytes":96452,"author":"John Boitnott","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-Legal-Tech-Companies-Are-Re-Shaping-the-Legal-World-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn4@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-17-749_309cdc283908bfaf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195873317},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","title":"Adding Cellular Connectivity to Your IoT Device","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=166927","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/27/adding-cellular-connectivity-to-your-iot-device/\" title=\"Adding Cellular Connectivity to Your IoT Device\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Adding-Cellular-Connectivity-to-Your-IoT-Device-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"cellular connectivity\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Adding-Cellular-Connectivity-to-Your-IoT-Device-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Adding-Cellular-Connectivity-to-Your-IoT-Device-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Adding-Cellular-Connectivity-to-Your-IoT-Device.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>In an increasingly connected world, data drives decision making within organizations, from the world’s most significant to the smallest. The Internet of Things (IoT) &#8211; <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2017/07/26/arm-iot-2035-dl1/\">an ever-expanding network of devices</a> &#8211; promises to offer business leaders even greater insight, but that means original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) must seize the opportunities and the challenges that are presented.</p>\n<h2>To realize the potential of the IoT, new technologies must be enabled by reliable wireless connectivity.</h2>\n<p>Cellular connectivity provides precisely that. Cellular devices can be deployed anywhere, seamlessly provisioned, and just work. WiFi devices require complicated configuration for the nearest hotspot.</p>\n<p>Cellular networks are established, trusted, and secure. They also require a subscriber identity module, or SIM, to authenticate a device so it can be connected to a mobile network, and to store and process sensitive subscriber information.</p>\n<h4>A SIM needs to be found and installed for each country or region a device ships to.</h4>\n<p>However, a traditional SIM card can create challenges for OEMs that are trying to meet the needs of data-hungry organizations and make their previously ‘dumb’ devices smart. A SIM needs to be procured and installed for each country or region a device ships to, which complicates manufacturing and logistics. For customers, who have to physically swap the SIM card when they want to switch providers to improve connectivity or control costs, it’s inconvenient and prohibitively expensive in the case of large-scale deployments.</p>\n<p>The embedded SIM (eSIM) or eUICC addresses all these concerns and enables seamless connectivity and invaluable data insights.</p>\n<h3><b>The Benefits of eSIM</b></h3>\n<p>The eSIM is still a physical SIM, but it’s not removable, it’s soldered into a device. The eUICC element, as outlined in the GSMA specifications, allows for the carrier provider to be changed remotely without any physical swapping of SIMs. As a result, it offers significant advantages over traditional cards:</p>\n<p><b>Smaller size:</b> the chip is approximately half the size of a nano-SIM. Also, the space that would have been allocated to a card tray and contacts is no longer needed, so the size of a device could be reduced. Additionally, connectivity could be added to smaller products, or space could be used for value-adding features such as a larger battery or more components.</p>\n<p><b>Remote management: </b>SIM profiles can now be updated digitally using <a href=\"https://www.gsma.com/iot/embedded-sim/\">remote SIM provisioning</a> (RSP), which eliminates complex SIM sourcing and logistics for OEMs. It also means that device makers can offer enterprises IoT devices that can be deployed across businesses, cities, or countries with a more cost-effective way of managing them at scale.</p>\n<p><b>Lower costs:</b> the smaller form factor lowers costs, while the total cost of ownership can be reduced as a result of reduced complexity in the supply chain and in device management.</p>\n<p><b>Maintains security:</b> according to the GSMA, eSIM provides an equivalent level of security as the removable SIM card. You can’t damage it as easily, tamper with it or steal it, and it’s better able to withstand harsh environments.</p>\n<p><b>Faster deployment:</b> connectivity is built into the device from the outset so that IoT projects can get off the ground quicker. Cellular devices can be deployed ANYWHERE, seamlessly provisioned, and work. Wifi devices require complicated configuration for the nearest hotspot.</p>\n<p><b>Differentiation:</b> in a world where data are increasingly driving decision making, the seamless connectivity that eSIMs enable can be a point of differentiation for device makers (for example, versus WiFi counterparts), and will help us realize the potential of the IoT.</p>\n<h3><b>The Industry’s Response to eSIM</b></h3>\n<p>Recently, Arm <a href=\"https://community.arm.com/iot/b/internet-of-things/posts/what-oems-really-think-about-esim-and-isim\">asked a range of partners</a> from across the Arm ecosystem for their views on new SIM technology. Eighty-eight percent of OEMs said they were aware of eSIM and understood the potential benefits and the opportunities it offers. However, they also had concerns.</p>\n<ol>\n<li>More than two-thirds (68%) of people believed their more established stakeholders would be reluctant to move away from traditional SIM technology.</li>\n<li>Nearly half (44%) said the complexity of delivering eSIM projects worried them.</li>\n<li>And more than half of respondents (57%) said they were concerned about the cost of adoption.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Confidence in the technology will grow as more OEMs embrace it and an increase in the number of products with seamless connectivity will lead to lower manufacturing and implementation costs. The total cost of ownership for eSIM, as described earlier, is much lower than for the traditional SIM, and the savings will filter through the value chain as eSIM becomes more popular.</p>\n<p>For now, though, much of the awareness comes from within larger manufacturers involved in the automotive sector, or through organizations developing consumer connected devices such as smartphones, watches, or laptops. More support and information will need to be provided to OEMs, in particular, small- and medium-sized organizations if we want to boost confidence in the market and accelerate adoption.</p>\n<p>For that reason, we’ve produced a white paper to make building cellular connectivity into an IoT device simpler. It outlines the top seven considerations for every project. They are:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<h4><b> Selecting a Cellular Technology</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>In addition to the widely used 3G and 4G networks, and emerging 5G technology, Low Power Wide Area Network (LPWAN) specifications compete for large-scale IoT deployment. The use case and other factors such as power, performance and mobility requirements should inform the choice of technology.</p>\n<ol start=\"2\">\n<li>\n<h4><b> Finding the right SIM</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>The eSIM has been developed to meet the needs of two distinct markets: machine-to-machine or IoT (e.g., smart meters) and consumers (e.g., mobile phones). Besides, the physical form can come in different grades, providing greater robustness for applications such as the automotive industry.</p>\n<ol start=\"3\">\n<li>\n<h4><b> Choosing an Operating System</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>The components that make up an operating system (OS) and connect a SIM to a network are defined in global standards. They enable a device to move seamlessly between networks and carriers. To select an OS, several essential criteria should be considered, including compliance, network support, and footprint.</p>\n<ol start=\"4\">\n<li>\n<h4><b> Establishing Initial Connectivity</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>An eSIM must be configured with a bootstrap profile so a device can connect to a network from the outset. The choice of profile will be determined by cost, and the coverage and flexibility required.</p>\n<ol start=\"5\">\n<li>\n<h4><b> Personalization</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>When a SIM is created, it’s given a unique identity and loaded with the data that enables it to authenticate to a network. This process is called personalization. The business relationships, certification, and RSP platform used by the personalization partner should be considered before moving forward.</p>\n<ol start=\"6\">\n<li>\n<h4><b> Deployment and Remote Management</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>The GSMA’s standard structures and processes set out the requirements for the remote management of devices using RSP. To enable that functionality, module and device manufacturers must upload information about the eSIM to an RSP platform. Accreditation, ease of integration, and interoperability are all crucial factors to consider before an RSP partner is selected.</p>\n<ol start=\"7\">\n<li>\n<h4><b> Standards and Certification</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Global specifications have been developed to ensure manufacturing, security, personalization, and RSP meet agreed standards. It further is agreed that devices operate effectively across networks, carriers, and vendors. OEMs should be familiar with these requirements.</p>\n<p>A number of eSIM solution providers exist to help OEMs realize the benefits of the IoT. Many will take manufacturers through all of the steps highlighted above, either in a consultancy capacity or by offering an end-to-end service. Arm provides <a href=\"https://www.arm.com/products/iot/kigen-sim/support\">flexible support</a> and is one of the few to suggest OEMs take advantage of a free trial period before making a longer-term commitment.</p>\n<p>In a recent blog, Arm outlined the extraordinary potential for growth in the <a href=\"https://www.arm.com/blogs/blueprint/esim-trillion-device-opportunity\">cellular IoT technology</a> market, where <a href=\"https://www.grandviewresearch.com/press-release/global-cellular-internet-of-thing-iot-market\">revenue is estimated to reach almost £8 billion by 2025</a>. eSIM, and the emerging technology iSIM or <a href=\"https://www.gsma.com/esim/blog-from-arm-unlocking-secure-iot-device-connectivity-with-isim/\">integrated eUICC</a>, which puts SIM functionality into the system-on-chip (SoC), enable us to reach more people, move into hard-to-access areas and cross borders while reducing the cost and complexity of IoT.</p>\n<p>For more information on building cellular connectivity into your next IoT design, please <a href=\"https://learn.arm.com/kigen-cellular-guide.html?utm_source=read-write&#38;utm_medium=sponsored-content&#38;utm_campaign=2020_ebg-kigen_mk01-2_na_na_arm&#38;utm_content=whitepaper\"><strong>download the white paper</strong></a> from the Arm website.</p>\n<p><em><strong>Image Credit &#8212; GettyImages #149081218</strong> </em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/27/adding-cellular-connectivity-to-your-iot-device/\">Adding Cellular Connectivity to Your IoT Device</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 28 Feb 2020 00:00:34 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Adding-Cellular-Connectivity-to-Your-IoT-Device.jpg","linkMd5":"98e009e207e65e0af7470f2c5e2989db","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn24@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-23-389_02ced77b7a344cfe.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Adding-Cellular-Connectivity-to-Your-IoT-Device.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":46302,"destBytes":44190,"author":"Karsten Harlow","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Adding-Cellular-Connectivity-to-Your-IoT-Device-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn19@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-20-985_80df8fdf3ed1a783.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195880443},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"How to Measure and Analyze Content Marketing Success","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171282","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/12/how-to-measure-and-analyze-content-marketing-success/\" title=\"How to Measure and Analyze Content Marketing Success\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"201\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/content-marketing-success-metrics-300x201.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/content-marketing-success-metrics-300x201.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/content-marketing-success-metrics-900x602.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/content-marketing-success-metrics-239x160.jpg 239w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/content-marketing-success-metrics-1536x1028.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/content-marketing-success-metrics.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">By now, virtually every brand across any industry or niche is doing some form of content marketing. Many of these businesses have formal content marketing strategies with editorial guidelines, content calendars, and posting schedules. But very few take the time to carefully measure content marketing results. And unfortunately, this comprises the very integrity of these campaigns by limiting or suppressing optimum results. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">In this article, we’re going to explore precise ways you can measure your content marketing efforts to get a clearer picture of what’s happening both at a micro and macro level. By the end, you should have some clear action steps on how you can proceed in the coming days and weeks. </span></p>\n<p><b>Why Measure Content Marketing?</b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Before we dig into the </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">how</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400\"> of measuring and analyzing content marketing, let’s explore the </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">why</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">. In other words, why should you measure your content marketing in the first place?</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Though each individual brand will have its own unique list of reasons, there are ultimately three overarching purposes:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Clarity. <span style=\"font-weight: 400\">It’s impossible to know how your content is being received if you don’t take the time to study the data and analyze the trends. Careful measurement and analysis pave the way for greater clarity. </span></b></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Justification. <span style=\"font-weight: 400\">If you’re investing in content marketing within a large organization or multi-layered business, you have to be prepared to justify the investment. Subjective statements and generalities will only go so far. Eventually, the people calling the shots will want to see objective data and numerical trends to offer their continued support.</span></b></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Optimization. <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/17/the-diminishing-returns-of-outsourcing-and-the-fallacy-of-automation/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Trends come and go</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">. Best practices evolve. New strategies emerge. A static content marketing strategy eventually crumbles into a heap of irrelevant ashes. The only way to optimize with any real strategy or direction is to measure what’s happening on the ground floor so that you can </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/12/how-to-successfully-automate-your-approach-to-guest-blogger-outreach/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">make the necessary changes and adjustments</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400\"> over time.</span></b></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Measuring content marketing takes time. Analyzing the data and trends requires a hefty ongoing commitment. But when you understand the impact, it becomes much easier to stay committed and tuned in. When in doubt, return to these three purposes and let them guide your decision-making. </span></p>\n<p><b>How Often Should You Measure Your Content Marketing?</b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">This question of how often is ultimately one of personal preference. However, the real answer is that you should be measuring content marketing as often as you can. (Ideally it’s a continual process.)</span></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://databox.com/how-to-hit-smart-marketing-goals\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">According to one industry survey</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">, leading experts set goals and track KPIs for every piece of content they create. Approximately 37 percent of marketers monitor the success of their content marketing every week, while another 26 percent do so on a daily basis. </span></p>\n<p><b>How to Measure and Analyze for Optimal Clarity</b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Okay, now that we’ve laid the groundwork and developed a common understanding of why content marketing needs continual measurement and analysis, let’s dig in and look at the action steps you can take to get clear and insightful takeaways that lead to growth and improvement.</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Get Clear on Your Goals</b></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Every good content marketing strategy starts with a definitive set of goals and desired results. Before you move any further in the process, it’s imperative that you get very clear on what these goals are in order that you can track against them. This includes both overarching goals, as well as content-specific objectives that apply to individual mediums and pieces.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Begin with your overarching goal:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Are you trying to increase your brand exposure to relevant members of your target audience?</span></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Is your primary objective to drive traffic to sales pages so that you can drum up conversions?</span></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Is your goal to educate people in order that you can cultivate an informed following?</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Then there are the content-specific goals, like:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Increasing blog readership</span></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Gaining backlinks</span></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Improving search rankings</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Each of these goals requires a different approach on the analysis front. (And it’s possible that you’ll have a combination of overlapping goals.) By getting clear on what your goals are, you can select the right measurements to move forward with.</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Track These Metrics</b></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Based on your goals, here are some powerful metrics you can analyze to measure content marketing efficacy:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Website traffic. <span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Track your website traffic data every single day and overlay it with your content posting schedule. Look for a correlation between when content is posted and how traffic fluctuates. Do you notice an uptick in traffic based certain types of content (quality) or the number of posts you publish (quantity)?</span></b></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Subscriber growth. <span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Email marketing is obviously a huge component of content marketing. By tracking your subscriber growth and opt-ins, you can see how many new people you’re reaching over time. You should also track opt-outs and other engagement metrics, which tells you if people like what they’re getting. </span></b></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Average time on page. <span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Google analytics has a neat metric that allows you to track the average amount of time people are spending on each page of content you produce. Keep an eye on this data point, as it’ll give you a good idea of whether people are quickly scanning your content and bouncing, or if they’re actually taking the time to consume what you’re publishing. Over time, you’ll notice that certain types of content lead to a spike in the average time on page. </span></b></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Click-through rate (CTR). <span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Your CTR tells you what percentage of a page’s visitors click through your content and go to other pages on your website. In other words, it tells you how well you’re doing at convincing people to continue the experience with your brand (versus leave for another website).</span></b></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Social shares. <span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Comments and likes on social media are one thing. But the true test of whether your content is resonating is how many shares it gets. You don’t need all of your content to go viral, but you should try to get a few shares per post. This increases the eyeballs/impressions and increases your likelihood of finding success.</span></b></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">This data can be pulled from a variety of sources, including website Analytics, email analytics, social media analytics, and a combination of standalone tools and trackers that you use. </span></p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Check Your Backlinks</b></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">It’s one thing to share your content and pump it out across a variety of social channels, but if you want to double or triple the impact of your content, you need a </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/10/artificial-intelligence-link-building-spam/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">backlinking strategy</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400\"> that encourages other websites and blogs to link back to you.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Use a </span><a href=\"https://seo.co/tools/backlink-checker/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">backlink checker</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400\"> to identify all of the inbound links to your site and consistently measure for growth and attrition. Ideally, you should be picking up dozens (or hundreds) of backlinks a year. This not only leads to the increased potential of referral traffic back to your website, but it also strengthens your search rankings. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">If you find one specific website or blog that regularly links back to your content, it might be worth sending them a quick thank you message for their support. (It would also be smart to link back to their site, when relevant and appropriate.)</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Study Search Ranking Trends</b></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">One of the primary goals of content marketing is to amplify your website’s SEO and improve search rankings, which enhances discoverability and subsequently increases your chances of driving organic traffic back to your URLs.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Study your search rankings over time &#8211; both on a domain-level and page-level. In other words, you should be tracking your website’s search ranking trends, as well as individual pieces of content and how they rank for particular keywords. This can all be done via a combination of tools like Google Analytics, Moz, Ahrefs, etc.</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Look for Anecdotal Evidence of Engagement</b></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">If search rankings and SEO represent the technical side of content marketing, engagement is associated with the softer side of things. But just because it’s more anecdotal doesn’t mean it lacks measurable metrics. In fact, studying content engagement is one of the keys to being successful. Here are some different elements to analyze:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Blog comments. <span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Comments on your blog posts &#8211; organic, not spammy &#8211; are a sign that your content is working. Don’t fret too much about whether these comments are positive or negative. The fact that you’re driving conversation is key.</span></b></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Email replies. <span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Are people replying to your email newsletters and blasts? This will tell you a lot about how effective the content is. (A lack of replies doesn’t necessarily indicate your emails are ineffective, but an abundance of them definitely shows you’re getting the job done.)</span></b></li>\n</ul>\n<ul>\n<li><b>Scrolling. <span style=\"font-weight: 400\">How far are people scrolling down on your blog posts and content? There are a variety of tools you can embed into your site to gather these insights. It’ll show you where people tend to drop off.</span></b></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">If you’re doing well in these areas, your engagement is high. This is perhaps the clearest indicator that your content marketing is working. </span></p>\n<p><b>Adding it All Up</b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Don’t let the volume of data or the dozens of different KPIs and measurements overwhelm you. You don’t have to tackle everything at once. In fact, you probably shouldn&#8217;t.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">The best approach is to start with one goal and to spend a week tracking it. Then add in another goal and measurement the next week. As you become more familiar with studying your content &#8211; and as you simultaneously add more analysis to your repertoire &#8211; you’ll gain even greater clarity into what’s happening and where you can improve.</span></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/12/how-to-measure-and-analyze-content-marketing-success/\">How to Measure and Analyze Content Marketing Success</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 12 May 2020 14:03:43 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/content-marketing-success-metrics.jpg","linkMd5":"c54811b02f0f34eb52449dda709ca162","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn91@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-24-916_f4c95ca10c9d23ed.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/content-marketing-success-metrics.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1285,"sourceBytes":171471,"destBytes":119086,"author":"Nate Nead","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/content-marketing-success-metrics-300x201.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn36@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-11-859_740c6029f0e97262.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877583},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","title":"Avoid Chaos at Scale: How to Prevent Your Robots from Running Amok","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170969&preview=true&preview_id=170969","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/07/avoid-chaos-at-scale-how-to-prevent-your-robots-from-running-amok/\" title=\"Avoid Chaos at Scale: How to Prevent Your Robots from Running Amok\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"224\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Prevent-Your-Robots-from-Running-Amok-300x224.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"prevent robots running amok\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Prevent-Your-Robots-from-Running-Amok-300x224.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Prevent-Your-Robots-from-Running-Amok-900x671.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Prevent-Your-Robots-from-Running-Amok-215x160.jpg 215w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Prevent-Your-Robots-from-Running-Amok.jpg 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Although robotic process automation (RPA) is at the heart of many digital transformation efforts. RPA is all too common for organizations when rolling out their software robots in a piecemeal fashion. For example, finance deploys its own set of bots, while manufacturing rolls out another &#8212; without coordination between the departments. A decentralized approach presents a risk for your company &#8212; one that leads to problems later. Here is how to avoid chaos at scale and prevent your robots from running amok.</p>\n<h2>Automated processes often require robots to interact with each other.</h2>\n<p>You want your robots to access and disseminate data. What this means is that these robots are often dependent on related systems and policies. But what happens when one of those policies change or a system breaks down? Your robots stop working and processes come to a grinding halt.</p>\n<h4>There’s no shortage of situations in which your robot will stop working.</h4>\n<p>Think about it: Legacy systems and websites evolve; applications are updated; passwords expire; spreadsheets get modified and security patches get applied.</p>\n<p>Without some sort of standard or way of managing and maintaining your army of robots, when a policy is changed, the robots won’t know what to do – and they’ll run amok.</p>\n<h4>Organizations can prevent chaos by putting in a strong governance program.</h4>\n<p>A governance program becomes especially important as you scale your RPA initiatives. In fact, a lack of governance is one of the most common reasons that initial RPA projects fail, according to EY. Without a strong governance program and the right robot lifecycle management tools in place, organizations put their automation initiatives at risk.</p>\n<p>Robots need guidance, management, and maintenance to continue to work properly and deliver maximum value to the organization. The organizations need to put three essential components in place: a guiding framework, a Centre of Excellence, and robot lifecycle management and analytics tools to support the program.</p>\n<h2>Lay the Governance Groundwork</h2>\n<p>To maximize RPA benefits, chief operating officers (COOs) and chief information officers (CIOs) must collaborate. With effective collaboration, the COO and CIO will establish an optimal software robot deployment and operating model.</p>\n<p>In designing and implementing a guiding framework, they lay the governance groundwork for how their digital workforce will collaborate. This is very similar to the compliance policies that human talent sign when they start working for a company.</p>\n<h3>An effective robotics framework requires three elements.</h3>\n<p>An enterprise robotics council: This team spearheads the program, defines its scope, and sets targets for tracking execution efficiency and outcomes.</p>\n<h4>A business unit governance council.</h4>\n<p>This group is responsible for prioritizing RPA projects across departments and business units. An RPA technical council or Centre of Excellence (COE). The team designs standards, formulates working principles and guidelines and compiles best practices. Establish a Centre of Excellence</p>\n<p>The Centre of Excellence is a group of core resources and people responsible for guiding everything related to automation, including managing and maintaining standards and vendors. They establish the best practices &#8212; training and so much more.</p>\n<p>The Centre of Excellence members includes IT as well as subject matter experts from each business unit. With this collection of intelligence, the team is better equipped not only to make decisions on the right RPA tools to deploy. They also process prime candidates for automation.</p>\n<p><strong>There are three main CoE models, which differ according to how responsibilities are shared across the enterprise.</strong></p>\n<p><strong>Centralized operating model</strong> &#8212; A single team is responsible for running and controlling all aspects of the program.<br />\n<strong>Decentralized &#8212;</strong> operating model: The responsibilities for running the automation program are replicated across separate business units within the organization.<br />\n<strong>Hybrid operating model &#8212;</strong> Some aspects of the automation program are run by a single, centralized team, while others are replicated across business units.</p>\n<p>Organizations should choose the model that makes the most sense given where they are today and adjust down the road as needed.</p>\n<h2>Invest in Robot Lifecycle Management Tools and Analytics</h2>\n<p>Governance is easy to accomplish when RPA tools include management and oversight capabilities like version control. More sophisticated capabilities, such as Robot Lifecycle Management, help teams manage enterprise RPA robot deployments from hundreds to thousands of RPA robots.</p>\n<p>For example, the tools help users keep track of changes, compare files and explore changes made. In addition, they also make it easy to store backup files so that if companies have to revert to a previous working version, they can do so effortlessly.</p>\n<h2>At scale, a strong governance and version control program becomes increasingly important.</h2>\n<p>When a robot breaks down, if you don’t have governance or digital workforce analytics, it’s almost impossible to track which one among hundreds or thousands is causing an issue or where one may have crashed into another and stopped a process in its tracks.</p>\n<p>By leveraging a Centre of Excellence along with sophisticated tools like Robot Lifecycle Management, organizations can take a more business-centric approach to RPA that goes far beyond simple task automation.</p>\n<h4>Conclusion</h4>\n<p>A strong governance program is a key RPA success indicator. When it’s supported by Robot Lifecycle Management and digital workforce analytics, you reduce the risk your robots will run amok.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Elina Krima; Pexels -[my thoughts for pic are &#8220;crazy robots!&#8221; drr]</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/07/avoid-chaos-at-scale-how-to-prevent-your-robots-from-running-amok/\">Avoid Chaos at Scale: How to Prevent Your Robots from Running Amok</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 07 Jul 2020 15:00:22 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Prevent-Your-Robots-from-Running-Amok.jpg","linkMd5":"fbfb15fc32dc5deb4582172a3f64ed5b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn27@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-21-373_a0cc0f79b5eb1d1f.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Prevent-Your-Robots-from-Running-Amok.jpg","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":954,"sourceBytes":149994,"destBytes":28698,"author":"Tyler Suss","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Prevent-Your-Robots-from-Running-Amok-300x224.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn32@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-10-853_526b19ef90e4a039.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195873339},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"How 6 Tech Giants Are Giving SMBs a Hand in the Pandemic","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170079","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/20/how-6-tech-giants-are-giving-smbs-a-hand-in-the-pandemic/\" title=\"How 6 Tech Giants Are Giving SMBs a Hand in the Pandemic\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"243\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Screen-Shot-2020-04-16-at-12.48.21-PM-300x243.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Screen-Shot-2020-04-16-at-12.48.21-PM-300x243.png 300w,
