Never has that been clearer than during COVID-19, the pandemic currently roiling the world economy. </p>\n<p>Small- and medium-sized businesses compete with larger companies, but they <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/28/3-predictions-for-corporate-innovation-in-2019/\">also depend</a> on them. Here’s how some of the biggest players in tech are making life easier for SMBs:</p>\n<h1><b>1. Microsoft</b></h1>\n<p>Microsoft was big tech before big tech existed. While most of the companies on this list got their start during the dot-com boom or after, Microsoft marked the new millennium by celebrating its 25th birthday. </p>\n<p>In the wake of COVID, Microsoft is leveraging its perspective to help leaders understand how the virus is affecting their community. Its <a href=\"https://www.bing.com/covid\">COVID-19 tracker</a> can zoom into specific counties, displaying related news in a sidebar. Those insights can help SMBs make better decisions about how great the risk is to employees, when to shut their doors, and where donations can do the most good. </p>\n<h1><b>2. Kabbage</b></h1>\n<p>Before Kabbage, the SMB lending process took ages. Kabbage’s cash flow management tools make it possible for companies to get cash in minutes, not weeks. </p>\n<p>Shortly after COVID reached U.S. shores, Kabbage unveiled its <a href=\"https://www.kabbage.com/helpsmallbusiness\">Help Small Business initiative</a>. Site visitors can purchase online gift certificates to local businesses, giving them another way to raise revenue when sales are likely dropping. Businesses that sign up for Help Small Business can access funds as soon as the next business day after a customer purchases a certificate. </p>\n<h1><b>3. Salesforce</b></h1>\n<p>A great CRM sets the foundation for sustainable growth. Salesforce, another company founded in the 20th century, introduced small businesses to the benefits of CRMs.</p>\n<p>Salesforce’s solutions integrate with lots of other tools, meaning SMBs don’t need to rebuild from the ground up to add services. Additional communication channels — such as email, chat, and social — empower SMBs to communicate with and track prospects across channels. </p>\n<p>For COVID, Salesforce has partnered with data visualization tool Tableau. Their <a href=\"https://www.tableau.com/covid-19-coronavirus-data-resources\">COVID-19 data hub</a> lets users look at coronavirus growth trajectories by country, helping them forecast the length and severity of business disruptions. </p>\n<h1><b>4. Cisco</b></h1>\n<p>Cisco knows that small and medium businesses compete with bigger players based on their agility and flexibility. It also knows that, during the pandemic, SMBs can’t afford enterprise-level remote work tools. </p>\n<p>While COVID rages, the network management company is offering <a href=\"https://www.cisco.com/c/m/en_us/covid19.html#~offers-and-solutions\">free access</a> to its Webex virtual work environment platform. It’s also giving small businesses free access to its top three data security technologies: Cisco Umbrella, Duo, and Anyconnect. </p>\n<h1><b>5. Facebook</b></h1>\n<p>Facebook doesn’t just sell ads or solicit status updates. Built to be used by even the most tech-illiterate business owners, Facebook’s tools make it easy to research and grow an audience. </p>\n<p>To help SMBs maintain those audiences during tough times, Facebook’s <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/boost/grants\">Small Business Grants program</a> is distributing $100 million in cash grants and ad credits. The program, which is available to small businesses in 30 countries, is intended to help recipients meet payroll, pay rent, connect with new customers, and keep their operations intact. </p>\n<h1><b>6. Google</b></h1>\n<p>What doesn’t Google do? Perhaps the tech giant that most affects the average person’s daily life, Google also offers a variety of useful tools for SMBs. Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, and Hangouts can replace paid versions of similar apps with little or no loss in quality.</p>\n<p>Google is helping small businesses affected by COVID in a couple of ways. For one, it’s encouraging them to <a href=\"https://support.google.com/business/answer/9773423?hl=en\">update their hours</a> and get the word out via their Google Business profile. Google also offers a <a href=\"https://smallbusiness.withgoogle.com/news/resources-for-smbs-impacted-by-coronavirus/#!/\">helpful guide</a> to help affected SMBs communicate with employees, create business continuity plans, and work remotely using the tools above. </p>\n<p>It couldn’t be clearer: Tech companies are stepping up in the face of COVID. And for the small- and medium-sized businesses that depend on them, their help could be the difference between thriving and throwing in the towel.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/20/how-6-tech-giants-are-giving-smbs-a-hand-in-the-pandemic/\">How 6 Tech Giants Are Giving SMBs a Hand in the Pandemic</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 20 Apr 2020 14:00:29 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Screen-Shot-2020-04-16-at-12.48.21-PM-300x243.png","linkMd5":"2b9559e2b0e4c4da9e75a3f22601f470","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn34@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-07-938_7e9cf96f6f22ee04.webp","destWidth":300,"destHeight":243,"sourceBytes":160013,"destBytes":15824,"author":"Brad Anderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Screen-Shot-2020-04-16-at-12.48.21-PM-300x243.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn34@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-07-938_7e9cf96f6f22ee04.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877747},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:51","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:51","title":"How Robotic Process Automation Can Revolutionize How Startups Manage Data and Empower Employees","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173451","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/03/how-robotic-process-automation-can-revolutionize-how-startups-manage-data-and-empower-employees/\" title=\"How Robotic Process Automation Can Revolutionize How Startups Manage Data and Empower Employees\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Automation-How-Startups-Manage-Data-and-Empower-Employees-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"automation manage data\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Automation-How-Startups-Manage-Data-and-Empower-Employees-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Automation-How-Startups-Manage-Data-and-Empower-Employees-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Automation-How-Startups-Manage-Data-and-Empower-Employees.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Automation has evolved to become essential in the composition of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/12/new-niches-for-startups-created-by-the-covid-19-pandemic/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">startups worldwide</a>. Every ambitious company from Seoul to San Diego is now looking to automate their operations as a means of fending off competition and staying competitive.</p>\n<p>Robotic process automation (RPA) has been identified by many entrepreneurs as an <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/24/5-advantages-artificial-intelligence-can-give-your-sme/\">essential tool in optimizing business processes</a> in a cost-effective manner. Tractica has estimated that the RPA market will see revenues of over $5bn by 2025.</p>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-full wp-image-173452\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Tractica.png\" alt=\"Tractica\" width=\"577\" height=\"414\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Tractica.png 577w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Tractica-300x215.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Tractica-223x160.png 223w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 577px) 100vw, 577px\" /></p>\n<p><i>(Tractica reporting suggests that global RPA revenue will top $5bn by 2025. Image: </i><a href=\"https://tractica.omdia.com/newsroom/press-releases/robotic-process-automation-market-to-reach-5-1-billion-by-2025/\"><i>Tractica</i></a><i>)</i></p>\n<p>The future is clearly bright for RPA technology and startups looking to manage large volumes of data without committing too much time and money to the challenge. The <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/05/marketing-automation-and-customer-service-how-are-they-connected/\">significance of automation</a> is that it can accelerate the growth of small businesses in a way that wasn’t possible before. Here’s a deeper look into the revolutionary influence that RPA is having over fledgling businesses:</p>\n<h2>Intelligent Data Processing</h2>\n<p>Many startups and project managers are capable of accessing large swathes of information but don’t possess the kind of technology that helps them to make real use of it. However, RPA helps users to access varied and extensive use cases from the data they obtain. RPA is a form of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/08/09/customer-data-management-a-crucial-step-to-increase-your-business/\">data management</a> that can ultimately prove essential in helping businesses to strategically grow from their formative months and years.</p>\n<p>Process mining can aid companies in gaining a stronger understanding of the processes involved in the actions that RPA undertakes. When something is automated using RPA, it’s possible to break it down into component parts and the various stages involved while finding areas in which to practice more efficiently and time management.</p>\n<h4>Process Simulations</h4>\n<p>Process simulations help users to supply information into a computer before letting it complete a prospective task. This form of hypothetical automation can allow you to calculate and re-calculate how best to approach tasks and see which method brings the most efficiency for your startup without having to focus time and effort on actually undertaking it.</p>\n<p>Process simulations are an excellent way for startups and project managers to figure out the most effective way of operating and possibly even change existing setups on the fly &#8211; should it be deemed necessary.</p>\n<h2>The Next Generation of Data Management</h2>\n<p>RPA is highly useful when it comes to the storing of data, and has the potential to bring efficiency to data cleansing, normalization, data wrangling, and the creation or updating of metadata.</p>\n<p>Many startups are required to indulge in some form of data entry throughout their respective lifespans. When data entry is conducted by human hands, the repetitive tasks carry a relatively high rate of error compared to automated alternatives.</p>\n<p>By utilizing RPA to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/21/prioritizing-revenue-capture-why-sales-order-management-needs-to-be-automated/\">manage data entry</a>, it’s possible to automatically screen for errors and irregularities within datasets, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/01/08/security-teams-need-to-be-prepared-with-an-incident-response-plan/\">move data between different storage systems </a>and eradicate duplicated metadata among other tasks.</p>\n<p>By utilizing RPA solutions, it’s possible to make your data go further. It’s also possible to simulate tasks in a way that can help you to effectively <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2011/03/04/3-affordable-ab-testing-tools-for-small-businesses/\">A/B test your processes</a> to keep ahead of your early competitors.</p>\n<h2>Easy Efficiency</h2>\n<p>Using RPA is an effective way of boosting productivity within your workplace. The beauty of RPA solutions is that they require very little technical understanding from users in order to utilize them effectively. Simply speaking, the software follows the instructions of the user and automates its given tasks. This makes it relatively straightforward to replicate the repetitive tasks involved in data entry and the addition of metadata for startups to focus employee energy on other vital tasks.</p>\n<p>It’s important for startups to respect the resources available to them and use them in an efficient manner. The implementation of RPA into a startup enables business owners to reallocate staff in order to tend to more pressing matters, due to their workloads being free from repetitive tasks.</p>\n<p>Reallocations also allow staff to take more time in their work, creating more creative solutions, and applying more care to the process of undertaking more complex business tasks.</p>\n<p>Regardless of how you decide to implement RPA, your <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/15/top-25-slack-alternatives-for-team-communication-and-collaboration/\">team would need to be a big part of the process</a> involved. The reason behind this is that they will already possess a fundamental understanding of said processes and will likely be skilled in finding the most efficient ways in which RPA can undertake work.</p>\n<p>Once your RPA system is in place, it’s vital that you use your new resources to their full potential. For instance, you could use the technology to provide support to a section of your startup that’s understaffed, or forecast to require more output in order to support the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/19/how-technology-plays-a-vital-role-in-small-business-growth/\">business’ growth</a>.</p>\n<p>Here, it’s vital to remember that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/23/ai-customer-service-will-save-you-money-but-it-might-cost-you-customers/\">automation will only provide users with efficiency</a> and cost-effective processes by allocating the technology to the right areas of your organization.</p>\n<h2>Automation to Bring Employee Empowerment</h2>\n<p>The early life of a startup can be a delicate and tentative time for business owners. There are plenty of <a href=\"https://daglar-cizmeci.com/startup-funding-7-potential-funding-options-to-explore/\">ways to access funding</a> and prepare your endeavor for its entry onto the market. However, small businesses with fewer employees face a constant challenge in ensuring that all workers remain motivated and committed to the startup.</p>\n<p>While automation can help to make employees more efficient, some <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/30/why-do-executives-hesitate-to-automate/\">business owners may be fearful of utilizing automation</a> in the workplace due to the level of disruption it may cause.</p>\n<p>However, studies from HR Technologist have shown that 92% of organizations have seen employments in employee satisfaction levels as a result of intelligent automation and robotic process initiatives.</p>\n<p>While some employees are perceived to be fearful of automation, reports suggest that the removal of manual and time-consuming workloads aids workers in focussing on more engaging activities.</p>\n<p>Increasing the time employees spend on more rewarding and engaging <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/15/5-work-culture-trends-that-improve-employee-productivity-and-satisfaction/\">workloads</a> also helps them to increase their motivation for tasks. This can be a key factor in ensuring workers communicate effectively with customers and optimize their own output in a way that helps startups to establish themselves faster during those tentative early months.</p>\n<p><strong>Ensuring that your approach to automation efforts keep your employees happy in their line of work is more important than a lot of business owners may know.</strong></p>\n<p>The most effective work will often come from contented employees, and it’s important to utilize RPA in a way that gets rid of the workloads that your employees are least engaged in. In doing this, it’s possible to have a positive effect on worker attitudes and your startup’s overall performance.</p>\n<p>Employees that approach their work in a positive mindset can help to reduce the costs of staff turnover and the impact of HR tasks associated with recruitment and training.</p>\n<p>The early days of a startup are the most important in its lifespan. By failing to optimize your operations, it could cost your business valuable working hours and damage the satisfaction levels of both your employees and customers.</p>\n<p>While embracing automation may cost money to set up, it can work wonders in saving money across various other departments &#8211; especially when it comes to recruitment and manual tasks. In a competitive landscape that often treats new businesses harshly, RPA can help startups to attain a fighting chance of survival where hope may otherwise be lost.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/03/how-robotic-process-automation-can-revolutionize-how-startups-manage-data-and-empower-employees/\">How Robotic Process Automation Can Revolutionize How Startups Manage Data and Empower Employees</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 03 Aug 2020 18:01:02 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Automation-How-Startups-Manage-Data-and-Empower-Employees.jpg","linkMd5":"22bc4fc8644cc11a27c5781f96762de6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn91@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-19-972_cbbdc44609a9b7a1.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Automation-How-Startups-Manage-Data-and-Empower-Employees.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":70354,"destBytes":67490,"author":"Daglar Cizmeci","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Automation-How-Startups-Manage-Data-and-Empower-Employees-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn72@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-15-282_4ac4fab5fa6bf8b6.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Tractica.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn35@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-21-984_714c9380130d7d2a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195871625},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","title":"3 Fast-Food IoT Technologies that Could Slow COVID-19","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=172483","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/18/3-fast-food-iot-technologies-that-could-slow-covid-19/\" title=\"3 Fast-Food IoT Technologies that Could Slow COVID-19\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/3-Fast-Food-IoT-Technologies-that-Could-Slow-COVID-19-300x185.jpeg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"iot slow covid-19\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/3-Fast-Food-IoT-Technologies-that-Could-Slow-COVID-19-300x185.jpeg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/3-Fast-Food-IoT-Technologies-that-Could-Slow-COVID-19-260x160.jpeg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/3-Fast-Food-IoT-Technologies-that-Could-Slow-COVID-19.jpeg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Some of the fast-food IoT <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/01/24/how-iot-and-big-data-applications-will-revolutionize-our-smart-cities/\">technologies</a> I’m about to dig into were already catching wind leading up to our current pandemic. Due to social distancing measures, it seems natural for any technology to thrive if it can help <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/27/paving-the-way-3-industries-ripe-for-post-pandemic-change/\">businesses operate</a> with less person-to-person interaction in this climate. As our favorite places cautiously reopen, the following three technologies can help keep customers and employees healthy. Here are three fast-food IoT technologies that could slow COVID-19.</p>\n<h2><strong>Ordering Kiosks</strong></h2>\n<p>Being able to place an order for food indirectly has existed since the telephone. Right now, there&#8217;s a need for added layers of separation between people in fast-food restaurants. Using a kiosk to order has never been more helpful.</p>\n<h3><strong>What is an Ordering Kiosk?<br />\n</strong></h3>\n<p>Ordering kiosks are large, rectangular screens that you can place an order on. The technology itself has been around since the late 1970s, thanks to people like <a href=\"https://kioskindustry.org/evolution-kiosk-software/\">Dr. Murray Lappe</a> at the University of Illinois in Urbana-Champaign. Major fast-food restaurants like Subway and McDonald’s began experimenting with these screens and ordering back in 2006.</p>\n<p>In a 2018 <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2018/06/04/mcdonalds-to-add-self-order-kiosks-to-1000-stores-each-quarter.html\">interview</a>, then-McDonald’s CEO Steve Easterbrook shared with CNBC that the company would be starting ambitious plans to equip 1000 restaurants every quarter with kiosks for eight to nine quarters. The alternative way of ordering would provide better customer experience and more revenue for the company.</p>\n<p>Fast-forward to summer 2019 and the investment paid off. In a Q2 earnings call last year, Easterbrook went over how the company was seeing higher average checks from customers using the order kiosks.</p>\n<h3><strong>Not Everyone is a Fan of the Ordering Kiosk, Though.</strong></h3>\n<p>Former CEO of McDonald’s USA, Ed Rensi, voiced his concerns about the growing Kiosk use about two years ago in an <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/edrensi/2018/07/11/mcdonalds-says-goodbye-cashiers-hello-kiosks/#70dfbbd26f14\">article</a> with Forbes. His main problem with them was that automating these parts of the business would eliminate valuable opportunities for teens and college students who need an entry-level <a href=\"https://www.thiscollegelife.com/finance/finding-a-job/how-to-succeed-in-your-first-service-industry-job/\">service industry job</a>. Considering the valuable lessons from my own experience as a cashier back in college, I agree with the concerns.</p>\n<h3><strong>How They Help Slow COVID-19</strong></h3>\n<p>In our current environment, things like kiosks need to be cleaned almost constantly. McDonald’s has issued reopening instructions that any restaurant using the self-order kiosks <a href=\"https://cnycentral.com/news/local/mcdonalds-prepares-to-reopen-with-new-changes-to-the-restaurant\">must have them cleaned</a> after every use. The kiosks will help employees in terms of social distancing and the employees will help the kiosks to stay clean. For the time being, then, they will work together.</p>\n<p>The IoT kiosks are just one piece of the order, though. Customers who are still wary of using them (despite cleaning protocols) do have other options. By now, most major restaurant chains offer an iPhone or an Android app plus a website for placing online orders.</p>\n<p>Smartphone apps and online ordering, in general, will come in handy for this situation, plus, they all provide a massive amount of data on customers who opt-in. Pizza Hut (a pioneer of digital ordering) even developed an Xbox app a few years ago and saw <a href=\"https://www.engadget.com/2014-01-10-pizza-hut-xbox-360-app-made-over-1-million-in-first-four-months.html\">over a million in sales</a> within the first four months.</p>\n<h3><strong>More Connection than Ever</strong></h3>\n<p>Now, the beginning of an order is quick, clean, and engaging for customers. Restaurants are also beginning to focus on the end of patrons’ meals, too. If the last thing they do before leaving is have disgusted feeling about something &#8212; chances are they won’t want to come back. That’s why businesses are looking at their garbage &#8212; and IoT &#8212; to further connect with customers and end meals on a cleaner note.</p>\n<h2><strong>At-The-Source Trash Compactors</strong></h2>\n<p>Different businesses, schools, and city governments have gradually been adopting at-the-source trash compacting during the last 20 years. Similar to the kiosks, major food chains like Chick-Fil-A have been adding more trash compactors at an increased pace lately. Also, like kiosks, various ideas and household versions of trash compactors and additional refuse disposal sources have <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L8LkzSQonUU\">been around</a> since the 1970s.</p>\n<p>The main reasons for restaurants adopting trash compactors and more trash disposal cans &#8212; is the operational efficiency and sustainability. Quick and easy trash disposal comes with added customer experience benefits that will be helpful in a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/22/how-smart-cities-can-help-build-a-better-post-pandemic-world/\">post-pandemic</a> environment.</p>\n<h3><strong>What is an at-the-source trash compactor?<br />\n</strong></h3>\n<p>An at-the-source trash compactor is essentially a garbage can that smashes trash into a cube so the employees don’t need to go back and forth to the dumpsters as often. Fewer dumpster trips, in turn, uses fewer trash bags, reducing the plastic output in the environment. Many also have the IoT technology built-in for sending a text message or an email once the machine is full. This allows restaurants to focus on other things until the exact time one needs to be emptied.</p>\n<h3><strong>How They Help Slow COVID-19</strong></h3>\n<p>While you might see handles on outdoor machines &#8212; and of course, the much-needed garbage can foot pedals. A compactor that has been showing up in restaurants like Chick-Fil-A all has automatic doors on them that use a motion sensor to open. Automatic doors on the trash bins will help, since making garbage disposal as contact-less as possible these next few months will be crucial.</p>\n<p>Studies that are currently underway by the CDC suggest that the novel coronavirus can survive for 48 to 72 hours on <a href=\"https://health.clevelandclinic.org/tips-for-keeping-your-home-clean-in-the-time-of-covid-19/\">common surfaces</a> like plastic or stainless steel. The fewer surfaces there are to touch, the better.</p>\n<p>Outside of the direct customer experience, being able to indirectly monitor when machines are full will aid workers in social distancing measures. Instead of needing to periodically go and check garbage, they can look at a computer or smartphone to know whether a compactor is full.</p>\n<p>Many chains have plans in place for the beginning and end of meal safety, but what about while you eat? In an April press release, the McDonald’s Vice President of U.S. Communications &#38; Government relations <a href=\"https://mcdonaldscorporation.gcs-web.com/static-files/87c67454-fcc5-458a-ba3c-21926216c1c6\">included a list</a> of precautionary measures that the fast-food giant will be taking to prioritize safety in restaurants.</p>\n<p>Two main areas will remain closed for the time being. The beverage bars and play places will stay closed (imagine the germs in those ball pits!) but not every contact-heavy area can be locked up. Since bathrooms will need to remain open, IoT-enabled devices may be able to help the efforts at keeping things clean.</p>\n<h2><strong>The IoT Bathroom</strong></h2>\n<p>By now, practically everything in a bathroom can leverage some type of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/25/how-iot-fixtures-will-power-the-bathroom-of-the-future/\">IoT fixture</a>. Things like soap dispensers and toilet paper rolls can be monitored for how much is left, toilets can self-flush, and lights can even indicate whether a stall is in use or the door just looks closed. Enormous amounts of data can also be sent to facilities management and customer experience teams.</p>\n<h3><strong>How They Can Help Slow COVID-19</strong></h3>\n<p>Currently, the main adopters of smart bathroom technologies have been airports. One of the most useful benefits of the IoT-enabled bathrooms at places like the Atlanta International Airport and the Los Angeles International Airport are <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q6_FPazyzDg\">lights on the ceiling</a> that indicate whether a stall is in use or not. When one is done being used, the cleaning crew could make sure it gets properly sterilized. According to the LAX <a href=\"https://www.flylax.com/travelsafely\">COVID-19 plan</a>, they are currently cleaning the restrooms once per hour. The ATL’s website mentions “increased frequency of cleaning of public areas” for their plan.</p>\n<h3><strong>Keep It Simple</strong></h3>\n<p>The light systems being installed at airports sound simple enough to fit in fast food. A battery-powered door lock wirelessly communicates with the light above to indicate whether the stall’s being used or not. The lights in the ceiling do require some basic wiring though, according to the website for Tooshlights, the company that provides them. After that, the status and data can be monitored remotely from a computer like the compactors and kiosks.</p>\n<h3><strong>Tying It All Together</strong></h3>\n<p>These next few months will undoubtedly be a tough time for everyone. In efforts to keep costs low and customer experience positive, various IoT systems may be an answer. Kiosks, compactors, and the bathroom will likely continue to be areas of focus for fast food chains to keep business running smoothly.</p>\n<p>Disclosure: I was an intern one summer about five years ago for Compaction Technologies, a company that makes trash compactors. I’ve cleaned out garbage cans before. I am not receiving any compensation from them or any other company mentioned/linked in this article.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/18/3-fast-food-iot-technologies-that-could-slow-covid-19/\">3 Fast-Food IoT Technologies that Could Slow COVID-19</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 18 Jun 2020 15:01:09 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/3-Fast-Food-IoT-Technologies-that-Could-Slow-COVID-19.jpeg","linkMd5":"24f8db5c9262924667182046937ad883","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn32@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-26-569_9fcf58e58bfda4fb.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/3-Fast-Food-IoT-Technologies-that-Could-Slow-COVID-19.jpeg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":31411,"destBytes":25580,"author":"Bob Buckley","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/3-Fast-Food-IoT-Technologies-that-Could-Slow-COVID-19-300x185.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn64@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-11-212_3b8599519acebfc0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195875704},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:59","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:59","title":"How Are Sustainable Startups Like Pela Fighting Plastic Waste?","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=167900","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/12/how-are-sustainable-startups-like-pela-fighting-plastic-waste/\" title=\"How Are Sustainable Startups Like Pela Fighting Plastic Waste?\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"181\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-12-at-10.59.02-AM-300x181.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-12-at-10.59.02-AM-300x181.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-12-at-10.59.02-AM-900x544.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-12-at-10.59.02-AM-260x157.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-12-at-10.59.02-AM-825x500.png 825w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-12-at-10.59.02-AM.png 1122w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Among the news that came out of the recent World Economic Forum was Coca-Cola’s refusal to curb its use of plastic bottles. Because consumers appreciate convenience, a <a href=\"https://cleantechnica.com/2020/01/23/coca-cola-will-continue-with-single-use-plastic-bottles-because-thats-what-people-want/\">spokesperson explained</a>, Coca-Cola will instead increase its use of recycled materials and aid in efforts to recycle the bottles.</p>\n<p>Environmental groups were quick <a href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-51197463\">to criticize</a> Coca-Cola for offering a false solution to the problem while putting more responsibility on consumers. They pointed out that Coca-Cola is one of the largest plastic polluters in the world.</p>\n<p>In a sense, Coca-Cola is right: Consumer demand is the reason companies continue to use plastic bottles. But it’s also true that companies have stoked that demand with marketing campaigns promoting a throwaway culture.</p>\n<p>To make a real dent in the problem of plastic pollution, all sides must take responsibility. But it’s not behemoths like Coca-Cola leading that charge; it’s <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/13/3-ways-the-iot-can-offer-innovative-solutions-to-serious-environmental-problems/\">sustainability-minded</a> startups like <a href=\"https://pelacase.com/\">Pela</a>.</p>\n<h2><b>The Plastic Problem</b></h2>\n<p>According to Pela CEO Matt Bertulli, a throwaway society persists, in large part, because consumers don&#8217;t understand the far-reaching effects of plastic waste.</p>\n<p>“There is literally no place on Earth that isn’t polluted by plastics,” Bertulli explains. “From the peaks of the Himalaya to the deepest reaches of the ocean, you’ll find pieces of plastic.”</p>\n<p>Those plastics have built up over a relatively short period. Nylon was invented in 1935, but plastics didn&#8217;t <a href=\"https://www.sciencehistory.org/the-history-and-future-of-plastics\">become commonplace</a> until the World War II era. Governments worked to preserve natural resources, propelling the increased use of long-lasting synthetic materials.</p>\n<p>Since then, the plastic industry has exploded. But disposal practices have stayed relatively static: <a href=\"https://www.nationalgeographic.com/news/2017/07/plastic-produced-recycling-waste-ocean-trash-debris-environment/\">Less than 10 percent</a> of the plastic produced is recycled. The rest is incinerated or winds up in landfills or oceans.</p>\n<p>That last resting place is what inspired Pela. After returning from a family vacation in Hawaii, where he saw all sorts of plastics embedded in the beautiful beaches floating in pristine waters, founder Jeremy Lang began experimenting.</p>\n<p>He and Bertulli sought biodegradable plastic alternatives that could be used in everyday products. “We knew there were solutions out there,” Lang says. “What we didn’t know back then was just how well they’d work for phone cases.”</p>\n<h2><b>Device Case Waste</b></h2>\n<p>Why start with phone cases? Because there’s a smartphone in every pocket. Consumers change smartphones every few years, and many change phone cases more often than that.</p>\n<p>Believe it or not, more than <a href=\"https://pelacase.com/pages/the-biodegradable-phone-case-vs-a-billion-dollar-industry\">a billion plastic phone cases </a>are thrown away every year, along with the packaging they come in. As the pace of technological change increases, that number is sure to grow.</p>\n<p>“Technology won’t slow down,” Bertulli points out, “and consumers use phone cases not just to protect their investment, but to express their personality.” Pela’s goal, he says, is to help them do so sustainably.</p>\n<p>All of Pela’s phone cases are 100 percent compostable and made from plants. They contain <a href=\"https://impakter.com/pela-case/\">flax shive</a>, a waste byproduct from agriculture flax harvesting. It acts as a binder, making the cases stronger and more durable.</p>\n<p>It also creates screen protectors that zero-waste. Although compostable plastics might not sound shiny and new, Pela’s cases are eye-catching.</p>\n<p>But Bertulli stresses that the goal wasn’t just to create a sleek phone case: “There are dozens of phone cases out there already. We wanted to get people talking not just about the cases themselves, but about the <a href=\"https://pelacase.com/pages/otterbox-casetify-casemate-sustainability-practices\">bigger picture of sustainability</a>.”</p>\n<p>More than 520,000 people — including Android, iOS, and Windows Phone users — have made the switch. The result? More than 290,000 pounds of plastic saved.</p>\n<h2><b>A Better Cycle</b></h2>\n<p>Pela doesn’t just sell eco-friendly phone cases. To go the extra mile in its sustainability mission, Pela encourages consumers to trade in their old phone cases through its <a href=\"https://pelacase.com/pages/pela-360\">Pela 360</a> initiative.</p>\n<p>Although Pela’s cases can be composted, not all consumers have access to composting facilities. And because most phone case manufacturers don&#8217;t accept trade-ins for recycling, Pela encourages consumers to send them <i>any</i> old phone case.</p>\n<p>“We didn’t go into this planning to do other companies’ dirty work,” Bertulli notes, “but it quickly became clear that people were just throwing their old cases away.”</p>\n<p>Pela donates 5 percent of its total sales to causes that work to keep plastic waste from entering the oceans in the first place. “It’s important to us to take an all-of-the-above approach,” Bertulli says. “Recycling, upcycling, supporting environmental causes — it’s all going toward the same effort.”</p>\n<p>Without enterprises like Coca-Cola on board, startups like Pela won’t change the world. But they just might be its spark, and that’s how every great movement starts.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/12/how-are-sustainable-startups-like-pela-fighting-plastic-waste/\">How Are Sustainable Startups Like Pela Fighting Plastic Waste?</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 12 Mar 2020 14:00:30 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-12-at-10.59.02-AM.png","linkMd5":"e43e7611af2b11b0963d802450c0a441","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn100@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-09-690_a85b927494b87da2.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-12-at-10.59.02-AM.png","destWidth":1122,"destHeight":678,"sourceBytes":1538733,"destBytes":113988,"author":"Brad Anderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-12-at-10.59.02-AM-300x181.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn67@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-15-281_2823a5adcb7eab7f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195879915},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","title":"Top 10 Best Help Desk Software for 2020","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=164632","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/15/top-10-best-help-desk-software-for-2020/\" title=\"Top 10 Best Help Desk Software for 2020\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Top-10-Best-Help-Desk-Software-for-2020-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"help desk software\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Top-10-Best-Help-Desk-Software-for-2020-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Top-10-Best-Help-Desk-Software-for-2020-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Top-10-Best-Help-Desk-Software-for-2020-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Top-10-Best-Help-Desk-Software-for-2020-1536x1024.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Top-10-Best-Help-Desk-Software-for-2020.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Customer service has become the game-changer in companies, and most businesses are investing a lot in it. Keeping up with technology, businesses have started leaning into <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/06/28/electronic-design-is-utilizing-ai-enabled-solutions-to-render-top-grade-service/\"><u>AI-powered customer service tools</u></a>. Here is the top ten best help desk software for 2020.</p>\n<h2><strong>Why is everything about the customer now?</strong><strong><em><br />\n</em></strong></h2>\n<p>Whether you are a startup or a large enterprise &#8212; giving your customers the front seat is crucial for you. When you make the customer first &#8212; you&#8217;ll always be number one.</p>\n<p>It&#8217;s important to focus on your customer service &#8212; but it&#8217;s also essential to put your money on the customer journey, experience, and retention. Each of these aspects have a different path and is not the same. It&#8217;s crucial to understand the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/10/customer-experience-vs-customer-service/\"><u>difference </u></a>in the customer journey, customer experience, and customer retention.</p>\n<h4>Understanding the different verticals of customer service empowers you to know how to go about offering customer service.</h4>\n<p>It also enables you to understand how customers try to contact you and the ways to respond to them instantly. The most common example of customer contact is social media.</p>\n<h4>With social media rages, your company can have a bad name with just one tweet.</h4>\n<p>Did you know that <a href=\"https://gofrontside.com/78-of-people-who-complain-to-a-brand-over-twitter-expect-a-response-within-one-hour/\"><u>78% of customers</u></a> complain to brands using their Twitter handle? Along with using their Twitter handle, they expect an answer within an hour.</p>\n<h4>All customers want is an instant answer to their questions.</h4>\n<p>Now, leveraging social media is a great idea to create a brand image. But, having a streamlined process for offering exceptional customer service is equally important.</p>\n<p>It&#8217;s essential to deploy a robust help desk software to keep track of all customer questions on one platform. With so many help desk tools available in the market, we offer you a helping hand by covering the top help desk software to consider in 2020. Pick one for your business.</p>\n<h2><strong><b>Top Help Desk Ticketing Systems: The Ultimate List</b></strong></h2>\n<p>Staying on top of your customer service game requires extensive research. Deploying the top help desk software doesn’t cut it, but it is crucial to finalize on one that is right for your company.</p>\n<p>In this blog post, we will cover 10 free help desk software that offer exquisite features to offer delightful customer service.</p>\n<h2><b>1. </b><a href=\"https://www.proprofs.com/helpdesk/\"><strong><u><b>ProProfs Help Desk</b></u></strong></a></h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/ProProfs-Help-Desk-Software.png\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-164635 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/ProProfs-Help-Desk-Software-900x488.png\" alt=\"ProProfs best help desk software\" width=\"900\" height=\"488\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/ProProfs-Help-Desk-Software-900x488.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/ProProfs-Help-Desk-Software-300x163.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/ProProfs-Help-Desk-Software-260x141.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/ProProfs-Help-Desk-Software-1536x833.png 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/ProProfs-Help-Desk-Software.png 1715w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></a></p>\n<p>The ProProfs Help Desk is the top help desk ticketing system that comes with an easy to use UI and advanced features that enable you to resolve customer questions well in time. You can also split complex tickets into sub tickets and assign them to the relevant support department. Along with managing customer tickets on a single dashboard, this help desk software focuses on monitoring agent performance and agent collaboration.</p>\n<p>You can respond to tickets with predefined responses and save agents’ time. Instead of taking up every customer ticket, resolve simple customer tickets in seconds with this feature. The Zendesk dashboard is feature-rich and a little complicated to use at first, but extremely useful in calculating agent performance. You can also assign tickets to agents right from the dashboard.</p>\n<p>The pricing for Zendesk help desk software is a bit on the high-price range, but the features offered are worth it.</p>\n<h3><strong><b>Features</b></strong></h3>\n<ul>\n<li>Predefined Ticket Responses</li>\n<li>Web Widgets</li>\n<li>Performance Dashboards</li>\n<li>Ticket Assignment</li>\n</ul>\n<h3><strong><b>Benefits</b></strong></h3>\n<ul>\n<li>Ability to search for customer history easily</li>\n<li>Integrated surveys help gain insight into customer satisfaction</li>\n<li>Other powerful integrations help improve the entire ticket management process</li>\n</ul>\n<h3><strong><b>Pricing</b></strong></h3>\n<ul>\n<li>Essential: $5/agent/month</li>\n<li>Team: $19/agent/month</li>\n<li>Professional: $49/agent/month</li>\n<li>Enterprise: $99/agent/month</li>\n<li>Elite: $199/agent/month</li>\n</ul>\n<h2><b>3. </b><a href=\"https://freshdesk.com/\"><strong><u><b>Freshdesk</b></u></strong></a></h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Freshdesk-software.png\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-164637 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Freshdesk-software-900x385.png\" alt=\"Best Freshdesk help desk software\" width=\"900\" height=\"385\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Freshdesk-software-900x385.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Freshdesk-software-300x128.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Freshdesk-software-260x111.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Freshdesk-software.png 1224w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></a></p>\n<p>Freshdesk is one of the top help desk systems that focus primarily on agent collaboration. Some might be overpriced while others might not offer the features you need. So, how do you make the decision that’s right for you?</p>\n<p>When finalizing on one help desk software, there are certain factors that you need to consider and make a final call.
