Adams","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Top-10-Best-Help-Desk-Software-for-2020-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn84@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-23-037_b82a361f423d6c70.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/ProProfs-Help-Desk-Software-900x488.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn91@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-17-749_9e69f27749bbb9ae.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Zendesk-Help-Desk-Software-900x414.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn12@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-16-452_27e805a651e76388.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Freshdesk-software-900x385.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn24@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-24-081_3bff83ab1efda7f1.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Liveagent-Software-900x460.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn76@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-13-160_6c9f3af3fa314af2.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/service-desk-MSP-software-900x330.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn12@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-15-657_b5ff3082b8c6fa9e.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Zoho-Desk-software-900x403.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn27@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-23-643_14fe04d143b34d56.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/happyfox-software.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn28@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-15-413_ba5d7b9066f51d8a.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Freshservice-software.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn3@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-16-215_c4160aa55fe84a2e.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/Kayako-software-900x476.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn68@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-21-614_cb517442758a025a.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/JIRA-Service-Desk-900x352.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn100@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-18-114_f2605db670f1acef.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195880798},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","title":"What’s Video Phishing and how do You Protect Yourself?","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=172485","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/20/whats-video-phishing-and-how-do-you-protect-yourself/\" title=\"What’s Video Phishing and how do You Protect Yourself?\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/What%E2%80%99s-Video-Phishing-and-how-do-You-Protect-Yourself-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"video phishing\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/What%E2%80%99s-Video-Phishing-and-how-do-You-Protect-Yourself-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/What%E2%80%99s-Video-Phishing-and-how-do-You-Protect-Yourself-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/What%E2%80%99s-Video-Phishing-and-how-do-You-Protect-Yourself-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/What%E2%80%99s-Video-Phishing-and-how-do-You-Protect-Yourself.jpg 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>In 2020, phishing is among the most common forms of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/29/the-biggest-cybersecurity-mistakes-businesses-are-still-making/\">cyberattacks on businesses</a> and individuals alike. 56% of IT decision-makers state that phishing attacks are the top security threat they are facing, with 32% of hacks involving phishing. Here is video phishing and how you protect yourself.</p>\n<h3><strong>Phishing is no longer limited to emails from Nigerian princes offering the recipients massive returns on investments.</strong></h3>\n<p>Many phishing messages and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/10/leveraging-big-data-that-data-every-website-should-track/\">websites have become sophisticated</a> to the point that users are no longer able to recognize them without specific training. Google now blacklists an average of 50,000 websites for phishing every week.</p>\n<p>On the upside, the ways that you can protect yourself from phishing attacks have evolved as well in recent years. They range from using up-to-date firewall software to using secure platforms such as cloud-based business phone services.</p>\n<h2><strong>A new threat is looming on the horizon: video phishing.</strong></h2>\n<p>Driven by technological advances, artificial intelligence, and machine learning, this new trend has the potential of causing catastrophic security breaches.</p>\n<p>Keep reading to find out what video phishing is, what it looks like, and how you can protect yourself.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1588058365718-9d74defc5313?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&#38;ixid=eyJhcHBfaWQiOjEyMDd9&#38;auto=format&#38;fit=crop&#38;w=1000&#38;q=80\"><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1588058365718-9d74defc5313?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&#38;ixid=eyJhcHBfaWQiOjEyMDd9&#38;auto=format&#38;fit=crop&#38;w=1000&#38;q=80\" alt=\"black iphone 7 on macbook pro\" width=\"1000\" height=\"667\" /></a></p>\n<p><strong>How does Video Phishing work? </strong></p>\n<p>Surprise! Elon Musk is interrupting your Zoom call.</p>\n<p>Sounds fake? It is.</p>\n<p>But it looks disturbingly real.</p>\n<p>See the end of the document for embed.</p>\n<p>The video above shows an application of Avatarify, a tool developed by a researcher to transform users into celebrities in real-time during Zoom or Skype calls. Its inventor, Ali Aliev, says that the program’s purpose was to have some fun during COVID-19 lockdown &#8212; by surprising friends during video conferences as Albert Einstein, Eminem, or the Mona Lisa.</p>\n<h4><strong>The technology behind donning someone else’s animated face like a mask is called deepfaking. </strong></h4>\n<p>Deepfakes are relatively new applications of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/10/why-multicultural-marketing-needs-machine-learning-and-facial-tracking/\">machine learning tools</a>. These tools generate realistic faces by analyzing thousands of videos and images of a target’s face and extracting patterns for common expressions and movements. Then, these patterns can be projected onto anyone, effectively morphing them into someone else.</p>\n<p><strong>You use the image of  Elon Musk. Or President Obama. In fact, a <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EtEPE859w94\">deep fake video</a> of the former President calling his successor ‘a total and complete dips**t’ went viral back in 2018.</strong></p>\n<p>The implications of this technology for <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/30/cybersecurity-ensuring-sanity-in-smart-cities/\">cybersecurity are wide-reaching </a>and potentially disastrous.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>Because instead of trolling your friends, or insulting President Trump via someone famous deepfakes &#8212; you won&#8217;t know if it&#8217;s friends being comical &#8212; or the dangerous, video phishing.</em></p></blockquote>\n<p><strong>What are the Dangers of Video Phishing? </strong></p>\n<p>According to <a href=\"https://edition.cnn.com/2019/10/07/tech/deepfake-videos-increase/index.html\">CNN</a>, the majority of deepfake videos on the internet as of the end of 2019, were pornography. In total, 15,000 of such videos were counted. That might not sound like much, considering the vastness of the internet.</p>\n<p>The reason for these rather limited numbers has been that generating convincing deepfakes takes a fair amount of computational power. Avatarify, for example, takes a high-level gaming PC to run properly.</p>\n<p>But lower-quality applications have already been developed, such as a face-swapping app that got banned again fairly quickly.</p>\n<p>It is only a question of time before deepfake technology becomes widely available. And widely used for cybercrime.</p>\n<h3>Some of these scams have already been recorded and you can find them on YouTube.</h3>\n<p>In one case, hackers used similar technology to <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/fraudsters-use-ai-to-mimic-ceos-voice-in-unusual-cybercrime-case-11567157402\">deepfake the voices of CEOs</a> and sent voicemail messages to executives. They succeeded in effecting a transfer of a mind-boggling $243,000.</p>\n<p>In another case, three men were arrested in Israel for swindling a businessman out of <strong>$8 million</strong> by <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/mar/28/conmen-made-8m-by-impersonating-french-minister-israeli-police\">impersonating the French foreign minister. </a></p>\n<p>Experts are already warning against other possible applications of deepfake videos for frauds to generate funds. One scenario, for example, is extortion. Hackers could threaten the release of a video containing content that can be damaging to a person’s or business’ reputation. Such content could range from straight-out pornography to the CEO of a company endorsing racist views.</p>\n<p>As experiences have shown, that could be disastrous. For businesses, even the regular kind of ‘fake news’ can have catastrophic impacts on industry relationships, and even their <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/kenrapoza/2017/02/26/can-fake-news-impact-the-stock-market/#3088a85a2fac\">stock market values</a>.</p>\n<p>“Those kinds of things can put a company out of business through reputation damage,” Chris Kennedy of the AI cyber-security platform AttackIQ said in a recent interview with <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/waynerash/2019/12/24/how-deep-fakes-can-hurt-your-business-and-what-to-do-about-it/:\">Forbes</a>. “We’re hitting the tipping point in which technology is taking advantage of the biggest human weakness, we’re over-trusting.”</p>\n<h2><strong>How to Defend Yourself against Deepfake Video Phishing</strong></h2>\n<p>Today, having a high <a href=\"https://www.wpbeginner.com/wordpress-security/\">cybersecurity standard</a> is more important than ever. With online life proliferating during the COVID-19 crisis, scams and phishing attacks have flourished as well.</p>\n<p>The good news in the case of phishing videos is that the technology, as of 2020, is still relatively new, and the case numbers relatively low. That means that individuals and businesses have time to prepare, and disseminate information to ward against such attacks.</p>\n<h4>Know the basic defense moves</h4>\n<p>As a most <a href=\"https://www.fcc.gov/consumers/guides/spoofing-and-caller-id\">basic form of defense</a>, extreme caution is advised if you receive an unsolicited video call, especially from someone famous or in a position of authority. Never trusting caller IDs, hanging up immediately, and not sharing any information on such calls is essential.</p>\n<p>If you receive video messages that might be authentic, but you are uncertain about it, you can use software to determine if what you are facing is a deep fake. For example, companies such as <strong>Deeptrace</strong> offers software with the capacity to recognize AI-generated video content.</p>\n<p>Apart from that, some low-tech solutions to protect against video phishing are having agreed-upon code words when <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/11/ai-startups-need-data-and-the-government-needs-help/\">communicating about sensitive information</a> via video messaging, using a second communication channel to confirm information, or asking security questions that your interlocutor can only answer if they are the real deal.</p>\n<p>Basically, pretend you’re in an old James Bond film. ‘In London, April&#8217;s a Spring month’ and all that.</p>\n<h5><strong>Final Thoughts </strong></h5>\n<p>Using AI to morph into someone else and extract sensitive information may still sound futuristic. But it is only a question of time until video phishing hits the mainstream.</p>\n<p>As technology advances and artificial intelligence and machine learning applications to copy the face and voice of people become widely available, the number of deepfake scams is set to go through the roof.</p>\n<p><strong>The best you can do, is to be aware, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/21/12-things-to-know-about-cybersecurity-now/\">keep informed</a>, and brace yourself. Keep safe.</strong></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/20/whats-video-phishing-and-how-do-you-protect-yourself/\">What’s Video Phishing and how do You Protect Yourself?</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 20 Jun 2020 18:01:01 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/What%E2%80%99s-Video-Phishing-and-how-do-You-Protect-Yourself.jpg","linkMd5":"bd29f606d146680610e1177f856118c8","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn60@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-25-946_d4d1df7a6ffb9b33.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/What%E2%80%99s-Video-Phishing-and-how-do-You-Protect-Yourself.jpg","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":853,"sourceBytes":47422,"destBytes":15770,"author":"Kanheya Singh","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/What%E2%80%99s-Video-Phishing-and-how-do-You-Protect-Yourself-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn11@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-13-990_35a495850f47d719.webp","https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1588058365718-9d74defc5313?ixlib=rb-1.2.1&ixid=eyJhcHBfaWQiOjEyMDd9&auto=format&fit=crop&w=1000&q=80":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn71@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-19-081_51b3e8c2b5560136.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195875611},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","title":"How Is AI Changing Medical Imaging?","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=172364","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/11/how-is-ai-changing-medical-imaging/\" title=\"How Is AI Changing Medical Imaging?\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Rad_Computer_iStock-1130772508_cmTriage-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Rad_Computer_iStock-1130772508_cmTriage-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Rad_Computer_iStock-1130772508_cmTriage-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Rad_Computer_iStock-1130772508_cmTriage-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Rad_Computer_iStock-1130772508_cmTriage-1536x1024.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Rad_Computer_iStock-1130772508_cmTriage.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Name an industry, and artificial intelligence is shaking it up. Some of the biggest changes, however, are happening in the quietest areas of the market.</p>\n<p>One of those is medical imaging. Although it may not be as glamorous as autonomous vehicles, AI-driven imaging is doing something even more important: saving lives. Companies like <a href=\"https://curemetrix.com/\">CureMetrix</a> are turning image analysis from a guessing game into a data-driven process.</p>\n<p>The typical radiology patient doesn’t see doctors using CureMetrix’s technology. All they know is that their treatment depends on an accurate diagnosis.</p>\n<p>What’s going on behind the scenes, and what’s next for the medical imaging industry? To find out, we sat down with CureMetrix CEO Navid Alipour. It turns out the answer is every bit as exciting as those self-driving cars. And no, the robots aren’t taking over any time soon.</p>\n<h2><strong>A Revolution in Medical Imaging</strong></h2>\n<p>To grasp just how much <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/15/decoding-the-future-trajectory-of-healthcare-with-ai/\">AI is changing the world of medical imaging</a>, it’s important to understand what the low-tech process looks like.</p>\n<p>“Not that long ago, medical imaging was a lot like ‘Where’s Waldo?’” Alipour explains. “Basically, experts would scan images and then search for tiny irregularities that could signal things like cancerous lesions.”</p>\n<p>Despite all the training doctors and radiologists go through, they make mistakes. Studies suggest error rates of human-only analysis may be <a href=\"https://www.researchgate.net/publication/272263016_Radiologic_errors_past_present_and_future\">around 35 percent</a>.</p>\n<p>Think about that: Without the help of AI, a third of patients who undergo radiology are steered in the wrong direction. And for different reasons, errors in either direction are dangerous.</p>\n<p>If something is missed — a false negative — the patient doesn’t receive treatment, and the cancer continues to grow. Many conditions that require imaging are time-sensitive. Every day that a cancerous tumor goes unnoticed, it grows larger and the risk of metastasis increases.</p>\n<p>On the other hand, a false positive — meaning the radiologist mistakes a benign feature for a medical issue — can expose patients to invasive procedures unnecessarily. Biopsies, for example, are painful and costly. On average, 70-80 percent of them come back negative in the search for breast cancer while placing emotional stress on the patient, as well as her family.</p>\n<p>How does CureMetrix minimize errors, and more importantly, what does that mean for patients?</p>\n<h2><strong>A Second Pair of Eyes</strong></h2>\n<p>Think of CureMetrix’s <a href=\"https://curemetrix.com/cm-triage/\">cmTriage</a> like a second set of eyes. The AI can’t supplant the person using the tool — the radiologist — but it can help him or her know which cases may be suspicious.</p>\n<p>Although AI won’t replace radiologists, those using AI will replace the ones who are not. Already, radiologists and mammography experts are in short supply, resulting in overwork, burnout, and costly errors — which can ultimately lead to lawsuits. CureMetrix empowers radiologists with data, serving as another arrow in their quiver in the fight against cancer.</p>\n<p>Cleared by the FDA as a triage tool for breast cancer screening, cmTriage provides a pre-read for the radiologist, helping to identify suspicious cases. The result is the potential for greater sensitivity, as well as fewer patient recalls.</p>\n<p>When it comes to detecting breast cancer, the average sensitivity of a radiologist is 84.4 percent, with 9.6 percent of cases requiring a second look. At 84.4 percent sensitivity, CureMetrix would have indicated that a total of 6.4 percent of the exams are suspicious. Even in default mode, the AI operates at higher specificity than radiologists.</p>\n<p>Even more powerful is the fact that cmTriage can operate at higher sensitivities. Its default setting is 93 percent, but it can be set as high as 99 percent.</p>\n<p>By combining deep learning and computer vision, cmTriage helps radiologists identify suspicious changes, enabling those with breast cancer to get treatment sooner. Just as importantly, it helps radiologists identify cases that are less suspicious or potentially normal, decreasing the chance that patients will be subjected to multiple visits or risky treatments.</p>\n<h2><strong>Beginning with Breast Cancer</strong></h2>\n<p>Currently, CureMetrix is available only for breast cancer detection. But why breast cancer, and what other conditions might it help with?</p>\n<p>When I asked Alipour, he pointed to two things: scale and the unique challenges of breast cancer — the most complex of all cancers to detect.</p>\n<p>Close to 300,000 Americans are diagnosed each year with breast cancer, comprising almost 30 percent of all cancer diagnoses in women. Secondly, an estimated <a href=\"https://curemetrix.com/wp-content/uploads/CureMetrixPoster.pdf\">$4 billion</a> is spent annually on mammography false positives. Biopsies, often the second step in detection, exhibit a stunning 75 percent false-positive rate.</p>\n<p>“We just couldn’t ignore numbers like that,” Alipour says. “There are a lot of different cancers out there, but few are as costly — in human or in monetary terms — as breast cancer.”</p>\n<p>Fortunately for other cancer patients, mammography is only the start of AI’s medical imaging makeover. CureMetrix plans to expand its AI into other areas of medical imaging.</p>\n<h2><strong>A One-Size-Fits-All Detection Tool?</strong></h2>\n<p>Imaging is a critical tool in cancer detection, but it’s not the only one. Other methods, like methylation analysis, can also be augmented by deep learning tools.</p>\n<p>“One advantage of deep learning,” Alipour notes, “is that it can deal with unstructured data. If fed the right training data, such an algorithm could spot cancer in other ways, like looking at chemical signatures.”</p>\n<p>As an example, Alipour mentions <a href=\"https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-020-00847-2\">a recent case</a> at New York University Langone Health. A young girl was diagnosed based on tissue pathology with recurrent medulloblastoma, one type of brain cancer. With the help of AI, however, her doctors discovered it was actually another variety: glioblastoma.</p>\n<p>Underscoring the importance of correct diagnosis is that the girl’s cancer may have been the result of radiation used to fight the first cancer. Had she been treated again in the same way, the treatment could have harmed her without actually destroying the new cancer.</p>\n<p>Despite diagnostic breakthroughs in breast cancer, Alipour makes it clear that a universal cancer detection tool is still years away. How we get there, however, is exactly what CureMetrix is doing: starting with the most complex cancer, and building from there.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/11/how-is-ai-changing-medical-imaging/\">How Is AI Changing Medical Imaging?</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 11 Jun 2020 14:00:14 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Rad_Computer_iStock-1130772508_cmTriage.jpg","linkMd5":"62dbf54a8cf7d4fcac7173fd9fefe0cf","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn92@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-27-337_688abec33a9c0216.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Rad_Computer_iStock-1130772508_cmTriage.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1280,"sourceBytes":183417,"destBytes":133778,"author":"Brad Anderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Rad_Computer_iStock-1130772508_cmTriage-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn56@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-18-155_3eff060375f49f6e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195875735},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"How the Tech Revolution Is Reshaping Shipping and Logistics","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171032","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/07/how-the-tech-revolution-is-reshaping-shipping-and-logistics/\" title=\"How the Tech Revolution Is Reshaping Shipping and Logistics\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"199\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-05-at-4.04.23-PM-300x199.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-05-at-4.04.23-PM-300x199.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-05-at-4.04.23-PM-241x160.png 241w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-05-at-4.04.23-PM.png 889w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">People around the globe depend on access to various goods and products, from food and drink to office supplies to lifesaving medical equipment. Amid the global crisis caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, that’s truer than ever. And the shipping and logistics industry </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">is </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/27/can-ai-save-the-supply-chain-from-its-own-destruction/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">responsible for granting that access</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Today, a consumer can order a product from a warehouse thousands of miles away, and it will arrive at his doorstep in a matter of days. That’s all thanks to the warehouse workers, pilots, ship crews, delivery drivers, postal workers, and others who put in the work to deliver each package in good condition (and in record time).</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It’s also thanks to some critical advances in technology. New entrants in the shipping and logistics field are offering </span><a href=\"https://www.dhl.com/content/dam/dhl/global/core/documents/pdf/glo-core-trend-report-artificial-intelligence.pdf\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">applications of artificial intelligence</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, the Internet of Things, and the cloud to help streamline the industry from the local level to the global market.</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Some leaders in the industry may be wary of adopting something new, such as a tracking app or AI software. If a series of spreadsheets gets the job done, why take the risk of buying a new program or product? It might be hard for a full team to adopt, or it could suddenly stop working for 12 hours.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The answer is twofold: Any tech offering worth its salt will include &#8217;round-the-clock support for implementation and maintenance. Worse, companies that don’t join the tech revolution will quickly find their competitors have left them in the dust.</span></p>\n<h2><b>Tech Tools in Action</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Even before the COVID-19 pandemic, technology played a crucial role in transforming shipping and logistics. These three types of tech are adding value across the industry:</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> </span></p>\n<h3><b>1. The Internet of Things</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">What if, instead of requiring micromanagement every step of the way, parts of the supply chain could monitor themselves? That’s what’s possible with the Internet of Things.</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">IoT-connected devices use sensors and programs to complete tasks, track progress, and alert supervisors if they need maintenance. They aren’t intended to fully replace human workers. They&#8217;re intended to augment and streamline the tasks in the supply chain best suited to automation.</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For an example of the IoT in action, one needs look no further than Amazon. In 2012, the company </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/13/is-it-time-to-implement-iot-in-the-warehouse/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">bought Kiva Systems</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, a startup focused on robotics. Since, Amazon has added more than 30,000 automated picking robots to its distribution centers alongside employees. Other types of IoT-enabled automated vehicles, like pallet jacks, are streamlining warehouse operations.</span></p>\n<h3><b>2. Collaboration Software</b><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> </span></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Whether a company operates on land, by air, by sea, or all three, a solid connection across the entire supply chain is critical. In the past, shipping and logistics businesses relied on simple </span><a href=\"https://www.hellenicshippingnews.com/how-will-technology-shape-the-shipping-industry-in-2020/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">paper-based systems</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> that made agility difficult.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">But thanks to the wider availability and reliability of internet-based programs, it’s much easier for companies to add digital platforms to keep everyone on the same page.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Collaboration software Coolfire, for example, </span><a href=\"https://info.coolfiresolutions.com/hubfs/Sales%20+%20Marketing%20Assets/Use%20Cases/Coolfire-Last-Mile-Collaborative-Logistics.pdf\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">enables situational awareness</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> throughout a company’s supply chain by aggregating data from existing systems. It also gathers information from vehicles, IoT-connected devices, sensors, and worker input — whether on the field or in the offices. When a company can view all its data in one picture, it can take proactive measures to ensure smooth operations, rather than reactive ones.</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> </span></p>\n<h3><b>3. Artificial Intelligence</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The shipping and logistics industry has always used data to drive decisions and operations, but the </span><a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/insights-penske/2018/09/04/how-artificial-intelligence-and-machine-learning-are-revolutionizing-logistics-supply-chain-and-transportation/#b88d8158f5dc\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">application of artificial intelligence</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> has made it easier for decision makers to analyze that data, identify patterns and insights, and take action.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">AI allows for </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/15/how-ai-is-revolutionizing-global-logistics-and-supply-chain-management/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">stronger predictions and forecasts</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> using powerful data analysis. It facilitates faster planning and scheduling by factoring in constraints so humans don’t have to. It can even analyze things like traffic and driving patterns to help leaders make decisions that improve public safety.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One company that’s effectively applying AI is TNX Logistics, which uses software to </span><a href=\"https://transmetrics.eu/blog/best-artificial-intelligence-logistics-startups/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">analyze a shipper’s available trucking loads</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> and identify the most effective tendering strategy for those loads. Applying AI in this way helps companies reduce costs and increase efficiency throughout their supply chains.</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When it comes to shipping and logistics, delivering a product to its final destination intact and on time will always be the primary goal. </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While each organization might have a different strategy in place to get from point A to point B, there’s no question that advances in technology will continue to streamline the process.</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Savvy businesses in shipping and logistics would do well to adopt these technologies if they want to remain competitive.</span></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/07/how-the-tech-revolution-is-reshaping-shipping-and-logistics/\">How the Tech Revolution Is Reshaping Shipping and Logistics</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 07 May 2020 07:00:06 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-05-at-4.04.23-PM.png","linkMd5":"8c9daa9833977676113a526908fb6f89","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn99@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-27-187_35e4c5b286da2285.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-05-at-4.04.23-PM.png","destWidth":889,"destHeight":589,"sourceBytes":1178375,"destBytes":108098,"author":"Brad Anderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-05-at-4.04.23-PM-300x199.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn12@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-11-799_57a59550c702e547.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877751},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","title":"Can Artificial Intelligence Replace the Role of Doctors?","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=166813","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/23/can-artificial-intelligence-replace-the-role-of-doctors/\" title=\"Can Artificial Intelligence Replace the Role of Doctors?\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" replace doctor\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Can-Artificial-Intelligence-Replace-the-Role-of-Doctors-1-300x185.png 300w,
