Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology has increased rapidly. Not only does it play a role in the field of entertainment and communication, but the future traces of AI in the area of health and life begin to be seen. In some countries, AI is integrated into sophisticated analytical tools to help doctors in hospitals diagnose cancer and other diseases. But can artificial intelligence replace the role of doctors?</p>\n<h2>Can AI make a significant contribution and push development in the health sector?</h2>\n<p>Through the application, AI automatically helps patients diagnose disease complaints online before visiting the doctor. How you do it The AI algorithm has the function of understanding the disease pattern and deciphering the device data and then reporting the health problems to the patients and private doctors.</p>\n<p>It is expected that in the next five to seven years, the proliferation of new AI technology companies will become an essential element to help medical professionals save lives. AI may be present in the operating room, providing clinical laboratory services to detect sources of disease with a &#8220;force&#8221; that had never existed before.</p>\n<h2><strong>What is the potential of AI in the sector of health worldwide?</strong></h2>\n<p>Global Market Insights research shows that AI market revenues in the US are expected. UU. In the field of medical care exceeding the US $ 4 billion in 2024, this figure has increased by 38% since 2016 to around $ 320 million.</p>\n<p>Research also shows that in the same period, the revenues of the AI market in Europe are projected to reach around $ 3.8 billion. The company&#8217;s global AI market revenue will also exceed $ 10 billion in 2024.</p>\n<h3>The use of AI-controlled robots does not completely replace the role of medical personnel.</h3>\n<p>AI-controlled robots can increase the role of doctors, surgeons, or nurses. In a Forbes report, Brian Kalis, managing director of digital health and innovation at Accenture, said AI would be widely used in US hospitals. Over the next five years. &#8220;AI reduces the complications and errors that can occur during surgery and makes the hospital stay shorter,&#8221; Kalis said.</p>\n<p>His company also estimates that the use of such robots will generate $ 40 billion annually for the US healthcare industry in 2026. &#8220;This will contribute a lot to the projected value,&#8221; he added.</p>\n<p>Interestingly, McKinsey&#8217;s research mentioned that integrating <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/10/improving-responses-to-medical-device-vulnerabilities/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">medical AI devices</a> into the patient care workflow would increase nurse productivity by 30% and 50%.</p>\n<h3>China&#8217;s health sector, including those that are quickly becoming fashionable and wish to adopt AI.</h3>\n<p>A recent Forrester investigation said that up to 20% of significant health industry organizations in China intend to adopt intelligent nursing technology, and 17% will adopt medical robots in the next three years.</p>\n<p>AI technology also contributes to the diagnosis and early detection of the disease. Artificial intelligence can help reveal details of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) and other scanning machines. Researchers at the University of Lehigh in the state of Pennsylvania, USA.</p>\n<p>For example, recently developed AI-based disease detection techniques. These innovations offer greater accuracy and detection efficiency and can be used at a relatively low cost in developing countries with the highest risk of disease.</p>\n<h2><strong>Increased concerns about AI.<br />\n</strong></h2>\n<p><img class=\"wp-image-166811 aligncenter\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Use-of-AI-in-Health-Care-Industry-300x147.png\" alt=\"Use of AI in Health Care Industry\" width=\"816\" height=\"400\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Use-of-AI-in-Health-Care-Industry-300x147.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Use-of-AI-in-Health-Care-Industry-900x440.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Use-of-AI-in-Health-Care-Industry-260x127.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Use-of-AI-in-Health-Care-Industry.png 986w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 816px) 100vw, 816px\" /></p>\n<p>The ability of AI to support various aspects of the health sector becomes a major leap that can produce prevention strategies and treatment approaches that are much more efficient and effective, including reducing the cost of medical care. Even so, some doctors believe that although AI can do a variety of things, AI cannot assume the role of human interaction.</p>\n<p>&#8220;Health and medical care are too human for AI to be treated,&#8221; said Rasu Shrestha, head of the innovation section of the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center and head of the radiology and computer science division.</p>\n<p>According to him, radiology became a specialization that AI would be interrupted for the first time if it was really applied. Will the medical school stop training radiologists later? &#8220;AI algorithms may be diagnostic experts, but AI cannot replace the role of doctors in decision making.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Another concern arises because most doctors do not realize that the use of AI used in clinics has an impact beyond research.</p>\n<h3>The health system needs to find ways to protect patient privacy and protect themselves from liability. What happens if AI is wrong?</h3>\n<p>In addition to the negative support or feeling, in reality, the application of technology in the health sector has not been able to completely replace the role of medical personnel. Hopefully, the development of AI in the health sector can help more people deal with various health problems.</p>\n<h2><strong>Utilization of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the Health Sector</strong></h2>\n<p>In the current era, the role of technology is very important. Technology plays a role and aims to make human work easier and more efficient.<br />\nEven in the health sector, technology plays an important role in minimizing errors caused by human negligence.</p>\n<p>For example, if technology does not play a role in surgical operations performed by doctors, the operation can be dangerous and prone to failure.<br />\nArtificial Intelligence can be interpreted as technology or machine that has intelligence like humans or, in other words, AI is a simulation of artificial intelligence on machines that are programmed to think like humans.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/16/why-5g-technology-will-be-a-game-changer-for-healthcare/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Artificial intelligence technology</a> that we often hear in smartphone camera technology to improve the results of our selfies. But, did we know that this technology is made and also used in many fields? From the fields of economics, education, defense/military, health, etc.</p>\n<h3>In the field of health, AI itself is used in many ways, which is undoubtedly minimizing the occurrence of errors and making things more efficient.</h3>\n<h4>1) Robotic surgery</h4>\n<p>Robots that have been equipped with artificial intelligence technology can analyze someone&#8217;s messy record data before performing the operation. The robot will guide and direct the surgeon during the operation process.</p>\n<p>The use of this robot can also produce new surgical techniques through data from previous operations to accelerate and simplify the operation process.</p>\n<h4>2) Virtual nurse</h4>\n<p>This virtual nurse has been developed by several companies and new companies. An example is Molly, developed by Sense. This virtual nurse serves to help nurses monitor and track the patient&#8217;s condition.</p>\n<h4>3) Creation of new drugs.</h4>\n<p>To develop a medication, you must go through clinical trials that sometimes take a long time and cost a lot. However, an AI-compatible program will make this process faster. AI is used to scan existing medications that can be redesigned to fight disease.<br />\nThe use of the AI program has only found two medications that can reduce Ebola infectivity in just one day.</p>\n<h4>4) Predict early cancer and Back Pain</h4>\n<p>The use of AI to predict cancer patients is to obtain information in a person&#8217;s DNA. AI will perform a body scan to detect cancers and diseases that someone may face based on their genetics.</p>\n<p>AI programmed computer use to deduct lower back pain or Sciatica pain issues and also suggest advice to the patient like usage of <a href=\"https://backpainchairslab.com/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">best office chair for back pain</a>, take a massage, exercises and Yoga tips.</p>\n<h4>5) Health monitoring</h4>\n<p>Health monitoring with AI technology can be seen in the technology applied to Smartwatch, where this smartwatch can monitor the heart rate and activity level of the user. A smartwatch can record user habits information that can be a source of data for doctors if the user is sick.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/23/can-artificial-intelligence-replace-the-role-of-doctors/\">Can Artificial Intelligence Replace the Role of Doctors?</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 23 Mar 2020 18:00:18 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Can-Artificial-Intelligence-Replace-the-Role-of-Doctors-1.png","linkMd5":"621b63eeff7adeebaf484b3d35408986","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn11@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-09-659_de80820ea00bace7.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Can-Artificial-Intelligence-Replace-the-Role-of-Doctors-1.png","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":602775,"destBytes":42084,"author":"Julia Smith","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Can-Artificial-Intelligence-Replace-the-Role-of-Doctors-1-300x185.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn3@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-11-706_e2f8cdc7f825a20d.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Use-of-AI-in-Health-Care-Industry-300x147.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn90@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-09-570_153496c31f42b9e0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195880425},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"5 Healthcare Tech Trends Worth Keeping an Eye On","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170060","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/16/5-healthcare-tech-trends-worth-keeping-an-eye-on/\" title=\"5 Healthcare Tech Trends Worth Keeping an Eye On\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Healthcare-Tech-Trends-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"5 Healthcare Tech Trends Worth Keeping an Eye On\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Healthcare-Tech-Trends-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Healthcare-Tech-Trends-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Healthcare-Tech-Trends.jpg 747w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>The healthcare industry is experiencing rapid shifts. Some of this is due to the current pandemic, but much of this evolution was happening even before the COVID-19 outbreak. Understanding and embracing the introduction of new technology into the market will be important for healthcare professionals and patients alike.</p>\n<p>Here are some of the trends worth keeping tabs on:</p>\n<h3>1. Telemedicine</h3>\n<p>If you want to talk about major evolution and change within the U.S. healthcare system, look no further than <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/29/3-ways-video-technology-can-improve-patient-safety-in-healthcare/\">telemedicine</a> (also known as telehealth).</p>\n<p>In a country as large and spread out as the U.S., telemedicine – or the practice of doctors meeting virtually with patients – is highly attractive and mutually beneficial. This is especially true from a cost perspective. Telemedicine lowers the cost of care for both patients and doctors by eliminating many of the physical barriers that take time and deplete resources. It’s also a much more efficient way of meeting – eliminating the commuting aspect and preventing wasted time in waiting rooms and lobbies.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.gminsights.com/industry-analysis/telemedicine-market\">According to one recent report</a>, the global telemedicine market is expected to expand from its current size of $45 billion to $175.5 billion by as soon as 2026. That represents a robust compound annual growth rate of 19.3 percent. The growth drivers will include:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Rising cases of COVID-19 and anticipation of similar future events</li>\n<li>Increased prevalence of chronic diseases in an aging population</li>\n<li>Growing number of smartphone users and internet-connected households</li>\n<li>Major technological advances in relation to mobile phones and internet (like 5G)</li>\n<li>Serious need for cost-savings in an expensive healthcare environment</li>\n<li>Long waiting times in hospitals for disease treatment</li>\n<li>Advantageous government initiatives</li>\n</ul>\n<p>There are also some challenges and risk factors moving forward. In the United States, the biggest concern has to do with cyber security and privacy – particularly when it comes to sensitive patient data (which is carefully regulated under HIPAA rules).</p>\n<p>Regulatory issues and compliance requirements – both on a macro scale (government) and a micro scale (healthcare industry) – will create issues moving forward. But once the red tape is dealt with, growth and adoption will skyrocket.</p>\n<h3>2. The Internet of Medical Things</h3>\n<p><a href=\"https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/Deloitte/global/Documents/Life-Sciences-Health-Care/gx-lshc-medtech-iomt-brochure.pdf\">According to Deloitte</a>, medical technology companies manufacture more than 500,000 different types of medical devices. This includes wearable external medical devices (like insulin pumps and skin patches), implanted devices (such as pacemakers), and stationary medical devices (like scanning machines). And almost every interaction a patient has with a healthcare provider or system involves the use of one of these devices or pieces of equipment.</p>\n<p>At the same time, the healthcare industry is becoming increasingly connected (in a digital sense). Cloud computing, big data, wireless technology, and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) are all working together to transmit, store, and interpret data.</p>\n<p>What happens when you combine telemedicine with the internet of things (IoT)? Well, you get the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/10/can-artificial-intelligence-humanize-patient-care/\">Internet of Medical Things</a> (IoMT), of course!</p>\n<p>“The IoMT brings together the digital and physical worlds to improve the speed and accuracy of diagnosis and treatments, and monitor and modify patient behaviour and health status in real time,” Deloitte explains. “It also improves health care organizations’ operational productivity and effectiveness by streamlining clinical processes, information and work flows.”</p>\n<p>The IoMT market was valued at roughly $41.2 billion in 2017 and is expected to balloon to $158.1 billion by 2022. (The connected medical devices portion of the market – which is responsible for diagnosing, monitoring, and treating patients – will account for $52.2 billion of the market.)</p>\n<p>Most healthcare organizations in the United States are already using IoMT technology in some capacity. The growth will occur from increased use and greater reliance on these devices and platforms over the next 24 to 30 months.</p>\n<h3>3. Low-Level Light Therapy</h3>\n<p>Now that we’ve addressed a couple of the major sweeping trends in the industry, let’s explore some of the smaller healthcare tech trends that are occurring within specific niches and industries.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://kiierr.com/how-it-works/\">Low-level light therapy (LLLT)</a> is the first micro trend we want to discuss. It’s one of the most promising developments in the premature hair loss space (which impacts tens of millions of men <em>and</em> women on an annual basis).</p>\n<p>LLLT, which is backed by years of research and several authoritative scientific studies, can be administered in a number of ways. One of the most common and convenient methods is through the use of a laser hair cap (which looks a lot like a standard baseball cap).</p>\n<p>LLLT caps work by improving cellular respiration and stimulating hair follicle growth through the use of safe low-level lasers that are known to produce thicker and healthier hair. Until recently, the technology could only be administered in a physician’s office. But with advances in safety and the practicality of new laser caps, people are now able to perform regular sessions (usually 30 minutes) from the comfort of their own homes.</p>\n<p>Considering that <a href=\"https://www.americanhairloss.org/men_hair_loss/introduction.html\">two-thirds of American men</a> will experience some degree of hair loss by the age of 35 (and 85 percent by age 50), health-tech like LLLT is extremely important and relevant.</p>\n<h3>4. Wearable Health Devices</h3>\n<p>There’s a massive surge in the number of patients who want to be able to monitor their own health on a day-to-day basis. This swelling rise is coupled with an increased familiarity and willingness to use mobile devices and technology that track information and data. The result is rampant demand for wearable health devices, which health-tech companies are using as a license to innovate and manufacture new lines of products.</p>\n<p>The wearable health market has grown significantly over the last couple of years and is a welcome trend for patients, doctors, insurers, and everyone else in between. Common devices include wearable fitness trackers, smart health watches, wearable blood pressure monitors, wearable ECG monitors, and even biosensors.</p>\n<p>This latter product category is especially interesting. It includes things like the self-adhesive trackers – such as the Philips wearable biosensor.</p>\n<p>“Research from Augusta University Medical Center showed that this wearable device registered an 89% reduction in patient deterioration into preventable cardiac or respiratory arrest,” <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/wearable-technology-healthcare-medical-devices\">BusinessInsider mentions</a>. “This demonstrates the ability wearables have to improve patient outcomes and possibly reduce staff workload.”</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.marketsandmarkets.com/PressReleases/biosensors.asp\">According to one industry forecast</a>, the biosensor market is expected to grow from $21.2 billion in 2019 to $31.5 billion by 2024. That amounts to a compound annual growth rate of 8.3 percent.</p>\n<h3>5. Augmented Reality</h3>\n<p>Currently valued around $850 million, the global market for virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR) in the healthcare space is expected to scale up to somewhere north of <a href=\"https://healthtechmagazine.net/article/2019/09/how-augmented-reality-improving-patient-care\">$5.1 billion by as early as 2025</a>.</p>\n<p>While AR can be <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/03/19/augmented-reality-technology-nuts-bolts/\">used in any number of ways</a>, one of the primary healthcare applications will occur in operating rooms and doctor training/education.</p>\n<p>Depth perception is something that’s very challenging in certain procedures, yet paramount to achieving successful outcomes. When blood vessels and nerves are in close proximity to one another, being able to have precise and accurate assessment of depth becomes critical. New technology is addressing this.</p>\n<p>The <a href=\"https://mbrc.umd.edu\">Maryland Blended Reality Center</a> is one of the leaders behind this charge. They’re currently in the development stages of an AR application that overlays computer images over the doctor’s view of the real world to help guide catheters into patients’ brains to relieve pressure after injuries. With the use of this technology, doctors can perform procedures like this within 0.5 millimeters of accuracy.</p>\n<p>As the underlying technology improves, healthcare experts anticipate seeing even more revolutionary technology emerge. The next two or three years will be incredibly important for innovation in this sector of the health-tech market.</p>\n<h3>A Brave New Medical World</h3>\n<p>The innovation that’s happening in and around the healthcare industry is both unprecedented and astonishing. While this is an industry that’s always been characterized by innovation, the speed of iteration is blistering. As a healthcare professional, techpreneur, or trendsetter, these are exciting times.</p>\n<p>Stay tuned in – as always, don’t be afraid to pivot, shift, or evolve along with the technology.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/16/5-healthcare-tech-trends-worth-keeping-an-eye-on/\">5 Healthcare Tech Trends Worth Keeping an Eye On</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 16 Apr 2020 10:23:49 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Healthcare-Tech-Trends.jpg","linkMd5":"4c62d662c59903f0b1c641a9231be3df","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn20@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-23-969_465c8c5c6b43bc76.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Healthcare-Tech-Trends.jpg","destWidth":747,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":54344,"destBytes":23420,"author":"Frank Landman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Healthcare-Tech-Trends-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn16@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-15-723_6b7324298fb1c02e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878266},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","title":"7 Tools That Support Remote Team Collaboration and Communication","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=175637","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/08/7-tools-that-support-remote-team-collaboration-and-communication/\" title=\"7 Tools That Support Remote Team Collaboration and Communication\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tools-to-support-remote-team-collaboration-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"7 Tools That Support Remote Team Collaboration and Communication\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tools-to-support-remote-team-collaboration-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tools-to-support-remote-team-collaboration-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tools-to-support-remote-team-collaboration.jpg 747w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Collaborating with a remote team is challenging, but the right tools and strategies can streamline the communication process.</p>\n<p>The two main challenges facing remote teams are major time zone differences and lack of in-person collaboration. Online collaboration is effective, but time zone differences make it hard to connect in real-time.</p>\n<p>For instance, when a team member in India needs to connect with a team member in the United States, there’s a time difference of nearly 12 hours (give or take, depending on specific time zones). For these two team members to connect, one will need to get up extra early and the other will need to stay up late.</p>\n<p>The other big challenge with large differences in time zones is that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/14/how-to-ensure-high-productivity-of-your-remote-workers/\">productivity</a> will always lag behind by 12 to 24 hours. This lag time makes it difficult to meet strict client deadlines and can put projects behind schedule.</p>\n<p>If your organization has a remote team, whether your employees are spread out across the states or the world, the following tools will help you maintain efficient <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2009/04/15/the-online-collaboration-tools-guide/\">online collaboration and communication</a> to ensure you deliver on time.</p>\n<h3>1. A company intranet</h3>\n<p>A company intranet is like a private internet for your entire team that can only be accessed by your team members. It can be implemented locally in the office with your own set of servers and networking equipment, or it can be hosted in the cloud.</p>\n<p>With an intranet hosted in the cloud, your team can access it from anywhere and you avoid maintenance and upgrade fees. If your team is 100% remote and you don’t have an office, your intranet will need to be hosted in the cloud.</p>\n<p>According to Happeo, <a href=\"https://www.happeo.com/guide-for-managing-remote-teams-happeo\">cloud collaboration makes remote teams successful</a> through tools like video conferencing applications, intranets, and document repositories. A company intranet can provide easy access to all of a team’s collaboration tools.</p>\n<h3>Intranet security</h3>\n<p>The privacy and security of an intranet is unparalleled even by the most highly secured software application you can install on your company website. For instance, installing proprietary collaboration software on a subdomain on your company’s website isn’t as secure as you think. Even when your team members use secure login credentials, your web server could get hacked on the back-end, compromising your sensitive data.</p>\n<p>On the other hand, a hosted intranet is separate from your company website. With a reputable service provider, the servers used to host your company intranet are locked down with the tightest security. When you intranet isn’t hosted on your website’s domain name, hackers won’t know where to look for it.</p>\n<h3>2. A navigable, online self-help portal</h3>\n<p>An online self-help portal will make your employees self-sufficient and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/30/3-ways-you-can-empower-your-remote-employees/\">empower your team</a> to find answers on their own. Usually, a self-help portal is hosted on a company intranet.</p>\n<h3>What information does a self-help portal contain?</h3>\n<p>A self-help portal can contain an infinite amount of knowledge regarding company policies and procedures, and even links to files. Essentially, any kind of information your employees might need, including answers to questions customers might ask, should be housed in a self-help portal.</p>\n<p>Employees can use a self-help portal to immediately look up answers to questions posed by clients, customers, and other team members. This accessibility reduces the amount of time it would take to contact a manager or supervisor to find the answer.</p>\n<p>A self-help portal can be created by using FAQ software or by hiring a development company to create a proprietary application just for your team. Either way, it works just like a website with a main menu, links for navigation, and a search function.</p>\n<p>The key to using an online self-help portal is to make it user-friendly and continually update and add to the information as processes change and your company evolves.</p>\n<h3>3. A well-designed training program</h3>\n<p>Every remote team is supported by a well-designed training program. How you onboard your remote employees matters, and how they’re trained will set the tone for how they’ll perform.</p>\n<p>Well-trained team members communicate and collaborate more efficiently than team members who work according to their own standards. It’s important to create a training program that can be implemented consistently by any and all of your trainers.</p>\n<p>With remote teams, it’s especially important to train your team over an extended period of time rather than give them a manual to read and call it a day. Training manuals serve a purpose, but they shouldn’t take the place of actual training.</p>\n<p>How you train your remote team depends on your industry. For instance, if you’re a marketing firm, your training program should include <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/05/how-to-tactfully-communicate-tough-feedback-to-remote-workers/\">providing constructive feedback</a> after each client interaction, after work is submitted, and throughout the entire process for at least one full project. This will give your team the feedback they need to align with company standards every step of the way.</p>\n<h3>4. A unified task management platform</h3>\n<p>Nothing disrupts remote teams like having tasks managed in multiple applications. This can be a tricky situation to get a grip on because all of your remote employees will probably have preferences for the software they like to use for managing tasks. To maintain good collaboration, you’ll need to require all team members to use the same application.</p>\n<p>You might have a task management application that you prefer, but stay open to using other platforms recommended by your team. They might know about a platform that is superior to what you’ve always used.</p>\n<h3>5. Communications training</h3>\n<p>Ongoing communications training is one of the best ways to keep a remote team on track and should be an irreplaceable part of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/29/how-to-prepare-for-a-future-of-remote-teams/\">your company’s communication strategy</a>. Everyone talks about great communication, but few can demonstrate what that looks like. For instance, communication is more than sharing information with another team member. Communication skills involve knowing how and when to deliver a message along with being able to have a productive dialogue with others, especially when there’s a disagreement.</p>\n<p>Traditionally, organizations have sent employees to weekend communications training programs, but today it’s easy to take those same courses online. Find an organization that specializes in teaching communication for team collaboration and start requiring your remote employees to complete the courses of your choice.</p>\n<h3>6. Top-of-the-line computers</h3>\n<p>It’s difficult to work in the tech industry on older computers running deprecated browser versions because the machine can’t handle an operating system upgrade. Sure, you can find laptops on eBay for a couple hundred bucks, but you’re not doing your company any favors that way.</p>\n<p>If your remote employees depend on current technology to get the job done, buy them the right equipment. You don’t need to spend $5,000 per person on new MacBook Pros, but you do need to consider a person’s work before buying them a machine.</p>\n<h3>7. World clock applications</h3>\n<p>The simplicity of a world clock application can’t be underestimated. Your remote team needs to know what time it is around the world where other team members and clients are located. This will help keep them on track to deliver tasks on time. For example, if someone from India sets a deadline for Tuesday, a team member in the U.S. can submit the task on Tuesday and yet it’s already Wednesday in India.</p>\n<p>World clocks with a little forethought will help team members across different time zones set and meet deadlines smoothly.</p>\n<h3>Remote collaboration can be exceptionally efficient</h3>\n<p>Despite team members living in different parts of the world, remote collaboration can be exceptionally efficient &#8211; even more efficient than an in-house team.</p>\n<p>The problem in-house teams face most is wasted time. It’s a drag having to get ready for work, commute to the office, and then sit at a desk all day. Remote teams are surprisingly more efficient because the freedom helps team members tailor their work to a schedule that works best for their lifestyle. Without the commute, they have more time and energy to devote to getting the job done.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/08/7-tools-that-support-remote-team-collaboration-and-communication/\">7 Tools That Support Remote Team Collaboration and Communication</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 08 Aug 2020 13:14:31 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tools-to-support-remote-team-collaboration.jpg","linkMd5":"6cca2e25cb4b8a425a82237f9ee05705","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn3@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-26-192_450372f0b1fae9ed.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tools-to-support-remote-team-collaboration.jpg","destWidth":747,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":67465,"destBytes":34020,"author":"Frank Landman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Tools-to-support-remote-team-collaboration-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn32@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-28-217_f21be61b7bc28891.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195870806},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"This Real Estate Brokerage is Changing Its Industry. Here’s What Your Business Can Learn from It","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171156","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/07/this-real-estate-brokerage-is-changing-its-industry-heres-what-your-business-can-learn-from-it/\" title=\"This Real Estate Brokerage is Changing Its Industry. Here’s What Your Business Can Learn from It\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"225\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/real-estate-blockchain-300x225.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/real-estate-blockchain-300x225.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/real-estate-blockchain-900x675.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/real-estate-blockchain-213x160.jpg 213w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/real-estate-blockchain-1536x1152.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/real-estate-blockchain.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>COVID-19 is creating unprecedented challenges. But as with other global crises throughout human history, coronavirus has also become a catalyst for <a href=\"https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/opinion/good-news-coronavirus-is-causing-an-innovation-renaissance\">incredible innovation.</a> The innovations range from the simple (like a <a href=\"https://twitter.com/reuters/status/1248191423288971265\">hook</a> for no-touch door opening,) to the high tech (like AI facial scans to quickly <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/hospitals-tap-ai-to-help-manage-coronavirus-outbreak-11584696601\">detect fevers</a> in hospital patients.)</p>\n<p>But innovation shines brightest when an <em>entire industry</em> has been disrupted. For example, the supermarket and <a href=\"https://www.foodlogistics.com/transportation/press-release/21125307/online-grocery-shopping-surges-to-record-levels-in-us-during-covid19-crisis\">grocery store</a> industry is turning to online sales and delivery apps. The <a href=\"https://www.industryweek.com/talent/media-gallery/21126580/manufacturing-stepping-up-to-help-during-covid19\">manufacturing</a> industry is refocusing its priorities and creating products to assist the coronavirus battle. And the shift from working at an office to working from home (WFH) is throwing the <a href=\"https://www.vox.com/2020/4/7/21209605/solow-paradox-coronavirus-technology\">tech</a> industry into a new spotlight.</p>\n<p>As many industries around the world are boldly adapting right before our eyes, another industry has been advancing behind the scenes. I’m talking about the <em>real-estate brokerage </em>industry, and China is leading the innovation.</p>\n<h3><strong>Introducing the Concept of New Living</strong></h3>\n<p>The last industry you’d expect to thrive during the current pandemic is Housing and Real Estate. But the Chinese startup called <a href=\"https://bj.ke.com/\">Beike</a>, a new generation real estate broker marketplace, is changing how real-estate brokerage is done.</p>\n<p>The concept of New Living is the phenomenon of completing the entire home-buying process online – from “virtual touring” of the property, to signing all necessary documentation. No one needs to meet in person. Not the property owner, the buyer, or the real estate agent.</p>\n<p><strong><em>Lesson – </em></strong><em>Can you think of new ways to meaningfully connect different parties (i.e., your offline network,) while eliminating the need for them to meet in-person?</em></p>\n<h2><strong>The Entire Operation Process Completed Online</strong></h2>\n<p>Here’s Beike’s process for innovating the industry shift into New Living:</p>\n<p><strong>Virtual Property Tours:</strong> Beike uses <a href=\"https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/story/2020-04-27/coronavirus-vr-virtual-reality-games-art-theater\">VR technology</a> to capture any of their properties in 3D and let home buyers tour the property using their smartphone. In fact, Beike has currently made a staggering 4 million homes available to tour via VR.</p>\n<p>How does a VR tour work? A potential homebuyer can virtually tour a property at any time, and the property’s broker can also be linked into the VR tour for real-time interaction with the buyer. This VR experience is almost like being at the real-life location, but without traveling to the property or breaking a quarantine order.</p>\n<p><strong><em>Lesson – </em></strong><em>In what ways are you effectively leveraging available technology like AI, VR or AR to provide value and disrupt your industry?<br />\n</em></p>\n<p><strong>Sign House Renting Contracts Online: </strong>Tenants can use an app to sign rental contracts online. The contract’s terms are simplified and clearly understandable. These online contracts have the same legal force as a traditional paper contract, and the tenant’s legal rights are protected as always.</p>\n<p><strong>Sign Resold House Transactions Online: </strong>An online closed loop of resold house contract signing eliminates the need for all three parties to sign physical copies several times. Each party signs once and a significant amount of time is saved.</p>\n<p><strong>Sign Loan Contracts Online: </strong>The traditional face-to-face model of signing loan contracts is digitized. This includes the interview, information collection and filling, printing photocopies and material signing.</p>\n<p><strong>Fund Custody (or Third-Party Custody): </strong>Fund custody is the client’s house-purchase fund, which is deposited in a third-party fund. When the transaction is complete, the fund will be unfrozen to the owner’s account. If the transaction fails, the fund will be returned to the client. This process avoids risks such as selling a house to more than one buyer.</p>\n<h3><strong>Vast Real Estate Database Live</strong></h3>\n<p><strong>Vast Real Estate Database:</strong> Beike was designed on the real-estate brokerage platform Lianjia. This is beneficial because throughout Lianjia’s many years of operation, the platform established a Real Estate Data Standard (REDS) of more than 219 million homes in over 330 cities. There are about 2.7 million housing resources currently in sale, and 13 thousand housing resources are added every day. All this data has established the foundation for Beike’s marketplace.</p>\n<p>Now that the Real Estate Data Standard is upgraded to the Real Estate Data Standard <em>Live,</em> China’s biggest real estate database is activated as a <em>dynamic</em> database.  Beike can now conduct real-time monitoring on how many housing resources are being searched, consulted, and visited by VR and offline as well. Real Estate Data Standard Live will also enable users to see the last transaction on a property, the last visit, how many times it has been visited, and whether or not it’s for sale.</p>\n<p><strong><em>Lesson – </em></strong><em>In what ways are you leveraging big data to provide valuable insights to clients? If you can turn data into trustworthy information that’s easy to use and understand, you’ll gain a competitive edge.</em></p>\n<h2><strong>The Business Model That’s Making It All Possible</strong></h2>\n<p>No study of an industry disrupter would be complete without looking at its business model. Beike’s is complex yet innovative.</p>\n<p>With this matching functionality, the right home choices start to become clear to overwhelmed home buyers. Brokers are also provided with the right leads who are excellent matches for their properties. For such a platform to work effectively, trust must be created – trust in the information, and trust in the other parties using the platform. Beike has earned this trust.</p>\n<p><strong><em>Lesson – </em></strong><em>Even if you have the right tech in place for your business or platform, have you built trust with your users? Trust takes time to build. Don’t rush, and don’t be discouraged.</em></p>\n<p><strong>An Open Platform: </strong>The platform consists of brokers, homeowners and buyers. Such an open ecosystem creates diversity and superior service.</p>\n<p><strong>Win-Win Cooperation: </strong>In a large network that connects every agent together, the agents are sure to find houses that fit the needs of all their customers. With all agents cooperating together and operating in a commission-sharing mechanism, a win-win situation is created.</p>\n<p><strong>A Final Lesson</strong></p>\n<p>One final lesson can be gleaned from Beike’s story of industry innovation. Don’t hold to the old belief that the best innovation is <a href=\"https://www.technologyreview.com/2020/04/25/1000563/covid-19-has-killed-the-myth-of-silicon-valley-innovation/\">coming from Silicon Valley,</a> or even from the US. In many ways, Silicon Valley is dropping the ball of innovation. China is often seen picking up this ball, as <a href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2020/01/why-silicon-valley-and-big-tech-dont-innovate-anymore/604969/\">was expressed</a> by former Google CEO Eric Schmidt:</p>\n<p><em>“Chinese companies are growing faster, they have higher valuations, and they have more users than their non-Chinese counterparts. It’s very important to understand that there is a global competition around technology innovation, and China is a significant player and likely to remain so.”</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/07/this-real-estate-brokerage-is-changing-its-industry-heres-what-your-business-can-learn-from-it/\">This Real Estate Brokerage is Changing Its Industry. Here’s What Your Business Can Learn from It</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 07 May 2020 13:20:55 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/real-estate-blockchain.jpg","linkMd5":"b7fe3a79bc53168f0cc0420281b31662","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn36@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-26-785_4a77557150258581.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/real-estate-blockchain.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1440,"sourceBytes":276325,"destBytes":299320,"author":"Brad Anderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/real-estate-blockchain-300x225.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn100@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-23-871_e9d79d12d7382079.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877658},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","title":"The Untapped Opportunities in Real Estate Automation","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173335","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/10/the-untapped-opportunities-in-real-estate-automation/\" title=\"The Untapped Opportunities in Real Estate Automation\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Untapped-Opportunities-in-Real-Estate-Automation-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Untapped-Opportunities-in-Real-Estate-Automation-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Untapped-Opportunities-in-Real-Estate-Automation-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Untapped-Opportunities-in-Real-Estate-Automation.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Real estate technology, or proptech, is one of the industries that has produced the <a href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/11/14/where-top-vcs-are-investing-in-real-estate-and-proptech-part-2-of-2/\">most unicorns</a> in the last few years. Historically, however, the real estate industry has been among the <a href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/11/14/where-top-vcs-are-investing-in-real-estate-and-proptech-part-2-of-2/\">lowest</a> spenders by sector on technology. Despite being slow to adopt new technologies, real estate contributes <a href=\"https://www.worldatlas.com/articles/which-are-the-biggest-industries-in-the-united-states.html\">13%</a> of US GDP, making it the country’s largest industry.</p>\n<p>Such a large sector represents a huge market ripe for technological disruption, especially in the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/05/real-estate-tech-that-will-endure-in-a-post-covid-world/\">post-Covid-19 world</a>.</p>\n<h2><strong>How automation can improve the real estate process </strong></h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/02/the-challenges-and-opportunities-for-automation-in-the-real-estate-industry/\">Automated real estate</a> transactions will soon be the norm. By digitizing documents and paper trails, technology improves information security for both consumers and agents. Processing payments digitally also increase transaction security and speed.</p>\n<p>Many automated tools help reduce busywork for agents, freeing up their time to focus on tasks that require a personal touch, like building client relationships.</p>\n<p>Automation can also help agents maintain consistent timelines and messaging. The expanded capacity to collect and analyze data allows agents to create informed strategies and concrete measures of success.</p>\n<p>As a whole, automation saves agents time and generates more opportunities by scaling their efforts. This, in turn, creates more opportunities and increases revenue.</p>\n<h3><strong>Over the last few years, the real estate industry has begun to prioritize technology.</strong></h3>\n<p>With the addition of technology &#8211;large real estate corporations have hired CIOs and created technology budgets, and most agents recognize the importance of tech for remaining competitive. The consumer research experience has already been transformed, and 44% (nar.realtor) of buyers now begin searching for homes online.</p>\n<p>The rest of the buying and selling process, however, can also be improved through technology that automates previously manual procedures.</p>\n<h3><strong>Marketing</strong></h3>\n<p>The automated marketing tools market was valued at $3.3 billion in 2019 and is expected to nearly double by 2024. While agents can use much of the automated marketing technology that already exists, there is also a demand for marketing technology specifically adapted to real estate needs.</p>\n<p>These real estate-focused tools help agents expand their reach and gain insight into their client base. For example, some real estate-focused tools generate targeted video and ad campaigns based on agency listings. Other marketing tools help agents create and manage social media campaigns across different platforms, automatically scheduling and publishing social media posts. Some even suggest existing relevant real estate content that agents can repost on their channels or use as inspiration.</p>\n<p>Data analytic tools also help agents track content views and types of engagement. Based on that data, the software compares content performance, helping agents determine what marketing tactics are working best.</p>\n<h3><strong>Lead Generation</strong></h3>\n<p>Automation tools can also help agents generate more high-quality leads. <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/21/prodigious-customer-service-live-chat-vs-chatbots/\">Chatbots,</a> for example, allow agents to engage with potential clients through their website at any time of day. The chatbots provide information that moves the lead down the pipeline, so they are better informed when they speak with the agent.</p>\n<p>CRMs designed for agents sync with real estate search platforms and agency social media profiles to gather leads across channels. Then, activity tracking tools monitor and sync potential client activity.</p>\n<p>Using this information, agents can adjust their outreach strategy for those potential clients. For some, an automated follow-up sequence triggered by specific activities can be activated. Meanwhile, other higher-quality leads might require more personal attention.</p>\n<p>Lead scoring tools help agents <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/10/a-startup-guide-to-creating-an-ideal-customer-profile/\">determine which leads they should prioritize </a>for personalized outreach. In tracking lead activity and source, these tools also show where the best quality leads are coming from, which helps inform marketing strategy.</p>\n<p>For agencies with multiple agents, lead routing software can automatically assign leads to agents based on geographic location. By streamlining and improving the lead generation process, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/06/where-will-ai-take-the-real-estate-market-in-10-years/\">these technologies</a> increase lead opportunities and reduce the time it takes to turn a lead into a customer.</p>\n<h3><strong>Agents&#8217; everyday workflows </strong></h3>\n<p>In addition to expanding the lead pipeline, automation can help agents manage their everyday workflow. Agents are constantly juggling many clients at <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/11/how-do-you-create-an-effective-journey-map-for-your-customers/\">different points in their customer journey</a>, and automatically generated task lists can help agents track and sync their activities for each client by stage. Tasks can be assigned deadlines with automatic reminders to keep agents on schedule.</p>\n<p><a href=\"http://calendar.com\">Calendar automation simplifies scheduling</a> with clients, allowing agents to set windows for types of appointments and block off times for inspections and showings. Thanks to calendar updates in real-time, clients can find an available time that works with their schedule, avoiding the back and forth that manual scheduling entails.</p>\n<p>For agencies with multiple agents, automation tools sync any updated information or documents, keeping everyone on the same page, and increasing transparency. Agent activity can also be tracked and evaluated to determine performance across the team.</p>\n<h3><strong>Transaction process </strong></h3>\n<p>The transaction process to close deals with clients can also benefit from automation technology. For most agents, this process is currently complex, slow, and mostly analog. For the real estate sector alone, technology for managing the transaction process has been valued as a potentially <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/nataliakarayaneva/2019/12/02/automation-in-real-estate-became-a-100-billion-opportunity-who-will-be-disrupted/#5b60388a1eb3\">$100 billion</a> opportunity. As a result, fintech solutions are on the rise, with the adoption of fintech <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbesfinancecouncil/2020/04/02/three-factors-driving-the-rise-of-fintech-and-what-the-banking-industry-can-learn-from-them/#3ea360f96d76\">quadrupling</a> from 2015 to 2019.</p>\n<h4>The transaction process involves many steps, each with the potential for improvement through automation. E-signature and e-notarization technology would speed up the signing procedures and increase process transparency. Digitized paperwork facilitates smart contracts, giving all the involved parties access to the most updated version of the agreement and prevents tampering.</h4>\n<h4><strong>Digital money transfers also offer a more secure option for agents and clients. </strong></h4>\n<p>After a money transfer is made, blockchain technology could automate the digital paperwork update for a faster and smoother ownership transfer. Using technology,<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/04/getting-high-returns-on-real-estate-investment/\"> agents can improve the customer experience</a> by providing an easier, quicker transaction process, which results both in satisfied customers and efficient agents.</p>\n<h2><strong>A turning point for the real estate industry</strong></h2>\n<p>Due to Covid-19, many agents have turned to new technology to continue working. This period will likely be a turning point, marking the start of large-scale adoption of real estate technology throughout the sector. With the market potential, and numerous opportunities to improve security, efficiency, and consistency, proptech will be an industry to keep an eye on.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Pixabay</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/10/the-untapped-opportunities-in-real-estate-automation/\">The Untapped Opportunities in Real Estate Automation</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 10 Jul 2020 17:53:13 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Untapped-Opportunities-in-Real-Estate-Automation.jpg","linkMd5":"b2ffa9ea99dcfa959aa430d74f1c65de","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn3@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-27-090_c55f272b5a237461.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Untapped-Opportunities-in-Real-Estate-Automation.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":18955,"destBytes":10532,"author":"Adrian Fisher","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Untapped-Opportunities-in-Real-Estate-Automation-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn51@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-15-152_02d41325ad4f0bec.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195874075},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:59","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:59","title":"26 Top Virtual Keynote Speakers","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169088","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/29/top-virtual-keynote-speakers/\" title=\"26 Top Virtual Keynote Speakers\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"214\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Virtual-Keynote-Speakers-300x214.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"Top Virtual Keynote Speakers\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Virtual-Keynote-Speakers-300x214.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Virtual-Keynote-Speakers-1536x1097.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Virtual-Keynote-Speakers.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>With the world on lockdown due to the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak, conferences and workshops are being cancelled or postponed until further notice. If you were organizing an event for your company and don’t know how to continue, contact a virtual keynote speaker.</p>\n<p>With modern technology, video conference calls are easy to set up and can be done remotely if necessary, with all of the same benefits. This means you can now make your conference or workshop with a virtual experience for your audience. There are many keynote speakers who are already accustomed to this channel, often participating in webinars, Facebook Live events, podcasts, and YouTube presentations.</p>\n<p>This article will provide you with the top 26 virtual speakers and what distinguishes them from other speakers. You can also learn about what to look for in a virtual speaker as well as discover how to create a successful online conference or workshop.</p>\n<h2>Best Virtual Speaker Overview</h2>\n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://johnhallspeaking.com/\"><strong>John Hall</strong></a></h4>\n<p>Best personable virtual speaker with timely topics on trust and relationship building.</p>\n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.briansolis.com/\">Brian Solis</a></h4>\n<p>Best seasoned virtual speaker and author as well as in-demand data analyst.</p>\n<h4><strong>3. <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/lenarequist/\">Lena Requist</a></strong></h4>\n<p>Best motivating virtual speaker for startup audiences and enterprises.</p>\n<h4>4. <a href=\"https://www.erikhuberman.com/\">Erik Huberman</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for engaging stories.</p>\n<h4>5. <a href=\"https://www.roryvaden.com/best-leadership-speaker\">Rory Vaden</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker with track record of speaking awards.</p>\n<h4>6. <a href=\"https://www.traceygrace.com/\">Tracey Grace</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for workplace diversity and training.</p>\n<h4>7. <a href=\"http://www.andrewpaulthomas.com/\">Andrew Thomas</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for empowerment and startup launch strategies.</p>\n<h4>8. <a href=\"https://www.chrispdyer.com/speaking/\">Chris Dyer</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker with their own podcast.</p>\n<h4>9. <a href=\"https://www.nirandfar.com/\">Nir Eyal</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for learning about attention management and productivity.</p>\n<h4>10. <a href=\"https://frontrowfactor.com/\">Jon Vroman</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker with a nonprofit background.</p>\n<h4>11. <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/schembra/\">Chris Schembra</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for a passionate delivery about people and relationships.</p>\n<h4>12. <a href=\"https://www.robertglazer.com/\">Bob Glazer</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for small business success and recognition.</p>\n<h4>13. <a href=\"https://www.elischwartz.co/\">Eli Schwartz</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker on transition from paid channels to organic growth.</p>\n<h4>14. <a href=\"https://www.brittanyhodak.com/\">Brittany Hodak</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for topics focused on customer loyalty and brand advocates.</p>\n<h4>15. <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeffrey-winters-ba290611\">Jeff Winters</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for virtual sales conferences and topics about lead generation.</p>\n<h4>16. <a href=\"https://tiffanibova.com/\">Tiffani Bova</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for global conference and industry expertise.</p>\n<h4>17. <a href=\"https://jonathankeyser.com/\">Jonathan Keyser</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for motivational success across commercial real estate and the general business environment.</p>\n<h4>18. <a href=\"https://ashleighdilello.com/\">Ashleigh Dilello</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker with an intriguing background as a chronic illness survivor, professional dancer, and innovative health specialist.</p>\n<h4>19. <a href=\"https://johnruhlin.com/\">John Ruhlin</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for sales, networking, and relationship-building topics.</p>\n<h4>20. <a href=\"https://hyken.com/\">Shep Hyken</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker with a humorous delivery and focus on the customer experience.</p>\n<h4>21. <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/sarahhill1/\">Sarah Hill</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for technology, including virtual and augmented reality.</p>\n<h4><strong>22. <a href=\"https://joelgoldbergmedia.com/\">Joel Goldberg</a></strong></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for culture-building and storytelling subjects.</p>\n<h4>23. <a href=\"https://chrisyeh.com/speaking\">Chris Yeh</a></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for “playing the rebound” and growing during and after the Covid-19 crisis.</p>\n<h4><strong>24. <a href=\"https://shamahyder.com/\">Shama Hyder</a></strong></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker for marketing and selling in the digital age.</p>\n<h4><strong>25. <a href=\"https://williamarruda.com/\">William Arruda</a></strong></h4>\n<p>Best motivational virtual speaker for engaging top talent.</p>\n<h4><strong>26. <a href=\"https://www.fifthavenuebrands.com/\">Richard Lorenzen</a></strong></h4>\n<p>Best virtual speaker on global entrepreneurship.</p>\n<h2>Here are the top virtual keynote speakers you&#8217;ll ever hear:</h2>\n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://johnhallspeaking.com/\">John Hall</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-169144\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/John-Hall_avatar_1451710503-400x400-1-300x300.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"300\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/John-Hall_avatar_1451710503-400x400-1-300x300.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/John-Hall_avatar_1451710503-400x400-1-160x160.jpg 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/John-Hall_avatar_1451710503-400x400-1-40x40.jpg 40w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/John-Hall_avatar_1451710503-400x400-1-60x60.jpg 60w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/John-Hall_avatar_1451710503-400x400-1.jpg 400w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>John Hall is unique in that he’s very personable in his keynotes, which is important when looking for a virtual keynote speaker. He wrote the bestselling book <i>Top of Mind</i>, and his subjects are timely, given how important building trust and remaining top of mind are for customers, partners, and other business stakeholders working remotely.</p>\n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://www.briansolis.com/\">Brian Solis</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-169145\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/briansolis3-300x300.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"300\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/briansolis3-300x300.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/briansolis3-721x719.jpg 721w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/briansolis3-160x160.jpg 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/briansolis3-40x40.jpg 40w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/briansolis3-60x60.jpg 60w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/briansolis3.jpg 849w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>Few people understand the impact that technology has had on business and society more than Brian Solis. Thirty years of experience have led to seven bestselling books and heavily sought-after skills as a digital analyst. His work, along with a popular online video series called “(r)evolution,” has garnered a loyal online fan base topping 700,000.</p>\n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/lenarequist/\">Lena Requist</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-169164\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-30-at-11.41.47-AM-300x278.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"278\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-30-at-11.41.47-AM-300x278.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-30-at-11.41.47-AM-173x160.png 173w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-03-30-at-11.41.47-AM.png 533w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>From a startup to a multi-million-dollar enterprise, Lena Requist is in the perfect position to talk to businesses of all sizes. As president of Ontraport, her company has grown 5,000% and was named one of Forbes’ “Most Promising Companies in America.” She believes in an inside-out approach to business, and she attributes Ontraport’s success to this perspective. She explores how team development leads to company success, aiding both the business and the individual. She is one of our top virtual keynote speakers for her experience and motivation on stage.</p>\n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://www.erikhuberman.com/\">Erik Huberman</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-full wp-image-169147\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/20160211165807-ErikHubermanHeadShot.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"300\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/20160211165807-ErikHubermanHeadShot.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/20160211165807-ErikHubermanHeadShot-160x160.jpg 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/20160211165807-ErikHubermanHeadShot-40x40.jpg 40w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/20160211165807-ErikHubermanHeadShot-60x60.jpg 60w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>A storyteller at heart, Erik Huberman’s insights into entrepreneurship will prove to be unique and memorable. He is the co-founder and CEO of Hawke Media, an agency valued at more than $60 million after only six years in business. He was named one of Forbes’ “30 under 30” and has the composure of a seasoned veteran.</p>\n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://www.roryvaden.com/best-leadership-speaker\">Rory Vaden</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-169148\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/RoryVaden-300x293.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"293\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/RoryVaden-300x293.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/RoryVaden-164x160.jpg 164w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/RoryVaden-40x40.jpg 40w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/RoryVaden-60x60.jpg 60w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/RoryVaden.jpg 450w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>The World Championship of Public Speaking hosts 10 contestants from a pool of 25,000 from more than 90 different countries. Rory has made that exclusive cut not once, but twice, including a World Champion first runner-up finish. On top of his speaking prowess, his book <i>Take The Stairs </i>is a No. 1 bestseller on multiple platforms. He believes in ultra performance and teaches that focus is the most important thing you can have. He works especially hard to customize every presentation for each audience.</p>\n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://www.traceygrace.com/\">Tracey Grace</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-169149\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/TraceyGrace-300x283.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"283\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/TraceyGrace-300x283.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/TraceyGrace-170x160.png 170w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/TraceyGrace-240x225.png 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/TraceyGrace.png 383w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>The president and CEO of IBEX has received numerous awards for her professional work. Tracey Grace has more than 20 years of experience in the training and information technology industry and is a pioneer of diversity in the workplace. When speaking about her success, she says, “It’s the people and ideas that I allowed into my inner circle that determined my life direction; it is my insatiable curiosity that impacted my ultimate success.”</p>\n<h3>7. <a href=\"http://www.andrewpaulthomas.com/\">Andrew Thomas</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-169150\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AndrewThomas-300x263.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"263\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AndrewThomas-300x263.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AndrewThomas-183x160.jpg 183w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AndrewThomas.jpg 354w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>Andrew Thomas promises to be candid and authentic with his speaking. His main source of experience comes from co-founding SkyBell, one of the first video doorbell companies. There, he drove over $100 million in revenue as its chief revenue officer. He’s spoken for a variety of news channels and companies, sharing the stories of his successes and failures, as well as what he learned from those experiences. His true desire is helping to empower others to identify their dreams and pinpoint how they can accomplish them.</p>\n<h3>8. <a href=\"https://www.chrispdyer.com/speaking/\">Chris Dyer</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-169151\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Chris_Dyer-300x300.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"300\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Chris_Dyer-300x300.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Chris_Dyer-160x160.jpg 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Chris_Dyer-40x40.jpg 40w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Chris_Dyer-60x60.jpg 60w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Chris_Dyer.jpg 450w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>The podcast “TalentTalk” has more than 3.65 million downloads, giving you many reasons to listen to its host, Chris Dyer. He was named one of Inc.’s “10 Leadership Speakers That Can Help Your Company Culture” and has spoken all over the world, lending insight into how performance can be driven through company culture. An incredibly adaptable speaker, Dyer has a number of messages he can share that get to the heart of what your company needs.</p>\n<h3>9. <a href=\"https://www.nirandfar.com/\">Nir Eyal</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-169152\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/NirEyal-300x248.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"248\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/NirEyal-300x248.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/NirEyal-194x160.png 194w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/NirEyal.png 349w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>A behavioral designer by trade, Nir Eyal’s goal as a speaker is to help people protect their attention from the negative effects of technology. The author of two bestselling books, <i>Hooked: How to Build Habit-Forming Products</i> and <i>Indistractable: How to Control Your Attention and Choose Your Life</i>, Eyal’s work draws from research on how we get distracted, as well as his own attention management tactics.</p>\n<h3>10. <a href=\"https://frontrowfactor.com/\">Jon Vroman</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-169153\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/JonVromam-300x300.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"300\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/JonVromam-300x300.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/JonVromam-160x160.png 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/JonVromam-40x40.png 40w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/JonVromam-60x60.png 60w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/JonVromam.png 648w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>Jon Vroman is the mastermind behind the Front Row Foundation, a charity that helps those with life-threatening illnesses attend their dream events. The name stems from his mantra, “Make moments matter.” As a highly successful keynote speaker, his goal is to help others adopt that mindset and “live life in the front row.” He is also a bestselling author who’s been requested to speak at more than 750 venues over the past decade.</p>\n<h3>11. <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/schembra/\">Chris Schembra</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-169154\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/ChrisSchembra-300x235.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"235\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/ChrisSchembra-300x235.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/ChrisSchembra-204x160.png 204w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/ChrisSchembra.png 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>Chris Schembra’s passion for people makes him an unforgettable speaker. He is the founder and chief question asker of 7:47, an organization committed to sparking connections among people at small dinner parties. Schembra also wrote <i>Gratitude and Pasta: The Secret Sauce For Human Connection</i>, a book that explains how to deepen relationships with others through gratitude and sharing a meal. During a time of social distancing, this is a conversation you don’t want to miss.</p>\n<h3>12. <a href=\"https://www.robertglazer.com/\">Bob Glazer</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-169155\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/BobGlazer-300x298.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"298\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/BobGlazer-300x298.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/BobGlazer-161x160.png 161w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/BobGlazer-40x40.png 40w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/BobGlazer-60x60.png 60w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/BobGlazer.png 397w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>You know you’re doing something right when you’re ranked the No. 2 small business CEO on Glassdoor. Bob Glazer is also one of Forbes’ “20 Speakers You Shouldn’t Miss” and one of Entrepreneur’s “11 Amazing and Unforgettable Speakers.” His passion is helping companies and individuals develop high-performing cultures. He has personally been one of the best virtual speakers I&#8217;ve ever heard.</p>\n<h3>13. <a href=\"https://www.elischwartz.co/\">Eli Schwartz</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-170392\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-04-23-at-8.42.53-AM-297x300.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"297\" height=\"300\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-04-23-at-8.42.53-AM-297x300.png 297w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-04-23-at-8.42.53-AM-158x160.png 158w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-04-23-at-8.42.53-AM-40x40.png 40w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-04-23-at-8.42.53-AM-60x60.png 60w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-04-23-at-8.42.53-AM.png 355w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 297px) 100vw, 297px\" /></p>\n<p>Eli Schwartz works with large-scale growth companies on building products poised for hypergrowth. He is also the former director of growth at SurveyMonkey, building organic search from the ground up. Eli is a regular speaker at marketing events throughout the U.S., Europe, and Asia, as well as serves as a guest lecturer at Duke University’s Fuqua School of Business, Singapore’s Civil Service College, and the Founder’s Institute.</p>\n<h3>14. <a href=\"https://www.brittanyhodak.com/\">Brittany Hodak</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-169156\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/BrittanyHodak-300x250.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"250\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/BrittanyHodak-300x250.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/BrittanyHodak-192x160.png 192w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/BrittanyHodak.png 424w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>If you’re looking at building a loyal fan base for your brand, look no further than Brittany Hodak. I saw a virtual keynote Brittany gave last week and I was impressed.</p>\n<h3>15. <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/jeffrey-winters-ba290611\">Jeff Winters</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-169157\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/JeffWinters-300x239.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"239\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/JeffWinters-300x239.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/JeffWinters-201x160.png 201w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/JeffWinters.png 391w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>The president of Sapper Consulting, lead generation is Jeff Winters’ expertise. He is known online as a top virtual motivational speaker because of how much he cares.</p>\n<h3>18. <a href=\"https://ashleighdilello.com/\">Ashleigh Dilello</a></h3>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-169160\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AshleighDiLello-300x273.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"273\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AshleighDiLello-300x273.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AshleighDiLello-176x160.png 176w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AshleighDiLello.png 482w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>At the young age of 13, Ashleigh Dilello was diagnosed with a life-threatening disease that changed her path.
