An acclaimed keynote speaker, Shama has delivered keynotes in more than 20 countries and spoken for recognized brands including Movado, Chase, Tupperware, and the Inc. 5000.</p>\n<div>\n<h3><strong>25. <a href=\"https://williamarruda.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.shamahyder.com/&#38;source=gmail&#38;ust=1593801700438000&#38;usg=AFQjCNEQlky96dxCvlfr2gvMu-zI6zrUoA\">William Arruda</a></strong></h3>\n<p><img class=\"\" src=\"https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/70e69c46e9afd5fd7fe67c000d34e3b8?s=400&#38;d=mm&#38;r=g\" alt=\"William Arruda\" width=\"276\" height=\"276\" /></p>\n<p>William Arruda uses his passion and enthusiasm to make virtual presentations feel like they’re in-person events. As the leading authority on the topic of personal branding, he shares his proven process for uncovering, expressing and growing your personal brand in the virtual world. Today, businesses need an extra dose of humanity, and William’s live virtual keynotes inspire talent to bring their authentic selves to work. He has built a reputation as the keynote speaker whose presentations are both motivational <i>and</i> actionable.</p>\n<h3><strong>26. <a href=\"https://www.fifthavenuebrands.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.shamahyder.com/&#38;source=gmail&#38;ust=1593801700438000&#38;usg=AFQjCNEQlky96dxCvlfr2gvMu-zI6zrUoA\">Richard Lorenzen</a></strong></h3>\n</div>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-174547\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-07-14-at-5.45.45-PM-300x224.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"300\" height=\"224\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-07-14-at-5.45.45-PM-300x224.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-07-14-at-5.45.45-PM-214x160.png 214w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-07-14-at-5.45.45-PM.png 512w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>Richard Lorenzen is an American entrepreneur, investor and the CEO of Fifth Avenue Brands, a New York-based public relations firm. He speaks on entrepreneurship, foreign policy and the economy at the United Nations, TEDx, universities and corporate forums. Richard is regularly cited as one of America’s most influential millennial entrepreneurs and has been featured in Forbes, CNBC, Fox News, Entrepreneur Magazine, AdWeek, PRWeek and more. Entrepreneur Magazine ranked him one of the top 50 people in digital marketing and Inc. Magazine named him one of the top inspirational entrepreneurs.</p>\n<h2>Other Top Speakers For Your Virtual Event</h2>\n<p>Looking for a few top speakers for your next event. Here are a few other top speakers we&#8217;ve found:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/15/top-25-blockchain-and-cryptocurrency-speakers/\">Blockchain Speakers</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/02/top-futurist-speakers/\">Futurist Speakers</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/04/top-15-growth-marketing-speakers/\">Marketing Speakers</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/06/7-keynote-leadership-speakers-bringing-fresh-insights-to-their-industries/\">Leadership Speakers</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/11/7-best-reputation-risk-speakers-to-help-your-organization-survive-and-thrive/\">Reputation Risk</a></li>\n<li><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/29/top-virtual-keynote-speakers/\">Virtual Keynote Speakers</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2>Guide to the Best Speakers</h2>\n<p>A few other guides to finding the best speakers:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/06/30/how-to-find-a-keynote-speaker-who-will-make-your-event-great/\">Find a Keynote Speaker</a></li>\n</ul>\n<p>When looking for the best speakers for your virtual conference or workshop, there are some key traits that can make all the difference with all well your virtual event goes.</p>\n<div>\n<h3><strong>Know what you want</strong></h3>\n<p>Before you approach keynote speakers for your virtual speakers, be prepared by having a framework for your virtual event, the speaker personas that fit that event, and your budget, among other things.</p>\n</div>\n<div class=\"ArticleText__bodyContentBlock__Pb-EW\">\n<p>Start with an objective for your virtual conference in terms of what you want to achieve by hosting the event. If your event focuses on industry trends, you will need to find speakers adept at that industry and understanding the forces that influences it.</p>\n<p>From there, determine what type of speaker personas can enhance the event. Do you want someone that is edgy, funny, or deeply personal? Think about your potential audience and the type of speakers they would enjoy. With this in mind, it&#8217;s also important to align the presentation style used by these prospective virtual speakers. The style should consider length, visual aids, and format.</p>\n<p>Also, know your budget first. Having a fee range in mind prior to your virtual speaker search can optimize the time spent for both you and the speakers you approach.</p>\n<h3>Other Considerations</h3>\n<p>After deciding on what you want, the next step is to conduct research and assess each of your virtual speaker prospects. Some considerations include:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Will the virtual deliver targeted and unique content for my audience? You don&#8217;t want to go with a virtual speaker that just recycles their same presentation for each event. Your audience may have already seen them give that presentation and not see any value in what you offer them.</li>\n<li>Is the virtual speaker flexible and easy to work with? Look for a virtual speaker that is responsive, thorough, helpful, and friendly. If they look at working with you on your virtual event as a partnership, then you will want to bring them on. This positive interaction can go a long way toward a fun and successful event for everyone involved.</li>\n<li>Can they add extra value to your event through additional content? While taking the virtual stage is already delivering good value, you can raise the bar to exceptional value if your virtual speaker has books or other content where they can share more content for the audience to &#8220;take home.&#8221;</li>\n</ul>\n</div>\n<div>\n<h3>Due Diligence</h3>\n</div>\n<div>\n<p>While it may not be difficult to find your ideal virtual speakers because you can conduct online research or get referrals from your network, the challenging part may be how you approach and win over the targeted speaking prospects for your virtual conference. Here&#8217;s a strategy to approach this part of the process:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Get started on your virtual speaker hunt early. Even though conferences have moved online and are just ramping up, your virtual speaker may already be booked weeks or months in advance. Plan your search accordingly, based on your virtual conference dates. This will reduce the stress of getting your ideal virtual speakers on the agenda.</li>\n<li>Take the time to watch videos of your speaker prospects in action at past events. Even if you can&#8217;t do it live now that it&#8217;s not possible, sites like YouTube as well as the speaker bureau or speaker&#8217;s own website have recordings. It&#8217;s also possible to request a speaker reel directly from the speaker or their bureau. The real offers short presentation clips.</li>\n<li>Check speaker references and speak to those who have incorporated targeted speakers in past events. In doing so, you will learn more about what they are like. From there, you can shorten your list.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Approaching Your Ideal Virtual Speakers</h3>\n<p>Once you have done these things, you should approach your ideal virtual speakers with clear information about your conference, what it involves and the role they would play. Be flexible because your ideal speakers may also want to share feedback on the panel topics or keynote focus. Their experience in doing past conferences can become a valuable resource for shaping the success of your event.</p>\n<p>Get everything in writing, including your expectations and that of each speaker. Having a formal agreement helps everyone feel comfortable and confident about working together. Once its on paper that each virtual speaker plans to be part of your event, get their feedback on how to include them in the pre- and post-marketing effort for your virtual event.</p>\n<p>Now that you have your virtual speakers in place, it&#8217;s time to plan and oversee a successful online event.</p>\n</div>\n<h2>How to Create a Successful Online Event</h2>\n<p>Having the right speaker or speaker lineup is just one of the many factors that go into hosting a successful online event or virtual industry conference. Here are some other critical components:</p>\n<h3>Focus on Video</h3>\n<p>A virtual conference needs video of the speakers and/or panel to engage your online audience. No one wants to just look at a screen share of a PowerPoint presentation. Instead, seeing the speaker&#8217;s body language and facial expressions personalizes the experience and adds to their message.</p>\n<p>Since webinar platforms support videoconferencing, having video should be fairly easy to showcase for your virtual event. Have your speakers practice using video conferencing tools prior to the event, especially if they are new to this technology.</p>\n<h3><b>Decide on Audio</b></h3>\n<p>Like video, the audio you use for your virtual conference can make or break your event. Your conference is live, so the audio must be flawless because there is no time to tweak it or address poor sound quality. Your audience doesn&#8217;t want to wait and watch you struggle with the speaker’s microphone, the audio platform, or the network you are using to transmit your event.</p>\n<p>Test out various audio options during the event preparation process. Look for services that deliver audio quality, including those recommended by other event hosts.</p>\n<h3><strong>Plan Unique Content and a Compelling Agenda</strong></h3>\n<p>Take the time to develop the content and agenda with your speakers. Their input and your understanding of the target audience can create a world-class virtual conference. If it goes well in terms of delivering a unique experience, then you will be more likely to attract a larger audience and parlay that into future events.</p>\n<h3><b>Focus on Interactive Features</b></h3>\n<p>To keep your audience engaged and enhance what the virtual speaker talent offers, look for ways to add interactive features to your online event. For example, have a Q&#38;A session where viewers can send in questions. You can also consider adding a poll during a specific session to get audience input on the speaker&#8217;s topic.</p>\n<h3>Conduct Virtual Session Run-throughs</h3>\n<p>Just like you would have done when hosting an in-person conference, your virtual conference should have a few run-throughs so that speakers can go over their presentations and panels can agree on how they will run their session.</p>\n<p>Also, this is the opportune time to test and re-test all audio and video equipment. Your audio/video quality, Internet connection, equipment, screen sharing, host-to-speaker private messaging, and interactive features must be flawless.</p>\n<h3><b>Have a Contingency Plan For Tech Issues</b></h3>\n<p>No matter how often you check and re-check, there are bound to be technical issues. Make sure your audio-visual technicians are ready to take on any tech issue that could possibly impact your virtual conference.</p>\n<p>One of the biggest things to go wrong with an online conference is network connectivity. You need to be prepared for bandwidth and how many people may sign on to view your online conference. While you want the most people possible, you also don&#8217;t want the platform you are using to crash.</p>\n<p>Make sure your tech talent has contingency plans in place to address the loss of connectivity, audio or video glitches, or lost speaker presentation files. The larger your risk assessment and planning process, the more likely you are to minimize any technical issues from impacting your audience&#8217;s overall experience.</p>\n<h3><b>Implement a Marketing and Publicity Plan</b></h3>\n<p>You want to attract the most people to your online conference as possible, so that means creating a marketing and publicity strategy just for your virtual event. Explore your options for the channels and content that can reach your intended audience. For example, use sites like LinkedIn, YouTube, and Facebook to create events. You can also create an email blast and website landing page. Or, if possible, designate and develop an entire online event website with links for registration. Another option is to Develop and feature a blog post about the event.</p>\n<p>Don&#8217;t deliver all the news about your online event at once. Provide teasers that reveal some news leading up to the event, such as revealing a featured virtual speaker each week prior to the event date. This provides an opportunity to continue contacting your audience and reminding them about the event. The approach can also help generate more buzz around your virtual conference.</p>\n<h3>Decide on Takeaways and Post-Event Marketing Tactics</h3>\n<p>During and after your online event, you have more opportunities. While you can&#8217;t recreate the “experience” associated with in-person events like networking opportunities and dinners, you can do other things to enhance the experience and add value.  Ideas include an event summary download, a digital coupon for a virtual speaker&#8217;s book, or a discount for products and services featured at the online event.</p>\n<p>Find ways to get more marketing ROI through post-event tactics. For example, you could feature video excerpts on various social media channels or panel and keynote summaries. You can use these to generate online discussions and blog posts that repackage and expand on the ideas presented throughout your virtual conference or workshop.</p>\n<p>Also, don&#8217;t forget to conduct a survey among online attendees to find out what they liked and what could have been better. Ask them what they would like to see from future virtual conferences so you can start planning for those.</p>\n<h2>Virtual Speakers and Planning Create Memorable Virtual Events</h2>\n<p>The world of virtual conferences is just getting started. Despite turning the conference and events industries into a tailspin, technology and innovative planning, combined with forward-thinking speaker talent, have the opportunity to shape and grow an entirely new channel for virtual conferences, trade shows, training courses, and workshops.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/29/top-virtual-keynote-speakers/\">26 Top Virtual Keynote Speakers</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 29 Mar 2020 15:00:33 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Virtual-Keynote-Speakers.jpg","linkMd5":"f86294b1e6da445d32649a655e43245e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn71@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-23-901_c405b67a0baafcc3.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Virtual-Keynote-Speakers.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1371,"sourceBytes":359758,"destBytes":283520,"author":"Brad 3/ShepHyken-300x292.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn55@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-19-652_6920a0b798478c2a.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/SaraHill-300x248.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn71@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-17-572_128cfe8757509a61.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-04-21-at-11.14.44-AM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn26@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-11-129_11ead2f92ecc2b3f.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-04-23-at-9.06.24-AM-233x300.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn91@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-13-214_65dfb32ced59a43c.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-07-02-at-1.46.58-PM-258x300.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn16@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-23-947_32fabb917825c4b0.webp","https://secure.gravatar.com/avatar/70e69c46e9afd5fd7fe67c000d34e3b8?s=400&d=mm&r=g":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn51@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-23-688_706e39e9e03559e4.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Screen-Shot-2020-07-14-at-5.45.45-PM-300x224.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn23@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-21-028_93ed039e809c7026.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195879108},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","title":"The Increasing Need for Hyperlocal Data Collection","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170090","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/26/the-increasing-need-for-hyperlocal-data-collection/\" title=\"The Increasing Need for Hyperlocal Data Collection\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Increasing-Need-for-Hyperlocal-Data-Collection-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"hyperlocal data collection\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Increasing-Need-for-Hyperlocal-Data-Collection-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Increasing-Need-for-Hyperlocal-Data-Collection-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Increasing-Need-for-Hyperlocal-Data-Collection-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Increasing-Need-for-Hyperlocal-Data-Collection.jpg 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>The ability to collect and harness big <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/05/securing-the-digital-workplace-amidst-the-covid-19-pandemic/\">data has transformed businesses worldwide</a>. This process, which is continually improved by data scientists and companies that heavily invest in big data, has allowed for dramatic changes to numerous industries. The benefits of using big <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/01/11/the-business-benefits-of-visualizing-your-data/\">data include improved processes</a>, data-driven business decisions, and better resource allocation. Here is the increasing need for hyperlocal data collection.</p>\n<h3><strong>While conversation often surrounds how to use big data, the use of hyperlocal data has also gained attention.</strong></h3>\n<p>Hyperlocal data refers to a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/18/how-to-use-quizzes-to-get-more-leads-for-your-business/\">more niche version</a> of local data. A zip code, for example, is an example of local data, but a street address is hyperlocal data. It’s more specific and tends to surround a very particular, defined geographic area. This <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/04/intelligent-virtualization-technologies-are-eliminating-data-silos-forever/\">data</a> is more difficult to collect, but its uses in business are growing.</p>\n<h2>Hyperlocal data benefits businesses</h2>\n<p>There are more obvious uses for hyperlocal data for businesses that rely on <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2017/08/30/connected-devices-revolutionizing-mobile-field-services/\">Google Maps or location-based services</a>. A food delivery company, for example, would benefit from having more addresses and exact locations of restaurants in a particular area because they can then offer customers more unique choices, gaining an edge over their competition.</p>\n<p>Google Maps itself also benefits from this data because the company can offer more accurate, up-to-date information to users, including directions and nearby locations.</p>\n<p>Both marketers and advertisers use hyperlocal data to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/18/gabb-wireless-a-smartphone-for-kids-to-keep-them-safe-and-minimize-screen-time/\">hone in on local customers</a>. Near-me searches have risen in popularity, and marketers are capitalizing on these searches to get customers into local stores and restaurants.</p>\n<p>Instead of focusing on a potential customer that may come to the area later, these campaigns focus on customers that are already in the vicinity. Of course, marketers must also focus on strong Google My Business listings and SEO to beat out the competition fighting for the top spots on search engines.</p>\n<p>Hyperlocal data has a place in a traditional business or <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2016/11/20/smart-cities-need-banks-data-power-governments-cl4/\">finance setting as well</a>. A company applying for a loan may overstate its value. Hyperlocal data can capture accurate information such as credit cards accepted, hours of operation, number of employees, etc. All of this information is necessary for financial institutions that want an accurate portrayal of a business. However, there are far more uses for hyperlocal data than just this.</p>\n<h2>Hyperlocal data and Covid-19</h2>\n<p>With the world battling a pandemic, many have turned to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/22/how-smart-cities-can-help-build-a-better-post-pandemic-world/\">hyperlocal data to track</a> the spread of Covid-19. By mapping out global cases, experts have been attempting to take a worldwide view of how the virus has spread and its impact on businesses.</p>\n<p>More importantly, they want to look at areas that have begun to flatten the curve so that other affected areas can mimic their efforts. Of course, none of this is possible without hyperlocal data that tracks infected populations. This data will play a key role in both curbing the spread and creating lessons to draw from in the future.</p>\n<h2>Hyperlocal and IoT use cases</h2>\n<p>What is particularly interesting is how hyperlocal data can benefit the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/10/how-iot-reshapes-industry-4-0-and-the-effects-of-iot-on-smes/\">Internet of Things</a>. With improved mobile technology, people are constantly creating data. Now, more than ever, people are sharing this data for the benefit of others. Take traffic reports, for example. There are apps where users can report accidents, and delays, which helps others traveling in the vicinity.</p>\n<p>The report is given to a GPS application, which can then <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/22/best-business-intelligence-software-and-business-operating-system-options-for-2020/\">reroute drivers to avoid sitting in long delays</a>. It’s even expected that self-reporting will soon become unnecessary as AI will become sophisticated enough to collect hyperlocal data without user input.</p>\n<p>Connected cars have grown in popularity and will soon play a substantial role in hyperlocal data collection and distribution. Equipped with smart sensors, this type of car could report weather information to a cloud service, which could then alert others in the area.</p>\n<p>If there is a severe storm or ice on the road, other travelers would know about it, assuming they are in connected vehicles themselves. Hyperlocal data can power IoT simply by offering larger amounts of accurate data.</p>\n<h2>Hyperlocal data moving forward</h2>\n<p>The <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/22/how-to-ensure-data-privacy-in-the-time-of-coronavirus/\">challenge of data collection</a>, particularly in emerging markets, is one hindrance to this movement. While data is readily available in developed cities, data in underdeveloped locations is not as easily accessible. This data, however, is growing in its value as more global companies seek to enter these markets.</p>\n<p>There are solutions to this problem of gathering data in <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2014/02/24/facebook-plans-internet-takeover-zuckerberg/\">underdeveloped markets</a>, and big brands are starting to vie for this data as it directly impacts expansion plans.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Anna Shvets; Pexels<br />\n</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/26/the-increasing-need-for-hyperlocal-data-collection/\">The Increasing Need for Hyperlocal Data Collection</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 26 Jun 2020 18:00:50 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Increasing-Need-for-Hyperlocal-Data-Collection.jpg","linkMd5":"80af6648b6edcbc26094c0da9edbb1ad","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn68@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-19-131_2d6f515521a49d33.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Increasing-Need-for-Hyperlocal-Data-Collection.jpg","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":853,"sourceBytes":296493,"destBytes":162704,"author":"Geoffrey Michener","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Increasing-Need-for-Hyperlocal-Data-Collection-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn60@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-28-512_5ee279ccf063a5a9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195875738},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:49","title":"Examples of Failure in Artificial Intelligence","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=175301","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/31/failure-in-artificial-intelligence/\" title=\"Examples of Failure in Artificial Intelligence\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ai-failure-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ai-failure-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ai-failure-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ai-failure-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ai-failure-1536x1024.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ai-failure.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><div id=\"contentsContainer\">\n<div id=\"contents\">\n<p id=\"E177\"><span id=\"E178\">Artificial intelligence is groundbreaking and, at times, still quite mind blowing. We’re constantly peppered with amazing stories of efficiency, automation, and intelligent prognostication. But </span><span id=\"E179\">AI isn’t</span><span id=\"E180\"> perfect. And for every story of success, there’s another tale of a mess up or mistake &#8211; a situation where something didn’t go as planned.</span></p>\n<p id=\"E183\"><span id=\"E184\">While I’m a huge </span><a id=\"E185\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/02/top-10-greatest-ai-trends-in-business-2020/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><span id=\"E186\">believer in AI</span></a><span id=\"E187\"> and have seen the power of it in my own businesses, sometimes it’s nice to see the other side of the coin, have a couple of laughs, and remember that we’re all just pushing for bigger and better things. But along that path, there will be friction and interruptions. It’s how we respond to these anomalies and shortcomings that ultimately defines where we go from here.</span></p>\n<h2 id=\"E190\"><strong><span id=\"E191\">6 Examples of AI Failures</span></strong></h2>\n<p id=\"E194\"><span id=\"E195\">We don’t want AI to be perfect. At least not yet. The fact that AI can still experience failures and lead to unintended consequences is somewhat refreshing (when you’re a couple of steps removed from the failure). But even for those close to the fire, these mistakes serve as lessons in growth and improvement. And the more failure there is today, the </span><a id=\"E196\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/18/growth-opportunities-available-during-and-after-pandemic-times/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><span id=\"E197\">more growth and improvement will occur</span></a><span id=\"E198\"> &#8211; ultimately leading the way to a more perfect and complete industry.</span></p>\n<p id=\"E201\"><span id=\"E202\">Okay, enough with the preamble. Let’s deliver the goods. Here are some of the top examples of AI failure over the past few years:</span></p>\n<p id=\"E205\" class=\"qowt-li-1_0 qowt-list\"><strong><span id=\"E206\">Microsoft AI Chatbot Learns Some Unbecoming Language</span></strong></p>\n<p id=\"E209\"><span id=\"E210\">AI chatbots have sort of become the norm on social media and other websites. Facebook has a really good one built into Messenger and it’s leveraged as a powerful business tool for providing customer service and jumpstarting conversations with prospects. But AI chatbots aren’t perfect, as exemplified by Microsoft’s AI chatbot, which briefly went by the name of “Tay.”</span></p>\n<p id=\"E213\"><span id=\"E214\">Released in March 2016 and deployed for Twitter users, Tay was programmed to have casual, natural conversations in the language of typical millennials. But it only lasted 24 hours. What happened? Well, a group of trolls on the site targeted its vulnerabilities and manipulated Tay into making very sexist and racist statements.</span></p>\n<p id=\"E217\"><span id=\"E218\">Peter Lee, the VP for AI and research at Microsoft, had to issue a public apology for not foreseeing this possibility ahead of time. </span></p>\n<p id=\"E221\" class=\"qowt-li-1_0 qowt-list\"><strong><span id=\"E222\">Athlete or Felon?</span></strong></p>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div id=\"contentsContainer\">\n<div id=\"contents\">\n<p id=\"E225\"><span id=\"E226\">Amazon has a project they call Rekognition. It’s an AI-based facial recognition software that’s marketed to police agencies for use in investigations. It’s essentially supposed to cross analyze images and direct law enforcement officers to possible suspects. The problem is that it’s not very accurate.</span></p>\n<p id=\"E229\"><span id=\"E230\">In a study by the Massachusetts chapter of the ACLU, dozens of Boston-area athletes’ pictures were run through the system. At least 27 of these athletes &#8211; or roughly one-in-six &#8211; were falsely matched with mugshots. This included three-time Super Bowl champion Duron Harmon of the New England Patriots.</span></p>\n<p id=\"E233\"><span id=\"E234\">Can you say, not a good look?</span></p>\n<p id=\"E237\" class=\"qowt-li-1_0 qowt-list\"><strong><span id=\"E238\">Users Find Flaws in Apple’s Face ID</span></strong></p>\n<p id=\"E241\"><span id=\"E242\">Apple is always coming up with cutting edge technology. They’ve set the standards in the smartphone and mobile device industry for years. For the most part, they get things right. But sometimes they can be a bit too brash in their marketing. In other words, they like to flex their muscles. As you might expect, this invites haters, trolls, and skeptics to challenge their claims.</span></p>\n<p id=\"E245\"><span id=\"E246\">One recent example occurred with the release of the iPhone X. Leading up to the launch, Apple had invested a lot of time and marketing dollars into their front-facing facial recognition system that replaced the fingerprint reader as the primary method of accessing the phone. The claim was that the AI component was so smart readers could wear glasses, makeup, etc. without compromising functionality. And that’s essentially true. The problem is that Apple also clearly stated the Face ID technology can’t be spoofed by masks or other techniques.</span></p>\n<p id=\"E249\"><span id=\"E250\">One Vietnam-based security firm </span><a id=\"E251\" href=\"https://www.wired.com/story/hackers-say-broke-face-id-security/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><span id=\"E252\">took this as a challenge</span></a><span id=\"E253\">. And with just $200, they made a mask out of stone powder, glued on some printed 2D “eyes,” and unlocked a phone. This is just a reminder that bold claims can sometimes come back to bite!</span></p>\n<p id=\"E256\" class=\"qowt-li-1_0 qowt-list\"><strong><span id=\"E257\">Robot Dog Meets Fatal Ending</span></strong></p>\n<p id=\"E260\"><span id=\"E261\">Who doesn’t love the idea of a robot puppy? You get a cute little machine without the barking, walking, pooping, eating, or expensive vet bills. But if you’re looking for a life partner, you might not want this robodog.</span></p>\n<p id=\"E264\"><span id=\"E265\">In 2019, a Boston Robotics’ </span><span id=\"E266\">robodog</span><span id=\"E267\"> named Spot met a dramatic and untimely onstage death while he was being demoed by the company CEO at a conference in Las Vegas. Tasked with walking, he slowly started to stumble and eventually collapsed to the floor as the audience uncomfortably gasped and chuckled. </span></p>\n<p id=\"E270\" class=\"qowt-li-1_0 qowt-list\"><strong><span id=\"E271\">Watson Is Not a Doctor</span></strong></p>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div id=\"contentsContainer\">\n<div id=\"contents\">\n<p id=\"E274\"><span id=\"E275\">IBM’s Waston is a pretty amazing piece of technology. This smart supercomputer has many accomplishments under his belt, including defeating some of the world’s smartest people in a game of televised Jeopardy. But as much as Watson knows, he’s not to be trusted as a doctor &#8211; yet.</span></p>\n<p id=\"E278\"><span id=\"E279\">In 2018, IBM Watson attempted to launch a medical AI system to make suggestions for treating cancer patients. IBM’s objective was nothing less than to “eradicate cancer.” But it didn’t take long for hospitals and oncologists to see major flaws. At one point, Watson suggested putting a patient with excessive bleeding on a medication that would cause even more bleeding &#8211; possibly killing the patient in the process!</span></p>\n<p id=\"E282\"><span id=\"E283\">IBM has blamed its engineers, stating they programmed Watson with hypotheticals and fictional cases, rather than relying on actual patient data and historical medical charts. Either way, it’s not a good look for Watson. Perhaps he’ll stick to gameshows. </span></p>\n<p id=\"E286\" class=\"qowt-li-1_0 qowt-list\"><strong><span id=\"E287\">Voice-Spoofing AI Software Cons CEO</span></strong></p>\n<p id=\"E290\"><span id=\"E291\">Deepfakes</span><span id=\"E292\"> are becoming a serious (and alarming) problem. Hackers have found ways to fake voices, pictures, and even video. And in certain cases, the effects are disastrous.</span></p>\n<p id=\"E295\"><span id=\"E296\">In March 2019, the CEO of a UK-based company got a phone call from his boss over at the German parent company. He was instructed to transfer the equivalent of $243,000 to a Hungarian supplier. The request was marked as urgent and the CEO was told to carry it out right away. The only problem with the request was that it wasn’t his boss on the other end of the line. It was an AI-based software made to mimic the boss’s voice. </span></p>\n<p id=\"E299\"><span id=\"E300\">While we’re calling this an AI failure, the reality is that the AI software won. It was the humans who got played to the tune of a quarter of a million dollars!</span></p>\n<p id=\"E303\"><strong><span id=\"E304\">AI: Challenges and Opportunities</span></strong></p>\n<p id=\"E307\"><span id=\"E308\">As we can clearly see, AI isn’t without its issues. As it pertains to business, AI implementation still faces several challenges. They include:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li id=\"E311\" class=\"qowt-li-3_0 qowt-list\"><strong><span id=\"E312\">Limited processing power. </span></strong><span id=\"E313\">While AI and ML have great potential, they utilize a ton of processing power. Most computing simply isn’t that advanced. As a result, it’s difficult to fully utilize these technologies outside of very specific environments.</span></li>\n<li id=\"E316\" class=\"qowt-li-3_0 qowt-list\"><span id=\"E317\"><strong>Limited knowledge</strong>. </span><span id=\"E318\">Only a handful of people truly understand AI well enough to explain it to the marketplace. This has kept adoption rates from being where they should be and is slowing down growth.</span></li>\n<li id=\"E319\" class=\"qowt-li-3_0 qowt-list\"><span id=\"E320\"><strong>Lack of trust</strong>. </span><span id=\"E321\">There will always be a degree of mistrust between people and computers. And while relations have improved over the past few years, failures like the ones </span>outlined in this article don’t help much.</li>\n<li class=\"qowt-li-3_0 qowt-list\"><strong>Data security</strong>. <span id=\"E326\">In order for AI applications to work, these systems need access to millions of data points. This creates possible weak spots and vulnerabilities for hackers to target and compromise.</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p>Despite these challenges, the beauty of AI lies in its <a id=\"E331\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/14/important-when-an-app-is-a-literal-lifesaver/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><span id=\"E332\">intelligence and brilliance</span></a><span id=\"E333\">. Not only are many of the world’s greatest minds dedicating their lives to improving and refining technology, but when you couple it with machine learning (ML), you get a self-fueling cycle of growth where every problem and mistakes ultimately paves the way for greater efficiency, accuracy, and opportunity. Speaking of opportunities, here are some of the top ones I see moving forward:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li class=\"qowt-li-3_0 qowt-list\"><strong>Makes big data easy</strong>. <span id=\"E338\">One of the issues businesses have with big data is finding ways to make sense of it. With so much information to sort through, discovering how to interpret and apply findings is difficult. AI can streamline this and lead to better, more efficient processes.</span></li>\n<li class=\"qowt-li-3_0 qowt-list\"><strong>Superior analysis</strong>. <span id=\"E343\">Certain AI systems can be used to monitor, detect, and analyze changes in various settings. Businesses can use it to keep an eye on competitors and understand things like price changes, PR activities, social engagement, etc.</span></li>\n<li class=\"qowt-li-3_0 qowt-list\"><strong>Smarter searches</strong>. <span id=\"E348\">The internet makes the world go around. In particular, search engines shape trends and control the flow of information. Search engine companies like Google are </span><a id=\"E349\" href=\"https://dev.co/ai/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><span id=\"E350\">using AI and ML</span></a><span id=\"E351\"> to transform the industry and deliver more accurate and timely results to customer searches.</span></li>\n</ul>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div id=\"contentsContainer\">\n<div id=\"contents\">\n<p id=\"E354\"><strong><span id=\"E355\">Looking Ahead</span></strong></p>\n<p id=\"E358\"><span id=\"E359\">Is AI perfect? As the tales in this article show, that would be a resounding no! But is it powerful and ever-improving? Yes on both. So as we look ahead to the next one, three, and five years, let’s remember that AI is a work in progress. And to get where we want to be, we have to deal with a bit of friction along the way. It comes with the territory.</span></p>\n</div>\n</div>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/31/failure-in-artificial-intelligence/\">Examples of Failure in Artificial Intelligence</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 01 Aug 2020 04:04:38 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ai-failure.jpg","linkMd5":"c2fab234d7f259b03622bd26fbefb96d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn98@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-09-730_dd9ad09d7e9100ed.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ai-failure.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1280,"sourceBytes":131662,"destBytes":90034,"author":"Nate Nead","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/ai-failure-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn80@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-13-782_14a23342ca3e3a20.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195869759},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:01","title":"The Top Work Operating Systems of 2020","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=167910","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/09/the-top-work-operating-systems-of-2020/\" title=\"The Top Work Operating Systems of 2020\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/The-Top-Work-Operating-Systems-of-2020-300x185.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"work operating systems\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/The-Top-Work-Operating-Systems-of-2020-300x185.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/The-Top-Work-Operating-Systems-of-2020-260x160.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/The-Top-Work-Operating-Systems-of-2020.png 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>You’ve heard of computer operating systems (OS) before. They’re the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/19/software-pre-launch-checklist-6-things-you-have-to-do/\">software</a> that supports a computer’s most basic functions. Think of an OS as the command hub for your computer, the central node that allows you to run all other programs and applications. Without it, you’d have to use long lines of code to get anything done. Even if you can’t explain what an operating system does, you’ve probably used one to run Windows, MacOS, or Android platforms.</p>\n<p>In an exciting shift, work operating systems are carving out a significant niche across all teams focused on operating productively and efficiently. Just like a computer OS, a work OS is a centralized platform for your team’s efforts. It’s where projects are planned, processes are tracked, and tasks are assigned and managed. Those key functions may sound simple, but they yield incredibly valuable benefits.</p>\n<p>A work OS puts the whole team on the same page, increasing clarity, transparency, and accountability. It streamlines work and cuts down on duplicated efforts and wasted labor. It provides valuable data on organizational productivity, making workflow optimization easier. And thanks to advances in AI and machine learning algorithms, many of these time-saving tweaks can be automated.</p>\n<p>As more organizations adopt a work OS, they’re becoming global, with hundreds of thousands of users on each. Looking to supercharge your company’s productivity or manage projects more effectively? Read on.</p>\n<h3><strong>1. <a href=\"https://www.smartsheet.com/s/task-software?s=261&#38;c=60&#38;m=3000&#38;utm_source=capterra&#38;utm_medium=cpc&#38;utm_campaign=task+management&#38;csrc=capterra\">Smartsheet</a></strong></h3>\n<p>From Cisco to Netflix, Smartsheet counts more than 3 million users of its task management software across 83,000 brands and 190 countries.</p>\n<p>It’s not hard to appreciate the appeal of Smartsheet. Setup takes only a matter of minutes. Subscribers can customize their own systems or draw from a library of existing templates to get under way. Collaboration and file sharing is simple. With automation integrations available, you can cut down on time spent on repetitive or basic tasks.</p>\n<p>Those kinds of features make Smartsheet a flexible one-stop operating system for all your workplace needs.</p>\n<h3><strong>2. <a href=\"https://monday.com/\">monday.com</a></strong></h3>\n<p>Work can be super complicated and hard. However, as monday.com, an emerging leader in the work OS category, proves, it doesn’t have to be either of those things.</p>\n<p>Its product offers aesthetically pleasing interface users love and get excited about. Upon logging in, you’ll see a palette of bright colors and an easy-to-use format. Anyone who can click, drag, drop and type won’t have trouble navigating its engaging format, which is why it’s widely used. And if you want help making the most of the platform, the brand has prepared engaging tutorials to guide you.</p>\n<p>But if the user experience of Monday.com is fun and games, its performance isn’t. It integrates seamlessly into your current programming suite, can be customized to different user interfaces, empowers you to build your own workflow to work the way you want, and brings powerful analytics to help optimize your workflow. No wonder organizations from the BBC to Uber use this colorful work OS.</p>\n<h3><strong>3. <a href=\"https://try.airtable.com/creativeteams?utm_source=capterra&#38;utm_medium=listing&#38;utm_campaign=capt-task&#38;r=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY2FwdGVycmEuY29tLw%3D%3D\">Airtable</a></strong></h3>\n<p>One of the defining traits of a good work OS is its interface. And it’s here that users often voice strong opinions on how they want to experience these solutions. Some prefer a calendar view; others like a spreadsheet that lays out categories clearly. The visually inclined like to browse icons; still, others dig <a href=\"https://www.atlassian.com/agile/kanban\">kanban</a>-style organization or forms to complete.</p>\n<p>How will you keep them all happy?</p>\n<p>Airtable offers a simple answer to this question: multiple display options for the dashboard that can be tailored to individual tastes. It’s an all-in-one collaboration solution that’s flexible enough to cater to the different needs of your workplace.</p>\n<h3><strong>4. <a href=\"https://www.notion.so/\">Notion</a></strong></h3>\n<p>Notion touts itself as an “all-in-one workspace.” That isn’t just branding; it’s a revolutionary consolidation of all the different parts of our work life into a single easy-to-use hub.</p>\n<p>To see how it works, consider how we typically work. At a meeting or in a conversation with a boss or client, we get a project going. Maybe we jot down a note or two and move on. Going into the project, we have to check old emails and the staff wiki to recall a standard procedure or two. Then there’s the breakdown and delegation of tasks. When the project’s complete, we take a few minutes to document and analyze our efficiency.</p>\n<p>Notion puts all these functions — notes and docs, knowledge bases, task management, and spreadsheet documentation — in one place. By simplifying how we work, Notion makes it much easier to manage everything we have on our plates in one place. That’s making workspaces much less confusing and distracting.</p>\n<h3><strong>5. <a href=\"https://asana.com/\">Asana</a></strong></h3>\n<p>Asana provides one of the longest-standing and most popular work OS programs on the market. Available via a number of subscriptions, it offers different capabilities to cater to the needs of various industries operating on all scales.</p>\n<p>The company built its reputation on no-nonsense structuring and tracking of workflows. Since its introduction, Asana has injected more engaging graphics into its once-staid system. Newer developments include improved analytics software and automated rules settings to cut down on remedial work.</p>\n<p>Given its size, influence, and power, Asana remains a competitive force in the task management space.</p>\n<h3><strong>6. <a href=\"https://trello.com/en-US\">Trello</a></strong></h3>\n<p>Before the advent of the work OS, there were yellow Post-it notes. They offered a simple but effective system (as long as the sticky notes kept their stickiness, that is).</p>\n<p>The designers at Trello have brought the user-friendliness of the Post-it into the Information Age. It’s a free application that takes just minutes to install and learn. You can type up individual “cards” or work from broader templates, mark tasks complete, and attach documents with ease.</p>\n<p>An application that works with the simplicity of notes on bulletin boards would be enough, but Trello also seamlessly integrates with existing communications programs like Slack. With Butler, users can automate some processes.</p>\n<p>Sometimes, the best approach is the simplest. Trello is proof of that.</p>\n<h3><strong>7. <a href=\"https://www.zoho.com/projects/?src=zoho-home&#38;ireft=ohome\">Zoho Projects</a></strong></h3>\n<p>A SaaS innovator based in India, Zoho Projects is just one offering among a more extensive suite of programs for office management. As such, it was created to run in tandem with other programs, both those within the larger Zoho constellation and with applications like Slack and Google Docs. That focus on integration makes Zoho distinctive — and incredibly useful.</p>\n<p>Like most work OSes, Zoho offers scheduling, task assignment, and collaborative features. It’s also on the cutting edge of analytics, with Gantt charts built into the UX. Another great feature is its time-logging integration, which is vital for contractors and hourly employees.</p>\n<p>Not for nothing, then, does Zoho Projects see itself as the most effective project management software you can get.</p>\n<p>It’s hard to imagine using computers without an OS, and it’s becoming equally hard to imagine work life without a working OS. Adopting one of these platforms will help you see what companies from Google to Netflix already know: Working on one centralized platform will change the way you do business.</p>\n<p>The post <a class=\"ql-align-justify\">The question about whether Real Estate or Stocks are <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/08/6-user-interface-musts-for-personal-finance-apps/\">your best options for a return</a> on your investment may become a moot point shortly after the big toss the last couple of weeks. Here is real estate vs stocks and which has a better return.</p>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">Most people are clear nowadays that you need <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/11/blockchain-metrics-will-add-transparency-to-investing-and-better-inform-investors/\">to have an investment strategy</a> that fits your budget as well as your needs. You have to plan for your retirement &#8212; it doesn&#8217;t just happen on its own. Are you saving for a college fund? Do you want to earn residual income? These are essential life and lifestyle strategies and decisions.</p>\n<h3 class=\"ql-align-justify\">Investing in stock sounds like an easy option and it&#8217;s a common investment option. Another standard and lucrative investment option is investment real estate.</h3>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">If you have invested in the right circumstances, real estate investments can turn out to be a low-risk strategy, offering greater diversification and yielding equal, if not better returns.</p>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">Many development companies can give you the right price for your investments. Let us have a look at both these investment options to see which one is the right option.</p>\n<h2>Investing in Real Estate</h2>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">When it comes to buying <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/06/where-will-ai-take-the-real-estate-market-in-10-years/\">real estate</a>, you are investing in physical land or property. Some real-estate options cost you money each month until the property is paid off.</p>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">When purchasing or <a href=\"https://jboitnott.com/the-cost-of-home-ownership-and-where-youre-probably-overspending/\">investing in real estate property</a>, you&#8217;ll want to maintain the property in order to get a good resale value. As with any investment, you have to spend some money out of your pocket in order to maintain your property.</p>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">That being said, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/04/getting-high-returns-on-real-estate-investment/\">many real estate properties</a> are cash-generating as well. If you invest with the right real estate company, you can find some properties which can generate some good chunks of profits for you.</p>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">If you invest in an apartment or buy a shop in a commercial complex, you will receive monthly rent for that. You can pay the expenses and keep the difference as a profit.</p>\n<h3 class=\"ql-align-justify\">Pros of Investing Real Estate:</h3>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">Let us discuss in brief the pros of investing in real estate:</p>\n<ol>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">The majority of the people are <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/06/19/3-ai-trends-every-real-estate-broker-should-know/\">familiar with investing in real estate</a>.</li>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">The real estate investment is tangible, and you can use and keep this investment it for yourself if you want. Some people buy and hold land and property and use it for personal needs.</li>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">Real estate serves as an inflation hedge.</li>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">The risk of fraud is less when it comes to investing in real estate.</li>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">Debt or leverage is more secure with real estate when compared to stocks.</li>\n</ol>\n<h3 class=\"ql-align-justify\">Cons of Investing in Real Estate:</h3>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\"><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/02/the-challenges-and-opportunities-for-automation-in-the-real-estate-industry/\">Investing in real estate</a> has some cons as well along with pros. Let us take a look at them as well:</p>\n<ol>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">Investing in real estate requires a lot of work when compared to investing in stocks.</li>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">Recurring costs may be incurred to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/15/how-iot-is-infiltrating-the-real-estate-market/\">maintain a real estate investment</a>.</li>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">There is often little or no scope for short term gains when it comes to investing in real estate. You&#8217;ll want to purchase your property and hang on to it for a time.</li>\n</ol>\n<h2>Investing in Stocks</h2>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">Investing in stocks means buying a piece of a company. The company can be in any industry. The investor is entitled to a share of profit for every share, which is owned by them.</p>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">You will likely not be able to merely look at a stock and be able to see its worth, and then purchase it. Investing in stocks needs a knowledge base of the &#8220;how-to.&#8221; Most often, stock traders have many years of school and experience.</p>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">Stock businesses have studied the trends in the market. Some feel there is a higher percentage of gambling or speculation in stocks. But any investment has some risks. Caution is required when it comes to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2011/12/07/how_social_media_is_changing_the_stock_market/\">investing in stocks</a>.</p>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">Stocks are always subject to economic cycles, monetary policies, tax rules in each country, and state, as well as under the ruling of each government, which is currently in power.</p>\n<h3 class=\"ql-align-justify\">Pros of Investing in Stocks:</h3>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">Here are the pros of investing in stocks:</p>\n<ol>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">Investing in stocks means owning a part of the business without having to do the work.</li>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">If the investment in the shares in a company which gives you regular dividends then this price increased every year.</li>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">Stock investments can be easily liquidated. For most stocks, you don’t need to wait for a long time to sell them.</li>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">Fewer formalities exist when starting to invest in stocks.</li>\n</ol>\n<h3 class=\"ql-align-justify\">Cons of Investing in Stocks:</h3>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">Let us have a look at the cons of investing in stocks:</p>\n<ol>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">Volatile markets and thus no guaranteed returns.</li>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">Influenced by a lot of pre-existing factors.</li>\n<li class=\"ql-align-justify\">Risk of fraud is more significant.</li>\n</ol>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">It seems clear that both options of stocks and real estate have their own pros and cons. All care should be taken when making a decision about either investment. Learn to understand the situation, the financial institution, and the business person you are dealing with.</p>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">If you are keen on investing in real estate &#8212; every country in the world has wonders to behold. My favorite place in the world is Hyderabad, India (BBG India dot com). Beautiful people, city, university, and more.</p>\n<p class=\"ql-align-justify\">Any city and country in the world will have various projects per your budget requirements. Consider the beauties of my <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/05/24/will-artificial-intelligence-ai-replace-real-estate-agents/\">country and a place for investing in property,</a> or stocks, and for building business opportunities.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/06/real-estate-vs-stocks-which-has-a-better-return/\">Real Estate vs Stocks: Which has a Better Return?</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 06 Mar 2020 21:00:01 href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/15/finance-automation-strategies-to-streamline-your-processes/\" title=\"Finance Automation Strategies to Streamline Your Processes\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Finance-Automation-Strategies-to-Streamline-Your-Processes-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"finance automation\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Finance-Automation-Strategies-to-Streamline-Your-Processes-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Finance-Automation-Strategies-to-Streamline-Your-Processes-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Finance-Automation-Strategies-to-Streamline-Your-Processes-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Finance-Automation-Strategies-to-Streamline-Your-Processes-1536x1024.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Finance-Automation-Strategies-to-Streamline-Your-Processes.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>If you&#8217;re still doing everything manually, then it&#8217;s time to discover how you can carve out more time in your day with automation. Sure, it might <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/09/4-obstacles-to-automation-get-over-them-now/\">sound intimidating in the beginning</a>, but once you find the right automation software, you&#8217;ll wonder why you didn&#8217;t dive into the tech pool sooner. Here is concrete advice on finance automation strategies and how to streamline your processes.</p>\n<p>There are so many ways for <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/11/outsource-or-automate-how-to-strategically-take-tasks-off-your-plate/\">businesses to automate nowadays</a> that it would be virtually impossible not to find a way to do it. Dispatchers can automate technician appointments, hospitals can automate patient check-ins, and finance departments can automate many of their most complicated tasks.</p>\n<h2>Automation is Key to Streamline Your Processes</h2>\n<p>Change can be hard, but it can also be necessary. In today&#8217;s world, it feels like we are always running on all cylinders. It&#8217;s no longer necessary to spend an entire day on a task that could take just a few minutes with automation. It&#8217;s becoming increasingly important to keep up <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/29/3-knowledge-management-solutions-to-skyrocket-productivity/\">productivity and free up employees</a> for vital tasks that cannot be done with automation.</p>\n<p>It&#8217;s more important than ever to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/24/why-you-need-a-data-driven-framework-to-guide-employee-experience/\">make employees feel like they matter</a>. You want them to know that they are seen, and they are appreciated. It&#8217;s challenging to offer those personal one-on-one interactions when you&#8217;re too busy with paperwork to even look up from your desk.</p>\n<p>Automation is not about replacing employees. It&#8217;s about making time for them. When you automate, there&#8217;s more time for brainstorming and team lunches. There&#8217;s more money for it, too. Automation can not only save time, but it can also save a lot of unnecessary expense.</p>\n<h2>The Evolution of Bookkeeping</h2>\n<p>The days of manually adding every instance of business revenue and each expenditure are over. Even if you&#8217;re an Excel spreadsheet master, it can be incredibly time-consuming to track each line item by hand. Fortunately, you no longer have to.</p>\n<p>There&#8217;s now<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/05/marketing-automation-and-customer-service-how-are-they-connected/\"> dedicated software available</a> that makes bookkeeping more efficient than ever. Perhaps one of the highlights of software like <a href=\"https://www.xero.com/\">Xero</a> and <a href=\"https://www.freshbooks.com/\">FreshBooks </a>is the fact that it&#8217;s so intuitive and simple to use. You can now automate many of your most complicated bookkeeping tasks, all on par with best practices and industry standards.</p>\n<p>For example, you may have a service business where your employees are in the field all day servicing customers. At the end of each day, they return to headquarters to submit their sales and expense paperwork.</p>\n<p>With tools like <strong>-ServiceTitan</strong> that integrate directly with Quickbooks- that entire process is automated. You&#8217;ll not only save time, but you&#8217;re more guaranteed to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/08/exploring-the-convergence-of-the-iot-and-patient-safety/\">have consistent records</a> and accurate information, as well.</p>\n<h2>Manual Billing is a Thief of Your Time</h2>\n<p>Gone are the days when you would have to track every single outstanding invoice or manually send out each new one. With <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/09/how-to-make-the-most-of-your-software-developer-interview/\">automation, you can use software</a> that will do these tasks for you, or at least help you track them. Just imagine being able to open a spreadsheet and have a daily update waiting for you.</p>\n<p>So, what does that daily update include? Things like which invoices are due that day, which ones are now considered late, and which ones are ready to be billed. Everything is carefully laid out in one place so that you don&#8217;t need to do any guesswork.</p>\n<h2>Payday is Easier Than Ever</h2>\n<p>Many accounting managers put <a href=\"https://www.chamberofcommerce.com/business-advice/business/best-online-payroll-services\">payroll at the top of their list</a> of tasks they dread. There are so many different elements that need to be accounted for. If an employee used up vacation days or sick days, or if there was a holiday during the pay period, it all needs to be accounted for.</p>\n<p>There are also <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/14/man-or-machine-for-better-customer-service-use-both/\">varying tax brackets</a> that require different percentages to be withheld from a paycheck. Not to mention social security and Medicaid. There is no one size fits all solution when it comes to employee paychecks and tax withholding. This is where automation software can be a lifesaver.</p>\n<p>Software such as -BambooHR- collects employee payroll data not just for a pay period, but for the entire lifetime of their employment. <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/08/09/customer-data-management-a-crucial-step-to-increase-your-business/\">Retaining all the records</a> helps you track all of the important information you might need to refer back to one day. Best of all, it does this in an easy to use format that&#8217;s simple to navigate.</p>\n<p>Whatever f<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/26/theres-no-such-thing-as-time-management-only-self-management/\">inancial process you&#8217;re interested in automating</a>, you&#8217;re sure to find a software that does everything you need it to and more. You&#8217;ll wonder why you didn&#8217;t make the transition sooner.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Andrea Piacquadio; Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/15/finance-automation-strategies-to-streamline-your-processes/\">Finance Automation Strategies to Streamline Your Processes</a> appeared first on <a 23:17:52","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","title":"Heimplanet Backdoor Inflatable Tent","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=174339","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/11/heimplanet-backdoor-inflatable-tent/\" title=\"Heimplanet Backdoor Inflatable Tent\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/HeimplanetBackdoor4PersonTent-300x300.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"inflatable tent\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/HeimplanetBackdoor4PersonTent-300x300.jpg 300w,
