+0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Screen-Shot-2020-06-29-at-12.12.35-PM-300x300.png","linkMd5":"f00815b2fe550b7b484522ce8e1d67aa","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn37@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-07-989_fd8a2054f51889a3.webp","destWidth":300,"destHeight":300,"sourceBytes":130472,"destBytes":12304,"author":"Deanna Ritchie","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Screen-Shot-2020-06-29-at-12.12.35-PM-300x300.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn37@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-07-989_fd8a2054f51889a3.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Screen-Shot-2020-06-29-at-12.12.51-PM-300x260.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn79@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-10-881_e72ff775c5dc0189.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Screen-Shot-2020-06-29-at-1.20.47-PM-2-300x293.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn84@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-14-069_f50b6dcabf59216d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195872545},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:56","title":"These Three Industries are About to be Hit by AIoT","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171293","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/07/these-three-industries-are-about-to-be-hit-by-aiot/\" title=\"These Three Industries are About to be Hit by AIoT\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/These-Three-Industries-are-About-to-be-Hit-by-AIoT-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"AIoT in industries\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/These-Three-Industries-are-About-to-be-Hit-by-AIoT-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/These-Three-Industries-are-About-to-be-Hit-by-AIoT-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/These-Three-Industries-are-About-to-be-Hit-by-AIoT.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Artificial intelligence and the Internet of things (AIoT) is one of the newest players on the tech scene, and it&#8217;s already garnered attention at a rapid pace. That’s thanks to its compelling combination of intelligent cognition, edge computing, and autonomous capabilities. While IoT on its own is no doubt powerful, connected networks can only take things so far even when performing at peak. When AI is brought into the same picture, things get a serious upgrade.</p>\n<p>IoT is already well established and still set to grow, with more than <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/internet-of-things-report\">41 billion IoT devices</a> in use by 2027. What’s more, <a href=\"https://www.gartner.com/smarterwithgartner/3-ai-trends-for-enterprise-computing/\">Gartner predicts</a> that more than 80 percent of enterprise IoT projects will include an AI component by 2022. But just why is such widespread adoption on the cards?</p>\n<h3>Imagine if your IoT-powered infrastructure could run with the ability to self-repair.</h3>\n<p>Think, not only self-repair, but having the ability to apply predictive maintenance, and adjust to external variables automatically. AI promises to offer these gains due to its ability to analyze the vast amounts of real-time data gathered by IoT devices and make autonomous, intelligent decisions based on this data.</p>\n<p>AIoT holds the potential to drive productivity and efficiency for any enterprise that employs IoT technology. AIoT is also expected to be particularly transformative for manufacturing, autonomous vehicles and robotics. Let’s explore what happens to these industries when AI fuses with IoT.</p>\n<h2>Keeping Ahead of the Manufacturing Curve with AIoT</h2>\n<p>Smart factories and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/07/iot-ecosystem-creates-an-optimized-smart-warehouse/\">warehouses</a> were some of the earliest adopters of IoT technologies. The World Economic Forum already identified over 1000 smart factories in <a href=\"https://www.weforum.org/press/2019/07/scaling-intelligent-manufacturing-10-factories-leading-the-way-in-innovation/\">2018</a>. However, as more production plants and factories join the trend, the competitive edge they hold diminishes.</p>\n<p>AI is pegged to deliver the next competitive advantage for organizations that already have their IoT infrastructure in place. AIoT will further enhance the capabilities of factory devices such as remote sensors, smart meters, and production machines as they can process the vast amounts of data and allow devices to react to their environment intelligently. Such changes enable products to reach the market more quickly, production lines to automatically respond to external market demand and offer new business insights from the operational data.</p>\n<h4>Take the regular IoT setup &#8212; and add in AI.</h4>\n<p>With an IoT setup, machinery can send automatic service updates to the system so that maintenance repairs can be scheduled. With the addition of AI, this process becomes fully automated. The computer systems will place orders for the parts required and the scheduling set up.</p>\n<h4>Nokia production &#8211;Finland.</h4>\n<p>Nokia’s production site in Oulu, Finland saw productivity <a href=\"https://www.nokia.com/about-us/news/releases/2019/07/03/nokias-digitalization-of-its-5g-oulu-factory-recognized-by-the-world-economic-forum-as-an-advanced-4th-industrial-revolution-lighthouse/\">increase by 30%</a> and they’re now able to bring products to market 50% more quickly. A whole-digital approach combined with cutting-edge technology such as digital twins and intelligent automation made this possible.</p>\n<h4>Farming specialists prime additions.</h4>\n<p>The German digital farming specialists <a href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20190807005185/en/BASF-Ontera-Collaborate-Precision-Diagnostics-Support-Farmers\">BASF teamed forces with Ontera inc</a> to create an intelligent feedback system that adjusts directly in line with agricultural needs. The project uses computer vision to monitor crop and climate conditions which are fed back to the plant. If signs of pest damage or vitamin deficiency are detected, the plant will tailor the formula accordingly. The formula ensures the crops receive only the formulas they require at that point in time, reduces the production of unnecessary treatments, and helps to improve overall crop yield.</p>\n<h2>AIoT fuels the era of autonomy</h2>\n<p>Autonomy is another key deliverable promised to organizations that adopt IoT in their digital transformation strategies.</p>\n<p>Many public and private buildings have been keen to adopt the power of IoT to improve their operational systems and allow for real-time service adjustments. Smart heating systems are one example of how this trend is taking shape.</p>\n<p>AIoT helps to monitor variables such as weather, pollution levels, or the number of workers in specific locations and auto-adjust devices across the building. Knowing the exact occupancy numbers improves conditions for the users of the building, prevents unnecessary energy consumption, and lays the groundwork for predictive analytics.</p>\n<p>Toronto-based Ecobee uses a range of AI-powered smart thermostats that continually readjust based on incoming real-time data from occupancy and humidity sensors, exterior temperature readings, and predictions based on prior user behavior patterns. Ecobee&#8217;s latest feature even connects the system to time-in-use energy pricing that allows the AI model to prioritize energy usage when it&#8217;s cheapest.</p>\n<p>When talking about the future of AIoT, we touch on autonomous vehicles. <a href=\"https://www.mckinsey.com/industries/automotive-and-assembly/our-insights/disruptive-trends-that-will-transform-the-auto-industry\">McKinsey predicts</a> that up to 15% of all cars will be autonomous by 2030. AI provides data to the control system so that vehicles respond to objects, control speed, and change direction accurately.</p>\n<p>In the autonomous vehicles use case, pre-existing AI will fuse with new <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/23/for-self-driving-systems-infrastructure-and-industry-efficiency-are-everything/\">IoT infrastructures</a> to help cars stay up to date with traffic patterns, road closures and weather conditions in real time. The more connected devices that are built into traffic and municipal infrastructures, the stronger the benefits &#8211; such as <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/22/how-iot-will-play-an-important-role-in-traffic-management-for-smart-cities/\">reduced traffic</a> &#8211; are set to become a reality.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.ericsson.com/en/internet-of-things/iot-platform/iot-ecosystem/partners/veoneer\">Ericsson and Veoneer</a> partnered to develop a connected vehicle cloud to support the widespread adoption of this technology. The partnership will deliver vehicle-to-vehicle (V2V) and vehicle-to-everything (V2X) connectivity to ensure every autonomous vehicle on the road has the latest real-time data. Cloud-technology processes this data with minimal latency.</p>\n<h2>How Robotics is Enhanced with AIoT</h2>\n<p>The robotic sector as a whole saw significant growth in 2019, with investments of <a href=\"https://www.therobotreport.com/robotics-investments-recap-june-2019/\">$1.1 billion</a> in June alone. As with human intelligence, our external environment influences the decisions we make. Robots with real-time AIoT at their fingertips make smarter decisions and one step closer to <a href=\"https://www.wired.com/wiredinsider/2018/11/key-better-robotics-aiot/\">realistic intelligence</a>.</p>\n<p>Delivery robots like those made by <a href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/8/20/20812184/starship-delivery-robot-expansion-college-campus\">Starship Technologies</a> are a familiar sight in many cities and help brands deliver consumer and commercial goods quickly and reliably. These robots already rely on the power of IoT to help them navigate and reach their destinations. Now, companies are exploring how AI could help these robots communicate with customers using natural language processing. As home delivery services continue to increase in popularity, robots are extremely likely to grow alongside this trend.</p>\n<p>AIoT is also poised to make <a href=\"https://www.robotics.org/blog-article.cfm/Robotic-Surgery-The-Role-of-AI-and-Collaborative-Robots/181\">surgical robots</a> even more helpful. Smart operating theatres are connected to medical devices, real-time imaging, and patient health data. <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/15/decoding-the-future-trajectory-of-healthcare-with-ai/\">Surgical robots</a> can use this data to adjust decisions during delicate surgeries to improve patient outcomes.</p>\n<h2>The next level of productivity and precision</h2>\n<p>The power of AI is, at times, limited by the amount of readily available data for the algorithms to train, detect patterns and make predictions. As industries continue to adopt the benefits of IoT, and the number of connected devices grows, so too does the potential of AI.</p>\n<p>AIoT takes advantage of the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/15/3-programming-languages-offering-better-support-for-iot-development/\">vast pools of data</a> that are available in these connected environments to make smarter autonomous decisions and more accurate predictive analysis. Overall this helps organizations increase their productivity, create more efficient processes and even improve overall customer experience.</p>\n<p>While industries more traditionally associated with hardware, such as manufacturing, autonomous vehicles, and robotics, are early adopters of this technology, any industry that incorporates IoT in their processes could benefit from the same productivity boosts that AIoT promises.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/07/these-three-industries-are-about-to-be-hit-by-aiot/\">These Three Industries are About to be Hit by AIoT</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 07 Jun 2020 15:00:04 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/These-Three-Industries-are-About-to-be-Hit-by-AIoT.jpg","linkMd5":"ac0e6ee4450a719d470e70aa5acb2fd2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn76@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-20-511_e7c30d592f86a4ae.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/These-Three-Industries-are-About-to-be-Hit-by-AIoT.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":58664,"destBytes":54780,"author":"Przemek Lopaciuk","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/These-Three-Industries-are-About-to-be-Hit-by-AIoT-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn91@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-18-463_79ed09e8ff338c9e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195876918},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","title":"The Secret Behind Every Bestselling eBook","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173239","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/30/the-secret-behind-every-bestselling-ebook/\" title=\"The Secret Behind Every Bestselling eBook\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"210\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Secret-Behind-Every-Bestselling-eBook-300x210.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"bestselling ebook\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Secret-Behind-Every-Bestselling-eBook-300x210.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Secret-Behind-Every-Bestselling-eBook-900x629.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Secret-Behind-Every-Bestselling-eBook-229x160.jpg 229w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Secret-Behind-Every-Bestselling-eBook.jpg 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>With so many writers out there and books getting published left and right, it is only natural to believe that the competition for a book becoming a bestseller must be fierce. However, we’re here to tell you that if you follow the right guidelines and take the right steps, the road to getting that &#8220;bestseller&#8221; tag in front of your book on <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2014/11/14/amazon-kindle-update-sharing-caring/\">Kindle</a> is still achievable.</p>\n<h3>Back in the day, publishing a book always used to be in publishers’ favor.</h3>\n<p>It was up to them what they want to publish, how they market, and which books they take towards the best-seller market. A lot of politics went into this, and a lot of money exchanged hands as well.</p>\n<p>Amazon eliminated that trend by giving YOU the power. Now, everything from writing to publishing to setting prices and becoming a bestseller is in your hands. Amazon also broke down the &#8220;bestseller&#8221; tag and assigned it to niches, i.e. bestselling fiction, bestselling autobiography, etc. thus <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/03/how-to-get-maximum-social-media-exposure-by-scheduling-amid-the-covid-19-pandemic/\">giving writers a better chance at earning that tag</a>.</p>\n<p>The revenue of the eBook industry stands at <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/outlook/213/100/ebooks/worldwide#market-users\">$15.7 billion in 2020</a>, rising by 6.2% each year. At the same time, there are over 1.02 billion readers worldwide growing at a whopping 8% per annum. Around 8 million readers every year.</p>\n<h3>How can you become a bestseller and stand out from the crowd?</h3>\n<p>Here, we’ll explain in detail how you can do that, all the way from writing an eBook or getting one written, editing it, publishing and marketing in a way as to enjoy the esteemed bestseller badge to the fullest. If you’re wondering, apart from satiating the ego, the tag really does make a difference in terms of sales.</p>\n<h2>The Secrets Behind Every Bestselling eBook</h2>\n<p>These eBooks don’t fall from the sky, nor is there a spirit guiding bestselling authors about what to write and what not to write about. Every bestselling author started right where you are; in front of a screen, contemplating whether their idea is worth it or not.</p>\n<p>Here is what you need to do to craft the perfect eBook.</p>\n<h2>Decide on Your Niche</h2>\n<p>Deciding where your niche is, is where you will decide which way you’ll lean in your writing, and what category of ‘bestsellers’ you will be recognized in.</p>\n<p>When you are deciding your niche, it&#8217;s as simple as choosing a class in a <a href=\"https://www.lemans.org/en/24-hours-of-le-mans\">24 Hours of Le Man’s race</a>. Choose the fastest, most competed for niche.   Think: prototypes in Le Man’s talk and Fantasy in eBooks, or the C class, slower cars where there is competition, but it’s not as fierce. These are autobiographies and children’s books.</p>\n<p>You can go all-in and try your luck in numerous or all categories if you’re really confident about your idea. Make a decision here and stick to it. Changing genres from fantasy horror to crime thriller mid-writing is one of the worst things you can do to your eBook.</p>\n<p>Remember, sticking to one niche means you’re not only competing with fewer authors &#8212; but you also get more authority. You get recognized for one niche, which is better. Would you rather be a jack of all or a master of one?</p>\n<h2>Cover the Bases – Lay Out Your Idea &#38; Start on a Draft</h2>\n<p>You have a perfect idea. From the flawless introduction to the storyline, climax and perhaps, the end. Or you might be missing out on a few parts? Whatever the case, you need to pen it down and see how it feels.</p>\n<p>Sometimes, an idea feels like the best one out there, but when you put it to paper, it’s not that magical. A lot of thought and strategy goes into making any idea become the best one, and the first step in doing so is fleshing the idea out.</p>\n<p>Right now, it’s not about making sure it’s well-written and error-free – It’s all about you and your idea.</p>\n<p>Here’s what you should do:</p>\n<ol>\n<li><strong>L</strong><strong>ist our ideas</strong>. Write at least three different variants of your book. Make a rough abstract, include a climax and an ending. The more passionate you are about a given idea, the easier it will be to churn out words and finish. Read through each one, or have a friend do it for you &#8211; friends, if possible. Plural. Follow the most popular one.</li>\n<li><strong>Choose one, and formulate an outline.</strong> Once you’ve finalized a candidate, make a detailed outline. Try to keep it as neat as possible. As if this is the final draft (it isn&#8217;t, but still). This will motivate you to make a draft that you will be able to follow later on – a &#8220;stencil&#8221; of sorts.</li>\n<li>Now, it’s just time to fill in the blanks. This is a long and gruesome task – and you’ll also get to meet one of our writers’ best friends; <strong>writers’ block</strong>. You can also choose to hire eBook writing services for that if you feel like you don’t have the time to write your book. Just make sure it’s a trustworthy writing service – not a freelance eBook writer where there is a chance of someone stealing your intellectual property.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Remember, that “bestseller” banner only comes if you keep your readers happy and they leave good reviews. And even then, no matter your sales or the tag, it won’t save you negative reviews.</p>\n<h2>Edit Your eBook the Bestseller Way</h2>\n<p>It’s one thing to write the perfect eBook, it’s entirely another to edit it. Not as big a grind as writing, I’ll give you that &#8212; but it’s a beast to tackle in itself nonetheless. No, let me reiterate, it’s a <em>nightmare. </em></p>\n<p>If you look at some professional eBook writing services, you’ll see that they don’t expect writers to send perfect, error-free drafts every time. Instead, they have a team of editors who go through their work regularly.</p>\n<p>While there are numerous alternatives available out there for eBook publishing and marketing needs, editing is something that ends up being a major obstacle for many a writer. Seasoned editors usually have years of writing experience, thus know what exactly what to look for. Plus, the independent view also gives them an edge over first time eBook writers such as yourself – or even veteran writers at times.</p>\n<h3>You Can&#8217;t Edit Your Own Work</h3>\n<p>The prime reason behind why you can’t edit your own work is that you’re too close to your work. You editing your own work would be like a surgeon performing surgery on their family.</p>\n<p>Bestsellers usually leave editing to their agents or hire a third-party service to do that for them, or use online tools to root out grammatical mistakes. However, there are errors that go beyond what the eye can see.</p>\n<p>These include the story and semantic-related issues that online resources simply can’t cater to. Having said that, I would like to expand a little on my statement; editing your own eBook is <em>very </em>difficult; not an impossible feat.</p>\n<p>Here are some clever editing tricks to keep in mind when editing your own work. Doing so, you may be able to reduce the cost of an editor significantly if they’re charging you per edit. So, roll your sleeves up and let’s dive into your eBook together.</p>\n<h3>Take a Break</h3>\n<p>One of the biggest mistakes writers make (understandably) is to jump into editing right after they finish writing or the very next day. It is completely natural to want to publish your masterpiece the moment it’s done, but that is a bad idea.</p>\n<p>Your conscience might fight you over this, but wait a while after completion. Just set it aside, let it collect dust for at least a week. More, if possible. Just don’t let spiders make webs on it. Three weeks is more than enough.</p>\n<p>As you give it time, you start forgetting tiny details. If you start right away, these details are fresh in your mind and you unintentionally start skimming through the text, leaving behind a wide margin for error.</p>\n<p>As you start forgetting, you’ll look at the book with a <em>relatively </em>fresher set of eyes, thus highlighting mistakes even better. Remember, distance gives you perspective; and nothing is better at highlighting your mistakes than hindsight and perspective.</p>\n<h3>Don’t Try to Finish It in One Go</h3>\n<p>Even the most notable writer, Mark Twain, had his first book rejected by publishers and edited numerous times before getting published.</p>\n<p>Don’t be ashamed if there are edits. Go through your book slowly and take breaks every now and then to get a fresh perspective each time you come back.</p>\n<p>Remember, it’s an eBook, not an article. Grit to get over with editing and getting it published soon is one thing, leaving behind errors and typos is entirely another. Not only will it ruin your readers’ experience, but it will also be a major obstacle on your road to becoming a best-seller.</p>\n<p>Frankly, it’s embarrassing to have one of your readers point out a typo. A &#8220;friend&#8221; of mine learned that the hard way.</p>\n<p>I recommend going through your eBook at least <em>three</em> times, and taking your time each time if it’s your own. If it’s ghostwritten, reading it twice would be more than enough, highlighting any changes in your path. Put in comments and send the file back. Just remember not to overedit.</p>\n<ol>\n<li>First, cater to story elements. Look for any plot holes, misalignments, discontinuations, change in characters or genders, or other such problems. If you find any typos, fix them but don’t focus too much on them.</li>\n<li>In the second run, focus on grammar. This is where you fix every typo, put in every punctuation mark, cross every “t” and dot every “i.&#8221;</li>\n<li>Your third read will be just to finalize it. You’re simply preparing it for your editor now.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Even if you go through your book a hundred times, you will find mistakes each time you go over it. Only a third-person can tell you whether your book is bestseller material or not.</p>\n<h3>Use Online Tools</h3>\n<p>Online tools aren’t the best alternative to hiring a professional editor, but they do help reduce the cost significantly. Here are some online companions that you can use to help sort out grammatical errors from your book:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.grammarly.com/\">Grammarly</a>: By far one of the most popular online editing software out there, Grammarly takes the cake not just in popularity but in versatility, compatibility and ease-of usage as well. Correcting mistakes with Grammarly is just a matter of clicking on its suggestions. However, you can only get the most out of this app if you purchase the paid version. Otherwise, the edits are mostly grammatical.</li>\n<li><a href=\"http://www.hemingwayapp.com/\">Hemingway App</a>: The fiercest competitor Grammarly has as of yet, Hemmingway stands tall as the <em>free </em>editing tool that has been a friend of many a bestseller over the years. From grammatical mistakes to sentence structures and other mistakes, Hemingway is a great tool for all. The web version is free with more features than Grammarly’s free version.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://paperfellows.com/college-paper-writers\">Paper Writers</a>: This is not an online tool, per se, but a ‘forum’ of sorts where you can share your manuscript with other aspiring writers and readers. You can ask them to go through your manuscript and make edits. They act as an extra pair of eyes, for those of you who need them.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Don’t Overedit – It’s the Bane of Many a Writer</h3>\n<p>Editing is for a manuscript what seasoning is for a meal. It can either make your eBook shine and leave your readers wanting more, or make it bland and tasteless. However, just as adding too much salt, sugar or spice can ruin a perfect dish, over-editing can do the same to your manuscript.</p>\n<p>Publishing without editing is a definite possibility, but let me ask you; when was the last time you heard about a best-seller that had typos in it? Or plot holes?</p>\n<p>Yes, these books sell, and sometimes they sell well too, but you can’t go as far as saying that they’re best sellers. The same goes for an overediting manuscript. And when editing your eBook yourself, this is one of the most common problems that you could face.</p>\n<p>As you go over your story, you are bound to see some errors and you’ll fix them too. However, in the next run, you might feel that it didn’t need to be changed in the first place, change it in the next read, revert it again and so on. That’s you overediting.</p>\n<p>This usually happens if you sit with your manuscript too long &#8211; you start seeing issues where there are none. You’ll even see plot holes where the story makes perfect sense! Remember, just as you see others’ pastures greener than yours, they are going to see your grass greener than theirs.</p>\n<p>Edit your book once, twice, or thrice at most and then leave it. If you still feel there are problems with it, give it to someone else. Accept that you can’t do it yourself. That’s the bestseller’s way of editing.</p>\n<h2>Marketing Your eBook, the Best-Seller Way</h2>\n<p>Once you’ve edited your eBook to the best of your ability, it’s time to give it to a professional. While they work their magic, the figurative rule of eBook thumbs dictates that you start marketing your eBook.</p>\n<p>As they say, make hay while the sun shines.</p>\n<p>While the book’s idea is fresh in your head, start writing social media posts, creating Facebook banners, YouTube videos, pamphlets to distribute, texts to send to friends and family, and more. Start showcasing your eBook and prepare material for once the book gets published.</p>\n<p>Remember, if your story idea is even the slightest bit different than what’s out there in the market, and you’ve got the book edited right, the only thing that stands in your way toward becoming a bestseller is marketing.</p>\n<p>Once your book is published, if it’s successful you won’t get the time to focus on writing promotional stuff. So create content not just for now but for the future as well.</p>\n<p>Now, focus on building anticipation. In the future, tell readers <em>why </em>they need to buy your book instead of telling them what they’re waiting for. Here are some tips to help you market your book the bestseller way before it’s even done.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Posting <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/06/12/using-nano-influencers-to-promote-your-brand-on-social-media/\">social media posts</a> about your book.\n<ul>\n<li>Include tips and tricks</li>\n<li>Tell them what they’ll get</li>\n<li>Give them some value</li>\n<li>Make them think that they’re learning something new from the promotional content, how good will the book be?</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li>Post regular updates about the book’s progress – incorporate a countdown, if you can</li>\n<li>Make a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/28/4-video-lead-generation-strategies-for-more-engagement/\">&#8220;behind the scenes&#8221; video or blog post</a></li>\n<li>Tell your followers about the challenges you had to face when writing – no need to mention your freelance writers or the eBook writing services you hired if any</li>\n<li>Create an event on Google and social media</li>\n<li>Engage your audience with questions and giveaways</li>\n<li>Plan and schedule interviews</li>\n<li>Plan and schedule book signings. Use <a href=\"https://kdp.amazon.com/en_US/l/print-on-demand\">Amazon’s Print of Demand Service</a> to your advantage. That’s a bestseller move that builds anticipation</li>\n</ul>\n<h2>Publishing Like Bestsellers – Print or eBook?</h2>\n<p>You’re not just publishing for the sake of publishing, you’re doing it to win. You’re looking to become a bestseller &#8212; so your marketing and publishing medium needs to reflect that. As you saw above, the marketing phase will be much more aggressive and writing will be more quality-intensive.</p>\n<p>Now comes the hard part; print or eBook?</p>\n<p>If your goal is to climb the New York Times bestseller list, you need to go with ‘print’ publishing. However, coming from NYT bestsellers, the tag is more hype and glamor than being actually more useful than Amazon’s bestseller tag.</p>\n<p>However, if making a passive income for yourself is what you’re really after, Amazon’s bestselling author tag is what you need. Plus, where you need to wait at least 6 to 12 months for the NYT bestseller tag, you only need a few weeks to become Amazon’s bestseller.</p>\n<p>Furthermore, if you choose to get your book printed, you will have to look for a publisher, sign a deal with them and give away a hefty share of your royalties as well. Though you do get to enjoy a <em>slightly </em>higher status, consider how hard it is to get accepted by these publishers.</p>\n<p>But if we come down to brass tacks, the process of getting a deal from one of the big publishers out there is unnecessarily complicated. Amazon has presented people with a good alternative, and sales aren’t any less for eBooks compared to physical books, especially in 2020.</p>\n<p>In fact, if you look at the total traffic volume on eBook selling platforms and sales during the first three months of COVID-19 lockdown, you’ll see that people are actually buying more eBooks than printed books! And we don’t mean digital copies of physical books, but actual, self-published eBooks.</p>\n<p>The following graph shows how the lockdown has increased the number of visits to <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/1112583/covid-19-impact-books-e-commerce-site-traffic-global/\">1.51 billion</a> in March 2020, from January’s 1.34 billion. As visits have grown, so have the number of books sold.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/1112583/covid-19-impact-books-e-commerce-site-traffic-global/\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-173241 \" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/1-3.png\" alt=\"Graph depicting the number of visits to eBook selling platforms due to the lockdowns\" width=\"614\" height=\"383\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/1-3.png 1124w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/1-3-300x187.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/1-3-900x562.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/1-3-256x160.png 256w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 614px) 100vw, 614px\" /></a></p>\n<h2>Wear Your Sunglasses Because It’s Time to Become a Bestseller</h2>\n<p>Now that you’ve published your eBook on whatever medium you choose, wait. It’s just a matter of time before you get an email congratulating you on your success. However, just because you’ve clicked the publish button and money has started rolling in, it doesn’t mean you can stop marketing.</p>\n<p>As mentioned above, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/07/refocusing-media-operations-during-pandemic-long-term-growth/\">that is what will drive sales</a> and get you past the finish line &#8212; and that is where most published authors stop putting in the effort.</p>\n<p>Don’t be like those writers. You set out to be a bestseller &#8212; don’t quit before that. Keep on <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/28/how-to-tap-into-the-power-of-organic-marketing/\">posting promotional content</a>, keep on responding to reviews, and most importantly, be active on social media.</p>\n<p>You might be inclined to start working on your second book at that point, but that is not what bestsellers do unless they have a launch team driving sales as they continue working. If you’re cutting costs, just jot down your idea somewhere like you did for this book and put it aside.</p>\n<p>That book can wait – it hasn&#8217;t even crossed anyone’s mind yet. Focus on what’s out there. Put your efforts into marketing and you shall reap the rewards for it.</p>\n<p>Don’t get up every day and get depressed because someone else holds the Amazon bestseller tag. Remember Amazon doesn’t have just <em>one </em>bestseller, but quite a few at the same time. Just keep an eye on the market and current trends, and if a book similar to yours gets popular instead of your own, you’re in luck.</p>\n<p>Use what we in the business call &#8220;second-hand marketing.&#8221; Target people who read that book. You can find them in the review section of Amazon or perhaps on <a href=\"https://www.goodreads.com/\">Goodreads</a>. Tell them via email or social media that since they liked that book, you think they’ll like this one too.</p>\n<p>Just try to be nice about it. If they’re not interested, don’t trust your book onto them. It’s a bit of a trial and error game, but you’ll get the hang of it eventually. If you’re nice about it, people will be inclined to leave a positive review as well. And word of mouth <em>sells</em>. Unlike any other form of marketing &#8212; sales by word of mouth is what you want.</p>\n<p>Here’s how many books you need to sell to become a bestseller:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>New York Times</strong>: 9,000 copies</li>\n<li><strong>The Wall Street Journal</strong>: 3,000 books</li>\n<li><strong>Amazon</strong>: Depends on books being sold in your category</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The last category is why, if you’re publishing an eBook on Amazon, you need to be careful about what niche or category you’re choosing. Try to choose one with the least competition. But if you have written or gotten an exceptional eBook Ghostwritten from professionals or freelance eBook writers, the competition won’t even matter.</p>\n<p>If you have applied any of the tips we mentioned above, or perhaps all of them, congratulations. You’re on the right path towards becoming a bestseller. If you haven’t, we hope our guide was of some use to you.</p>\n<p>If you think we missed out on something or want to pitch in your two cents, get in touch with us down in the comments. We’d love to hear what you have to say.</p>\n<p><em>Top Image Credit: Andrea Piacquadio; Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/30/the-secret-behind-every-bestselling-ebook/\">The Secret Behind Every Bestselling eBook</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 30 Jul 2020 19:26:57 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Secret-Behind-Every-Bestselling-eBook.jpg","linkMd5":"c0695225ad19450fd95c779f0aabd5d0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn4@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-24-087_f58e709cd10d5a73.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Secret-Behind-Every-Bestselling-eBook.jpg","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":894,"sourceBytes":99334,"destBytes":49856,"author":"Rob Davis","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Secret-Behind-Every-Bestselling-eBook-300x210.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn36@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-17-225_79e6b2d6448857fc.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/1-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn60@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-11-182_280766db501781cc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195873321},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","title":"Why Search Rankings Seem So Volatile","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=174448","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/12/why-search-rankings-seem-so-volatile/\" title=\"Why Search Rankings Seem So Volatile\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/online-search-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/online-search-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/online-search-900x599.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/online-search-241x160.jpg 241w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/online-search-1536x1022.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/online-search.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">If you’ve ever spent time optimizing a website for search engines via search engine optimization (SEO), you’ve likely felt the pain of seeing your rankings plummet after an unexpected update. Even if you’ve never heard of SEO, you’ve likely conducted an identical search query on multiple occasions and gotten strangely different results.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">The goal of Google search (</span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2010/04/07/search_engines_in_march_ask_continues_to_grow_-_bi/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">and other search engines</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">) is to provide you with the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/28/how-to-tap-into-the-power-of-organic-marketing/\">best possible results on the web</a> for a given query. So is it reasonable to think that the “best possible” website for your query changes on a regular basis?</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Maybe—but let’s take a deeper look at what makes search engine rankings so volatile.</span></p>\n<p><b>The Basics: How Search Rankings Are Calculated</b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">To understand why search rankings are volatile, you first have to understand how search rankings are calculated. Google works much like other search engines, and it’s the dominant competitor in the search engine market, so we’ll use it as our main example.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Google starts by putting together an index of websites and pages throughout the web. If the internet is every book ever written, the index is a kind of properly organized library, where the correct book and correct page can be found relatively easily.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">When a user inputs a query, Google attempts to bring that user the best possible results in its search engine results pages (SERPs). To do that, it needs to provide results that are both contextually relevant and trustworthy.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Contextually relevant content is chosen based on</span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/02/volumetric-video-is-becoming-a-key-content-for-vr/\"> <span style=\"font-weight: 400\">the type of content it is</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400\"> and its relationship to the initial query. For example, if you search for something like “tech startups,” you’ll want to find actual tech startups or articles about them, rather than content about hot dog stands or water balloons. This seems obvious, but coding a machine to determine relevance is more complex than it first appears.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">To be trustworthy, a website needs to prove that it’s a reliable resource for others. The easiest way to do this is to <a href=\"https://www.podbean.com/media/share/dir-t55tp-8bc1136\">earn many high-quality links</a> from other trusted publishers; the number and quality of links you have will directly increase your authority, helping you rank higher. This is why so many brands rely on an outside</span><a href=\"https://seo.co/link-building-services/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400\"> link building service for SEO</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400\"> to increase their authority and climb the ranks.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">With this understanding, why is it that search rankings change so frequently?</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">There are many explanations.</span></p>\n<p><b>Search Engine Algorithm Updates</b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">First, you have to think about search engine algorithm updates. Google’s ranking algorithm isn’t a stagnant swath of code; it’s something that evolves on a regular basis.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Throughout Google’s first decade of existence, the algorithm went through some massive changes. Webmasters and content creators were quick to try and game the system, manipulating their content and spamming links as black hat tactics to improve their rankings. To combat this, Google refined its parameters for what it considered to be “quality” content. In the early 2010s, a series of major updates named after animals (Panda, Penguin, and Hummingbird, to be exact) helped establish better standards for content evaluation, link evaluation, and query interpretation, respectively.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Since then, Google has introduced a high number of smaller, yet impactful updates. In fact, there were thousands of micro-updates in 2018 alone. Google is notoriously tight-lipped about these updates and how they function; in fact, sometimes it denies having issued an update at all. However, through data analysis, search optimizers can figure out the gist of the new update.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">New updates can do a lot of things. They can refine how Google evaluates content; if your best content suddenly doesn’t look so impressive, you might fall in rankings. They can refine how Google evaluates links; if any of your inbound links are considered to have higher or lower authority, it can impact your site’s overall authority. They can also change how they analyze user queries, affecting your likelihood of being</span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/08/customer-relationships-the-benefits-of-using-crm-software-for-startups/\"> <span style=\"font-weight: 400\">deemed “relevant” to your customers</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">. They can even add new features, changing what an SERP looks like, or introducing new content entries that compete with yours.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Almost any change, even a minor one, can affect the global landscape of search rankings. And because updates are so frequent, it’s only natural that search rankings get shaken up on a regular basis. Fortunately, most updates are small, and many of them only impact certain industries or types of sites, so it’s not a total free-for-all.</span></p>\n<p><b>Content Updates</b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Search rankings also change because the content on the web is changing. Remember, if you’re constantly updating your site with technical changes, new content, and new inbound links, there are likely thousands, if not millions of people like you doing the same things.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">The internet is a complex tapestry that’s constantly changing. Every time someone enters a new search query, Google is forced to consider a completely new set of circumstances. Did a link from a new, high-authority source finally push your competitor past you in terms of authority? Did you come out with a new blog post that’s more interesting or more relevant than the content that came before it?</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">When combined with the sheer frequency of updates to Google’s search algorithm, it’s plain to see why there are so many disruptions in search rankings.</span></p>\n<p><b>Other Factors to Consider</b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Updates and new content aren’t the only factors to consider when it comes to search engine volatility, of course. There’s also:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">         </span><b>Personalization. </b><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Google has increasingly dedicated attention to personalizing its search results, using factors like demographic information, location information, and previous searches to tailor its search results. Accordingly, if you conduct two identical searches at different times of day, or in different places, you might end up with surprisingly different results.</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">         </span><b>Machine learning.</b><span style=\"font-weight: 400\"> Some of Google’s latest updates, including RankBrain,</span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/06/machine-learning-software-testing/\"> <span style=\"font-weight: 400\">have machine learning elements</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400\"> that help them “learn” and automatically update on their own. RankBrain, for example, is constantly learning how people search, so it can better understand the context for long user queries. Google isn’t manually pushing updates here, so it’s only natural that it’s responsible for sudden and frequent changes—especially for long-tail keyword queries.</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">         </span><b>New features.</b><span style=\"font-weight: 400\"> Google’s updates sometimes introduce new features that change the layout of SERPs. For example, you might have noticed that Google often answers your queries directly with “rich answers,” helping you forgo the need to click a link to find the answer yourself.</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">         </span><b>Index updates.</b><span style=\"font-weight: 400\"> The index Google uses to rank queries is also frequently refreshing. New content isn’t instantly added to the index; it typically takes time to become available.</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>How to Reduce Volatility</b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">If you’re interested in ranking higher in search engines, you’ll likely be interested in reducing volatility. Is there a way to keep your rankings more consistent?</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">The short answer is no. It’s important to update your site regularly, adhering to new technological standards and introducing new content for your visitors, and those changes alone will impact how you rank. Even if you kept everything completely consistent, the sites you’re competing with would be adding new content and making changes daily, and Google would constantly be refining how it considers and ranks search results.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">That said, you can rest assured that Google’s motivations—to give users the best possible online experience—will remain consistent. As long as you’re making a genuine effort to make user experiences better, and provide them with the content they want to see, you should be capable of steadily increasing your rankings.</span></p>\n<p><b>The Future of Volatility in Search Rankings</b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Google has gone from introducing occasional, major overhauls to its search algorithm to releasing a constant stream of smaller tweaks as updates. Accordingly, we can assume Google is satisfied with the way its algorithm works, and the future will be mostly geared toward making small, gradual improvements. Volatility in the future will likely be less extreme, but more common; search rankings will change constantly, but the major boosts and plummets will all but disappear.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400\">Some volatility is a good thing for search engines, since it means users are getting a more up-to-date, more carefully considered list of results. And with the current state of Google search and user expectations, volatility seems to be in a good place. </span></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/12/why-search-rankings-seem-so-volatile/\">Why Search Rankings Seem So Volatile</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 13 Jul 2020 03:52:00 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/online-search.jpg","linkMd5":"0cca01211e1161353375f13a0e7c9478","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn71@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-26-022_7d313f27d8ed8030.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/online-search.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1277,"sourceBytes":148699,"destBytes":116828,"author":"Nate Nead","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/online-search-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn88@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-13-153_1d4b3dd8b62319dc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195873502},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","title":"How Voice Technology is Changing the Financial Industry ","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=164890","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/20/how-voice-technology-is-changing-the-financial-industry/\" title=\"How Voice Technology is Changing the Financial Industry \"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/How-Voice-Technology-is-Changing-the-Financial-Industry--300x185.jpeg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"voice tech financial industry\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/How-Voice-Technology-is-Changing-the-Financial-Industry--300x185.jpeg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/How-Voice-Technology-is-Changing-the-Financial-Industry--260x160.jpeg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/How-Voice-Technology-is-Changing-the-Financial-Industry-.jpeg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Speech recognition and voice technologies have advanced rapidly in the last few years. Most people use <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/22/evolution-of-speech-technology/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">voice-recognition</a> on a regular basis, interacting with Siri, Alexa, or Cortana. In fact, <a href=\"https://www.capgemini.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/dti-conversational-commerce.pdf\">51%</a> of consumers are already using <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/25/how-voice-assistant-marketing-can-future-proof-your-brand/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">voice-enabled virtual assistants</a> via a smartphone. Here is how voice technology is changing the financial industry.</p>\n<h2>Voice-enabled devices are to save time, to make things easier, and to be more efficient.</h2>\n<p>When on the road, for example, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/24/3-ways-tech-startups-are-using-ai-to-revolutionize-customer-experience/\">consumers need a hands-free option</a>. While consumers are perfectly comfortable asking Alexa to play a new song or for the weather forecast, they are a bit more wary of using voice recognition with banking.</p>\n<h3>Financial institutions, however, have seen a lot of advancements with AI-powered voice technology.</h3>\n<p>Many are now pushing internal projects or partnering with fintech in order to offer more robust voice-activation services. And while this industry has the added challenge of consumer trust, this technology is truly taking off in this space.</p>\n<h2>Customer service is key.</h2>\n<p>One reason why voice technology has taken off in the banking sector is to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/09/banking-is-the-next-personal-assistant/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">improve customer service</a>. Thanks to machine learning, this technology can understand accents, slang, dialects, intonation, emphasis, and more, making it easier to interact with and faster to get questions answered.</p>\n<p>Customers are increasingly <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/01/10/reimagining-the-employee-experience-in-an-age-of-ai/\">frustrated with outdated technology</a> that either sends them to the wrong place or places them in long wait times. Financial institutions cannot afford to annoy their customers since the rise of fintech has created serious competition in this space.</p>\n<h4>Voice-driven customer service, therefore, is one key to keeping customers happy.</h4>\n<p>This technology can answer questions quickly and also understand if there is a particularly angry or upset customer that might need human assistance fast.</p>\n<p>Powered by <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/16/does-artificial-intelligence-help-fight-financial-fraud/\">artificial intelligence and machine learning</a>, voice-recognition software does not necessarily replace human employees either. Instead, it serves as an automated support staff that can categorize calls, answer questions, and direct customers to the right place.</p>\n<h2>Hands-free banking.</h2>\n<p>Voice payments are starting to pick up as more consumers become comfortable with this type of banking. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-voice-payments-report-2017-6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Business Insider</a> notes that the adoption of voice payments is set to grow from 8% to 31% of US adults by 2022. The report noted that the factors fueling this growth are “an explosion of voice-enabled devices, generational gains in AI, and a strong consumer value proposition for voice payments.”</p>\n<h4>Currently, touchless payments are typically only used for small e-commerce transactions.</h4>\n<p>But this will likely change &#8212; as consumers will become more reliant on virtual assistants and more comfortable with biometrics in banking.</p>\n<p>Those who currently use voice payments can send money to friends via platforms such as Venmo, Square Cash, or PayPal. These customers use Alexa to make a purchase and conduct bank transactions such as paying a credit card or making a transfer.</p>\n<h4>The potential for voice payments is enormous.</h4>\n<p>Once consumers adopt the technology &#8212; the world of e-commerce will impact how consumers find and buy products. Voice technology creates a new payment method for consumers to use that is even easier than the “one-tap purchase” option.</p>\n<h2>Overcoming security barriers.</h2>\n<p>Financial institutions are much more risk-averse than other companies and for good reason. <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/06/small-business-cybersecurity-threats-and-how-to-fix-the-fox/\">Security breaches</a> have far-reaching impacts beyond just frustrating customers. Given that, while <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/25/how-voice-assistant-marketing-can-future-proof-your-brand/\">voice technology is quickly evolving</a>, banks are less likely to launch these tools until they are fully secure.</p>\n<h3>Aside from ensuring the technology is sound, these companies will also have to convince the consumer that they are trustworthy.</h3>\n<p>Again, this is a more difficult task in this industry, where consumers are less likely to risk personal information being breached. Furthermore, any security problems will make consumers extremely unlikely to use this technology in the future.</p>\n<p>Another challenge is <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/07/what-the-rise-of-blockchain-can-teach-the-regulatory-environment/\">new regulatory compliance</a> mandates for global banks. The European Union’s revised Payment Services Directive (PSD2), which <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/06/its-time-to-truly-consider-the-privacy-implications-of-iot/\">requires strong customer authentication</a> (SCA), will also have effects on voice-activated payments.</p>\n<h3>Security obstacles are certainly daunting in fintech.</h3>\n<p>Those who are typically less risk-averse, are moving quickly on this technology, pushing innovation forward. Since voice-payments are still nascent and have yet to be widely adopted, first to market platforms will have a distinct advantage.</p>\n<p>While the security stakes are high, the consumer demand for personalization and fast-acting technology will push financial institutions forward in this endeavor.</p>\n<p>As with <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/09/a-web-developers-new-best-friend-is-the-ai-waiting-to-be-utilized/\">AI-powered chatbots</a>, consumers began to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/24/e-commerce-failures-and-mistakes-why-do-so-many-startups-fail/\">trust and rely on these features</a>, which means we can likely expect the same from voice technology.</p>\n<p><strong><em>Image Credit: Unsplash</em></strong></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/20/how-voice-technology-is-changing-the-financial-industry/\">How Voice Technology is Changing the Financial Industry </a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 20 Feb 2020 16:00:20 And, let&#8217;s be honest, the results are not great.</p>\n<p>Enter a new option that may make these video experiences look much more professional. The Papalook PA452 Pro webcam is a features-rich tool that improves the look of live and recorded video.</p>\n<h2>About the Papalook PA452 Pro Webcam</h2>\n<p>The <a href=\"https://papalook.com/products/papalook-1080p-hd-webcam-pa452-pro\">Papalook PA452</a> is a USB 1080p HD live Web camera. The USB webcam delivers 1080p video for all your conferencing and video needs. It has a high-quality manual focus lens set inside a dark silver rectangular body and face with a dark grey mirrored finish.</p>\n<h2>Features and Functionality</h2>\n<p>The smooth HD 1080P video with 30Fps makes it ideal for face-to-face Skype chatting, video conferencing, and YouTube recording. It has a high pixel-count CMOS sensor with 2.o super-large aperture and a four-layer film-coated optical glass lens. Other features include a built-in, omni-directional stereo microphone that filters out external noise.</p>\n<div id=\"r-1559027661145\" class=\"gf_row\" data-label=\"Row\" data-icon=\"gpicon-row\" data-id=\"1559027661145\">\n<div id=\"c-1559027661227\" class=\"gf_col-lg-12 gf_column\" data-id=\"1559027661227\">\n<div id=\"m-1559027704492\" class=\"module-wrap\" data-label=\"(P) Description\" data-icon=\"gpicon-product-description\" data-ver=\"1\" data-id=\"1559027704492\" data-status=\"dynamic\">\n<div class=\"module gf_module-left gf_module-left-lg gf_module--md gf_module--sm gf_module--xs gf_module- \" data-pid=\"2470778273856\" data-readmore=\"0\" data-moretext=\"Read More\" data-lesstext=\"Less\" data-readmoreheight=\"100px\">\n<div class=\"gf_product-desc\">\n<p>The webcam easily connects to your devices through a USB port, giving it plug and play functionality. There is a rear lever arm that offers additional support for when it&#8217;s placed on narrower screens. It also works well with the various tripods I tried it with.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-175660 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PapalookPA452Webcam-719x719.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"719\" height=\"719\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PapalookPA452Webcam-719x719.jpg 719w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PapalookPA452Webcam-300x300.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PapalookPA452Webcam-160x160.jpg 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PapalookPA452Webcam.jpg 1500w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 719px) 100vw, 719px\" /></p>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<h2>Pros and Cons</h2>\n<p>It&#8217;s really difficult to find anything wrong with this versatile webcam. The sound and picture quality are excellent. On both a Mac and PC, it&#8217;s driver-free. Other things I like are the monitor mount stability, tilt and rotation adjustment, and the manual focus.</p>\n<p>Set-up is easy, which always makes me happy because I don&#8217;t want to spend time fiddling around with gadgets. I need to get them to just plug, play, and do what I need them to do, which is what this webcam does for me.</p>\n<p>The price, which averages about $70, is very fair for all the clarity in sound and picture that it delivers. This makes it a great value for the investment. It is ideal for adding a great-looking video to your blog posts or to creating reviews or how-to videos for YouTube.</p>\n<p>If there was anything that I might change, it would be to change the LEDs to show me if the camera is actually active or not.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-175661 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PapalookWebcamwithMic-900x675.jpeg\" alt=\"\" width=\"900\" height=\"675\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PapalookWebcamwithMic-900x675.jpeg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PapalookWebcamwithMic-300x225.jpeg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PapalookWebcamwithMic-213x160.jpeg 213w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PapalookWebcamwithMic.jpeg 1440w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<h2>In the Box</h2>\n<p>You get the webcam and user manual.</p>\n<h2>Where to Buy</h2>\n<p>You can buy the Papalook webcam from the company&#8217;s website.
