Mic for Livestream, Recording, and Chat</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 12 Aug 2020 18:00:38 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PapalookWebcamVideo-300x286.jpg","linkMd5":"e884f31139dcd41058080e5f50baf41f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn10@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-07-814_1c99ca1a6ac6c335.webp","destWidth":300,"destHeight":286,"sourceBytes":10503,"destBytes":9746,"author":"Deanna Ritchie","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PapalookWebcamVideo-300x286.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn10@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-07-814_1c99ca1a6ac6c335.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PapalookPA452Webcam-719x719.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn84@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-12-286_cb08f1b09b5314b1.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/PapalookWebcamwithMic-900x675.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn48@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-12-914_c6247a90465c8f4d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195868060},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","title":"How Big Data Analytics Address COVID-19 Concern in Healthcare Industry?","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=174325","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/16/how-big-data-analytics-address-covid-19-concern-in-healthcare-industry/\" title=\"How Big Data Analytics Address COVID-19 Concern in Healthcare Industry?\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-could-Big-Data-Analytics-address-COVID-19-concern-in-Healthcare-Industry-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"big data analytics and covid\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-could-Big-Data-Analytics-address-COVID-19-concern-in-Healthcare-Industry-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-could-Big-Data-Analytics-address-COVID-19-concern-in-Healthcare-Industry-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-could-Big-Data-Analytics-address-COVID-19-concern-in-Healthcare-Industry.jpg 626w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>The Coronavirus Pandemic has spurred interest in big data to track the spread of the fast-moving pathogen and to plan disease prevention efforts. But the urgent need to contain the outbreak shouldn’t cloud thinking about big data’s potential to do more harm than good. Here is how big data analytics address COVID-19 concern in the healthcare industry.</p>\n<h3><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2012/10/02/how-big-data-is-improving-healthcare/\">Big data’s</a> blind spots could lead public health authorities astray, diverting critical resources from proven containment methods such as aggressive testing.</h3>\n<p>They could also lead to draconian restrictions that disproportionately impact the rights of those under- or misrepresented by the data. In Israel, the government’s cell phone location-tracking program has caused complaints that the authorities are erroneously confining people to their homes based on inaccurate location data.</p>\n<p>While the capacity of big data to help curb the coronavirus outbreak is, at best, uncertain, its risks to privacy are immense. Governments and companies have cited the anonymization of personal data as a key privacy safeguard, but multiple studies show that this may only delay rather than prevent the person’s re-identification.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/25/iot-can-put-your-data-at-risk-heres-how/\">Location data is particularly vulnerable</a> since it can be combined with public and private records to create an intricate and revealing map of a person’s movements, associations, and activities.</p>\n<h3><strong>Impact of Big Data Analytics in Healthcare on COVID-19 Outbreak</strong></h3>\n<p>COVID-19 has arrived with consequences that are grave and unsettling. Big Data lies at the heart of efforts to comprehend and forecast the impact that Coronavirus will have on all of us.</p>\n<p>The near real-time COVID-19 trackers that continuously pull data from sources around the world are helping healthcare workers, scientists, epidemiologists and policymakers aggregate and synthesize incident data on a global basis.</p>\n<p>There has been some interesting data resulting from GPS analyses of population movement by region, city, etc., which ultimately helps provide a view of the population’s compliance &#8212; or <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/13/accessibe/\">lack of compliance</a> &#8212; with social-distancing mandates.</p>\n<p>There are many <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/08/10-examples-of-how-to-use-data-to-pitch-press-during-covid-19/\">opportunities</a> to make the use of Big Data more impactful in situations like these as a society and as an industry, though no one yet been able to effectively leverage the power of Big Data in search of a cure.</p>\n<p>Ideas such as creating large scale COVID-19 Real World Evidence (RWE) studies that pull data from a variety of real-world sources — including patients now be treated in the hospital setting &#8212; could help accelerate the development of treatments in a more patient-centric and patient-friendly way.</p>\n<h3><strong>Global Big Data Analytics in Healthcare Industry Landscape</strong></h3>\n<p>According to Goldstein Market Intelligence research, the market size of big data analytics in the healthcare industry was valued at USD 16.90 billion in 2017 and is projected to reach USD 68.20 billion by 2025 and is expected to expand at a CAGR of 18.6% over the <a href=\"https://www.goldsteinresearch.com/report/big-data-analytics-healthcare-industry-discrete-market-report\">forecast period</a>.</p>\n<p>Based on types of analytics type, the descriptive analytics segment is anticipated to account for the largest share of the big data healthcare analytics market and continue to dominate the big data analytics in the healthcare industry during the forecast period.</p>\n<p>Based on geography, North America is expected to dominate the market followed by Europe during the forecast period, due to a rise in advancements in IoT and an increase in the demand for analytical models on patient information for better service delivery, government policies.</p>\n<h4><strong>Substantial Upsurge in Demand for Financial Analytics in Healthcare is Driving The Global Big Data Analytics in Healthcare Industry</strong></h4>\n<p>Every day, people working with various organizations around the world are generating a massive amount of data. The term “digital universe” quantitatively defines such massive amounts of data created, replicated, and consumed in a single year.</p>\n<p>The digital universe in 2017 expanded to about 16,000 EB or 16 zettabytes (ZB) and would expand to 40,000 EB by the year 2020.</p>\n<p>National Institutes of Health (NIH) recently <a href=\"https://www.nih.gov/\">announced</a> the “All of Us” initiative that aims to collect one million or more patient’s data such as EHR, including medical imaging, socio-behavioral, and environmental data over the next few years. EHRs have introduced many advantages in handling modern healthcare related data.</p>\n<p>The advantage of EHRs is that healthcare professionals have an<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/12/04/like-it-or-not-technology-and-media-companies-now-influence-healthcare/\"> improved access to the entire medical history</a> of a patient. The information includes medical diagnoses, prescriptions, data related to known allergies, demographics, clinical narratives, and the results obtained from various laboratory tests.</p>\n<p>Major factors driving the growth of<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/03/share-other-health-data-in-real-time-like-its-a-pandemic/\"> big data analytics in the healthcare</a> sector include substantial upsurge in demand for financial analytics. There is an increased demand for discovering structured and unstructured data existing in the healthcare industry, declining costs, and accessibility of big data software and services. There is also augmented adoption of novel technologies for data analytics in healthcare industry transformations, worldwide.</p>\n<p>Big Data Analytics have already made a significant impact on grounds related to healthcare: medical diagnosis from imaging data in medicine, quantifying lifestyle data in the fitness industry, to mention a few.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/16/how-big-data-analytics-address-covid-19-concern-in-healthcare-industry/\">How Big Data Analytics Address COVID-19 Concern in Healthcare Industry?</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 16 Jul 2020 21:00:08 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-could-Big-Data-Analytics-address-COVID-19-concern-in-Healthcare-Industry.jpg","linkMd5":"1e815d17c7c763e6e6a13c0902d08609","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn11@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-27-638_312afa6ccab38fce.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-could-Big-Data-Analytics-address-COVID-19-concern-in-Healthcare-Industry.jpg","destWidth":626,"destHeight":417,"sourceBytes":82334,"destBytes":31592,"author":"Steve Blade","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/How-could-Big-Data-Analytics-address-COVID-19-concern-in-Healthcare-Industry-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn96@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-13-110_30f65651be22f9a8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195872763},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","title":"Content Strategy Not Working? Here are the 6 Reasons Why","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173113","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/29/content-strategy-not-working-here-are-the-6-reasons-why/\" title=\"Content Strategy Not Working? Here are the 6 Reasons Why\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Content-Strategy-Not-Working-Here-are-the-6-Reasons-Why-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"content strategy\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Content-Strategy-Not-Working-Here-are-the-6-Reasons-Why-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Content-Strategy-Not-Working-Here-are-the-6-Reasons-Why-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Content-Strategy-Not-Working-Here-are-the-6-Reasons-Why.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Click on any blog related to content marketing and you will read “Content is the king” somewhere mentioned there. Content with the right content strategy helps you build your brand, make it visible to your audiences, boost customer trust, increase conversion rate, and even close sales. But does this ‘king’ bring everyone the same profits? Here is your content strategy not working? Here are six reasons why.</p>\n<p>Today, we see every one creating content, and over <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/state-of-marketing\">70%</a> of the marketers are even actively investing to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/20/how-to-scale-your-content-marketing/\">scale content marketing</a>. But the sad truth is &#8212; not all of these marketers are happy with the results they see.</p>\n<p><strong>In the majority of the cases, it is not the content that is to be blamed. It is rather the content strategy.</strong></p>\n<p>Despite putting in all the efforts to make the content work, many still see their content lost somewhere in the deep dark digital abyss.</p>\n<p>With minimal views, zero interaction, no engagement, and certainly no conversion, the dream of dominating the world with your content could instantly turn into a nightmare. But there is a ray of hope that will pull you out from failing at your content strategy.</p>\n<p>Here is a blog that will tell you the main reasons why your content strategy is failing and how you can fix the strategy to succeed.</p>\n<h2><strong>Because You Are Writing for the Bots and Not Humans</strong></h2>\n<p>One of the biggest mistakes that most of the companies make when following a content strategy is that they focus too much on making their content rank than making it interesting. Google bots have become super smart and would automatically rank your content if it is loved by the people.</p>\n<p><strong> If your target audiences are not able to connect with what you write &#8212; it will be of no value to your company.</strong></p>\n<p>You will never be serving your target audience if you stuff your content with keywords, key phrases, and links.</p>\n<p>Check for your content strategy.</p>\n<p>Is it totally backed by keyword analysis and nothing else? Are you just churning out new content every other day to make sure your keywords rank?</p>\n<p>If that’s the case, your content strategy is never going to work. Here are some mistakes in your content strategy that are taking you down.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Writing just enough (300 words) to fulfill Google guidelines without covering the complete topic.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Unnecessary stuffing the content with long and short tail keywords that make no sense to the reader.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Hyperlinking the content with just the service or product rather than linking it to informative pieces.</li>\n</ul>\n<p><b><i>Quick Fixing Tip:</i></b></p>\n<p>While writing content, you need to ensure that it is written with humans in mind and only optimized for search engines.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Create content that is catering to the needs of your readers and is still <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/26/5-seo-writing-tools-for-optimizing-your-content/\">optimized for search engines</a>.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Make sure it has at least <a href=\"https://99firms.com/blog/google-search-statistics/\">1,890</a> words. This way, it covers the complete topic and also makes Google web crawlers happy.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Keywords are important. Place them strategically. Primary keyword once in the first paragraph, title, and URL.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">To avoid keyword stuffing yet ranking for the same, use LSI keywords to make your content look more natural.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Link your content but make sure it is linking to both internal and external pages that provide value to your readers.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Images are important to keep your reader entertained. You can use these images to gain ranking as well by adding Alt Tags and ensuring it ranks on Google images. When <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/25/how-to-create-top-performing-content-on-google-according-to-science/\">creating top-performing content on Google</a>, you also need to add images with Alt Tags in it.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2><strong>Because You are Scared of Experimenting with Content Forms</strong></h2>\n<p>In an age when you are surrounded by content in all forms, limiting your content strategy to just blogs and articles is a sin. You might have a full-blown content strategy in place with a content calendar that ensures your writers churn out content pieces and post them on your website or external platforms. However, it is 2020 and your target audiences have gone far beyond consuming content through just one means.</p>\n<p>Each business starts its content strategy from ‘having a blog page.’ And it is <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/21/how-can-publishers-grow-traffic-after-the-latest-google-update/\">great as over 60% </a>of the businesses that acquired more customers had a blogging channel in place. But thinking that that’s enough is where you start failing.</p>\n<p>You need to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/30/personalizing-your-customer-service-with-6-strategies/\">study your buyer persona</a> and the stage they are in the buyer journey to offer them the required kind of content for a successful inbound marketing initiative as well.</p>\n<p>For example, a buyer in the awareness stage would like to have blogs and ebooks or guides around the topic. Those in the consideration stage might look for whitepapers, blogs on ‘tips’ or ‘best ways’, etc. And those in the decision stage of their journey would rather look for case studies, videos, industry reports in the niche.</p>\n<p>The mistake you are doing is that you are offering all types of buyers in all stages of their buyer journey with the same content. Neither are you looking at the buyer demographics nor on the stage of their journey to create customized content.</p>\n<p>If your content strategy is failing even in the times when content is the king, know that it is the time to diversify.</p>\n<h3><b>Quick Fixing Tip:</b></h3>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The best way to diversify your content strategy is by repurposing your content. This way, you don’t have to increase your team size to create all types of content. You simply need to repurpose the content that’s already available with you. In fact, <a href=\"https://neilpatel.com/blog/38-content-marketing-stats-that-every-marketer-needs-to-know/\">60%</a> of marketers use their one piece of content in two to five ways.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Turn your content into <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/10/22/7-dos-and-donts-for-app-preview-videos-if-you-want-a-shot-at-going-viral/\">different forms like videos,</a> podcasts, ebooks, pdfs, infographics, etc., to ensure it reaches audiences in the way they <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/11/09/how-to-expand-your-business-through-multi-channel-marketing/\">consume their content</a>.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Look for content that is already working with the audiences and update in to make it brand new. Add new pointers, create images, and make it eye-catchy, provide new examples, improve the layout, and much more to ensure it keeps the visitors engaged.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Create videos from your engaging blogs</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Make social media graphics to build your community of readers there</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Offer downloadable content in the form of pdfs, guides, whitepapers, etc.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Transform your long-form content into ebooks and send them across to your clients</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Create a buzz among your audience by creating a post that talks about the best round-up posts.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If you have some really good information-rich content, create webinars from them to build your authority in the niche</li>\n</ul>\n<h2><strong>Because Your Competitors Already Dominate the Niche</strong></h2>\n<p>Your content is good, you are producing all types of content, and even promoting it right. Yet, you are not able to succeed with your content marketing. Why?</p>\n<p>Maybe because your competitors are way too strong.</p>\n<p>Yes, one of the main reasons why a majority of the businesses see their content strategy failing is because they are up against industry giants. Many times, businesses are doing nothing wrong, it’s just that they are in an industry or market that is already dominated by big names. In such situations, it is only human to feel that it is not much you can do. But giving up should never be the case.</p>\n<p>Think you cannot fight the saturated or dominated market? You can.</p>\n<h3><b>Quick Fixing Tip:</b></h3>\n<p>If you are also in an industry where your competitors have left no scope for you and no matter what you do, your content is still not working, here is what you can do.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Offer problem-solving content to ensure that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/25/how-to-turn-your-sales-to-absolutely-what-you-want/\">your target audience</a> can rely on you for solutions</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Be consistent with your content delivery and never back down. Slowly and steadily, you will reach the top.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Start with building a small niche group of followers with your content and start expanding it.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Try the skyscraper method of creating content where you find the best piece of your competitor’s content and generate something even better.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Look where they are lacking through a thorough competitor analysis. There must be something they are missing out on and that’s where you need to hit with your content strategy.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2><strong>Because You Are Not Creating Valuable Content</strong></h2>\n<p>Producing content for content’s sake is not going to take you far. It should always provide some value to your audience. A very prominent reason why the majority of the companies do not succeed with their content is that they get too busy simply churning out content pieces one after the other without considering if it is working for their audiences or not.</p>\n<p>You are not thinking about your audience while creating content. It is only the numbers you are worried about. And the same thing has passed on to your writers as well. They aren’t worried about content quality or the value it would create with the readers, they are simply meeting the deadlines and targets of writing x number of words each day.</p>\n<h3><b>Quick Fixing Tip:</b></h3>\n<p>When it comes to writing valuable content for the audiences, there are many things you can do. Here are some of them:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Have a buyer persona and analyze the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/24/5-product-discovery-tips-for-building-solutions-customers-will-buy/\">characteristic of the audience</a> to know what kind of content they like. You need to find what clicks your audience and create content that engages them.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Your content team should be experienced and know how to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/25/5-steps-for-creating-effective-pillar-content/\">create high-quality content</a>. You cannot expect them to create great content if you haven’t familiarized them with your target buyer personas. Make sure they have complete information about your company’s offering, working process, and the target audience so that they can create valuable content.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Make your content stand out by adding some unique qualities to them and offer value in one way or the other.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Give a different angle or perspective to your content to ensure that it is creating more value for your audiences</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Talk to your sales or business development team to know the questions that the customers are actually asking and create content on that.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Pay attention to the content type that is not working with your target audience and either stop doing that in your strategy or try to improve them.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2><strong>Because Your Content Promotion is Not On Point</strong></h2>\n<p>Content marketing is not just about content. It’s second half talks about marketing and that is where most people fail. Many people have talented content writers who tell the company stories in a perfect manner while also offering value. But they lack in <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/25/5-steps-for-creating-effective-pillar-content/\">promoting the content</a> on the right channels.</p>\n<p>Your content strategy would definitely not work if you are doing nothing about the content once it has gone live on your website.</p>\n<p>How do you expect your users to find the content? Do you expect them to type your blog URL to reach the page? No one would do that, of course.</p>\n<p>How will they reach your content? They will reach your content when you <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/20/how-to-scale-your-content-marketing/\">know how to promote</a> it.</p>\n<p>Take, for example, <a href=\"https://www.robbierichards.com/seo/case-study-triple-traffic-in-30-days/\">Robbie Richards</a>, a professional that helps growth-stage SaaS companies with their SEO strategies. His page was just a month old with no backlinks or anything. Yet, he grew his traffic by 272% in just 30 days. How?</p>\n<p>Having a content strategy that emphasizes on creating great content and promoting it right. He used Buzzbundle tool, weekly round-ups, forum marketing, etc.</p>\n<h3><b>Quick Fixing Tip:</b></h3>\n<p>There are some simple and quick tips that can help you improve your content strategy through promotion.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Send out email newsletters to all your subscribers for your blog posts</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Share each of your blog posts on social media platforms that best suit your business and audience in a very engaging manner. Don’t forget, over <a href=\"https://www.pewresearch.org/internet/fact-sheet/social-media/\">74%</a> of your users are on social media. But make sure you target your content according to social media platforms. LinkedIn for business posts, Instagram for cultural posts, Pinterest for infographics, Twitter for mentioning industry experts, etc.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When sending out emails to your prospects, you can link your informative posts in the email to give them value and get more traffic on your site.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Reshare your content on different reposting channels like Medium etc., with your original link as canonical to reach out to wider audiences.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Answer questions on Quora, Reddit, etc., while linking to your blog post to get interested readers from there.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2><strong>Because You Aren’t Tracking Content or Wasting Your Data</strong></h2>\n<p>Data is imperative in today’s world and you need to make complete use of the data that you have to improve your content strategy. Basically, if you are not backing your content strategy with data, you are simply taking the guess-based approach. And that is not going to take you too far.</p>\n<p>It is important that you track each piece of content and know the numbers to not just formulate your content strategy but also improvise it accordingly.</p>\n<p>The data collected from tracking and analysis of content, marketing campaigns, and other similar things can be very useful in strengthening your content strategy and making it fool-proof.</p>\n<p><b><i>Quick Fixing Tip:</i></b></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Google Analytics, Hubspot Analytics, SEMrush, and many more tools are available to help you <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/12/how-to-measure-and-analyze-content-marketing-success/\">analyze your content performance</a></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Looks at the page views, bounce rates, average session, etc., to see how your content is performing</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">See the referral traffic and make sure sharing content there becomes a routine</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Have a monthly report to see where the traffic arrives most and from where. Create content and promotion strategies accordingly.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2><strong>On an Ending Note</strong></h2>\n<p>Like having a correct inbound strategy is imperative for digital engagement, a correct and fail-proof content strategy is also crucial for your success. In fact, if done right, your content strategy can get you three times more leads than paid search advertising. All you need to do is find the reasons why it is failing and fix them to succeed.</p>\n<p>In this blog, we covered all the major reasons that lead to the failure of content strategy and how you can quickly fix them. You can perform <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/15/a-comprehensive-guide-to-a-content-audit/\">content audits</a> regularly and see ho everything is working out. Once done, implement the quick fixing tips and do not forget to include these implementations in your content documentation as, without it, your strategy would not stand.</p>\n<h3>Key Takeaways:</h3>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">To make your content strategy work, make sure your content is written for humans and well-optimized for search engines.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Creating just one kind of content would bore your audience. Treat them with variety and serve them with a mix and match of video, blogs, podcasts, infographics, etc.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The content should always provide value to the readers and compel them to take some action.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Do not worry if your industry is already dominated. <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/21/a-better-customer-experience-why-little-things-matter/\">Offering value consistently</a> would help you carve your niche.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Just pushing down chunks of content on your website wouldn’t suffice. Promoting the content should take an important part of your content strategy.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You also need to monitor all your content efforts. Otherwise, how would you know what’s working and what’s not? With proper tracking, you can create more value-driven content that will resonate with your customers’ requirements.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/29/content-strategy-not-working-here-are-the-6-reasons-why/\">Content Strategy Not Working? Here are the 6 Reasons Why</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 29 Jul 2020 18:01:05 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Content-Strategy-Not-Working-Here-are-the-6-Reasons-Why.jpg","linkMd5":"45efaa89a9ab5818fef5ff7ad4cc7ae1","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn88@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-21-563_6544533f80a9c70f.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Content-Strategy-Not-Working-Here-are-the-6-Reasons-Why.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":45382,"destBytes":38220,"author":"Swati Sharma","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Content-Strategy-Not-Working-Here-are-the-6-Reasons-Why-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn44@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-11-963_7e8c73a9925f3c26.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195872537},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:59","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:59","title":"Intelligent Virtualization Technologies are Eliminating Data Silos Forever","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=165982","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/04/intelligent-virtualization-technologies-are-eliminating-data-silos-forever/\" title=\"Intelligent Virtualization Technologies are Eliminating Data Silos Forever\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Intelligent-Virtualization-Technologies-are-Eliminating-Data-Silos-Forever-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"intelligent virtualization tech\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Intelligent-Virtualization-Technologies-are-Eliminating-Data-Silos-Forever-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Intelligent-Virtualization-Technologies-are-Eliminating-Data-Silos-Forever-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Intelligent-Virtualization-Technologies-are-Eliminating-Data-Silos-Forever.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In an ever-accelerating information age, the companies most likely to succeed glean the most profitable insights from their data, faster and more nimbly than their competitors. For the data-driven enterprise today, you likely have game-changing insights into your business and your customers hidden throughout your vast troves of data. Here is why <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2013/04/02/steve-wozniak-explains-virtualization-video/\">intelligent virtualization technologies</a> are eliminating data silos forever.<br />\n</span></p>\n<h3><b>What Data Must be Consumerized</b>.</h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">However, to uncover these insights, your data must be consumerized. Consumerized means that the data must be readily available and readable to all stakeholders across the organization &#8212; while ensuring reliability and security. </span></p>\n<h3><b>Are data lakes going the way of the dodo? </b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Data is only going to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/18/ai-is-the-fourth-industrial-revolution-technology/\">continue becoming more diverse</a>, dynamic, and distributed. Many organizations attempt to collect all of their data and make it accessible by throwing it all into a data lake, which can hold raw data in its native format until it is needed for analysis. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Until recently, this practice has more or less been compelling enough; companies could afford to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/22/how-intelligent-data-addresses-the-chasm-in-cloud/\">wait for data scientists to collect</a>, translate, and analyze the myriad of different data types contained in data lakes. </span></p>\n<h4><strong>The need for immediate access to data has grown considerably.</strong></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> Organizations race to collect and analyze as much data as possible to gain even the slightest competitive advantage over their peers. Traditional data lakes can’t handle the ever-growing number of emerging data sources and new local databases being created. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Queries have to match the specific database you’re working with, so the more databases you have, the more query languages you’ll be forced to utilize. On top of all this, integrating disparate data in a data lake to make it accessible and universally legible still requires manual data engineering, which is intensely <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/18/5-ways-artificial-intelligence-is-transforming-recruitment-in-2019/\">time-consuming for data engineers</a> and data scientists.</span></p>\n<h4><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>The lack of agility in data lakes means they will no longer be adequate in a data-driven economy.</strong> </span></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Many organizations are, therefore turning to data virtualization to optimize their analytics and BI. The BI and data is connecting all of their data and making it readable and accessible from a single place. </span></p>\n<h3><b>Not all data virtualization is created equal.</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Data virtualization creates a software virtualization layer that integrates all of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/13/startup-essentials-stop-overcomplicating-your-processes/\">your data across the enterprise</a>. No matter what format the data is in, or which silos, servers or clouds the data resides in, it is translated into a common business language and accessible from a single portal. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In theory, this empowers organizations with a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/12/remote-work-woes-are-a-boon-for-mobile-data-collection-apps/\">shared data intellect</a> where all the different business units and business users gain immediate access to the data they need—having fast access enabling businesses to make data-driven decisions for a shared purpose.   </span></p>\n<h3><strong>However, many data virtualization solutions fall short of this promised Eden of analytics. There are a few critical reasons for this.</strong></h3>\n<h4><strong>Proprietary formats.</strong></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Many data virtualization providers consolidate and then translate all of an<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/06/top-5-areas-where-companies-want-iot-solutions/\"> organization’s data</a> into a proprietary format. While consolidation allows the data to be integrated into a single place for a single view, the vendor’s proprietary format often reduces the data to a lowest-common-denominator state. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The common-denominator state can result in some data getting skewed, losing specialized functionality, or even getting lost in translation. Some data may also require the context of its original database to be reliable. Thus, your company may be drawing insights from faulty data and making counterproductive business decisions. </span></p>\n<h4><strong>BI tool incompatibility.</strong></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">BI tools are a considerable investment for organizations. Most enterprise-level companies already have several different types of BI tools across various departments. For example, one department might use Tableau, while another uses Microsoft Power BI or Excel. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For big data analytics to work for enterprises, data has to be <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/31/how-are-the-top-mncs-using-big-data-analytics-to-their-advantage/\">easily discoverable and universally accessible</a> to all users, no matter what tools they prefer to use. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Proprietary data formats that many vendors use may not be interoperable with the technologies your company has already invested in.</span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Different tools use many different query languages and vary in the ways they display data. When data with incongruent definitions are integrated, costly errors in analysis can occur. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The ability to use the BI tool of choice is crucial to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/13/3-ways-the-iot-can-offer-innovative-solutions-to-serious-environmental-problems/\">minimizing business disruptions</a> and maximizing user productivity.</span></p>\n<h4><strong>Query limitations.</strong></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The more your data grows and evolves; the more complicated your queries will become &#8211; not ideal for analytics workloads and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/19/how-to-get-away-from-a-growth-mindset-and-start-to-scale/\">working with data at scale</a>. The more disparate data sources you have to manage, the more data engineering will be required to run fast, interactive queries. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Moving large volumes of data at query time for distributed joins does not work for interactive queries. It puts unpredictable and unacceptable stress on enterprise infrastructure, and simplistic data caching is insufficient for a dynamic query environment and today’s data sizes. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When you add BI and AI workloads to the mix, performance degrades quickly, driving end-users to seek other direct paths to the data, which undermines the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/18/how-virtualization-transforms-software-testing/\">benefits of data virtualization</a>.</span></p>\n<h5><strong>In addition to these scaling pitfalls, traditional virtualization products do a poor job of addressing analytics use cases.</strong></h5>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> Scaling out big and complex data services requires an intimate understanding of the details: statistics on the data, the databases involved, the load on those shared resources, use cases and intent of the data consumers, security constraints.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Virtualization solutions need to offer users a business-contextual view of their data that includes hierarchies, measures, dimensions, attributes, and time series.  </span></p>\n<h3><b>What data virtualization should provide.</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Most data virtualization solutions have not evolved at the same pace as today’s datasets and data science practices and still rely on traditional data federation approaches and simple caching techniques. There is, however, a next-generation, more <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/05/02/advantages-and-risks-of-cloud-computing-regarding-security/\">intelligent type of data virtualization</a> designed for today’s complex and time-sensitive BI requirements. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If your data virtualization solution does not provide you with the following capabilities, it simply isn’t intelligent enough.<br />\n</span></p>\n<h4><strong>Autonomous data engineering.</strong></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Human beings can never be perfect; luckily, computers can.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">A human simply cannot manage the complexity of a modern data architecture—at least not at the speed that business now requires to stay competitive. That’s why your data virtualization solution needs to provide autonomous data engineering.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Autonomous data engineering can automatically deduce optimizations based on countless connections and calculations that a human brain wouldn’t be able to conceive of. Machine learning (ML) is <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/21/is-business-intelligence-the-fastest-way-to-improve-customer-experience/\">leveraged to dissect all company data</a> and examine how it&#8217;s queried and integrated into data models being built by all users across the organization. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Automating, as many aspects of data engineering as possible save a significant amount of money and resources while freeing up data engineers to perform more complex tasks that are more valuable to the organization. </span></p>\n<h4><strong>Acceleration structures.</strong></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Intelligent data virtualization can also automatically <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/07/4-ways-to-prepare-for-the-next-wave-of-digital-transformation/\">place data into the specific database</a> where it will achieve optimal performance. </span></p>\n<h5><strong>There are many types of specialized data and different formats that are optimal for that data. </strong></h5>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Intelligent data virtualization can automatically <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/05/open-applications-and-solving-the-future-of-platform-economics/\">decide on what platform to place data</a> based on where it will generate the best performance. Different data platforms have distinct advantages and strengths. For example, if your data model and query are working with time-series data, intelligent data virtualization will place an acceleration structure in a database that is <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/22/the-boundaryless-era-the-time-for-distributed-teams/\">optimized for time series data</a>. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Automatically knowing which database has which strength and then leveraging it will take a traditional liability—the variability of all your different database types—and turn it into an advantage. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Acceleration structures <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/11/3-surprising-benefits-of-the-cloud-in-iot/\">provide significant savings on cloud operating costs</a>. Depending on the platform you&#8217;re using, you may be charged for the storage size of your database, the number of queries you run, the data being moved in a query, the number of rows in a question, the complexity of the query, or several other variables. </span></p>\n<h5><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>With Google BigQuery, for example, the amount you’re charged is proportional to the size of your database, and the complexity of the queries.</strong> </span></h5>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When you automatically use acceleration structures for both performance and cost optimization, you’re only charged for the query data you used in the acceleration aggregate, not the size of the entire database. </span></p>\n<h4><strong>Automatic data modeling.</strong></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The next generation of data virtualization doesn’t just translate and provide access to data; intelligent data virtualization can <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/27/how-will-ai-change-the-future-of-seo/\">automatically understand the capabilities</a> and limitations of each data platform. It automatically discovers what information is available and how it can be combined and integrated with other data when building models. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Intelligent data virtualization can reverse engineer data models and queries used to create legacy reports, so you can continue using the same report without having to rebuild data models or queries. If, for example, you created a TPS report in your old system, you will still be able to retrieve it in your new system.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> Past queries may have been run on old data, but they can still be translated and run on the new system without any rewrites. </span></p>\n<h4><strong>Self-service enablement.</strong><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><br />\n</span></i></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Many aspects of IT have become “democratized” in recent years—that is, advances in technology (particularly cloud) have made them <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/22/how-intelligent-data-addresses-the-chasm-in-cloud/\">accessible to laypersons</a> without extensive technological acumen. While analytics and business intelligence have lagged in the democratization trend, BI tools are now increasingly becoming usable for the average worker. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The BI usage has resulted in the growth of a new “self-service” analytics culture, where business users can directly access and analyze data with their own preferred BI tools, and not have to rely on data engineers or data analysts. </span></p>\n<h4><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>Self-service analytics is fast becoming a necessity for optimizing big data analytics in an organization.</strong> </span></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Let’s say, for example, the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/25/presentation-management-key-component-to-the-enterprise-sales-funnel/\">sales department has data</a> about the previous year’s spend but wants to augment it with data regarding customer behavior patterns in multiple areas. Or the marketing department needs to initiate an account-based marketing campaign that targets companies deemed most likely to switch vendors. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With self-service analytics, the business users in the sales or marketing department can access this data, and use it themselves with their own tools. The <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/02/3-ways-tech-can-help-you-scale/\">self-serve analytics</a> is used rather than having to rely on trained data engineers to source the data for BI tools, and on data scientists to model and predict outcomes. </span></p>\n<h5><strong>With the self-service dynamic allows each department in an organization to apply their own experience and expertise to BI, achieving a whole new level of agility. </strong></h5>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Intelligent data virtualization provides a business logic layer that virtually translates all of your data into a common business language that is both sources and tool-agnostic. With the logic layer, it means that business users can use any BI tool they prefer, and no users have to bend to a single standard for BI software. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">All data will be accessible no matter what or how many tools you use, and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/06/04/9-critical-questions-to-consider-when-assessing-a-conversational-ai-solution/\">all queries will return consistent answers</a>. The standard and logical explanations empower your organization with a shared data intellect and the self-service culture that&#8217;s growing increasingly necessary in today&#8217;s data-driven business landscape. </span></p>\n<h4><strong>No-hassle security.</strong></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In your quest to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/18/what-can-we-expect-for-iot-in-2020/\">consumerize your data</a>, you cannot sacrifice security and compliance, no matter the agility and cost benefits. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Virtualization layers have been known to pose security risks. However, with next-generation intelligent data virtualization, your data inherits all of the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/12/06/data-legislation-is-coming-can-you-get-compliant/\">security and governance policies of the database</a> where it resides. The standard governing procedures mean that your permissions and policies remain unchanged. </span></p>\n<h5><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>All existing security and privacy information are preserved down to individual users by tracking the data’s lineage and user identities.</strong> </span></h5>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Even when working with multiple databases with <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/11/are-you-making-a-major-security-mistake-with-paas/\">different security policies,</a> the policies are seamlessly merged, and all global security and compliance protocols are automatically applied. There are no additional steps needed to ensure security and compliance after adopting intelligent data virtualization.</span></p>\n<h3><b>Your data virtualization must evolve with the rest of your IT.</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As important as it is to have enterprise-wide, consumerized data that is readable, accessible, and reliable, many companies today are simply overwhelmed by the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/01/24/to-prevent-fraud-healthcare-organizations-must-streamline-their-data-processes/\">enormous volume of data</a>. The increasingly distributed model with dynamic and diverse formats and use cases add to the data. When users can’t quickly locate and analyze the data they need and be confident that it’s accurate and up-to-date, BI quality decreases, resulting in suboptimal – or even worse – gut-based decisions. </span></p>\n<h5><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>Data virtualization, therefore, needs to evolve to meet these new challenges and complexities so it can genuinely work for big data analytics.</strong> </span></h5>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If your <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/18/how-virtualization-transforms-software-testing/\">data virtualization solution</a> is not providing autonomous data engineering, acceleration structures, such as automatic data modeling, self-service analytics enablement, you have a problem. You need worry-free security, and compliance, or a multi-dimensional semantic layer that speaks the language of the platform. If you don&#8217;t have these processes &#8212; then your data virtualization solution &#8212; simply isn’t intelligent enough. </span></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/04/intelligent-virtualization-technologies-are-eliminating-data-silos-forever/\">Intelligent Virtualization Technologies are Eliminating Data Silos Forever</a> appliance in our house. It&#8217;s been through so many holiday meals not to mention all the recent baking we&#8217;ve found ourselves doing while stuck at home.</p>\n<p>Like everything else where we&#8217;ve cut the cord, the hand mixer has also gone cordless. KitchenAid has been our family&#8217;s go-to brand for mixers, so we thought it was as good a time as any to see what their cordless hand mixer could do.</p>\n<h2>About the Cordless 7-Speed Hand Mixer</h2>\n<p>The <a href=\"https://www.kitchenaid.com/countertop-appliances/hand-mixers/hand-mixer-products/p.cordless-7-speed-hand-mixer.khmb732bm.html\">KitchenAid cordless 7-speed hand mixer</a> just recently was released as part of its new cordless collection of small appliances. They also offer a cordless hand blender and cordless chopper. All use the same rechargeable lithium battery, making them compatible.</p>\n<h2>Colors and Features</h2>\n<p>Features include seven speeds that are similar to those on their hand mixer with a cord. These speeds let you mix, whip, and stir.The speeds make it ideal for all types of mixing needs, including egg whites, heavy cream, butter and sugar, mashed potatoes, and cookie dough.</p>\n<p>It includes a soft start feature, so the beaters come up gradually to the speed you&#8217;ve selected, reducing the risk of splatter.</p>\n<p>Other features include an ejector button and beater accessories. Its innovative design also allows it to stand on its own. A b<span class=\"a-list-item\">attery indicator light also lets you know when it is time to charge the battery. </span></p>\n<p>&#160;</p>\n<p>Color choices include our favorite, matte black. You can also select from numerous other colors, such as onyx black, passion red, matte charcoal gray, empire red, white, and blue velvet.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-175656 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/KitchenAidCordlessHandMixer.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"572\" height=\"1618\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/KitchenAidCordlessHandMixer.png 572w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/KitchenAidCordlessHandMixer-106x300.png 106w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/KitchenAidCordlessHandMixer-254x719.png 254w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/KitchenAidCordlessHandMixer-57x160.png 57w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/KitchenAidCordlessHandMixer-543x1536.png 543w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 572px) 100vw, 572px\" /></p>\n<h2>Pros and Cons</h2>\n<p>This is a convenient small appliance that gets it done. I like that it only takes two hours to completely recharge. While I haven&#8217;t attempted to see if it would work long enough to make 200 cookies like its website claims, it does seem to hang in there for as long as we need it for. KitchenAid does make high-quality appliances that are built to last. I particularly like their color options in recent years to personalize it more for what we like.</p>\n<p>The one con is that it doesn&#8217;t feel as powerful as our hand mixer that plugs into the wall, and it&#8217;s a decade or so old. There is a little sluggishness on the tougher to mix items, but we just whip out the stand mixer for that (a KitchenAid that is still going strong 20 years on!).</p>\n<h2>In the Box</h2>\n<p>The cordless mixer comes with a charger and two dishwasher-safe beater attachments.</p>\n<h2>Where to Buy</h2>\n<p>The KitchenAid website sells the cordless hand mixer for $99.99. You can also find it at Amazon, Bed Bath &#38; Beyond, Best Buy, QVC, and HSN.</p>\n<h2>Final Thoughts</h2>\n<p>When it&#8217;s time to upgrade your hand mixer, I would recommend going with this cordless design even with its slightly less power output. You can get a cordless hand mixer for $50 or $60. But, this cordless hand mixer is not that much more in price but gives you the freedom to move around the kitchen without hunting down an outlet.</p>\n<p>It&#8217;s even perfect for taking on the road in the RV. Plus, you can add more color to your kitchen.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" Appliance Into the Modern Age</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 10 Aug 2020 18:31:18 Ritchie","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/KitchenAidCordlessMixer-300x300.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn50@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-07-815_f5b93afc4094ea44.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/KitchenAidCordlessHandMixer.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn96@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-22-440_e153a41d9eb4f8b0.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195868060},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","title":"10 Practical Strategies to Secure Your Digital Life","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=174445","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/12/10-practical-strategies-to-secure-your-digital-life/\" title=\"10 Practical Strategies to Secure Your Digital Life\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Secure-your-digital-life-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"10 Practical Strategies to Secure Your Digital Life\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Secure-your-digital-life-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Secure-your-digital-life-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Secure-your-digital-life.jpg 747w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Is your cyber life secure? How do you know? Data security is critical more than ever before. If you’re not careful, you could end up victimized by any number of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/22/6-emerging-cyber-threats-to-lookout-for-in-2019/\">cyberattacks common in today’s world</a>. If other people use your network, not protecting your network puts their devices and data at risk.</p>\n<p>Here are 10 strategies to help you secure your digital life.</p>\n<h3>1. Implement a zero-trust architecture strategy for your business</h3>\n<p>Zero-trust is exactly what it sounds like. Rather than grant employees and contractors access to your entire network, a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/27/3-amazing-strategies-that-will-burst-cybercrimes-in-2020/\">zero-trust strategy</a> grants access to company data as needed. In other words, employees are given access only to the areas of the network necessary to do their job.</p>\n<h3>2. Implement strong network security strategies</h3>\n<p>Whether you’re running a small business or you’re a solopreneur, you need network security. High-tech network security protects your data from a plethora of breaches and attacks using hardware and software solutions.</p>\n<p>A <a href=\"https://www.checkpoint.com/cyber-hub/network-security/what-is-network-security/\">network security strategy</a> typically includes controlled network access, antivirus software, application security, endpoint security, firewalls, and strong analytics. With High-tech security, threats are detected and blocked in real-time. Strong network security will protect your network from common threats including:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Viruses</li>\n<li>Worms</li>\n<li>Trojans</li>\n<li>Spyware</li>\n<li>Adware</li>\n<li>Ransomware</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Cyberattacks are constantly evolving and becoming more dangerous every minute. If you’re storing personal information from your customers, you need strong network protection to prevent that data from being stolen or manipulated.</p>\n<h3>3. Use a VPN on private and public Wi-Fi networks</h3>\n<p>Your data is vulnerable when you connect to public Wi-Fi networks. While a VPN won’t give you 100% protection, it’s the best way to mitigate most risks. However, it’s also wise to use a VPN on a private network.</p>\n<p>A VPN does two main things: protects your identity/location and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2017/08/30/6-technologies-secure-iot-network-dl1/\">encrypts</a> your internet traffic. This comes in handy whether you’re on a public or private network.</p>\n<p>Normally, your internet traffic is passed through your internet service provider’s server. This gives your ISP access to all of your browsing history, which means they can hand it over to law enforcement, advertisers, or another third party. When you’re on a public Wi-Fi network, it works the same way – the ISP receives your browsing history.</p>\n<p>When using a VPN, your browsing history is encrypted and therefore impossible to read.</p>\n<p>Since a VPN encrypts your internet traffic, you’ll be protected from the hackers that like to sit around at coffee shops and hijack other people’s browsing sessions. If a hacker gets access to your computer through a public network, they could install a keystroke logger and get access to your bank account and any other online account you have.</p>\n<h3>4. Limit the amount of personal information you publish online</h3>\n<p>Each time you post personal information online, you’re making yourself more vulnerable should you ever become the victim of a data breach. Cybercriminals use individual pieces of data to piece together a full profile of an individual and use that information to commit crimes. For example, a criminal who has your full name and address might search your Facebook account for answers to the security questions to gain access to your online banking account.</p>\n<p>Posting bits of information may not seem harmful as you post, but the cumulative effect of posting personal information over a long period of time literally hands criminals the information needed to steal your identity.</p>\n<p>Some criminals use identities to open credit cards while others make fake ID cards to obtain loans. Some criminals use stolen identities to rack up utility bills when their own account has been shut off. There are a host of reasons why people steal personal data and the less information you publish, the better.</p>\n<h3>5. Shred every piece of mail you recycle or throw away</h3>\n<p>Cybercriminals don’t just look for information online. Sometimes they get information in the physical world by breaking into mailboxes and stealing trash. Yes, cybercriminals resort to stealing trash – and sometimes entire recycle bins – in an attempt to obtain personal data.</p>\n<p>Even junk mail can contain personal information you don’t want cybercriminals to have. Sometimes all they need is a phone number or the last 4 digits of your credit card. The only way to ensure cybercriminals don’t get that information from discarded mail is to shred it before you toss it.</p>\n<p>If you don’t have a paper shredder, take your mail to a mail store that provides shredding services or cut out your personal information and burn those pieces in a metal trash can. You can also get black permanent markers with a cross-hatch pattern to blackout data.</p>\n<h3>6. Stop saving your passwords in your browser</h3>\n<p>Most of the top browsers store your bookmarks and passwords in the cloud rather than on your local machine. This puts all of your login credentials at risk if your browser experiences a data breach.</p>\n<p>While you can use <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2007/06/13/do_we_need_password_management_services/\">password management applications</a> that store your passwords using one main password, your login credentials aren’t entirely safe. If your password application is installed on your local machine it’s safer than in the cloud. However, if your device gets stolen and you haven’t logged out of your password manager, you’re extremely vulnerable.</p>\n<p>It’s convenient to save all of your passwords, especially when you use complex passwords on a mobile device, but it’s always safer to enter your password each time. If you don’t want to type in your password each time you log into your accounts, that’s understandable. At the very least, stop saving your password for online financial accounts or accounts where your credit card data is stored (like Amazon).</p>\n<h3>7. Immediately secure your smart devices</h3>\n<p>Smart devices usually come with either no password or a factor-generated password printed in your device’s manual. Change – or set – this password immediately before connecting to the internet. If you don’t plan on connecting the smart device to the internet (like a TV, for example), then disable the Wi-Fi entirely.</p>\n<p>You should also <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/05/7-actionable-tips-to-secure-your-smart-home-and-iot-devices/\">create a separate Wi-Fi network</a> just for your IoT devices. If someone manages to hack into your device-only network, they won’t have access to your computer or other devices.</p>\n<h3>8. Mac users: turn Air Drop on/off for each use</h3>\n<p>For Mac users, it’s a good idea to turn AirDrop on and off for each use. You can set AirDrop to accept file transfers only from trusted devices, but that could be a problem if someone has already compromised your Mac to trust their device.</p>\n<p>The safest way to protect your Mac is to manually turn AirDrop on and off for each file transfer you perform. Additionally, if you’re not using Wi-Fi or Bluetooth, turn those features off until you need them.</p>\n<h3>9. Train contractors you employ, no matter how small their task</h3>\n<p>Sometimes you just need to hire someone to upload files you don’t have time to manage, or you need someone to perform ten minutes of work on your website. Small tasks can still place you at risk for a cyberattack if the person performing those tasks doesn’t take precautions.</p>\n<p>Always train any contractors (and friends) you hire to do quick work for you online. Make sure they aren’t performing the work from unsecured public Wi-Fi and if they must, then make sure they use a VPN.</p>\n<p>Be assertive and require their agreement to not store your passwords in their browser. Last, always create a unique account for each contractor and delete or disable the account the moment they’re done with the work.</p>\n<h3>10. Back up your data regularly using immutable storage</h3>\n<p>If you fall victim to a ransomware attack, you’ll be glad to have a backup of your data. Instead of paying a ransom and hoping the criminal decrypts your data (most of the time they don’t), you can simply restore your data from a healthy backup.</p>\n<p>However, backups are not immune to ransomware. That’s where immutable storage comes into play. Ransomware encrypts data by changing the storage blocks on a drive. Immutable storage allows you to prevent changes to storage blocks for any period of time and you can restore your data to specific recovery points you’ve created.</p>\n<p>No matter what kind of storage you use, make sure to create offline backups. Connect your backup device to the internet only long enough to perform the backup and then disconnect the device.</p>\n<h3>Cybersecurity is critical for 2020 and beyond</h3>\n<p>Your cybersecurity strategies will make or break your success whether you’re running a full-scale business or you’re just getting started on your own. If you’re not sure how to implement cybersecurity practices, hire an IT security professional to create a security solution best suited to your needs.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/12/10-practical-strategies-to-secure-your-digital-life/\">10 Practical Strategies to Secure Your Digital Life</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 13 Jul 2020 02:00:12 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Secure-your-digital-life.jpg","linkMd5":"f3bd66881dceb27d21ae11bd3888eb24","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn96@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-27-030_85b9d151adee4488.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Secure-your-digital-life.jpg","destWidth":747,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":65905,"destBytes":33796,"author":"Frank Landman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Secure-your-digital-life-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn76@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-24-080_0950b845535452e4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195873921},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","title":"Digital Collectibles Go Mainstream on the WAX Blockchain","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173599","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/30/digital-collectibles-go-mainstream-on-the-wax-blockchain/\" title=\"Digital Collectibles Go Mainstream on the WAX Blockchain\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Digital-Collectibles-Go-Mainstream-on-the-WAX-Blockchain-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"collectibles blockchain\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Digital-Collectibles-Go-Mainstream-on-the-WAX-Blockchain-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Digital-Collectibles-Go-Mainstream-on-the-WAX-Blockchain-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Digital-Collectibles-Go-Mainstream-on-the-WAX-Blockchain.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Collectors have always had a problem. The value of the items they collect depends on their rarity. If DaVinci had seen that people really liked his portrait of the <i>Mona Lisa</i>, for example, and knocked out a few thousand copies to cash in on the interest &#8212; the first buyer might have felt put out, and the picture in The Louvre would be worth a lot less.</p>\n<h2>Digital Collectibles are exciting as they go mainstream.</h2>\n<p>Da Vinci can’t do that now, but if you’re collecting baseball cards or other trading cards, you always face the risk that the manufacturer will churn out more of the product and lower the value of your holdings. As long as someone else has the freedom to print copies of your collectibles, those collectibles face a risk to their value.</p>\n<p>It’s similar to money. If the government prints more of it, the value of the dollar in your pocket will go down.</p>\n<h3><strong>The fact that the dollar will go down has always been a large part of the attraction of Bitcoin.</strong></h3>\n<p>A burst of quantitative easing can’t unexpectedly lower the value of your digital currency. The number of Bitcoins that can circulate is pre-programmed, and the structure of the blockchain ensures that no fake coins can circulate.</p>\n<p>The value of a Bitcoin, like the value of a work of art by a dead artist, is dependent entirely on the rise and fall of demand. The supply is fixed.</p>\n<h4><strong>Having the supply fixed makes the blockchain an ideal way to keep track of—and secure the value of—other collectibles through the use of non-fungible tokens.</strong></h4>\n<p>These tokens are digital items written into the blockchain that each represent a single unique object, such as a work of art. They function as a certificate of authenticity secured by the blockchain’s distributed ledgers.</p>\n<p>It’s already happening. In May, <a href=\"http://wax.io\">WAX</a>, a blockchain company, teamed up with collectible firm Topps to release a set of digital Garbage Pail Kids cards. All 12,000 packs, a total of 110,000 cards, <a href=\"https://wax.io/blog/sold-out-gpk-card-packs-on-wax-sold-out-in-just-28-hours\">sold out within 28 hours</a> and quickly made their way to secondary markets.</p>\n<h4><strong>WAX and Topps will soon release another set making use of licensed property related to Tiger King. </strong></h4>\n<p>William Shatner, the original captain of the Starship Enterprise, <a href=\"https://wax.io/blog/william-shatner-is-coming-to-the-wax-blockchain-get-digital-memorabilia-from-star-treks-captain-kirk-as-nfts-on-wax\">is releasing his collectible memorabilia on WAX’s blockchain</a>. Shatner has now joined the <a href=\"https://council.wax.io/#about\">WAX Advisory Council</a>.</p>\n<p>Considering the new functionality that the blockchain is bringing to the collectibles market, it’s not surprising that WAX is also working with the hosts of <a href=\"http://badcryptopodcast.com\">The Bad Crypto Podcast.</a></p>\n<p><strong>The Bad Crypto Podcast is set to produce a set of digital collectible trading cards featuring parodies of blockchain and cryptocurrency personalities</strong><strong>.</strong></p>\n<p><a href=\"http://bcheroes.com\">Blockchain Heroes</a> is shaping up to be another success as chatter on social channels would seem to indicate.</p>\n<p>What’s happening here is that the collectibles market is undergoing a revolution. It’s possible now for anyone to fake anything. While you can find anything you want to buy on sites like eBay, you can never be sure that what you’re buying is genuine.</p>\n<h4><strong>Blockchain technology is bringing that authenticity and certainty to the collectibles market.</strong></h4>\n<p>Blockchain technology has fraud-proof ledgers, and the use of non-fungible tokens ensures that you can always see the proof of ownership for an item you want to buy. You can even see the sales price so that you can track how the market is performing.</p>\n<p>You&#8217;ll be confident that if someone tries to sell you a happier looking version of the <i>Mona Lisa &#8212; merely</i> ask to see the blockchain ledger!</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/30/digital-collectibles-go-mainstream-on-the-wax-blockchain/\">Digital Also, any time you play together, it motivates your team to build better communication, a deeper discussion of plans, problem-solving <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/category/ai/\">AI tech</a> techniques, and powerful solutions.</p>\n<h2>Why Team Building Activities are Important?</h2>\n<p>Just imagine getting up in the morning and anticipating having fun at work. Anticipation will automatically encourage you to get up for work happily. Wanting to go to work can become a reality by bringing laughter and happiness to the office. Bringing in activities will de-stress your team.</p>\n<p>Indoor activities provide amazing team-building opportunities, improves workplace tasks, and develop positive work culture. These activities are vital for boosting performance.</p>\n<p>Team collaboration is important because each team member has a different point of view to reach a team’s collective potential. It also helps in increasing the morale of team members.</p>\n<p>There are so many interesting indoor activities that would help to infuse fun and creativity in tasks to increase the progress of the organization.</p>\n<h2>Why Business Needs Indoor Activities?</h2>\n<p>Business needs indoor activities for responsive and meaningful communications which will allow the employees to think out of the box, and to recharge and refresh them.</p>\n<p>These activities will automatically boost the morale of an employee. For successful team building, comfort in the workplace is necessary.</p>\n<h2>Amazing Team Building and Indoor Activities</h2>\n<p>To enhance team performance there should be healthy competition between team members. Competition increases productivity in a positive way. You can encourage the team by providing incentives to make them motivated.</p>\n<p>One of the best team-building strategies is to perform indoor activities which outcomes in better work progress by improving communication.</p>\n<p>It is not mandatory to do all work activities formally, Informal activities should also be conducted to uplift the team’s spirit and remind their values to their team leads. There can be following indoor activities for amazing team building.</p>\n<h3>●     Solve a Mystery</h3>\n<p>This type of activity will allow the team member to solve a puzzle or mystery with the help of clues to increase their collaboration.</p>\n<h3>●     Talking in Circles</h3>\n<p>It will be used to test the level of trust among team members.
