It will bring your team together in an immersive environment.</p>\n<h3>●     Truth or lie &#8212; (truth or dare, if you trust your team)</h3>\n<p>Truth or lie is also an interesting game to know each other for the first time.</p>\n<h3>●     Damsharas (dumb charades)</h3>\n<p>A very popular game to have fun in the workplace and to know other creative minds and acting skills.</p>\n<h3>●     Celebrations and Motivations</h3>\n<p>It is very important to celebrate little team achievements for motivation. There are many team building activities for motivation and enhancing collaboration. Check your local listings and find something worthwhile and fun.</p>\n<h3>●     Decorate the Workplace</h3>\n<p>A team can also decorate a workplace, during decoration, they will communicate with each other to know each other ideas and creative skills. For decorating, a team can use bright colors, flowers, funny photos and interesting quotes. They can also create art together by letting each member participate in that art piece.</p>\n<h3>●     Have a Pizza or Ice Cream Party</h3>\n<p>To celebrate important achievements, goals or milestones, a team can have pizza or ice cream socials.</p>\n<h3>●     Letter of Appreciation</h3>\n<p>One can also write a letter of appreciation to an employee to let them know the significant things they have done in improving the company standards.</p>\n<h3>●     Set up Talent Show</h3>\n<p>Setting up a talent show in a game room can allow employees to open up their talents, whether it’s singing a song or playing an instrument or any other hidden talent. A talent show will be a team-building component because the employees will collaborate to organize the event.</p>\n<h3>●     Celebrate Achievements</h3>\n<p>Many informal activities can take place in workplaces such as short celebrations, dinner parties for teamwork appreciation, learning sessions for their self-development, providing a bonus for an excellent job to encourage team members.</p>\n<h3>●     Built a Wall of Fame</h3>\n<p>A wall of fame should be designed in one of the office walls, where the team lead will put the awards for team members to appreciate them. They can also introduce the ‘thank you’ notes for the ‘employee of the week’ to encourage their hard work.</p>\n<h3>●     Complaint Box</h3>\n<p>Hang up a complaint box in a central area of the office and allow the team to elaborate on their needs and problems they are facing during work out Artificial intelligence gaming trends.</p>\n<h2>Rules for Building an Amazing Team</h2>\n<p>Following are the rules for an amazing team-building:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Support new ideas</li>\n<li>Give challenging activities</li>\n<li>Encourage creativity</li>\n<li>Provide each team member with an opportunity to grow</li>\n<li>Should use the right communication tool for collaboration</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Recommended post:</p>\n<h2>How to Motivate your Team?</h2>\n<p>Following are the ways to motivate the team:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Offer them opportunities for self-development</li>\n<li>Appreciate their effort</li>\n<li>Encourage happiness</li>\n<li>Set clear goals</li>\n<li>Collaborate with your team</li>\n</ul>\n<p>We have organized many team building activities in Dubai for an amazing team experience by engaging them to work together and take care of each other&#8217;s backs.</p>\n<p>There are many other fun indoor activities in your area. You can find: breaking things in the smash room and bowling. These indoor activities bring long-lasting effects in organizations nowadays for VR Games.</p>\n<h2>Final Thoughts</h2>\n<p>To communicate openly is the key to building a good relationship in a team. Fun Indoor activities can build a strong team and allow employees to get to know each other in a better way.</p>\n<p>Knowing each other&#8217;s interests, strengths and weaknesses can encourage each team member to contribute during meetings. So we should organize fun, engaging team activities to enhance the work performance of the organization.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/29/gaming-with-artificial-intelligence-technology-in-2020/\">Gaming with Artificial Intelligence Technology in 2020</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 29 Feb 2020 16:00:28 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Gaming-with-Artificial-Intelligence-Technology-in-2020.jpg","linkMd5":"888787a903aa5b8d67ca81324979034c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn67@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-23-698_3ed01fffdc4b8cc3.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Gaming-with-Artificial-Intelligence-Technology-in-2020.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1282,"sourceBytes":98121,"destBytes":48136,"author":"M. Al. Nabeel","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Gaming-with-Artificial-Intelligence-Technology-in-2020-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn64@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-12-079_7afe5d175b548601.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195879853},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","title":"Connected Devices in the Workplace: What You Need to Know","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=164895","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/21/connected-devices-in-the-workplace-what-you-need-to-know/\" title=\"Connected Devices in the Workplace: What You Need to Know\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"225\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Connected-Devices-in-the-Workplace-What-You-Need-to-Know-300x225.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"connected devices\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Connected-Devices-in-the-Workplace-What-You-Need-to-Know-300x225.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Connected-Devices-in-the-Workplace-What-You-Need-to-Know-900x675.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Connected-Devices-in-the-Workplace-What-You-Need-to-Know-213x160.jpg 213w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Connected-Devices-in-the-Workplace-What-You-Need-to-Know-1536x1152.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Connected-Devices-in-the-Workplace-What-You-Need-to-Know.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>There are about <u><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/14/a-look-at-how-convenience-is-driving-connected-devices/\">26.66 billion connected devices </a></u>on the planet right now, and forecasts predict around <u><a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/678739/forecast-on-connected-devices-per-person/\">seven connected devices</a></u> per person in 2020. Employees bring those devices into a workplace and connect them to the internet, many times via the corporate network. Here is connected devices in the workplace, and what you need to know to avoid the risk.</p>\n<h2>Connected devices can be convenient to have around &#8212; they aren&#8217;t without risk.</h2>\n<p>An overload of personal tech can disrupt corporate connectivity, halt productivity, and introduce security concerns.</p>\n<h3>Bandwidth Blockers</h3>\n<p>Bandwidth refers to the volume of data that can be sent over a network at one time. It is not unlimited, and the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/05/the-concept-of-visibility-is-sabotaging-your-security-infrastructure/\">more people using the network</a>, the slower it becomes.</p>\n<p>When calculating bandwidth requirements, businesses should determine how many employees they have, how many devices they are connecting to the network, and what activities each individual frequently performs.</p>\n<p>Before the influx of IoT devices, companies only had to consider one device per employee, maybe two. Also, they only needed to estimate how many employees at one time were:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Video conferencing</li>\n<li>Downloading or uploading large files</li>\n<li>Checking and sending emails</li>\n<li>Using the web for research</li>\n<li>Streaming music or video</li>\n<li>Using VOIP</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Those activities are still crucial for bandwidth requirement purposes.</strong></p>\n<p>However, if you&#8217;re ending your focus there, you&#8217;re missing today’s bigger picture. Now, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/09/internet-of-things-makes-it-easier-to-steal-your-data/\">employees may have</a> smartwatches, fitness trackers, smart glasses, and a health monitoring device.</p>\n<p>Each employee likely has smart speakers or brings in a smart assistant. Consider that when each of these devices connects to the network, some questions must be asked.  How often are the devices sending and receiving data?</p>\n<blockquote><p><strong><em>Are these device sending and receiving data in real-time? Is the transfer done in batches throughout the day? Whenever a request is made? How much bandwidth are employees’ personal devices using throughout the day?</em></strong></p></blockquote>\n<p>Without warning, an influx of personal tech can consume much of your WiFi and internet bandwidth. How is this consumption is affecting productivity in your company? How much of the usage is causing problems for your customers?</p>\n<p>It&#8217;s common knowledge that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/29/how-iot-embraces-smart-communication/\">high consumption of internet bandwidth</a> can lead to slow load times for web pages, difficulty opening large files, or problems with video conferences, presentations, or VOIP calls.</p>\n<p>In general, you’ll be looking at complaints that the internet or the WiFi is slow. As a result, employee productivity will suffer. Productivity isn’t the only risk, either. Unsecured personal tech opens up a corporate network to a whole host of potential network vulnerabilities.</p>\n<h3>Security Holes</h3>\n<p>A system is only as secure as its weakest point. With personal IoT devices flooding a network, the number of possible weak points greatly increases.</p>\n<p>Frequently, these devices do not have the same security protocols as business devices, but we connect them to the same network &#8212; a network that houses sensitive, confidential data.</p>\n<h4>Confidential, secure data makes employee data an attractive target for hackers.</h4>\n<p>A personal device that&#8217;s hacked is bad news for employees and a lot worse news for companies. As these devices are <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/30/cybersecurity-ensuring-sanity-in-smart-cities/\">connected to the corporate network</a> &#8212; without proper IoT cybersecurity &#8212; your network is vulnerable to:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Hackers gaining access to sensitive data, including the risk of someone hacking a device and using said device to take photographs or record video.</li>\n<li>Sabotage of company facilities, such as losing control of the HVAC, or being locked out of machinery.</li>\n<li>Botnets infecting devices and launching distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks that bring down a network entirely.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>These scenarios have happened and are already happening. Criminals <u><a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/leemathews/2017/07/27/criminals-hacked-a-fish-tank-to-steal-data-from-a-casino/#4b0e977732b9\">hacked a smart thermometer</a></u> in a casino fish tank to steal data about the casino’s highest paying customers.</p>\n<p>Home thermostats have been used as a <u><a href=\"https://www.ibtimes.co.uk/hackers-leave-finnish-residents-cold-after-ddos-attack-knocks-out-heating-systems-1590639\">launch point for DDoS attacks</a></u> that have left residents freezing and locked out of their own central heating systems. The FDA proved that implantable <u><a href=\"https://money.cnn.com/2017/01/09/technology/fda-st-jude-cardiac-hack/\">cardiac devices</a></u> can be hacked.</p>\n<p>Additionally, Corero Network Security reported that organizations experienced an average of<u><a href=\"https://www.techrepublic.com/article/ddos-attacks-increased-91-in-2017-thanks-to-iot/\"> 237 DDoS attack attempts per month</a></u>. The examples go on and on. Take these security risks seriously. Design your network to keep hackers and criminals securely locked out.</p>\n<h3>How to Solve the Problems</h3>\n<h4><strong>Identify</strong></h4>\n<p>Before you can <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/27/3-amazing-strategies-that-will-burst-cybercrimes-in-2020/\">adequately protect your network</a> and optimize your bandwidth, you have to know what devices are on the network. Of those devices on the network, identify which are corporate devices and which are personal devices.</p>\n<h4>One way to verify this is through device discovery and device profiling.</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>Device discovery alerts you when new devices connect to your network.</li>\n<li>Device profiling identifies the device and sharing information such as device type, brand, and operating system.</li>\n<li>Profiling provides details down to the specific make and model.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>With the right tools, this process takes only minutes. The identification provides companies with complete visibility into their wireless networks and lets them know precisely what the network is supporting and how the bandwidth is utilized.</p>\n<p>Your AP vendor might provide profiling. If not, there are other analytics tools you can turn to for the job.</p>\n<h4><strong>Protect</strong></h4>\n<p>Now that you know how many and what kind of IoT devices are on your network &#8212; how do you keep it all secure?</p>\n<p>Many IoT devices don’t have a user interface (UI) that would allow for the installation of additional software, like antivirus software. These employee devices might even be lacking the hardware capacity needed for such an installation.</p>\n<p>What enterprises need to do is <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/08/09/feature-flags-will-be-the-great-enabler-of-the-connected-world/\">flag the devices</a> for anomalous activity, and put such devices on a network that is separate from your corporate network.</p>\n<p>Enterprises achieve differentiation when using different SSIDs, VLANs, and subnets, or a combination thereof. Then further designate device-specific access roles.</p>\n<h3>Anomalous Activity</h3>\n<p>After personal devices are identified, flag them, so you receive an alert if they act suspiciously.</p>\n<p>Consider a scenario where a device identified as a smartwatch suddenly starts downloading or uploading large amounts of data either to or from your network. This is an immediate red flag that the device is being used for malicious purposes.</p>\n<p>With real-time identification, IT can resolve the problem before the negative consequences are too severe.</p>\n<p>Make sure you continuously upgrade the criteria used for anomalous detection, allowing your business to keep pace with natural changes in device usage and behavior.</p>\n<h4>Three SSIDs</h4>\n<p>Acting proactively, IT can limit the information available to IoT devices by deploying two or three service set identifiers (SSIDs). The different SSIDs provide varying levels of network access to different users and devices. Generally, I recommend using three SSIDs:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>SSID 1 &#8212; </strong> is the most secure network with strong firewalls and a unique password or certificate for each device. Typically, configure SSID 1 as WPA2 &#8211; Enterprise. Limit your SSID 1 to employees and business devices only.</li>\n<li><strong>SSID 2</strong> &#8212; is the guest network. It can be open or password-protected (WPA2 &#8211; Personal), with or without a captive portal (web-browser based authentication). SSID 2 can require an agreement of terms and conditions from all users or some form of user login.</li>\n<li><strong>SSID 3 &#8212;</strong> if needed, you can use the SSID 3 as a catch-all network for any other devices. This designation includes personal IoT devices that may have limited band or security protocols support.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Using a slightly different method, companies could also choose to put all IoT devices on the 2.4GHz network. Then, the company can reserve the 5GHz network exclusively for corporate devices.</p>\n<p><strong>Be very selective about which devices join which network.</strong></p>\n<p>For example, it might not seem worrisome if a hacker accesses a printer, but that criminal can now see everything that is printed or scanned in an office. Yikes!</p>\n<p>Ensure your employees understand the risks involved if they allow their personal devices to connect to a secure network. Enforce company policies that prohibit such connections.</p>\n<h3><strong>Shape</strong></h3>\n<p>Quality of service (QoS) technologies allow you to deliver optimal performance for different types of network traffic. The first thing you’ll want to do is classify your network traffic.</p>\n<ol>\n<li>You can be as broad or as specific as you like for your QoS technologies. Once you’ve determined what kind of traffic you have, there are different methods you can implement.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>A differentiated service model configures network hardware so that different traffic types have different priorities.</p>\n<p>If voice traffic is a higher priority than other traffic, the differentiated service model allocates more network resources for peak performance.</p>\n<p>You can use bandwidth shaping, also known as traffic shaping. Traffic shaping lets you reserve bandwidth for higher priority, business-related traffic. Using shaping, companies limit the bandwidth available to certain applications, or limit bandwidth based on the source and destination of packets.</p>\n<p>For example, it would be possible to reserve 60% of the bandwidth for corporate use and designate only 20% each for IoT devices and guests.</p>\n<p>If IoT devices start trying to use more than 20%, bandwidth shaping will usually hold traffic in a buffer and delay sending it until it can be transmitted without going over the configured speed &#8212; or drop it.</p>\n<p>To determine if bandwidth shaping is necessary for your company, use network tests and device profiling to determine bandwidth utilization over time. Are business applications running slowly because of an increase in users? Or is slow down because of an increase of personal or other IoT devices? Does the bandwidth need to be upgraded? Or, will bandwidth shaping resolve the issue?</p>\n<h3><strong>Keep it Visible, Keep it Safe</strong></h3>\n<p>With 100% network visibility, companies have a better understanding of their network. The company will know how their networks are growing. They know what devices they&#8217;re supporting, and what, if any, security vulnerabilities exist.</p>\n<p>As the number of IoT devices continues to grow, this practice will be more necessary than ever.</p>\n<p>Implement policies for identification, protection, and traffic shaping. Your goal is to keep your network secure and optimized, no matter how many devices enter the office.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/21/connected-devices-in-the-workplace-what-you-need-to-know/\">Connected Devices in the Workplace: What You Need to Know</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 21 Feb 2020 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Connected-Devices-in-the-Workplace-What-You-Need-to-Know.jpg","linkMd5":"e4e7fb5b7b8600867bb5babd000963d0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn47@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-27-005_7389030dd1369a2d.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Connected-Devices-in-the-Workplace-What-You-Need-to-Know.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1440,"sourceBytes":249097,"destBytes":196956,"author":"Anil Gupta","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Connected-Devices-in-the-Workplace-What-You-Need-to-Know-300x225.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn84@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-15-392_cc69e91c2882408e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195880481},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","title":"5 Reasons Your Own Website is Killing Your Sales","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=174112","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/14/5-reasons-your-own-website-is-killing-your-sales/\" title=\"5 Reasons Your Own Website is Killing Your Sales\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/5-Reasons-Your-Own-Website-is-Killing-Your-Sales-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"website killing sales\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/5-Reasons-Your-Own-Website-is-Killing-Your-Sales-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/5-Reasons-Your-Own-Website-is-Killing-Your-Sales-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/5-Reasons-Your-Own-Website-is-Killing-Your-Sales.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>More people than ever are shopping online. In 2019, e-commerce retail sales equated to <a href=\"https://99firms.com/blog/ecommerce-statistics/#gref\">14.1% of global sales</a> and by 2040, 95% of purchases are expected to come from e-commerce. Here are five reasons your own website is killing your sales.</p>\n<h3>Clearly, there’s never been a better time to sell online.</h3>\n<p>However, there are a lot of factors to consider when it comes to actually making sales. Having <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/21/website-traffic-metric/\">a brand website is important</a>, but it doesn’t guarantee you’ll have a successful business.</p>\n<p>Your website is potentially the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/09/amazon-ppc-campaign-to-increase-sales-during-pandemic/\">first impression consumers</a> have of your brand. It showcases your back story, your vision, and your overall product line. But, if your sales aren’t exactly setting the e-commerce industry on fire, it might be time to make a few changes.</p>\n<p>Not getting as many sales as you’d hoped? Here are 5 reasons why your website may be having a negative impact.</p>\n<h2><b>Your website isn’t mobile responsive</b></h2>\n<p>61.51% of the world’s <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/08/the-cloud-based-companys-4-step-guide-to-mobile-device-management/\">population own a mobile phone</a> &#8212; that’s around 4.78 billion people. By 2021, purchases made via mobile are predicted to be worth $3.56 trillion.</p>\n<p>With more consumers using their phone to research products, learn about businesses, and make purchases, your website needs to deliver it’s A-game, and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/24/3-ways-tech-startups-are-using-ai-to-revolutionize-customer-experience/\">deliver a great user experience.</a></p>\n<p>Let’s say you’re interested in buying a set of golf clubs. You head to Google using your phone, find a store selling your perfect set, but the website doesn’t conform to mobile screens.</p>\n<p>What are you going to do? My best bet is that you’re going to click off pretty sharpish.</p>\n<p>To prevent losing potential customers, your website should be responsive to screen size, load quickly, and provide a good user experience.</p>\n<p>How to fix:</p>\n<ol>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Shift to a responsive design, based on a fluid/stackable grid pattern. This will ensure your content resizes no matter what screen size is used.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Consider image sizing in your CSS. Alternatively, if you’re using a different URL for mobile, upload smaller product images instead.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Contemplate touch screen elements for tablet and smartphone devices.</li>\n</ol>\n<h2><b>Your website is too slow</b></h2>\n<p>Nobody likes to wait. In fact, 40% of people abandon a website if it takes 3 seconds or more to load.</p>\n<p>It’s not only customers a slow website can have an impact on. According to a <a href=\"https://www.shopify.com/enterprise/site-performance-page-speed-ecommerce\">speed study by Google</a>, your bounce rate declines for every second your website takes to load.</p>\n<p>Did you know that slow web pages affect your search ranking and the cost per click of your Google ads? So, how can you win over customers and search engines by improving your site speed?</p>\n<p>How to fix:</p>\n<ol>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Use <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2016/11/08/4-mistakes-made-transitioning-cloud-hosting-pl4/\">fast hosting</a>. Quick, reliable hosting is imperative for any e-commerce site, especially if you’re experiencing high traffic or transactions. Look at limitations on bandwidth and memory when you choose a host.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Minimize HTTP requests. The more components a site has, like images and scripts, the more HTTP requests are made, making your website take longer to load.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Combine your files. While CSS, JavaScript, and HTML files are important, minifying them to eliminate unnecessary code and whitespace will reduce their size to make your website faster.</li>\n</ol>\n<h2><b>Your SEO is lacking</b></h2>\n<p>Not <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/24/top-tips-to-increase-website-conversions/\">getting many people visiting your store</a>? Perhaps SEO is having an impact. Good SEO techniques put you further up in search engine results, sending more users to your website.</p>\n<p>SEO can take time to implement so don’t expect changes to happen overnight. However, with the correct techniques, you may need to rely less on paid advertising.</p>\n<p>How to fix:</p>\n<ol>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/01/how-to-do-keyword-research-for-seo/\">Be clever with keywords</a>. Do your research to discover what potential customers are searching for. Remember, when <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/20/the-language-of-seo-identifying-and-implementing-central-keywords/\">implementing keywords</a> into content, avoid stuffing them into text.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Target local SEO. If you’re a small business, local SEO is essential. Use local keywords and sign up for a Google My Business account.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Use on-page SEO techniques. Take advantage of optimizing meta titles and headings with keywords. Optimize your URLs with your most important keywords.</li>\n</ol>\n<h2><b>Your site isn’t secure</b></h2>\n<p>Making <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/19/how-prepared-is-your-business-to-face-botnet-threats/\">sure your website is secure</a> increases trust and credibility as a reputable business. After all, you want your customers to keep coming back to you, and spread good reviews about you via word of mouth.</p>\n<p>What can you do if your store is lacking the security it needs?</p>\n<p>How to fix:</p>\n<ol>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Get an <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/07/an-ev-ssl-certificate-is-more-important-than-other-ssl-certification/\">SSL certificate.</a> An extended validation certificate (EV SSL) is the most effective type recommended for a high level of security, especially when you’re processing payments and obtaining sensitive data from customers. Make sure you monitor your certificate and not have it expire on you, letting your website exposed. You can use Sematext to track this for free.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">State your refund policy to enhance trust. A clear refund policy not only encourages users to trust your company, but it can also improve sales by increasing customer confidence in your brand.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Display your contact information. You may not have a physical store, but customers still need to know how to contact you for inquiries or complaints. Make it easy for them by using a specific contact form, email address, or phone number.</li>\n</ol>\n<h2><b>Your site is hard to navigate</b></h2>\n<p>A visually pleasing design isn’t everything, but it does form the first impressions of your business and enhance user experience. It only takes 0.05 seconds for a user to decide if they’re going to stay on your website or not.</p>\n<p>If you want people to stick around on your website long enough to browse your products or services, then you have to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/06/14/what-these-7-brands-can-teach-you-about-ux/\">improve your user experience</a>.</p>\n<p>How to fix:</p>\n<ol>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Use <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/25/ecommerce-how-to-survive-its-troughs/\">clear navigation with a search bar</a>. Avoid confusion by placing the most important links at the beginning and end of your navigation to make it easier for people to spot them. Organize your offerings in categories so users can easily find what they’re searching for.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Use clear product images. Not only will you enhance trust, but you’ll increase conversions too!</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Optimize your landing page. Consider where users are coming from and tailor it to them. For instance, if you’re running a Facebook ad with a 20% off coupon, make sure your landing page mentions the discount. It’s also important to regularly test your landing page to improve conversions.</li>\n</ol>\n<h3><b>Improve your conversions by continually analyzing your website</b></h3>\n<p>If you’re <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/06/the-impacts-of-covid-19-on-sustainability-and-technology/\">struggling to make sales</a>, don’t sit around waiting for things to change.</p>\n<p>Getting your e-commerce website to where you want it to takes time. But, by using the correct methods, you can significantly increase sales.</p>\n<p>Use our tips as a starting point and evaluate your website on a continual basis to keep making improvements along the way.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: charles deluvio; unsplash</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/14/5-reasons-your-own-website-is-killing-your-sales/\">5 Reasons Your Own Website is Killing Your Sales</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 14 Aug 2020 15:01:06 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/5-Reasons-Your-Own-Website-is-Killing-Your-Sales.jpg","linkMd5":"a2e75cf97520b0d3a4b0a7ce28c24fc1","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn96@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-23-935_e2f03056edb67b7d.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/5-Reasons-Your-Own-Website-is-Killing-Your-Sales.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":35194,"destBytes":27134,"author":"John Demian","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/5-Reasons-Your-Own-Website-is-Killing-Your-Sales-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn95@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-20-754_b0f05504f9352e89.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195870487},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","title":"4 Actionable Tips to Improve your Customer Service Strategy","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=172174","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/14/4-actionable-tips-to-improve-your-customer-service-strategy/\" title=\"4 Actionable Tips to Improve your Customer Service Strategy\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/4-Actionable-Tips-to-Improve-your-Customer-Service-Strategy-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"customer service strategy\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/4-Actionable-Tips-to-Improve-your-Customer-Service-Strategy-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/4-Actionable-Tips-to-Improve-your-Customer-Service-Strategy-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/4-Actionable-Tips-to-Improve-your-Customer-Service-Strategy-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/4-Actionable-Tips-to-Improve-your-Customer-Service-Strategy.jpg 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Customer service is vital for any business to retain its customers and gain more value from them. Through top-notch customer service, businesses can reduce the acquisition cost of a new customer and cultivate a loyal user-base. Your user-base will act as brand ambassadors, and double as case studies and provide testimonials and reviews. Here are four actionable tips to improve your customer service strategy.</p>\n<h3>When you invest in customer service to delight the customers, they remain engaged with your brand for the long-term.</h3>\n<p>You&#8217;ll also find that they and convince their personal and professional network to interact with your business. After all, positive reviews are more effective in gaining new customers than the marketing campaigns by your business and are cheaper.</p>\n<p>With the incrementally high costs of acquiring a new customer, retaining an existing happy user is all the more important.</p>\n<h4>Ask these questions:</h4>\n<ul>\n<li>How to earn <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/12/improving-customer-loyalty-with-3-easy-steps/\">customer loyalty</a>?</li>\n<li>How can your customer service agents woe the customers to not only come back but also refer their friends and family to purchase from your brand?</li>\n</ul>\n<p>To answer these questions, here are the four actionable and proven tips to improve your customer service strategy.</p>\n<h2><strong>#1. Collect feedback.<br />\n</strong></h2>\n<p>As customer needs vary depending on the industry you are targeting; good customer service looks different for every business. Instead of assuming what your customers want, use a customer satisfaction survey to receive their perspective on your business.</p>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-172176\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/123Form-1-300x268.png\" alt=\"Customer survey form builder \" width=\"300\" height=\"268\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/123Form-1-300x268.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/123Form-1-805x719.png 805w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/123Form-1-179x160.png 179w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/123Form-1.png 974w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>123FormBuilder</p>\n<p>This way, you can identify what your audience requires and provide customized solutions. These forms can be in the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/17/how-to-get-useful-customer-feedback-in-4-steps/\">feedback</a> request sent after the purchase is made, or after an interaction is completed with the customer. You can ask for ratings using Net Promoter Score Surveys (NPSS) or even a detailed form built for personalized browsing or checkout experience. The reports generated by these feedback forms can form the basis for <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/30/personalizing-your-customer-service-with-6-strategies/\">personalized customer service</a> strategies.</p>\n<p>Don’t miss this chance of enhancing your products and improving the customer experience.</p>\n<h2><strong>#2. Know your average response time.<br />\n</strong></h2>\n<p>Customers want fast solutions to their queries. <a href=\"https://www.forrester.com/report/2018+Customer+Service+Trends+How+Operations+Become+Faster+Cheaper+And+Yet+More+Human/-/E-RES142291\">66%</a> of customers report that an important part of good customer service is the company valuing their time. Ace up your efficiency by developing a workflow that streamlines and co-ordinates with different support departments and functions. By reducing the average response time your website visitors and customers are less likely to get distracted or navigate away from your website.</p>\n<p>To speed up the average response rate, eliminate internal confusion to reduce the delays. To remove the confusion whether the reps replied to the customer query or not, use a shared inbox.</p>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-172177\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Kayako-300x241.png\" alt=\"Kayako's shared inbox\" width=\"300\" height=\"241\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Kayako-300x241.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Kayako-897x719.png 897w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Kayako-200x160.png 200w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Kayako.png 974w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>Kayako’s shared inbox</p>\n<p>As communication is transparent and visible, everyone in the team is updated about the responses that are pending. With multiple users accessing the inbox, teammates can respond to clients in real-time.</p>\n<p>Further, you could adopt a helpdesk to manage and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/05/marketing-automation-and-customer-service-how-are-they-connected/\">automate customer service</a> tasks to help your team stay organized, prioritize work and fastrack the customer query response rate.</p>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-172178\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Proprofs-helpdesk.-png-300x226.png\" alt=\"Proprofs helpdesk \" width=\"300\" height=\"226\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Proprofs-helpdesk.-png-300x226.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Proprofs-helpdesk.-png-900x679.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Proprofs-helpdesk.-png-212x160.png 212w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Proprofs-helpdesk.-png.png 974w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>ProProfs Helpdesk software</p>\n<h2><strong>#3. Customer support through SMS.</strong></h2>\n<p>A staggering <a href=\"https://www.eweek.com/networking/consumers-like-using-text-messages-to-solve-customer-service-issues\">52%</a> of customers prefer to text a customer support representative over other channels of communication. With over 5 billion people sending and receiving SMS messages globally, consider including SMS texting in your customer service arsenal, to communicate with the users.</p>\n<p>For small businesses whose marketing budgets are restrained, customer service over <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/01/how-to-enhance-your-omnichannel-strategy-with-sms-messaging/\">SMS</a> is a good option because it works on all phones, needs no separate app downloads, and is independent of the internet. It allows your customers to follow-up, respond to your text message instantly, and interact 1:1 with your support team.</p>\n<p><strong>Some etiquettes to remember, while sending SMS messages to your audience are these.<br />\n</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>Get written consent from the customers before reaching out to them over SMS.</li>\n<li>Collect their phone numbers through signup and contact forms while mentioning that you would reach out to them over text messaging for customer service updates.</li>\n<li>Consider messaging at the right time, preferably regular business hours.</li>\n<li>Avoid sharing sensitive information that the customers may not be comfortable discussing over text.</li>\n<li>Escalate to a phone call when the problem becomes too complex to handle over SMS.</li>\n</ul>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium wp-image-172179\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Text-Magic-300x151.png\" alt=\"TextMagic's build SMS \" width=\"300\" height=\"151\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Text-Magic-300x151.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Text-Magic-900x454.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Text-Magic-260x131.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Text-Magic.png 974w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>TextMagic</p>\n<p>Don’t shy away from publicizing that your customers can reach out to you by SMS, which shows your commitment to offering excellent customer service.</p>\n<h2><strong>#4. Use content to support your customer service.<br />\n</strong></h2>\n<p>Along with generating leads, your content can also be used to increase customer happiness and satisfaction.</p>\n<p>The support team knows the most of what your customers require, complain and recommend about your business. It becomes all the more essential to connect your content creators with the support staff. The content that answers all the questions your audience has, can be used to deliver value to the leads and clients. The blog content that is filled with statistics and insights can be used by the support team to increase customer loyalty.</p>\n<p>Start by identifying the 10 most frequently asked questions your support team receives. Identify or create content to answer those questions in the form of easy to understand resources. Ensure that your support team understands the same content and uses it to answer the queries.</p>\n<p>Also, you can use email gated content to send people down the sales funnel. This could take the form of a previously recorded webinar, podcast, or an e-book. People who have contacted you are already interested in your offering. Instead of sending them through a boring and long demo, consider this soft sell.</p>\n<p>In cases where the questions are straightforward, you could direct the visitors to the FAQ page or knowledge base where they can find corresponding answers. For technical questions that are complex, take the help of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/18/7-types-of-video-that-will-make-a-massive-impact-on-your-website/\">videos</a>, case studies and how-to-posts to help them understand.</p>\n<p>You can do this yourself or hire a content writing agency to help you create content that retains customers and nurtures leads.</p>\n<h4>Conclusion</h4>\n<p>Delight your customers with a stellar customer service strategy. Your customer service reps have a tremendous influence on your business, revenue, sales and overall growth.</p>\n<p><strong>They are an important touchpoint to delight the existing and potential customers.</strong></p>\n<p>Invest in a proper customer service strategy taking into consideration the 4 fool-proof strategies mentioned above, to serve your customers.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Andrea Piacquadio; Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/14/4-actionable-tips-to-improve-your-customer-service-strategy/\">4 Actionable Tips to Improve your Customer Service Strategy</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 14 Jul 2020 18:01:10 Desai","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/4-Actionable-Tips-to-Improve-your-Customer-Service-Strategy-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn31@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-21-459_f9d28d954d102f52.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/123Form-1-300x268.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn23@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-20-270_234ad36e04cf9df0.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Kayako-300x241.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn40@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-10-575_9cb69ac2a635421f.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Proprofs-helpdesk.-png-300x226.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn68@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-12-900_581aeea30a509284.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Text-Magic-300x151.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn39@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-28-236_9372f081304912c4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195872845},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","title":"The Potential Impact of Voice-Enabled Tech in 2020","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=165879","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/28/the-potential-impact-of-voice-enabled-tech-in-2020/\" title=\"The Potential Impact of Voice-Enabled Tech in 2020\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/The-Potential-Impact-of-Voice-Enabled-Tech-in-2020-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"voice enabled tech\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/The-Potential-Impact-of-Voice-Enabled-Tech-in-2020-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/The-Potential-Impact-of-Voice-Enabled-Tech-in-2020-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/The-Potential-Impact-of-Voice-Enabled-Tech-in-2020.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>“<i>It should be rather evident to anyone paying attention that we are on the verge of a massive disruption of the market due to voice-enabled applications</i>.&#8221;</p>\n<p>That was the opener that Guy Sheetrit, CEO of Over The Top SEO, had in store for me when I approached him about the topic of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/21/is-voice-search-the-next-big-travel-technology-trend/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">voice search, and voice-enabled apps</a>.</p>\n<p>It is hard to argue that these techs are poised to have a massive surge in relevance at the dawn of the new decade. Whether you are talking smartphones, speech-to-text software, Alexa, or your smart home’s IoT appliances… As the underlying tech continues to become more accurate and accessible, on-screen keyboards and button-filled panels might become a thing of the past.</p>\n<p>“<i>Think about it. Why would you ever grab your phone and type if you </i><b><i>knew</i></b><i>, with certainty, that you could just ask it to do something in conversation? Short of privacy and environment restrictions, there’s little reason to do so once accuracy becomes a non-issue</i>” Shared Sheetrit.</p>\n<p>But what are the key data points that seem to be heralding the rise of “<i>voice</i>” as the preferred input methodology for the near future?</p>\n<h2>Voice Search by the Numbers</h2>\n<p>“<i>It wasn’t so long ago that most people gasped when Google announced that mobile search had surpassed regular queries volumes” Asserted Sheetrit jokingly. “Even though we’ve been saying it was inevitable long before that. Guess what? It’s happening all over again. Voice search is the second preferred choice for mobile searches already.</i>” Guy added, and he seems to be right on the money.</p>\n<p>In early 2019, <a href=\"https://www.perficientdigital.com/insights/our-research/voice-usage-trends\">a research conducted</a> by Proficient Digital showed that people’s comfort with voice command usage was on the rise, and had become the number two choice for mobile searches. Adobe’s own study seemed to back this trend up, as they reported that <a href=\"https://theblog.adobe.com/voice-assistant-statistics-trends-2019\">48% of consumers</a> are using voice for “<i>general web searches</i>” regularly.</p>\n<p>Moreover, as we continue to see growth in the widespread adoption of the tech, some companies are already shifting into finding actionable data. On its <a href=\"https://about.ads.microsoft.com/en-us/insights/2019-voice-report\">April 2019 report</a>, Microsoft made a point of finding out more about these search use cases.</p>\n<p>Most voice searches seem to be related to finding out a quick fact (68%), asking for directions (65%), or searching for a business (47%)</p>\n<p>“<i>…And it is those businesses that are already looking two or three moves ahead and optimizing right now for voice search that will see the most benefit in the near future once the floodgates blow open</i>&#8221; augured Guy.</p>\n<h2>Voice Searches, SEO, and the Impact on the Industry</h2>\n<p>Just as it happened with things like mobile accessibility, UX-centric design, and other paradigm-shifting developments of the past decade, one could imagine a similar outcome for voice-enabled tech. In fact, we are already starting to project the <a href=\"https://hbr.org/2018/05/marketing-in-the-age-of-alexa\">possible implications</a> of gadgets like Alexa on the market.</p>\n<p>This is what Guy Sheetrit feels about the future: “<i>The impact of voice searches on the consumer side is rather predictable. As people grow accustomed to this tech, they’ll begin to expect it – and then demand it – on their apps and gadgets. On the businesses side, things are more complex.</i></p>\n<p><i>We are not just talking about bigger R&#38;D budgets to accommodate said expectation – Their marketing strategies will need to adapt to this new way in which audiences approach their content</i>.</p>\n<p><i>As good as the </i><a href=\"https://www.overthetopseo.com/semantic-google-search-optimization-all-you-need-to-know\"><i>new semantic algorithms</i></a><i> eventually get at figuring out searcher intent, there are important differences between spoken and written queries. Differences that will most likely make a difference in SERPs, and will have to be addressed to outplay the competition.”</i></p>\n<h2>Searches Are Probably Just Be the Start</h2>\n<p>I could sense we were starting to touch on something Guy is very passionate about as I noticed slightly stern notes in his voice.</p>\n<p>“<i>My focus is on searches because that’s my game, but don&#8217;t let that fool you” </i>he warned<i>. “Searches are just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to voice-enabled tech.</i>”</p>\n<p>Guy’s sentiment resonated with a statement on the Adobe study as well, which stated that while voice usage was growing, it needed designers to reach everyday adoption.</p>\n<p>Well, it seems like designers are hearing the call and getting to work. Increasingly more apps and devices are delving deeper into voice command implementations, and some even seek to replace the touch interaction altogether!</p>\n<p>Microsoft’s Bing Search App version 6.48 was recently released, and on top of a visual revamp, <b>the app included direct site navigation via voice</b>. Once users navigate to a website, they are prompted to “K<i>eep using voice to search this site</i>.&#8221; They can then choose a page or a specific area of the site they&#8217;d like to go to.</p>\n<p>Implementations like these are not only a huge step forwards in terms of accessibility, but they also signal a wider-adoption opportunity for the technology.</p>\n<h2>Wrapping Up</h2>\n<p>The new decade has barely started, and the stakes already seem pretty high when it comes to voice technology!</p>\n<p>Whether you are talking big-picture, with machine learning improving recognition accuracy by leaps and bounds, or granular implementations like effective speech-to-text solutions: <b><i>Voice-enabled tech is set to change the game</i></b>.</p>\n<p>As the whole thing continues to pick up steam, it’s bound to make big splashes in the news cycles and consumers’ collective habits – And it’ll be up to smart businesses and developers to keep an ear to the ground to anticipate, and capitalize on, these major shifts!</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/28/the-potential-impact-of-voice-enabled-tech-in-2020/\">The Potential Impact of Voice-Enabled Tech in 2020</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 28 Feb 2020 16:00:32 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/The-Potential-Impact-of-Voice-Enabled-Tech-in-2020.jpg","linkMd5":"51e0e9dcc6ab195a99e2dff67e5a89c9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn99@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-23-154_68502e9df97b5d5a.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/The-Potential-Impact-of-Voice-Enabled-Tech-in-2020.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":28691,"destBytes":20710,"author":"David Townsend","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/The-Potential-Impact-of-Voice-Enabled-Tech-in-2020-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn48@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-27-680_4d489140a223e145.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195880236},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"The Top Ways Apps are Stopping Bots and Fake Accounts","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=168907","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/31/the-top-ways-apps-are-stopping-bots-and-fake-accounts/\" title=\"The Top Ways Apps are Stopping Bots and Fake Accounts\"><img width=\"264\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/The-Top-Ways-Apps-are-Stopping-Bots-and-Fake-Accounts-264x300.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"bots\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/The-Top-Ways-Apps-are-Stopping-Bots-and-Fake-Accounts-264x300.png 264w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/The-Top-Ways-Apps-are-Stopping-Bots-and-Fake-Accounts-632x719.png 632w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/The-Top-Ways-Apps-are-Stopping-Bots-and-Fake-Accounts-141x160.png 141w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/The-Top-Ways-Apps-are-Stopping-Bots-and-Fake-Accounts.png 649w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 264px) 100vw, 264px\" /></a></div><p>Every year, we spend more and more time on the Internet. With the arrival of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/22/from-polarization-to-open-learning-how-technology-can-help-us-beyond-covid-19/\">COVID19</a>, millions of people are using it from home more than before. From work to online shopping, social media, and dating, apps integrate with our lives in new ways all the time. But as more users join these apps and websites, where we go to consume content and interact with people become hubs for online scams, bots, and fake accounts.</p>\n<p>Campaigns that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/22/rise-of-scams-after-coronavirus-outbreak/\">prey on the trust of people</a> are rampant online. It might be advertising campaigns that astroturf social media websites with bots or fake accounts to make it look like a specific product is extremely popular. It could be fake emails from your bank asking you to reset your password. Unfortunately, these campaigns are quite lucrative for the scammers running them. In fact, people reported more than <a href=\"https://public.tableau.com/profile/federal.trade.commission#!/vizhome/FraudReports/FraudFacts\">250,000 cases of online scams</a> last year in the U.S. alone, with more than $300 million in damages.</p>\n<p>Of course, apps don’t want fake users and scammers on their platforms either. There’s an ever-evolving battle between malicious actors and the developers behind these apps. Below are some of the unique approaches developers use to detect fake users and get them off their platforms quickly and effectively.</p>\n<h2><b>Multi-Step Authentication</b></h2>\n<p>People who create spam bot accounts generally try to make many hundreds of accounts at the same time. Usually, this is because app users are able to detect fake accounts with ease. That means these developers want a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/06/how-to-choose-top-ios-app-development-tools/\">simple account creation</a> process that can be easily automated. Similarly, scammers want easy verification steps to speed up the process or brute-force hack their way onto already-existing apps easily. One way that apps are stopping quick account creation is through captcha and multiple account verification steps.</p>\n<p>By asking users for a password, then <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2015/06/04/two-factor-authentication-security-business/\">sending a security code to a device</a> owned by the person who knows the password, users can verify their identity quickly and securely so they can gain access. Some of the first major companies to adopt two-factor authentication included Wells Fargo. Now, most software companies and social media apps use it to make sure that your account is truly yours.</p>\n<p>For slowing down automated threats, platforms like Twitter and massively multiplayer online games like League of Legends require users to <a href=\"https://venturebeat.com/2019/04/23/winning-against-bots-how-gaming-apps-can-fight-back/\">link accounts to other pre-existing accounts</a>. When you create an account, the service uses these existing accounts to verify your online presence and act as a way to observe human actions like clicking and typing during all sign-up steps.</p>\n<h2><b>Manual Review</b></h2>\n<p>It&#8217;s clear that tech-based solutions are useful for stopping the majority of bad bots. But, sometimes stopping human-like bots takes a simpler solution – manual review of accounts. For example, Twitter and Facebook use automated systems as their first line of defense, <a href=\"https://about.fb.com/news/2019/05/fake-accounts/\">but then flag certain accounts</a> for actual humans to look at. Using metrics collected by the account creation and posting system, reviewers can look through an account’s history to determine whether it has a particular agenda that’s related to other bot activity on the platform.</p>\n<p>For example, a set of accounts may be created on a similar date and post regularly about innocuous content. But then, they suddenly transition their posting style to one that matches a particular agenda. These accounts won’t be flagged by automatic systems early on because they won’t match the traditional flagging metrics. But, their later posts might be reported by other platform users. Manual reviewers are then able to determine if it’s a group of real people or a set of bot accounts.</p>\n<h2><b>Real-Time Verification</b></h2>\n<p>Some apps try to create real-life situations where people can meet up and interact in person. For example, Pokémon Go requires users to band together in a physical location so they can take down powerful, legendary Pokémon. Other dating and friend-making apps entirely rely on users to interact in-person to establish relationships. These types of apps have a unique problem. They must ensure their users are entirely real, so others can trust the app to find them safe social situations.</p>\n<p>Many of these apps use a significant amount of manual reviews to find fake users. But others use extensive verification and new, unique technology to do the same. Dating apps like <a href=\"https://hily.com/\">Hily</a> (Hey, I Like You) capture new user information by linking to pre-existing Facebook accounts and comparing uploaded photos to Facebook photos to ensure that the <a href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2017/10/05/hily-dating-app-uses-ai-and-identification-to-improve-safety-and-potential-matches/\">same person is using both accounts</a>.</p>\n<p>Other social apps are now introducing <a href=\"https://www.irishtimes.com/business/technology/tinder-takes-on-fraudsters-by-asking-for-real-time-photo-1.4154237\">real-time photo requirements</a>. A real-time photo obligation involves snapping a current picture to compare against uploaded images (pictures). The goal is to use built-in technology to make the account creation process more challenging to automate. By requiring multiple verification steps, apps can curb scam accounts and increase user safety.</p>\n<h2><b>A Problem that Isn’t Going Way</b></h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://jboitnott.com/how-to-reduce-credit-score-damage-if-youre-a-victim-of-identity-theft/\">Online scams</a> and malicious bots will likely continue to increase in number as we devote more time and trust to Internet-based technology. But app creators and developers realize this and are taking necessary steps to develop better security systems.</p>\n<p>Entrepreneurs are testing many approaches, from detecting fake accounts through machine learning and facial recognition to manually reviewing user-flagged accounts. And, as nefarious tactics evolve, we’re likely to see even better methods to stop these spammers from succeeding.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Polina Zimmerman; Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/31/the-top-ways-apps-are-stopping-bots-and-fake-accounts/\">The Top Ways Apps are Stopping Bots and Fake Accounts</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 31 Mar 2020 15:00:25 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/The-Top-Ways-Apps-are-Stopping-Bots-and-Fake-Accounts-264x300.png","linkMd5":"36de1938a10fb37b54cc74629e70cba6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn41@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-07-787_fc4469717fef5126.webp","destWidth":264,"destHeight":300,"sourceBytes":125806,"destBytes":9162,"author":"John Boitnott","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/The-Top-Ways-Apps-are-Stopping-Bots-and-Fake-Accounts-264x300.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn41@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-07-787_fc4469717fef5126.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878347},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"AI Won’t Fix Education, but it Can Help","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=168904","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/14/ai-wont-fix-education-but-it-can-help/\" title=\"AI Won’t Fix Education, but it Can Help\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AI-Won%E2%80%99t-Fix-Education-but-it-Can-Help-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"ai in education\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AI-Won%E2%80%99t-Fix-Education-but-it-Can-Help-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AI-Won%E2%80%99t-Fix-Education-but-it-Can-Help-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AI-Won%E2%80%99t-Fix-Education-but-it-Can-Help.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Now more than ever, our teachers need help. Faced with an unprecedented crisis of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/22/from-polarization-to-open-learning-how-technology-can-help-us-beyond-covid-19/\">having to move all instruction online in a matter of weeks</a>, everyone is figuring out the new playbook for teaching in the 21st century. Here is artificial intelligence, and education &#8212; AI won&#8217;t fix education, but it can help.</p>\n<p>One of the topics discussed, alongside video chats, online quizzes, and remote attendance is artificial intelligence. Indeed, it’s time to take a closer look at how AI can be helpful to our instructors today. But, the problem is that very few people understand AI.</p>\n<h4>Do you understand AI?</h4>\n<p>I do not mean that very few people understand the computer languages and algorithms that drive artificial intelligence, although that’s true for many. I mean that very few people understand the pattern of what “artificial intelligence” means to human beings in a macro sense.</p>\n<p>Not having an understanding of something as crucial to the future as artificial intelligence <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/04/a-megatrend-set-to-disrupt-the-business-world/\">has consequences.</a> Those consequences will cross all of the business sectors, investment, technology, media, and will primarily be apparent when those sectors converge in a hype cycle or are thrust into the unknown.</p>\n<h2>We think AI is a solid thing.</h2>\n<p>We tend to think AI is a solid thing like a concrete construction. We believe that things are either <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/24/how-ai-at-the-edge-other-iot-trends-are-transforming-every-industry/\">AI or they are not AI</a>. But history demonstrates that’s not how it works. Depending on where we are on any given day, artificial intelligence is a moving target.</p>\n<p>Just having passed the 50th anniversary of the first moon landing, it’s helpful to remember that at that time, the best minds in the world were working on the space effort. We thought that machines doing the heavy trigonometry and calculus required for guiding rockets would have to be “artificially intelligent.”</p>\n<h4><strong>Collectively, we thought, “this math is hard, you have to be very intelligent to do it,” so we surmised that machines doing this work were intelligent, thinking machines. </strong></h4>\n<p>We stopped thinking of them as being artificially intelligent once computers did fancy math faster and better than humans. Humans decided that what computers did was just advanced number crunching, and we <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2014/07/21/how-computer-code-has-changed-since-apollo-11-landed-on-the-moon/\">moved the goal post</a>.</p>\n<p>In the 1970s and 1980s, many smart people believed a computer couldn&#8217;t master the strategic and creative thinking in chess. We used to believe that chess was the ultimate intelligent endeavor.</p>\n<p>A computer that understood chess <em>had</em> to be intelligent. In the 1990s, computers began regularly beating the planet’s best chess masters. We accepted the fact then that intelligence didn&#8217;t win chess games. Computers dominated chess because they could cycle through many more potential moves far faster than any human.</p>\n<h4><strong>Suddenly, a machine that could win at chess was a specialized algorithm, not artificially intelligent. </strong></h4>\n<p>Similarly, the complexity of human speech was potentially beyond the reach of machines before Siri, Alexa, and Google brought speech recognition into our phones and homes. The idea that someone could say, “Alexa, order pizza,” and pizza would come to your door had to be powered by artificially intelligent computers that could understand and obey.</p>\n<p>But now we see speech recognition as just translating from soundwaves to text, and then processing the text with some simple rules, and there’s no “thinking” anywhere in the process. And as we’ve come to accept that, we’ve discounted it and moved the AI target again.</p>\n<h2>Understanding AI as being fluid</h2>\n<p>The point is that AI isn’t an object with a solid beginning point. It’s the next thing on the horizon, and today, that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/27/future-of-artificial-intelligence-for-2020/\">horizon looks very different.</a> Once we understand this “object” and what it does, once we accept it and understand it, we won’t think of it as AI anymore, and we’ll move on to the next goal in smart machinery.</p>\n<h4><strong>If history has taught us anything, we may never get to a place where we say, “Alright, that’s AI.” </strong></h4>\n<p>We won&#8217;t be able to recognize what AI is until we have machines that mimic or surpass human intelligence and reasoning. We refer to that kind of depth and breadth as “Artificial General Intelligence.” While this scenario will almost certainly happen &#8212; it’s a long way off.</p>\n<p>That does not mean we won’t develop <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/08/how-will-it-shape-up-the-future-of-the-internet/\">compelling solutions to complex problems</a>. The innovative products that come from complex issues will generally make our lives better. We will have plenty of those, probably at an accelerated pace now. The area of AI where I work, in education, offers good examples.</p>\n<h4>AI software.</h4>\n<p>We are, right now, working on software that can sort responses and help instructors <a href=\"https://www.gradescope.com/help#help-center-item-assignment-types\">assign grades to written coursework </a>at high speed and in great quantities.</p>\n<p>We are constantly improving teaching, learning, and course work. AI, as a tool is helpful particularly when you can’t meet with students personally. Other companies have developed computer tutors that can answer questions about certain subjects. These computers can also suggest the most helpful learning resources.</p>\n<p>Answering questions is extremely helpful when students aren’t in physical classrooms. They can&#8217;t raise their hands or ask classmates if they aren&#8217;t sitting, physically, in a certain space.</p>\n<h4>AI products.</h4>\n<p>The AI products are fundamentally filling some of the human activities of teaching. However, they do things that people can do so we think of them as being artificial or driven by AI. But like their chess-playing ancestors, the AI-enabled tutors and auto-graders won’t actually be thinking as a human would.</p>\n<h4>AI tutors.</h4>\n<p>These AI tutors comb through data, looking for patterns and similarities, and acting accordingly. And one day, we will eventually view these AI-enabled tools as commonly acceptable technology activities. We’ll start thinking of <i>grading </i>AI the way we think of <i>chess </i>AI, a tool to help us get better at or do something more efficiently.</p>\n<h2>AI is a tool</h2>\n<p>Knowing that AI is a tool leads us to another hangup about AI. It&#8217;s a tool &#8212; not a decision-maker. “Smart” computers may calculate and track the path of a projectile faster and more accurately than a person. But, AI cannot decide whether we should go to the moon.</p>\n<p>Similarly, in education, AI won’t replace teachers, with their ability to connect, inspire, and guide students to become better people. Instead, AI will make many tasks easier and faster as it did for NASA flight engineers 50 years ago.</p>\n<h4>AI is here &#8212; and it&#8217;s perpetually just around the corner.</h4>\n<p>The point is that AI isn’t something we’re waiting for since it’s both <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2012/10/16/futurists-cheat-sheet-artificial-intelligence/\">here already and perpetually around the next corner.</a> We can, and should, expect bread-and-butter shortcuts and solutions to things we think are complex or difficult. But that’s technology, not AI.</p>\n<p>We get technology. Tech is something we see, experience – a thing we can make and invest in. We can call it AI if we want. We probably just won’t call it that for very long.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/14/ai-wont-fix-education-but-it-can-help/\">AI Won’t Fix Education, but it Can Help</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 14 May 2020 15:00:14 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AI-Won%E2%80%99t-Fix-Education-but-it-Can-Help.jpg","linkMd5":"35c30ec1086696746d8c464b43506a8c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn56@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-25-806_afc4853fe8523aed.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AI-Won%E2%80%99t-Fix-Education-but-it-Can-Help.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":52478,"destBytes":46036,"author":"Sergey Karayev","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/AI-Won%E2%80%99t-Fix-Education-but-it-Can-Help-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-28-202_f18f1f87ad99a070.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877082},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:01","title":"How AI Will Help Eradicate Spam Backlinks","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=166729","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/10/artificial-intelligence-link-building-spam/\" title=\"How AI Will Help Eradicate Spam Backlinks\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/artificial-intelligence-link-building-spam-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/artificial-intelligence-link-building-spam-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/artificial-intelligence-link-building-spam-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/artificial-intelligence-link-building-spam-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/artificial-intelligence-link-building-spam-1536x1024.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/artificial-intelligence-link-building-spam.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Whilst governments attempt massive crackdown on email spammers via laws like GDPR, some of the world’s largest tech behemoths are working hard to eliminate email and link building tactics that sit on the negative end of the bell curve. But instead of regulating with punitive legal measures, they regulate via training their algorithms to learn, adapt and improve how they read, interpret and act against some of the internet’s most prolific backlink spammers. In short, the bots are getting closer to reasoning as humans would when it comes to identification of poor online content or tactics that add little to increase the value to actual users.</p>\n<p>As the bots get smarter, eventually even the <a href=\"https://seo.co/link-building-strategies/\">best backlink strategies</a>, if they are done manually, will be more easily detected by smarter, always-learning webcrawlers. Avoiding manual link building altogether is ill-advised, but extreme care should be taken when doing so, to ensure the path of least resistance is not a shady shortcut.</p>\n<h2><strong>The Early Days of Link Building Are Dead </strong></h2>\n<p>In the early days of the internet, a wild west land grab was truly afoot. In those days, simple exact match domains (EMDs) could be purchased, a few low-quality links thrown their way and voila: you’re ranking for high volume search queries.</p>\n<p>In fact, in the earliest days, there were no algorithmic checks for site gestation (often referred to as the “<a href=\"https://ahrefs.com/blog/google-sandbox/\">Google Sandbox</a>”) that would keep sites’ rankings muted for months or longer, to ensure they were not wielding some fly-by-night, flash-in-the-pan business model for selling shady products/services.</p>\n<p>No, in those days, you could rank easily with a basic knowledge of SEO.</p>\n<p>Contrast that to today. A more mature internet means billions of pages of indexed content, including that number to the Nth degree of legitimate backlinks. In fact, <a href=\"https://techjury.net/stats-about/blogs-published-per-day#gref\">it is estimated</a> that some 4.4 million blog articles are posted daily.</p>\n<p>A more established internet also means that some sites have backlink profiles that are decades old, including millions of relevant inbound links. These types of signals are extremely strong to search engine spiders, allowing the big to get bigger and the small to stagnate without a whole lot of hustle.</p>\n<p>This is one reason why, when it comes to online marketing in competitive industries, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/20/why-we-shouldnt-be-in-love-with-startups/\">startups are in a perpetual state of playing catch-up</a> with larger, more seasoned rivals. It’s at least one reason why startups should <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/04/startups-dont-need-to-be-revolutionary-they-need-to-be-different/\">seek to differentiate</a>, not revolutionize the world.</p>\n<p>As early as a decade ago, startups had a better chance at competing by creating low quality content from link wheels, link farms, private blog networks, sitewide links, web directories and other tools for automatic link generation.</p>\n<p>Fortunately for the users, today’s algorithms are getting better at outsmarting spam.</p>\n<h2><strong>How Search Engines Interpret Link Spam </strong></h2>\n<p>A year ago we experienced algorithmic blocks on emails that were incorrectly attributed to spam. The experience is not only a great case study in how legit sites can also get it wrong, but also how algorithms are now created with their own checks and balances to weed out bad actors.</p>\n<p>In this case, we had established new emails under a brand-new domain name, but these emails were attached to an established business, so several of the accounts which were tied to existing email sequences for marketing. These sequences were accustomed to sending more than 200 emails a day from automated marketing chains.</p>\n<p>However, due to the newness of the accounts anything over 50 emails started causing an automated throttle-down to occur with the server. This began occurring daily until the account was considered properly seasoned, which tool over a month. In the interim, even the folks in support could not help us get away from what was manually included in the algorithm.</p>\n<p>The machines had interpreted the account as 100% new, assuming that, as a new business account, it would not be normal to have larger numbers of emails sent immediately. We were told it was one of many failsafe layers included in the email algorithm, in order to prevent large-scale spam emails.</p>\n<p>Much like the automated email spam blocks, automating how search engine algorithms interpret spam is very similar. The algorithms look for patterns inherent and common among those building links in a spammy fashion. Here are just a few.</p>\n<p><strong>Link Velocity</strong> – How quickly are links being acquired? Are massive numbers of similar links being pointed to specific pages all at once has the growth in inbound links occurred more naturally over a more extended period?</p>\n<p><strong>Anchor Text &#38; IP Variability</strong> – Is your website using the same term over and over to rank for “buy used cars online”? Are your links coming from different IP addresses? How varied are those IPs?</p>\n<p><strong>Link Variability</strong> – Are there more incoming site links to specific pages targeting highly-competitive keywords? When it comes to outbound links, are there a good mix of both internal and external links from the site in question? Does each article being written include outbound links to other sites using commercial terms or are the links natural and pointing to pages relevant to the user experience that answer actual user queries? This also applies to sitewide links, including those in the footer or on a blog sidebar.</p>\n<p><strong>Co-Citation &#38; Applicability</strong> – Are references in specific articles applicable to other links referenced in the same article?
