href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/27/future-of-artificial-intelligence-for-2020/\"><u>Developments in AI</u></a> are advancing at a rampant pace, with innovations improving the quality of life in different ways across disciplines.</p>\n<p>For instance, <em><i>Forbes </i></em>estimates that <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/oliviergarret/2017/03/03/10-million-self-driving-cars-will-hit-the-road-by-2020-heres-how-to-profit/#2f3b47be7e50\"><u>10 million self-driving cars</u></a> will hit the road in 2020, and another study reported by <em><i>Business Wire</i></em> projects that automotive artificial intelligence will bring in <a href=\"https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20170524005456/en/Automotive-Artificial-Intelligence-Revenue-Reach-14-Billion\"><u>revenues of over $14 billion by 2025</u></a>.</p>\n<p>Another example is Google’s Deep Learning program <a href=\"https://ai.googleblog.com/2017/03/assisting-pathologists-in-detecting.html\"><u>helping pathologists detect cancer</u></a> with higher accuracy. Another article from <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/reenitadas/2017/10/05/how-big-data-could-help-to-prevent-one-fatal-heart-attack-every-40-seconds/#3462df6a2089\"><em><u><i>Forbes</i></u></em></a> asserts how the use of big data can help prevent a heart attack every 40 seconds.</p>\n<p>Although many organizations across fields still lack the foundational practices needed to create value from AI at scale, <strong><em><b><i>AI is being adopted at a rapid rate by digital marketers across niches.</i></b></em></strong></p>\n<p>As reported by <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/190858/most-effective-online-marketing-channels-according-to-us-companies/\"><u>Statista</u></a>, artificial intelligence and machine learning are among the most effective digital marketing techniques used by marketers today.</p>\n<p>With more and more marketers learning how AI can help them create better marketing solutions, in 2019 AI saw an <a href=\"https://albert.ai/news/new-study-finds-that-88-of-marketers-are-using-artificial-intelligence-yet-many-marketers-still-dont-feel-very-well-supported-by-their-technology/\"><u>88%</u></a> adoption rate in marketing—up from 43% in 2016.</p>\n<p>AI aids marketers in gaining insights into their customers’ ideations and improves their marketing approach.</p>\n<p><strong><b>Most recent innovations in marketing with AI have seen great results. </b></strong></p>\n<p>The <em><i>Washington Post</i></em> has been <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/pr/wp/2016/08/05/the-washington-post-experiments-with-automated-storytelling-to-help-power-2016-rio-olympics-coverage/\"><u>experimenting with automated storytelling</u></a>. <em><i>USA Today</i></em> leveraged AI to maximize video engagement, and Netflix continues to apply machine-learning techniques to <a href=\"https://www.fool.com/investing/2016/06/19/how-netflixs-ai-saves-it-1-billion-every-year.aspx\"><u>personalize your recommendations deeply</u></a> (helping them save billions of dollars annually!).</p>\n<h2><strong>Here are some more ways AI will disrupt marketing in 2020:</strong></h2>\n<h3>1. Advertising Networks</h3>\n<p>Technology has miniaturized, and people now <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/678739/forecast-on-connected-devices-per-person/\"><u>own six connected devices on average</u></a>. However, even with the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/16/10-reasons-that-demonstrate-the-importance-of-technology-in-business/\"><u>technological advancements</u></a> and all the screens an average person owns, advertising remains inept.</p>\n<p>Users are bombarded with ineffective advertisements that have nothing to do with their interests.</p>\n<p>It is safe to say that there’s a significant void in advertising—the lack of personalization—that can be filled using AI.</p>\n<p>Although primitive ad automation helps bring forth more relevant ads, the technology completely disregards privacy. It also does not factor in accidental clicks and taps on ads, which is where AI can chip in to help.</p>\n<p>AI can instantly generate a personalized advertising copy by security and anonymously analyzing user data. It will make predictions exhilaratingly accurate and boost ROI in advertising exponentially.</p>\n<p>Search sessions will become more relevant, and finding products will never have been easier. Both Facebook and Google incorporate machine learning to their ad platforms to furnish personalized ads to targeted audiences.</p>\n<h3>2. Email Marketing</h3>\n<p>Brands in all kinds of niches can leverage the power of AI to personalize emails in <u>email marketing campaigns</u> based on customer behaviors and preferences.</p>\n<p>AI will enable brands to make better connections with their audiences and, in turn, boost revenues.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/06/machine-learning-software-testing/\"><u>Machine learning</u></a>, even in its nascent stages, can analyze millions of data points about a customer base and determine the best times to send customers emails.</p>\n<p>This information, coupled with the personalized content that the AI will generate, will drive more interest and clicks.</p>\n<p>In contrast, A/B tests take a lot of time and have a margin of error. AI will aid marketers in reaching and converting customers quickly.</p>\n<p>Tools like Boomtrain and Persado use AI to make email marketing campaigns potent and persuasive.</p>\n<h3>3. Content Generation</h3>\n<p>Although AI cannot <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/21/blogger-outreach-the-definitive-guide-for-the-beginners/\"><u>write a blog post</u> </a>or newspaper column unaided, the content generated by an AI can help brands attract visitors to their websites.</p>\n<p>AI can save marketers lots of time and resources by writing reports and generating news articles based on data supplied.</p>\n<p>Intelligent tools like Wordsmith and Quill are already in use by the <em><i>Associated Press </i></em>and <em><i>Forbes </i></em>to create posts that drive clicks on their website. Google, too, is working on an AI that will be able to generate a best-selling book in no time.</p>\n<p>The AI-based tools do not work unaided, and templates and “fill-in-the-blank” style forms are still used to enter data and keywords to generate unique, targeted content; however, the content generated by the AI is indistinguishable from that written by a professional.</p>\n<p>It is likely that users have already read posts on news outlets like BBC, CBS, the <em><i>New York Times</i></em>, and the <em><i>Washington Post</i></em> generated by AI.</p>\n<p>The technology is slowly trickling down and will change the way marketers create content.</p>\n<h3>4. Content Curation</h3>\n<p>AI can also curate content for the user and not just generate it. AI will make it possible for brands to connect with their visitors better by showing them more relevant, personalized content.</p>\n<p>AI is already used to make content recommendations that the visitor may find interesting. Amazon does this on a large scale using the “people who buy X also buy Y” recommendations.</p>\n<p>As mentioned above, Netflix’s recommendation system uses AI to keep the user hooked to shows and movies they like. The AI helps Netflix reduce cancellations, saving them billions of dollars a year.</p>\n<p>Tools like Curata and List.ly enable markets to curate the most relevant content for each user.</p>\n<h3>5. Voice Searching</h3>\n<p>A report by Statista reveals that <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/1036727/global-voice-search-region-device/\"><u>42% of the worldwide population</u></a> has voice-searched for something online in the first quarter of 2019.</p>\n<p>With smart devices becoming increasingly accessible and cheap, and the rise of Apple’s Siri, Microsoft’s Cortana, and more recently, Amazon’s Alexa and the Google Assistant is changing how we search.</p>\n<p>AI will make searching more accurate and leverage the data the user supplies to make personalized recommendations.</p>\n<p>However, the use of AI and voice searching leaves marketers wondering how they can optimize their content for voice searches since the natural, conversational language used in doing these searches does not involve the use of keywords in the same manner.</p>\n<p>Although marketers will have some trouble initially, the user will benefit from the personalized content and hence will make more purchases.</p>\n<h3>6. User Experience (UX)</h3>\n<p>Through the use of intelligent algorithms, it’s possible to personalize user experience on a website.</p>\n<p>After analysis of various data points about the user, including location, demographics, type of device, and style of interaction with the site, the AI can personalize offers and contents displayed on the website accordingly.</p>\n<p>In 2017, <u>33% of the marketers</u> were experimenting with AI for real-time personalization. When asked about the benefits of AI-driven customization, 63% of them responded that it improved the consumer’s experience and increased conversion rates.</p>\n<p>Tools like <a href=\"https://uizard.io/\"><u>Uizard</u></a> and Mockplus leverage AI to help marketers create better user experience.</p>\n<p>Excellent user experience keeps the user browsing the site longer, and the longer users stay on the site, the higher the probability of conversion is.</p>\n<p>Personalizing the UX will make websites highly attractive and immensely profitable.</p>\n<h3>7. Web Design</h3>\n<p>Creating websites is a lot easier now than it was ever before. Using tools like WordPress, programming or technical experience is no longer necessary to make a website.</p>\n<p>However, web design is about to get a lot easier.</p>\n<p>Tools like <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OXA4-5x31V0\"><u>Grid</u></a> use AI to design websites based on information provided by the user. Soon marketers will only need to supply AI with the text, images, and calls to action they want on their website to create a professional-looking website in minutes.</p>\n<h3>8. Chatbots</h3>\n<p>Many brands now use messaging apps like WhatsApp, Slack, and even Facebook Messenger to communicate with their prospects.</p>\n<p>Communicating this way is fast and easy since the customers are already using these tools to chat with their friends and family.</p>\n<p>Chatbots use AI to automatically engage and respond to both customers and prospective buyers’ queries.</p>\n<p>Marketers will sell their products and services passively—without needing to be available to respond to clients. With chatbots, there will also be no compromises in the quality of service.</p>\n<p>AI-powered chatbots are capable of answering open-ended questions using natural language processing and machine learning to generate the correct response.</p>\n<p>Other than making quality customer support available to clients 24-7, with chatbots, there are no risks of slipups. Waiting time will also no longer be an issue.</p>\n<p>Facebook bot tools and wit.ai are tools that help marketers train bots by feeding them example conversations. The chatbot will continually get better at responding to clients.</p>\n<h2><strong><b>Conclusion</b></strong></h2>\n<p>I firmly believe that digital marketing firms must take advantage of AI-driven tools and integrate the new processes, tools, software, and skills at the earliest.</p>\n<p>With the increase in popularity of AI-as-a-service models, marketers will soon have access to diverse and powerful tools that will aid them in creating and curating content that connects with prospects on a deeper level.</p>\n<p>These tools will also assist in fabricating digital marketing strategies and help brands deliver improved customer experiences. The technology will also give marketers a head start by designing enticing websites quickly. Therefore, missing out on this marketing revolution could lead to many Kodak moments.</p>\n<p>From all outlooks, it seems that 2020 will be an exciting year for AI, and businesses across disciplines, including <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/cognitiveworld/2019/10/13/ai-in-finance-insights-from-bny-mellon/#4e5ec24a53c2\"><u>FinTech</u></a>, health care, and marketing organizations, will benefit from AI-based tools.</p>\n<p>The global market for AI is on the rise, with revenues generated from AI <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/607716/worldwide-artificial-intelligence-market-revenues/\"><u>expected to increase to $118.6 billion by 2025</u></a>.</p>\n<p>Therefore, conclusively, I think the adoption of AI regardless of niche is what the marketing space needs to increase engagement and boost profits while reducing the direct costs of content research, creation, and promotion.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/12/is-ai-going-to-disrupt-the-marketing-industry/\">Is AI Going to Disrupt the Marketing Industry?</a> appeared +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Is-AI-Going-to-Disrupt-the-Marketing-Industry.jpg","linkMd5":"7f0b20b71aa116323dadee90e2f3ddb5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn84@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-22-322_8bb4a278bf6158bb.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Is-AI-Going-to-Disrupt-the-Marketing-Industry.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":27607,"destBytes":18492,"author":"Harikrishna Kundariya","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Is-AI-Going-to-Disrupt-the-Marketing-Industry-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn55@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-10-690_51f77b7f6368b7fc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195868862},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","title":"BPM Core WiFi-Enabled Blood Pressure Monitor","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173377","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/29/bpm-core-wifi-enabled-blood-pressure-monitor/\" title=\"BPM Core WiFi-Enabled Blood Pressure Monitor\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/BPM-Core-WiFi-Enabled-Blood-Pressure-Monitor-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"blood pressure monitor\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/BPM-Core-WiFi-Enabled-Blood-Pressure-Monitor-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/BPM-Core-WiFi-Enabled-Blood-Pressure-Monitor-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/BPM-Core-WiFi-Enabled-Blood-Pressure-Monitor.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>BPM Core is a soon-to-be-launched WiFi-enabled blood pressure monitor. This clinically-validated blood pressure monitor is more than just a monitor, though. Developed by two cardiologists that work in Paris hospitals, it also is an electrocardiogram and stethoscope, which enable a better chance of detecting silent heart conditions.</p>\n<h2>About BPM Core</h2>\n<p>This is one of the easiest blood pressure monitors to use. You strap the monitor on similar to other devices. Then, you press a button that delivers a three-in-one heart health checkup. The readings show up instantly on the device.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-173384\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/withings-bpm-core-1-300x200.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"600\" height=\"399\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/withings-bpm-core-1-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/withings-bpm-core-1-900x599.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/withings-bpm-core-1-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/withings-bpm-core-1-1536x1023.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/withings-bpm-core-1.jpg 1840w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></p>\n<h2>Blood Pressure Results</h2>\n<p>BPM Core results include systolic and diastolic blood pressure. Taking your blood pressure at home helps alleviate the fear of going to the doctor plus gives you an easy way to regularly track your hypertension.</p>\n<h2>Electrocardiogram Results</h2>\n<p class=\"feature-subtitle\" data-tr=\"hkixihee\">Using an electrocardiogram can help to detect atrial fibrillation. BPM Core delivers a medical-grade ECG because it uses three electrodes. Like your blood pressure tracking, you can get immediate results to find out if you show any signs of atrial fibrillation.</p>\n<h2 data-tr=\"hkixihee\">Digital Stethoscope Results</h2>\n<p class=\"feature-subtitle\" data-tr=\"okroxox\">A digital stethoscope can help to detect valvular heart disease. BPM Core has a precise sound sensor and artificial intelligence capability that listen for heart sound frequencies that indicate how your heart valves are doing when it comes to opening and closing. The device can detect potential disturbances that may indicate you are at risk for common valvular heart diseases.</p>\n<p data-tr=\"okroxox\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-173385\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/withings-bpm-core-3-en-300x200.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"600\" height=\"400\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/withings-bpm-core-3-en-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/withings-bpm-core-3-en-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/withings-bpm-core-3-en-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/withings-bpm-core-3-en.jpg 1240w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></p>\n<h2 data-tr=\"okroxox\">Shareable Data</h2>\n<div class=\"col-insight\">\n<div class=\"insight-wrapper\" data-event-action=\"click-arg-block\" data-event-label=\"share-info-doctor\">\n<p class=\"insight-txt\" data-tr=\"etyl\">One of the standouts of using this smart device is that, if you have the iOS version of its Health Mate App, then you can share the data with your physician. By sending your physician data about your blood pressure history and electrocardiogram results, you have a better chance of effectively managing hypertension and heart health.</p>\n<h2 data-tr=\"etyl\">Standout Features</h2>\n<p>Some features to note is the ability to share the device with up to eight people. It offers free data storage and unlimited access to all the data recorded on the BPM Core. Other standout features include a rechargeable battery, integration with Apple Health, and instant results that are easy to read on the clear LED screen. The Health Mate App can track activity, sleep, weight, heart, and environment.</p>\n<h2>Improvements</h2>\n<p>While the Health Mate App works on Android devices, too, it doesn&#8217;t offer the ability to share the data with your physician yet.</p>\n<h2>In the Box</h2>\n</div>\n<p>The BPM Core device comes with a micro-USB cable and installation guide. The Health Mate app is free and can be downloaded from an app store. You also get a free Withings account, which is where your data can be securely stored, accessed, and downloaded at any time.</p>\n</div>\n<h2>Where to Buy</h2>\n<p>The cost is $249.95, and it will become available shortly. A travel case for $29.95 will also be available soon. It will come with free shipping, a 30-day return option, and a one-year warranty.</p>\n<p>There is a link on <a href=\"https://www.withings.com/us/en/bpm-core\">Withings</a> where you can put your name on the list to be one of the first to purchase the smart blood pressure monitor.</p>\n<h2>Overall Thoughts</h2>\n<p>Although this blood pressure monitor is more expensive than others on the market, it offers more functionality and features that greatly increase its value. It&#8217;s well worth the money to have this ability to track heart health and blood pressure from home, especially when it may be challenging to get to the doctor&#8217;s office.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/29/bpm-core-wifi-enabled-blood-pressure-monitor/\">BPM Core WiFi-Enabled Blood Pressure Monitor</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 29 Jun 2020 21:01:11 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/BPM-Core-WiFi-Enabled-Blood-Pressure-Monitor.jpg","linkMd5":"109b4656ec1ab8218baadaa4f6c5231e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn86@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-09-434_8730b211abaf7c21.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/BPM-Core-WiFi-Enabled-Blood-Pressure-Monitor.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":84829,"destBytes":90552,"author":"Deanna Ritchie","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/BPM-Core-WiFi-Enabled-Blood-Pressure-Monitor-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn85@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-09-537_d5ce20e396c1c41d.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/withings-bpm-core-1-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn40@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-12-707_1c0d02b8e925f518.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/withings-bpm-core-3-en-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn28@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-15-681_38569ca91f298261.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195874497},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:01","title":"Public Venture Funding Could Help Build Canada’s Tech Talent","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=166611","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/13/public-venture-funding-could-help-build-canadas-tech-talent/\" title=\"Public Venture Funding Could Help Build Canada’s Tech Talent\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Public-Venture-Funding-Could-Help-Build-Canada%E2%80%99s-Tech-Talent-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"public venture funding\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Public-Venture-Funding-Could-Help-Build-Canada%E2%80%99s-Tech-Talent-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Public-Venture-Funding-Could-Help-Build-Canada%E2%80%99s-Tech-Talent-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Public-Venture-Funding-Could-Help-Build-Canada%E2%80%99s-Tech-Talent.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Over the last few years, Canada’s technology sector has been experiencing a renaissance. Increased venture funding has been helping to develop a robust tech ecosystem with major hubs in Vancouver, Ottawa, Montreal, and Toronto. Here&#8217;s how public venture funding can help build Canada&#8217;s tech talent.</p>\n<p>Despite this noticeable growth, however, Canadian tech companies still face significant challenges when it comes to <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/04/today-the-tech-talent-shortage-is-everybodys-problem/\" data-original-title=\"\">attracting and retaining top-quality talent</a> — but that’s starting to change.</p>\n<p>Public venture funding has become a valuable avenue for growth for early-stage businesses in the sector, helping to put Canada’s tech industry on the map for professionals both locally and abroad.</p>\n<h2><b>Where Canada’s Tech Talent Landscape is Today</b></h2>\n<p>Canada’s capabilities for developing tech talent are evident across a number of its post-secondary institutions, and technical education is also seeing investment from industry players.</p>\n<p>Shopify is working with Carleton and York universities to <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://www.theglobeandmail.com/business/careers/management/article-tech-companies-increasingly-hiring-passionate-committed-talent/?utm_medium=Newsletter\" data-original-title=\"\">recruit grade 12 students</a> for a co-op computer science degree. Despite such efforts, up to <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://www.theglobeandmail.com/business/technology/article-canada-facing-brain-drain-as-young-tech-talent-leaves-for-silicon/\" data-original-title=\"\">25% of STEM graduates</a> from the country’s top universities leave Canada to <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/06/11/the-investment-landscape-of-the-future-toward-many-silicon-valleys/\" data-original-title=\"\">work abroad</a>, taking the investment into their education — and their potential to generate tax dollars — with them.</p>\n<h4>Canada is working hard to make it easier for skilled professionals from abroad to make their way into our growing tech ecosystem.</h4>\n<p>Government-led programs like the <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/services/immigrate-canada/start-visa.html\" data-original-title=\"\">Startup Visa Program</a> and the <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://venturebeat.com/2019/10/05/why-we-moved-our-silicon-valley-startup-to-canada/\" data-original-title=\"\">Global Talent Stream</a> are proving successful in attracting quality talent.</p>\n<p>With the Global Talent Stream, for instance, the country has reduced visa-processing times from 10 months to two weeks for those with a background in IT or STEM-related fields. To date, some 1,000 technology companies have hired 4,000 workers through the program.<b></b></p>\n<h3><b>Imported talent — along with the STEM graduates that stay in-country, are often recruited by major international companies.</b></h3>\n<p>These workers are recruited to work in international development offices.</p>\n<p>Most of the time, employees in these satellite locations are paid at a discount of what their peers make at HQ. The code developed in these offices is then monetized by international firms. The monetization reduces the effective share of corporate taxes funneled into the Canadian government.</p>\n<h4>Besides, these companies will often work to move their top talent to their international headquarters, further contributing to Canada’s tech talent gap.</h4>\n<p>All of these factors add up to a tenuous talent landscape that begs to be addressed by both industry and government alike — especially if we want to see Canada’s tech ecosystem participate alongside other global leaders.</p>\n<h2><b>Incentivizing Tech Talent to Stay</b></h2>\n<p>If we want to <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/04/today-the-tech-talent-shortage-is-everybodys-problem/\" data-original-title=\"\">keep existing tech talent</a> in Canada, then we have to ensure that our tech industry is something worth staying for. On their part, tech companies are taking their fates into their own hands.<b> </b></p>\n<h3><b>To combat the lack of private venture funding in Canada, growth-stage businesses are leveraging public venture capital.</b></h3>\n<p>Public venture capital has been vital in establishing Canada’s leadership in the resource space. Canada’s average deal size across all deals in 2018 was <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://central.cvca.ca/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/CVCA_EN_Canada_VC_Q3-2019_Final2.pdf\" data-original-title=\"\">C$12 million.</a> That figure is compared to <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://files.pitchbook.com/website/files/pdf/3Q_2019_PitchBook_NVCA_Venture_Monitor.pdf\" data-original-title=\"\">US$14.5 million</a> for early-stage companies and the US $42.2 million for late-stage companies in the United States.</p>\n<p>Junior mining and energy companies capitalized on public markets like TSX Venture Exchange to attract retail investors. The capitalization also builds success early on. We’re now seeing our technology community leverage these same mechanisms to foster growth.</p>\n<p>An added bonus? By being public, companies can better <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/29/five-ways-to-close-the-iot-skills-gap/\">attract qualified employees</a> with stock options, helping them buy into the long-term success of the business.</p>\n<h3><b>Both federal and regional governments are working to develop innovation incentives that could develop more appealing job opportunities for local and international professionals.</b></h3>\n<p>The job opportunities include the <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://news.bloombergtax.com/daily-tax-report-international/insight-research-and-development-tax-credits-are-you-eligible-part-2\" data-original-title=\"\">Scientific Research and Experimental Development (SR&#38;ED</a>) tax credit. Federal tax breaks are offered of up to 35% to private Canadian companies that have an R&#38;D cycle at the core of their business model.</p>\n<p>As a result, organizations can now afford to seek out highly skilled developers and engineers to help them develop new, <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/01/free-up-the-worlds-best-entrepreneurs-to-keep-inventing/\" data-original-title=\"\">disruptive products</a>.</p>\n<h4>Changes are also being made at the provincial level.</h4>\n<p>British Columbia, for instance, has established tax credits of up to 30% for individuals and corporations that invest in <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/employment-business/investment-capital/venture-capital-programs/eligible-business-corporation/tax-credits\" data-original-title=\"\">eligible business corporations</a> (EBCs).<b> </b></p>\n<p>Tax credits have also helped increase investor interest in many BC-based technology companies, allowing them to better fund their product development and talent pool.</p>\n<p>As other provinces and territories opt to implement such practices, there is a greater opportunity for tech companies to access available funding and become more appealing to both home-grown and imported professionals.</p>\n<h2><b>There’s Still More to Be Done</b></h2>\n<p>These public and corporate initiatives are starting to make a difference in the development of Canada’s tech space, making it more appealing to potential employees both within and beyond its borders. However, there’s still more to be done.</p>\n<h3><b>To further incentivize growth in this market, Canada’s federal government needs to take measures that help level the playing field between private and public companies.</b></h3>\n<p>With the growing move toward <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/05/31/why-private-access-to-public-assets-will-decide-the-fate-of-smart-cities/\">public venture capital</a>, the government needs to recognize the value of public markets. The government must make it easier for growth-stage companies to list on an exchange while still having access to publicly funded incentives like the SR and ED tax credit.</p>\n<p>As well, the<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/05/10-fabulous-predictions-for-the-future-of-cryptocurrencies/\"> government should also reward investors</a> for putting their hard-earned dollars toward local businesses, expanding the EBC program across the country. These credits should be made available to public companies as well.</p>\n<p>With these measures in place, there will be added opportunities for growth-stage tech companies to make their mark in the space and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/19/5-essential-skills-all-entrepreneurs-need-to-build-success/\">provide attractive jobs</a> to both local and international talent.</p>\n<p>Given all of the initiatives designed to boost tech innovation and funding in Canada, it’s a great place for recent tech grads to build their careers.</p>\n<p>By continuing to develop the innovation ecosystem with support from government programs and private investment &#8212; Canada can further create a space that attracts and retains local talent and benefits the economy.</p>\n<p><em><strong>Image credit: annie spratt, unsplash</strong></em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/13/public-venture-funding-could-help-build-canadas-tech-talent/\">Public Venture Funding Could Help Build Canada’s Tech Talent</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 13 Feb 2020 16:00:24 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Public-Venture-Funding-Could-Help-Build-Canada%E2%80%99s-Tech-Talent.jpg","linkMd5":"09cd96bb8719681d7755f8847239f662","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn71@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-24-690_2321878de3bbb5c4.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Public-Venture-Funding-Could-Help-Build-Canada%E2%80%99s-Tech-Talent.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":48069,"destBytes":42842,"author":"Brady Fletcher","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Public-Venture-Funding-Could-Help-Build-Canada%E2%80%99s-Tech-Talent-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn52@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-27-606_083c09e06aac6730.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195881022},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:01","title":"Outsource or Automate? How to Strategically Take Tasks Off Your Plate","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=166610","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/11/outsource-or-automate-how-to-strategically-take-tasks-off-your-plate/\" title=\"Outsource or Automate? How to Strategically Take Tasks Off Your Plate\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Outsource-or-Automate-How-to-Strategically-Take-Tasks-Off-Your-Plate-300x185.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"outsource or automate\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Outsource-or-Automate-How-to-Strategically-Take-Tasks-Off-Your-Plate-300x185.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Outsource-or-Automate-How-to-Strategically-Take-Tasks-Off-Your-Plate-260x160.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Outsource-or-Automate-How-to-Strategically-Take-Tasks-Off-Your-Plate.png 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Delegation is an essential leadership skill. However, leaders have to delegate correctly. The act of delegating a task doesn’t merely involve dumping the work off and never giving it a second thought. Here is the question, do you outsource or automate? How do you strategically take tasks off your plate?</p>\n<p>Done right, delegating work should be carefully thought out with an eye toward the future. Will the person carrying out the task be able to deliver the expected results on time? Will he be able to help you focus on other things, or will you need to continue an unsavory micromanaging role?</p>\n<p>Perhaps the question that haunts modern leaders most when it comes to delegating tasks is whether they should hand off a job to another human — or a machine. Below are a few easily delegated tasks, along with insights into whether they should be entrusted to a human or an automated process.</p>\n<h2><strong>Invoice Data Entry</strong></h2>\n<p>One of the most mind-numbing processes facing financial professionals is the daunting task of invoice data entry. Processing invoices is easy enough for a small business with a handful of financial interactions. When a company grows beyond that point, though, the volume of invoices can spike. That can make it nightmarish to keep up with inputting the data.</p>\n<p>Do you outsource this to an accountant, who can spend her days punching in numbers for you? Or is there a viable automated solution? According to data extraction company Rossum, smart optical character recognition (OCR) <a href=\"https://rossum.ai/blog/what-is-invoice-data-capture/?utm_source=facebook&#38;utm_medium=social&#38;utm_campaign=blog_what_is_invoice_data_capture\">invoice data entry</a> is now easily automated.</p>\n<p>Not only can the newest software scan a document and gather data from it, but through machine learning, it can also find the data in a variety of templates and formats. The data entry software can then enter the relevant data, turning it into usable information within your accounting system.</p>\n<p>While you still want someone available to oversee the data collection process, you shouldn&#8217;t be afraid to automate invoice data entry.</p>\n<h2><strong>Social Media Management</strong></h2>\n<p>Social media can dramatically help companies in multiple areas, especially when it comes to marketing and customer service. However, the benefits of a good social media strategy can be overshadowed by the intimidating job of regularly creating and posting content for various social channels.</p>\n<p>Fortunately, there are multiple options to help take this one off your plate. Best of all, they involve outsourcing <i>and</i> automation. To start with the latter, automate most of your social media efforts by utilizing applications to organize and schedule your social media calendar.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/\">HubSpot</a> and <a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/\">Sprout Social</a>, for instance, are allow you to automatically post content at the correct times. In addition, software like <a href=\"https://zapier.com/home\">Zapier</a> can enable you to post content to one place, such as WordPress, and have it automatically spread across multiple social channels.</p>\n<p>However, you can’t properly automate the actual creation of content — not yet. For that, consider outsourcing your efforts. Fortunately, millions of freelance writers, editors, graphic designers, and content managers are available for hire. Most cost pennies on the dollar compared to a full-time employee. Sites like <a href=\"https://www.upwork.com/\">Upwork</a> and <a href=\"https://www.fiverr.com/\">Fivver</a> provide easy access for short-term jobs, while sites like <a href=\"https://problogger.com/\">Problogger.com</a> source candidates for long-term freelance positions.</p>\n<h2><strong>Customer Service</strong></h2>\n<p>Customer service is more important than ever. There&#8217;s competition in nearly every industry, and online platforms empower customers to provide very public feedback. The way you treat your existing customer base has <a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/284799\">never been more essential to success</a>.</p>\n<p>However, customer service is a painstakingly time-consuming job that can soak up endless amounts of a leader’s time. This is especially true for entrepreneurs and SMB owners, who often put in much of the customer service legwork themselves.</p>\n<p>Increasingly sophisticated chatbots utilize <a href=\"https://anadea.info/blog/10-verticals-where-ai-is-making-an-impact-in-2019\">Natural Language Processing to understand and interact with humans</a>. However, they&#8217;re still limited in the scope of their abilities. Therefore, unless your customer service needs are extremely simple, it’s likely better to outsource the job to another human being.</p>\n<p>With that said, flesh out a proper transition process. Write out your expectations as you consider different call centers and customer service options. Don’t simply pass the baton without a thought — you could end up hurting more than helping.</p>\n<h2>Outsource or Automate?</h2>\n<p>Each situation warrants an “<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/14/outsourcing-automation-future-of-business-scalability/\">outsource or automate?</a>” conversation. Leaders need to take the time to consider their tasks — what activities can be delegated to free up time? This allows them to avoid the time-sucking nature of repetitive tasks and the decline in productivity often accompanying them.</p>\n<p>Delegate smaller or repetitive tasks to humans and machines alike. You’ll be able to focus on essential leadership activities without being distracted or hurting your bottom line.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/11/outsource-or-automate-how-to-strategically-take-tasks-off-your-plate/\">Outsource or Automate? How to Strategically Take Tasks Off Your Plate</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 11 Feb 2020 08:00:37 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Outsource-or-Automate-How-to-Strategically-Take-Tasks-Off-Your-Plate.png","linkMd5":"eff85d5a7b5970a8b1e8c628dd2159d6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn99@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-26-183_98fc5405e439cd7a.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Outsource-or-Automate-How-to-Strategically-Take-Tasks-Off-Your-Plate.png","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":611308,"destBytes":48022,"author":"Brad Anderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Outsource-or-Automate-How-to-Strategically-Take-Tasks-Off-Your-Plate-300x185.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn64@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-27-734_082c368dbf67d8e4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195881128},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","title":"WiFi Range Hacks 2020","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=162826","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/10/wifi-range-hacks-2020/\" title=\"WiFi Range Hacks 2020\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/WiFi-Range-Hacks-2020-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"WiFi Range Hacks\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/WiFi-Range-Hacks-2020-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/WiFi-Range-Hacks-2020-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/WiFi-Range-Hacks-2020.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>The world has progressed onto 5G, and yet many times we end up having trouble connecting to a wireless internet connection. It doesn&#8217;t even matter if it&#8217;s even under the same roof as us. We find ourselves calling the customer service representative of an ISP &#8212; screaming our lungs out about their bad internet coverage. However, is it all their fault?</p>\n<pre>Read more: <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/06/18/5g-and-blockchain-what-to-expect/\">5G and BlockChain: What to Expect?</a></pre>\n<h2>There are many reasons WiFi can be awful &#8212; due to the fact that even a good internet connection can be deemed unfit.</h2>\n<p>Internet, although, a part of our daily routine ends up making us feel highly frustrated &#8212; think many.</p>\n<h4>Here are some reasons your WiFi might be acting out.</h4>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<h4><strong>Distance</strong> –</h4>\n<p>At times, the routers and access points have a limited reach of up to 100 feet indoors. They are designed to have a low-power broadcast in order to reduce the chances of interference with other equipment in the area.</li>\n<li>\n<h4><strong>Construction</strong> –</h4>\n<p>Sometimes, Wi-Fi signal drops in particular rooms even though it is strong in the other ones. This is mainly due to the construction of your home in such a manner. Thick walls especially those that contain plaster and lath create a metallic mesh within the walls themselves.</p>\n<p>Such walls can successfully upset any WiFi signal that might pass through it. The signal might be reduced to minimal strength or be jammed completely.</li>\n<li>\n<h4><strong>Device Interference</strong> –</h4>\n<p>Various non-WiFi devices can interfere with the signals due to a match in their operating bandwidth. A WiFi device runs in the 2.4 GHz bandwidth. But so do remote alarm products, cordless phones, wireless microphones, mobile phones, and even Bluetooth.</p>\n<p>Moreover, microwaves are also able to create significant interference for the frequency range used by other wireless non-Wi-Fi devices, which in turn can block the signals completely.</li>\n<li>\n<h4><strong>Other Wi-Fi Devices</strong> –</h4>\n<p>Wireless devices tend to function as per the art of transmitting and receiving data on distinct paths. At times, they shift from the specific instructions to the same default channel.</p>\n<p>Thus, if you have more than one WiFi device around the house, office, etc. then you are just forcing all their signals to compete with each other &#8212; in the same frequency bandwidth.</li>\n</ol>\n<h2><strong><u>Combating the challenges</u></strong></h2>\n<p>The latest WiFi products (802.11n) are to have a higher frequency range, therefore, the issue of <strong>distance</strong> can be tackled by observing its distance. In order to have a better and reliable network, over a lot of ground area. The best thing to do would be getting additional wireless routers or repeaters.</p>\n<h4>Wireless routers, repeaters or ethernet cable will enhance your coverage as long as you place them at a healthy distance from each other.</h4>\n<p>One thing that will always remain the same is your own distance from the device. The closer you will be to it the stronger connectivity signals you will have.</p>\n<p>When you seem to have a <strong>construction</strong> issue that might be interfering with the signal, you will need to change the router’s position to a more common ground for all the rooms.</p>\n<p>Change the position as much as you have to, the more you do it – the more you’ll know. Create a structured formation line and place your router as per that configuration to avoid the chances of intrusions.</p>\n<h4>If you think that there might be too much <strong>device interference</strong> then your strategy to overcome this would be placing such wireless devices away from the router.</h4>\n<p>However, if the disturbance persists you would have to replace those devices with wireless-friendly substitutes or equipment with 5GHz frequency bands (802.11n products).</p>\n<p>Since we already know that, <strong>other WiFi Devices</strong> may affect your signals as well. The best plan of action for you is to switch to a different frequency or a less packed area. A <strong>signal booster</strong> may also help you combat the challenges a WiFi device presents.</p>\n<h4>You can also install a <strong>DD-WRT</strong> on your router if it is possible.</h4>\n<p>All wireless routers have a pre-installed firmware designed with a software that helps its hardware work efficiently. Some of such routers have the ability to run 3<sup>rd</sup> party firmware as well, in order to boost their function.</p>\n<p>A DD-WRT is able to boost Wi-Fi signals by help you customize the router settings as per your desire. However &#8212; just remember that you need to adjust the amount of power your router can draw safely. Otherwise, it’d end up being overheated, and you losing your money to another router.</p>\n<pre>Read more: <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/05/9-main-security-challenges-for-the-future-of-the-internet-of-things-iot/\">9 Main Security Challenges for the future of IoT</a></pre>\n<h2><strong>How to Detect such Issues?</strong></h2>\n<p>There are many apps that can help you detect and recognize such issues without having to invest too much time. Here’s a list to help you choose;</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Netspot</li>\n<li>WiFi Analyzer</li>\n<li>iNet</li>\n<li>Scanny</li>\n<li>Open Signal</li>\n<li>Network Signal Info</li>\n<li>Wi-Fi Monitor</li>\n<li>Wi-Fi Sweet-spots</li>\n<li>Scan-Fi</li>\n<li>Wi-Fi Manager – Home Wi-Fi Alert</li>\n<li>Wi-Fi Analytics Tool</li>\n<li>Wi-Fi Data – Signal Analyzer</li>\n<li>IP tools – Wi-Fi Analyzer</li>\n</ol>\n<p>Although all these are able to help you detect the interferences with your WiFi signal &#8212; not all offer the same things. While some might be able to help you come across every single thing that you ought to know others might just tell you about your signal strength or the position.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.netspotapp.com/\"><strong>Netspot</strong> </a>is by far the best Wi-Fi analyzer app that I have come across. The company offered me a <em>Netspot Pro License</em> key for a month’s trial in September 2019, and it has done nothing but made my life easier.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Pictoral-Guide-for-NetSpot.jpg\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-162833 size-full\" src=\"https://readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Pictoral-Guide-for-NetSpot.jpg\" alt=\"Pictoral Guide for NetSpot\" width=\"800\" height=\"2000\" /></a></p>\n<h2><strong>How does NetSpot work?</strong></h2>\n<p>Netspot is a software tool that is available on mobiles as well as laptops &#38; computers. The app has to be downloaded and offers both a free and a pro version.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Wireless Network Assessment.</li>\n<li>Wireless Network Scanning and Surveys.</li>\n<li>Analyzing Wi-Fi Coverage.</li>\n<li>WiFi Performance.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The app as two modes “<strong>Discover mode</strong>,” which helps you search, analyze, compare, and check the networks available around you. You can check the strength of each signal by clicking on it in the <strong>graph</strong> <strong>column</strong> alongside the other nit-grit piece of information that might come in handy. You can even download its CSV report.</p>\n<p>The other mode, “<strong>Full Site Survey,</strong>” helps you create a map or customize their sample map and place pins where you think all the WiFi devices are, one by one.</p>\n<h4>Once complete, you can start the survey and check which connection is strong and which isn’t.</h4>\n<p>The survey offers 15 different heat map visualizations &#8212; each one to focus on a different area of the WiFi assessment.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Passive-Surveys.jpg\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-162829 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Passive-Surveys-900x450.jpg\" alt=\"Active and Passive surveys in NetSpot for better internet connectivity\" width=\"900\" height=\"450\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Passive-Surveys-900x450.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Passive-Surveys-300x150.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Passive-Surveys-260x130.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Passive-Surveys.jpg 1024w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></a></p>\n<p>By far, this is the only app that I know of with this many heat map visualizations and detail.</p>\n<h2><strong>Why is WiFi Range and Position important?</strong></h2>\n<p>If you have an office or company, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/10/3-ways-to-boost-the-efficacy-of-your-digital-marketing-plan/\">digital marketing</a> (being today’s best mode of customer acquisition) for you will be a failure. You will not be able to update your social media as often and as much as those who have sorted all this out already. Your work hours will mostly constitute you waiting for a download or upload only to delay the important tasks, at hand.</p>\n<h4>WiFi is only as important as the tasks you complete using the internet.</h4>\n<p>Moreover, even if you are using your WiFi for entertainment purposes &#8212; would you rather wait for a movie to stream every five minutes, and then buffer for the 10, or would you just relax and enjoy it in one go?</p>\n<pre>Read more: <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/01/which-countries-have-the-strictest-internet-censorship/\">Which companies have the strictest internet censorship?</a></pre>\n<h4>The Internet has become one of the essential necessities of our lives, nowadays.</h4>\n<p>From connectivity to entertainment, from travels to medication bills &#8212; we do almost everything using the internet. Therefore, when you choose to neglect your WiFi positioning or analysis, you are only neglecting yourself, your dreams, and your loved ones in the long run.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/10/wifi-range-hacks-2020/\">WiFi Range Hacks 2020</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 10 Feb 2020 22:00:31 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/WiFi-Range-Hacks-2020.jpg","linkMd5":"8556a2262a92c05b512b009a7cf50ef0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn11@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-23-957_130e99298965b078.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/WiFi-Range-Hacks-2020.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":25038,"destBytes":17268,"author":"Sijdah Hussain","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/WiFi-Range-Hacks-2020-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn99@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-18-923_34106b866daa42a4.webp","https://readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Pictoral-Guide-for-NetSpot.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn79@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-11-529_71ab6a223c65ce86.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/Passive-Surveys-900x450.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn47@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-16-818_ccaf6f866eee64fd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195880975},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","title":"Productivity is not Enough. Be Proactive","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171544","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/17/productivity-is-not-enough-be-proactive/\" title=\"Productivity is not Enough. Be Proactive\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"199\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Productivity-is-not-Enough.-Be-Proactive-300x199.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"be proactive\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Productivity-is-not-Enough.-Be-Proactive-300x199.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Productivity-is-not-Enough.-Be-Proactive-900x598.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Productivity-is-not-Enough.-Be-Proactive-241x160.jpg 241w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Productivity-is-not-Enough.-Be-Proactive.jpg 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Considering the current world-wide situation we are all highly limited as to what we can do and how we can spend our time. It is also easy to cave to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/29/how-to-battle-severe-depression-as-an-entrepreneur/\">procrastination or to allow bad habits</a> to creep in. Another poor habit I&#8217;ve seen is individuals falling into the trap of social hysteria. While the fear is very much valid and certainly not out-of-place at this time, worry and fear will add no value to our individual lives, nor to our society.</p>\n<p>All that being said, we have two choices. We can sit tight and wait anxiously for the next months to pass and come out on the other side, or we can commit ourselves to make the most of the crisis and grow as individuals and a part of our company.</p>\n<h2><strong>Productivity</strong> <strong>vs. Proactivity</strong></h2>\n<p>Both words have been tossed around a lot for a long time. You can hardly read any self-improvement content without reading about being proactive and productive. I believe we should start by defining what each of those terms means and why both are a vital part of any efficient employee.</p>\n<h3>To be productive definition:</h3>\n<blockquote><p><i>“The effectiveness of productive effort, especially in industry, as measured in terms of the rate of output per unit of input.”</i></p></blockquote>\n<p>While subjective, productivity generally means to have effective production methods that generate significant results in terms of predefined targets. Being productive in my line of work would mean to be able to produce more articles for the same period while maintaining the same or higher quality of work.</p>\n<h3>To be proactive definition:</h3>\n<blockquote><p><i>“Creating or controlling a situation rather than just responding to it after it has happened.”</i></p></blockquote>\n<p>Being proactive demands more than just improving on your process for the sake of results. It can often mean there is a need for a higher level of self-involvement. Such as setting the goals yourself. Being able to identify issues without being pushed to from a different source. And once those issues are identified it demands to lay out a plan and following through until a reasonable solution is reached.</p>\n<h2>What do I need to be both?</h2>\n<p>Being productive is a must. Both as an employee and individual, getting things done efficiently can make all the difference as to how far your career goes. And for many professions being simply productive may be enough, but if you have more self-driven goals then you also need to be self-driven in terms of proactivity.</p>\n<p>Being able to control situations as they arise is in your interest. That is beyond responding to external demands. Having a combination of both skills can unlock an entirely different realm of work for you. It can be the bridge to a leadership position or a successful independent business. Many have excelled with the opportunity to work as freelancers, especially in the IT industry.</p>\n<h2><strong>Professional Proactivity</strong></h2>\n<p>I am currently a part of a company that develops healthcare solutions (dreamix.eu), and we are all doing our best to stay on top of our game and remain productive despite the current working conditions. And while we all have laid out all of the objectives we are hoping to keep up with, there is more to maintaining a business throughout this crisis.</p>\n<p>Meeting the minimum demands is not enough. We need to do more. We can participate in thinking up ways to make the process more efficient to meet our targets and keep the business running, or finding ways to make a difference in society.</p>\n<p>Right now, people, businesses and communities need help. And there is a lot that can be done to contribute to our world at this time.</p>\n<p>For instance, our CEO initiated a “Hack the Crisis” event. The goal was to connect professionals from various fields, provide them with resources and experienced mentors, and unleash their creativity and problem-solving skills. In only a week the team put together and released the event. And in the duration of a weekend, 800 people joined in and developed 111 projects. Some of which will get the funding to be developed and be released to assist the crisis.</p>\n<h2>Here are a few examples of what the teams came up with:</h2>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"list-style-type: none;\">\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Corona Positive </b>&#8211; a platform that is aiming to assist people with the mental toll of the current social situation. Along with connecting psychologists with people who seek them, the platform also makes strides to add a shred of positivity to people’s lives by connecting them with like-minded peers. The goal is to limit the devastating impact that the COVID- 19 is expected to have on everyone’s psyche.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Online doctor</b> &#8211; A system that allows online diagnostics to limit the face-to-face interactions between doctors and patients. With the world-wide hospitals packed with corona patients, it is less than safe to conduct a usual exam.\n<p>And while all emergency doctors are still on call and respond to all health issues, if possible avoiding contact is a must. The platform provides a reliable, secure and confidential channel for doctor-patient communication. It also records all history of consultations to allow doctors access to medical history and give them a chance for a more precise diagnosis.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>SmallBags </b>&#8211; Businesses are closed. We all know that. And this is true for small grocery and convenience stores as well as non-essential services. The purpose of the platform is to connect people with a digital version of service to their favorite stores &#8211; as a result providing the business owner with income, and supporting the economy. For this to be possible, the store staff needs assistance in fixing and featuring the digital service.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Hero Courier &#8211; </b>a platform that connects volunteers and people in need of essentials delivery. A user can put in delivery over for themselves, they can also order necessities in the form of a donation to someone in a less fortunate circumstance. The couriers are volunteers and assist those who are under higher risk or cannot physically shop from grocery stores and pharmacies.</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Those are just a few of the ideas that were presented at the event. Being proactive in a time such as this goes beyond keeping your job, but also helping those who need it. As a direct result of being proactive, all participants made valuable connections to entrepreneurs in the community.</p>\n<p>Further, we were able to test the limits of everyone&#8217;s creativity- making a meaningful project to add to their CV and a newer appreciation for what they are capable of in just a short amount of time.</p>\n<h2><strong>Personal Proactivity</strong></h2>\n<p>As rewarding as assisting society can be, sometimes we need to help ourselves before we can help others. For many of us living under quarantine, uncertainty has become a core part of our lives and a constant worry can completely change us.</p>\n<p>It opens the door to degrading <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/06/can-iot-bridge-the-gaps-in-modern-mental-health-treatment/\">mental health</a> and lowered motivation to do things &#8211; for some; this means losing the drive to improve themselves and grow. I am sure I am not the only one who forgot to take care of myself for a while, overwhelmed.</p>\n<p>However, being proactive can be a tool to battle the current crisis. Even if considered just from the personal point of view. At the very least, we all need to be proactive in maintaining our health as best we can. Doing small things that are healthy can help our chances if we do end up sick with COVID-19.</p>\n<p><strong>Maintaining a healthier mindset towards our habits will also help us all get back up on our feet once we come out on the other side.</strong></p>\n<p>My approach is simple. I started with consciously evaluating what is important for me right now. And then I thought about the small things I can do to feel better, healthier and stronger. I am sharing all of this with you, hoping you will find value in my experience, and find ways to make your life better for your current and your future self.</p>\n<h2>What is important to me:</h2>\n<h3>Physical health</h3>\n<p>Being physically healthy is an obvious perk. The stronger I am, the better my chances at a better future. And also, the more I can help my family. In an attempt to protect them, I do all of the shopping for necessities so they do not have to get exposed.</p>\n<p>I am always well-protected with mask, gloves, and hand sanitizer on hand. I also maintain my habit of daily exercise with a simple goal: 10 to 15 minutes but daily. It can be stretching, it can be lifting weights. Or simply dancing around or taking a walk around the house. And usually, it ends up around 40 minutes of exercise simply because <i>it feels good and I don’t want to stop</i>.</p>\n<p>I also take a combination of vitamins daily, make an effort to eat balanced. No food group is off-limits, and I indulge with small portions, which has all but killed my binge-eating cravings. Maintaining health demands proactive measures.</p>\n<h3>Mental health</h3>\n<p>I happened to end a long-term relationship just before going on quarantine. The breakup, coupled with uncertainty and fear for myself and my family, took a toll on me for a couple of weeks. Which is why I took special note of my mental health.</p>\n<p>I battled it by doing more of what made me feel better. I slept as much as I needed and invested more time to communicate with my loved ones. Drinking a lot of water became a daily habit. And picked up journaling if I was in the mood to put my thoughts on paper. Writing my thoughts down gave me a chance to process them and move on from them. The key to journaling? Forget structure and perfectionism. Let it be gibberish that is out of order. Let it be hectic, let it be chaotic. The relief is worth it.</p>\n<h3>Professionalism</h3>\n<p>My work is important to me. I love my work, I am good at it and I enjoy it. So doing my best to maintain my healthy working habits was imperative for me to feel useful and <i>normal</i>. So I made it a priority to meet my targets and work at a healthy but productive pace. To do that I made some much-needed arrangements.</p>\n<p>I dedicated a corner in my room for work only: a desk and a couch. I sorted through all of my belongings and took my time setting up my room in a way that is easy to work in.</p>\n<h3>Personal and creative growth</h3>\n<p>Start small &#8211; the more you do it, the easier it will be and the better the results will be. Set small goals for yourself &#8211; something so easy that you can do it consistently with little to no effort. And adjust your approach as you go. If you feel like doing more of something, just do it! Within reason, of course.</p>\n<h2>Growth and productivity as a principle</h2>\n<p>All hardship in life challenges our values and principles. The current crisis has made many, question what is truly important to us in a time such as this. And for many of us, there are some core principles that seem to align: keeping our loved ones safe and healthy, maintaining a source of income and stability, giving back to the society we are a part of.</p>\n<p>There is one principle for me that I do not see as often as the others, that I truly believe can make all the difference. That is personal growth &#8211; in whatever shape or form. To grow, truly a person needs to be proactive and productive with performing activities that bring us closer to our self-assigned goals.</p>\n<p>For some, it may be getting more efficient with work. For others, it may be picking up a new skill and turning it into a hobby. And for others, it may be as simple as becoming more patient with themselves and their struggles.</p>\n<p>Whatever our own weak spots are and whatever our goals are we need to continue making efforts to grow individually. It is what will bring us a better future and help us stay healthier &#8211; both mentally and physically.</p>\n<p>I hope this inspired you to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/03/physical-vs-digital-health-what-you-need-to-know-about-privacy-and-healthtech/\">be more productive and proactive</a> when working on yourself! If you want to share your own goals and aspirations, make sure to add them below in the comment section.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Miguel A. Padrinan; Pexals </em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/17/productivity-is-not-enough-be-proactive/\">Productivity is not Enough.
