Petrova","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Productivity-is-not-Enough.-Be-Proactive-300x199.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn35@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-14-231_8eba8b5c8089059f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195872188},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"IoT and Healthcare Technologies Converge for Better Patient Care","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=167276","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/30/iot-and-healthcare-technologies-converge-for-better-patient-care/\" title=\"IoT and Healthcare Technologies Converge for Better Patient Care\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/IoT-and-Healthcare-Technologies-Converge-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"iot healthcare tech converge\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/IoT-and-Healthcare-Technologies-Converge-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/IoT-and-Healthcare-Technologies-Converge-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/IoT-and-Healthcare-Technologies-Converge.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>The healthcare sector is thriving by making <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/23/can-artificial-intelligence-replace-the-role-of-doctors/\">health services and medical system</a> more efficient for patients. The integration of technological advancements and the convergence of emerging technologies have expanded the reach of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/31/4-trends-that-are-transforming-the-future-of-healthcare/\">proactive and preventive care worldwide</a>. Still, there is a lot of room left for improving healthcare facilities and enhancing the sharing of the patient’s health information between clinicians and healthcare facilities.</p>\n<p>Every year, more than 50% of deaths occur due to chronic and fatal diseases like cancer, stroke, and heart disease. These diseases have affected the quality of life and health of many people globally. Now, technology can lend a helping hand in increasing the effectiveness of preventive and therapeutic care for such diseases. Are we talking about diagnosis or treatment technology? Healthcare is capable of providing a personalized experience to patients.</p>\n<p>These days, we witness a paradigm shift in both medical device manufacturing and healthcare app development industries in favor of the end-users or patients. Internet of Things-enabled medical technology is responsible for this reactive care paradigm in the healthcare sector. As <a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/internet-of-things-in-healthcare-2016-8\">forecasted by BI intelligence</a>, the number of healthcare IoT devices will grow from 95 million in the year 2015 to 646 million in the year 2020.</p>\n<p>It is an unchallenged fact that the medical community can deliver high-quality healthcare services if individuals care for their health and preventive pre-diagnoses care. The convergence of IoT and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/12/19/healthcare-is-booming-hand-in-hand-with-the-technology-industry/\">healthcare technology</a> makes this possible by revolutionizing reactive and proactive healthcare services. IoT-powered healthcare services can enhance data collection and analysis, increase patient usability of services, and empower service providers and patients alike.</p>\n<p>From predicting to the prevention of the onset of diseases and respond to other health-related complications, the IoT technology can assist clinicians and the healthcare executives to act more rapidly. For example, the patient’s data regarding lab tests, history, and other clinicians’ therapeutic options can help healthcare service providers improve their responses during any emergency situation.</p>\n<p><strong>Role of IoT in Medical Services</strong></p>\n<p>Physicians have to spend a lot of time in collecting and analyzing the patient’s data. As the number of patients keeps on increasing, it is <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/09/5-reasons-why-artificial-intelligence-is-important-to-you/\">difficult for them to analyze</a> all aspects of every patient’s health condition along with analyzing health data. There, IoT-enabled technologies come into the picture. These technologies alleviate these difficulties by providing specific information to physicians that can help them make informed decisions in real-time.</p>\n<p>What’s more, physicians can also spend more time on sensitive issues of the patient’s health and focus on major aspects. Here are the top three <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/31/repositioning-your-brand-against-cybercrimes-through-vpns/\">healthcare domains</a> on which IoT can have a major impact.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Clinicians can get a concise and holistic data of Patient’s condition with other physicians’ reviews</li>\n<li>Healthcare professionals can get a better insight into patient rehabilitation through data</li>\n<li>Easy and effective transfer of data between healthcare providers</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Simply put, IoT has started providing many benefits to the healthcare sector and facilitate healthcare service providers to transform the traditional procedures into patient-centric procedures. For example, <a href=\"https://www.ibm.com/downloads/cas/O610P1XM\">IBM Watson has developed Knowledge Integration Toolkit (KnIT) </a>for discovery. It consists of a three-phase process of exploration, analysis, and interpretation of the healthcare procedures. KnIT uses Watson’s AI platform to read and analyze scientific papers.</p>\n<p>Here, Watson enables clinicians and healthcare service providers to get rid of data analysis while allowing them to spend time on improving the patient’s conditions and vitals. Companies like Biotricity are pioneers in <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/06/20/the-future-of-healthcare-is-mobile/\">developing remote patient monitoring technology</a>. These companies build medical devices that fetch the real-time patient data and transmit the same for analysis within the cloud securely.</p>\n<p>This IoT-powered technology can facilitate communication across various devices and the system. It is designed to communicate data over a secure network and facilitate better data analysis for healthcare providers. As a result, the healthcare company can serve patients in a better way. Physicians can get real-time actionable data with feedback.</p>\n<p>Taking the example of Biotricity, the company has a remote patient monitoring technology known as Bioflux. This technology can improve patient care and reduce inefficiency. Ultimately, it assists doctors to save lives. Let’s go through the key benefits of IoT-powered healthcare technology and its importance in the modern healthcare industry.</p>\n<p><strong>Key Benefits of IoT-based Medical Technology in the Healthcare Sector</strong></p>\n<p>Here we mention five major benefits of IoT-enabled medical technology.</p>\n<ol>\n<li><strong>Get and share alerts real-time-</strong> Many IoT devices work on a 24/7 basis, and therefore, they can play a significant role in the health industry. If any unusual findings or data are detected, these devices immediately alert the user. In a way, such devices can help patients to get emergency treatment and prevent the condition to get worsened.</li>\n<li><strong>More engagement-</strong> Just like <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/09/19/increasing-customer-engagement-five-tactics-to-use/\">customer engagement</a>, patient engagement has also become a buzzword in the modern healthcare system. IoT-based medical technology enables the patients to get more control over their health journey and encourages them to participate in the healthcare program with more confidence.</li>\n<li><strong>Cost reduction-</strong> The greatest advantage of IoT devices is they can reduce operational inefficiencies that cost a lot to the company. Official research has predicted that IoT will continue to reduce these costs by 25% or $100 billion every year. IoT-based healthcare technology can help patients to prevent any emergency situation or making the condition worse thereby saving a lot of money.</li>\n<li><strong>Telehealth promotion- </strong>The telehealth approach can be implemented in the best possible manner with the help of IoT technology. It facilitates the patient to receive healthcare services without physically going to the physician’s clinic. The telehealth concept is a technological boon for people who live in remote or rural areas.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>More effective and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/25/iot-can-put-your-data-at-risk-heres-how/\">relevant data- IoT devices</a> can collect useful and relevant data across different industry sectors. In the healthcare sector, such devices monitor the patient’s conditions round-the-clock and fetch better-quality data for the specialist’s reference. Also, IoT-enabled medical devices are programmed to analyze, interpret, and report the data instantly.</p>\n<p>Do you want to know the future of IoT-enabled medical technology? Read on to know the scope of IoT in the healthcare sector.</p>\n<p><strong>Future of IoT-enabled Medical Technology</strong></p>\n<p>The thriving healthcare sector will rely more on healthcare app development services in the future. Customized healthcare apps will fetch real-time data and help clinicians predict and control any possible disease outbreaks. IoT wearables can be connected with healthcare apps to change the face of healthcare services globally. Ingestible sensors, smart glasses, hearables or hearing-based wearables, and ‘moodables’ or devices that are used to relax patients with stress disorders, depression, and ADD.</p>\n<p>As a result, there is a significant decrease in suffering or pain and cost. Let’s take an example of a stroke algorithm. It is based on the severity of stroke during EMS (Emergency Medical Service). Thanks to this algorithm, the ambulance staff can get real-time information and use advanced tools to identify the type of stroke and assess the patient’s condition. Based on this, the ambulance can take the patient to the most suitable hospital for specific treatment.</p>\n<p>Traditionally, healthcare services remain inadequate to provide personalized experienced to patients especially when the number of patients keeps on increasing worldwide. In other words, patient engagement is reducing day-by-day and the incidents of nonadherence are increased. Clinicians and healthcare staff find it difficult to cope with the growing number of patients and manage every process smoothly.</p>\n<p>There, IoT-enabled medical technology can transform the processes into more result-oriented and patient-focused procedures. It provides real-time, relevant, and medical-grade information of every patient to healthcare professionals. What’s more, it facilitates patients and physicians to record, share, and reinforce critical data on a 24/7 basis. In a nutshell, the future of healthcare services is an IoT-enabled medical technology and we will witness its exponential growth in the coming years.</p>\n<p>However, one should not utilize IoT without taking protective measures in healthcare services. It is fair to mention that clinicians or specialists should remain <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/05/9-main-security-challenges-for-the-future-of-the-internet-of-things-iot/\">vigilant for protecting the patient’s confidential data</a>. The patient-related data is usually stored in the cloud, but there is always a risk of a data breach. Therefore, while making the most of the IoT technology, the effective plan for protecting the patient’s data should be in place.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/30/iot-and-healthcare-technologies-converge-for-better-patient-care/\">IoT and Healthcare Technologies Converge for Better Patient Care</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 30 Apr 2020 15:00:09 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/IoT-and-Healthcare-Technologies-Converge.jpg","linkMd5":"ce29cf31f11b14aad06b89f3229c7256","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn52@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-25-801_2fd722e56d6d333a.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/IoT-and-Healthcare-Technologies-Converge.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":39003,"destBytes":30716,"author":"Robert Jackson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/IoT-and-Healthcare-Technologies-Converge-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn27@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-10-421_618babae3da8d0c7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877757},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","title":"What Happens When a Tech Startup Fails?","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=168122","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/10/what-happens-when-a-tech-startup-fails/\" title=\"What Happens When a Tech Startup Fails?\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/when-tech-startup-fails-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"What Happens When a Tech Startup Fails?\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/when-tech-startup-fails-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/when-tech-startup-fails-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/when-tech-startup-fails.jpg 747w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Even universally acclaimed startups with strong leadership and great ideas can go under, if there isn’t enough demand or if the landscape changes. We’ve heard of hundreds of young tech companies, from the first dotcom legends to groundbreaking, disruptive startups of the modern era, utterly failing. But with up to millions of dollars at stake, the remnants of a new technology still lingering, and dozens to hundreds of people suddenly out of a job, what really happens to a CEO and investors <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/05/how-to-avoid-being-part-of-90-of-failed-companies/\">after a tech startup fails</a>?</p>\n<h3>Corporate Structure and Finances: Venture Capital and More</h3>\n<p>First, you’ll need to consider the structure of the company and the type of finances involved. For the most part, startups with any kind of money at stake are structured as a limited liability company (LLC), a corporation, or something similar. If you were to start a company as a sole proprietor and CEO, your name would be practically interchangeable with the company’s; if the company took on debt, you’d be responsible for paying that debt back.</p>\n<p>However, LLCs and corporations are treated as separate legal entities. If you started “TechStart, Inc.” as a corporation, “TechStart” would be seen as a totally separate identity in the eyes of the legal system. If TechStart held $1 million in debt, and you personally owned TechStart, you would not be liable for TechStart’s $1 million in debt (in most situations). You could simply walk away to your next venture.</p>\n<p>There are also different types of financing to consider. If the company was very profitable and had an excess of cash, it probably wouldn’t be in a position to fail or close; in most cases, the company has outstanding debts and liabilities to consider. Typically, a company does everything it can to make those debts whole as it closes. For example, it would collect on outstanding accounts, apply those payments to any outstanding debts, liquidate assets to pay debts further, then start paying back any and all investors who contributed money to the startup. In many cases, venture capital investors and other investors will end up with a loss.</p>\n<p>In some cases, a business or individual involved with the business will need <a href=\"https://www.rowdywilliams.com/what-type-of-bankruptcy-is-right-for-me/\">to consider filing for bankruptcy</a>. Bankruptcy is a legal option that allows a business or individual to claim themselves unable to pay a debt. Usually when this happens, the entity must prove its current assets and debts in a court of law, and work together with owed parties to come up with a reasonable solution. Different types of bankruptcy, like Chapter 7 bankruptcy and Chapter 13 bankruptcy, may be viable options if an entrepreneur is dealing with personal debt, but the most common form of bankruptcy for business owners is Chapter 11; in some cases, you can continue running the business after filing Chapter 11.</p>\n<h3>The Closing Process for CEOs</h3>\n<p>Most business owners and CEOs involved in a struggling business will eventually need to follow a process to “close” the business or shut it down in a systematic way. First, they have to decide whether or not the startup is salvageable; this is a long and arduous decision process for many entrepreneurs. Many companies are able to lose money on paper for months, or even years, leveraging debt or new investment capital to keep going, and eventually become successful. Accordingly, most failure points are the result of a major impact to the business, and not just a reflection of financial performance; for example, you may note that sales and market interest are declining, or that there’s significantly more competition than you expected, or that your app simply isn’t working the way you thought.</p>\n<p>At this point, an entrepreneur usually has conversations with the board of directors, venture capital investors who are financially exposed to the company, mentors, and other authorities. If multiple people seem to be in agreement, it may be time to close the business. Otherwise, the entrepreneur may step down in favor of new leadership, or collectively, the company may pivot in an <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/18/the-4-critical-challenges-of-tech-startup-pr/\">attempt to revitalize the business</a>.</p>\n<p>If the decision to close the business moves forward, the founder must reveal the information in a deliberate and organized way. Typically, they’ll speak with decision makers and lawyers first, coming up with a high-level game plan. Then, they’ll begin to let their employees know, and if appropriate, may put together a press release.</p>\n<p>From there, the company will move into shutdown mode. It will begin to collect money from outstanding accounts, alerting customers that the company is going out of business, and will file official dissolution documents—which will vary depending on the corporate structure.</p>\n<p>After that, the business will likely begin liquidating assets in an effort to pay off its debts and simplify the end-of-life process; for example, you may sell off your computers, sell any commercial property you acquired, and get rid of any company cars. After paying outstanding debts, including tax requirements, founders typically distribute whatever money is leftover to shareholders in one way or another. There may or may not be any leftover money to distribute.</p>\n<p>One by one, in order of increasing importance, employees are let go. The founder will cancel business licenses and permits as necessary, and close any financial accounts. From there, it’s important for the founder and other shareholders (like venture capital investors) to keep meticulous records of everything to do with the closure of the business in case they’re necessary to reference in the future.</p>\n<h3>Technology and Intellectual Property: What Do CEOs Do?</h3>\n<p>Many people start tech companies because they love the idea of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/10/29/5-misconceptions-you-should-know-about-before-launching-your-tech-startup/\">introducing some new, amazing technology to the world</a>. When that technology stops developing, or when the company runs out of money, it can be heartbreaking. But it doesn’t always have to end there.</p>\n<p>During the asset liquidation phase, entrepreneurs frequently consider their tech product, possibly including their patent or their intellectual property, as an asset to distribute. In this process, they may be able to sell the in-progress technology to an interested buyer. For example, if you were developing a new app, you could talk to big tech companies in a similar space, and invite bids to acquire the technology for their own purposes. While this isn’t ideal for any entrepreneur or CEO, it can help the idea find new life, and introduce enough money to the startup that it can adequately pay off investors and shareholders.</p>\n<h3>The Post-Mortem: Communicating With the Market</h3>\n<p>Depending on the situation, the founder, board of directors, and other decision makers in the company may take the time to put together a post-mortem. This can take the form of a letter to shareholders, a short statement to venture capital investors, or even a press release. The basic idea is to explain, concisely, what went wrong with the company, how it could have (or couldn’t have) been prevented, and what’s happening next.</p>\n<p>Post-mortems are especially valuable to CEOs in a similar space; it’s a good chance to teach your peers and/or the next generation of tech founders about the mistakes you made. It’s also a way to clear the air around your company, to squash any rumors about why the company really went under.</p>\n<h3>The Next Venture for a CEO</h3>\n<p>While it’s almost always heartbreaking for a CEO to watch their startup fail, they can usually take comfort in the fact <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/24/e-commerce-failures-and-mistakes-why-do-so-many-startups-fail/\">that failure is incredibly common</a>—to the point where most successful entrepreneurs have helmed at least one business that didn’t go as originally planned. Failure is, in many ways, a learning opportunity; it’s a chance for an entrepreneur to reflect on what went wrong, celebrate their successes, and consider how they can apply those lessons to the next venture.</p>\n<p>Oftentimes, this is the period that defines whether an entrepreneur will be successful. Will they take the loss personally, fear the prospect of starting another business, and go back to a mainstream kind of career? Or will they channel this energy into another startup, and disrupt a new market?</p>\n<p>Startup failure isn’t especially glamorous, and it’s not what we like to think about when we think about the prospect of entrepreneurship. However, it’s important to realize the important role that failure plays in the tech ecosystem. It’s a natural part of the cycle, and a common occurrence; but in addition to representing loss, it also represents learning and rebirth.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/10/what-happens-when-a-tech-startup-fails/\">What Happens When a Tech Startup Fails?</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 10 Mar 2020 17:25:44 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/when-tech-startup-fails.jpg","linkMd5":"e90432c561d80b2f06979cc50064e3e6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn59@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-22-871_154c5c9bba2c9dc5.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/when-tech-startup-fails.jpg","destWidth":747,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":97939,"destBytes":52732,"author":"Frank Landman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/when-tech-startup-fails-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn16@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-16-274_4a7f28ff3f0fa0a4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195880678},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","title":"AI Changing Pen Testing Game Worldwide","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171546","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/09/ai-changing-pen-testing-game-worldwide/\" title=\"AI Changing Pen Testing Game Worldwide\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/AI-Changing-Pen-Testing-Game-Worldwide-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"penetration testing\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/AI-Changing-Pen-Testing-Game-Worldwide-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/AI-Changing-Pen-Testing-Game-Worldwide-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/AI-Changing-Pen-Testing-Game-Worldwide.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The need for <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/17/the-penetration-of-artificial-intelligence-in-indian-railways/\">penetration testing services</a> arose a century back when the attacks on the systems became frequent. Lots of companies started losing their sensitive data and it affected their customers in the worst way possible.<br />\n</span></p>\n<h4><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>The loss of sensitive data is exactly when (and why) the world saw another technical industry rising.</strong> </span></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You can see one </span>pen testing company <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">giving way to a whole new industry of penetration testing. The company collected the best tech brains and asked them to come up with solutions to stop cybercriminals from harming organizations and individuals.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>However, the field of cybercriminals and testers changes faster than any other technical field.</strong> </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Cyber Criminals keep coming up with <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/07/tips-to-hire-and-retain-the-right-cybersecurity-professionals/\">new sorts of viruses and cyber-attacks</a>. To save people from falling into these traps, testing companies needed to evolve enough to plan for these viruses and stay one step ahead of the criminals. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Let’s dive into the history of penetration testing to see how it has evolved over time.</span></p>\n<h3><strong>Penetration Testing in the Beginning</strong></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Businesses always had a reason to opt for penetration testing to stay at a great distance from malware and other viruses. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">First of all, penetration testing was only designed for systems &#8212; making them secure from every angle. Soon it was discovered that a business can be targeted through phishing and social presence as well. </span></p>\n<p><strong>The multi-angled attacks forced penetration testing companies to come up with solutions for every possible cyber threat.</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Most of the time, testing was done manually where a team of testers would sit together, understand the software, list down all the requirements, and build test cases. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">These test cases were then run one by one and the status of every test case was recorded. In the end, a report was prepared for the developers to understand the possible loopholes present, ways to recreate them, and ideas to cover them.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>Different techniques were introduced in the market to suit different requirements of the people.</strong> </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">However, the steps were almost always the same since it involved a team of human testers to carry out all the activities. Then came the era of more advanced technologies; ones powered by artificial intelligence and machine learning. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Machine Learning tech was smart but was unguarded and open for the cybercriminals to attack and get hang of it. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Although every </span>pen testing company<span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> felt it was a good idea to use manual testing for this new category of tech, IoT, they <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/05/blockchain-success-stories-show-valuable-opportunities/\">failed most of the time</a>. The failure clearly called for new ways to be devised and used for the betterment of the organizations and individuals using AI and ML technology gadgets.</span></p>\n<h3><strong>The Era of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning</strong></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Although testers were trying their best to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/04/cyber-security-modern-technology-and-business-threats/\">fight new cyber threats</a> with the help of manual testing, they lost the battle many times. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In the hands of criminals, Artificial intelligence started becoming more of a threat rather than being a blessing. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When AI became a threat to criminals is when the world of pen testing introduced a new turn in history. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Artificial intelligence and machine learning were made a part of penetration testing. Different AI and ML techniques and tools were developed to help catch malware and viruses present in the system. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Now, you must be wondering if artificial intelligence is so strong in the hands of criminals, should it not offer more benefits when used for pen testing? </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Obviously, it should offer more benefits with pen testing &#8212; so here is how penetration testing companies are evolving with AI and ML embedded in their technologies and techniques:</span></p>\n<h3><strong>Better Information Gathering</strong></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One of the most important stages of the whole pen-testing activity is <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2011/11/23/controversy_surrounds_data_gathering_practices_of/\">gathering information</a>. It is also known as the reconnaissance stage. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">According to experts, if the testers manage to gather more data, in the beginning, the chances of their success gets even more than double. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">However, it is easy to say that and a lot difficult to do. In a pen testing activity, the team has only a limited amount of time to spend on gathering data. It is hard to ensure that the quality of the gathered data is the best.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With AI as constant support, a great amount of quality data can be gathered in a limited amount of time. One can even make use of Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, and Machine Learning to ensure a good profile of data is built with lots of details.</span></p>\n<h3><strong>Scanning Systems</strong></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Testing a lot of systems manually takes a lot of time. Also, since humans are bound to make mistakes, a lot of times loopholes go unnoticed in the system causing trouble later. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When it comes to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2014/12/24/online-retail-ecommerce-scale-reactive-tomax/\">scanning hundreds of systems</a>, you can imagine the havoc manual testing can bring. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">AI-empowered scanning ensures comprehensive coverage and good interpreted results. It can also be used to make a few amendments in the code where needed.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Overall, it saves a lot of time and effort. Moreover, AI offers good test management and automatic creation of test cases. Hence, it makes your systems secure and sound in less time.</span></p>\n<h3><strong>Maintenance and Access Stage</strong></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Once the testers are past scanning, they are ready to gain access to multiple network devices and extract the targeted data and start testing. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The main purpose of this step is to ensure there are no loopholes left for the criminals to exploit later and take advantage of. The testing also includes checking for credentials for every employee and strong articles too.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">AI-based solutions are powered to try different password combinations to check how strong the passwords are to break-in. Different algorithms are designed to observe user data, on-going trends, present patterns, and train themselves to do better testing.</span></p>\n<h3><strong>Better Reporting</strong></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The last stage of penetration testing followed by every </span>pen testing company<span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> (kualitatem dot com) is the reporting stage. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>The reporting stage usually tests the ability of the attackers to cover their tracks and remove all traces of their presence in the system.</strong> </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">These kinds of evidence can be found in existing access channels, user logs, and unexpected error messages raised due to the infiltration process.</span></p>\n<p><strong>Manual testing has failed to find these issues at a larger scale making it easy for the attackers to perform their tasks without management being aware of their presence.</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> On the other hand, artificial intelligence tools can easily discover hidden <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/12/know-your-enemy-the-5-different-types-of-data-breach/\">backdoors</a>, traces of the presence of cybercriminals in the system, and multiple access points that were not supposed to be there. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Once found, these activities and their details are stored and saved in a report. The detailed report also contains a proper timeline against every attack done.</span></p>\n<h3><strong>Overall Benefits of AI-powered Pen Testing</strong></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Now that we have talked about the benefits AI has to offer and the changes it is introducing in the penetration testing world, we are able to count the benefits on our fingertips. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Here is the whole list of the ways AI-powered pen testing is much better than manual testing.</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Since artificial intelligence is involved in AI-based pen testing, the results are returned faster than manual testing. This decreases the expected investment of time and gives more time to developers to fix issues.</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">AI-based penetration testing ensures there are no loopholes left once the testing is done. This makes your system and software more secure as compared to manual testing.</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The test results are more accurate as compared to manual testing. This leaves less headache for the developers and testers as well.</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When it comes to companies, having AI do repetitive and boring tasks decreases investment. You can invest in an AI tool and forget about hiring and managing a large team of testers.</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Since organizations are growing at a good speed, it is hard to test for them through manual testing. Hence, AI-based testing ensures a large number of systems are tested with good results in less time.</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">These tools are easily available in the market and stay updated with new threats and viruses entering the market. So you do not have to worry about upskilling your employees and investing in them.</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\"
