But still, there&#8217;s much more information in the form of unstructured data that would help businesses better &#38; also understands their client’s behavior.</p>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">The American software firm, Clarabridge offers SaaS products for semantic analytics to measure emotion, intent, and root cause analysis utilizing both machine learning and AI. Possessing an <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/12/how-mastering-natural-language-processing-can-boost-your-bottom-line/\">AI-Powered NLP Engine</a>, this platform can offer a highly effective report on what customers are saying, taking you to the contextual understanding of comments, which is significantly more than NLP. Clients are sharing their views in a lot of different ways in every single moment, they&#8217;re using social media sites, forums, blogs, reviews or online news commenting.</p>\n<h2 style=\"text-align: left;\">What&#8217;s exactly Sentiment Analysis?</h2>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">It is a better way to know how consumers feel about your products and services. <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/10/can-artificial-intelligence-humanize-patient-care/\">AI has become smart</a> enough to understand the tone of a statement, this is very helpful for companies/organizations or who want to grow their business, improve customer participation, and even able to identify top influencers in their customer base.</p>\n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">Make New Opportunity with Sentiment Analysis</h3>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">The AI can collect from unstructured data and affective computing in sentiment analysis. In years past, surveys conducted through a comment section which is mentioned at the bottom of the poll where individuals can leave thoughts, comments. But Sentiment analysis is effective at 90 percent precision; reviewing text-based feedback like social media posts that have been made in just 1 use of sentiment analysis.</p>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">However, technologies like Cognitive review customer service calls in real-time, discovering human signs, offering behavioral guidance to enhance the quality of the interaction. There are also present some sentimental analysis tools that demonstrated to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/21/the-biggest-growth-marketing-trend-of-2020-radically-inclusive-advertising/\">improve customer satisfaction by almost 30 percent</a>, decrease call manage time by 15 percent and result in boost customer responses.</p>\n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">Improving Customer Support</h3>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">Improving customer support is not the only thing sentiment analysis can do, it’s beyond that. When combined with technology like cognitive recognition and affective computing, it can save more lives. Sentiment analysis is already booming all around the world, the discipline of sentiment analysis for a service is like skyrocketing. The sentiment analysis will always play an important role in <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/18/top-industry-players-in-employee-experience-software-2020/\">successful customer experience</a> and responsible for moving forward. Sentimental analysis is a great method to know customer behavior better and act on this accordance for the greater.</p>\n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">Client Data Programs with Sentiment Analysis</h3>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">This tech-driven data, opinion analysis is best for better client experience and that will be the Customer Data Platform (CDP). The rise of the Customer Data Platform CDP by firms like Microsoft, Oracle, and Adobe will enable further contextualization across a larger number of structured and unstructured data. On the other side, the rise of multiple versions will standardization, especially in environments that used in many applications that aren&#8217;t supported by the same common data models.</p>\n<h2 style=\"text-align: left;\">How Machine Learning Beneficial for Semantic Analytics</h2>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">The main objective of machine learning is to enhance and increase the text analytics capabilities that semantic analysis does, also include the Role of Speech tagging. Data scientists run a machine learning model to recognize the actual sense by providing a large volume of text documents containing a lot of pre-tagged description.</p>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">When the model is ready, the same data scientist can apply those training methods to building new models to identify other elements of speech. The result is very quick and that reliable Part of Speech tagging helps in a bigger text analytics system to identify sentiment-bearing phrases more effectively and accurately.</p>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">Machine learning also helps in information analysts to solve tricky problems caused by the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/23/5-ways-ai-is-revolutionizing-ecommerce-marketing/\">growth of language</a>. Creating some sentiment analysis rule set for such type of platform where the thing is impossible.</p>\n<h2 style=\"text-align: left;\">Top 5 Sentiment Analysis Tools</h2>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">Sentimental Analysis and data mining are important for any organization. It assists businesses to extract insights from social data and understands their customer behavior exactly what they believe about the services/products. To analysis, the feelings of the customer&#8217;s activities behind the words and it can do that by making use of a technology called Natural Language Processing (NLP).</p>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">There are so many tools are available in the market to make the work easier for businesses and gain a broader audience. Stay tuned with this blog, you can use some useful tools for sentiment analysis.</p>\n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">IBM Watson Tone Analyzer</h3>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">Powered by IBM Watson, Tone Analyzer understands emotions and communication style. It uses linguistic analysis to detect joy, fear, despair, anger, analytical, confident, and tentative tones found in the text.</p>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">It monitors customer service and support conversations so it can allow organizations to react to customers appropriately and at scale. It may also be integrated with chatbots to supply personalized conversation experience.</p>\n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">OpenText</h3>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">OpenText is best for all those companies that supply Enterprise Information Management (EIM) products. OpenText Content Analytics solution is powered by <a href=\"https://www.the-next-tech.com/machine-learning/how-image-processing-and-machine-learning-can-be-linked-together/\">Machine Learning with Natural Language Processing </a>techniques.</p>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">It&#8217;s designed in such a manner that it identifies and assesses subjective expressions, patterns of sentiment within the textual content.</p>\n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">Quick Search by Talkwalker</h3>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">Talkwalker is a social networking analytics and social media monitoring too. Its service Quick Search is a very useful tool when it comes to sentiment analysis. This tool allows the organization to identify what exactly people feel about the company&#8217;s social networking accounts.</p>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">It monitors matters like mentions, remarks, engagements along with other information and provides a report that assists organizations to create more effective campaigns so they can engage more with the target audience.</p>\n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">Rapidminer</h3>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">Rapidminer is a data science platform that produces the most out of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/07/achieving-paperless-operations-and-document-automation-with-ai-and-ml/\">analytics with the assistance of artificial intelligence</a>. Its Text mining platform takes a lot at resources like online testimonials, social media chatter, telephone center transcriptions, claims forms, research journals, patent filings, etc. and it extracts insights from such unstructured data.</p>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">Sentiment Analyzer is another opinion analysis tool. It&#8217;s a free tool that offers sentiment analysis on just about any text written in English. Speaking about how this functions and it also calculates a sentiment score.</p>\n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">Social Mention</h3>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">If it comes to analyzing sentiment in social media, Social Mention is among the most popular. This tool monitors 100+ social platforms such as blogs, news sites, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/16/8-best-digital-marketing-strategies-small-businesses-should-implement/\">user-generated content information</a>, allowing you to understand what customers are feeling and saying about your brand.</p>\n<h2 style=\"text-align: left;\">How Human Emotions can be Express via Text</h2>\n<p>Truly, we need a system/function to understand the principles of human expressions, individual emotions via text. And <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/27/how-to-tame-artificial-intelligence-a-brief-guide-for-business/\">Sentiment analysis makes decisions easily with Artificial Intelligence</a> and helps to increase customer experience.</p>\n<h2 style=\"text-align: left;\">Final Thoughts</h2>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">Sentiment analysis is beyond that we are thinking and it’s an interesting, high-tech boom technology, and will soon become an unbelievable tool for many businesses.</p>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">Hence, Sentiment analysis enables us to glean new insights, better understand our clients, and enable our teams more effectively so they perform better and more effective work.</p>\n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">By including this in existing systems, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/18/the-4-critical-challenges-of-tech-startup-pr/\">major brands can work</a> quicker, with more precision, toward more useful results. Sentiment analysis is playing a crucial role in the advertising domain. It can help to create a new target audience and assist a business in realizing customer&#8217;s preferences.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/02/understanding-the-role-of-ai-and-ml-in-sentiment-analysis/\">Understanding the Role of AI and ML in Sentiment Analysis</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 02 Jun 2020 18:00:33 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Understanding-the-Role-of-AI-and-ML-in-Sentiment-Analysis.jpeg","linkMd5":"d8c3593a5d9c644199b404b0e6da0a04","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn48@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-24-976_b443ce8de2447680.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Understanding-the-Role-of-AI-and-ML-in-Sentiment-Analysis.jpeg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":37337,"destBytes":30856,"author":"Shikha Sharma","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Understanding-the-Role-of-AI-and-ML-in-Sentiment-Analysis-300x185.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn59@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-23-652_a0e8eb6da053704d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195876842},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"Cubo Ai Baby Monitor: A Smart and Cute Way to Protect Your Bundle of Joy","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170216","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/23/cubo-ai-baby-monitor-a-smart-and-cute-way-to-protect-your-bundle-of-joy/\" title=\"Cubo Ai Baby Monitor: A Smart and Cute Way to Protect Your Bundle of Joy\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Cubo-AI-Baby-Monitor-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"Cubo AI Baby Monitor\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Cubo-AI-Baby-Monitor-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Cubo-AI-Baby-Monitor-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Cubo-AI-Baby-Monitor.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Baby monitors have come a long way since the audio-only devices that were put in a baby nursery to track our bundles of joy. Now, smart technology has revolutionized how baby monitors work, providing a much better idea of what our babies are up to when we are not in the same room with them. The Cubo Ai Baby Monitor is one of the most technologically advanced, so I thought I would put it to the test with our littlest one. Here&#8217;s my review.</p>\n<h2>About Cubo</h2>\n<p>Joanna Lin started <a href=\"https://us.getcubo.com/pages/cubo-brand-story\">Cubo</a> after she could not find solace from the six different baby cameras she used to monitor her baby. A medical consultant/pediatrician, as well as technology experts, helped design the baby monitor.</p>\n<h2>How it Works &#8212; Features and Functionality</h2>\n<p>The first standout feature of this smart WiFi baby monitor is the covered face alert. The camera continually tracks your baby’s face. It will alert you if they get buried under pillows, blankets, or other items like stuffed animals. The danger zone alert is another essential feature. It lets you draw an area on the video from the app. That way, if your baby crosses that area, you get an alert.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-170221 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Smartbabymonitor-900x596.jpeg\" alt=\"Smart Baby Monitor\" width=\"900\" height=\"596\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Smartbabymonitor-900x596.jpeg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Smartbabymonitor-300x199.jpeg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Smartbabymonitor-242x160.jpeg 242w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Smartbabymonitor-1536x1017.jpeg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Smartbabymonitor.jpeg 1807w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<p>Other features include infrared night vision, night light, camera zoom, and two-way talk. You can also record video as well as track room temperature and humidity. It does not offer features that other smart baby monitors may have, like playing lullabies or tracking baby&#8217;s health.</p>\n<p>Many baby monitors are easy to hack. However, Cubo encrypts all data and communications with a 256-bit symmetric-key encryption that is only accessible through your authenticated mobile device.</p>\n<h2>Video and Audio Quality</h2>\n<p>Cubo Ai has a 1080p wide-angle lens that is made by Sony. The picture is excellent during the day and night. Video streaming and sound quality also are superior to other baby monitors that we&#8217;ve tried.</p>\n<p>You’ll get a smooth video streaming experience as long as your Wifi connection is reliable. The remote function also provides welcome relief when you are away from home because you can still get a good quality video and zoom in from your phone.</p>\n<h2>Phone App</h2>\n<p>The phone app is also one of the best features, offering a way to control the baby monitor from either an Android or iOS device. The app is easy to set-up, including a fast registration process. There is also a family sharing account that can be set up so that more than one smartphone can sign in to the baby monitor.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-170222 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/smartbabymonitorreview-635x719.jpg\" alt=\"Smart Baby Monitor Review\" width=\"635\" height=\"719\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/smartbabymonitorreview-635x719.jpg 635w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/smartbabymonitorreview-265x300.jpg 265w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/smartbabymonitorreview-141x160.jpg 141w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/smartbabymonitorreview-1356x1536.jpg 1356w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/smartbabymonitorreview-1808x2048.jpg 1808w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/smartbabymonitorreview.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 635px) 100vw, 635px\" /></p>\n<p>The Cubo Ai has a VOX mode, which means that the baby monitor works even if your screen is off. The app will run in the background and notify you if there is a relevant alert. It&#8217;s also possible to turn your screen off and just have the audio portion play. Otherwise, if you had to endure a continuous live video stream, your phone battery would die very quickly.</p>\n<h2>Pros and Cons</h2>\n<p>There are many things to like about the Cubo Ai Baby Monitor. At the top of my pro list, the baby monitor delivers excellent video quality and zoom capability. It also has a high-performing app with customizable notifications and live video stream with only the slightest of delays. The baby monitor is really cute. Its design is the perfect fit for a nursery or child&#8217;s room because it resembles a toy rather than the typical baby monitor, which looks utilitarian.</p>\n<p>Another plus was the three options for mounting the baby monitor, including floor or mobile stand as well as crib mount. Other useful aspects of the Cubo include the covered face/rollover detection, which I could not find as a feature on other smart baby monitors.</p>\n<p>In terms of improvements, it could be easier to set up the baby monitor physically. However, it did feel sturdy once in place. There isn&#8217;t perfect packaging or presentation for storing the other two mounts that are not in use. It would be good if there were a storage case included. The app needs to be organized to make it easier to use.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-170220 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/CuboAIbabymonitorreview-900x600.jpg\" alt=\"Cubo Ai Baby Monitor Review\" width=\"900\" height=\"600\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/CuboAIbabymonitorreview-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/CuboAIbabymonitorreview-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/CuboAIbabymonitorreview-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/CuboAIbabymonitorreview-1536x1023.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/CuboAIbabymonitorreview.jpg 1600w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<h2>In the Box</h2>\n<p>When you buy a Cubo Ai Baby monitor, you get the camera unit and two USB wall plugs. The box also contains the three mounting options, including the u-shaped camera holder (for putting it on a shelf), a mobile stand, a floor stand with base, and a critical stand.</p>\n<h2>Where to Buy</h2>\n<p>The Cubo Ai Baby Monitor is available on Cubo&#8217;s website as well as through retailers like Amazon. It&#8217;s available for $249 on Cubo&#8217;s website and offers free two-day and standard shipping. Their website also connects you with a financing option, but they also accept credit cards and PayPal.</p>\n<h2>Overall Thoughts</h2>\n<p>Overall, I would recommend the Cubo Ai Baby Monitor over the other baby monitors I&#8217;ve researched and used. Although this baby monitor doesn&#8217;t have a feature like the baby&#8217;s health vitals, it is still an affordable, versatile option compared to the other smart baby monitors now available. It has provided solid peace of mind about your baby.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/23/cubo-ai-baby-monitor-a-smart-and-cute-way-to-protect-your-bundle-of-joy/\">Cubo Ai Baby Monitor: A Smart and Cute Way to Protect Your Bundle of Joy</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 23 Apr 2020 16:00:24 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Cubo-AI-Baby-Monitor.jpg","linkMd5":"f924c2a1f756286d0ea0a2bdcc33cfe0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn44@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-24-241_a220f644193bce1c.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Cubo-AI-Baby-Monitor.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":30482,"destBytes":23190,"author":"Deanna Ritchie","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Cubo-AI-Baby-Monitor-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn44@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-15-731_769897c5d9e4e29f.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Smartbabymonitor-900x596.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn51@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-09-582_b3ae8349f87b743b.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/smartbabymonitorreview-635x719.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn7@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-19-348_b41f3812a2eebf19.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/CuboAIbabymonitorreview-900x600.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn44@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-12-904_480fe9036c574a19.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878375},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:59","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:59","title":"How Technology Can Replace the Watercooler and Connect Employees","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169333","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/06/how-technology-can-replace-the-watercooler-and-connect-employees/\" title=\"How Technology Can Replace the Watercooler and Connect Employees\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/How-Technology-Can-Replace-the-Watercooler-and-Connect-Employees-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"tech to connect employees\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/How-Technology-Can-Replace-the-Watercooler-and-Connect-Employees-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/How-Technology-Can-Replace-the-Watercooler-and-Connect-Employees-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/How-Technology-Can-Replace-the-Watercooler-and-Connect-Employees.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Whether they like it or not, many businesses must learn to <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/05/remote-working-culture-the-facts-business-owners-need-to-know/\" data-original-title=\"\">work from home</a> as the world grapples with the coronavirus pandemic. It remains to be seen whether this crisis will <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/11/the-modern-workplace-may-come-with-a-couch-chips-and-netflix/\" data-original-title=\"\">usher in a new era of remote work</a>. But in the meantime, companies must learn how to maintain a strong, healthy culture by proactively combating employee isolation and encouraging new ways to connect and share critical information.</p>\n<p>Of course, the actual work being done is an important part of the typical workday.</p>\n<h3><b>Employees also spend a lot of time chatting in the break room, sharing details about their personal lives, and brainstorming solutions to challenges.</b></h3>\n<p>The chats help employees feel like they’re part of a team and that their work matters. Though it’s easy enough these days to sit at a computer at home and cross tasks off our lists &#8212; it can be harder to maintain those channels of connection.</p>\n<h2><b>The Pitfalls of Remote Work</b></h2>\n<p>When employees feel cut off from one another and the company at large, they feel isolated.</p>\n<h4><b>Without regular interactions from these parties, they can easily <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://www.health.com/condition/infectious-diseases/coronavirus/social-distancing-mental-health\" data-original-title=\"\">become stuck in negative thinking</a>. Their mood suffers, and engagement and productivity plummet.</b></h4>\n<p>Remote workers’ <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"http://workplacementalhealth.org/News-Events/Blog/January-2018/Loneliness-in-the-Workplace-Can-Be-a-High-Cost\" data-original-title=\"\">health can also deteriorate</a>: In fact, social isolation is correlated with a higher risk of cardiovascular disease, depression, and other ailments. This leads to higher health insurance costs and sick days — and you probably also want employees to stay healthy for their own sake, too.</p>\n<p>The risk of employees feeling isolated is even more severe when companies that usually encourage in-person interaction to establish remote work policies overnight. This was the case with many companies at the beginning of the coronavirus pandemic, and it leaves no time to transition to remote life.</p>\n<h2><b>Building Remote Connections</b></h2>\n<p>It’s on company leaders to make relationship-building <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"http://workplacementalhealth.org/News-Events/Blog/January-2018/Loneliness-in-the-Workplace-Can-Be-a-High-Cost\" data-original-title=\"\">a strategic priority</a>. They must create new ways for employees to interact virtually and encourage cross-team collaboration, communication, and interaction — including chats that aren’t related to work.</p>\n<p>Leaders need to walk the walk, too: They should demonstrate the importance of building relationships virtually by reaching out to employees and scheduling one-on-one videoconferences and informal catch-up sessions.</p>\n<h4><b>Run-of-the-mill <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/30/best-collaboration-tools-to-manage-remote-workers/\" data-original-title=\"\">collaboration tools</a> (such as videoconferencing and instant messaging) are good places to start, but they’re not enough.</b></h4>\n<p>These tools are great at bringing together individual employees or small teams, but they’re not so great at facilitating connections across companies. Important messages can easily become lost in the noise.</p>\n<p>Again, when employees face prolonged periods of isolation, they need to feel connected to the company in addition to their co-workers and teammates.</p>\n<h2><b>The Right Tech for the (Remote) Job</b></h2>\n<p>Companies should invest in an <a class=\"editor-link editor_tip\" title=\"\" href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbestechcouncil/2019/12/26/13-smart-strategies-for-keeping-remote-tech-workers-informed/#35e6cd541092\" data-original-title=\"\">accessible internal communications platform</a> that can serve as a centralized, trusted source for the company to communicate with employees and provide emotional support during uncertain times.</p>\n<h4><b>In other words, companies need a single place to share news, reinforce values, and celebrate wins.</b></h4>\n<p>For example, when Simpplr was in the process of moving to a new office, we were delayed for a week, forcing everyone to go remote. We used our own centralized platform to stay connected with departments and teams and kept everyone updated about move-in dates and new office policies.</p>\n<p>By using this technology and not relying simply on email or instant messaging, employees knew exactly where to go for updated, accurate information.</p>\n<h2><b>The Virtual Watercooler</b></h2>\n<p>Regardless of what tech you implement to keep connections <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/02/demystifying-8-core-myths-that-surround-the-internet-of-things/\">going strong among your remote workforce</a>, the goal for doing so should be to create a feeling of normalcy and help employees engage with one another. You can use technology to virtually replicate the office watercooler or break room.</p>\n<p>Here are a few ways to start your virtual watercooler:</p>\n<h3><b>1. Post weekly fun prompts.</b></h3>\n<div>\n<p>On your communication channel, post prompts that employees can respond to that aren’t related to work. For instance, you might ask questions about TV shows, movies, podcasts, or recipe recommendations.</p>\n<p>You could also host contests to see which employees come up with the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/03/6-ways-to-boost-employee-morale-with-visual-communication/\">best-themed photos each week</a>. This allows employees to connect in a fun, lighthearted way and talk about their hobbies and interests outside of work.</p>\n<div>\n<h3><b>2. Host virtual lunches.</b></h3>\n<p>Get people together from different departments or teams for lunch every few days. By connecting people who don’t typically work together on a day-to-day basis, you can help employees talk to people they usually wouldn’t be able to connect with and build new personal relationships.</p>\n<div>\n<h3><b>3. Recognize remote workers on a companywide scale.</b><b></b></h3>\n<p>Whenever remote workers have big wins or reach notable milestones, toot their horn. Just because they’re out of sight doesn’t mean they have to be out of mind, and a little bit of public recognition can go a long way in securing their trust and loyalty.</p>\n<p>Whether remote work is a crisis-only situation or becomes a new <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/24/5-technologies-to-support-working-from-home/\">norm for your company moving forward</a>, you need to proactively think through how to maintain your company culture and keep employees connected, healthy, and happy. With the right tech, who needs a watercooler anyway?</p>\n</div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/06/how-technology-can-replace-the-watercooler-and-connect-employees/\">How Technology Can Replace the Watercooler and Connect Employees</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 06 Apr 2020 18:00:07 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/How-Technology-Can-Replace-the-Watercooler-and-Connect-Employees.jpg","linkMd5":"502f29773642784651bc5cbceb6ebe78","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn100@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-25-431_42ef540e846b28d6.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/How-Technology-Can-Replace-the-Watercooler-and-Connect-Employees.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":67540,"destBytes":62000,"author":"Dhiraj Sharma","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/How-Technology-Can-Replace-the-Watercooler-and-Connect-Employees-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn8@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-17-007_52aa745d460eda61.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195879141},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","title":"4 Questions Product Managers Should Ask to Ensure a Stellar CX","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171661","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/07/4-questions-product-managers-should-ask-to-ensure-a-stellar-cx/\" title=\"4 Questions Product Managers Should Ask to Ensure a Stellar CX\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Product-Managers-Should-Ask-to-Ensure-a-Stellar-CX-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"product managers\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Product-Managers-Should-Ask-to-Ensure-a-Stellar-CX-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Product-Managers-Should-Ask-to-Ensure-a-Stellar-CX-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Product-Managers-Should-Ask-to-Ensure-a-Stellar-CX.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>In today’s digital world, it’s no secret that delivering an excellent Customer Experience (CX) is <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/25/10-core-foundations-for-a-great-customer-experience/\">paramount</a>. Consumers have more choices available to them than ever before and have come to expect products that are easy to use and effective. Clients and customers want you to be good at anticipating their needs and solving their problems. Here are four questions product managers should ask to ensure a stellar CX.</p>\n<h4><strong>Product managers are the driving force to guarantee quality and consistency in products and services.</strong></h4>\n<p>Your Product Manager is behind projects from conception through delivery and support, which puts the full responsibility for CX on their shoulders.</p>\n<p>Below are four questions product managers should ask themselves to make sure they’re delivering a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/21/a-better-customer-experience-why-little-things-matter/\">solid customer experience</a> and a product that meets users’ needs.</p>\n<h2><b>1. Do I </b><b><i>really </i></b><b>understand my customers?</b></h2>\n<p>Product managers always think they understand their customers: their goals, expectations, and the problems they’re seeking to solve.</p>\n<p>Often that understanding of the customer isn’t as deep as the company believes it is. It’s easy for any group of people to fall into groupthink about customers, operating on their preconceptions rather than objective customer data.</p>\n<h4>Add in helpful feedback from non-objective observers like colleagues and senior management, and a team can easily go in the wrong direction.</h4>\n<p>A non-vetted-vote creates a high risk that you’ll need to go back and redo work. You may be rushing either before launch when you discover the problems, or even worse after launch when you don’t get the traction you expected.</p>\n<p>The best way to control for this is to gain an in-depth, objective understanding of how your customers think and feel.</p>\n<p>You can gain this understanding via frequent contact with fresh customers who haven’t been contaminated by talking with you previously. I prefer to do this through video rather than in person, for reasons that I’ll explain below.</p>\n<h4><strong>Relying solely on quantitative data from surveys and analytics won’t cut it when you are searching for concrete data.<br />\n</strong></h4>\n<p>Your analytics will tell you what people are doing &#8212; but not what they’re thinking. Without human insight, you won’t be able to form high-quality hypotheses on what to build.</p>\n<p>It’s important to mention that not all customers are created equal when it comes to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/07/18/the-importance-of-customer-feedback-and-5-ways-to-obtain-it/\">obtaining feedback</a> to help guide product design. Product managers need to speak with users who are representative of their customer base as a whole—not outliers sourced from support.</p>\n<p><strong>Your noisy people on social media may not be the best resource.</strong></p>\n<p>Twitter is not a market research tool &#8212; it’s an echo chamber for enthusiasts. Getting feedback from the average customer allows teams to develop products that address the most common challenges users contend with. In this way, you can find &#8220;standard&#8221; goals that most often you&#8217;ll be trying to accomplish.</p>\n<h2><b>2. Is engineering on board?</b></h2>\n<p>Once product managers have a clear understanding of customer needs, it’s time to make sure engineering understands what to build and why.</p>\n<p>The aforementioned video feedback will prove useful here, giving engineers insights into what customers want—straight from the horse’s mouth.</p>\n<p>The video feedback lets you align the team quickly, and head off the religious debates that can sometimes slow down a product team. Video feedback from customers is emotionally compelling and settles disputes quickly.</p>\n<h2><b>3. Are all of the project’s stakeholders aligned?</b></h2>\n<p>Having easy access to customer video feedback is also helpful for aligning all of a project’s stakeholders. Often product teams are bombarded with helpful advice from random employees, senior management, or maybe a sales rep who’s on fire after a single customer meeting.</p>\n<p>Video feedback from customers aligns everyone by showing what users actually need, in their own words. This saves product managers the energy of having to explain why a product is being built in a certain way, a process that is usually slow and sometimes politically difficult.</p>\n<h2><b>4. Is my message being conveyed appropriately? </b></h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2015/07/27/customer-service-tech-personal-touch/\">Customer feedback</a> should also be shared with your customer-facing teams, especially marketing and sales.</p>\n<p>In addition to sharing the initial video feedback that led you to design the product, product managers (or your product marketing people, if you have them) can go back to customers again and test their value proposition to see if it holds true.</p>\n<p>Providing marketing and sales with insights on the problems they need to solve, and which features customers liked, ensure that the messages will reflect the real strengths and benefits of your product.</p>\n<p>From there, these teams have a solid framework from which to develop content that will closely resonate with prospective customers.</p>\n<p>Oftentimes, marketing and sales teams are presented with the task of marketing a product to customers without the added feedback and context you want them to have.</p>\n<p>Sales may be successful in communicating certain selling points, but you&#8217;ll want them included and coordinated with the feedback so your results aren&#8217;t disjointed campaigns with materials that don’t do the product justice.</p>\n<h4>Conclusion</h4>\n<p>Qualitative customer feedback is the backbone of creating <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/07/3-ways-to-make-customer-experience-your-differentiator/\">outstanding CX</a> and proves to be valuable at nearly every step in the product development process. By keeping in mind these four crucial questions, product managers can keep their projects on the path to delivering a product that is tightly aligned with customer needs.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/07/4-questions-product-managers-should-ask-to-ensure-a-stellar-cx/\">4 Questions Product Managers Should Ask to Ensure a Stellar CX</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 07 Jul 2020 18:10:02 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Product-Managers-Should-Ask-to-Ensure-a-Stellar-CX.jpg","linkMd5":"24bbd5825de406ea3a3105c5443fcad9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn95@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-09-605_b251825cfebe953b.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Product-Managers-Should-Ask-to-Ensure-a-Stellar-CX.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":38890,"destBytes":31314,"author":"Michael Mace","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Product-Managers-Should-Ask-to-Ensure-a-Stellar-CX-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn63@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-10-535_ed4c7c8e12489239.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195875292},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:59","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:59","title":"Artificial Intelligence: Forecasts for 2020","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=166069","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/04/artificial-intelligence-forecasts-for-2020/\" title=\"Artificial Intelligence: Forecasts for 2020\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Artificial-Intelligence-Forecasts-for-2020-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"artificial intelligence forcast\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Artificial-Intelligence-Forecasts-for-2020-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Artificial-Intelligence-Forecasts-for-2020-900x601.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Artificial-Intelligence-Forecasts-for-2020-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Artificial-Intelligence-Forecasts-for-2020-1536x1026.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Artificial-Intelligence-Forecasts-for-2020.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>In 2019, <a href=\"https://www.dqindia.com/predictions-2020-ai-time-turn-artificial-reality-checks/\">53% of global data and analysis </a>established by decision-makers announced that artificial intelligence is established, or in full development within their company. Here are the artificial intelligence forecasts for 2020.</p>\n<p>It is important to note that these findings are taken from statistics revealing percentages calculated from the observation of Fortune 500 companies. The Fortune 500 companies are recognized as the most profitable in the United States. The study shows finding that 29% of developers have worked on AI and machine learning in recent years. The findings have come from a <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/gilpress/2019/11/22/top-artificial-intelligence-ai-predictions-for-2020-from-idc-and-forrester/#605fd602315ahttps://www.forbes.com/sites/gilpress/2019/11/22/top-artificial-intelligence-ai-predictions-for-2020-from-idc-and-forrester/\">Forrester study.</a></p>\n<h3>Based on the Forrester team results, believing they can make predictions about artificial intelligence for 2020, I give their findings in this piece.</h3>\n<p>Most of the stats talked about in AI constitute 54% of decisions regarding the processing of AI within the IT sector in which the companies concerned, work. And most of the stats are regarding the anticipated benefits of AI.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<h4><b>The implementation of intelligent automation of certain processes.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>According to Forrester, <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/gilpress/2019/11/22/top-artificial-intelligence-ai-predictions-for-2020-from-idc-and-forrester/#12c03fca315a\">25% of Fortune 500 companies</a> plan the implementation of hundreds of Intelligent process automation (IPA) processes. In other words, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/05/marketing-automation-and-customer-service-how-are-they-connected/\">the automation of specific tasks</a> through the use of artificial intelligence.</p>\n<p>Thus, as part of the AI implementation involves specific automated robotic tasks. Companies will use text analysis and machine learning in particular to process a set of incoming emails and documents. Concerning the implementation of automatic responses or chatbots (robotic discussions), &#8211; programs are designed to converse with Internet users or customers in the guise of a human &#8211; also called <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/06/04/9-critical-questions-to-consider-when-assessing-a-conversational-ai-solution/\">conversational agents</a>.</p>\n<h5>Conversational agents.</h5>\n<p>These conversational agent programs are also supposed to save time, especially for HR employees and IT (Information Technology) teams. There will need to be certain monitoring tools using Machine learning for <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/11/evolving-relationship-between-artificial-intelligence-and-big-data/\">Big Data processing</a>. The programmers having previously created algorithms allowing the computer to sort the data.</p>\n<h5>Sorting data.</h5>\n<p>The more the algorithms sort the data, the more AI will be able to recognize the data that&#8217;s considered normal &#8212; and be able to find the data testifying to abnormal behavior. The human operator is therefore, directly directed by the machine towards abnormal behavior and can focus more quickly on the corrective measures to be taken.</p>\n<h5>Investment in automatic processes.</h5>\n<p>The increase in investment in this type of automatic process is partly due, according to the Forrester firm, to the anticipation of an economic downturn linked to the <a href=\"https://www.aljazeera.com/ajimpact/china-great-slowdown-economic-growth-slumps-27-year-191018035548056.html\">economic recession</a> in China.</p>\n<p>The economic recession in China could risk raising interest, which could dampen not only consumption and investment, but also reduce the market value of companies. Reducing market value is especially true in technology companies. The tech businesses have valuations that are highly dependent on the growth of profits in the long term.</p>\n<h5>Targeted automation.</h5>\n<p>No wonder companies are looking to develop the sectors to ensure the efficiency of their services. This type of targeted automation is also quicker to set up, and less costly than a transformation towards AI innovation projects, requiring a long-term investment, specifies the report.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<h4><b>AI benchmarks, a new weapon of competitiveness.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>As the AI market grows and computing platforms struggle to be recognized as the fastest, most scalable, and least expensive to deal with artificial intelligence workloads. Benchmarks of the industry should play an increasingly important role.</p>\n<h5>Benchmarks.</h5>\n<p>Last year, the MLPerf benchmarks stood out as the benchmark in terms of competitiveness. All players, from Nvidia to Google, boasted of superior performance on these tests.</p>\n<p>In 2020, AI benchmarks will be a crucial element of the marketing strategy, and this segment will only become commonplace over time.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<h4><b>A development far from weakening in the face of certain reluctance or questioning.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Forrester sited <a href=\"https://go.forrester.com/what-it-means/ep28-artificial-intelligence/\">dangers</a> linked to the use of artificial intelligence. A few examples of the risks are disinformation due to the filtering of certain algorithms on social networks, mass technological <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/19/facial-recognition-shaping-the-future-of-identity-verification-market/\">surveillance thanks to facial recognition</a> (as is the case in China), the proliferation of “deep fake” videos thanks to the intelligent permutation of faces or algorithmic discrimination.</p>\n<h5>Reproduction of discrimination in society.</h5>\n<p>AI can show (either by genuine or fake means) an unmatched amount of data. The data can present a lack of diversity and reproduce the discriminations of our societies. We were able even to witness the origin of an accident caused by an autonomous car from Uber, for example.</p>\n<p>All of this will not diminish AI investment in companies in 2020, according to Forrester. These incident reports will lead to demonstrate the importance and the need for AI and to be “transparent” in its use. Additionally, the AI findings will show areas begging the need for improvements to be made &#8212; all described in the Forrester report.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<h4><b>Consideration of data source needs.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>According to Forrester, the implantation of AI in companies will necessarily encourage managers to take the necessary measures to facilitate the work of developers in Machine Learning. For the most part, companies spend more than 70% of their time recovering all the data essential to the proper functioning of their programs.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<h4><b>AI in SaaS mode reduces demand for data scientists.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Since last year, <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/steveandriole/2019/02/06/the-microsoft-amazon-ibm-google-clouds-enable-emerging-technologies-and-everything-else/#50a5c0e82c65\">the machine learning offered as a service</a> from suppliers such as AWS, Microsoft, Google, IBM, and others has gained momentum.</p>\n<p>As the trend for AI picks up, more and more business users will rely on these cloud providers to meet more of their AI needs. Cloud providers will allow businesses to move from teams of data scientists employed internally.</p>\n<h5>Saas providers and AI.</h5>\n<p>By the end of 2020, SaaS providers will become the primary providers of natural language processing, predictive analytics, and other AI applications. These AI applications will include tools such as <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2017/05/15/artificial-intelligence-transform-devops-dl1/\">platform services and DevOps tools</a>.</p>\n<p>Companies that will continue to support internal AI initiatives will further automate the roles of data scientists, so they will not need to hire new machine learning modelers, data engineers, and support workers. Over the decade, most data scientists will be recruited primarily by SaaS and other cloud providers.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<h4><b>Continuous real-world experimentation for enterprise AI.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Each enterprise digital transformation initiative is based on the use of the most suitable learning models. The learning models approach requires experimentation in real situations where AI-based processes test alternative machine learning models. The <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/18/4-mistakes-of-machine-learning-startups/\">ML model</a> will automatically choose those tests and models that allow the desired result to be achieved.</p>\n<h5>Real-life experiments in business processes.</h5>\n<p>By the end of 2020, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/10/businesses-can-safely-and-efficiently-adopt-artificial-intelligence/\">most companies will implement real-life experiments in all business processes</a>, both in contact with customers and those in the back-end.</p>\n<p>As businesses <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/22/how-intelligent-data-addresses-the-chasm-in-cloud/\">turn to cloud providers</a> for their AI tools, features like those launched recently by AWS will model iteration studios, and tracking devices. There will be Multi-model experiences, and model-tracking dashboards. All of these features will become the norm in 24/7 AI-based models of the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/05/the-cloud-is-the-future-of-software-delivery/\">professional application environments</a>.</p>\n<h5>Best practices for optimizing AI.</h5>\n<p>Over the decade, AI-based automation and DevOps capabilities will spawn a universal best practice for optimizing AI-based business processes.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<h4><b>The work of modeling AI developers automated by AI.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Neural networks are at the heart of modern AI. In 2020, the work plans of corporate data scientists will begin to incorporate a new methodology based on AI called &#8220;neural architecture research,&#8221; it is intended to automate the construction and optimization of neural networks according to objectives.</p>\n<p>As it is adopted and improved, <a href=\"https://www.informationweek.com/big-data/ai-machine-learning/neural-architecture-search-could-tune-ais-algorithmic-heart/a/d-id/1336275\">research into neural architecture</a> will boost the productivity of data scientists, help them make decisions to build their models based on established machine learning algorithms, such as linear regression and random decision tree forest algorithms, or any of the latest and most advanced neural network algorithms.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<h4><b>End-to-end transparency of regulated AI.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>AI is becoming an increasingly important risk factor in enterprise applications. As companies face an upsurge of lawsuits on socio-economic biases, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/13/ai-how-its-impacting-surveillance-data-storage/\">privacy breaches, and other unfortunate effects</a> of AI applications, legal officials will demand full tracking of machine learning models to find out how they were built, trained, and managed, and how they are used in enterprise applications.</p>\n<p>By the end of 2020, the legal managers of most companies will ask their teams of data scientists to record each step of the machine learning process automatically, and to explain in plain language the automatic inference induced by each model. Over the next decade, the transparency of AI projects will be decisive for obtaining funding.</p>\n<p>Finally, it can be safely assumed that, in the coming years, demands for AI-based capacity regulation for all products. We will especially see those products that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/27/are-solutions-keeping-up-with-iot-security-concerns/\">use personally identifiable information</a> &#8211; will increase.</p>\n<p>Besides the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/09/5-reasons-why-artificial-intelligence-is-important-to-you/\">growing importance</a> given to transparency <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/18/what-can-we-expect-for-iot-in-2020/\">in the development of AI</a>, it is too early to say what the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/08/how-will-it-shape-up-the-future-of-the-internet/\">impact of these future regulations</a> will be on the evolution of the underlying platforms, tools, and technologies. But it seems likely that these regulatory initiatives will only intensify in the years to come, regardless of who wins the US presidential election this November.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/04/artificial-intelligence-forecasts-for-2020/\">Artificial Intelligence: Forecasts for 2020</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 04 Mar 2020 19:00:18 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Artificial-Intelligence-Forecasts-for-2020.jpg","linkMd5":"2db8b0629f366be1a82bfc292d6b7d8f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn8@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-23-483_3b434ee0e7219c71.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Artificial-Intelligence-Forecasts-for-2020.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1282,"sourceBytes":157894,"destBytes":92776,"author":"Adedeji Adewale","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Artificial-Intelligence-Forecasts-for-2020-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn95@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-22-755_54aebd6192e97b9f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195879692},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"4 Technology Trends Shaping Property Portals","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=168126","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/20/4-technology-trends-shaping-property-portals/\" title=\"4 Technology Trends Shaping Property Portals\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/4-Technology-Trends-Shaping-Property-Portals-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"shaping property portals\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/4-Technology-Trends-Shaping-Property-Portals-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/4-Technology-Trends-Shaping-Property-Portals-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/4-Technology-Trends-Shaping-Property-Portals.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>The process of buying and selling property has transformed in recent years. According to the Real Estate in a Digital Age 2019 Report by the National Association of REALTORS®, in 2018, 44% of buyers looked for properties online first. The Internet is often the first place people look when searching for a new home. Here are four technology trends shaping property portals.</p>\n<p>Gone are the days of having to browse newspaper classifieds and drive through neighborhoods to find the perfect home. Today&#8217;s <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/19/5-ways-technology-is-transforming-the-real-estate-industry/\">property marketplaces</a> make it easy for homebuyers and renters to search specific properties without ever stepping foot outside their homes.</p>\n<p>As property portals continue to grow in popularity, they also face changes due to industry trends. Here are four trends shaping real estate marketplaces.</p>\n<h2>1. Artificial intelligence (AI) is helping to generate better search results.</h2>\n<p>Many people become overwhelmed when searching for a new home. Real estate portals recommend properties based on details such as square footage, price, number of rooms, etc. However, they often show irrelevant results and more information than potential buyers need.</p>\n<p>With <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/06/where-will-ai-take-the-real-estate-market-in-10-years/\">AI and machine learning</a>, property marketplaces can help consumers more accurately search for homes. Similar to how Amazon shows consumers relevant products based on their behavior, portals using AI can recommend properties that match consumers&#8217; lifestyles, preferences, and values.</p>\n<p>For example, if a user clicks on numerous properties with quartz countertops, machine learning algorithms enable real estate marketplaces to suggest similar listings that may be of interest to them. Portals can deliver fewer, higher-quality properties based on consumers&#8217; wants and needs.</p>\n<p>Additionally, some <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/13/does-your-business-really-need-an-ai-solution/\">property marketplaces </a>allow users to collaborate with family and their agents to pick the houses that interest them. They can group homes that fit their unique style into specific categories, such as “five bedrooms or more” or “homes with beach access.” Instead of switching between numerous tabs and sorting through lists of links, users can keep track of properties in one place.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/02/the-challenges-and-opportunities-for-automation-in-the-real-estate-industry/\">Advancements</a> in AI and machine learning are helping property marketplaces simplify the home search experience and deliver far better results to potential buyers.</p>\n<h2>2. Facebook could become a property portal competitor.</h2>\n<p>Zillow and Trulia are the most popular real estate portals in the world. Meanwhile, there&#8217;s the possibility that Facebook might be building its own property marketplace to become the next competitor in the industry.</p>\n<p>In early 2019, Facebook <a href=\"https://about.fb.com/news/2019/03/protecting-against-discrimination-in-ads/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">published an article on its news page</a> that stated it was building a tool so that users could &#8220;search for and view all current housing ads in the U.S. targeted to different places across the country, regardless of whether the ads are shown&#8221; to them.</p>\n<p>While it&#8217;s unclear precisely what the tool is, a standalone property search portal within the platform where <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/04/getting-high-returns-on-real-estate-investment/\">real estate businesses</a> where advertise directly would be a massive disruptor to traditional property portals. It would also change the way consumers search for properties online.</p>\n<p>If Facebook does roll out a property portal, it may force other marketplaces to rethink their current approach or increase their offerings to hold onto consumers.</p>\n<h2>3. Zillow adds mortgage lending services.</h2>\n<p>The most painstaking part of buying a new home can be getting a mortgage. Zillow, however, aims to streamline the process for consumers by providing its own mortgage origination service.</p>\n<p>Last year, the property portal giant announced the launch of its mortgage lending operation, Zillow Home Loans. Zillow will now compete with the third-party lenders listed on its mortgage marketplace, where homebuyers search for a mortgage through Zillow&#8217;s website. The shift towards buying and selling homes places the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/14/6-tech-trends-that-will-dominate-the-new-decade/\">portal among the competitive ranks</a> of companies like Redfin, Offerpad, and Opendoor.</p>\n<p>Zillow&#8217;s move into mortgages signals the trend of property marketplaces getting closer to the real estate transaction to create better customer experiences. While portals initially focused on property advertising, there&#8217;s a growing likelihood that they will expand across the entire real estate transaction to offer services related to mortgages, insurance, moving, and more.</p>\n<h2>4. Demand for mobile access continues to grow</h2>\n<p>Property managers have the opportunity to extend beyond property and transform into online marketplaces, which are valuable to today&#8217;s renters.</p>\n<p>According to a daVinci Payments survey, renters ages between the ages of 18 and 29 outnumber every other rental group combined, and those renters are looking at the quality of their experience. Furthermore, 71% of renters make purchases on their phones, meaning rental properties need targeted incentives designed for mobile use.</p>\n<p>Property managers that become an online marketplace can meet consumer expectations for on-demand services.</p>\n<p>According to the 2020 NMHC/Kingsley Apartment Resident Preferences Report, 81% of renters value having mobile access to their resident portal, which is an increase from 2017 when it was 77%. Additionally, renters would rather perform tasks, such as submitting maintenance requests (64%) and paying rent (58%) on a mobile device versus a desktop computer.</p>\n<p>Offering an enhanced <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/04/why-you-need-to-consider-iot-in-improving-customer-experience/\">customer experience over a mobile device</a> will make it more likely for property managers to hold onto renters. By <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/06/real-estate-vs-stocks-which-has-a-better-return/\">cutting costs from reduced turnover</a> and increasing their efficiency, property managers can buy back equity from the banks, enabling them to increase the number of properties they hold. With less money owed to banks, they can take out loans at excellent rates and grow their portfolios faster.</p>\n<p>It&#8217;s hard to imagine buying a home before real estate portals. However, more buyers and renters are turning to the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/04/4-key-components-for-building-a-startup-website-that-converts/\">Internet to start their search for properties</a>, fueling the rise of property marketplaces.</p>\n<p>As new <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/19/9-web-development-trends-to-skip-in-2019/\">trends in the industry appear</a>, there’s no doubt that they will play a crucial role in shaping property portals – now and into the future.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Pixabay<br />\n</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/20/4-technology-trends-shaping-property-portals/\">4 Technology Trends Shaping Property Portals</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 20 Apr 2020 20:00:46 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/4-Technology-Trends-Shaping-Property-Portals.jpg","linkMd5":"31493234db1a10ad32f786fdaa78bc57","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn60@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-19-832_587e03fed022086f.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/4-Technology-Trends-Shaping-Property-Portals.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":40144,"destBytes":34434,"author":"Adrian Fisher","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/4-Technology-Trends-Shaping-Property-Portals-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn87@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-22-388_d9470dba2ea9d0fa.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878280},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","title":"Why HealthTech Companies Must Become More User-Centric or Risk Failing","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173600","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/16/why-healthtech-companies-must-become-more-user-centric-or-risk-failing/\" title=\"Why HealthTech Companies Must Become More User-Centric or Risk Failing\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"217\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Why-HealthTech-Companies-Must-Become-More-User-Centric-300x217.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"healthtech companies\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Why-HealthTech-Companies-Must-Become-More-User-Centric-300x217.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Why-HealthTech-Companies-Must-Become-More-User-Centric-221x160.jpg 221w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Why-HealthTech-Companies-Must-Become-More-User-Centric.jpg 584w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>HealthTech companies have been instrumental during the COVID-19 pandemic. These companies have made medical help outside of traditional facilities more accessible, kept communities informed, <a href=\"https://www.minnpost.com/community-voices/2020/05/how-data-analytics-and-technology-are-helping-us-fight-covid-19/\">collected contact-tracing data</a>, and facilitated the recent reopening of society. Here is how healthtech companies must become more use-centric or risk failing.</p>\n<h3>No doubt, HealthTech has cemented its role as a necessity in the digital age.</h3>\n<p>In May, the UN <a href=\"https://unctad.org/en/pages/newsdetails.aspx?OriginalVersionID=2371\">pledged</a> to boost HealthTech production for COVID-19. Meanwhile, the UK has announced a <a href=\"https://www.mobihealthnews.com/news/europe/uk-health-tech-companies-take-centre-stage-covid-19-crisis-response\">£1.25 billion</a> government package for young HealthTech companies. The wave of support for the industry has spurred rapid growth and has poised HealthTech to be part of everyday life on a long-term basis.</p>\n<h4>As HealthTech platforms become more popular, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/12/how-to-create-a-better-user-experience-in-med-tech/\">user experience</a> (UX) is set to become a bigger priority.</h4>\n<p>Currently, HealthTech solutions are focusing on practicality over usability because he need to reach markets is more pressing than tailoring features and processes.</p>\n<p>Nonetheless, to be successful, HealthTech companies have to put UX front and center. Research shows that 70 percent of customers will abandon a service that has <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/17/5-whatsapp-business-features-to-elevate-customer-experience/\">a bad user experience.</a></p>\n<p>Among a new landscape, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/29/crisis-versus-opportunity-6-ways-to-bootstrap-a-startup-in-a-post-covid-19-world-while-navigating-the-new-normal/\">new user behaviors</a>, and new UX expectations, HealthTech companies that do not put users first, risk losing consumers and even failing. Here&#8217;s why:</p>\n<h3><b>HealthTech companies in a new landscape.</b></h3>\n<p>COVID-19 has completely changed how people interact and the tools they use to maintain a sense of normality. Government-enforced quarantines have meant people are at home more, while social distancing rules limit outside physical contact.</p>\n<p>These environmental changes are leading evolutionary changes, especially in the relationship between humans and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/06/the-impacts-of-covid-19-on-sustainability-and-technology/\">technology</a>.</p>\n<h4>Drones</h4>\n<p>Already, drones have been used to <a href=\"https://www.syracuse.com/coronavirus/2020/05/syracuse-company-develops-coronavirus-killing-drone-for-arenas-and-stadiums.html\">spray disinfectant</a> over large urban areas, robots are delivering medical supplies, and telemedicine companies are <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/telemedicine-keeps-doctors-and-patients-connected-at-a-safe-remove/2020/05/14/5f1fa262-742b-11ea-ae50-7148009252e3_story.html\">catering</a> to people with no insurance or high deductibles.</p>\n<p>These new adoptions co-align with how people are turning to online services to continue their daily lives. Traditionally-offline services are now available via the internet, and so, people&#8217;s digital literacy is improving.</p>\n<p>However, there is still a sharp gap between the tech-savvy and tech beginners.</p>\n<p>The disparity presents a challenge for HealthTech companies that now have to provide solutions for the different user segments. They have to consider both avid users and those who are less-practiced with technology.</p>\n<h3><b>HealthTech companies and new user behaviors.</b></h3>\n<p>During the lockdown, people are online more often and for longer periods. In some parts of the world, internet usage has even gone up by <a href=\"https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2020/03/will-coronavirus-break-the-internet/\">50 percent</a>. The internet surge could mean that people are no longer browsing from their mobile phones but instead using their desktops.</p>\n<p>The change in hardware is key to HealthTech UX, which has to be optimized for larger screens.</p>\n<h3>The lockdown has led to an <a href=\"https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(20)30460-8/fulltext\">incline</a> in cases of poor mental health, anxiety, and stress.</h3>\n<p>In the midst of such uncertainty, people want solutions that relieve, not antagonize, their fears. As a result, people are looking for ways to preserve their health via quick, accurate medical advice with limited physical contact.</p>\n<p>For HealthTech then, UX needs to answer these new demands and develop systems that are instant, reliable, and remote.</p>\n<p>To be a wholly trusted mode of support, HealthTech also requires empathetic, &#8216;human&#8217; language, alongside engaging characteristics like animations, interactive graphs, and downloadable information.</p>\n<h3>HealthTech can equally look to other spheres for inspiration around UX.</h3>\n<p>Streaming sites are currently offering measures like <a href=\"https://www.netflixparty.com/\">collaborative watching</a>, where people in different locations can view the same film or show at the same time.</p>\n<p>HealthTech companies have to consider if they can harness such features and apply them to their customer journeys. For instance, people may want to join consultations together or read progress reports simultaneously.</p>\n<p>Regardless of the pandemic, people still have a desire to connect &#8212; HealthTech has to identify if this is a core new user behavior for the future or a short-term reaction in the existing climate.</p>\n<h3><b>HealthTech companies and new UX expectations.</b></h3>\n<p>On average, a person owns <a href=\"https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/executive-perspectives/annual-internet-report/air-highlights.html\">eight networked devices</a> &#8211; and that figure is expected to rise substantially within the next decade.</p>\n<p>Wearable devices like blood pressure, sleep, and step monitors generate huge amounts of data that users want to access in a clear and digestible format.</p>\n<p>Particularly amid and following COVID-19, people are more alert and want instant answers. HealthTech UX therefore needs to be minimalistic to effectively process numbers and calculations.</p>\n<h4>For less tech-ready user groups, guided, and easy-to-understand UX is a must.</h4>\n<p>Tech-ready groups are likely to look for <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/09/if-conversational-chatbots-want-to-take-off-they-need-to-act-like-robots/\">chatbots</a> to get fast information, book appointments, and reduce their overall waiting time.</p>\n<p>In telemedicine specifically, chatbots are a smart tool to keep medical professionals and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/30/iot-and-healthcare-technologies-converge-for-better-patient-care/\">patients connected</a>, without being a huge drain on resources.</p>\n<p>For <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/02/top-10-greatest-ai-trends-in-business-2020/\">chatbots to be most efficient</a>, complex algorithms are needed to make conversations in-depth and natural. This is something HealthTech developers will need to prioritize when <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/23/optimize-micro-interactions-to-enhance-your-ux-design/\">making UX changes</a>.</p>\n<h4>Messaging Apps</h4>\n<p>Another thing to consider is that many users anticipate that chatbots mirror the layout of bots they are already familiar with. Facebook Messenger and Whatsapp are the messaging apps with the <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/258749/most-popular-global-mobile-messenger-apps/\">most active users</a> in the world, so mimicking their formats would be wise.</p>\n<p>Likewise, as <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2012/07/06/infographic-the-1-000-year-evolution-of-speech-and-voice-recognition/\">voice recognition</a> devices become more commonplace in people&#8217;s homes, HealthTech will have to adapt and establish a user flow based solely on sound. This optimization would be beneficial for multiple user segments.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/27/paving-the-way-3-industries-ripe-for-post-pandemic-change/\">Younger generations</a> are already accustomed to voice recognition, and older generations with limited mobility would welcome movement-free instructions. Alternatively, voice recognition can aid physicians in documenting patient information.</p>\n<p>For example, Suki is a startup that uses voice commands to help physicians create clinical notes or orders for tests and prescriptions.</p>\n<h3><b>HealthTech companies offering greater value</b></h3>\n<p>As new user needs are still surfacing throughout COVID-19, HealthTech companies have to be flexible and pivot to best meet emerging UX expectations. User testing and research should be a continuous, iterative process, that balances unprecedented circumstances with heightened sensitivity toward health.</p>\n<p>Still, in COVID-19 and the era that follows, patients are also consumers. As HealthTech accelerates, the industry will become more competitive. Companies built around customer preferences will have the most significant advantage.</p>\n<p>By having a more user-centric approach, HealthTech will not only scale faster in the new normal and garner loyal followings but also offer greater value to people when they need it most.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: cottonbro; Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/16/why-healthtech-companies-must-become-more-user-centric-or-risk-failing/\">Why HealthTech Companies Must Become More User-Centric or Risk Failing</a> appeared 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"Impact of COVID-19 in the Crypto Market","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169699","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/24/impact-of-covid-19-in-the-crypto-market/\" title=\"Impact of COVID-19 in the Crypto Market\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\"
