src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Bootstrap-Your-Startup-for-Years-Without-Funding-300x199.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"bootstrap your startup\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Bootstrap-Your-Startup-for-Years-Without-Funding-300x199.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Bootstrap-Your-Startup-for-Years-Without-Funding-900x596.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Bootstrap-Your-Startup-for-Years-Without-Funding-242x160.jpg 242w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Bootstrap-Your-Startup-for-Years-Without-Funding-1536x1018.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Bootstrap-Your-Startup-for-Years-Without-Funding.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>When starting a business, it&#8217;s typical to look for venture capital, angel investors, and even co-founders to help get the company up and running. While funding is necessary for almost all businesses, seeking it out yourself isn&#8217;t necessarily the right path for everyone. Instead, knowing how to bootstrap your startup might be a better option.</p>\n<h2><b>How to Bootstrap Your Startup</b></h2>\n<p>When you <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2013/04/30/bootstrapping-your-startup-7-hard-earned-tips-from-entrepreneurs/\">bootstrap</a> your startup, you retain full control of the new business. You don&#8217;t have to worry about securing and keeping funders happy. If bootstrapping is right for your small business, the following tips can help you through the process.</p>\n<h3><b>Get Creative With Startup Funds</b></h3>\n<p>It takes money &#8211; sometimes a lot of money &#8211; to start any business. So, your initial funding has to come from somewhere. But that doesn&#8217;t mean that you need to give away equity in your business or seek out external funding. During the early stages of your business, it&#8217;s possible to rely on credit cards and the personal savings of startup founders as you get things up and running.</p>\n<p>When <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/01/03/increasing-business-credit-the-safe-and-smart-way/\">launching a bootstrapped startup</a>, you may need to get creative. Design your business model so that you can quickly start selling services or products to establish cash flow. Taking the time to write up a detailed business plan outlining all of your expenses can help you better envision the expenses that will be involved, as well as the time it may take to pay off those credit cards.</p>\n<h3><b>Focus on Your Customers</b></h3>\n<p>When you&#8217;re working with limited resources, one of the best things bootstrappers do is <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/27/9-ways-to-refresh-your-companys-image-without-spending-a-fortune/\">focus on clients</a> from the very beginning. Engaging with potential customers on social media can help inform everything from your marketing strategy to your product design and launches. The better connected your business is to your customers, the more aware you&#8217;ll be of what they&#8217;re looking for and how they&#8217;ll respond to your business, and products or services.</p>\n<p>It&#8217;s equally as important to focus on <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/05/marketing-automation-and-customer-service-how-are-they-connected/\">providing effective customer service</a>. When your business is willing to go above and beyond to create a positive customer experience, you can build customer loyalty as well as valuable customer referrals. Increased referrals can expand your business without increasing your marketing budget.</p>\n<h3><b>Consider Outsourcing</b></h3>\n<p>You may reach a point where your startup needs more team members, but you don&#8217;t have the finances or stability to hire anyone full-time. During this growth stage, consider outsourcing some of your work to talented <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/09/21/the-freelance-entrepreneurs-guide-to-surviving-in-the-world-of-iot/\">freelancers or independent contractors</a>. When you hire freelancers, you can often save money over the cost of hiring an actual employee, since you don&#8217;t have to pay into the Federal Unemployment Tax or worry about contributing to employee benefits.</p>\n<p>If you decide to outsource some work, be deliberate and cautious in the process. Outline the types of work that you would like to outsource and determine the skills and experience that you would <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/27/9-ways-to-refresh-your-companys-image-without-spending-a-fortune/\">want to see in a freelancer</a>. There are many platforms, like Upwork, where you can find freelancers, but this can be hit-or-miss in terms of finding talented, reliable help. Instead, try to network with other business owners to see if they have a favorite freelancer they would recommend.</p>\n<h3><b>Hire for Attitude</b></h3>\n<p>Chances are that your startup won&#8217;t have the funding to <a href=\"https://www.calendar.com/blog/pros-and-cons-of-hiring-a-remote-team/\">hire top-tier</a> veteran talent, but when it is time to hire employees, hire for attitude, rather than experience. Aytekin Tank, CEO of JotForm, advocates for this strategy, and it&#8217;s paid off for JotForm.</p>\n<p>&#8220;We&#8217;ve sort of adopted a belief at JotForm that we don&#8217;t necessarily hire superstars; we grow them. We hire for attitude and make sure we treat the standouts well with more responsibility and good pay. This has reduced turnover and kept our production consistently high.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Look for potential employees who are <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/12/the-3-ways-your-business-can-utilize-social-media-analytics-data/\">invested in your mission</a>, and who know how to bootstrap your startup too. They&#8217;ll be a powerful investment as they learn on the job, and bring genuine passion and hustle to their work.</p>\n<h3><b>Embrace Slow Growth</b></h3>\n<p>As an entrepreneur with an exciting business idea, it&#8217;s easy to get frustrated when you&#8217;re forced to grow <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/14/outsourcing-automation-future-of-business-scalability/\">your business more slowly</a> because of limited funding. But according to Tank, slowing down can be a gift in disguise.</p>\n<p>&#8220;We&#8217;re methodical about how we expand our team and add new products, and over time we&#8217;ve built something incredibly sustainable. We also always have a rule only to add new employees if we have the money to pay their salaries for an entire year.&#8221;</p>\n<p>The forced slowed growth you&#8217;ll experience as you bootstrap your startup can make you more aware of how you&#8217;re spending money. And, you&#8217;ll become more deliberate and cautious in your business decisions. Taking the time to step back and evaluate each move can help ensure that your business is wisely built, encouraging its chances of being successful.</p>\n<h3><b>Be Patient &#8211; and Appreciate How it Helps</b></h3>\n<p>Finally, remember to be patient and relax.</p>\n<p>&#8220;Bootstrapping is a long game,&#8221; Tank says. &#8220;So take time to unwind and appreciate what you&#8217;re doing so that you don&#8217;t burn yourself out. I&#8217;m much better nowadays at <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/04/can-you-learn-to-be-creative-at-work/\">taking vacations and breaks at work</a>. I also encourage the same from our employees. It keeps us more productive and fresh, not to mention preserves our sanity.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Bootstrapping can take time, but be patient and enjoy the experience of building something great, all with your own funding.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/18/how-to-bootstrap-your-startup-for-years-without-funding/\">How to Bootstrap Your Startup for Years Without Funding</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 19 Feb 2020 00:00:10 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Bootstrap-Your-Startup-for-Years-Without-Funding.jpg","linkMd5":"454f50c0e08486534bf6ec6f09529aa0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn40@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-26-594_1021153be1f66440.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Bootstrap-Your-Startup-for-Years-Without-Funding.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1272,"sourceBytes":168291,"destBytes":139936,"author":"John Boitnott","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Bootstrap-Your-Startup-for-Years-Without-Funding-300x199.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn40@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-17-978_dc5139c751a239cc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195880843},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"What the Drones of Future Can Do","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=168259","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/23/what-the-drones-of-future-can-do/\" title=\"What the Drones of Future Can Do\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/What-the-Drones-of-Future-Can-Do-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"drones in future\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/What-the-Drones-of-Future-Can-Do-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/What-the-Drones-of-Future-Can-Do-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/What-the-Drones-of-Future-Can-Do.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>On Oct 11, 2019, the high precision surveillance along 50 km of the entire route traversed by Chinese President Xi Jinping’s convoy in India by four drones designed by Anna University made us wonder at the possibilities spurting from something like 3 cm resolution at an altitude of 100 m.</p>\n<p>But on the other hand, the drone attack in Saudi Arabia in Sep 2019, which mopped away some five percent of the global oil supply, and reverberated a difficult question. Will drones continue as the benefactors of humanity or they will become a weapon for mass destruction and terrorism in the future?</p>\n<p>Three factors exist with drones. The need for good technology, huge investment, and fast adoption. All three levels can conspire in a scenario where the antithetical opportunities for prosperity and destruction may coexist subject to our <strong>drones of the future.</strong></p>\n<h3><strong>Introduction to Drones</strong></h3>\n<p>A drone is an <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/07/what-you-need-to-know-to-use-drones-for-your-wedding/\">unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV)</a> that can be made to fly autonomously by a dedicated remote unit. It has the capability to perform certain operations in the air dictated by the computer program whereas flight mode controls are assisted by tracking devices such as <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2017/02/22/ping-gps-locator-dl4/\">GPS</a>.</p>\n<p>The origin of drones attributes to the need realized by the government and military for intelligent warfare devices since the 1960s. During the Vietnam War, the US Army actively used drones for surveillance purposes followed by the later use by the Israeli military in 1982 during the Lebanon War.</p>\n<p>However, with the advancement in technology, drones were later customized into different forms for many commercial applications. To the great benefit of mankind have come assistance in accessing harrowing situations, finding missing people, creating 3D maps, surveying landscape, wildlife conservation, pipeline inspection, traffic monitoring, weather forecasting, and firefighting, agriculture, photography, video making, academic projects.</p>\n<h4>Even delivery services &#8212; especially in pandemic situations, may find a comforting benefit for all of us.</h4>\n<p>The cost of drones depends on size and functionality. The mini version drones which fit in the palm may cost as less as $100 whereas the military-grade drones which fit in a backpack can cost tens of millions of dollars. One of the largest military drones is 47.6 feet long <a href=\"https://www.popularmechanics.com/military/aviation/a28120333/mq-4-triton/\">MQ-4 Global Hawk</a> which is wider than a Boeing 737 airliner.</p>\n<p>One of the most popular drones in the market was the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/05/09/video-a-look-into-dji-the-worlds-largest-drone-manufacturer/\">DJI</a> Phantom 3 known for professional cinematography. The drone uses an advanced technology that is inherited by the latest drones such as the Mavic Air, Phantom 4 Pro, Inspire 2, Walkera Voyager 5, etc.</p>\n<h3><strong>How Drones Work</strong></h3>\n<p>A drone is made of light composite material to reduce weight and provide high altitude coverage. The motor operation is achieved by a compact high-torque multi-propeller system that makes this device highly independent and provides fail-safe features in a way that even if any motor inside this device stops working; it will keep on flying as it gets support from propellers that are working in a group.</p>\n<p>These propellers are operated by remote ground control systems (GSC) using radio waves, including Wi-Fi. Most of these devices contain removable batteries so that it can stay in the air for the long run. The flight time can increase with the use of powerful batteries in design.</p>\n<p>The rates of rotation and other parameters are relayed by the gyroscopes and sensors to computers that use algorithms to make adjustments to the positioning of the drone. This keeps the drone balanced, hovering consistently and moving forward, backward, or vertically.</p>\n<p>Computer algorithms assist the drone operator in controlling the drone’s descent. While the drone pilot can control where and when the drone moves, it is the computer positioning algorithms that ensure an automatic stability level.</p>\n<p>Navigational systems, such as GPS, are fixed in the nose of a drone which communicates the precise location of the drone. Optionally, an onboard altimeter can communicate the altitude vectors and keep the drone at a specific altitude, if commanded by the controller.</p>\n<h3>Evolving Technologies</h3>\n<p>The latest high tech drones of today are successfully outdoing previous versions in a variety of ways.</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Collision avoidance systems</strong> &#8211; <a href=\"https://www.dronezon.com/learn-about-drones-quadcopters/top-drones-with-obstacle-detection-collision-avoidance-sensors-explained/\">Obstacle detection sensors </a>are used to scan the surroundings, while software algorithms produce the images into 3D maps allowing the drone to sense and avoid obstacles. The most popular example is the latest <a href=\"https://www.dronezon.com/drone-reviews/dji-mavic-2-pro-zoom-review-of-features-specifications-with-faqs/\">DJI Mavic 2 Pro and Mavic 2 Zoom</a> which have obstacle sensing on all 6 sides.</li>\n<li><strong>No Fly Zone Feature &#8211; </strong>In order to increase flight safety and prevent accidents in restricted areas regulated and categorized by FAA (Federal Aviation Administration), the latest drones from DJI and other manufacturers include a “No Fly Zone” feature which gives a warning on entry into these zones.</li>\n<li><strong>FPV Live Video Transmission – </strong>The FPV (<a href=\"https://www.dronezon.com/learn-about-drones-quadcopters/what-is-fpv-flying-drone-equipment/\">First Person View</a>) based technology consists of a video camera which is mounted on the drone and broadcasts the live video using the radio signal to the pilot on the ground.  This gives real-time onboard experience to the ground pilot allowing the drone to fly much higher and further than one can from looking at the aircraft from the ground.</li>\n<li><strong>Smart Interface &#8211; </strong>Most of the drones today can be flown by a remote controller or from a smartphone app, which can be downloaded from Google Play or the Apple Store. Such a manufacturer-specific app allows for full control of the drone.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3><strong>New Areas and Business Prospects</strong></h3>\n<p>The drones used for commercial applications are flourishing. This shall give different businesses a large scale opportunity to boost their revenue and help global economies grow in unimaginable ways.</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Shipment services</strong> &#8211; According to the recent reports, Google and Amazon are developing their own drones so that shipment can be delivered by air in a much shorter time. Facebook is planning to develop giant drones to carry the signal to remote locations for internet access.\n<p>In 2018, Boeing announced it had prototyped an unmanned electric VTOL <a href=\"https://www.boeing.com/features/2019/05/cav-first-flight-05-19.page\">cargo air vehicle (CAV)</a> that can carry up to a 500-pound payload. As a part of <a href=\"https://www.weforum.org/press/2019/10/medicine-from-the-sky-telangana-hits-milestone-for-drone-delivery-of-medical-supplies-to-remote-areas/\">WEF’s “Medicine from the sky” initiative,</a> Telangana Govt has adopted a framework to use drones for last-mile delivery of essential medical supplies such as blood and medical samples in an effort to increase access to health care to communities across the state. Drones are also in use by news reporters to gather information from inaccessible locations.</li>\n<li><strong>Collaboration with IoT</strong> – An integrated system of Drones with on-ground IoT sensor networks can help agricultural companies monitor land and crops, energy companies survey power lines and operational equipment and insurance companies monitor properties for claims and policies. In 2015, an experiment was conducted in Austin, Texas in which drones successfully spotted the IoT networks that were present in residential and business areas of the city.</li>\n<li><strong>Measurement and estimation </strong>&#8211; Drones can measure and record the height of crops, buildings, and mountains. This is done by using remote sensing technology called <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2013/10/15/seven-ways-3d-lidar-is-transforming-our-physical-world/\">Lidar</a> that illuminates the target with a laser and calculates distance and height by measuring what is reflected back.</li>\n<li><strong>Atmospheric studies</strong> &#8211; Drones can fly to unsafe and inaccessible areas to measure air quality, check for the presence of specific micro-organisms or atmospheric elements, and even detect earthquakes.</li>\n<li><strong>Live recording</strong> &#8211;  Television sports networks use Drones nowadays to capture sporting event footage that would otherwise be difficult to acquire.</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>Given such sprawling grounds of new applications, here are some recent business predictions on drone economy:</strong></p>\n<ul>\n<li>PricewaterhouseCoopers has valued the drone-based businesses service market at more than $127 billion, with the top industries being infrastructure at $45.2 billion, agriculture at $32.5 billion, and transportation at $13.0 billion.</li>\n<li>The Association for Unmanned Vehicle Systems International (AUVSI) predicts the drone industry will create more than 100,000 U.S. jobs and add $82 billion to the U.S. economy by 2025.</li>\n<li>Goldman Sachs predicts a $100 billion market for drones between 2016 and 2020, with the military making up the bulk of it with $70 billion spending. It is estimated that consumer drones will take a $17 billion share of that market, with commercial and civil government use making up $13 billion.</li>\n<li>The United Nations Institute for Disarmament Research quoted in its 2017 report that the global drone market may increase four times by 2022 from its 2015 value and surpass a net worth of $22 billion that includes drones used for both military and non-military purposes.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The above data clearly indicates that drones are here to stay, and so is the threat they pose if they land in unsafe hands.</p>\n<h3><strong>Threats due to Proliferation</strong></h3>\n<p>No matter how impressive drones might appear, for now, they can become dangerous weapons in the future. The increasing popularity of drones and ease of usage is a reason for a number of privacy, security, and safety concerns. Hence the importance of finding a way for them to safely coexist with manned aircraft is growing increasingly urgent.</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Privacy threats</strong> – These mischievous spies in the sky can take pictures of individuals in their homes or other private locations. For example, a magazine like Splash News assembled about 200 photo sets of small episodes from the lives of the celebrities.  Drones have also been found in potentially unsafe areas such as urban locations and near airports.</li>\n<li><strong>Collisions</strong> &#8211; The increasing drone traffic may lead to midair collisions and loss of drone control. The threat of drones flying too close to commercial aircraft has prompted calls for regulation. For instance, in June 2019, Iran shot down a US military surveillance drone. The impact was the deterrence of major airline routes across the world to avoid attack by mistake on entering the country’s airspace.</li>\n<li><strong>The possibility of civil attacks</strong> &#8211; Drones are relatively cheaper in comparison to conventional weapons and yet can achieve far more destructive results. It is this easy-to-procure, easy-to-operate, and foolproof technology that makes it an attractive weapon of mass destruction. In a <a href=\"http://www.unidir.org/files/publications/pdfs/increasing-transparency-oversight-and-accountability-of-armed-unmanned-aerial-vehicles-en-692.pdf\">2017 study</a>, the United Nations Institute for Disarmament Research (UNIDR) said that the same characteristics that make drones attractive to militaries can make armed drones particularly susceptible to misuse. According to a report in the <a href=\"https://pennpoliticalreview.org/2018/11/eye-in-the-sky-the-militarization-of-drones-by-non-state-actors/\">Penn Political Review</a>, many armed groups such as the Houthi rebels, Lebanese Hezbollah, Hamas, Libyan militias, Ukrainian separatists, Kurdish Peshmerga, Al Qaeda in Syria, Colombian FARC are known to possess and use drones. Besides, the recent case of the Saudi Aramco oil facility drone attack proves how the expensive anti-missile detector systems turn ineffective for drones because of their low altitudes and slow speed.</li>\n<li><strong>Hacking</strong> &#8211; Drones in some ways are like flying computers carrying an operating system and software with programmable code that can be hacked. Drones have been developed to fly around seeking other drones, hacking into their wireless network, disconnecting the owner, and taking over the control.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3><strong>Safety Regulations by the Government</strong></h3>\n<p>Over time, regulators around the world have taken steps to prevent the possible misuse of drones.</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>China:</strong> Any drone weighing more than 15 pounds or flying higher than 400 feet requires a license from the Civil Aviation Administration of China (CAAC).</li>\n<li><strong>UK:</strong> The Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) mandates the registration for drones weighing more than a half-pound and prohibits flying above 500 feet.</li>\n<li><strong>U.S:</strong> FAA specifically mandates certain regulations such as Remote Pilot Certificate for commercial drones and registration for speeds up to 100 mph, daylight-only operations with appropriate anti-collision lighting, and the prohibition of UAV operation over non-participants under a covered structure or inside a covered stationary vehicle.</li>\n<li><strong>Europe:</strong> SESAR (Single European Sky ATM Research) is planning the roll-out of U-space foundation services, including e-registration, e-identification, and drone geofencing and full integration with manned aviation for the avoidance of interference and collision with commercial aircraft.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3><strong>Conclusion</strong></h3>\n<p>Drones are the spectacular gifts of technology. Their expansion at large scale is inspiring almost all the countries to develop their drones for different applications. A drone of today is a combination of all advanced technologies like microcontrollers, GPS, Wi-Fi, and sensor units. They need to work in a synchronized fashion which is giving business to many companies and start-ups. Besides, the profusion of drone kits, easy to learn programming languages, and course material on the internet makes it easy for novices to build and code a drone.</p>\n<p>The role of the government is vital in such a scenario to enforce the development of low-cost detection systems. Such systems should be advanced enough to spot malevolent drones and to build strong regulations. Lest the trespassers will misuse this precious technology.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/23/what-the-drones-of-future-can-do/\">What the Drones of Future Can Do</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 23 Apr 2020 18:00:24 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/What-the-Drones-of-Future-Can-Do.jpg","linkMd5":"76bd3dff0ea2b7fd636e4d2a12ab8560","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn84@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-26-135_db10c8655c539a8f.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/What-the-Drones-of-Future-Can-Do.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":24437,"destBytes":16566,"author":"Bharti Jain","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/What-the-Drones-of-Future-Can-Do-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn88@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-23-083_fa3261cc40d00337.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878180},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:51","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:51","title":"An Obscure Program Shows How FinTech Can Fight Stimulus Fraud","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=172860","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/22/an-obscure-program-shows-how-fintech-can-fight-stimulus-fraud/\" title=\"An Obscure Program Shows How FinTech Can Fight Stimulus Fraud\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/An-Obscure-Program-Shows-How-FinTech-Can-Fight-Stimulus-Fraud-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"fraud\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/An-Obscure-Program-Shows-How-FinTech-Can-Fight-Stimulus-Fraud-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/An-Obscure-Program-Shows-How-FinTech-Can-Fight-Stimulus-Fraud-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/An-Obscure-Program-Shows-How-FinTech-Can-Fight-Stimulus-Fraud.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Sen. Chuck Grassley offered a scathing critique of the federal government’s EB-5 <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/08/global-immigration-market-is-shaped-by-ai-tech-careers/\">immigrant</a> investor program and the potential for fraud when the Senate passed a bill last year reforming the three-decade-old program.</p>\n<p>The money from foreign investors — who in return for investing $500,000 to $1 million were promised green cards — was supposed to spark economic activity in <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2016/11/11/how-iot-and-citizen-science-can-tackle-urban-disadvantage-cl1/\">distressed</a> and rural <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/07/30/the-blueprint-for-building-a-smart-city/\">areas</a>. “All of a sudden, investment dollars intended for communities in need were being sucked up for glitzy projects in America’s most well-to-do neighborhoods,” Grassley wrote in an <a href=\"https://www.grassley.senate.gov/news/news-releases/op-ed-trump-s-changes-investor-visa-program-are-win-rural-america\">opinion piece</a> at the time.</p>\n<p>If that were true, the episode would be another disgraceful nail in the coffin of an American dream that’s stimulated hard work, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/20/how-voice-technology-is-changing-the-financial-industry/\">ingenuity</a> and brought the dreamers and ambitions of the global community to this country. A dream that made it the glorious example of human achievement it once was. Now, just like an <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/22/what-small-businesses-and-entrepreneurs-can-learn-from-the-college-admission-scandal/\">Ivy League</a> education, can your parents buy it for you?</p>\n<h2><b>What’s EB-5?</b></h2>\n<p>Understanding what went wrong with the EB-5 program, and how policymakers and the private sector adapted over the past decade, is instructive. It’s especially instructive, urgently so, as we deal with a new wave of funding, ostensibly managed by the federal government, but largely relying on the vetting and fraud-detection <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/16/does-artificial-intelligence-help-fight-financial-fraud/\">capabilities</a> of private financial services, from big banks to boutique investors.</p>\n<p>We could be entering a golden age of financial crime. Six trillion stimulus dollars have been injected into the financial system. That’s equivalent to 27 percent of the U.S.’s gross domestic product with more than half of it in cash sent out in only about three months. I can’t think of a larger structural change in the economy, ever. Even after Pearl Harbor, it took a year to get the vaunted World War II economy moving.</p>\n<h2><b>Follow the money</b></h2>\n<p>Early<a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/05/07/business/small-business-loans-coronavirus.html\"> criticism</a> of the spending has focused on where the money is going. The Small Business Administration allowed <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/18/growth-opportunities-available-during-and-after-pandemic-times/\">funds</a> to go to parts of the country that weren’t as hard hit, according to reports. It went to companies that many felt didn’t fit their idea of small main street shops. Billion-dollar <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/27/sports-franchises-could-qualify-for-loans-with-coronavirus-relief-bill.html\">sporting</a> franchises have allegedly been exploiting the “small” business loan. The list only starts there.</p>\n<p>Much of the money has already been lost to fraud and deception. In the banking sector the talk is all about “Know Your Customer.&#8221; Too late. There have been a huge number of projects to try to “know” the customer.</p>\n<p>But the silos of diverse and distributed data, incompatible technologies and processes within a firm, and poorly executed mergers have all undermined really understanding the customer. Banks lose insight into the customer&#8217;s behavior, sentiment, risk and expectations. Or whether even the customer is real, or honest.</p>\n<p>As we face a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2009/02/07/stimulus_package_stimulates_ne/\">long</a> road ahead in figuring out who inherits the debt and the associated risks from COVID-19 stimulus spending, what was Senator Grassley stewing over with the EB-5 jobs program?</p>\n<h2><b>Easy money</b></h2>\n<p>The EB-5 program started to grow in popularity after a previous series of reforms in 2005. Those reforms made the application process faster and easier. In 2015 alone, there were 17,691 applications for visas through the program.</p>\n<p>As EB-5 activity increased, so did abuse of the program, ranging from a couple <a href=\"https://www.sec.gov/news/press-release/2018-241\">accused of double-dealing</a> in their operation of a regional center for investment in California, to <a href=\"https://www.justice.gov/usao-vt/pr/four-men-indicted-fraud-charges-related-jay-peak-eb-5-anc-vermont-project-northeast\">developers in Vermont</a> accused of a “multi-year wire fraud scheme.”</p>\n<p>The massive investments into New York City property,<a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/16/opinion/hudson-yards.html\"> particularly Hudson Yards</a>, also showed how a program meant to bring brains and ideas into the country, may have been just getting Green Cards for kids with more money.</p>\n<p>There&#8217;s one particularly important lesson from the EB-5 program&#8217;s past troubles. The government and investors are quick to blame financial institutions. Due diligence and identifying fraud is a must.</p>\n<p>The Government Accountability Office wrote in a <a href=\"https://www.gao.gov/products/GAO-15-696\">2015 report</a> that “fraud risks in the EB-5 Program are constantly evolving, and continually identify new fraud schemes.” Like nearly all specialized conduits for high volumes of funds outside of normal channels, EB-5 is susceptible to bad actors.</p>\n<h2><b>How technology figures in</b></h2>\n<p>There are many stories of past scandals. But proponents have plenty of evidence to argue EB-5 works. It works when it&#8217;s effectively and correctly used. It is actually highly beneficial to the U.S. economy and job creation.</p>\n<p>Looking back on the<a href=\"https://www.politico.com/agenda/story/2017/05/09/investor-visa-program-kushner-jobs-000440/\"> jobs</a> created or saved by EB-5 during the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2013/07/08/5-startup-lessons-from-the-great-recession/\">Great Recession</a>, the 174,000 jobs the Department of Commerce discovered came from EB-5 represented 4.3 percent of U.S. job growth during that time.</p>\n<p>What few realized, and realize even today, is the role played by the rise of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/23/role-of-big-data-in-the-evolution-of-the-financial-industry/\">technology</a> to support fund administration, like the work of <a href=\"https://nesfinancial.com/\">NES Financial</a> in Silicon Valley, which has since been acquired by JTC Group.</p>\n<p>Purpose-built technology and processes enabled end-to-end process management beyond middle and back-office accounting and administration. Speed and quality have advanced. Early machine learning has delivered.</p>\n<p>Investors and fund managers need a clear picture of investment, compliance and impact information. They need to manage and report on large pools of small limited partners. That had to be done regardless of average investment size. Doing that established best practices, protected investors and helped limit fraud.</p>\n<h2>Getting to success</h2>\n<p>Senator Grassley may continue to be concerned about where the money goes. But the financial integrity of the program is now impressive. Past problems with fraud have not reemerged.</p>\n<p>Policy-making is now shoring up technology. Just recently a 2019 bill made many seemingly minor changes. But together they create myriad new opportunities. New chances to stop funds from going to bad actors. They also significantly increase the demands on the private and public actors involved.</p>\n<p>The 2019<a href=\"https://www.leahy.senate.gov/imo/media/doc/EB-5,%2009-25-19,%20EB-5%20Reform%20and%20Integrity%20Act%20-%20Summary.pdf\"> law established</a> an “EB-5 Integrity Fund” — funded by fees from investors — to be used by the Department of Homeland Security for international anti-fraud activities including audits and site visits.</p>\n<p>It required background checks of project principals; more disclosures to investors regarding business risks and conflicts of interest; and more oversight of projects and closer monitoring for securities compliance. The technology that&#8217;s now in place is key.</p>\n<p>It makes these requirements possible. And it allows them to work, and not choke oxygen off from the program with frustrating paperwork.</p>\n<p>A success? Actually, yes. But crime evolves quickly and so the test will be how long this success stays on target.</p>\n<h2><b>A menagerie of fraud</b></h2>\n<p>The government is not the only one shouldering the threat of fraud. That&#8217;s true, in both the EB-5 program and the more recent employment-based loans. It also falls on the various banks and contractors involved in the deals.</p>\n<h4>Here are a few examples of what could be coming our way.</h4>\n<p>Employee stuffing or shedding is a problem. For instance, it occurs when companies fraudulently expand their payroll to increase their fund eligibility. They may then get rid of staff and continue making ghost payroll payments to avoid violations of the loan agreement.</p>\n<p>There are shuck and clean operations. Organized crimes take over distressed firms for cash. It&#8217;s not just for fraud. These operations are a wholesale assault by establishing hundreds of shell companies. And this one troubles us the most.</p>\n<p>We should be very concerned about opening up the financial markets to easy access to crime. Entities are dangerous when ownership is the same, but control over it has changed without the bank knowing.</p>\n<p>Identity theft and elder abuse are the types of petty fraud that often plague government-assistance programs. They will continue but will <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2012/01/04/new-form-of-online-banking-fra/\">get worse</a>, supercharged by the $350 billion in US stimulus.</p>\n<p>Finally, cross-system abuse is another problem. This is where companies use multiple bank relationships to make multiple applications for the same staff pool and the same receivables. Don&#8217;t confuse this with legitimate companies trying to switch banks mid-process.</p>\n<h2><b>Due diligence</b></h2>\n<p>The government&#8217;s approach has a major weakness. The rush of stimulus occurring now is running through relaxed due diligence.</p>\n<p>“If the PPP loan is being made to an existing customer and the necessary information was previously verified, you do not need to re-verify the information,” the <a href=\"https://www.fincen.gov/sites/default/files/2020-04/Paycheck_Protection_Program_FAQs.pdf\">Department of Treasure advised</a> in April.</p>\n<p>And this creates a perfect account takeover scenario both from within and now from outside the country. Companies can change hands and shed half their employee base without anyone noticing. The scale and urgency of the coronavirus crisis measures are enormous.</p>\n<p>It’s understandable why the federal government has tried to get money out the door with limited friction. As we learned with EB-5, the risk of reducing friction is inviting fraud.</p>\n<h4>Technology has to be the answer again. It is the only answer frankly.</h4>\n<p>It will likely be years before we are able to account for the billions in COVID-19 stimulus funds distributed. The sooner we make smart investments in anti-fraud efforts, the more we will actually help legitimate companies. We can help companies hoping for a chance at recovery.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/22/an-obscure-program-shows-how-fintech-can-fight-stimulus-fraud/\">An Obscure Program Shows How FinTech Can Fight Stimulus Fraud</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 22 Jul 2020 21:01:01 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/An-Obscure-Program-Shows-How-FinTech-Can-Fight-Stimulus-Fraud.jpg","linkMd5":"58f40d1d240a979d61bf5ae134d9867b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn87@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-25-528_e3cd9e976ef3f5f0.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/An-Obscure-Program-Shows-How-FinTech-Can-Fight-Stimulus-Fraud.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":36580,"destBytes":33084,"author":"Simon Moss","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/An-Obscure-Program-Shows-How-FinTech-Can-Fight-Stimulus-Fraud-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn26@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-18-675_62ded21025417652.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195871170},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","title":"Vectice Raises $3M Revolutionizing Enterprise Management of AI and Data Science Initiatives","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=172984","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/16/vectice-enterprise-management-of-ai/\" title=\"Vectice Raises $3M Revolutionizing Enterprise Management of AI and Data Science Initiatives\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"160\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/vectice-1-300x160.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"vectice\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/vectice-1-300x160.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/vectice-1-900x480.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/vectice-1-260x139.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/vectice-1.png 1500w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Businesses have long begged for better enterprise management of AI and Data Information and Vectice is delivering on that promise, raising $3M for their data science initiatives.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.vectice.com/\">Vectice</a>, the cloud-based platform that powers data and AI initiative among F2000 Corporations in San Francisco, announced a $3M seed round co-led by Spider Capital and Crosslink Capital. Early executives from Salesforce, forming Global Founders Capital, have joined investors along with leading executives in the enterprise cloud and data science space.</p>\n<p>Vectice will use the capital, developing its enterprise AI asset management and collaboration software platform for data science teams and business stakeholders within the data-centric architecture arena.</p>\n<blockquote><p>Michael Neril, Founder and Managing Partner of Spider Capital, said, &#8220;We invested in the Vectice team because we believe their vision to provide a system of record for data science and AI teams is a critical missing piece for enterprises and F2000 companies to organize and scale their AI initiatives. We are excited about partnering with such a seasoned founding team whose platform will help power and optimize the significant AI investment initiatives among global corporations, which is expected to produce tens of trillions in incremental global GDP over the next one to two decades.”</p>\n<p>“Enterprises across many industries are launching AI initiatives that have the power to make a real impact on their businesses, but there are too few tools available to effectively build and scale AI applications,&#8221; says Phil Boyer, Principal at Crosslink Capital. &#8220;We believe there is a massive hole to fill in helping data science teams manage institutional knowledge and better collaborate with business groups, and that Vectice has the right team to do it. We are excited to support Vectice&#8217;s mission of accelerating AI adoption and impact in the enterprise.”</p></blockquote>\n<p><strong>Vectice</strong> was founded by enterprise entrepreneurs Cyril Brignone and Gregory Haardt, to revolutionize the way data science teams work and collaborate in their organization. Data has become a primary and permanent asset in organizations requiring precise management that will be delivered by Vectice.</p>\n<p>Data Science Teams will be enabled to better track these assets including AI models and institutional knowledge, collaborating with the rest of the enterprise. Brignone and Haardt will help businesses have a more positive and concrete impact on their AI investment.</p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;Gartner projects that 85% of companies&#8217; AI projects will fail to create measurable business value for the enterprise,&#8221; says Vectice co-founder Gregory Haardt. &#8220;What people are starting to realize is that leveraging AI to develop better products for their customers represents not only a technological challenge, but also an organizational and cultural challenge, and increasingly, a strategic imperative.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>&#8220;To be successful and become AI-driven, companies need a solution to track all their AI assets and promote collaboration to align business owners and AI owners,&#8221; says Cyril Brignone, Vectice’s co-founder &#38; CEO. &#8220;Successful AI-driven enterprises will focus on enabling their business to seamlessly consume AI and efficiently produce AI.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Modern data science teams produce a rising compilation of assets, ranging from data sets, features, models, and many notes and experiments. The implementation of any given application and its assets will be around, valid and permanent, long after the model is gone. All of these assets are typically siloed and reside in different systems, and are rarely linked together &#8212; creating a lag-time and link disconnect for the context of their creation.</p>\n<blockquote><p>As Brignone points out &#8212; &#8220;The results will show in analytics teams often spend a significant amount of time determining which datasets are &#8216;modeling ready,&#8217; what experiments have been run before, which features were used to train a given model, or trying to track down the &#8216;expert&#8217; on a particular domain.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p>Understanding how models feed into business initiatives is a whole other challenge for analytics teams, who often have to build up their understanding of business context by curating a collection of meeting notes, chat histories, shared documents, and emails &#8212; all with no unifying system.</p>\n<p>Vectice will provide the unifying system software, helping those teams tasked with transforming customer and market data to help their companies develop better products. The Vectice software system will be providing helps for teams in such diverse fields as self-driving cars, novel therapies and drugs, risk scoring models for financial services firms and software to optimize industrial and manufacturing facilities, and more.</p>\n<blockquote><p>&#8220;Enterprise data science teams are expanding rapidly in terms of sizes, the complexity of tasks, and impact on profitability. Until Vectice, there has been no true commercial solution for managing business processes, simplifying knowledge transfer, increasing collaboration, and ensuring traceability to maximize speed to market, ROI, as well as minimize the risk of AI initiatives,&#8221; says Monica Richter, former Chief Data Officer of Dun &#38; Bradstreet and Vectice investor.</p>\n<p>&#8220;Data science will be core to every job function for future successful enterprises,&#8221; says Chet Kapoor, CEO of DataStax and Vectice investor. &#8220;The Vectice software will enable enterprises to create an AI knowledge catalog and promote internal collaboration needed to successfully scale their AI initiatives.&#8221;</p></blockquote>\n<p><em><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-172999\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Vectice.png\" alt=\"Vectice\" width=\"1920\" height=\"817\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Vectice.png 1920w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Vectice-300x128.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Vectice-900x383.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Vectice-260x111.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Vectice-1536x654.png 1536w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 1920px) 100vw, 1920px\" /></em></p>\n<p><strong>The Founders</strong></p>\n<p>Cyril Brignone ​has 20 years of experience as an entrepreneur, R&#38;D leader, and sales executive in the field of IoT and enterprise solutions. He was the CEO of Arrayent, a B2B IoT enterprise platform with a successful exit in 2017. Co-founder/COO of Vator.tv, an online portal for emerging startups. Previously a research scientist manager at HP Labs.</p>\n<p>Gregory Haardt​ brings 20 years of experience delivering enterprise software &#38; data/AI-driven products. He was the CTO of Lattice Engines, a late-stage startup, acquired by Dun and Bradstreet, focused on AI-driven SaaS solutions optimizing marketing and sales; and a product leader at Salesforce, focusing heavily on data science/ML. Previously, he launched the first API gateway in the market at Apigee.</p>\n<h3>About Vectice</h3>\n<p>​Vectice&#8217;s mission is to revolutionize the way enterprise data science teams track their assets, manage knowledge, and collaborate with the rest of the business. We are building a platform-agnostic AI assets management and collaboration software for enterprises to successfully scale their AI initiatives.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/16/vectice-enterprise-management-of-ai/\">Vectice Raises $3M Revolutionizing Enterprise Management of AI and Data Science Initiatives</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 16 Jun 2020 16:00:19 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/vectice-1.png","linkMd5":"729c05b613a594ed8d46ca233846d612","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn68@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-26-900_4fae369697606f17.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/vectice-1.png","destWidth":1500,"destHeight":800,"sourceBytes":26550,"destBytes":7786,"author":"Brad Anderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/vectice-1-300x160.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn27@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-28-189_ea53f6b767525caf.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Vectice.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn81@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-09-718_16f4ce90f5090864.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195875667},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","title":"How Do You Create an Effective Journey Map for Your Customers?","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170443","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/11/how-do-you-create-an-effective-journey-map-for-your-customers/\" title=\"How Do You Create an Effective Journey Map for Your Customers?\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Effective-Journey-Map-for-Your-Customers-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"journey map for customers\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Effective-Journey-Map-for-Your-Customers-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Effective-Journey-Map-for-Your-Customers-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Effective-Journey-Map-for-Your-Customers.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Customers have a lot in mind when they land on a website to purchase a product or service. Some expect to find the product they have in mind instantly, while <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/31/trends-that-will-characterize-the-ecommerce-industry-in-2020-and-beyond/\">others conduct thorough research</a> before they purchase a product. Well, that’s not all. Some end up being fickle-minded and land with no product at all. Here is how to create an effective journey map for your customers.</p>\n<p>Landing in the &#8220;no product at all&#8221; category makes it all the more crucial for marketers to study different customer-mindsets in-depth and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/10/a-startup-guide-to-creating-an-ideal-customer-profile/?__cf_chl_jschl_tk__=721269e438db37a5778ea368c4dde03d741e100c-1587714837-0-AY1r0IpZasv-31WhcVggM0ljh6kxU3m12NbRA4mRT4nvlL097jdS4rrrs8Cts0VAMJyNCg74GOiRivOe0JmeEDUu7x_g1ymstEk7L11SojK85SmgfCoHnzAk66QE9GdrYiC-FlFbHUKDbyy0J7qU-1XxH094MdXMhAJmC0ylVT7oo_UFYcRfDC2uoOuEPTZilKh9i7WVskGVLA47zwe-WohN1Cp8430AIp4Qfze-JoJR9kNg8kvsfXaAtoCvaMkp1mVlzo3w9g4XhkzK0UK3whrd_M1RYhag9QA3TdZJawyt3F4PU-yGKsmGQr-H0jqW-XudFuMWfVIEZvG8sLDWoIQcClyNVgN0TQ71ZDtYYi8XJlaB98AtZJMpomdrM2RAbCg8MnbalhyDzhyU7tJW-a5J9GvkxwZA2ZT1J8IhytxX\">learn how to create your customer&#8217;s persona</a>.</p>\n<p>That’s why experts recommend studying situations from the customer’s point of view; to anticipate what will be their next course of action. Only then can a marketer get answers to the following questions:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">What is the root intent when one is<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/21/the-biggest-growth-marketing-trend-of-2020-radically-inclusive-advertising/\"> looking for a solution to a problem</a>?</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Why did the customer choose your competitor over you?</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">How did they feel for the first time after using a product?</li>\n</ul>\n<p>It will allow you to create a message that instantly captures attention, and finally work upon creating a customer journey map. But besides answering these questions, you need to follow the steps below to create a journey map successfully.</p>\n<h2>Understanding Your Customers</h2>\n<p>Do you come up with a lot of questions when trying to understand your customers?</p>\n<p>“What encourages my customers to buy the product?”</p>\n<p>“Why do they hesitate about purchasing our product?”</p>\n<p>“What concerns do customers have when thinking of purchasing the product?”</p>\n<p>Well, these questions arise <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2015/08/26/customer-journey-maps-marketing/\">when you do not understand your customer’s personality</a> as their journey begins with your brand.</p>\n<p>But to know this, to answer your “how to create a customer journey map” question, you need to understand them in the first place. And once you know them well, mapping the customer journey also becomes simpler.</p>\n<p>In this section, we’ll help you to understand your customers in four easy-to-follow steps. So, let’s deep dive now!</p>\n<h3>Step #1: Gather Key Data</h3>\n<p><i>Did you know that </i><a href=\"https://hbr.org/2016/09/know-your-customers-jobs-to-be-done\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><i>68% of customers</i></a><i> prefer version A to version B?</i></p>\n<p>But you’d only know this if you understand who your customers are.</p>\n<p>So, to understand customers, you need to gather crucial data about them. For this, use channels like:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Landing page performance data.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/23/cubo-ai-baby-monitor-a-smart-and-cute-way-to-protect-your-bundle-of-joy/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Customer support tickets</a> received via help desk software.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Incoming <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/05/marketing-automation-and-customer-service-how-are-they-connected/\">customer support chats</a>.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">CRM data such as customer’s name, email address, products or services purchased so far, and so on.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Search history of the knowledge base repository.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Customer behavior data via an analytics tool.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Current social media activities.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Such data allows your business to answer the questions mentioned above and, from there, help you customize and create a customer journey map.</p>\n<h3>Step #2: Speak With Colleagues</h3>\n<p>Another way to know your customers is to communicate with your co-workers who are in customer-facing roles every day. Communication with coworkers can include your support, sales, and marketing team insights on customer behavior during a product purchasing journey.</p>\n<p>While sometimes it may seem to be a vague attempt, experience tends to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/10/09/the-customer-care-bar-has-never-been-higher-so-brands-must-automate-to-keep-up/\">help organizations understand customers better</a>. Those who face customer requests every day would know:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Your target audience better.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">How many stages should the customer journey be divided into?</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">How customers might end up behaving during support, sales, or marketing process?</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Step #3: Send Out Surveys</h3>\n<p>Capture qualitative and quantitative data via surveys to get a holistic idea of a customer’s mindset. For this, send out customer satisfaction surveys and even Net Promoter Score (NPS surveys &#8212; like qualaroo dot com) to see where your brand stands.</p>\n<p>Plus, you learn whether the existing customers are satisfied with your services or not.</p>\n<p>Basically, the more data you collect, the more clarity you get on customers. And thus, it becomes easy to build an audience persona. In addition to this, you get to create a seamless customer journey mapping process.</p>\n<h3>Step #4: Develop a Target Audience Persona</h3>\n<p>With all the data in hand, time to develop a target audience persona. You can create personas like:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/16/how-mobile-apps-can-enhance-real-world-experiences/\">Customer motivations</a>.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Customer needs.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Customer’s hesitation towards your products.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Customer’s concerns <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/06/how-to-create-a-successful-crowdfunding-campaign-for-your-startup/\">related to the overall brand service</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>It’s no guesswork; you can build viable personas with the quantitative and qualitative data you gather. Once you create these personas, it becomes simpler to reach out to your target audience with effective marketing campaigns that end up increasing sales.</p>\n<h2>Understanding What Customers Go Through</h2>\n<p>You’ve understood how to identify customers and what affects them when interacting with your brand. It’s time that you understand their pain points at a deeper level.</p>\n<p><i>91% of customers</i><i> who are unhappy with a brand will leave without complaining &#8212; this is important to note.<br />\n</i></p>\n<p>As a customer-oriented organization like yours, you wouldn’t like to see this happening with your customers. That’s why you need to work upon the next customer journey stage to understand what your customers go through.</p>\n<p>Doing so will allow you to create excellent customer journey mapping examples for upcoming teams at work hassle-free.</p>\n<h3>Step #5: Consideration Phase</h3>\n<p>As you complete the process of creating a target audience persona, you should dive deeper to learn what all things do your customers consider before making a purchase.</p>\n<p>Make a list out their concerns, such as:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Is the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/23/ai-customer-service-will-save-you-money-but-it-might-cost-you-customers/\">service worth investing in</a>?</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Do I need the product?</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">What purpose <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/13/create-a-product-that-truly-delights-customers/\">will the product’s use serve me</a>?</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Are there any consequences I need to be worried about?</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">What if the quality isn’t worth my investment?</li>\n</ul>\n<p>These help you create counter solutions that help you answer &#8211; what is customer journey mapping and how to simplify it further.</p>\n<h3>Step #6: Purchase Phase</h3>\n<p>As you map out this phase, you see the steps your customers take to complete the product purchasing process. Here your organization can identify the problem areas and provide solutions to improve sales.</p>\n<p>Questions you should look into can be inclusive of:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When did the customer lose interest in the product?</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Should we cut-short the check out process?</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Should we add a live chat to create upsell opportunities?</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Should we trigger help when we see an exit-intent?</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Step #7: Retention Phase</h3>\n<p>Finally, track your retention strategies and monitor how many customers you successfully retain with their help. You’d learn about things that put your customers off and why they deviate from the purchasing process. This would allow your team to further upgrade existing strategies and actually retain customers.</p>\n<p>Track what strategies worked out fine and which ones ended up losing more customers, only to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/18/5-proven-strategies-to-reduce-customer-churn-rate/\">refine the existing marketing and retention strategies</a>.</p>\n<h4>In the End</h4>\n<p>It is important not just to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/14/5-questions-msps-should-ask-customers-to-determine-security-needs/\">understand the customers</a> but also to carve their journeys with your brand. However, learning about their thought process is crucial for your business. That’s why you need to follow the aforementioned steps to:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Understand your customers using:</b>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Different mediums to capture crucial data on customers</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Information collected through colleagues</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Surveys like customer satisfaction or NPS</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Target audience persona</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Understand customer thought process:</b>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When they consider reasons for investing in your product or service</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When they find compelling reasons to purchase your product</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When they find your efforts impressive and helps your brand to retain customers effectively</li>\n</ul>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Once understood, it becomes easier to come up with strategies that shape their journey with your brand. We hope these easy to follow steps help you create a customer journey map hassle-free.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/11/how-do-you-create-an-effective-journey-map-for-your-customers/\">How Do You Create an Effective Journey Map for Your Customers?</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 11 Jun 2020 21:00:11 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Effective-Journey-Map-for-Your-Customers.jpg","linkMd5":"77325dd22e2cb4162888468b35d76d35","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn3@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-25-444_6fc023055242e9a7.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Effective-Journey-Map-for-Your-Customers.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":32730,"destBytes":22770,"author":"Vineet Gupta","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Effective-Journey-Map-for-Your-Customers-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn55@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-17-651_7bbf1f758a264c00.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195875577},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"Global Immigration Market Is Shaped By AI, Tech Careers","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169580","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/08/global-immigration-market-is-shaped-by-ai-tech-careers/\" title=\"Global Immigration Market Is Shaped By AI, Tech Careers\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/AI-Tech-Careers-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"Global Immigration Market Is Shaped By AI, Tech Careers\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/AI-Tech-Careers-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/AI-Tech-Careers-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/AI-Tech-Careers.jpg 747w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>When economist Thomas L. Friedman published his international best seller “The World Is Flat” in 2005, he wasn’t making a counter scientific argument. No, Friedman’s work examined what we also sometimes term a borderless world – one that is intimately connected by technology, that eliminates the barriers between people. What’s more, Friedman’s view actively engages many of today’s most widespread business tools, from workflow software to offshoring and international streamlined supply chains.</p>\n<p>Friedman’s work put a microscope to what it means to be a global society and specifically a global economy, but there are factors that his work couldn’t predict. In particular, Friedman’s work couldn’t foresee the recent changes in immigration policy that determine worker movement and that continue to transform the professional and technological landscape. Recent changes to immigration rules significantly favor those working in the tech sector who are developing the tools that make our world flat.</p>\n<h3>Remote First Isn’t Enough</h3>\n<p>In an unusual moment, one in which all types of businesses are attempting to operate remotely, it seems natural that all businesses should be developing in a remote first fashion. Focusing on remote operations would likely keep business costs down by reducing infrastructure and allow companies to take advantage of top talent across the globe. Workers wouldn’t need to immigrate and could just work from wherever they were in the world. As we’ve seen, though, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/07/remote-first-why-isnt-every-company-boundaryless/\">most businesses aren’t boundary</a> free. Instead, they rely on abundant local talent and cheap real estate to operate, elements that are no longer reliably available because of regional competition.</p>\n<p>Of course, even a few years ago, it made sense that businesses didn’t prioritize remote work, especially at a global level. It was one thing for local team members to work from home with reliable infrastructure, but it was much harder to consistently connect with international workers, especially those in less developed parts of the world. And that’s without accounting for the added difficulty of working across time zones, something businesses generally prefer to avoid among high level workers. What norms of years past overlook, though, is the exponential development of digital tools.</p>\n<p>All of these changes add up to our present circumstances: faced with more competition for top workers and expensive real estate, coupled with improved digital tools, companies could be remote first, but they’ve already invested too much into being place-bound. That means that companies need to get workers to wherever they’re operating. As such, they’re highly reliant on immigrant labor, leaving businesses subject to international policy changes and competing countries – not just competing businesses.</p>\n<h3>Industries Driving Immigration</h3>\n<p>What businesses are most reliant on immigrant labor to be successful? Historically, it’s been low paying jobs in food service and healthcare, and while that hasn’t necessarily changed, immigration policy has, making it harder for these workers to move between countries. The outlook is brighter in the tech sector, though, which now leads the way in driving professional immigration patterns.</p>\n<p>One sector that’s fueling immigration is Fintech, the subsector of banking that merges technology and finance. It has <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2012/11/14/making-online-payments-truly-mainstream/\">made online payment systems mainstream</a>, and it’s precisely the field’s relationship to banking that gives it so much power. Backed by enormous amounts of capital, these companies have the money to sponsor high paying tech jobs for skilled immigrants. Other companies in the tech sector have been similarly successful, though it’s been harder for tech startups to sponsor the types of jobs governments issue visas for.</p>\n<p>Another key consideration in the competition for skilled technology workers is the fact that more industries than ever rely on at least a small contingent of these professionals. From healthcare to industrial concerns, every field has some degree of digital integration, a backroom of IT professionals or an app that needs tending. Though much of this work is outsourced to software firms and other support companies, demand for this class of workers is greater and more spread out across industries than anyone might have predicted.</p>\n<h3>Understanding The New Rules</h3>\n<p>Given that even tech companies don’t adhere to a remote first philosophy and are up against fierce competition for top workers, it’s critical that they understand the rules that shape our connected world and these vary widely by country. In the UK, for example, Brexit has left companies reeling, trying to understand their new, cut-off place in the world, but the news isn’t all bad. The UK’s new immigration system uses a points-based system prioritizes professional skills, along with a minimum salary, with skilled workers offered additional points through an employer-led system. All employers need to do is sponsor a work visa; workers can then <a href=\"https://immigrationlawyers-london.com/\">identify sponsor companies</a> to support their immigration application.</p>\n<p>While the UK prioritizes immigration for skilled tech workers, in the United States, tightened visa restrictions are holding tech companies back, preventing them from competing for top industry talent. Whether looking for tech workers who understand <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/13/is-it-time-to-implement-iot-in-the-warehouse/\">industrial IoT for manufacturing</a> or professionals who can provide cloud support for healthcare, the United States is likely to fall behind in the competition for talent.</p>\n<h3>Will Immigration Change Tech Hotspots?</h3>\n<p>Given changes in immigration policy and the need for businesses to recruit global workers, should we expect to see changes in where tech talent clusters? Experts believe so. Silicon Valley, for example – among other American technology hotspots – are likely to face a shortage of skilled workers needed to push innovation. In fact, US-based companies were already looking to move away from the area, shifting to cities like Phoenix that are more affordable. But relocating won’t be enough, especially while the US continues to block workers from majority-Muslim countries. The entire country is cut off from major talent streams.</p>\n<p>At the same time that the US is actively blocking tech entrepreneurs from immigrating, London’s tech sector has been performing well <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/31/vc-funding-in-2020-what-investors-look-for-in-startups/\">attracting substantial VC funding</a>. If UK-based companies can demonstrate that they have access to a disproportionate quantity of top talent, companies there could attract additional funding that would compound their advantages. With more money, they can create more sponsored positions, further securing their industry dominance.</p>\n<p>We also shouldn’t discount Canada in the competition for top talent. Historically, Canada hasn’t attracted much VC capital and isn’t known for its tech dominance, but Toronto has seen the most growth in technology jobs in North America over the last five years. The country is also fast-tracking visas for tech workers and welcoming subsidiaries of international technology companies.</p>\n<p>Competition for global tech workers raises another question: where are they all coming from? India ranks at the top of the list, but countries like Pakistan, Turkey, and Iran also supply many of these workers. The UK is also likely to see an influx of skilled workers from parts of Eastern Europe, workers who were permitted free movement into the UK prior to Brexit.</p>\n<h3>Is There A Balance Between Immigration And Remote Work?</h3>\n<p>Technology jobs may direct the flow of workers around the world right now, but is there a balance between promoting remote work and encouraging workers to immigrate to innovation hubs? The next few years could determine the answer to this question.</p>\n<p>The most likely balance for tech companies trying to work within contemporary immigration policy is that they will sponsor jobs at the upper echelons, those who would, within the UK’s new immigration scheme, easily meet the points criteria. Meanwhile, workers lower down in tech operations are more likely to remain remote, especially as global infrastructure and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/30/best-collaboration-tools-to-manage-remote-workers/\">remote collaboration tools</a> improve. Technology jobs undoubtedly move people, but they won’t move everyone.</p>\n<p>The earth may not be flat, but the world – the space in which we all work and connect, in which we do business – absolutely is. Thomas Friedman may not have been able to predict future political fluctuations, but even fifteen years ago, he had a clear grasp of how technology already had and would continue to bring us closer together.</p>\n<p>From remote work to highly skilled technology careers, we’re all working more closely together than ever before, even if much of that interface takes place through screens.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/08/global-immigration-market-is-shaped-by-ai-tech-careers/\">Global Immigration Market Is Shaped By AI, Tech Careers</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 08 Apr 2020 12:35:53 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/AI-Tech-Careers.jpg","linkMd5":"d82b093a9067c919f73a3d81b0333c3a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn56@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-24-426_f26fd86bf816ba11.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/AI-Tech-Careers.jpg","destWidth":747,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":44954,"destBytes":19546,"author":"Frank Landman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/AI-Tech-Careers-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn44@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-18-079_de8c7a67e08e36ee.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878785},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","title":"5 Technologies a Trucking Business Must Be Aware Of","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169341","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/25/5-technologies-a-trucking-business-must-be-aware-of/\" title=\"5 Technologies a Trucking Business Must Be Aware Of\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/5-Technologies-a-Trucking-Business-Must-Be-Aware-Of-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"trucking business\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/5-Technologies-a-Trucking-Business-Must-Be-Aware-Of-300x200.jpg 300w,
