+0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/The-Best-Digital-Marketing-Strategies-for-Startup-Businesses.jpg","linkMd5":"278c1f1288f90f3ee120780cec6b92cc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn15@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-27-128_7bc69f5bb6d07178.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/The-Best-Digital-Marketing-Strategies-for-Startup-Businesses.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":27434,"destBytes":22150,"author":"Sahin Alom","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/The-Best-Digital-Marketing-Strategies-for-Startup-Businesses-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn24@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-18-998_c6c8936b692f7f3d.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/AI-Change-the-Future-of-SEO-300x182.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn10@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-09-886_8317a242c7cc0886.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195871186},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","title":"Brands Flock to Voice Search as 2020 Goes “Contactless”","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173502","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/26/brands-flock-to-voice-search-as-2020-goes-contactless/\" title=\"Brands Flock to Voice Search as 2020 Goes “Contactless”\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Brands-Flock-to-Voice-Search-as-2020-Goes-%E2%80%9CContactless%E2%80%9D-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"voice search 2020\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Brands-Flock-to-Voice-Search-as-2020-Goes-%E2%80%9CContactless%E2%80%9D-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Brands-Flock-to-Voice-Search-as-2020-Goes-%E2%80%9CContactless%E2%80%9D-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Brands-Flock-to-Voice-Search-as-2020-Goes-%E2%80%9CContactless%E2%80%9D-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Brands-Flock-to-Voice-Search-as-2020-Goes-%E2%80%9CContactless%E2%80%9D.jpg 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>As businesses in every industry scramble to improvise “contactless” strategies for interacting with customers and delivering products and services.  The adoption of voice search technology <a href=\"https://adage.com/article/brand-playbook/how-use-voice-tech-during-covid-19/2260006\">has rapidly accelerated</a> for everything from internet searches and shopping to ordering food from a table in a restaurant. Here is how brands flock to voice search as 2020 goes &#8220;contastless.&#8221;</p>\n<h4>Whether a business is completely virtual or maintains brick and mortar locations, it seems clear that voice technology will alter the business model much sooner than previously thought.</h4>\n<p>Every industry from food to financial services to retail and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/21/is-voice-search-the-next-big-travel-technology-trend/\">even travel</a> are being impacted by voice search. Voice search may even be a solution to the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/17/why-our-supply-chain-failed-us-during-the-pandemic/\">supply chain problems</a> that embroiled the country during the pandemic.</p>\n<p>Before the COVID-19 pandemic, the majority of brands paid little, if any, attention to their identity and positioning on voice search.</p>\n<p>Even fewer were embracing voice technology that transformed their fulfillment and delivery processes. Peter Peng, the CEO of <a href=\"https://www.jetson.ai/\">Jetson</a>, which helps brands build their voice search presence, has seen a surge in companies pivoting to voice in light of COVID: “The global pandemic has changed the way that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/12/new-niches-for-startups-created-by-the-covid-19-pandemic/\">people shop and do business</a>. Virus-related restrictions have led to increased demand for ‘touchless technology’ — or e-commerce options that employ technology allowing consumers to maximize their shopping experience while minimizing physical contact and the need to touch screens.”</p>\n<p>As we look to the future of a world filled with less “touch”, it’s important for every company to at least review how their <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/14/biotechnology-benefits-and-risks-at-a-glance/\">brand is represented</a> even during a simple voice search, and whether their brand is even searchable at all.</p>\n<h3><b>Voice Could Become a Windfall for Fast Movers</b></h3>\n<p>It’s important to remember that every major shift in the industry throughout the centuries has brought with it even more opportunity than cost.</p>\n<p>The competition for attention through voice search is currently significantly less dense than it will be in another two to three years when there is higher adoption from brands. According to Peng, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/24/how-logistics-leaders-can-use-ai-right-now/\">brands adopting voice technology</a> quickly will have the first-mover advantage which will lead to better placement in search results and higher customer acquisition, especially for smaller brands.</p>\n<p>Says Pend, “Right now, relatively few small businesses are offering voice ordering. That means that if your business is proactive about getting on board with what we call the “voice revolution,” you’re far more likely to get top billing on voice search results.”</p>\n<p><strong>To take advantage of the &#8220;contactless future&#8221; a brand should be looking at two key questions: </strong></p>\n<ol>\n<li>How can I optimize my presence to be found via voice search? Which is to say, do you have a voice search profile and is it consistent with the rest of your branding?</li>\n<li>How can I offer a voice solution for actually purchasing and receiving my product or service? Are we currently selling any of our products directly on voice assistant tools (ie. Amazon Alexa)?</li>\n</ol>\n<h3>What Industry is Seeing the Fastest Voice Tech Switch?</h3>\n<p>We also asked Peter which industry he has seen the fastest growth of voice technology in. His response? Food. “Without a doubt, the food industry has been one of the fastest-growing areas for voice ordering. Jetson boasts over 10,000 food-related vendors on our platform.”</p>\n<p>Indeed as many cities begin allowing restaurants to reopen, voice technology for placing orders at your table seems to be an integral part of keeping both employees and customers safe.</p>\n<h3><b>Where to Start with Voice</b></h3>\n<p>For brands who have not yet explored a voice strategy and are now forced to adapt rapidly, understanding the technology and process may appear daunting. Peter Peng recommends starting with strategy before getting lost in the tactical implementation: “The first step would be to consider your company’s long-term goals. What do you want for your company, and how could voice search and voice commerce be part of that plan?”</p>\n<h4>How Does Voice Fit Your Plan?</h4>\n<p>Once you know how voice technology fits into your overall business strategy (ie, will you only be implementing a voice search identity or also using voice technology in other areas of order fulfillment, customer service, etc), you can tackle each component individually.</p>\n<p>There are a number of tools available, including Jetson, that streamline the process of creating a brand’s “voice profile” and optimizing it for maximum searchability and lead generation while making it affordable for businesses of all sizes. Being able to sell your products directly on voice assistant platforms also creates a new stream of revenue that many ecommerce players currently overlook.</p>\n<h4>The next step is to tackle your brand identity on voice search as quickly as possible.</h4>\n<p>Consumers are not waiting for brands to adapt, they are <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/02/how-voice-search-is-changing-the-future-of-shopping/\">already flocking to voice search</a> at a higher rate than ever due to the unique circumstances of the times. Neglecting your voice search identity could be costing business money each day. Making sure your brand is searchable and optimized for maximum placement is the first priority to tackle.</p>\n<h3><b>Avoid Being Intimidated by Larger Brands Already Doing Voice</b></h3>\n<p>Peng points out that the biggest mistake most companies make is shying away from <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/02/how-voice-search-is-changing-the-future-of-shopping/\">voice search</a> because of the intimidating capabilities of larger brands. “A lot of companies will see big corporations like Wal-Mart or Starbucks offering voice-powered commerce options and will think, ‘oh, that’s cool, but they’re a lot bigger than me. Or maybe, &#8220;I can’t afford to invest in voice technology.’” Indeed the costs of voice capability for ecommerce have reduced significantly with the proliferation of technology and tools that make it a viable option for anybody.</p>\n<h3>Media planning company, Comscore, predicted that by 2020, 50% of all online searches will be voice.</h3>\n<p>That prediction was made prior to the pandemic that accelerated the trend further. The <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/07/impact-of-voice-search-on-seo-rankings-in-2020-5-tips-to-optimize/\">benefits of optimizing your brand</a> for voice technology run the gamut from increased exposure and online traffic to shortening your sales cycle. The sales cycle now makes it easier for customers to buy from your brand to even demonstrating your commitment to customer safety and concerns during uncertain times.</p>\n<p>Many services, including Jetson, even make it seamless for a brand to list and sell products directly on voice assistant platforms such as Amazon Alexa, Google Voice, and others, and they’ll facilitate the sale and process the payments for you.</p>\n<h4>Adapting to the shift to voice technology quickly will level the playing field for companies of all sizes.</h4>\n<p>All companies or varying sizes will be able to gain the first-mover advantage and secure valuable real estate that will become increasingly competitive just twelve months from now. Making the investment at a lower cost now is likely what is going to set apart the most visible brands of the future.</p>\n<p>Image Credit: alleksana; Pexels</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/26/brands-flock-to-voice-search-as-2020-goes-contactless/\">Brands Flock to Voice Search as 2020 Goes “Contactless”</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 26 Jun 2020 14:01:02 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Brands-Flock-to-Voice-Search-as-2020-Goes-%E2%80%9CContactless%E2%80%9D.jpg","linkMd5":"f936e74ed46a154096c6a4c619dd005a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn72@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-19-833_f0906d0a2bdd3921.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Brands-Flock-to-Voice-Search-as-2020-Goes-%E2%80%9CContactless%E2%80%9D.jpg","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":853,"sourceBytes":65791,"destBytes":34754,"author":"Brad Anderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Brands-Flock-to-Voice-Search-as-2020-Goes-%E2%80%9CContactless%E2%80%9D-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn11@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-12-435_307cc20e1418755b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195874681},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:56","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:56","title":"5 Post-Pandemic Changes to Expect in the Workplace","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171325","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/09/5-post-pandemic-changes-to-expect-in-the-workplace/\" title=\"5 Post-Pandemic Changes to Expect in the Workplace\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/5-Post-Pandemic-Changes-to-Expect-in-the-Workplace-300x185.jpeg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"changes in workplace\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/5-Post-Pandemic-Changes-to-Expect-in-the-Workplace-300x185.jpeg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/5-Post-Pandemic-Changes-to-Expect-in-the-Workplace-260x160.jpeg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/5-Post-Pandemic-Changes-to-Expect-in-the-Workplace.jpeg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Disrupting businesses in every sector of the economy and infecting nearly 7 million people at the time of this writing &#8212; with 400,000 deaths globally. The coronavirus pandemic that sprung up December 2019 has had negative <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/22/from-polarization-to-open-learning-how-technology-can-help-us-beyond-covid-19/\">effects on businesses across the world</a>, and the economy as a whole.</p>\n<p>The stay-at-home orders that have been mandatory in several countries have caused our work lives to be affected in so many ways, from working in open offices and interacting with coworkers daily to working from home and having to rely on <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/30/3-ways-you-can-empower-your-remote-employees/\">video conferencing apps</a> for <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/29/how-iot-embraces-smart-communication/\">effective communication</a>.</p>\n<p>These many changes in our current work-life have left many of us wondering whether it&#8217;ll have any lasting effects on our work-lives once the pandemic is over and the current lockdown measures are eased. How will how our new work lives proceed from here?</p>\n<p>The many effects the pandemic will have on our current work-life include:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<h4><b>Higher Prioritization of workers&#8217; health.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The current attention that employee well-being has been garnered recently by organizations and employees themselves will surely increase. We will surely see employee health, wellness, and well-being being of greater importance in a post-pandemic situation.</p>\n<p>We can predict more sick day allowances and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/16/5-healthcare-tech-trends-worth-keeping-an-eye-on/\">health initiatives </a>like the full health checks and examination of employees before they enter their workplaces.</p>\n<p>After the pandemic and for a short period of time, signs may be posted to remind everyone to wash hands and perhaps limit how they give handshakes and hugs, and to maintain personal space.</p>\n<p>To avoid overcrowding, keycards and sensors will monitor your whereabouts throughout the day and alert you whenever you&#8217;re in close proximity to another individual.</p>\n<p>In the long run, contact-tracing apps for co-workers may also become part of the work-life experience to avoid the spread of future diseases and infrared body temperature scanners before access to the office building. These <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/30/big-data-as-a-double-edged-sword-in-the-fight-against-covid-19/\">contact-tracing apps</a> might even show areas with high coworker traffic similar to apps like Waze.com.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<h4><b>Remote work</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/18/how-to-achieve-tech-powered-collaboration-in-the-era-of-remote-work/\">role in-office collaboration</a> has to play in a company is overwhelming as it is important for building personal bonds and relationships between coworkers and boosting employee productivity, it is also essential for the creation of company culture, but what is more important is the safety of an organization’s employees.</p>\n<p>The importance of remote working at a time like this has shown as many organizations have looked too remote working as a means of sustaining their businesses and to keep them up and running.</p>\n<p>In a post-pandemic situation, it&#8217;s likely that we see the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/14/how-to-ensure-high-productivity-of-your-remote-workers/\">retention of remote working</a> as a means of working for non-essential workers by organizations. However, office and in-house collaboration are surely not going away and higher-ranking workers may still work in-house.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<h4><b>Restructuring of office spaces.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The fundamental design of office workspaces and offices will surely be altered. More personal space, elevator capacity limits, and demarcating spots to stand in elevators to limit physical contact.</p>\n<p>More <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/15/5-work-culture-trends-that-improve-employee-productivity-and-satisfaction/\">space between desks</a> with coworkers sitting on every other seat, partitioning may be installed to reduce the risk of spreading diseases, fewer chairs in conference rooms, private cubicles or offices, there&#8217;s an endless list of how the overall design of the office space might evolve in a post-pandemic situation.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<h4><b>Business travel and conferencing.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The coronavirus pandemic will definitely have a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/30/building-a-startup-culture-that-encourages-wellness/\">lasting effect on meetings</a> as a whole, we should expect fewer conferences and curtailed travel plans in the post-pandemic era. Essential meetings will still hold, but ones with lesser importance will be moved to emails, phone calls, and video conferences.</p>\n<p>We should expect employees will only have physical meetings when a project is crucial and cannot be done via video conferencing. Conferences, meetings, and conventions will be halted for the foreseeable future with meetings that aren&#8217;t necessary would now be done with video conferencing.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<h4><b>Work shifts and office hours.</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Organizations will have gradual returns and might not require most people to come back until there’s widespread testing, treatment, or a vaccine. Work shifts might be put in place to ensure there&#8217;s a limited amount of employees in the workplace at any given time.</p>\n<p>Limiting the number or set of people required to come to the office has been important for employee safety as it reduces the chances of them getting the disease. Only requiring essential workers to come to the office might be the norm in a post-pandemic situation.</p>\n<h5><b>In Conclusion</b></h5>\n<p>How business around the world is going to be <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/06/06/deep-work-vs-shallow-work-how-your-distracted-habits-could-cost-you-your-career-in-the-new-economy/\">changed due to the current global pandemic</a> is unknown as we cannot predict the future with a 100 percent accuracy but by making educated guesses we might know how the impacts of the pandemic might shape our work life.</p>\n<p>Workplaces may have significant changes in the long run, these may include new seating arrangements and the addition of building materials that discourage the spread of germs.</p>\n<p>In order to reduce the risk of spreading future diseases, it&#8217;s a great time for new technology and innovation. We will need to be provided with access to rooms and elevators without employees having to physically touch a handle or press a button. Innovations in automatic door sensors, automatic sinks, soap dispensers, and maybe even voice-activated elevators.</p>\n<p>Measures will surely be put in place to reduce the spread of any future diseases and pandemics to guarantee the general public and employee safety.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Andrea Piacquadio; Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/09/5-post-pandemic-changes-to-expect-in-the-workplace/\">5 Post-Pandemic Changes to Expect in the Workplace</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 09 Jun 2020 18:00:16 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/5-Post-Pandemic-Changes-to-Expect-in-the-Workplace.jpeg","linkMd5":"d4820fff60fdb523149b23e848d38b35","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn64@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-21-412_5a353fe7ffb2796c.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/5-Post-Pandemic-Changes-to-Expect-in-the-Workplace.jpeg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":41495,"destBytes":34796,"author":"Misan Etchie","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/5-Post-Pandemic-Changes-to-Expect-in-the-Workplace-300x185.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn44@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-20-237_d75766c8f6a4a31e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195876045},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","title":"What is the Future of SMS Marketing?","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171689","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/07/what-is-the-future-of-sms-marketing/\" title=\"What is the Future of SMS Marketing?\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/What-is-the-Future-of-SMS-Marketing-300x185.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"future of sms marketing\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/What-is-the-Future-of-SMS-Marketing-300x185.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/What-is-the-Future-of-SMS-Marketing-260x160.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/What-is-the-Future-of-SMS-Marketing.png 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Over the past two decades, SMS marketing has become so ingrained in our lives that we don’t even pause to consider what life was like without it. Despite that, marketers still don’t regard the platform as highly as email or social media marketing. What a mistake. Here is what the future of SMS marketing is all about.</p>\n<h3>Fundamental channels for digital marketing.</h3>\n<p>While <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/11/14/4-email-personalization-tactics-that-are-sure-to-get-clicks/\">email has long been a fundamental</a> channel for digital marketing campaigns. The hype around social media marketing is well deserved, if only for its powerful targeting and personalization capabilities.</p>\n<p>SMS marketing, on the other hand, offers <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/06/guerrilla-marketing-growth-hacking-your-startup/\">equally valuable yet unsung benefits</a> for marketing communications. If you’ve hesitated to adopt <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/10/19/if-you-arent-using-sms-in-your-business-nows-the-time-to-start/\">text messaging as a marketing channel</a>, perhaps it’s the best time to reconsider.</p>\n<h2><b>Why It’s the Best Time to Adopt SMS Marketing</b></h2>\n<p>Although SMS is now considered as a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/01/how-to-enhance-your-omnichannel-strategy-with-sms-messaging/\">powerful addition to an omnichannel strategy</a>, it wasn’t always an attractive digital marketing platform. It was too expensive for marketers to take it seriously. Plus, it lacked any semblance of a playbook, which email already had.</p>\n<p>Today’s digital landscape, however, has paved the way for text messaging to be a marketing platform that’s not just viable but actually worthwhile. In particular, these changes have driven its success as a medium for marketing:</p>\n<h3><b>Peak Mobile Penetration</b></h3>\n<p>The first SMS-ready mobile phone was introduced to the market in 1993. But, the rapid adoption of mobile phones came towards the late 90s as cellular networks became more stable and even allowed cross-network messaging.</p>\n<p><strong>By 2000, 12% of the world’s population</strong><strong> had mobile phones, and that number has consistently increased since the</strong>n.</p>\n<p>Today, there are over five billion unique mobile subscribers worldwide. The stat means over 65% of people all over the world have a mobile device of some kind.</p>\n<p>Although the number of smartphone users is increasing steadily, approximately <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/330695/number-of-smartphone-users-worldwide/\">30% of mobile subscribers</a> don’t have a smartphone with internet access. But, each one is capable of receiving text messages.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_171691\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-171691\" style=\"width: 719px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-examples.png\"><img class=\"wp-image-171691 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-examples-719x719.png\" alt=\"SMS examples\" width=\"719\" height=\"719\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-examples-719x719.png 719w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-examples-300x300.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-examples-160x160.png 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-examples-40x40.png 40w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-examples-60x60.png 60w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-examples.png 1140w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 719px) 100vw, 719px\" /></a><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-171691\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><em>SMS examples with different country codes.</em></figcaption></figure></p>\n<h3><b>Development of Regulations</b></h3>\n<p>In the early days of SMS marketing, there were barely any regulations to guide marketers in using it appropriately. It was essentially a free-for-all platform for any business that could afford to use it. Spam was prevalent and branded text messages were considered a nuisance.</p>\n<h4>Data Privacy Regulations</h4>\n<p>Several regulations have already been developed and widely accepted across the world to encourage not only respectful practices but also data privacy protection.</p>\n<p>These regulations have made people more open to receiving promotional text messages. In fact, nowadays, 75% of consumers say they don’t mind getting texts from brands for as long as they opt in.</p>\n<h3><b>Lower Costs</b></h3>\n<p>In the early 2000s, a single SMS could cost anywhere from ten to twenty cents, depending on the operator. For businesses engaged in mass texting, the costs quickly piled up. But, over time, costs were driven down by several factors. Not the least of which was the popularity of social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook, and instant messaging software like Viber and Messenger.</p>\n<p>Nowadays, there are innumerable marketing packages that make SMS a cost-effective platform. Some of them could even bring costs down to one cent per text. Keywords and shortcodes involve additional costs.</p>\n<p>Keywords are unique phrases that your customers can use to interact with your company while shortcodes are the numbers to which those keywords are sent. In the text “Send HELP to 66586,” HELP is the keyword and 66586 is the shortcode.</p>\n<p>In the past, a business looking to seriously engage in SMS marketing would need to make use of dedicated shortcodes, which allow for unlimited use of keywords. Those could cost anywhere from fifteen to thirty thousand dollars per year. Nowadays, there are mobile marketing firms that share shortcodes across multiple businesses through a keyword rental model. Each keyword rental could cost anywhere from five to twenty-five dollars per month.</p>\n<h3><b>Software Advancements</b></h3>\n<p>Earlier, the SMS gateways that enabled computers to send, receive, and manage text messages were physical appliances that merely allowed marketers to ramp up their text messaging efficiency. Nowadays, SMS gateway applications allow you to do all that without the cost of procuring specialized hardware.</p>\n<p>Advancements in marketing applications have also led to the wide acceptance of SMS as a marketing medium. While there are SMS-specific apps for businesses with limited needs, there is also powerful software that allows you to manage entire marketing campaigns across multiple channels, all using a single platform. Using such applications, you can use SMS as part of an omnichannel strategy alongside email, social media, and search advertising.</p>\n<h3><b>Omnichannel Adoption</b></h3>\n<p>In recent years, consumers have shown a clear preference for omnichannel brand communications. Not only are purchase rates higher for companies that use three or more channels, but retention rates are also much higher. While businesses available on only a single channel keep approximately 33% of their customers, retention rates are as high as 89% for companies with omnichannel engagement.</p>\n<p>There’s no denying that a large part of the success of omnichannel campaigns is the proper use of SMS marketing. Not only are consumers more willing to receive text messages from businesses, but those who opt into SMS along with other channels are much more likely to convert. This rapid adoption and undeniably positive acceptance of omnichannel marketing make the future of SMS even more exciting.</p>\n<h2><b>The Benefits of SMS Marketing</b></h2>\n<p>Advancements in the digital marketing landscape have definitely paved the way for SMS to be a valuable marketing platform. To brands and marketers, these are the most significant benefits that are unique to the medium:</p>\n<h3><b>It Doesn’t Require an Internet Connection</b></h3>\n<p>Unlike email, it doesn’t take an internet connection or even a smartphone to receive text messages. That means your customers will receive your message no matter where they are and what kind of phone they’re using. In the US, that gives you access to<a href=\"https://www.pewresearch.org/internet/fact-sheet/mobile/\"> 96% of the total adult population</a>.</p>\n<h3><b>It is a Widely Accepted Medium</b></h3>\n<p>A vast majority of digital consumers are eighteen to forty-nine years old. Of them, <a href=\"https://www.pewresearch.org/internet/fact-sheet/mobile/\">99% have access to SMS-enabled mobile devices</a>. But, the success of SMS marketing is not only because of cellphone penetration but also the acceptance of texting as a natural means of communication. In fact, among Americans younger than fifty, <a href=\"https://news.gallup.com/poll/179288/new-era-communication-americans.aspx\">text messaging is the most popular form of communication</a>.</p>\n<h3><b>It is Always Within Reach</b></h3>\n<p>According to research by <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/cherylsnappconner/2013/11/12/fifty-essential-mobile-marketing-facts/#53e7aee37475\">Morgan Stanley</a>, 91% of adults keep their mobile devices within reach at all times. In fact, Americans check their phones <a href=\"https://nypost.com/2017/11/08/americans-check-their-phones-80-times-a-day-study/\">every 12 minutes</a> while they’re awake. That means the average American engages with their cellphone about 80 times a day.</p>\n<h3><b>It is Easy to Consume</b></h3>\n<p>Since phones are always within reach and text messages are typically around 160 characters long, marketing messages on SMS are easily consumed. That is probably the reason why it enjoys open rates of over 98%. In contrast, email open rates average 14% across all industries. Additionally, about 90% of text messages are read within the first three minutes of receipt.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-statistics.png\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-171692 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-statistics.png\" alt=\"SMS statistics\" width=\"816\" height=\"418\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-statistics.png 816w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-statistics-300x154.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-statistics-260x133.png 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 816px) 100vw, 816px\" /></a></p>\n<h3><b>SMS Messaging Encourages Quick Responses</b></h3>\n<p>Because text messages are easy to consume, recipients are also more likely to respond. In fact, the average <a href=\"https://www.business2community.com/infographics/email-marketing-vs-sms-marketing-stats-infographic-02021390\">response rate for SMS is 45%</a> while email response is only 6%.</p>\n<p>SMS is also the preferred means of receiving coupons intended for both online and in-store redemption because of its convenience. In fact, redemption rates for SMS-based coupons are <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/cherylsnappconner/2013/11/12/fifty-essential-mobile-marketing-facts/#53e7aee37475\">ten times higher</a> than printed versions.</p>\n<h2><b>The Benefits of Combining SMS With Other Channels</b></h2>\n<p>Email has been the long-established medium for digital marketing. It isn’t going anywhere, no matter how prevalent SMS marketing becomes. But, text messages differ vastly from emails not only in format but also in how they are consumed. For that reason, SMS undoubtedly has its own role to play in a truly omnichannel marketing campaign.</p>\n<p>While email excels because of its ability to communicate extensive and dynamic content, it can’t beat the timeliness of SMS. That makes text messaging the perfect complement to email. Time-sensitive offers, for example, perform best on SMS. Text messaging is also an effective way to drive your audiences to your email content.</p>\n<p>SMS and email make up the critical platforms of an omnichannel campaign. But, it doesn’t really end there. Depending on the nature of your business and the needs of your audience, using these two platforms alongside others like push notifications, social media, search advertising allows you to be truly omnipresent without being invasive.</p>\n<p>By combining available platforms and allowing each one to play their own roles, you’re able to provide seamless customer experiences that enhance both sales and brand affinity.</p>\n<h2><b>SMS Marketing is Bound to Become More Valuable</b></h2>\n<p>Though SMS has undoubtedly proven its worth as a marketing channel, changes and improvements that will inevitably come will make it an even more effective channel. Some of them might include:</p>\n<h3><b>Improvements in Personalization</b></h3>\n<p>As it integrates more seamlessly with other channels and becomes ingrained in more business processes, SMS marketing will enjoy a broader scope of data. Add to that the inevitable advancements in artificial intelligence and marketers will clamor over SMS for the extent to which they can personalize messages.</p>\n<p>More data and targeting options also mean better automation capabilities. Marketers will be able to set more specific triggers, and machine learning capabilities can lead to even more personalized campaigns. With SMS’ current performance as a marketing medium, these advancements in personalization and automation will undoubtedly lead to even more improved engagement rates and, ultimately, better sales.</p>\n<h3><b>Developments as a Primary Support Channel</b></h3>\n<p>Through AI-driven enhancements, SMS could become the primary means by which customers can access support. Today, chatbots can already accurately answer frequently asked questions. As they become more informed and more intuitive, they could be integrated into more business processes that will inevitably enhance customer experiences.</p>\n<p>Imagine entering a busy boutique and finding a top you like but not in the size you wear. Instead of waiting for your turn to ask the sales associate to check for your size, you could simply send a text message and receive a response in an instant. As SMS bots become even more integrated into business processes, they could even instruct sales associates to pull out the item you asked for, track you down within the store, and assist you through the rest of the buying process.</p>\n<h3><b>Usefulness in Various Industries</b></h3>\n<p>SMS marketing is currently most beneficial to ecommerce businesses. But, innovative marketers are quickly finding new applications for it and open up possibilities to harness its power in non-traditional ways.</p>\n<p>Pretty soon, its benefits as a medium will encourage more and more industries to adopt it. That, in turn, will further contribute to its wide acceptance and performance as a marketing platform.</p>\n<h3><b>Integration With More Channels</b></h3>\n<p>The most common way to use SMS is to complement email campaigns. With thoughtful planning and preparation, some of the more advanced marketers also successfully use it alongside other channels like push notifications, instant messaging, social media, and search.</p>\n<p>However, through data-driven insights and advancements in software, SMS should soon integrate more seamlessly with a wider variety of channels in order to provide a truly personal and cohesive experience that’s consistent across all platforms.</p>\n<p>Today, some of the most powerful marketing software are already making some of these scenarios possible. Nevertheless, apps will continue improving and further increase SMS’ value.</p>\n<h2><b>Best Use of SMS Marketing</b></h2>\n<p>Businesses have adopted SMS for a wide variety of applications. Here are some of the best ways to use text messaging effectively:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Post-Purchase Notifications: </b>The period after a shopper completes a purchase is crucial to customer retention. Apart from a comprehensive confirmation email, send them SMS alerts as you process their order, ship their item, and confirm that they have received their package. Doing so will make a second purchase much more likely.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Time-Sensitive Alerts: </b>The short format of text messages and the proximity of mobile phones to its users make it the perfect medium for time-sensitive information that you want your audiences to act on right away. These include product launches, sales promotions, and other limited-time offers or events.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Gift Distribution: </b>Impressive redemption rates make SMS an ideal platform for distributing digital coupons and virtual gifts. With marketing automation platforms, you can even send gifts automatically through relevant triggers like birthday and purchase milestones.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Customer Support: </b>The quick and direct nature of SMS makes it an excellent option for providing fantastic customer service. SMS bots can receive and answer basic questions and then escalate more complex or sensitive concerns to a highly trained support team. That allows support teams to focus only on critical issues while giving all customers access to timely assistance.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Accessing Information: </b>Apart from providing assistance, you can use SMS to offer quick and easy access to information. Practical applications include confirming availability, providing store locations, and offering product recommendations.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Drive to Site: </b>Through SMS, you can drive your customers to your site to boost traffic, promote new content, or get them to re-engage. This is especially useful for users that haven’t visited in a long time and have stopped opening emails.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Order Placements: </b>If you have limited SKUs, SMS could be a good way to accept orders. When fully automated, this could provide an effortless ordering experience to your customers, which could lead to better retention and more sales.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Appointment Setting &#38; Reminders: </b>Businesses can allow their customers to book appointments via SMS. You can use the same platform to automatically send appointment reminders.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Identity Verification Processes: </b>Two-factor authorization via SMS is not a new concept. But, as data privacy and security becomes more imperative to the success of businesses, more industries will surely adopt text messaging for identity verification.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Feedback Gathering: </b>Remarkable SMS response rates also make it an excellent platform for feedback gathering. Through text messages, you can ask your customers to answer simple surveys. You can even use SMS bots to ask questions as a human market researcher would.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3><strong>Conclusion</strong></h3>\n<p>The current success of SMS marketing shows that it is here to stay. As <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/22/predictive-analytics-how-to-turbocharge-your-digital-marketing-strategy/\">brands’ innovative use of the channel</a> drives its growth and wide acceptance, it should become even more valuable. Ultimately, it will take its rightful place alongside email as an indispensable medium for marketing communications.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/07/what-is-the-future-of-sms-marketing/\">What is the Future of SMS Marketing?</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 07 Jul 2020 20:01:05 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/What-is-the-Future-of-SMS-Marketing.png","linkMd5":"9ebb0de06cec7b54354299acb2bbf942","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn11@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-27-287_bc98a7a3cac2b337.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/What-is-the-Future-of-SMS-Marketing.png","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":387516,"destBytes":15342,"author":"Laura Narusyte","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/What-is-the-Future-of-SMS-Marketing-300x185.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn100@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-14-195_ac9540194fd24b8b.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-examples-719x719.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn59@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-12-973_37309b0a13befd8f.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/SMS-statistics.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn3@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-10-782_f63b2f87262ce9f4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195874397},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:01","title":"5 Ways Technology is Transforming the Real Estate Industry","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=168389","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/19/5-ways-technology-is-transforming-the-real-estate-industry/\" title=\"5 Ways Technology is Transforming the Real Estate Industry\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/5-Ways-Technology-is-Transforming-the-Real-Estate-Industry-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"&#34;real estate&#34;\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/5-Ways-Technology-is-Transforming-the-Real-Estate-Industry-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/5-Ways-Technology-is-Transforming-the-Real-Estate-Industry-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/5-Ways-Technology-is-Transforming-the-Real-Estate-Industry.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>As the Internet becomes more ingrained in every facet of our work and personal lives, industries that primarily rely on person-to-person interactions have started to adopt new technology. Adopting new technology allows companies to free up valuable time and resources for future development. Here are five ways technology is transforming the real estate industry.</p>\n<h3>Some fields have begun state-of-the-art technology adoption more slowly than others.</h3>\n<p>One market that’s been slow to change is the real estate industry &#8212; but under the surface, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/02/the-challenges-and-opportunities-for-automation-in-the-real-estate-industry/\">high tech is completely transforming</a> the industry.</p>\n<h3><strong>The real estate industry is massive.</strong></h3>\n<p>In the United States alone, the land and housing market <a href=\"https://realtyna.com/blog/how-big-is-real-estate-industry/\">contributes over $2.7 trillion</a> each year to the U.S. economy. Tech companies see the potential of this market and are developing products that help buyers, sellers, and investment firms. Here are five of the most innovative ways that technology is helping real estate professionals and their customers right now.</p>\n<h2><b>1. Repetitive Task Management</b></h2>\n<p>Realtors often fill out the same paperwork over and over across multiple properties. That eats into valuable time that could be spent networking, working leads on social media, or researching new properties. Entrepreneurs have studied these inefficiencies, looking to create products that automate redundancies.</p>\n<p>According to Roy Dekel, CEO of real estate software company <a href=\"http://www.setschedule.com/\">SetSchedule</a>, task automation is becoming increasingly critical for real estate transactions. &#8220;We see these technologies throughout the real estate ecosystem. They include email and drip campaigns for marketing, automated appointment scheduling, technologies that target and communicate with prospects, and even automation in the commercial space with portfolio management. These small process changes can make a huge difference in business strategy, prioritization, efficiency, and service.&#8221;</p>\n<p>Using these small process changes to create a robust difference in strategy is especially true for asset management research. Asset management research usually involves finding the monetary value of every property in a <a href=\"https://jboitnott.com/the-cost-of-home-ownership-and-where-youre-probably-overspending/\">real estate</a> company’s portfolio and creating informative spreadsheets of that data. Tech companies have made tools that continuously monitor these property valuations, updating information in near-real-time without manual input.</p>\n<h2><b>2. Online Real Estate Marketplaces</b></h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/06/real-estate-vs-stocks-which-has-a-better-return/\">Real estate</a> markets have always relied on in-person meetings between brokers and potential buyers. But technology has allowed for online marketplaces to be relatively secure and trustworthy, even for industries like real estate. Online marketplaces make it easy to see a list of all the homes that fit your preferences without leaving your living room.</p>\n<p>These sites provide things like virtual tours that you can view on your smartphone. Even better, some of these marketplaces don’t even require interactions with in-person real estate agents at any point during the process. Tech-enabled brokers let people buy with the assistance of a broker but without the steep commission fees.</p>\n<h2><b>3. Price Refinement</b></h2>\n<p>Brokers often rely on just a few neighborhood-level factors and house features to make price estimations for properties. But with technologies like artificial intelligence (AI) and precise mathematical modeling, they can estimate prices more accurately than before.</p>\n<p>These upgraded models take into account everything from historical crime statistics to noise levels and nearby markets and schools. Experts like Bernard Marr, a futurist and technology adviser for businesses across the world, <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/bernardmarr/2020/02/03/the-top-proptech-trends-6-technologies-disrupting-the-property-and-real-estate-industry/\">believe that</a> usage of this tech will let homebuyers make more intelligent real estate purchases in the future.</p>\n<h2><b>4. Smart Devices for Property Management</b></h2>\n<p>The Internet of Things is the collection of non-personal computer devices connected to the Internet. This includes everything from Google Home and Amazon Alexa to smart sensors that don’t require human input to transmit data. These devices are just starting to be integrated into rental properties. They provide unique opportunities for tenants and landlords to transform the landscape of property management.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/04/the-key-to-smart-home-success-safety-and-security/\">Smart doorbells and locks</a> give tenants enhanced security by seeing exactly who’s at the door without having to go near that door. They also give landlords a way to monitor potential security risks. Smart thermostats intelligently change the temperature in rental units, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/04/3-ways-you-can-benefit-from-smart-home-technology-today/\">lowering heating and cooling costs</a> significantly while maintaining the right temperature for tenants.</p>\n<h2><b>5. Personalized, Targeted Real Estate Ads</b></h2>\n<p>High-end customers might do a home search in a certain area but can&#8217;t find exactly what they want. Ad tech is changing this, however. With ad management know-how, real estate brokers can now target perfect customers for new on-the-market homes.</p>\n<p>Experts like John Hall, co-founder of scheduling app Calendar and marketing expert, <a href=\"https://www.inc.com/john-hall/as-industry-transforms-marketers-must-become-visionaries.html\">believe that</a> personalized ads will change how real estate marketing is done. For example, you might target ads based on several bathrooms, proximity to other houses, and other metrics.</p>\n<p>The real estate industry has historically been slow to change. However, with cost-effective technology not only helping real estate agents and brokers but also homebuyers, space is adapting faster than ever. Moreover, whether it&#8217;s machine learning algorithms or innovative software, real estate is entering a new era that may bring more profit for everyone.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/19/5-ways-technology-is-transforming-the-real-estate-industry/\">5 Ways Technology is Transforming the Real Estate Industry</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 19 Mar 2020 16:00:38 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/5-Ways-Technology-is-Transforming-the-Real-Estate-Industry.jpg","linkMd5":"1328c3d4cacaf35969275b04e9a5c54f","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn51@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-24-989_cb1ee2d9daba612d.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/5-Ways-Technology-is-Transforming-the-Real-Estate-Industry.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":74230,"destBytes":80728,"author":"John Boitnott","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/5-Ways-Technology-is-Transforming-the-Real-Estate-Industry-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn39@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-24-509_2ef8f2109e2d544d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195881449},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:51","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:51","title":"How Display Ads Got Smart—and Keep Getting Smarter","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=175802","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/12/how-display-ads-got-smart-and-keep-getting-smarter/\" title=\"How Display Ads Got Smart—and Keep Getting Smarter\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Display-Ads-Got-Smart-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"How Display Ads Got Smart—and Keep Getting Smarter\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Display-Ads-Got-Smart-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Display-Ads-Got-Smart-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Display-Ads-Got-Smart.jpg 747w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Advertising has been an embedded feature of our world for many decades now, providing brands with the opportunity to introduce new products to consumers and giving consumers a chance to discover new products. But over the years, advertising has evolved considerably. Today’s advertisers have access to an abundance of different platforms, analytics tools, and potential approaches to use to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2011/12/06/how_to_make_ads_that_dont_suck/\">get their target market’s attention</a>, and consumers oftentimes encounter advertising where they least expect it—or don’t even notice when they’re being advertised to.</p>\n<p>One of the most interesting areas of development in this field has been with display ads. In just a couple of decades, display ads have gone from being a straightforward way to advertise on the internet to one of the most sophisticated and “smartest” forms of advertising in the world.</p>\n<p>So how did display ads get “smart,” and how could they get smarter from here?</p>\n<h3>Display Ads: The Basics</h3>\n<p>Let’s start with <a href=\"https://www.marceldigital.com/blog/what-is-display-advertising-a-display-ads-101\">a briefer on display advertising</a>. Display advertising refers to targeted advertisements that are used to promote a product, service, or brand; these ads are distributed across a wide network of different “publisher” websites, usually making an appearance in the headers, in sidebars, and in other locations. Display ads can come in many forms; you’ve likely seen a mix of text-based ads, images, and videos as you’ve browsed the web. Additionally, display ads come in different shapes and sizes; you’ve likely encountered some dominating ads that practically take over the rest of the page, and you’ve likely missed some innocuous ads that were hard to notice.</p>\n<p>There are many different display advertising “networks” that advertisers can leverage to promote their brand. Google’s Display Network is one of the largest, reaching 90 percent of all internet users across millions of different websites and blogs. With a set budget and the right advertising material, you can easily put together a campaign from scratch and start advertising. Most display advertising partners will charge you based on the number of clicks your ad generates, with a set “cost per click” (CPC) based on your industry, your competition, and your targets.</p>\n<p>The quality and accessibility of display ads have increased dramatically since their inception. In other words, display ads have gotten “smart.” But what factors have led to these developments, and what kinds of developments could we see in the future?</p>\n<h3>Factors Pushing for Display Advertising Advancement</h3>\n<p>Why have display ads become more sophisticated? We can consider these push factors as influencing their development:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Profitability. </strong>Traditional forms of advertising have been expensive; you have to pay money to erect a billboard or print and distribute a flyer. But in the digital space, placement is relatively cheap. Tech companies and publishers can charge for advertising space without excessive costs, offering low prices to advertisers while still making a decent profit for themselves.</li>\n<li><strong>Mutual gains.</strong> Every link in the display advertising chain gets some kind of benefit. Advertisers can tap into a vast network they otherwise wouldn’t be able to touch. Display ad networks get to make a stream of income. Publishers can generate revenue from their popular online content. And consumers get to see ads for things that are important to them.</li>\n<li><strong>Audience expansion.</strong> The internet has grown remarkably in the past three decades, with millions of new popular websites and billions of new users to browse them. Over the years, display advertising has been accessible to a bigger and bigger audience. Accordingly, the potential money to be made has increased.</li>\n<li><strong>Ties to other technology.</strong> Display ad networks are often tied into other forms of advanced technology. For example, if your company hosts websites for millions of users, incorporating advertising into those websites is relatively easy; this is why <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2007/08/20/text_and_banner_ads_on_amazon/\">major tech brands like Amazon</a>, Google, and Facebook have all gotten into the display advertising game.</li>\n<li><strong>Display ad competition.</strong> Of course, there are dozens of major players in the display advertising market, and thousands of other significant options to choose from. This fierce competition drives innovation, and forces companies to invest in new technology and more advanced features to offer their customers.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Audience Targeting</h3>\n<p>One of the biggest ways display ads have gotten “smarter” is with their ability to target different types of audiences. Any marketer can tell you the secret to an effective campaign is learning to target the right people; if you choose the right target demographics for your messaging, and capture their attention with a well-placed, well-written message, you’ll stand a good chance of converting them.</p>\n<p>Over the years, display ads have gotten much better at targeting the right types of people. Sophisticated display ad networks (<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2008/10/16/google_adwords_display_ads/\">like Google AdWords</a>) offer you the ability to choose target consumers based on demographic factors, like age, gender, level of income, level of education, and dozens of other factors. But beyond that, you can make your audience even more specific with things like:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Remarketing. </strong>Through remarketing, you can specifically target users who have visited your website in the past. These are commonly used to remind people of the products they’ve seen on your site, and attract them back to complete their purchase (or research).</li>\n<li><strong>Interest. </strong>Google and other major tech companies keep detailed consumer profiles, so you can target people who have expressed interest in a specific type of product in the past. You can even target people based on the types of terms they’ve searched for in the past, and the types of websites they’ve visited recently.</li>\n<li><strong>Lookalike. </strong>One of the most impressive ad targeting features available today is targeting a “lookalike” audience. Here, you’ll upload an existing marketing list, and provide display advertising to people who resemble the types of people on that list.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Data Analytics</h3>\n<p>Display ads have also advanced significantly in the realm of data analytics. Advertisers can now log into a dashboard to monitor and analyze how their ads have performed in the recent past. How many ads have been served? How many impressions are they getting? How many clicks are they getting? How are those visitors behaving once they reach your website? How much did you pay for this traffic? Are those users converting? You can also conduct an AB test with different variations of your ad to compare their performance; which features are most likely to attract the right people to your site?</p>\n<h3>Ease of Access</h3>\n<p>Online advertising used to be a complex endeavor, but these days, signing up for a display advertising account and starting your first campaign is easy. Major display ad networks want to attract advertisers of all shapes and sizes—including mega-corporations who want to reach millions of people and small-time bloggers who just want their <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/08/local-advertising-is-the-best-kept-secret-and-tech-can-help/\">first stream of local traffic</a>. Accordingly, they’ve designed platforms and products that can be easily understood—even if you’ve never run an advertising campaign in the past.</p>\n<h3>Budgeting and Costs</h3>\n<p>Display ads have always been affordable, except in highly competitive markets, but innovations in the industry have made it even more approachable for advertisers to set their budgets, understand their spending, and ultimately make better purchasing decisions.</p>\n<p>For example, in some platforms, you can set a firm budget of how much you want to spend in a given period of time. You might set a budget of $1,000 per week; if you do this, the platform can automatically optimize displays to help you get the most out of this budget.</p>\n<h3>The Future of Display Ads</h3>\n<p>Thanks in part to their constant competition, platforms like Google, Amazon, and Facebook are constantly refining and improving their display advertising networks. In the coming years, we’ll likely see display ads with even more sophisticated targeting, lower costs, and lower barriers to entry—all with smarter and more advanced analytics platforms to measure your results. We may even see altogether new forms of advertising emerge.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/12/how-display-ads-got-smart-and-keep-getting-smarter/\">How Display Ads Got Smart—and Keep Getting Smarter</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 12 Aug 2020 the day. I&#8217;ve dragged all types of coolers with me for years and only recently noticed that some now come with wheels &#8212; including YETI. I&#8217;ve used the YETI brand for their stay-cold drink containers.</p>\n<p>I recently purchased the <a href=\"https://www.yeti.com/en_US/hard-coolers/tundra-haul-cooler/10060200000.html#start=1\">YETI Tundra Haul Wheeled Cooler</a> to see how it worked for all of our on-the-go needs. Here&#8217;s my review.</p>\n<h2>About the Wheeled Cooler</h2>\n<p>This wheeled cooler from YETI is a beast in terms of its size and durability. Even with nothing in it, the cooler weighs nearly 40 pounds! It will hold about 55 pounds of ice and 45 cans of beer. To hold that much, the cooler has to be strong yet versatile to easily move around.</p>\n<p>The cooler comes in a wide range of colors. These include white, desert tan, ice blue, charcoal, navy blue, seafoam, river green, and coral.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-173574\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/YetiTundraHaulCoolerInside-300x200.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"600\" height=\"400\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/YetiTundraHaulCoolerInside-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/YetiTundraHaulCoolerInside-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/YetiTundraHaulCoolerInside-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/YetiTundraHaulCoolerInside.jpg 1500w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></p>\n<h2>Unique Features</h2>\n<p>The Tundra Haul uses YETI&#8217;s trademarked Fatwall Design. The cooler has extra thick walls that YETI says offers up to two inches of insulation to keep everything inside as cold as possible for as long as possible.</p>\n<p>The cooler is also rotomolded, which means it is made as one single complete body versus seams that can lead to structural stress and then potential leakage. Another feature is its hinge system, which the company guarantees won&#8217;t break, along with durable handles for when you have to lift it into and out of a vehicle.</p>\n<h2>Pros and Cons</h2>\n<p>There are many pros when it comes to this incredible cooler on wheels. Besides its durability, storage capacity, and color choices, it can actually keep ice frozen for up to three or four days. You would be lucky to have ice still frozen on the same day with the typical ice chest. Plus, when I tried blocks of ice, they were still more than half frozen seven days after putting them in the cooler.</p>\n<p>You can also customize your YETI cooler with a collegiate or MLB logo. This is an additional fee but something that sets your cooler apart from all the others at the campgrounds or beach.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-173576\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/YETITundraWhite-300x300.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"600\" height=\"600\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/YETITundraWhite-300x300.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/YETITundraWhite-719x719.jpg 719w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/YETITundraWhite-160x160.jpg 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/YETITundraWhite.jpg 1500w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></p>\n<p>The cons are that there is stiff competition from other manufacturers with similar products where the ice can last up to 10 days. Others may not last as long in terms of freezing capability but they are significantly cheaper. However, I haven&#8217;t tested these other coolers so I&#8217;m not sure if they are as durable.</p>\n<p>Another con is that this particular model of cooler is not compatible with YETI&#8217;s dry goods basket or divider.</p>\n<h2>Where to Buy</h2>\n<p>Priced at $399.99, you can buy the YETI Tundra Haul Wheeled Cooler from the company&#8217;s website as well as other retailers like Amazon. Numerous sporting goods and camping retailers also carry this rugged cooler on wheels.</p>\n<h2>Overall Thoughts</h2>\n<p>Although it is expensive for wheeled coolers &#8212; there are still more expensive ones. The YETI is backed by high-quality materials and a solid reputation for developing long-lasting products. With such durability, I know this cooler will last for years, saving me from buying a new one every summer.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" back pain.” </span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">The mattress boasts a blend of features, such as zoned lumbar support and Tencel Temperature Regulation, that enhance your hours of restful sleep each night, so that you wake up feeling rejuvenated. </span></p>\n<h3 class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">The ReadWrite team got a chance to sample the Helix Midnight Luxe and we loved it. Check out our full feature on this awesome mattress:</span></h3>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">Studies show that the average American sleeps for about a third of their lives. It can pay dividends to do the research and make sure that you get the right mattresses for your family. </span></p>\n<h4 class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">Here are some of the features that make the Helix Midnight LUXE an exceptional option:</span></h4>\n<ul class=\"ul1\">\n<li class=\"li1\"><span class=\"s1\"><b>Luxe Upgrade Features: </b><span class=\"s3\">Zoned lumbar support<span class=\"s1\"> technology provides a cradle for your body by creating a softer zone under your shoulders and more rigidity under your hips. The multi-layered design is optimized to give you the right support for your body type without being too soft. </span></span></span></li>\n<li class=\"li1\"><span class=\"s1\"><b>Tencel Temperature Regulation: </b>No more nights of waking up in a cold sweat thanks to the ultra-breathable cover that keeps the mattress cool to the touch.</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">Mattresses are a constant in our lives; you can travel far and wide, but at some point you’re going to return and curl up in your bed and expect a great night of sleep, and it matters what material the bed is made out of.</span></p>\n<h4 class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">Here is a breakdown of the 6 internal layers wrapped in a cooling cover:</span></h4>\n<ul class=\"ul1\">\n<li class=\"li1\"><span class=\"s1\"><b>Ultra Breathable Cover  &#38; Pillow Top:</b> This Tencel cover enhances breathability and moisture-wicking, while the premium pillow top adds an extra layer of luxurious comfort.</span></li>\n<li class=\"li1\"><span class=\"s1\"><b>Gel Visco Support Layer: </b>High-density gel is infused into the memory foam layer of the mattress to perfectly cup your body. Because the mattress is made from premium materials you do not ever need to flip over or rotate the mattress.</span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">The Helix Midnight Luxe is one of those rare combinations of top of the line quality combined with affordability. Helix offers a 100-night sleep trial as a guarantee that you will love your mattress, as well as a 15-year limited warranty. So there&#8217;s little to no risk in giving this mattress a shot. </span></p>\n<h4>Helix Add-ons</h4>\n<p>Helix&#8217;s product suite doesn&#8217;t stop at mattresses. They also produce their own pillows, bases, foundations, and bedding. In addition to the Helix Midnight Luxe, the ReadWrite team sampled the Helix Adjustable Base to experience the full Helix sleep package.</p>\n<p>The <a href=\"https://helixsleep.com/products/adjustable-base\">Helix Adjustable base</a> has three main functions:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Zero Gravity and Memory Settings: </strong>You can simulate &#8220;weightlessness&#8221; by adjusting the head and foot positions, reducing stress on your back and spine. The memory setting allows you to save specific positions.</li>\n<li><strong>Head-Up &#38; Foot Adjustability: </strong>The entire frame is adjustable so you can adjust both head and foot positions. These settings can provide optimal reading, watching, and &#8220;anti-snoring&#8221; positions.</li>\n<li>3<strong>D Wave Massage Technology: </strong>This setting provides a light vibration on the head and feet positions. This should not be mistaken with a massage similar to what you&#8217;d receive in a massage chair as the mattress sits in between the motor and your body.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The assembly of the Helix Adjustable Base is a breeze and it provides a completely customized sleep experience. The position and memory settings are great however we thought the 3D Wave technology wasn&#8217;t entirely necessary. It takes nothing away from the experience but doesn&#8217;t add a ton as far as comfort.</p>\n<p>Overall the team was pleased with the Helix Sleep package.
