Ritchie","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-26-at-5.07.46-PM-300x220.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn24@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-16-605_248b16653a9a2988.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877519},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"Big Data as a Double-Edged Sword in the Fight Against COVID-19","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170476","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/30/big-data-as-a-double-edged-sword-in-the-fight-against-covid-19/\" title=\"Big Data as a Double-Edged Sword in the Fight Against COVID-19\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Big-Data-as-a-Double-Edged-Sword-in-the-Fight-Against-COVID-16-825x510-1-300x185.jpeg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"big data and COVID-19\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Big-Data-as-a-Double-Edged-Sword-in-the-Fight-Against-COVID-16-825x510-1-300x185.jpeg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Big-Data-as-a-Double-Edged-Sword-in-the-Fight-Against-COVID-16-825x510-1-260x160.jpeg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Big-Data-as-a-Double-Edged-Sword-in-the-Fight-Against-COVID-16-825x510-1.jpeg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Big Data has emerged as a leading technological advancement that is fueling our efforts to limit the spread of the novel coronavirus. At the time of writing, the world has seen 2,585,197 cases of COVID-19, and many countries are still waiting to hit their peak. Here is how big data as a double-edged sword in the fight against COVID-19.</p>\n<p>In such times, the efforts on the technological front to develop platforms to reduce its effects are ongoing with advancements in drug discovery, surveillance, and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/10/is-artificial-intelligence-the-ultimate-university-stimulus/\">tracking and tracing technologies</a>. Tech companies and governments are spending billions of dollars on damage control and in developing Big Data and AI-powered tools to help control this situation, such as surveillance drones and contact tracing apps.</p>\n<p>While these technologies show immense promise as a vertical to fight the spread of COVID-19, there are significant limitations and concerns that have come to light about the use of these technologies. The concern of false positives and panic concerns over privacy and security in the wake of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/04/13/unassisted-ai-video-surveillance-techniques-help-numerous-verticals-to-scale/\">high-tech surveillance</a> and the use of these technologies in the post COVID world has led to a lot of raised eyebrows.</p>\n<p>Despite this, tech giants such as Google and Apple are working in collaboration to help with contact tracing while the governments of the world, such as the US, UK, and even the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2017/09/16/gdpr-european-union-business-dl1/\">European Union</a>, are relying on such technologies to fight COVID-19.</p>\n<p>Let’s take a look at how Big Data is being leveraged in the fight against COVID-19, the limitations of the technology, and the rising concerns with regards to its <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/05/9-main-security-challenges-for-the-future-of-the-internet-of-things-iot/\">long-term use on privacy and security</a>.</p>\n<h2>How Big Data Is being Used To Fight COVID-19</h2>\n<p>Big Data has been hailed by experts as one of the leading resources in the fight against COVID-19. Experts have found uses for Big Data and Big Data analytics platforms for various purposes, such as surveillance in Smart Cities, for contact tracing, and vaccine development.</p>\n<h3>Smart Cities For Surveillance</h3>\n<p>Within smart cities, big data platforms are being used to identify the compliance of the population with social distancing measures. Surveillance data from sensors and cameras are also being analyzed to identify pedestrian traffic within areas.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2020/apr/03/uk-road-travel-falls-to-1955-levels-as-covid-19-lockdown-takes-hold-coronavirus-traffic\">Road travel has gone down by 73% in the UK</a>, to levels similar to those in 1955. The way smart city technology is being leveraged is going to be crucial in understanding the response of the population to government policies, and the pandemic as a whole.</p>\n<p>It can also help narrow down the focus on specific areas using Big Data analytics where these measures are being followed with significant lethargy. The rate of spread of the virus in these areas can then be corresponded to their response, helping us better understand the impact of social distancing and lockdowns in reducing the spread of the virus.</p>\n<h3>Artificial Intelligence For Vaccine Development</h3>\n<p>The coming together of Artificial Intelligence and Big Data platforms has improved our ability to dig through years of data to identify possible drugs already approved by the FDA for treating similar viruses. These <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/14/how-will-the-pandemic-impact-the-future-of-work/\">AI and Big-Data powered systems</a> can also help identify new molecules using this database to help us develop a vaccine quicker.</p>\n<p>This process of drug discovery is powered by modern technology is one of the reasons that illnesses today are much less fatal than they would be in the 1900s. In the case of COVID-19, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/12/robotics-and-big-data-are-transforming-nursing-4-key-insights/\">similar applications</a> of these technologies are going to be crucial to the efforts of scientists and medical experts to quickly develop and distribute vaccines.</p>\n<h3>Contact Tracing</h3>\n<p><a href=\"https://hbr.org/2020/04/how-digital-contact-tracing-slowed-covid-19-in-east-asia\">Contact tracing has emerged as a digital solution</a> that has been accepted universally with countries like Israel (<a href=\"https://github.com/MohGovIL/hamagen-react-native\">HaMagen</a>), Singapore (TraceTogether), and South Korea already using contact tracing platforms to locate, test, and isolate potential carriers of the novel coronavirus.</p>\n<p>Earlier this month, <a href=\"https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2020/04/apple-and-google-partner-on-covid-19-contact-tracing-technology/?subId3=xid:fr1587465086697agi\">Apple and Google announced a joint plan</a> to release an API for public healthcare providers that allows contact tracing apps from public health departments to be interoperable between Android and iOS devices.</p>\n<p>Moreover, the tech giants also announced the integration of this capability within their devices for the future to ensure wider accessibility.</p>\n<p>Contact tracing uses BLE technology to gather encrypted identifiers from other devices in its proximity and logs it. Each app’s user can flag themselves once they are tested positive for COVID, and every person who would have come into close proximity would receive an alert. All of this action is through the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2016/03/24/wi-fi-industry-standards-needed-sm4/\">encrypted proximity identifier</a> that they might have been potentially exposed, including time and date of when they were close to a carrier.</p>\n<p>This data can be used to identify not just potential carriers but also areas with higher virility rates, helping governments take area-specific actions by labeling them as red zones.</p>\n<h2>Limitations of Big Data</h2>\n<p>One of the limitations of Big Data and information gathering is the inability of these technologies to count for social causes. This means that while they might be great at gathering and analyzing numerical data (which isn’t necessarily true), the context of those trends being unavailable can result in poor decision-making.</p>\n<p>For example, in poor neighborhoods, especially in developing nations, people neglecting social distancing measures can result in law enforcement agencies to take stricter measures, increase fines and, and implement stricter consequences.</p>\n<p>While that’s one way to solve the problem, it might still be ineffective based on the initial reason for the negligence. For many people, social distancing is hard because they don’t have access to the same resources as others. Daily wage laborers are one such demographic and do not share the privilege of maintaining long-lasting social distancing, and this is something <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/30/cybersecurity-ensuring-sanity-in-smart-cities/\">surveillance technology even within smart cities cannot account</a> for.</p>\n<p>So while the data available is accurate, it does not point towards a good solution, and treating all data as homogenous can be a fatal mistake that experts can make.</p>\n<p>Secondly, critics of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/27/covid-19-jobs-data-and-machine-learning/\">Big data-based platforms such as contact tracing</a> apps highlight that the Bluetooth technology might be ineffective in understanding proximity contexts. For example, Bluetooth can be caught across walls and partitions. Even if you’re safely partitioned from a person who tests positive for COVID-19 via a wall &#8212; you’ll still get a notification for potential exposure as long as you’re in Bluetooth range.</p>\n<p>The action allows for false positives to occur and creates unnecessary panic within the population. Demonstration the idea here &#8212; is that you cannot depend on these technologies solely and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/08/big-data-in-the-telecommunications-ecosystem/\">require experts to weigh in</a> on the context of the data you’re analyzing to better come up with strategies based on that data.</p>\n<p>Lastly, the biggest limitation of big data platforms such as a contact tracing platform Is that they have to be opt-in. The kind of user penetration it requires 60%-80% is incredibly difficult to reach for the platform to be a success. The biggest <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/24/is-there-any-stopping-techs-big-four-from-monopolizing-user-data/\">trouble here is trust</a>. With recent debacles with regards to user data and privacy, people generally vary of such invasive platforms and might not opt-in for these services.</p>\n<p>While Google and Apple are working on device integration, most people, in fact, don’t have access to the most recent devices, meaning that for a large portion of the population, penetration will still be a significant barrier and over-relying on these <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/12/know-your-enemy-the-5-different-types-of-data-breach/\">technologies can result in the negligence</a> of other important steps such as social distancing.</p>\n<h2>Privacy Concerns With Regards To Big Data</h2>\n<p>One of the biggest reasons why Big Data is a double-edged sword is its long-term consequences. The kind of technological advancements in surveillance that are being made can have a massive impact on the world post-COVID-19.</p>\n<p>Take, for example, of the “<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/23/what-the-drones-of-future-can-do/\">pandemic drones</a>” that the US is testing that can monitor body temperature, breathing, heart-rate, coughing, and sneezing of an individual. These drones can also be used to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/19/facial-recognition-shaping-the-future-of-identity-verification-market/\">identify people using facial recognition</a> technology and is something right out of a dystopian novel like 1984.</p>\n<p>That’s one end of surveillance that is more hardware-oriented. On the software end, contract tracing apps and big data platforms are being developed, which can be a huge risk of cyber threat. While Google and Apple have both promised commitment to privacy and anonymity, the tech giants of the world don’t have a great reputation with regards to upholding privacy and adopting transparent systems of accountability.</p>\n<blockquote><p><strong>The challenge we face is the long-term use case of the innovative technologies that are being developed in the wake of COVID-19. Moreover, skeptics have raised concerns over the use of these technologies by authoritarian regimes even after COVID-19. But this skepticism can be directed towards all governments and tech companies that are involved in the development of such technologies.</strong></p></blockquote>\n<p>Is there an expiry date for the usage of surveillance tech? To what degree will we wait for COVID-19 to slow down until we can stop violating the privacy of individuals in the way that this unprecedented crisis has forced us to do.</p>\n<h2>Conclusion</h2>\n<p>One of the things that we have to realize with regards to technological solutions and leveraging big data is that they are not perfect solutions.</p>\n<p>Their effectivity is limited to the capability of our technological prowess, and we are yet to unlock their true potential as a race. While technological evolution has made incredible inroads towards solving this problem with multiple possible vaccines now in the human trial phase, simple things like washing hands and maintaining social distancing are incredibly crucial.</p>\n<p>How we use <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/13/ai-how-its-impacting-surveillance-data-storage/\">technology for surveillance</a> for potential carriers, then <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/16/the-false-choice-between-privacy-and-safety-in-smart-surveillance/\">surveillance</a> of those already tested positive, and in testing and drug discovery are all efforts that happen side by side fulfilling our social responsibility towards this pandemic.</p>\n<p>However, while there’s good, the double-edged sword that is technology is also something we should be cognizant about. How this tech evolves, post-COVID is a conversation that needs to happen today before it’s too late. Privacy, security, anonymity, and safety should always be an important factor in our planning in the long-run.</p>\n<p>How secure will people feel knowing that their mobile devices can be used to determine associations and activities by in-built systems of tracing, which are much more targeted than the traditional location services? The answer lies in <a href=\"https://hackernoon.com/coronavirus-a-test-for-modern-technology-and-tethics-trrm3wom\">our understanding of ethics</a> and the responsibility we take with regards to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/13/it-trends-of-the-future-that-are-worth-paying-attention-to-today/\">Big Data backed platforms</a> that we develop as tech companies. How we choose to limit the use of this technology in the greater good of society is what will define how sharp the double-edged sword cuts back when it’s no longer needed to fight COVID-19.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/30/big-data-as-a-double-edged-sword-in-the-fight-against-covid-19/\">Big Data as a Double-Edged Sword in the Fight Against COVID-19</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 30 Apr 2020 18:00:52 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Big-Data-as-a-Double-Edged-Sword-in-the-Fight-Against-COVID-16-825x510-1.jpeg","linkMd5":"40835af680fefbf8173184b821385857","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn75@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-25-850_903000686cfc9bd9.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Big-Data-as-a-Double-Edged-Sword-in-the-Fight-Against-COVID-16-825x510-1.jpeg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":36221,"destBytes":30350,"author":"Abeer Raza","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Big-Data-as-a-Double-Edged-Sword-in-the-Fight-Against-COVID-16-825x510-1-300x185.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn36@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-19-054_01e07b53a42269fd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878027},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"Charting a Course Between Two Extremes of Startup Cash Management","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=168381","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/30/charting-a-course-between-two-extremes-of-startup-cash-management/\" title=\"Charting a Course Between Two Extremes of Startup Cash Management\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Charting-a-Course-Between-Two-Extremes-of-Startup-Cash-Management-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"startup cash management\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Charting-a-Course-Between-Two-Extremes-of-Startup-Cash-Management-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Charting-a-Course-Between-Two-Extremes-of-Startup-Cash-Management-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Charting-a-Course-Between-Two-Extremes-of-Startup-Cash-Management-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Charting-a-Course-Between-Two-Extremes-of-Startup-Cash-Management-1536x1024.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Charting-a-Course-Between-Two-Extremes-of-Startup-Cash-Management.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>In the world of startups, there are about <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/05/how-to-avoid-being-part-of-90-of-failed-companies/\">9 failed businesses</a> for every single one that succeeds. It&#8217;s the kind of statistic that&#8217;s enough to keep even the most seasoned founder up at night. If you take a peek inside that statistic, you&#8217;ll also find that the majority of startups that fail (besides those that were badly conceived in the first place). Many fail because they fail to keep their <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2016/01/04/startup-business-spending/\">burn rate</a> in check and then run out of investors who are willing to fund their operations.</p>\n<p>Part of that can be <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/06/22/9-steps-to-assess-whether-a-startup-is-suitable-for-investment/\">chalked up to sheer mismanagement</a>. After all, many founders fall victim to the notion that the financial tap won&#8217;t ever dry up – and they spend like there&#8217;s no tomorrow. A surprising number of others, though, suffer from the opposite problem. They treat their startup&#8217;s burn rate like it&#8217;s etched in stone. Some companies are unwilling to either spend more or less than their estimates indicate. They don&#8217;t consider the facts on the ground and what the facts are indicating they should be doing.</p>\n<p>The latter group also tends to spend every waking moment in the pursuit of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/01/recession-startup/\">lining up new financing</a>. As a result, they neglect the very things that will determine the future of their startup. While they make the rounds looking for money, product lines stagnate, customer service suffers, and innovation grinds to a halt. The result is that their startup goes belly-up anyway, like a bunch of grapes left to whither on the vine.</p>\n<p>The natural question is how, then, is a founder supposed to strike the balance between over-managing burn rate and profligate spending? And how can they even recognize the condition their startup&#8217;s in from the inside, so they can take corrective action before it&#8217;s too late? To help, here&#8217;s a look at what the two extremes of startup cash management look like. If you see your startup reflected in either of them, it&#8217;s time to make some changes.</p>\n<h2>The Go-Go Startup</h2>\n<p>I refer here to startups that waste their financing as though there&#8217;s an endless supply of cash waiting to be brought in the doors as go-go startups. The reason is that the term is emblematic of the attitude that such startups tend to adopt. The people in charge see spending more as a symbol of getting things done, and can&#8217;t resist the lure of jumping into everything with both feet before looking at where they&#8217;re likely to land.</p>\n<p>To be more specific, they tend to throw excessive amounts of cash in the following areas:</p>\n<h3>Overstaffing</h3>\n<p>One of the areas where startups tend to overspend is in hiring staff that their development cycle does not yet call for. For example, it&#8217;s common for startups to begin building out a massive marketing department long before they have a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2015/08/03/minimum-viable-product-mvp-test/\">minimum viable product</a> (MVP) to bring to market. At best, the only value those marketers will be able to generate is in building up hype for a nonexistent product. Then, if your MVP doesn&#8217;t live up to expectations, you&#8217;ll have burnt up cash just to harm your own fledgling brand&#8217;s image.</p>\n<p>To avoid this pitfall, it&#8217;s essential to spend your startup&#8217;s money on building a product and getting it in front of potential customers before almost anything else. All of the other business functions that you might view as essential early on should be put on hold until you find out if the business itself has a viable market to focus on in the first place.</p>\n<h3>Lavish Workspace</h3>\n<p>Another area where startups tend to go overboard is in finding and securing their office spaces. Recent history is littered with failed startups that went from inhabiting posh, palatial offices to bankruptcy proceedings seemingly overnight. It&#8217;s easy to understand why. In recent decades, venture capitalists have prized style over substance, and part of generating a positive buzz comes from having a feature-story-worthy office.</p>\n<p>The problem is that crazy office spaces and the perks they enable cost money. That money would be better spent on creating products and services that drive revenue, however. Plus, all those office perks that reporters breathlessly laud don&#8217;t have much correlation to success. In fact, they may even kill your startup&#8217;s productivity.</p>\n<h3>Excessive Promotional Materials</h3>\n<p>If there&#8217;s one thing that profligate startups seem to love, it&#8217;s branded swag. If you can put a logo on it, they&#8217;ll buy it in bulk. Bonus points if the item is unique, expensive, and trendy (remember how every tech startup was handing out business card CD-ROMs during the .com boom?). The truth about all of that stuff, however, is that nobody cares. Nobody, except the marketing firm you&#8217;re shoveling all of that money at.</p>\n<h2>The Go-Slow Startup</h2>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_168385\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-168385\" style=\"width: 900px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/startup-skyrocketing-success.jpg\"><img class=\"wp-image-168385 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/startup-skyrocketing-success.jpg\" alt=\"go-slow startup\" width=\"900\" height=\"500\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/startup-skyrocketing-success.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/startup-skyrocketing-success-300x167.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/startup-skyrocketing-success-260x144.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></a><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-168385\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><em><strong>The &#8220;go-slow-startup.&#8221;  </strong></em>                                                                                                                                   <em> Image credit: H_Ko / Adobe Stock</em></figcaption></figure></p>\n<p>On the other end of the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/14/5-tech-companies-to-turn-to-during-uncertain-times/\">startup spending spectrum</a> is the type of company that I like to call the go-slow startup. For them, it seems like the primary purpose of operating isn&#8217;t to make money, it&#8217;s to attract investment – whether it&#8217;s needed or not. At the same time, conserving operating cash isn&#8217;t a goal; it&#8217;s an all-consuming priority, often to the detriment of the business.</p>\n<p>Go-slow startups often exhibit the following characteristics:</p>\n<h3>Putting Funding Before Customers</h3>\n<p>The ethos of the go-slow startup seems to be: if we raise the cash to stay in business long enough, the customers will come. In truth, this is an idea that rarely, if ever, translates into reality. In service of it, startups sometimes use up their valuable time and manpower chasing VC funding rounds to the exclusion of almost every other useful business activity.</p>\n<p>This is folly for several reasons. First, venture capital <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/10/04/despite-what-you-hear-you-dont-need-vc-funding/\">isn&#8217;t always appropriate</a> for every startup. Second, investors mean expectations. Those expectations can take over the direction of your startup and push it toward decisions you&#8217;d have never made otherwise.</p>\n<p>In the early stages, this can rob a founder of the flexibility they need to execute their vision. Instead of chasing funding, it&#8217;s much more important to spare no effort to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/24/e-commerce-failures-and-mistakes-why-do-so-many-startups-fail/\">build a loyal core of customers</a> that will help keep your bottom line healthy – and that will grow along with your product or service.</p>\n<h3>Funding for Funding&#8217;s Sake</h3>\n<p>Another sure sign of the go-slow startup is the tendency to seek new funding sources every time there&#8217;s even a hint of progress on the business side. More often than not, there&#8217;s no particular reason they need the cash, except to build up a funding cushion in anticipation of harder days ahead.</p>\n<p>In the past, I&#8217;ve seen startups manufacture every possible excuse for this behavior, from the diminished purchasing power of the falling US dollar to a desire to take advantage of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/16/crowdfunding-your-startup-at-700-percent-oversubscribed/\">historic low-interest rates on business</a> working capital loans. I&#8217;ve even had a founder tell me they were raising money &#8220;because it&#8217;s there.&#8221;</p>\n<p>The problem is the money a startup raises isn&#8217;t free. If there&#8217;s no real plan for how to use it to drive the company forward, taking on additional investors can have some <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2015/07/13/pitfalls-venture-capital/\">pretty serious drawbacks</a>. The bottom line is that a well-run startup should only raise money when it needs money, and only when that need is related to the startup&#8217;s actual business goals.</p>\n<h3>Hoarding Cash and Making Unreasonable Demands</h3>\n<p>The last characteristic of the go-slow startup is one that I consider to be the cardinal sin of all early-stage businesses. It happens when the startup is so consumed with building a cash reserve that it begins starving its own organization of needed resources. This usually shows up in the form of a stubborn refusal to hire needed staff (as opposed to the excessive staffing discussed earlier), followed by an ever-increasing burden on existing employees.</p>\n<p>Now, it&#8217;s invariably true that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/14/outsourcing-automation-future-of-business-scalability/\">startup employees typically work long hours</a> in service of a greater goal. It&#8217;s just that there&#8217;s a limit to what a startup should expect of its dedicated employees. They&#8217;re not a fixed asset. They&#8217;re not machines. If you push them too hard, they&#8217;ll leave &#8212; and take your startup&#8217;s soul with them.</p>\n<p>The problem is that many startups have dedicated employees that will keep acceding to unreasonable demands until they literally break down. At that point, it&#8217;s a situation beyond repair. For that reason, if your startup is doing this, make changes immediately.</p>\n<h2>Getting Things Right</h2>\n<p>The goal for every startup should be to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/17/12-best-sales-engagement-solutions-for-2020/\">pursue burn rate management</a> in the manner most appropriate for their specific circumstances. As you can see, there are quite a few ways that companies can be either too passive or too aggressive in their approach, and none of them ends well.</p>\n<p>Put simply, though, if your startup is exhibiting any of the qualities listed here, you need to reexamine your situation and make adjustments as needed. If you don&#8217;t, your startup may well end up joining the majority of its peers in irrelevance and insolvency – and not because it was a bad idea in the first place.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/30/charting-a-course-between-two-extremes-of-startup-cash-management/\">Charting a Course Between Two Extremes of Startup Cash Management</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 30 Apr 2020 15:00:37 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Charting-a-Course-Between-Two-Extremes-of-Startup-Cash-Management.jpg","linkMd5":"952e155a54b538c916e1c9ab4f3f3d91","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn80@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-27-131_09e3b64de53d1c4a.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Charting-a-Course-Between-Two-Extremes-of-Startup-Cash-Management.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1280,"sourceBytes":493531,"destBytes":496622,"author":"Andrej Kovacevic","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Charting-a-Course-Between-Two-Extremes-of-Startup-Cash-Management-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn99@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-15-576_a8434708dc16155e.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/startup-skyrocketing-success.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn48@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-19-596_d78091eff641fdc3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878259},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"Why You Should Allow Employees to do Online Shopping at Work","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169231","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/21/why-you-should-allow-employees-to-do-online-shopping-at-work/\" title=\"Why You Should Allow Employees to do Online Shopping at Work\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Why-You-Should-Allow-Employees-to-do-Online-Shopping--300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"shopping at work\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Why-You-Should-Allow-Employees-to-do-Online-Shopping--300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Why-You-Should-Allow-Employees-to-do-Online-Shopping--900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Why-You-Should-Allow-Employees-to-do-Online-Shopping--240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Why-You-Should-Allow-Employees-to-do-Online-Shopping--1536x1024.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Why-You-Should-Allow-Employees-to-do-Online-Shopping-.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Encouraging your employees to shop during work hours sounds odd, to put it mildly. But armed with some data, I’m willing to explain why it’s not quite like kicking yourself or throwing your money in the air.</p>\n<p>You should not only allow employees to do personal shopping at work. You should be happy when they do it. As the founder of the time tracking app DeskTime, I’ve always been passionate about productivity. But I’ve often found it to be misunderstood by staff and managers.</p>\n<p>On the DeskTime app, we’ve labeled sites and applications &#8221;productive&#8221; or &#8221;unproductive&#8221;. But are the unproductive ones really harmful to our team’s overall performance? Or, are they a distraction that’s sometimes welcome and even necessary?</p>\n<p>That’s why we decided to look at a supposedly unproductive activity – <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/08/how-online-shopping-is-evolving-with-the-times/\">online shopping</a> during office hours.</p>\n<h2><strong>Employees spend more than half an hour a day in online shopping.</strong></h2>\n<p>Many studies confirm what you may have already suspected to be true – most people engage in online shopping at work. When you look at millennials, <a href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90408181/you-shop-online-at-work-we-all-know-it-and-this-research-proves-it\">81 percent</a> of them browse shopping sites during work hours.</p>\n<p>We decided to have a closer look at this phenomenon, so we gathered data from more than 180K users of our app. We pulled data concerning the use of online shopping sites over the last four years.</p>\n<p>First of all, we confirmed that office workers indeed use online shopping to procrastinate during work hours. We noticed that <b>online shopping at work is a growing trend</b>.</p>\n<p>Let me explain:</p>\n<p>In 2016, an average DeskTime user spent only up to 12 minutes a day on online shopping, but a year later, this number more than doubled. In 2018, an average office worker was already spending up to 45 minutes a day shopping. Last year, however, the trend seems to have slowed down with 32 minutes dedicated to online shopping per day.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/employees-shopping-at-work.png\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-169234 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/employees-shopping-at-work-900x657.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"900\" height=\"657\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/employees-shopping-at-work-900x657.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/employees-shopping-at-work-300x219.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/employees-shopping-at-work-219x160.png 219w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/employees-shopping-at-work-1536x1121.png 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/employees-shopping-at-work.png 2000w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></a></p>\n<p>That being said, despite the slight changes in online shopping dynamics we observed last year, I still believe those office workers from all over the world will continue to flock to the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/20/4-technology-trends-shaping-property-portals/\">Internet to make purchases</a>. It wouldn&#8217;t be a surprise if the total time spent on online shopping during work hours would increase again in 2020 along with the entire e-commerce market, which is also <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/272391/us-retail-e-commerce-sales-forecast/\">continuously growing</a>.</p>\n<h3><strong>Where do employees shop the most during office hours?</strong></h3>\n<p>When it comes to online shopping destinations, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/tag/amazon/\">Amazon</a> remains the most popular e-commerce site visited during office hours. In 2019, people spent almost 60 percent of all time dedicated to online shopping browsing Amazon. The runner-up is eBay with 11.6 percent and Etsy with 4 percent ranking third.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_169237\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-169237\" style=\"width: 900px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/popular-shopping-websites.png\"><img class=\"wp-image-169237 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/popular-shopping-websites-900x484.png\" alt=\"popular shopping websites\" width=\"900\" height=\"484\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/popular-shopping-websites-900x484.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/popular-shopping-websites-300x161.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/popular-shopping-websites-260x140.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/popular-shopping-websites-1536x826.png 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/popular-shopping-websites.png 2000w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></a><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-169237\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><em>Top online shopping destinations during work hours, 2019</em></figcaption></figure></p>\n<p>So, if you weren’t sure that your employees shopped during work hours, now you should be. From now on, it’s up to you whether you let them do it openly or whether you’d prefer them to sneak around.</p>\n<p>Let me explain why I think<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/15/4-ethical-concerns-for-the-connected-world/\"> transparency is the best policy</a> here and why you should not mind your team doing some shopping at work.</p>\n<h4>1: Online shopping is one of the least harmful unproductive activities</h4>\n<p>Online shopping is far from being the biggest productivity threat to companies. So, before you block all e-commerce websites in the office or fire someone for browsing Amazon at work, reflect on this:</p>\n<blockquote><p>Only about <b>3.8 percent of the unproductive time is spent on shopping, </b>according to the data.</p></blockquote>\n<p>In the meantime, social media and video streaming websites (such as YouTube and Netflix) take up 49 percent and 35 percent, respectively.</p>\n<h4><b>2: Shopping makes employees happier</b></h4>\n<p>Numerous studies point out that the use of social media <a href=\"https://www.livescience.com/62718-social-media-habits-depression.html\">can cause depression</a> and <a href=\"https://www.huffpost.com/entry/social-media-anxiety_n_1662224\">anxiety</a>. On the contrary, shopping has been found to promote the release of dopamine – a hormone that plays a vital role in how happy we feel.</p>\n<p>A distraction like shopping lets employees takes a mental break. And happy employees are found to be <a href=\"https://www.themuse.com/advice/its-true-happy-people-are-just-more-productive\">more productive</a> and efficient. Also, people who aren’t policed and restricted at work are less likely to search for another job.</p>\n<p>When you look at it that way, allowing your employees to buy some new gadget or a piece of clothing during working hours doesn&#8217;t sound like such a big deal, does it? Certainly not if it can boost morale and reduce employee turnover.</p>\n<h4><b>3: Shopping at work can actually make people more productive</b></h4>\n<p>Imagine yourself in a situation where you just did some shopping during work hours. How do you feel?</p>\n<p>Are you satisfied that you’ve saved some of your private time? Guilty for abandoning your work duties for a while?</p>\n<p>Probably a bit of both. I guess that this combination of happiness and guilt can give a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/13/5-quick-tips-for-improving-productivity-at-work-in-2020/\">productivity boost</a> to many people.</p>\n<p>Studies prove that employees’ productivity soars after short breaks. And psychologists claim that giving your brain a short rest can <a href=\"https://www.psychologytoday.com/intl/blog/changepower/201704/how-do-work-breaks-help-your-brain-5-surprising-answers\">help you stay focused on the task at hand.</a></p>\n<p>Ideally, you should encourage taking breaks away from the computer so that your employees rest their eyes, stretch, walk around, and drink some water. However, if a mental break is what they need at that moment, let it be.</p>\n<h2><strong>Key takeaway?</strong></h2>\n<p>A <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/26/the-modern-workplace-demands-better-visibility/\">modern workplace</a> should put a focus on employee performance rather than on counting the minutes spent on productive or unproductive activities. And you heard that from me, the founder of a time tracking app.</p>\n<p>Instead of restricting personal shopping in the workplace, consider starting an initiative where each employee can spend up to 30 minutes a day on settling personal business at work.</p>\n<p>Remember &#8211; intrinsic motivation is a crucial player in a company’s overall productivity and in reducing employee turnover. Trusting your employees and giving them a break is a more significant motivation booster than you might think.</p>\n<p>Image Credit: Andrea Piacquadio; Pexels</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/21/why-you-should-allow-employees-to-do-online-shopping-at-work/\">Why You Should Allow Employees to do Online Shopping at Work</a> appeared first on <a Rozentals","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Why-You-Should-Allow-Employees-to-do-Online-Shopping--300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn64@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-13-609_5dc2de6d644cac7f.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/employees-shopping-at-work-900x657.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn95@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-28-023_5eee3e119d9e21b7.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/popular-shopping-websites-900x484.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn35@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-28-339_92cf45fb4c648b50.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877690},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","title":"How Can Publishers Grow Traffic After the Latest Google Update?","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=172659","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/21/how-can-publishers-grow-traffic-after-the-latest-google-update/\" title=\"How Can Publishers Grow Traffic After the Latest Google Update?\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/How-Can-Publishers-Grow-Traffic-After-the-Latest-Google-Update-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"latest google update\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/How-Can-Publishers-Grow-Traffic-After-the-Latest-Google-Update-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/How-Can-Publishers-Grow-Traffic-After-the-Latest-Google-Update-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/How-Can-Publishers-Grow-Traffic-After-the-Latest-Google-Update-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/How-Can-Publishers-Grow-Traffic-After-the-Latest-Google-Update.jpg 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><i>*Mentioned products, tools in the article are non-affiliated and non-sponsored. </i></p>\n<p>After Google announced its latest core update on May 4th, more and more publishers have faced a significant drop in their traffic. Having armed with key data and metrics, I would like to share with you four major tips on how to recover from this traffic crack.</p>\n<h2><strong>1. Get your blog featured in Google News</strong></h2>\n<p>According to SimilarWeb.com Google News currently has over <a href=\"https://www.similarweb.com/website/news.google.com#overview\">500M monthly visits.</a> As it is the dream of most online publishers to reach an audience this big, this is the chance to distribute your content to a readership that is already well-established.</p>\n<p>The potential of Google News is incredible and can help you to become one of the most featured blogs in your industry.</p>\n<p>Let&#8217;s compare Ahref’s results on how organic traffic has changed from April to June for two Setupad publishers -– Publisher A and Publisher B.</p>\n<p>Publisher&#8217;s A website is dedicated to the news category and displayed in Google News.</p>\n<p>On the other hand, Publisher&#8217;s B website is about recipes and food and is not featured in Google News.</p>\n<p>According to the figure below, on April 26th, organic traffic was greater for Publisher B. The Publisher B results could lead us to think that after Google&#8217;s latest update, Publisher B would see a heavier drop in organic traffic in comparison to a Publisher A, who is in Google News.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-172661 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Grow-your-traffic-with-Google-News-Apr..png\" alt=\"Grow your website's traffic Apr.\" width=\"2000\" height=\"700\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Grow-your-traffic-with-Google-News-Apr..png 2000w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Grow-your-traffic-with-Google-News-Apr.-300x105.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Grow-your-traffic-with-Google-News-Apr.-900x315.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Grow-your-traffic-with-Google-News-Apr.-260x91.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Grow-your-traffic-with-Google-News-Apr.-1536x538.png 1536w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 2000px) 100vw, 2000px\" /></p>\n<p>The figure below shows that both publishers experienced a drop in organic traffic after the latest Google Update. However, for Publisher A, organic traffic decreased only by 28K, while Publisher B experienced a drop over 51K in organic traffic.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-172670 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Grow-your-websites-traffic-Jun..png\" alt=\"Grow your website's traffic Jun.\" width=\"2000\" height=\"700\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Grow-your-websites-traffic-Jun..png 2000w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Grow-your-websites-traffic-Jun.-300x105.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Grow-your-websites-traffic-Jun.-900x315.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Grow-your-websites-traffic-Jun.-260x91.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Grow-your-websites-traffic-Jun.-1536x538.png 1536w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 2000px) 100vw, 2000px\" /></p>\n<p><b>What should you keep in mind?</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Your content has to be optimized for search engines, so make sure you are running <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/26/blockchain-marketing-6-effective-ways-to-boost-your-seo-in-2020/\">SEO</a>.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Google News SEO can help you to get listed in top stories, and thus increase your website traffic.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2><strong>2. Site audit for your website</strong></h2>\n<p>A site or website audit helps you to track your page&#8217;s performance and evaluate how you are achieving traffic goals. By running a site audit, you can understand whether the website is optimized or not and whether it is friendly to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/16/heres-what-you-need-to-know-about-search-in-2020/\">search engines.</a></p>\n<p>After the site audit, you can gain a clear picture of what is wrong with your site and the errors you should fix. By fixing and optimizing your website, you can attract more visitors and generate more leads.</p>\n<p>This audit gives you a strategic plan to help you take the right action.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>You can compare your site results with that of your competitors to gain a competitive advantage.</li>\n<li>Evaluate your site’s overall SEO efforts and make corresponding improvements.</li>\n<li>Fix any errors, such as broken images, non-compressed images, etc.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Remember that it&#8217;s perfectly alright if you cannot manage to improve everything at once, but these changes can be made over time.</p>\n<p>The main difference between site and content audit is that a site audit also evaluates not only the content of your website but also its technical performance.</p>\n<h2><strong>3. Content audit for your website</strong></h2>\n<p>If you want to know which pages of your website are ranked lower due to the update, a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/15/a-comprehensive-guide-to-a-content-audit/\">content audit</a> will help.</p>\n<p>With a content audit, you can track how well your blog articles and landing pages are performing, as well as the quality of your engagement with your audience.</p>\n<p>By running content audits and analysis, you can see which articles and pages have to be updated and re-written.</p>\n<p>One of the greatest tools to help you analyze your content is <a href=\"https://www.screamingfrog.co.uk/seo-spider/\">Screaming Frog</a>. This tool conducts an SEO audit of your website and checks the first 500 URLs for free. It helps you identify which pages have dropped in performance due to the update. Definitely recommended.</p>\n<h2><strong>4. Improve user experience (UX)</strong></h2>\n<p>After doing your site and content audit, continue with improving UX. The truth is, if your user experience is bad, you cannot hope for good results in search engines and rankings. Since search engine algorithm updates have become more advanced, user searches have become the top priority and play a considerably essential role in website ranking.</p>\n<p><b>Where to start and what to check? </b></p>\n<p>Make sure your content is clean and readable. Remember to emphasize your headings, so that it&#8217;s understandable for users and matches what they expect to read.</p>\n<p>Check if you use colors that are consistent and echo your brand values. You can create a brand book or so-called style guide that includes the main elements that constitute your brand. Doing this can help you create strategic guidelines that drive all aspects of your brand.</p>\n<p>A <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/11/12/web-designing-in-the-age-of-iot/\">well-designed site</a> or a blog will boost your engagement. But remember that the focus should be on blocks that users see first— for example, testimonials on the homepage. Testimonials can also help you gain users and create great UX experience.</p>\n<h2><strong>Key takeaway</strong></h2>\n<p>One of the most important things you can do for your site is observing your analytics and identifying unexpected changes in your traffic.</p>\n<p>Remember that after running a site and content audit, you should fix any errors as soon as possible. This will help you increase your website&#8217;s traffic.</p>\n<p>Get your blog displayed in Google News. It can take you two to four weeks to get approved, but if you undergo the approval process, rest assured that traffic will go up.</p>\n<p>Another thing to keep in mind is that you shouldn&#8217;t attempt to win Google over its updates. Google focuses on providing the best experience for its users, so it makes sense that websites with great UX rank higher and gain more traffic. As a publisher, your long-term goal should be to provide a better user experience, which will later result in less traffic loss due to algorithm updates.</p>\n<p><i>*Mentioned products, tools in the article are non-affiliated and non-sponsored.</i></p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Andrea Piacquadio; Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" Panders","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/How-Can-Publishers-Grow-Traffic-After-the-Latest-Google-Update-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn100@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-21-685_c8944ec6a89ac1ca.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Grow-your-traffic-with-Google-News-Apr..png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn63@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-13-037_a417eda45fe75d10.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Grow-your-websites-traffic-Jun..png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn15@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-13-359_aa62f9c7e5736c6d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195873345},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:51","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:51","title":"10 Different Ways to Use Employee Feedback Software at Your Workplace","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171676","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/15/10-different-ways-to-use-employee-feedback-software-at-your-workplace/\" title=\"10 Different Ways to Use Employee Feedback Software at Your Workplace\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Use-Employee-Feedback-Software-at-Your-Workplace-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"employee feedback software\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Use-Employee-Feedback-Software-at-Your-Workplace-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Use-Employee-Feedback-Software-at-Your-Workplace-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Use-Employee-Feedback-Software-at-Your-Workplace.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Running a company with a large number of employees is not an easy nut to break. Apart from managing a business or company &#8212; managing employees is another important responsibility for the owner. Here are ten different ways to use employee feedback software at your workplace.<br />\n</span></p>\n<h2>Run the feedback &#8212; <em>but how do you react</em>?</h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You can easily manage your employees &#8212; and provide your workplace with an essential employee engagement bump without investing extra resources and efforts.</span></p>\n<p><strong> Your employee feedback helps you to get deeper insights into your employees.</strong></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Nowadays, every business is actively involved in taking Employee Feedback, but the basic difference is the way you are deploying it. The way you use the Employee Feedback determines the growth of your employees &#8212; and your company.</span></p>\n<h2><b>What is Employee Feedback?</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Employee Feedback refers to a process in which a company asks constructive suggestions about work culture, company, managers, other team members, and other facilities like the cafeteria, and washroom. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">These suggestions are being asked either through a questionnaire or through online employee feedback surveys (zonkafeedback dot com, Survey Monkey, others) conducted via emails and SMSes. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The practice of conducting <a href=\"https://www.zonkafeedback.com/employee-feedback-software\">employee feedback</a> helps the company to gauge employee experience and their performance level and create a better workplace culture.</span></p>\n<h2><b>Why Do You Need Employee Feedback?</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You may have a small or medium-sized company &#8212; or even a large multinational company organization. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Employee feedback surveys help the companies to acknowledge employees and their performances. Measuring employee feedback is an effective way to track employees’ expectations and fulfill them to ensure maximum employee satisfaction and loyalty. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There are various benefits of deploying Employee Feedback in an organization.</span></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Why-You-Need-Employee-Feedback-.png\"><img class=\"wp-image-171802 aligncenter\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Why-You-Need-Employee-Feedback--288x719.png\" alt=\"Employee Feedback\" width=\"288\" height=\"719\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Why-You-Need-Employee-Feedback--288x719.png 288w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Why-You-Need-Employee-Feedback--120x300.png 120w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Why-You-Need-Employee-Feedback--64x160.png 64w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Why-You-Need-Employee-Feedback--614x1536.png 614w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Why-You-Need-Employee-Feedback-.png 800w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 288px) 100vw, 288px\" /></a></p>\n<h2><b>What is Employee Feedback Software?</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The organization’s success is determined by the employees’ satisfaction and happiness. A happy and satisfied employee will always contribute to augment the company’s productivity along with business growth. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With the rising significance of gauging employees’ perceptions, feedback culture has evolved and massively used in an organization to measure employee engagement. Therefore, introducing Employee Feedback Software at the workplace has become the need of the hour. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Employee Feedback Software is an online tool that enables you to measure the employees’ satisfaction and maintain a healthy work environment in the organization. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It not only provides a platform for employees to share their feedback and suggestions but also helps companies to drive real-time accountability for all touchpoints and areas.</span></p>\n<h2><b>How Employee Feedback Software Can be Used in the Workplace?</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Employee Feedback Software can be used at different touchpoints to gauge the level of employee satisfaction. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Here are six different ways to use Employee Feedback Software in the workplace.</span></p>\n<ol>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Employee Satisfaction Survey</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Pulse Surveys</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Culture Surveys</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Cafeteria Surveys</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Amenities Surveys</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Mood Surveys</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">On-Boarding Surveys</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Professional Development Surveys</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Performance Appraisal Surveys</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Exit Surveys</span></li>\n</ol>\n<h3><b>1. Employee Satisfaction Survey</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As the name suggests, the Employee Satisfaction Survey can be conducted to gauge the satisfaction level of employees in the workplace. These surveys can easily be conducted through employee feedback software. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Employee satisfaction surveys cover the following feedback aspects including about company, job, the workplace, and the manager. It also helps the organizations to track the employees’ perceptions about the company’s policies, and job security.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">A survey contributes to creating a motivated workforce and positive work culture. The parameters gauged from an employee satisfaction survey are directly influencing the employee retention rate.</span></p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-174513\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/1-900x506-1.jpg\" alt=\"Employee Satisfaction Survey Questions\" width=\"900\" height=\"506\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/1-900x506-1.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/1-900x506-1-300x169.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/1-900x506-1-260x146.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<h3><b>2. Pulse Surveys</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Pulse Surveys are short and different from other typical surveys. It is meant for  </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Many organizations now prefer to use employee pulse surveys. A Pulse employee survey refers to a quick survey system that is conducted weekly or every few weeks. This employee survey is conducted with the intent to get a frequent insight into the health of the organization.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Pulse Surveys help the organizations to acquire employees’ information regarding workplace areas of interest including employees’ engagement, satisfaction, work culture, and other parameters. These areas help the organization to get into the employee’s opinion on specific parameters. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The data collected through pulse employee surveys also help the organizations to frequently map out the latest employee feedback trends and patterns. This practice contributes to employee morale and maximum satisfaction.</span></p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-174514\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/2-900x506-1.jpg\" alt=\"Employee Surveys\" width=\"900\" height=\"506\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/2-900x506-1.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/2-900x506-1-300x169.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/2-900x506-1-260x146.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<h3><b>3. Culture Surveys</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Whenever we choose any company or organization, after the pay scale, we look at the culture of the company. The culture of the organization helps the employees to fit themselves in the organization environment. On another hand, the culture of the organization plays a crucial role in making an organization a milestone. The culture of the organization affects the business decisions, policies. Actions, and missions &#38; goals. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The organizational culture trends and patterns are changed over time. So, the organization needs to conduct Culture Surveys to ascertain the employees’ perceptions about the organizational culture. This survey provides an in-depth and clear picture of the internal structures, skills, and qualities that affect the behavior, and management style of the organization.  </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Based on the data collected from surveys help the companies to seamlessly go through a culture improvisation including management changes, amenities improvisation, mergers, acquisitions, and large changes in management.</span></p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-174515\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/3-900x506-1.jpg\" alt=\"employee survey software\" width=\"900\" height=\"506\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/3-900x506-1.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/3-900x506-1-300x169.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/3-900x506-1-260x146.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<h3><b>4. Cafeteria Surveys</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When it comes to establishing or improving healthy work and communication culture, no place is better than a cafeteria. Also, food and facilities make this place a great source for strengthening the bond between employees.     </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">So, the organization needs to conduct regular cafeteria feedback among their employees to get to know about their perceptions regarding the quality of food, taste, hygiene, availability of food products, etc. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Now forwarding cafeteria email surveys at the workplace seems a little awkward. In the flow of work, either ignore the surveyor or spam your email survey. So, to avoid this, you can set up a simple Kiosk Survey System at your cafeteria. This will help you capture real-time instant employee feedback about your cafeteria.</span></p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-174518\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/6-900x506-1.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"900\" height=\"506\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/6-900x506-1.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/6-900x506-1-300x169.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/6-900x506-1-260x146.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<h3><b>5. Amenities Surveys</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Now since you’ve considered taking feedback about the cafeteria, there are various other services or amenities for which you need to take employee feedback. You should conduct Amenities Surveys that help you to track employees’ opinions about facilities and privileges provided by you as a company. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Amenities Survey covers feedback on various parameters including washroom, cleanliness of workspace, availability of stationeries, hygiene at the workplace, gym (if have), medical facilities, etc.  </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You can set up a survey tablet or kiosk survey in washrooms, gyms, and other employees’ touchpoints with the simple rating scale questions to capture employee feedback. This helps you to collect real-time feedback data and improve your other services and amenities to make your workspace a comfortable hub.</span></p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-174519 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/7-900x506-1.jpg\" alt=\"Employee Feedback Survey Software\" width=\"900\" height=\"506\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/7-900x506-1.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/7-900x506-1-300x169.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/7-900x506-1-260x146.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<h3><b>6. Mood Surveys</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Employees’ sentiments or moods determine the level of the employees’ engagement. According to the State of the Global Workplace report, 85% of employees are not engaged or actively disengaged at work. So, if you want to make your employees happy, satisfied, and keep them engaged, then you need to actively involve yourself in conducting Mood Surveys to track the sentiments of your employees. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Mood surveys help you to capture the employees’ sentiments in special scenarios like change in leadership, management reconstruction, business transitions including mergers, etc. on these touchpoints, you are easily able to track the different employees’ mood patterns and trends. Employee Mood Surveys help you to quickly track whether your employees are happy or frustrated at the workplace.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Based on the data collected from the mood surveys, you can quickly trace out the dynamics that lead to employee disengagement. Acting on it and resolving the issues can help you to reduce your employee churn rate and improve employee retention rates.</span></p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-174520 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/8-900x506-1.jpg\" alt=\"Employee Feedback Survey Software\" width=\"900\" height=\"506\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/8-900x506-1.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/8-900x506-1-300x169.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/8-900x506-1-260x146.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<h3><b>7. On-Boarding Surveys</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">On-Boarding, as the name suggests, these surveys are specifically conducted to understand the perceptions and opinions of the new employees and how new hires feel about the organization. On-Boarding Survey can be forwarded to the selected candidate during the salary negotiation. This, in turn, helps you to understand the employees’ expectations and the latest hiring trends and patterns to make your hiring process and onboarding survey experience better.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">According to the</span> <a href=\"https://www.shrm.org/resourcesandtools/hr-topics/talent-acquisition/pages/effective-onboarding-should-last-for-months.aspx\">study by SHRM</a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, the onboarding process should go beyond passive first-day orientation and morph into regular conversations throughout the first 30, 60, and 90 days.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You can handover a tablet-based feedback system to the selected candidate where they can freely give their feedback, opinions, and suggestions regarding the onboarding process.</span></p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-174516 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/4-900x506-1.jpg\" alt=\"Employee Feedback Survey Software\" width=\"900\" height=\"506\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/4-900x506-1.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/4-900x506-1-300x169.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/4-900x506-1-260x146.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<h3><b>8. Professional Development Surveys</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When it comes to sustaining in an organization, Professional development is a very important aspect for an employee. Today’s employees are career-focused and learning-oriented employees, who love to stay long at that place where they grow and learn simultaneously. If you want your employees to sustain long at your company, then start ascertaining their professional development. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For this, you can conduct a Professional Development Survey to assess your approach in providing professional scope to your employees. It also helps you to track the quality and performance of the skills, leadership training, executive, and industry exposure you are providing. This, in turn, helps you to promote an engaged and skilled workforce.</span></p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-174521\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/9-900x506-1.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"900\" height=\"506\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/9-900x506-1.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/9-900x506-1-300x169.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/9-900x506-1-260x146.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<h3><b>9. Performance Appraisal Surveys</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Performance appraisal is the secret of employees’ productivity….LoL </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Well, jokes apart, employees are eagerly waiting for this period. Here in this, the manager plays a crucial role in properly evaluating the performance of the employees and providing them with the boost to perform effectively. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">So, the Performance Appraisal Survey is the best platform where managers can offer employees constructive criticism without being into the grey shade. These surveys not only motivate your employees to perform well but also develop healthy communication and engagement between employees, managers, and supervisors.</span></p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter size-full wp-image-174517\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/5-900x506-1.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"900\" height=\"506\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/5-900x506-1.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/5-900x506-1-300x169.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/5-900x506-1-260x146.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<h3><b>10. Exit Surveys</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The loss of a talented employee is very tough but it is a perfect opportunity where the organization can collect genuine feedback from a departing employee. Conduct an Exit Survey to get an in-depth understanding of the employees’  perspectives and experiences regarding the workplace, company policies, work culture, career scope, etc.</span></p>\n<p>&#160;</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/15/10-different-ways-to-use-employee-feedback-software-at-your-workplace/\">10 Different Ways to Use Employee Feedback Software at Your Workplace</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 15 Jul 2020 16:49:02 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Use-Employee-Feedback-Software-at-Your-Workplace.jpg","linkMd5":"4a62f47c6f28b8446ae9acecae332235","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn31@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-25-830_88bbb69963c283e5.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Use-Employee-Feedback-Software-at-Your-Workplace.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":43694,"destBytes":45936,"author":"Archit Jain","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Use-Employee-Feedback-Software-at-Your-Workplace-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn52@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-17-395_4bfbfb26cb6908df.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Why-You-Need-Employee-Feedback--288x719.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn99@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-17-806_43c94172c5a45868.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/1-900x506-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn64@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-20-317_52630d82e48a67f7.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/2-900x506-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn8@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-21-038_a33c4fa0b7419846.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/3-900x506-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn35@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-20-327_ae44bd225e90d43c.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/6-900x506-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn88@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-19-226_97c8994b373cef29.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/7-900x506-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn36@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-13-377_9839078e93e15b74.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/8-900x506-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn59@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-22-125_18c8e58085c2c23a.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/4-900x506-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn3@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-20-694_878629a30f599737.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/9-900x506-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn92@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-14-458_d1e8a8f1f816119f.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/5-900x506-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn80@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-18-418_7d7ae6876d2fa8ef.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195871984},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","title":"Striking A Software Balance: How To Choose Programs For Efficiency","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=175914","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/15/striking-a-software-balance-how-to-choose-programs-for-efficiency/\" title=\"Striking A Software Balance: How To Choose Programs For Efficiency\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Striking-a-software-balance-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"Striking A Software Balance: How To Choose Programs For Efficiency\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Striking-a-software-balance-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Striking-a-software-balance-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Striking-a-software-balance.jpg 747w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Not so long ago, businesses had access to a relatively narrow assortment of programs. There was word processing software, platforms for inventory, accounting tools, and antivirus programs, but most served broad constituency. Ultimately, most critical processes either relied on in-house solutions (often the programs referred to as legacy programs in today’s tech ecosystem) or they had to be managed manually. These approaches were time consuming and prone to error, but limited software choices weren’t all bad.</p>\n<p>Back when they had few options, businesses had to think critically about what tools they would use and how, and carefully consider the best ways to complete a given task. Today’s tools may be more powerful, but those charged with choosing the right platforms are often overwhelmed by their scope, as well as the sheer number of options. Such excess actually makes it harder for businesses to determine whether they’re doing something in the most efficient way. When six different programs can all easily complete a task, does it really matter which one your company chooses? Yes, it does.</p>\n<p>Picking the right software can substantially boost your business’s efficiency, help keep costs down, and make your company more agile, but it isn’t always easy. By intentionally evaluating your current software, your process-based needs, and by setting targeted performance goals, you can streamline your digital ecosystem and optimize your company’s performance.</p>\n<h3>Start With Goals</h3>\n<p>The first step for any business seeking to streamline their software use with a focus on efficiency is, unsurprisingly, goals-based planning. What does your business do, and how do you define the successful completion of your professional aims? Planning isn’t just outlining a project idea, but framing how long it will last and how you’ll measure whether you’ve met that goal. This is why most experts recommend <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/02/how-entrepreneurial-planning-helps-you-have-smoother-sailing/\">using the SMART planning process</a>.</p>\n<p>SMART is an acronym for how goals should function.
