A goal must be specific, measurable – many goals leave out this step, it must be achievable, it needs to be relevant within the bigger picture, and finally, it must be time-bound. If you don’t know how long a task will or should take or how you’ll determine a project is complete, then you don’t have a SMART goal. And while you can, and should, use SMART planning across a variety of tasks, it works particularly well for choosing software programs for several reasons – reasons made evident through the evaluation process.</p>\n<h3>Evaluating Program Needs</h3>\n<p>Once you define what your core goals are, as a business and specifically for your software ecosystem, it’s time to look at what tools you’re already working with and what tools your company needs. This evaluation process should weigh several factors, including software integration, ease of use, scalability, redundancy, and cost. These elements will carry different weights in the final decision making. For example, it may be worth it to pay more for a program that delivers more <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/14/8-ways-entrepreneurs-can-improve-their-time-management-skills/\">automation through business process management</a> (BPM).</p>\n<p>Remember: time is money, so a program that costs more but saves time may still come out ahead of a more affordable program that requires greater staff engagement to complete tasks. In fact, time management is one of the most significant business concerns as software systems multiply, since a significant percentage of lost productivity stems from the need to switch frequently between programs.</p>\n<h3>Cutting The Fat</h3>\n<p>As your business evaluates what tools it needs in order to efficiently meet its goals, you’ll also likely uncover that your company has some loose ends floating around. That could mean several things, including that:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>You’re paying for software subscriptions you no longer use.</strong> This happens surprisingly often, in much the same way that many individuals end up with stray media subscriptions. Because the payments are automated and are small, relative to the overall scope of business spending, they may be overlooked.</li>\n<li><strong>You’re still running old software and it’s burdening your system.</strong> It takes time and effort to shift data and processes away from legacy programs, but it’s worth doing. Those programs are rarely optimized for speed and tend to be clunky compared to purchased solutions. They slow down your network, don’t integrate with new software, and it’s time to transition away from them.</li>\n<li><strong>You’re running processes through several programs to get results that really only require one. </strong>Most popular business software integrates, at minimum, with other programs from their own suite of offerings, but even more often with the other top names in business software. For example, since the majority of companies use Salesforce, other software brands design their platforms for Salesforce integration. But while it’s one thing for a process to move through several integrated elements in order to complete a process, anything that requires staff to manually transition information between programs is doing more to hinder your business than to help it.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>All of these factors are strong indicators that you need to make some updates to your software suite if you want your business to achieve maximum efficiency. Cutting back on the number of programs you’re running and instead focusing on choosing a small, targeted suite will also help your business <a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/346104\">minimize the risk of security breaches</a>, speed up onboarding, and more.</p>\n<h3>Key Efficiency Features</h3>\n<p>You’ve set out your goals. You’ve evaluated your current software holdings and needs and gotten rid of the elements that aren’t working. Now your business is finally ready for the software adoption segment of the optimization process. There are several key features that you’ll want to focus on during this process, including:</p>\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Standardized Scripting: </strong>Remote monitoring and management platforms (RMM) have made it possible for businesses to streamline large scale data collection and analysis, but there’s no one size fits all approach to this process. Instead, the best RMM platforms <a href=\"https://syncromsp.com/time-saving-features-platform/\">include a script library</a> so that your businesses doesn’t need to craft the code from scratch for every new operation. Script libraries aren’t quite automation, but they enable automation.</li>\n<li><strong>Integrated Pathways:</strong> As noted above, integration is an important part of efficiency. If you have to manually navigate process pathways to complete an otherwise automated task, you can just about guarantee that there’s a better way. Look for software with integrated, automated process pathways for your most common tasks, such as invoicing, report generation, and patch management.</li>\n<li><strong>Easily Scaled:</strong> Scalability is critical to business success, and it’s one of the great advantages of today’s SaaS model. Though you may not have any intention or need to scale up in capacity right now, if your business is thriving, you’ll need to increase capacity (data volume, number of licenses) at some point down the line. If a program makes that hard to do, it’s not the program for your business.</li>\n<li><strong>High-Level Service: </strong>Customer service tends to be overlooked when businesses are choosing software. That’s not because it doesn’t matter – it’s just because it’s harder to test for. You can run a sample of software and watch demo videos, but you can’t be sure about support and maintenance services until you’re in the thick of things. That being said, you can <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbestechcouncil/2019/11/01/how-to-choose-the-right-software-solution-for-your-startup/#496fdaa52a6f\">discuss vendor support services</a> before committing to a contract. Will they dispatch a consultant to help with IT issues, or will they leave you talking to a chatbot? These details matter.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Overcoming Barriers To Software Transition</h3>\n<p>When a business needs to shift its processes, they tend to drag their feet. Making such a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/07/5-signs-that-you-are-ready-to-scale-business-and-deploy-innovation/\">change may feel impossible</a> or it may seem like there’s no right choice – or just too many choices. It’s okay to feel hesitant, but it’s important that you don’t let anxiety over innovation hold back your business. Instead, acknowledge your concerns and develop a plan that takes those concerns into account. By plotting out your goals, carefully evaluating your existing tools, and selecting for ease of use, automation, and strategic value, you can shift your business into its next iteration. It’s easy to get stuck in a rut, but your business won’t survive that kind of stagnation. Keep your eyes on the next step.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/15/striking-a-software-balance-how-to-choose-programs-for-efficiency/\">Striking A Software Balance: How To Choose Programs For Efficiency</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 15 Aug 2020 10:15:20 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Striking-a-software-balance.jpg","linkMd5":"1d786385bd83a52d14cc56b324a41e5e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn95@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-26-114_ff89dd1cd4dc1c20.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Striking-a-software-balance.jpg","destWidth":747,"destHeight":498,"sourceBytes":60692,"destBytes":30484,"author":"Frank Landman","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/Striking-a-software-balance-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn99@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-13-163_a3c548f96b7bab7e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195870432},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"Paving the Way: 3 Industries Ripe for Post-Pandemic Change","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171556","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/27/paving-the-way-3-industries-ripe-for-post-pandemic-change/\" title=\"Paving the Way: 3 Industries Ripe for Post-Pandemic Change\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"223\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-18-at-1.36.35-PM-300x223.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-18-at-1.36.35-PM-300x223.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-18-at-1.36.35-PM-215x160.png 215w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-18-at-1.36.35-PM.png 782w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There is no doubt the world is going to change after the pandemic. Some of those changes will be temporary, and some will be more permanent. Most industries had to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/16/thanks-covid-remote-work-is-now-mandatory/\">adapt to remote work</a> and adopt new technology immediately, but it already existed. Change was imminent, but possible. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Take restaurants, for example. A quick shift to takeout was required because eateries had no other option. Returning to the in-person experience will be awkward, at best, but it will be necessary in most cases to continue doing business and turning a profit. We were already using delivery apps as a subset of the food-buying experience, and they&#8217;ll see a continued uptick in the short term. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">But when there&#8217;s a vaccine or a clear and obvious return to safe socializing, most will continue to go to restaurants for the experience. And restaurants aren&#8217;t alone in this.</span></p>\n<h2>The Times, They Are A-Changin&#8217;</h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This will also be true for sporting events, concerts, and other experiences that simply can</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">t be replicated online. Denmark is doing drive-in concerts right now, hosting 500 cars per show. That</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">s something that</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">s interesting in the short term, but it won</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">t permanently replace the concert experience once crowds are permitted again</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Sports may be a smart arena in which to test VR seating experiences, offering a sort of premium option for people viewing from home. Placing cameras in select locations that move with the action wasn</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">t a priority before, but ticket prices were getting tough for the average fan to manage pre-pandemic. That</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">s something that could work in teams&#8217; favor, especially if it takes a couple years for things to get fully back to normal for all consumers.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">And that</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">s perhaps the most important part of industry and technology going forward: People will take some calculated risks for the things and experiences that can</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">t be replaced. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Where we will see the biggest changes? That part is obvious: Those will take place in </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">the industries that were already shifting and needed to shift. </span></p>\n<h2><b>Retail Will Change — It Has No Choice</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The most obvious example could be found in retail. We were already trending online: Malls and big box stores were losing consumers&#8217; interest as more shifted to boutique retailers and online outlets. It took 20 slow years, but people finally got comfortable with ordering almost anything online. Direct-to-consumer companies were able to keep their costs low and disrupt industries. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As consumers, this one seems easy — it</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">s safe to say that the majority of people will opt to keep buying things online, even when there&#8217;s an all-clear. When spending power is back, this will create plenty of online retail opportunities. And for a while, there will be a broadening of brands and entrants. That will consolidate over this decade, but if you</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">re in retail right now, consider market share a free-for-all fight. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There will always be those nostalgic for the mall. There will be a few exceptions that work because they create a unique experience, like Lush and other retailers in the health and beauty realm. But younger generations will be fine with buying products online and getting their tutorials from Instagram and TikTok.</span></p>\n<h2><b>Health and Wellness Are Going Digital</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">On the flip side of cosmetics and beauty are how we treat common illness, get medicine, and stay informed about health. These aspects of well-being will become better suited for telehealth. Most people weren</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">t using it pre-pandemic; if we look closely, health and medicine probably hosted the most antiquated systems people were using. It&#8217;s ironic in a world where medicine has come so far.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Online portals for primary care still look like something from the early 2000s rather than the efficient apps and systems we expect. It</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">s easier to learn a language on your phone than it is to check in with your doctor. That</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">s an opportunity that&#8217;s apparent now. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In every stage of life, expect to see app-based systems that inform, track progress, send updates, and map out health. Seem far-fetched? </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Here</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">s a good example: FARE (Food Allergy Research &#38; Education) conducted a </span><a href=\"https://www.foodallergy.org/resources/learning-early-about-peanut-allergy-leap\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">study</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> on peanut allergies. Approximately 1.6 million kids have these allergies. However, the study found that 80 percent of those allergies could be eliminated by introducing certain allergens early to infants. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Give parents something on their phone that lets them track what they can be doing. Then, kids will grow up with that system and use it as adults, rendering our healthcare system more efficient. There will be bumps, but that&#8217;s where we should be heading. </span></p>\n<h2><b>Education Has Changed for Good</b></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">And now, perhaps the biggest change: online education. There was a solid resistance to online education, even a few months ago, with people feeling the virtual experience deprived students of vital elements. Now that everyone has been forced to become online students and homeschoolers, they&#8217;ve discovered </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">there are some benefits. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Thirty million learners were already using Instructure</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">s tool Canvas to manage online learning, so the technology exists; many colleges and universities already use it. That means that unlike healthcare, where tools will need to be built, there</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">s already an accepted standard in education. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Shifting more to online education has a couple immediate benefits. Students may be able to keep costs down and work more during school with a flexible schedule so they don</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">t have as much student loan debt in their early career. Today</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">’</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">s students get everything on-demand already, making education feel like the next frontier to follow suit and boost productivity and efficiency as a result.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">And on-demand learning will see a bump post-conventional education. As conferences and networking events go on hold, LinkedIn Learning and Skillshare are growing. Forbes8 launched before the pandemic as a digital alternative to conferences and continued education via mobile videos and tutorials. Expect that sector to grow, as well, as the business world shifts its focus from in-person experiences to online development. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The world is always changing. A pandemic and a recession are just accelerating the pace and making people comfortable with certain changes faster. Rather than wait for change to come, businesses should look at how they can influence and shape it.</span></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/27/paving-the-way-3-industries-ripe-for-post-pandemic-change/\">Paving the Way: 3 Industries Ripe for Post-Pandemic Change</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 27 May 2020 14:00:14 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-18-at-1.36.35-PM.png","linkMd5":"26326b43694d681d4b9585da4c4c2494","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn63@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-23-682_15bbc144b1676322.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-18-at-1.36.35-PM.png","destWidth":782,"destHeight":582,"sourceBytes":539505,"destBytes":26380,"author":"Brad Anderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Screen-Shot-2020-05-18-at-1.36.35-PM-300x223.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn56@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-18-843_9203e7b2435f8923.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877327},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"Role of Big Data in the Evolution of the Financial Industry","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169247","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/23/role-of-big-data-in-the-evolution-of-the-financial-industry/\" title=\"Role of Big Data in the Evolution of the Financial Industry\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Role-of-Big-Data-in-the-Evolution-of-the-Financial-Industry-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"big data and financial\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Role-of-Big-Data-in-the-Evolution-of-the-Financial-Industry-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Role-of-Big-Data-in-the-Evolution-of-the-Financial-Industry-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Role-of-Big-Data-in-the-Evolution-of-the-Financial-Industry.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>The financial industry has always been a highly competitive sector. Considering how disruptive technologies like Big Data have reached their maturation, big data can be made a beneficial part of the financial industry. Businesses can harvest big data for security, personalization, and investment decisions.</p>\n<p>Big Data is bringing forth new datasets that can help understand customer behavior and improve the area of predictive analysis. With this data-driven approach, let&#8217;s take a look at how Big Data is transforming the financial industry.</p>\n<h3><strong><b>Enhanced Product Diversity</b></strong></h3>\n<p>As stated previously, Big Data is now highlighting new datasets that are a powerful medium to understand the customer psyche and accordingly offer them new and improved financial services.</p>\n<p>For example, companies now operate <a href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/terms/r/roboadvisor-roboadviser.asp\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\"><u>fintech Robo-advisors</u></a> that offer holistic advice regarding digital investments. Given that these Robo-advisors make use of Big Data to gather insight on customer spending patterns and other parameters for personalization, the advice tendered will also be extremely relevant for the customer. Similarly, other services like loan availability, customer risk analysis, etc. can be included in the list of financial products.</p>\n<h3><strong><b>Market Analytics</b></strong></h3>\n<p>Investors can effectively tap into the potential offered by big data to analyze market trends and make smarter investments. Several companies have cutting-edge predictive systems in place, which can not only understand large volumes of data but also interpret them to offer informed investment decisions.</p>\n<p>With AI-powered trading, investors can increase the profitability of their investments. As a result, the area of market investments is no longer limited to veterans or seasoned investors but also extends to newbies who wish to try their hand at capitalizing on market gains.</p>\n<h3><strong><b>Robust Security</b></strong></h3>\n<p>In the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/14/how-iot-changes-banks-and-fintech-companies/\">financial industry</a>, certain services are more vulnerable to security lapses and frauds. Thus, big data can play a vital role in plugging these gaps and keeping customers safer. Lending institutions and banks are making use of a combination of <u>machine learning and big data</u> (clearinghouse.org) to automate their security. Further, it keeps them two steps ahead of any miscreant who looks at exploiting security loopholes, especially in outdated systems.</p>\n<p>Location intelligence keeps track of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/20/improving-customer-service-using-artificial-intelligence/\">where the customer is using the financial service</a>. It also monitors the kind of products or services that they normally purchase and the number of transactions per cycle. With this information, big data can monitor and highlight deviations from the regular purchase patterns to alert and protect users from fraud.</p>\n<h3><strong><b>Fewer Manual Processes</b></strong></h3>\n<p>Big data will usher with it the era of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/28/will-big-data-be-a-game-changer-for-the-banking-and-finance-sector/\">artificial intelligence and machine learning</a>. As a result, manual and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/09/the-top-work-operating-systems-of-2020/\">repetitive processes like documentation</a>, looking up customer history, etc. can be automated through algorithms. Furthermore, it also decreases the response time while also abiding by the prevailing regulatory structure.</p>\n<p>While cutting down manual processes does offer a customer-centric approach, it is feared that it will jeopardize the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/21/12-things-to-know-about-cybersecurity-now/\">job security of individuals</a> involved in these manual processes. This fear is exacerbated by the fact that technologies are more efficient, more accurate, and much cheaper. However, the displaced human resource can be utilized in new and diversified positions after thorough training.</p>\n<h3><strong><b>Customer-Centric Perks</b></strong></h3>\n<p>Personalized services are one of the key takeaways of big data-assisted financial services. On the basis of the customer&#8217;s spending habits, financial institutions can offer personalized recommendations and upsell products that will meet their needs. With this value-added approach, the companies can develop customer loyalty across all verticals and enjoy a strong consumer presence.</p>\n<h3><strong><b>Accurate Risk Analysis</b></strong></h3>\n<p>Previously, financial services like loans were based on one or two factors like credit score, debt-to-income ratios, etc. However, Big Data has diversified these datasets and introduced several variables that can offer a more concrete and individualistic risk assessment of the individual.</p>\n<p>Machine learning factors in economic conditions, business capital, customer segmentation, etc. in an unbiased manner to identify risky investments or defaulters.</p>\n<h3><strong><b>Key Challenges</b></strong></h3>\n<p>While, on paper, Big Data may appear like the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/11/online-id-verification-a-primer-for-fintech-businesses/\">ultimate solution for all financial institutions</a>, it does bring with it certain challenges. These obstacles may be company-specific and include:</p>\n<h4><strong><b>Data Volume</b></strong></h4>\n<p>Big Data is characterized by three &#8220;V&#8221;s: Volume, Velocity, and Variety. Essentially, it means that Big Data technologies handle vast quantities of data in a static and real-time environment while supporting multiple data types. Financial companies are either unable to compute such volumes of data or cannot access this from multiple channels. Moreover, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/24/why-you-need-a-data-driven-framework-to-guide-employee-experience/\">data silos make it difficult</a> to integrate all the collected Big Data.</p>\n<p>As a result, they are unable to tap into the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/25/iot-can-put-your-data-at-risk-heres-how/\">full potential of Big Data</a>.</p>\n<h4><strong><b>Accuracy and Quality</b></strong></h4>\n<p>Diluted and inaccurate data is of no apparent use. Companies have to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/30/top-2020-wordpress-plugins-for-business-data-visualization/\">make use of reliable data</a> to capitalize on the opportunity. When it comes to the financial industry, it becomes even more imperative to seek accurate and reliable data, which is a major challenge faced by several institutions.</p>\n<h4><strong><b>Security and Integrity</b></strong></h4>\n<p>Banking and financial institutions shall have to maintain the highest standards of safety and security when storing sensitive personal data of their customers. Any <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/04/cyber-security-modern-technology-and-business-threats/\">security breach or possible threat</a> could result in a severe loss of trust. Some companies may not be prepared to offer this level of data security.</p>\n<h4><strong><b>Regulations</b></strong></h4>\n<p>In addition to online regulations, there are several banking regulations regarding data security, consumer privacy, reporting, and transparency. Adhering to these regulations while also keeping to digital safety can be a difficult task to balance.</p>\n<h4><strong><b>Final Thoughts</b></strong></h4>\n<p>In the years to come, it is clear that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/30/the-impact-of-using-big-data-in-industries-today/\">Big Data will revolutionize</a> how we perceive the financial industry. Big data will give companies an insight into customer behavior and profile the individual into certain types. Resultantly, this data can be of extreme value to businesses to further their business and establish a loyal customer base.</p>\n<p>It is only a matter of time until Big Data emerges as a second currency in the financial industry.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Carlos Muza; Unsplash</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/23/role-of-big-data-in-the-evolution-of-the-financial-industry/\">Role of Big Data in the Evolution of the Financial Industry</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 23 May 2020 15:00:41 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Role-of-Big-Data-in-the-Evolution-of-the-Financial-Industry.jpg","linkMd5":"6b0e15a20e05c44acf024070a8a0680d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn47@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-22-987_41a92ed084a0fcb0.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Role-of-Big-Data-in-the-Evolution-of-the-Financial-Industry.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":40495,"destBytes":31400,"author":"Evan Morris","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Role-of-Big-Data-in-the-Evolution-of-the-Financial-Industry-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn43@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-15-109_12539c24b6fc05a9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877252},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"Developing a Secure FinTech App – Best Practice for 2020","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169368","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/12/developing-a-secure-fintech-app-best-practice-for-2020/\" title=\"Developing a Secure FinTech App &#8211; Best Practice for 2020\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Developing-a-Secure-FinTech-App-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"develop secure fintech app\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Developing-a-Secure-FinTech-App-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Developing-a-Secure-FinTech-App-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Developing-a-Secure-FinTech-App-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Developing-a-Secure-FinTech-App-1536x1025.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Developing-a-Secure-FinTech-App.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Over the years, we have seen a large increase in the usage of technology in finance and financial transactions. The introduction of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/23/secrets-of-financial-applications-traits-of-fintech-apps/\">financial applications</a> has ensured that the ease of use and effectiveness, which has been on a constant rise over the decade, is made possible. Here is developing a secure FinTech app &#8212; the best practices for 2020.</p>\n<p>End users can now make financial transactions through a snap of a finger through tech ease of access. But, we have to be wise in how we use the new FinTech apps.</p>\n<p>With the ease of apps <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/29/is-cloud-hosted-data-really-more-secure/\">comes the danger of financial security</a>, which is largely due to sensitive personal and business data shared on financial platforms. Care must be taken or it may result in major vulnerabilities such as data leakages and breaches.</p>\n<p>Recent studies reveal that FinTech startups, about 98% are vulnerable to cyber attacks, risk of theft, and phishing. Considering that the finance industry is one that should be 100% secure in the protection of client data, it begs a question on aspects to consider while developing a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/11/online-id-verification-a-primer-for-fintech-businesses/\">FinTech app to make it more secure</a>, while performing other functions as required.</p>\n<p>We need to look into the possible ways of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/10/what-happens-when-a-tech-startup-fails/\">developing a finance app</a> &#8212; keeping in mind that the security of data is paramount. Many companies forget security in their rush to get an app to market.</p>\n<h2>Integral parts of creating secure FinTech Applications.</h2>\n<p>With the focus on finding a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/10/improving-responses-to-medical-device-vulnerabilities/\">solution to the vulnerabilities</a> associated with developing a fintech app, this is some of the best practices on how to secure a financial app.</p>\n<h3><strong>Establish infrastructural security.</strong></h3>\n<p>It is without a doubt now that a responsible and trustworthy finance firm should consider establishing a secure infrastructure. Irrespective of either going for a private or public cloud storage system, it is imperative to make sure that cloud vendors of choice are security conscious and aligns with the modern data security standards.</p>\n<h3><strong>Establish a secure application logic.</strong></h3>\n<p>It&#8217;s simple, it is just making sure that while developing each stage of the app, security should be of conscious. In every step of the app usage, there should be a feeling of security to it. Questions like what types of data should be collected and safely secured, the passcode, and all other necessary info should be called to mind, not forgetting how best to monitor and secure the data collected.</p>\n<h3><strong>Ensure to write secure code.</strong></h3>\n<p>While it is important that your FinTech app is cross-platform responsive, it’s essential to also develop an algorithm that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/10/a-startup-guide-to-creating-an-ideal-customer-profile/\">allows for easy detection of flaws</a> in case of attacks or a breach. It is advisable to implement the inclusion of input validation and reviewing of data received in the app, while keeping a vivid eye on granting external access, defining clear access rules, and taking all adequate measures to secure appropriate data.</p>\n<h3><strong>Run an App Test.</strong></h3>\n<p>It&#8217;s never enough, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/06/how-to-choose-top-ios-app-development-tools/\">take the time to test that app all over</a>. Through all the processes and steps, perform effective penetration tests, adhere to the standard testing process for FinTech firms, and if necessary, hire professional testers to establish efficient attack resistant code.</p>\n<h3><strong>Ensure API and Web-Server Security.</strong></h3>\n<p>APIs, as well as web-servers, are usually run on mobile devices, and this makes it a target; hence the sensitivity in its security.</p>\n<h3><strong>Encrypt Data.</strong></h3>\n<p>Considering that all info received on the app is <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/16/fintech-boom-is-disrupting-the-way-companies-are-run/\">highly classified and important</a> to your end-users, it&#8217;s very necessary that you consider encrypting all the data collected on your FinTech app. You can introduce various encryption algorithms like AES which is regarded as the safest.</p>\n<h3><strong>Initiate a Payment Blocking Feature.</strong></h3>\n<p>To remain secure, one of the best ways to hinder fraudulent activities on the app is to initiate a payment blocking feature in cases of suspicious activities. This will help to ensure the immediate block of suspicious payment, say a large amount of money transfer, or an unusual location transaction.</p>\n<h4><strong>Conclusion</strong></h4>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/07/revolutionizing-the-banking-sector-with-next-level-mobile-apps/\">Developing a secure FinTech app</a> is a lot of work. It wouldn&#8217;t be FinTech if it&#8217;s not secure after all. It&#8217;s imperative to make sure of testing the app through this procedure, and if necessary, hire professional hands to help with the process.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/12/developing-a-secure-fintech-app-best-practice-for-2020/\">Developing a Secure FinTech App &#8211; Best Practice for 2020</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 12 May 2020 18:00:27 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Developing-a-Secure-FinTech-App.jpg","linkMd5":"7e78b87099d477195ad9d6706fb98aee","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn88@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-09-694_8c4a49ecc664bba5.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Developing-a-Secure-FinTech-App.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1281,"sourceBytes":261600,"destBytes":202436,"author":"Solomon Shojobi","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Developing-a-Secure-FinTech-App-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn99@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-11-631_ba343a4c89de1186.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877604},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"Trends that will Characterize the eCommerce Industry in 2020 and Beyond","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=167187","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/31/trends-that-will-characterize-the-ecommerce-industry-in-2020-and-beyond/\" title=\"Trends that will Characterize the eCommerce Industry in 2020 and Beyond\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Trends-that-will-Characterize-the-eCommerce-Industry-in-2020-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"ecommerce in 2020\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Trends-that-will-Characterize-the-eCommerce-Industry-in-2020-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Trends-that-will-Characterize-the-eCommerce-Industry-in-2020-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Trends-that-will-Characterize-the-eCommerce-Industry-in-2020.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>In 1994, when Amazon was launched, its first package consisting of a Physics book was sent via post. Fast forward to 2020; today, drones are being deployed to deliver packages at customer doorsteps.</p>\n<p>Folks! The utopian future that was depicted in The Jetson’s Family cartoon is almost upon us. eCommerce is the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/08/how-will-it-shape-up-the-future-of-the-internet/\">key driver of the future</a>. Every year, new trends emerge in the eCommerce space at such a giddying space that it is natural to feel missed out.</p>\n<p>Even in 2020, we expect the global eCommerce space to evolve in several aspects. This blog aims to capture such trends that will shape the eCommerce space in 2020.</p>\n<p>What are those trends? Read further.</p>\n<h3><strong>Developments in on-demand deliveries.</strong></h3>\n<p>In 2019, eCommerce deliveries became time-sensitive. Numerous studies have proven that customers are willing to shell out extra bucks for same-day delivery or scheduled deliveries.<a href=\"https://www.pwc.com/gx/en/industries/consumer-markets/consumer-insights-survey/2018/survey/delivery-expectation.html\"> PwC’s Global Consumer Insights Survey 2018</a> found that over<i> 40% of online shoppers said they would pay an additional charge for same-day delivery.</i></p>\n<p>From an eCommerce business perspective, same day deliveries can result in higher sales volumes. Another allied benefit is that there will be a reduction in the need for warehouse space. Thanks to the fast-paced deliveries made possible by last-mile deliveries, online stores will need only smaller distribution centers to store stocks.</p>\n<p>Now, how will the delivery scene change in 2020? Amazon’s Prime Air hints at a future when most deliveries could be made by drones<i></i>. In fact, in an interview<a href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/news/amazons-jeff-bezos-looks-to-the-future/\"> with CBS News</a>, given in 2013, Jeff Bezos has hinted at the future when Amazon will deliver packages via drones. He claims that more than 86% of Amazon packages weigh less than 5 pounds. Read this fact, along with customers are willing to pay for immediate/same-day delivery, in 2020, we can expect to see more drones flying to deliver packages.</p>\n<p><img class=\"size-full wp-image-167188\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/amazon-drone.jpg\" alt=\"eCommerce trends in 2020\" width=\"720\" height=\"480\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/amazon-drone.jpg 720w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/amazon-drone-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/amazon-drone-240x160.jpg 240w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 720px) 100vw, 720px\" /></p>\n<p>Source: <a href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2013/12/1/5164340/delivery-drones-are-coming-jeff-bezos-previews-half-hour-shipping\">Theverge</a></p>\n<h3><strong>Data privacy will take center stage.</strong></h3>\n<p>Businesses today have endless touchpoints from where they can collect and analyze user data. Web browsing cookies, mobile app usage, website behavior heatmaps, to name a few. However, reckless data collection of users could spell doom for the business. eCommerce retailers have been the infamous lot for sending too many retargeting ads and emails <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/13/it-trends-of-the-future-that-are-worth-paying-attention-to-today/\">that infiltrate user’s data privacy</a>.</p>\n<p>Also, there have been umpteen cases where brands have been found to be lethargic in protecting user data. The security breaches of British Airways, Equifax, Exactis, Cathay Pacific are a few notable examples. Accordingexciting to PWC&#8217;s<a href=\"https://www.pwc.com/us/en/services/consulting/cybersecurity/digital-trust/2018-insights.html\"> 2018 Digital Trust Insights</a>, “although companies<i> encourage consumers to entrust them with their data, only 53% include proactive management of cyber and privacy risks in their digital transformation plans.”</i></p>\n<p>In 2020 and years to follow, such data privacy hindering activities will become restricted. GDPR was just a beginning to such data collection controls that hamper user’s data privacy. As data privacy takes center stage, businesses will be forced to implement new data protection measures or revamp their existing processes.</p>\n<h3><strong>Voice shopping to gallop in volumes.</strong></h3>\n<p>Amazon&#8217;s Echo has 10% penetration of US homes, Google&#8217;s Home, 4%, and Microsoft&#8217;s Cortana, 2% — this is the estimated market penetration of virtual assistants in US homes. Do you know what is the most obvious feature of all these virtual assistants?</p>\n<h4><b>Voice search. </b></h4>\n<p>Right from checking how the day’s weather is going to pan out for the day to streaming on-demand music, there is so much that these virtual assistants can go. Furthermore, they have become catalysts for eCommerce as well. <a href=\"https://www.occstrategy.com/media/1285/the-talking-shop_uk.pdf\">The talking shop – the rise of voice commerce report</a> by OC&#38;C Strategy Consultants have found that by 2022, voice shopping is expected to jump to $40 billion in the US and by $5 Billion in the UK.</p>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-full wp-image-167189\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/voice-commerce-sales-2017-2022-02.jpeg\" alt=\"eCommerce trends Voice Shopping\" width=\"600\" height=\"552\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/voice-commerce-sales-2017-2022-02.jpeg 600w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/voice-commerce-sales-2017-2022-02-300x276.jpeg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/voice-commerce-sales-2017-2022-02-174x160.jpeg 174w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></p>\n<p>Source:<a href=\"https://voicebot.ai/2018/03/05/voice-shopping-reach-40-billion-u-s-5-billion-uk-2022/\">voicebot.ai</a></p>\n<p>Modern eCommerce retailers, if they wish to stay relevant in a business landscape led by voice search, will be forced to adapt their shopping channels to voice shopping. And 2020 will see more developments in that direction.</p>\n<h3><strong>Immersive experiences will become differentiators.</strong></h3>\n<p>One thing that makes eCommerce enticing for online shoppers is the experience of viewing, comparing, and making their final pick from an almost endless list of options. Until now, that experience was limited to watching 2D images of products from multiple angles with zoom-in and zoom-out feature.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/20/how-voice-technology-is-changing-the-financial-industry/\">Today’s customers</a> mostly made up of millennial age groups, want <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/09/the-rise-and-rise-of-mobile-payment-technology/\">immersive shopping experiences</a> packaged within their few-inch screen mobile screens.</p>\n<p>Luckily for eCommerce retailers, several new technologies can dish out immersive experiences that captivate users — augmented reality being one among the top of them. Augmented reality is one of the mixed reality technologies that embed digital snippets of data atop physical objects or surfaces.</p>\n<p>In eCommerce,<a href=\"https://www.intelivita.co.uk/blog/how-augmented-reality-is-promise-for-ecommerce-development\"> augmented reality has several applications</a>, including real-time product try-ons in actual physical surroundings. Virtual mirrors for fashion shopping to cite an example. Another real-world example if that of IKEA’s mobile app. It allows users to place their choice of furniture items in actual physical surroundings.</p>\n<p>The benefit of AR in eCommerce is twofold — first, it makes shopping enticing. Secondly, it helps reduce the volume of returns substantially. ECommerce brands that take heed in using immersive technologies will be able to differentiate themselves from the rest of the fold.</p>\n<h3><strong>Small businesses to become a dominant force.</strong></h3>\n<p>It is no secret that is the big enterprises that always hog the limelight with their dizzying stock prices and globe-spanning sales territories. But, there is another side to the story. Small businesses, typically floated by solopreneurs or by a small team of ambitious individuals, have been rising in number and volumes in recent years. They have fewer than 500 employees and yet have managed to penetrate markets that were earlier reserved for the bigwigs.</p>\n<p>According to the US Small Business Administration, there are nearly 30 million small businesses in the United States, employing <a href=\"https://www.sba.gov/sites/default/files/advocacy/All_States.pdf\">47.8 percent of US workers</a>. Also, studies by<a href=\"https://clutch.co/website-builders/resources/small-business-websites-2018\">Clutch.co-found that</a> <i>nearly Two-Thirds of Small Businesses Rely on Websites to Connect with Customers. At the beginning of 2018, almost two-thirds (64%) of small businesses have a website.</i></p>\n<p>In other words, it is safe, to sum up, that small businesses are a dominant force that will gather momentum in 2020 and beyond. In addition to generating employment, they will also leverage the power of eCommerce to carve a niche for themselves in a global market.</p>\n<h3><strong>Along with mobile shopping, digital wallets would also become mainstream.</strong></h3>\n<p>It is no secret that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/07/how-to-avoid-becoming-the-next-victim-of-a-data-breach/\">mobile commerce has grown</a> with leaps and bounds in recent years. However, there has been one catalyst feature that can be cited as the prime reason for this rapid growth of mobile commerce. It is a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/09/the-rise-and-rise-of-mobile-payment-technology/\">mobile payment facility</a> like digital wallets. The mobile payment industry is projected to reach <a href=\"https://www.alliedmarketresearch.com/mobile-payments-market\">$4,574 billion</a> by 2023.</p>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-full wp-image-167192\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/ecommerce-trends-mobile-payment-2.png\" alt=\"ecommerce-trends-mobile-payment\" width=\"800\" height=\"504\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/ecommerce-trends-mobile-payment-2.png 800w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/ecommerce-trends-mobile-payment-2-300x189.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/ecommerce-trends-mobile-payment-2-254x160.png 254w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/ecommerce-trends-mobile-payment-2-160x102.png 160w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 800px) 100vw, 800px\" /></p>\n<p>source: <a href=\"https://www.growcode.com/blog/ecommerce-trends/\">growcode</a></p>\n<p>There are several benefits that mobile payments and mobile wallets offer customers that make them enticing for customers.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The convenience of not carrying a wallet or plastic card</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Quick online ordering without leaving the mobile app screen</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Loyalty points and rewards on transactions</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The facility of sending/receiving the money to contacts and most frequently used outlets</li>\n</ul>\n<h3><strong>More inclination toward sustainable practices.</strong></h3>\n<p>Greta Thunberg’s flaring speech on <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/06/smart-cities-solving-todays-healthcare-challenges/\">climate change</a> sends ripples around the world. It was heard by businesses as well. After all, they are the biggest consumers of natural resources. Also, almost 90% of eCommerce orders being <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2014/12/10/google-cardboard-sdk-apps-virtual-reality-vr-headset/\">shipped in corrugated boxes</a>, which mounts huge pressure on the rainforests.</p>\n<p>With rising awareness about climate change, shoppers are inclining towards brands that have adopted eco-friendly practices. Top among them is eco-friendly packing. According to Nielsen, <i>73% of consumers say they would definitely change their consumption habits to reduce their environmental impact.</i></p>\n<p>Along with eco-friendly packing, consumers are also becoming increasingly <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/10/visual-merchandising-online-startups-cannot-afford-to-overlookvisual-merchandising-online-startups-cannot-afford-to-overlook/\">conscious about the products</a> they use and their impact on the environment. The same Neilsen study quoted above mentions that there has been a tremendous <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/25/ecommerce-how-to-survive-its-troughs/\">increase in consumers</a> who are willing to pay a premium price for organic products.</p>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-large wp-image-167194\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Healthy-and-premium-754x719.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"754\" height=\"719\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Healthy-and-premium-754x719.png 754w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Healthy-and-premium-300x286.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Healthy-and-premium-168x160.png 168w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Healthy-and-premium.png 1000w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 754px) 100vw, 754px\" /></p>\n<p>Source: <a href=\"https://www.nielsen.com/us/en/insights/report/2018/unpacking-the-sustainability-landscape/\">nielsen</a></p>\n<h3><strong>Better return policies in the cards.</strong></h3>\n<p>The pleasure of online shopping also has a peril to it. Customers are wary of the quality, the fit, and the rightness of their choices. As a result, returns skyrocketed, hindering the profitability of online stores.<a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/871365/reverse-logistics-cost-united-states/\"> Statista</a> (<i>gated</i>) found that in 2018, U.S. return delivery costs were estimated to be 381 billion U.S. dollars. This figure has been steadily increasing and is predicted to reach 550 billion U.S. dollars by 2020.</p>\n<p>Unfortunately, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/10/09/the-customer-care-bar-has-never-been-higher-so-brands-must-automate-to-keep-up/\">free shipping, as well as free returns</a>, are something that customers want as default offerings from any online store. In the past, and even today, this has put online stores in a spot to figure out innovative ways to meet customer expectations.</p>\n<p>There are two brands that have turned this challenge into their competitive advantage. The first is Amazon Go, which <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/06/4-unique-growth-tactics-for-2020/\">allows customers to pick up products</a>, pay for it through their Amazon Pay app without having to wait for a second at the cash counter — because there isn’t any. Although <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/07/31/will-we-someday-be-able-to-do-everything-through-online-platforms/\">Amazon Go is limited to groceries</a>, we can envision a future when this lightning fast way of shopping will become mainstream.</p>\n<p>After Amazon, it is Warby Parker that seems to have hit the sweet spot in impressing customers. Their <a href=\"https://www.warbyparker.com/home-try-on\">Home Try-On</a> facility allows users to select five frames to test out for five days — and all the five frames will be shipped to customers for free.</p>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-large wp-image-167193\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Warby-Parker-Try-At-Home-900x336.jpg\" alt=\"ecommerce customer policy\" width=\"900\" height=\"336\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Warby-Parker-Try-At-Home-900x336.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Warby-Parker-Try-At-Home-300x112.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Warby-Parker-Try-At-Home-260x97.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Warby-Parker-Try-At-Home.jpg 951w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<p>Source:<a href=\"https://bespokeunit.com/articles/style/warby-parker-home-try-on-glasses-review/\">bespokeuni</a></p>\n<h2>What’s in store for eCommerce in 2020</h2>\n<p>In the 1990s, when Amazon was in its initial stages,eCommerce development was hardly heard of. It was not even a part of the software development vocabulary. Today, it is a Trillion dollar industry that is enabling individuals to small teams to build their own online stores rich with experiences aimed to win customers.</p>\n<p>2020 is going to be yet another year when <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2013/07/15/how-retailers-spy-on-you-in-the-real-world/\">online retailers will experiment</a> with new strategies and tactics to woo customers and to retain them. There are solid trends that signal these <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/10/visual-merchandising-online-startups-cannot-afford-to-overlookvisual-merchandising-online-startups-cannot-afford-to-overlook/\">oncoming strategies and tactics</a>. From drone deliveries to better return policies and everything in between, there is so much to look forward to.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/01/31/data-privacy-attitudes-and-connected-cars-a-deeper-look/\">Data privacy</a>, which was often overlooked in the previous years, will become a serious priority for all. Similarly, small businesses will also rise to the occasion to give solid competition for established players.</p>\n<p>All said it is safe to assume that 2020 is going to be an interesting year for eCommerce retailers and consumers.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/31/trends-that-will-characterize-the-ecommerce-industry-in-2020-and-beyond/\">Trends that will Characterize the eCommerce Industry in 2020 and Beyond</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" Sarvaiya","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Trends-that-will-Characterize-the-eCommerce-Industry-in-2020-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn24@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-09-594_94c2797f1794b00a.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/amazon-drone.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn63@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-20-457_08fcc9244390fea2.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/voice-commerce-sales-2017-2022-02.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn92@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-23-952_539772d883ce9ba5.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/ecommerce-trends-mobile-payment-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn43@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-19-062_504ac94855c913ad.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Healthy-and-premium-754x719.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn40@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-22-108_bf96a51cf84f9c0b.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Warby-Parker-Try-At-Home-900x336.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn87@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-27-914_a013c2c40d6adb8d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878965},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","title":"Maintaining Perfect Health in the World of New Technologies and Devices","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170105","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/26/maintaining-perfect-health-in-the-world-of-new-technologies-and-devices/\" title=\"Maintaining Perfect Health in the World of New Technologies and Devices\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Maintaining-Perfect-Health-in-the-World--300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"maintaining perfect health\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Maintaining-Perfect-Health-in-the-World--300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Maintaining-Perfect-Health-in-the-World--260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Maintaining-Perfect-Health-in-the-World-.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In the era of technologies and digital screens, millions of products are marketed as “healthy.” But why is it that a growing number of people are challenged with chronic diseases and mental illnesses? Here is <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/01/how-exercise-can-help-you-sleep-better/\">maintaining perfect health</a> in the world of new technologies and devices.<br />\n</span></p>\n<h3>What apps are you more likely to click on?</h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While we have nutrition and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/23/how-mobile-apps-are-improving-access-to-healthcare-services/\">fitness apps at our fingertips,</a> the harsh reality is that these live-saving apps and tech are nowhere near as popular as fast food delivery apps. Internet addiction and trolls can also put some vulnerable people at risk of mental illnesses.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">To live a </span><a href=\"https://thisladyblogs.com/top-5-daily-ways-to-take-care-for-happier-mind-and-healthy-body/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">healthy happy life</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> in the midst of convenient choices, we need to embrace the power of technology while practicing the most primitive ways of achieving health. </span></p>\n<h2><b>Here are 5 secrets of how you can use but not abuse technology to be healthy.</b></h2>\n<p><b>Unleash the power of your genetics</b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Recently, </span><a href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/crispr-gene-editing-tool-used-inside-humans-for-the-first-time/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">CRISPR-based therapy</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> was used to treat inherited blindness for the very first time in human history. This officially brings human gene-editing from science fiction to reality.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Your DNA is the blueprint for building you &#8211; your eye color, ancestry, and risks of genetic diseases.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If your health is partly determined by genetics, doesn’t it make sense to crack this code and prepare for what the future holds?</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Indeed, commercial genetic testing has gained rapid popularity all over the world. Dozens of companies like </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2014/02/13/genetrainer-fitness-genomics/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">23anMe</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> are competing to offer you the most comprehensive genetic interpretations.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In our genetic makeup, millions of single-nucleotide polymorphisms, or SNPs, hold the secrets to your:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Disease risks and tendencies</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Response to medications, food, and exercise</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Physical traits and mental health</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Plus more!</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With this information, you can take active actions to improve your lifestyle, inform your doctor, and manage potential diseases. Our medical system is moving towards an exciting era of personalized data-driven practice as we speak.</span></p>\n<h3><b>Know your gut bacteria</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Did you know that our gut has 10 times the amount of cells compared to everything else in the body combined?</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It’s huge. Our gut houses at least 1000 different types of bacteria &#8211; the good, the bad, and the ugly.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For good bacteria to flourish in our gut, we need to feed them with fermentable fiber from plant-based foods, also known as “prebiotics.” With these healthy fuels, the good gut bacteria start to:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Protect you against infections and inflammation</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Produce healthy short-chain fatty acids </span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Help you manage weight and chronic diseases</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It even improves your mood!</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If you are serious about optimizing your gut health, you can even get a microbiome sequencing that tells you exactly what bacteria are in your gut. Compared to conventional DNA sequencing, this is a relatively new technology. Nevertheless, </span><a href=\"https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fimmu.2018.02868/full\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">researchers</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> are very excited about harnessing the massive amount of gut information for disease diagnosis and treatment.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In the near future, it may become commonplace to get personalized nutrition plans and health care based on your genes and gut bacteria.</span></p>\n<h3><b>Connect with nature’s herbs and minerals</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In today’s fast-paced society, cognitive technologies like nootropics are favored by many people who want 48 hours out of their day. </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Unfortunately, scientists have said that there is no strong evidence in synthetic cognitive supplements. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If you still want ways to boost your productivity, natural compounds, and </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">herbs for health</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> (herbcottage.com) care may be the safer option that actually works. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Have you heard of these popular natural cognitive enhancers?</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/08/6-supplements-to-solve-workplace-focus-problems/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Caffeine</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">: A natural stimulant found in coffee, cocoa, and tea, which boosts alertness</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Rhodiola Rosea</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">: </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> is a supplement derived from the herb </span><i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Rhodiola Rosea</span></i><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, which is often used in Chinese medicine to promote well-being and healthy brain function.</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Fulvic minerals</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">: Naturally occurring organic acid found in humus that improve gut health and restore body minerals</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/08/6-supplements-to-solve-workplace-focus-problems/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Ginkgo biloba</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">: Extracted from the Ginkgo leaves, which has shown benefits for mental processing and working memory</span></li>\n</ul>\n<h3><b>Replace stress hormones with happy hormones</b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Technology and devices are great for offering valuable data, but that also means that we are constantly bombarded with information. How do we strive for a balance between performance and burnout?</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The answer lies in our biology. Our body has intricate levels of different hormones that try to keep things in balance. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">When we are stressed, our body produces stress hormones like cortisol. The hormone itself is not bad. It actually helps us control blood sugar levels, metabolism and blood pressure. However, a constantly high level of cortisol is known to harm both physical and mental health. In women, high cortisol also contributes to low libido and abnormal menstrual cycles.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">But luckily, we are also naturally equipped with happy hormones like </span><a href=\"https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/320839#what-are-endorphins\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">endorphins</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. These are our natural painkillers that reduce stress and pain. They activate opioid receptors in the brain, but without getting your addicted.</span></p>\n<h3><b>How do you replace stress hormones with happy hormones? </b></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There is no need for supplements. The most basic ways of relaxation can do the trick:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Physical exercises, such as </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/18/5-outdoor-activities-for-beating-office-burnout/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">outdoor activities</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> triggers endorphin release.</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://commons.clarku.edu/surj/vol1/iss1/10?utm_source=commons.clarku.edu%2Fsurj%2Fvol1%2Fiss1%2F10&#38;utm_medium=PDF&#38;utm_campaign=PDFCoverPages\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Meditation</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> can reduce the levels of stress hormones including cortisol.</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Music performance boosts endorphin levels, including singing, dancing, and drumming.</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>Nourish your social connections</b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">We have to thank the internet and electronic devices for bringing distant people closer. But at the same time, they can also push our close family and friends apart. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Let’s not forget that the most </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">primitive and effective way of happiness, even in the era of technology</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, is genuine human interaction.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The </span><a href=\"https://www.health.harvard.edu/newsletter_article/the-health-benefits-of-strong-relationships\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Harvard Medical School</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> reports that people who have great relationships and social support tend to be happier and healthier. These include satisfying marriages, family, friends, and community. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In a landmark paper published in the journal </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Science</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, researchers found that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2015/01/08/under-armour-record-mapmyfitness-follow-model/\">lack of social connections</a> puts people at increased risk of obesity, smoking, and high blood pressure. In contrast, those who do nourish their social relationships have better longevity, immune system, self-esteem, and many more health advantages.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It might not sound like a mind-blowing secret, but it is something that all of us forget sometimes. Social connections, just like our body and mind, need to be nourished. We can only live happily with new technologies when we use them to connect, but not disconnect.</span></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/go-trax-scooter.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>From college campuses and workplaces to around town, electric scooters are gaining in popularity across the country. I&#8217;ve been eager to try one out so I started with the Gotrax Xr Elite Electric Scooter because this brand has been making a wide range of electric scooters for some time. Here&#8217;s my review.</p>\n<h2>About the Electric Scooter</h2>\n<p>Available in black only, the Gotrax Xr electric scooter is a low-priced model. It is foldable and has a large deck to stand on. There is an anti-slip material that is cushioned and helps keep me in place while riding.</p>\n<p>The electric scooter has a smart display that is easy to read while riding. It is where you control the headlights as well as access cruise control, see the speedometer, and check on battery life.</p>\n<p>There are also fairly large tires, an upgraded kickstand, powered LED taillights that activate when the scooter is on, and six retro-reflectors for good visibility at night-time.</p>\n<p>It goes about 18 miles before needing to be charged again. The battery also has protection from overcharging, over-discharging, temperature, short-circuiting, open circuiting, and over-current. The most weight it can take is about 220 pounds.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-173973\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/go-trax-scooter-xr-elite-300x225.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"600\" height=\"450\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/go-trax-scooter-xr-elite-300x225.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/go-trax-scooter-xr-elite-900x675.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/go-trax-scooter-xr-elite-213x160.jpg 213w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/go-trax-scooter-xr-elite-1536x1152.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/go-trax-scooter-xr-elite.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></p>\n<h2>What I Like and What Could Be Better</h2>\n<p id=\"2-highlights\">For the price, it offers good ride quality, durability, and range for a budget-friendly price. The top speed of 15mph isn&#8217;t too bad, either. This speed comes from the upgraded 300W motor.</p>\n<p>It doesn&#8217;t weigh much, making it easy to take with me in the car to enjoy it at the park or beach. The folding mechanism is easy to use. Overall, the scooter also has a good waterproof rating.</p>\n<p>The electric scooter did fairly well at acceleration and hill climbs. Since it&#8217;s a budget model, I didn&#8217;t expect much here as I was mostly interested in taking it on flat surfaces around the neighborhood. The front and rear brakes also work well. It features disc braking and anti-lock electrical braking for responsive braking. Also, I am a big fan of the bell on it, too.</p>\n<p>They have a U.S.-based customer support team where I got fast, friendly and educated service.</p>\n<p>On the downside, there is some vibration on rougher roads, but again my expectations weren&#8217;t high, knowing I had selected an entry-level price scooter. The brakes also take some getting used to, but after practicing on the scooter a few times this was much better.</p>\n<h2>Where to Buy</h2>\n<p>The electric scooter costs $399. It comes with a three-month warranty, free shipping, a thirty-day return policy, and is available on the <a href=\"https://gotrax.com/products/xr-elite-commuting-electric-scooter?variant=31408323690611\">company&#8217;s website.</a></p>\n<h2>Overall Thoughts</h2>\n<p>The Gotrax Xr Elite is a budget-friendly electric scooter that is a good starter model. It has long-range and is durable enough to use every day. If you are looking for more features and technology, I&#8217;d recommend going with one of the more expensive electric scooter models.</p>\n<p>Currently, their website shows they are sold out because this is one of their most popular models, but they also note they will soon have more. This is a great gift for the commuter or college student!</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/06/gotrax-xr-elite-an-electric-scooter-with-kicki/\">Gotrax Xr
