+0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/PortablePizzaOven.jpg","linkMd5":"3df6fda6683bba048e59bdc38c998554","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn68@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-22-395_97e968a9aeeb4f79.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/PortablePizzaOven.jpg","destWidth":1000,"destHeight":562,"sourceBytes":309197,"destBytes":42396,"author":"Deanna Ritchie","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/PortablePizzaOven-300x169.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn87@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-17-690_a0724a81a6724939.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/GozneyRoccbox-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn91@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-12-266_ce2f4d6d224306b9.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/pizza-van-conversions-gozney-pizza-ovens-01-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn88@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-14-123_0031da97d0b70272.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195873804},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","title":"On-Demand Money Making Business Model for Startups","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169484","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/29/on-demand-money-making-business-model-for-startups/\" title=\"On-Demand Money Making Business Model for Startups\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"257\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/On-Demand-Money-Making-Business-Model-for-Startups-300x257.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"on-demand business model\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/On-Demand-Money-Making-Business-Model-for-Startups-300x257.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/On-Demand-Money-Making-Business-Model-for-Startups-187x160.png 187w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/On-Demand-Money-Making-Business-Model-for-Startups.png 526w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>It wasn’t so long ago when we used to stand in queues waiting for taxis or go to local stores for grocery shopping. However, owing to the rise of on-demand businesses &#8211; stepping out of our homes for our daily needs seems to be an idea of another era. And the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/11/5-digital-health-technologies-helping-to-stop-the-coronavirus-pandemic/\">COVID-19 crises</a> has sealed the deal.</p>\n<h2><b>On-demand business, what is that?</b></h2>\n<p>The <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2015/07/23/build-an-uber-for-x/\">on-demand</a> business model is also known as an access economy or a shared economy.</p>\n<p>It basically fulfills the customer’s demand for goods and services immediately. Here, the ever-growing digital platforms make use of existing but unutilized assets and infrastructure.</p>\n<p>The fundamental idea behind this is &#8211; Access is better than Ownership. And isn’t that a modern-day fact? If you can share or have access to goods and services immediately &#8211; there are low chances that you’ll prefer buying it.</p>\n<p>Owing to its benefits, not only consumers but on-demand businesses also rely on renting rather than buying the service permanently. That means they work with freelancers rather than hiring full-time employees.</p>\n<h2><b>On-demand businesses on the rise.</b></h2>\n<p>There has been a 360-degree revolution in technology that has encompassed the businesses and customers both. Now due to the coronavirus COVID-19 pandemic &#8212; on-demand appshave seen an unprecedented surge (spaceo.ca).</p>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-medium\" src=\"https://www.spaceo.ca/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/a.jpg\" alt=\"guide to making on demand app during flu season\" width=\"730\" height=\"400\" /></p>\n<p>Customers are no longer satisfied by getting what they want at a reasonable price- they not only want to have the best but also want to have it in a way that enhances their experience. And they are willing to pay for that. Businesses now understand the pain point, and if you observe &#8211; the ones that serve their customers with ‘convenience’ become most profitable.</p>\n<p>A report from Statista states: <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/topics/2477/online-shopping-behavior/\">42%</a> of consumers prefer online shopping. If you’re phone any of them, you know why.</p>\n<p>With <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2015/03/13/mobile-future-notifications-not-apps/\">mobile apps</a>, the convenience factor has increased multifold. The ease of accessing a convenient service is what plays a role in attracting customers. All customers have to do is make a click, and the business will be there to serve them at their doorsteps in the most time and cost-effective fashion.</p>\n<p>The on-demand business is flourishing and how. Here’s a pie chart that shows the usage and spendings of on-demand companies.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://d3l69s690g8302.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/11082641/d50c80cc-108a-4866-a71e-c6a38e3fa806-624x624.png\"><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https://d3l69s690g8302.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/11082641/d50c80cc-108a-4866-a71e-c6a38e3fa806-624x624.png\" alt=\"On-demand app ideas\" width=\"624\" height=\"624\" /></a></p>\n<ul>\n<li>86.5 Million Americans have used an on-demand service.</li>\n<li>45 Million US people have offered services in the On-demand sector.</li>\n<li>22.4 Million users annually spend around $57.6 billion on On-demand services.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Businesses need to solve their prospects’ problems and that too in the most convenient way.</p>\n<p>On-demand business models leverage this fact and hence are thriving like never before.</p>\n<p><b>A report by Harvard Business Review states: the on-demand industry is attracting 22.4 million customers annually, who spend $57.6 billion on them.</b></p>\n<p>It wouldn’t be justified to talk about On-demand businesses and shared economy and miss out on Uber. The primary reason that Uber excelled is that it made the overall experience of commuting &#8211; convenient and cost-effective. From booking a cab to making the payment &#8211; it takes care of the whole journey. The entire service is brought to the users on a single user-friendly platter.</p>\n<h3><b>Reasons that make on-demand businesses profitable.</b></h3>\n<p>Uber has managed to raise approximately $10.2 billion, Urban Clap has raised nearly $35 million, and Ola Cabs has raised almost $1.18 billion after having completed seven stages of funding.</p>\n<p>Do you think this was possible if there wasn’t a demand and supply gap to fulfill?</p>\n<p>The on-demand businesses don’t rely on intuition and guesswork. Rather they serve their customers with what they need the most &#8211; efficient, convenient, technically updated, and cost and time-effective solutions.</p>\n<p>That’s the reason on-demand business models prove to be a success for investors, customers, and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/10/29/5-misconceptions-you-should-know-about-before-launching-your-tech-startup/\">startup</a> owners.</p>\n<p>It becomes an attractive space for investors because they can predict the trends resulting from technological and business integration.</p>\n<p>The customers, on the other hand, are always on a lookout for better alternatives. This makes the on-demand industry more competitive and drenched in scope. The increasing demand is the reason that there’s no dearth of investors and industry tycoons who are more than willing to test the waters.</p>\n<h4><b>Another reason for its flourishing nature is that it is can be linked to all types of industries.</b></h4>\n<p>If we think about it, many apps practically make our every day lives hassle-free.</p>\n<p>From hyperlocal delivery to healthcare to home and local services, the possibilities of on-demand businesses are limitless.</p>\n<p>This means no matter what industry you choose, as long as your model is equipped with speed, accuracy, convenience, and quality &#8211; your business will be profitable.</p>\n<h3><b>The deciding variables for a successful on-demand business</b><b> </b></h3>\n<ol>\n<li><b> Degree of commoditization &#8211; </b>The rule is simple. The more the number of variables that users care about in the context of a product or service, the less commoditized the service/product is, and vice-versa. Think about Uber &#8211; fewer variables, more commoditized. You need to identify what <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/13/does-your-business-really-need-an-ai-solution/\">suits your business model</a>.</li>\n<li><b> Pricing structure </b>&#8211; There are two options you have &#8211; a singular pricing structure or for the complete platform. You need to choose one that fits your needs depending on your degree of commoditization.</li>\n<li><b> Delivery option &#8211; </b>Here again, you have the option of choosing between scheduled and instant delivery. However, no matter where you start, you can always expand from one to the other.</li>\n<li><b> Stakeholders- </b>The number of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/17/b2b-customer-experience-13-actions-bringing-better-results/\">stakeholders depends on your business model</a>. Most on-demand businesses, however, have at least two stakeholders. For example, Uber has two stakeholders- passengers and drivers.</li>\n<li><b> Supply Side and Platform relationship</b>&#8211; To <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/07/5-signs-that-you-are-ready-to-scale-business-and-deploy-innovation/\">run a successful business,</a> you’ll have to choose &#8212; whether to aggregate the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/25/ecommerce-how-to-survive-its-troughs/\">existing small businesses</a> or to contract the supply. It is easy to achieve the former.</li>\n</ol>\n<h4><b>Final Thoughts</b></h4>\n<p>The <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/12/04/building-an-iot-ecosystem-that-fuels-business-transformation/\">on-demand business models</a> are on a roller coaster ride that will only go up in the coming years. The future is bound to belong to on-demand businesses that will serve their customers with enhanced experience and convenience.</p>\n<p>These business models are indeed a goldmine for startups as the present-day market conditions are entirely in their favor. The technologies that make it possible are new but rapidly evolving.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/29/on-demand-money-making-business-model-for-startups/\">On-Demand Money Making Business Model for Startups</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 29 May 2020 18:00:53 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/On-Demand-Money-Making-Business-Model-for-Startups-300x257.png","linkMd5":"99f9c07d06a673c6838e0f6df1114536","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn29@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-07-928_0063b4d722af769f.webp","destWidth":300,"destHeight":257,"sourceBytes":127879,"destBytes":11236,"author":"Sourodip Biswas","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/On-Demand-Money-Making-Business-Model-for-Startups-300x257.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn29@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-07-928_0063b4d722af769f.webp","https://www.spaceo.ca/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/a.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn24@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-17-987_b484a3a6d318143c.webp","https://d3l69s690g8302.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/11082641/d50c80cc-108a-4866-a71e-c6a38e3fa806-624x624.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn63@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-17-349_9dd2e9ea5cecc967.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195875493},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/02/manufacturers-approach-cybersecurity-like-your-assembly-line/\" title=\"Manufacturers: Approach Cybersecurity Like Your Assembly Line\"><img width=\"300\" https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Approach-Cybersecurity-Like-Your-Assembly-Line-720x719.png 720w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Approach-Cybersecurity-Like-Your-Assembly-Line-160x160.png 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Approach-Cybersecurity-Like-Your-Assembly-Line.png 1002w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>To combat cyberattacks, which pose <a href=\"https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2020/03/coronavirus-pandemic-cybersecurity/\">a growing threat during the COVID-19 pandemic</a>, manufacturers should take a page out of their own book and apply an assembly line approach to their cybersecurity.</p>\n<h2>More connected devices on the factory floor mean more opportunities for hackers to attack.</h2>\n<p>Even after the <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2017/dec/30/wannacry-petya-notpetya-ransomware\">infamous cyberattacks of WannaCry and NotPetya</a> that cost manufacturers millions of dollars in 2017, nearly half of all manufacturing companies still <a href=\"https://www.sikich.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/SKCH-MD-Report-2019-1.pdf\">suffered a data breach in the past year</a>. Threats are evolving so quickly that manufacturers simply can’t keep up.</p>\n<p>But by breaking down cybersecurity into its independent parts, manufacturers can better prepare for inevitable data breach attempts.</p>\n<h2><b>Growing IIoT cybersecurity risks.</b></h2>\n<p>Despite the security risks associated with the Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT), connected devices have far more advantages than disadvantages on the factory floor.</p>\n<p>The manufacturing industry must embrace digital transformation to remain resilient amid a tight labor market, shifting trade policies, and a global economy hit hard by COVID-19.</p>\n<p>IIoT devices can help manufacturers improve performance, access consistent reports and insights, improve process visibility and customize their capabilities more seamlessly.</p>\n<h3>IIoT devices are particularly vulnerable to attack.</h3>\n<ul>\n<li>Many black box devices like smart sensors and programmable logic controllers (PLCs) run on outdated code — in some cases <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/08/sellyourmacs-brian-burke-on-the-true-costs-of-old-tech/\">code from the 90s</a> — with bolted-on modules.<br />\nThe <a href=\"https://www.wired.com/story/urgent-11-ipnet-vulnerable-devices/\">decades-old code often contains bugs</a> that put devices at risk of dedicated-denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks, or even total takeovers.</li>\n<li>Additionally, many of these black box devices aren’t set up or configured by IT departments. For example, most manufacturers choose which milling machines to purchase based on how quickly they turn out parts, not how strong their firewall is. But when these devices join the connected world, they’re exposed to new threats.</li>\n<li>The companies that produce connected devices often intentionally leave open a backdoor so they can more easily conduct routine maintenance. In some cases, the only way manufacturers can update a device is through USB ports, which are notoriously prone to malware transmission.</li>\n<li>Manufacturers haven’t done their due diligence in training blue-collar workers, who are often not as IT savvy as those in white-collar industries. Workers unfamiliar with proper security protocol are more susceptible to phishing scams.</li>\n<li>Similarly, as mobile scanning apps become more popular on the factory floor, manufacturers have introduced more opportunities for potential attacks. Most companies don’t have the capacity to manage various individual devices and apps in addition to their own technology, so personal tech often goes unsupervised.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Because IIoT devices are more susceptible to cyber breaches, DDoS attacks are common.</h3>\n<p>Think back to the 2016 attack on Dyn, a domain name system (DNS), which <a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2016/oct/26/ddos-attack-dyn-mirai-botnet\">brought down major sites including Twitter, Netflix, Paypal and Spotify</a>. Groups of automated harmful programs, or botnets, attacked IoT devices in what was, at the time, the largest DDoS attack in history.</p>\n<h4>Not only are the risks of cyberattacks growing, the consequences can be devastating.</h4>\n<p>According to a <a href=\"https://newsroom.ibm.com/2018-07-10-IBM-Study-Hidden-Costs-of-Data-Breaches-Increase-Expenses-for-Businesses\">study conducted by IBM</a>, the average time to identify a data breach is 197 days, the average time to contain a data breach once identified is 69 days and the average cost of a data breach in the U.S. is $7.91 million.</p>\n<p>In the <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MGMOW7nLGvY\">words of former FBI Director Robert S. Mueller III</a>, “It is no longer a question of ‘if,’ but ‘when’ and ‘how often.’</p>\n<p>There are only two types of companies: those that have been hacked and those that will be. And even they are converging into one category: companies that have been hacked and will be hacked again.”</p>\n<h2><b>The assembly line approach to cybersecurity.</b></h2>\n<p>Even though <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/29/12-lesser-known-iot-protocols-you-wished-you-knew-about-earlier/\">data breaches are inevitable</a>, manufacturers can still take the right precautions to decrease their magnitude and mitigate potential damage.</p>\n<p>Think about cybersecurity like a product in your assembly line. At every stage in the process, something new gets added, until you’ve assembled the final product. But if you stop adding new pieces in the middle of the process and try to use the product, it likely won’t work properly.</p>\n<h4>Cybersecurity requires similar layers of firewalls, encryption, anti-malware, access control, and endpoint protection to best defend your IIoT devices.</h4>\n<p>Managing cybersecurity like an assembly line requires strategies for every part of the process.</p>\n<ol>\n<li><b>Education</b>: Employees who don’t know better are <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/05/7-actionable-tips-to-secure-your-smart-home-and-iot-devices/\">some of the easiest targets</a> for cyberattackers. But a few simple process changes can help diminish instances of breaches caused by employees.\n<ol>\n<li><strong>Onboarding tutorials:</strong> Teach employees what to watch out for on day one. Include a web tutorial on how to avoid phishing scams as part of the onboarding process, and follow it up with a short quiz.</li>\n<li><strong>Frequent testing:</strong> Any <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/21/connected-devices-in-the-workplace-what-you-need-to-know/\">employees who use devices that can get hacked</a> should be tested frequently. Send your own test phishing messages to ensure initial training actually took hold. Employees that click the links in these test emails should be automatically scheduled to take a refresher course.</li>\n</ol>\n</li>\n<li><b>Network segmentation and device fencing: </b>To address the rise of unsecured IIoT and personal devices on the floor, manufacturers should invest in network segmentation. By splitting your main computer network into subnetworks, or segments, companies can not only boost performance but also enhance security.\n<p>Segmentation restricts network access to approved users and gives IT teams the ability to better control, monitor and protect the flow of information. If one subnetwork gets hacked, the risk of spread and the amount of data compromised are much lower.</p>\n<p>Additionally, manufacturers should <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/30/how-to-create-an-effective-cybersecurity-routine/\">establish device geofencing</a>, which provides an added layer of access control and streamlines BYOD management. These boundaries limit access to certain applications or devices and track compliance within a specific geographical perimeter.</p>\n<p>A geographical perimeter can also be set up as a &#8220;device fence&#8221; &#8212; to alert system administrators when company-owned devices leave the premises or the device can be set to automatically shut off access.</li>\n<li><b>Hiring and outsourcing</b>: Many manufacturers simply don’t have the IT department needed to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/27/are-solutions-keeping-up-with-iot-security-concerns/\">monitor and manage security risks</a>. Often, the same person is responsible for managing both the company’s security and its network.\n<p>These employees are usually overworked and lack the necessary checks and balances of a fully staffed IT department. It should come as no surprise then that the burnout rate is incredibly high among these professionals &#8212; adding further strain to manufacturers trying to compete in a tight labor market.</li>\n</ol>\n<h4>Even with the right number of IT professionals in place, every business operating in the connected world needs 24/7 security coverage, 365 days a year.</h4>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/14/5-questions-msps-should-ask-customers-to-determine-security-needs/\">Managed security service providers</a> (MSSPs) can fill in the gaps that IT departments can’t manage single-handedly. External specialists not only have access to a much broader cybersecurity toolkit than in-house staff, they also often cost less than hiring an entire internal team. And the savings in reduced malware infection rates are invaluable.</p>\n<h3>MSSPs provide several crucial layers necessary for an assembly-line approach to cybersecurity.</h3>\n<p>The MSSPs approach includes a perimeter defense, endpoint security, intrusion detection and prevention systems (IDPs). The MSSPs also provide security information and event management (SIEM).</p>\n<h4>When selecting an MSSP, look for a partner with:</h4>\n<ol>\n<li style=\"list-style-type: none;\">\n<ol>\n<li>Considerable experience with incident response and use of leading endpoint protection technologies.</li>\n<li>Multiple client success stories, case studies and credible references.</li>\n<li>Breach detection that analyzes every trouble ticket, instead of just tracking trends.</li>\n<li>Experienced staff — with the proper certifications — in every time zone where you conduct business.</li>\n</ol>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<h2>The pace of IIoT cyberattacks isn’t letting up anytime soon.</h2>\n<p>No, the pace of IIoT cyberattacks isn&#8217;t letting up &#8212; they’re <a href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/04/14/what-you-need-to-know-about-covid-19-related-cyberattacks/\">intensifying in the wake of the coronavirus</a>.</p>\n<p>It’s only a matter of time before your manufacturing company is breached — if you haven’t been already.</p>\n<p>Know that the right combination of security layers can help you detect and prevent more breaches, and recover quicker when the inevitable strikes.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Ivy Son; Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/02/manufacturers-approach-cybersecurity-like-your-assembly-line/\">Manufacturers: Approach Cybersecurity Like Your Assembly Line</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 02 Jul 2020 22:42:29 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Approach-Cybersecurity-Like-Your-Assembly-Line-300x300.png","linkMd5":"f21b945320662853f460237b304b4906","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn14@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-07-821_928820e5d0abb9be.webp","destWidth":300,"destHeight":300,"sourceBytes":149582,"destBytes":14990,"author":"Mike Rulf","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Approach-Cybersecurity-Like-Your-Assembly-Line-300x300.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn14@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-07-821_928820e5d0abb9be.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195873364},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","title":"How to Launch Your Own Data-Driven Email Marketing Campaigns","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=168275","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/16/how-to-launch-your-own-data-driven-email-marketing-campaigns/\" title=\"How to Launch Your Own Data-Driven Email Marketing Campaigns\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Launch-Your-Own-Data-Driven-Email-Marketing-Campaigns-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"launch email marketing\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Launch-Your-Own-Data-Driven-Email-Marketing-Campaigns-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Launch-Your-Own-Data-Driven-Email-Marketing-Campaigns-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Launch-Your-Own-Data-Driven-Email-Marketing-Campaigns.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Marketers can take advantage of data to build effective email marketing campaigns tailored to their target audience. </p>\n<p>Studying and tracking data over time reveals what does and doesn’t work. And marketers can use a/b testing to rectify mistakes, overcome issues, and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/11/how-to-use-behavioral-data-to-inform-marketing-decisions/\">achieve better results</a>. </p>\n<p>Sourcing data to personalize campaigns is simple enough thanks to the proliferation of reporting tools in most email marketing platforms. However, knowing how to actually put the information to good use is more complicated. </p>\n<p>In this post, I explore how you can implement data into your email marketing strategy to improve performance and get stronger results. </p>\n<h2><b>Measuring Email Marketing Campaigns to Gauge Performance and Identify Opportunities </b></h2>\n<p>You want to know how customers react to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/06/13/why-i-choose-email-marketing-for-best-roi/\">email marketing campaigns</a> and what actions they take if any. As a marketer, you have access to a considerable amount of data in your marketing channels and platforms, but not all of it will be of use to you. </p>\n<p>The first thing you should do when measuring your email campaign’s success is to identify your goals. </p>\n<p>Is the aim to drive interest in a forthcoming product by encouraging new subscribers or existing customers to register for a live-streamed demonstration? Do you want to increase sales of low-value products through a flash sale? Are you looking to gain feedback from customers through a brief questionnaire, perhaps included with a welcome email or email newsletter?</p>\n<p>Understanding the goals of any <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/14/how-to-send-the-warmest-cold-emails/\">email marketing campaign</a> helps small businesses establish benchmarks and metrics. It’s vital to be clear on both to ensure you measure results accurately. You can see how specific emails achieve goals and explore what changes you can make if they don’t. </p>\n<h2><b>Choosing the Most Effective Metrics to Measure Performance </b></h2>\n<p>Business owners use metrics to measure email list performance and assess the varying response-types of emails get. </p>\n<p>These responses range from the most basic, such as email open rates, click-through rates, and bounce rates, to conversion rates, list growth rates, spam complaints, and unsubscribe rates. Each action is important in a unique way. For example, open rates tell you the number of subscribers who opened the emails after seeing them in their inbox. That’s an achievement in itself, considering how many emails we&#8217;re all getting. But, what made the individual open your email above something else in their inbox?</p>\n<p>The email open rate doesn’t tell you enough about how email subscribers are engaging with messages. Is the individual looking at the message but taking no further action? How will you know?</p>\n<p>The <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/24/top-tips-to-increase-website-conversions/\">click-through rates</a> and conversion rates come into play here, and tell you what you need to know. If a subscriber clicks on a link to watch a video, read a blog post, view a product, or sign up for a webinar &#8212; that means something in the email is done right. The email piqued their interest in the first place. </p>\n<p>But again, depending on the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/10/22/5-ways-to-improve-conversion-rates-for-your-landing-pages/\">quality of the landing page</a> and the content or products linked to &#8212; a click doesn’t necessarily translate into success. Conversion rates, on the other hand, tell you the number of subscribers who took the desired action after clicking through. </p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/15/data-analytics-the-skill-everyone-needs-to-know/\">Studying these metrics</a> will reveal insights into the quality of a website or other elements of the customer experience. For example, if promotional emails attract an impressive number of click-through rates but poor conversion rates, there may be a problem with the landing page or product catalog. </p>\n<p>In this case, the marketing is doing its job, but flaws outside of the emails themselves are to blame. </p>\n<p>Another critical step is to establish benchmarks, to see how your engagement levels compare to industry and previous averages. Measuring your email marketing efforts against the averages helps gauge a campaign’s success. It also shows the specific areas that demand attention, such as open rates or bounce rates.</p>\n<h2><b>Breaking Audiences into Segments to Boost Email Relevance</b></h2>\n<p>Finding the right <a href=\"https://blog.sendinblue.com/email-marketing-services-comparison/\">email marketing services</a> can be tricky. One way you know you have a good email provider if it has strong segmentation functionality.</p>\n<p>Segmenting audiences makes targeting customers with relevant, engaging emails much easier. It’s more effective than blasting every subscriber with identical messages and hoping enough of them take action to justify the effort. </p>\n<p>Marketers can use various types of data to segment audiences for their email marketing campaigns. One of the most important is customers’ transactional activities — what have they bought, how many purchases have they made, what’s their average order value, and how much have they spent in total?</p>\n<p>You’ll learn which customers are the most valuable and which have yet to make a purchase.</p>\n<p>Another key type of data is their personal details: name, age, gender, and location. You might get this direct at the point of subscription or when customers make a purchase. </p>\n<p>This data means marketers can send emails targeted to different age groups, genders, and geographical areas. For example, there may be a flash sale on women’s clothing or an event geared toward younger audiences. Segmenting ensures they’re only marketed to people most likely to show an interest.</p>\n<p>The next type of data relates to customer behavior. How many emails do they tend to open and take action on? How many times have they opt-in or make a purchase? Do they abandon their carts frequently? </p>\n<p>Subscribers with high click-through rates but no conversions may need a little push, such as a discount or free shipping.</p>\n<h2><b>Personalizing Email Marketing Campaigns to Boost Engagement </b></h2>\n<p>Personalization is the best way to make sure emails are relevant to subscribers and their interests. </p>\n<p>Something as simple as adding the recipient’s name in the subject line makes a positive impact. Using the name in the subject line is shown to <a href=\"https://www.business2community.com/infographics/understanding-importance-e-mail-subject-lines-infographic-01492127#za6tqbgOJuwEl071.97\">grow open rates</a> from an average of 15.70 percent to 18.30 percent, while working “free” into the subject line makes an email 10 percent more likely to be opened, too. </p>\n<p>The content of the email should be tailored to the target segment carefully. Consumers are more likely to shop with companies that include relevant offers and recommendations. </p>\n<p>Personalization may not always bring immediate, transformative results. But, it can make subscribers feel more valued by a brand, rather than just another faceless buyer. </p>\n<p>Follow the tips above to launch a data-driven email marketing campaign with the potential to secure higher engagement, conversions, and loyalty. </p>\n<p>Take advantage of relevant data to know your target audience better and cultivate stronger relationships with existing and prospective customers. Once you’ve established goals, chosen metrics, and put benchmarking into place, you can continue to track performance, chart progress, and spot improvement opportunities over time. </p>\n<p>Getting <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/21/6-email-marketing-trends-you-need-to-be-aware-of/\">email marketing campaigns</a> right takes time and commitment, but it will pay off down the line, with more customers and greater profit.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/16/how-to-launch-your-own-data-driven-email-marketing-campaigns/\">How to Launch Your Own Data-Driven Email Marketing Campaigns</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 17 Mar 2020 00:00:22 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Launch-Your-Own-Data-Driven-Email-Marketing-Campaigns.jpg","linkMd5":"e46cdacd4136b970a8133d8a60e0d7c2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn63@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-24-448_325a505290b54c32.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Launch-Your-Own-Data-Driven-Email-Marketing-Campaigns.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":27029,"destBytes":21158,"author":"John Boitnott","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Launch-Your-Own-Data-Driven-Email-Marketing-Campaigns-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn48@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-18-819_cb5938622e8246cd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195880275},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","title":"The Future of Cybersecurity in the Hands of AI","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173640","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/06/the-future-of-cybersecurity-in-the-hands-of-ai/\" title=\"The Future of Cybersecurity in the Hands of AI\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Future-of-Cybersecurity-in-the-Hands-of-AI-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"cybersecurity ai\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Future-of-Cybersecurity-in-the-Hands-of-AI-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Future-of-Cybersecurity-in-the-Hands-of-AI-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/The-Future-of-Cybersecurity-in-the-Hands-of-AI.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Globally, the AI cybersecurity <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/10/22/why-theres-a-bright-future-in-a-cyber-security-careers/?__cf_chl_jschl_tk__=576a04ecf815fcf6fa3e5b854f943db5516b65ca-1592221799-0-AbQEMuxNxj85ptqi6vDC82y1NNa-ZCrvnKnaKDKAU6Ps5v_BTXwiTbGeEhctoDTHWWA7WfhSGv4ToaBLdYfs1i68Qrv1d-6LWPFNPrmleARjRHDl-im5uDL-ypRW52pf8b4-Qyb1suJUVeyDBJjXa8ROCt0fJg1H2Omtzb1ZL2C28wou44fDNvAffkWHslWrwcDky0hkDGUal-_AZGKCzPnpY8-njp9YYMgJz3z-ICleCdBV4hY6ide90WmNW_6GhEdYptAQ0NmFdOaM4iAR4FOlpsXqP49F_BTifmM7tZyDeZpSDq0cWxhun84GePorWdeUqZpUY96ddIRrrqtSqNjUVsvCjSEzj2Ka9iW68pYeVzbEXXSGr0TNJ_1Na6nWZ4rEn-cSf1mevYDzv4xqFfrrp539463JxAREKPXukqz1\">job</a> market will witness 3.5 million unfilled <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/04/cyber-security-modern-technology-and-business-threats/\">cybersecurity</a> jobs by 2021 according to <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2018/11/07/business/the-mad-dash-to-find-a-cybersecurity-force.html\">The New York Times</a>. Plus, the market size is predicted to reach USD 30.5 billion by 2025.</p>\n<p>A recent<a href=\"https://www.synack.com/press-releases/security-gears-up-for-a-turning-point-in-2020-thanks-to-augmented-intelligence/\"> Synack Report</a> claims that combining cybersecurity talent and AI-enabled technology results in 20x more effective attack surface coverage than traditional methods.</p>\n<p>But it’s difficult to truly understand the implication of these numbers. Most content on the topic leaves the reader to do all the math, connect the dots, and try to understand the <i>real </i>problem behind the numbers, all by themselves – an overwhelming task.</p>\n<p>Two of the most interesting topics on the internet today are Artificial Intelligence and Cybersecurity. You want solid takeaways and insights to embrace in today&#8217;s inter-connected digital economy.</p>\n<h2><b>Challenges of AI: A cybersecurity industry perspective</b></h2>\n<p>A recent survey by the Consumer Technology Association identifies AI’s top application as cybersecurity, with <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/805348/world-ai-application-areas-in-enterprise/\">44% of all AI applications</a> being used to detect and deter security intrusions.</p>\n<p>At the other end of the spectrum, cybercriminals are increasingly (and innovatively) using AI as digital ammunition. It is to create potent security threats, resulting in an increased demand for cybersecurity experts.</p>\n<p>On the subject of threats, here&#8217;s my pick of the top-3 current concerns:</p>\n<h3><b>1. Increased </b><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/04/cyber-security-modern-technology-and-business-threats/?__cf_chl_jschl_tk__=3aac4a1d143f318897ce2f2fbec5ebd3cb7c81cd-1590864307-0-AZ01iYuAJZ1yPLFjePvkUm3KvFcvzLr38MjWO-z1IQCHY3Gny6Djht3dT5MRllWSI8vW9q8mjzl1bRs3UbvH8lk3MptswEmIsPLcy-vKPogx11PmXrOPpfLw5tied7Pmp4NI06zczvZJOzMhSfnMP_GpUahaQH9n4peUaIdi4BvFOBodUC82YTbis-zEp1giN8RmhoQDO8RKvYPAd7aBEWk5TtWHkTw-2iXJMvCzscysmKqz9GxOXGQMJklzM0MvyKX7XbkwsDToPOgkMFfuMGyKvumAToYOaDYd8UzURvbnUvleM8sslwK9t4kJ-Wai9rYbK3YZtrkO61caUDFeiVpi2P9dj4bJOpJ0UF9gs0DyY78cO1pmJ-4468zGWO1TBTCngNm58X-eYtOTHKDFAczeSmpU7jMhibVjVYy_MNc9\"><b>cybersecurity threat</b></a></h3>\n<p>In 2019, the Wall Street Journal <a href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/fraudsters-use-ai-to-mimic-ceos-voice-in-unusual-cybercrime-case-11567157402\">reported</a> that a group of cybercriminals had demanded €220,000 from the CEO of a U.K.-based energy firm. An interesting twist to the plot: they used AI to impersonate the CEO’s voice. The lesson learned? AI provides cybercriminals with an additional <i>edge</i> to bypass security blind spots in an organization.</p>\n<h3><b>2. Accelerated volume and complexity of cybersecurity attacks and data breaches</b></h3>\n<p>A study by <a href=\"https://www.varonis.com/blog/the-world-in-data-breaches/\">Varonis</a> puts things into perspective:</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-173641 size-medium\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/data-breaches-stats-960x653-1-300x204.png\" alt=\"Accelerated volume and complexity of cybersecurity attacks and data breaches\" width=\"300\" height=\"204\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/data-breaches-stats-960x653-1-300x204.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/data-breaches-stats-960x653-1-900x612.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/data-breaches-stats-960x653-1-235x160.png 235w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/data-breaches-stats-960x653-1-182x125.png 182w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/data-breaches-stats-960x653-1.png 960w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p>&#160;</p>\n<p>Long story short, <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbestechcouncil/2018/05/23/how-the-development-of-ai-has-advanced-the-technology-available-for-chatbots/#2e252e96c213\">AI-powered technology</a> can enable automation of tasks, protect the attacker&#8217;s identity, spawn the next frontier in enterprise fraud, a.k.a deepfakes, and refine malicious services (to name but a few instances) at a rate and scale that&#8217;s virtually unheard of.</p>\n<h3><b>3. A window of (threat) opportunity, owing to greater reliance on AI-enabled technology</b></h3>\n<p>Practically speaking, AI-led technology can swing both ways. Either in favor of organizations or in favor of cybercriminals, depending on the circumstances. Organizations can beef up their security by using emerging technologies and AI-led software.</p>\n<p>Ironically, attackers can overcome these security controls and manipulate routine tasks by using the same technology in an improvised capacity, giving rise to more complex and interconnected risks. Believe it or not, in 2018, <a href=\"https://cybersecurityventures.com/cybersecurity-almanac-2019/\">Cisco</a> reported that they “blocked seven trillion threats, or 20 billion threats a day, on behalf of their customers.” Currently, it seems like we&#8217;re stuck in a &#8220;chicken-egg&#8221; situation.</p>\n<h2><b>How AI is contributing to cybersecurity processes </b></h2>\n<p>According to Capgemini, two out of three organizations are planning to adopt AI solutions by 2020.</p>\n<p>Despite posing serious threats, AI augments and complements the future of cybersecurity best-practices. Here&#8217;s a lowdown of the &#8220;AI advantage&#8221; in the cybersecurity landscape:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\n<h3><b>Reduced response time to threats and cost of preventing breaches</b></h3>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Synack claims that “using AI accelerates the time to evaluate the breach-worthiness of vulnerability by 73%.”</p>\n<p><i></i>Plus, additional data by Capgemini research shows that “3 out of 4 executives believe AI in cybersecurity speeds up breach response &#8212; both in detection and remediation.<i><br />\n</i></p>\n<p>And around 64% said that it also reduces the cost of detection and response.” Expert <a href=\"https://twitter.com/kaynemcgladrey\">Kayne McGladrey&#8217;s</a> take on AI explains what these numbers might mean. Talking to <a href=\"https://www.cio.com/article/3515730/ai-automation-emerge-as-critical-tools-for-cybersecurity.html\">CIO</a>, she says:</p>\n<p>“AI’s tenacity results in reducing time to discovery, which doesn’t need holidays, coffee breaks, or sleep. And, is unlike Tier 1 security operations center analysts for whom reading endless log files and alerts gets boring.”</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\n<h3><b>Ease of multi-tasking</b></h3>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>AI is like a superpower organization that can use in a number of ways – to review user behaviors, find patterns, and locate irregularities in the security network to name just a few.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-173644 size-medium\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/data2-300x228.jpg\" alt=\"Ease of multi-tasking\" width=\"300\" height=\"228\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/data2-300x228.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/data2-900x685.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/data2-210x160.jpg 210w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/data2.jpg 1112w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://info.whitehatsec.com/Content-2020-AIHumanSecurityReport_LPNew.html?utm_source=website&#38;utm_medium=0320-Website-AIHumanSecurityReport/\">Image Source</a></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\n<h3><b>Enhanced and dynamic security practices</b></h3>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The use of AI in combination with human efforts can help companies find and close critical vulnerabilities <a href=\"https://www.synack.com/press-releases/security-gears-up-for-a-turning-point-in-2020-thanks-to-augmented-intelligence/\">40% faster</a>.<i><br />\n</i></p>\n<p>Plus, this allows companies to focus their efforts on creating secure ‘choke points’ instead of spending millions to secure the entire work environment.</p>\n<p>Finally, by using AI for improved security, companies can leverage greater returns and minimize risks &#8212; a growing-concern among companies today.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\n<h3><b>Minimized security responsibilities with high-quality results</b></h3>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>AI is often described as intelligent, and rightly so. There are numerous application areas in which this powerful technology is helping organizations highlight recurring incidents and reverse the damage. (More on this in the next section).</p>\n<h2><b>Top-3 impactful use cases of AI in cybersecurity </b></h2>\n<h3><b>1. Combing through mountains of security data and automating routine tasks</b></h3>\n<p>One of the biggest concerns in cybersecurity is the sheer volume of data organizations have to tackle daily. This is probably one of the reasons why Gmail chose the AI route to<a href=\"https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/g-suite/ridding-gmail-of-100-million-more-spam-messages-with-tensorflow\"> block 100 million extra spam messages every day</a> CTO of Seedcamp, <a href=\"https://twitter.com/davidmytton\">David Mytton&#8217;s</a> explanation of how AI is disrupting the cybersecurity space is on-point.</p>\n<p>In CIO <a href=\"https://www.cio.com/article/3515730/ai-automation-emerge-as-critical-tools-for-cybersecurity.html\">Mytton says,</a> “As more and more systems become instrumented, the problem shifts from knowing that ‘something’ has happened. This is to highlight that &#8220;something unusual&#8221; has happened.”</p>\n<p>Instrumented system refers to as &#8212; who has logged in and when? What was downloaded and when? What was accessed and when?</p>\n<h3><b>2. Reducing false security alarms and capturing unusual incidents</b></h3>\n<p>AI intelligence, in conjunction with threat intelligence, can detect new security issues and resolve them, offering a threat detection rate of 95% as opposed to traditional antivirus software, “where the detection rate is only about 90%, meaning 10% of malicious samples are being missed.”</p>\n<p>In the same vein, <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/michaeloverly/\">Michael Overly</a>, partner at Foley &#38; Lardner LLP, talked to <a href=\"https://www.cio.com/article/3515730/ai-automation-emerge-as-critical-tools-for-cybersecurity.html\">Digital Munition</a> about the benefits of addressing these missed threats in a time-sensitive manner, saying:</p>\n<p>&#8220;The hope is that these systems will minimize false alarms and insubstantial issues, leaving a much smaller set of ‘real’ threats to review and address.&#8221;</p>\n<h3><b>3. Empowering foolproof security by offering predictive functions and improving efficiency</b></h3>\n<p>One of the most innovative and effective applications of AI in thwarting security breaches is the use of biometric authentication. Tech giant, Apple, uses this method &#8212; commonly known as &#8220;Face ID.&#8221;</p>\n<p>The powerful face ID technology combines built-in infra-red sensors and neural engines to recognize the user. If Apple&#8217;s claims are to be believed, the benefits are vast, with “only a <a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/339509\">one-in-a-million</a> chance of fooling the AI to open a device with another face.”</p>\n<p>Apart from providing additional layers of security, AI is making teams more efficient, according to 70% of security professionals, and it is eliminating as much as 55% of employees&#8217; manual tasks.</p>\n<p>With the additional layer of security and helping the team pivot their energies towards solving more important tasks, AI also powers productivity. Helping with productivity reduces overall stress levels for everyone involved.</p>\n<h2><b>Key perspectives and future trends in AI security</b></h2>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\n<h3><b>Training AI-powered systems to protect us</b></h3>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>We&#8217;ve spoken plenty about how AI works round-the-clock to keep an enterprise secure, but what about the safety and training of the technology itself?<br />\nExperts and enterprises need to refocus their strategies on training AI &#8211; ML models to max the value of these systems.<br />\nML systems can be trained to learn from historical data and detect anomalies. They can allow companies to mitigate and manage cyberattacks efficiently.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\n<h3><b>AI is the shiny new toy in the digital arms race</b></h3>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>From boosting the security defense to hyper-automating parts of the cybersecurity processes, AI will play an increasingly important role in preventing cyberattacks.</p>\n<p>Capgemini recently reported that AI “adoption is set to skyrocket, with almost two out of three (63%) of organizations planning to employ AI by 2020.”</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\n<h3><b>AI as an offensive-defensive capability</b></h3>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>As mentioned earlier, AI is a technology that can be used to both defend and attack an organization&#8217;s digital defense systems.</p>\n<p>The need of the hour is for cybersecurity experts to proactively identify attacks (think: Spam email attempts, disabling critical infrastructure, among others) and defend against them.</p>\n<h2><b>Limitations of AI &#38; possible solutions </b></h2>\n<p>&#8220;<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/13/10-security-tips-for-work-from-home-enterprises-during-covid-19/\">AI won’t solve all your security problems</a>. Think of it as a way to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/09/top-covid-19-cybersecurity-scams-to-watch-for-and-how-to-mitigate-them/\">advance the security</a> posture, not as a silver bullet.” &#8211; Raja Patel, vice president, security products at Akamai Technologies.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/dd.jpg\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-173645 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/dd-557x719.jpg\" alt=\"Limitations of AI &#38; possible solutions\" width=\"557\" height=\"719\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/dd-557x719.jpg 557w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/dd-233x300.jpg 233w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/dd-124x160.jpg 124w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/dd.jpg 862w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 557px) 100vw, 557px\" /></a></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://info.whitehatsec.com/Content-2020-AIHumanSecurityReport_LPNew.html?utm_source=website&#38;utm_medium=0320-Website-AIHumanSecurityReport\">Image Source</a></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\n<h3><b>Experts favor findings verified by humans rather than AI</b></h3>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>According to research by White Hat Security, “<a href=\"https://info.whitehatsec.com/Content-2020-AIHumanSecurityReport_LPNew.html?utm_source=website&#38;utm_medium=0320-Website-AIHumanSecurityReport\">60% of security</a> professionals are still more confident in cyber threat findings verified by humans over those generated by AI.”<i><br />\n</i></p>\n<p>The top-4 areas where human intelligence trumps AI in the operational security process are the use of intuition<i>, </i>creativity, human experience, and frame-of-reference <i>– </i>evolved capabilities that AI is yet to demonstrate, let alone master.</p>\n<p>Evidently, the current cybersecurity climate at least has tipped the balance towards human capabilities. The solution? Augmenting human talent with AI&#8217;s technological prowess can be a reliable way forward. <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/aarti-borkar\">Aarti Borkar</a>, Vice President at IBM Security, writes in <a href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90429474/ai-is-changing-cybersecurity-but-when-its-biased-its-dangerous\">Fast Company</a> of a 360-degree solution enterprises can embrace:</p>\n<p>&#8220;One way to help prevent bias within AI is to establish cognitive diversity. The diversity in the computer scientists developing the AI model, the data feeding it, and the security teams influencing it.&#8221;</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Establishing AI systems requires an incredible amount of assets and resources, such as memory, accurate data sets, and computing power. Not to mention, it is an expensive and time-intensive undertaking.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Some of the other growing concerns with the use of AI have been well captured by<a href=\"https://info.protectwise.com/osterman-state-of-ai-in-security\"> Osterman Research</a>:</p>\n<p>Moving forward, let&#8217;s look at how enterprises can solve these limitations from a holistic perspective:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The first step is for companies to invest in an experienced cybersecurity firm with seasoned professionals.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Test systems and audit your hardware as well as software to find and proactively fix security gaps.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Install – and constantly update – firewalls and other malware scanners that keep your systems secure.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Review the latest cyber threats and security protocols to prioritize risks and develop effective strategies.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2><b>AI-Powered cybersecurity in the future: Expert speak</b></h2>\n<p>We&#8217;ve chalked out the numbers and done our analysis. But what do the experts think about the prevalence and relevance of AI in cybersecurity? Let&#8217;s look at the picture painted for us by some of the expert opinions collected in <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/gilpress/2019/12/03/141-cybersecurity-predictions-for-2020/#5f7b09151bc5\">Forbes</a>:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\n<h3><b>The one who uses the technology first will call the shots</b></h3>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/samiplaine\"> Sami Laine</a>, Director of Technology Strategy at Okta, says: &#8220;We will see threat actors use <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/gilpress/2019/12/03/141-cybersecurity-predictions-for-2020/#75dd371bc568\">deepfakes as a tactic</a> for <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/29/the-biggest-cybersecurity-mistakes-businesses-are-still-making/\">corporate cyberattacks</a>, similar to how phishing attacks operate.</p>\n<p>Phishing attacks are where the money is for cybercrooks, and they can wreak serious havoc on unsuspecting employees.</p>\n<p>What this means is that organizations will need to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/15/employees-can-be-your-greatest-defense-against-security-threats/\">keep validation technology up-to-date</a>; the tools &#8211; to create deepfakes and to detect them- will be the same. So, it’ll be an arms race for who can use the technology first.&#8221;</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\n<h3><b>Rise of deepfakes-as-a-service</b></h3>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p><a href=\"https://uk.linkedin.com/in/audraesimons\"> Audra Simons</a>, Director of Innovation at <a href=\"https://twitter.com/ForcepointSec\">Forcepoint</a>, offers an interesting perspective: “We expect deepfakes to make a notable impact across all aspects of our lives in 2020 as their realism and potential increases.<i><br />\n</i></p>\n<p>We will see <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/gilpress/2019/12/03/141-cybersecurity-predictions-for-2020/#75dd371bc568\">Deepfakes-As-A-Service</a> move to the fore in 2020 as deepfakes become widely adopted for <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/28/cybersecurity-concerns-shouldnt-halt-digital-transformation-of-your-business/\">both fun and malicious reasons</a>.”</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\n<h3><b>In the offensive-defensive cybersecurity game, the defensive side has their work cut out</b></h3>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Marcus Fowler, Director of Strategic Threat at <a href=\"https://twitter.com/darktrace/status/1258813003950100481\">Darktrace</a> explains what it takes to fight AI with AI: “The building blocks are well in place for the <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/gilpress/2019/12/03/141-cybersecurity-predictions-for-2020/#75dd371bc568\">rise of AI-powered cyberattacks</a> in 2020, as more sophisticated defenses and access to open-source AI tools incentivize adversaries to supercharge their attacks.</p>\n<p>AI won’t only enable malware to move stealthily across businesses without requiring a human’s hands on the keyboard, but attackers will also use AI in other malicious ways, including determining their targets, conducting reconnaissance, and scaling their attacks.</p>\n<p>Security experts recognize that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/02/top-10-greatest-ai-trends-in-business-2020/\">defensive AI</a> is the only force capable of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/01/08/security-teams-need-to-be-prepared-with-an-incident-response-plan/\">combating offensive AI attacks</a>. And that the battle must be fought by matching – or exceeding – the speed with which attackers innovate.”</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\n<h3><b>The emergence of disinformation and fake news</b></h3>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p><a href=\"https://twitter.com/geenensp?lang=en\">Pascal Geenens</a>, Security Researcher at Radware talks about this hot topic plaguing organizations and countries across the globe: “<a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/gilpress/2019/12/03/141-cybersecurity-predictions-for-2020/#75dd371bc568\">Disinformation and fake news</a> can spread havoc in both the public and private sector and is increasingly being used as a weapon by nation-states.</p>\n<p>In 2020, deep learning algorithms can bring about in generating fake, but seemingly realistic images and videos.<br />\nThis application of AI will be a catalyst for large scale disinformation campaigns. ”</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">\n<h3><b>The impact of increased digitization on AI and cybersecurity</b></h3>\n</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Phil Dunkelberger, President, and CEO of <a href=\"https://twitter.com/noknoklabs/media\">Nok Nok Labs</a>, sums up how increasing digitization will impact organizations, cybercriminals, governments, and the world at large: “As digitization continues in 2020, data will become more valuable than ever before.<br />\nInformation that may have previously seemed trivial to the everyday consumer will hold significant value for stakeholders and hackers across the spectrum.</p>\n<p>Adversaries or real-life ‘data bounty hunters’ will hunt for new ways to exploit it, governments will seek better ways to access it, enterprises will adopt stronger security measures to protect it, and end-users will demand better privacy to secure their personal information.</p>\n<p>Furthermore, with the rise of AI and machine learning, crucial data that impacts how medical decisions are made, where/how autonomous cars move. And more will become increasingly more mainstream—and increasingly more lucrative to threat actors pining for the information.”<i><i><br />\n</i></i></p>\n<h2><b>The first and last line of defense in cybersecurity</b></h2>\n<p>Whichever way you slice it, one key learning, in particular, emerges from all this.</p>\n<blockquote><p><em>&#8220;AI isn&#8217;t ready to fly solo any time soon.&#8221;</em></p></blockquote>\n<p>Enterprises, as well as experts, are more comfortable embracing a &#8220;middle-ground&#8221; approach. AI can be used as a smart tool to augment human intelligence. And help organizations stay competitive and safe in the ever-expanding world of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/06/small-business-cybersecurity-threats-and-how-to-fix-the-fox/\">cybersecurity threats.</a></p>\n<p>In a nutshell, the advantages of AI far outweigh the limitations and offer a hopeful (and secure) way forward. What are your thoughts?</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/06/the-future-of-cybersecurity-in-the-hands-of-ai/\">The Future of Cybersecurity in the Hands of AI</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 06 Aug 2020 18:01:03 23:17:53","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:53","title":"Top 10 Best Live Chat Software for 2020","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173404","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/13/top-10-best-live-chat-software-for-2020/\" title=\"Top 10 Best Live Chat Software for 2020\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Top-10-Best-Live-Chat-Software-for-2020-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"best live chat software\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Top-10-Best-Live-Chat-Software-for-2020-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Top-10-Best-Live-Chat-Software-for-2020-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Top-10-Best-Live-Chat-Software-for-2020-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Top-10-Best-Live-Chat-Software-for-2020.jpg 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Did you know that 48% of customers would be more likely to return to a website with <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/21/prodigious-customer-service-live-chat-vs-chatbots/\">chat support</a>, and 41% of customers trust the brand more when the chat support option is available? These numbers give insights on how live chat software is perceived and how much a business can gain from its use.</p>\n<h4><strong>What options do your customers prefer?</strong></h4>\n<p>Out of those who prefer live chat 79% said they did so because they get their questions answered quickly &#8212; 51% liked chat because they could multitask and talk at the same time &#8212; and 46% agreed chat support was the most efficient communication method.</p>\n<p>What these stats tell us about chat support is that with its use, you get the options to:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2011/05/30/improving-the-online-customer/\">Deliver instant support</a></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Help customers and your operators multitask</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Bridge the communication gap between your customers and you</li>\n</ul>\n<p>That’s why you need to get the best live chat software for your online business. To help you find the best chat support &#8212; we’ve curated a list of top 10 live chat software solutions that have made a mark successfully in 2020.</p>\n<h2><strong>What is Live Chat Software?</strong></h2>\n<p>Live chat software is an online service that enables your business to connect faster with customers in real-time. Just like a messenger, live chat allows you to connect with multiple customers at the same time.</p>\n<p>In addition to these benefits, the use of live chat also helps you capture more leads, close more sales, and increase customer satisfaction. And while the use of the tool seems beneficial for your business, your customers may have different reasons to use the tool such as:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">42% of consumers say that they prefer live chat functions because they don&#8217;t have to wait on hold</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">79% of customers say that the use of live chat helps them get their questions answered quickly</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">51% of customers believe that the use of live chat software helps them to multitask during the support process</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">46% of customers express how they find live chat software as the most efficient form of communication method</li>\n</ul>\n<p>These numbers clearly state a win-win situation for both the customers and your business online. But the question is, <i>how does live chat work</i>?</p>\n<h2><strong>How Does Live Chat Work?</strong></h2>\n<p>A live chat has two interfaces. While one is visible to your customers, the other can be used by your operators. Let’s understand the two interfaces below and see how live chat works.</p>\n<h3><strong>Operator Window</strong></h3>\n<p>Operator window, also known as monitor window, is the interface that enables your operators to track and monitor visitor behavior in real-time. Although the features of the operator window vary from software to software, still there are a few common features that you are likely to find across all live chat software solutions.</p>\n<p>Some of them include:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The number of visitors online</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The pages they browse in real-time</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The number of co-operators online</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The number of chats other operators are managing at the same time</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The amount of time a visitor spends on your website</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Access to the previous chat history</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Access to previous chat transcripts</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Operator-to-operator chat to increase collaboration during an ongoing conversation</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The access to such features helps your operators to understand visitors better and initiate a chat with them in strategic moments. Other than the list of features mentioned above, some chat solutions also allow your operators to monitor and join ongoing chats. In short, the operator window helps your support reps to weave the best experience for your visitors/customers.</p>\n<h3><strong>Visitor Window</strong></h3>\n<p>Visitor window is the interface that the visitors on your website get to see when they click on the chat button for support. Your visitors can either initiate a chat or accept an incoming chat from your operators through their chat interface.</p>\n<p>Besides this, three other features will be visible once the visitor opens the chat window for support. These features include the following.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Pre-chat Form</b>To capture quality leads, a pre-chat form is considered to be one of the most crucial features in a live chat. You can gather details like name, phone number, address, email id, and more based on the nature of your business. You can even customize your pre-chat form fields to capture specific information about your visitors.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Offline Messages</b>Another form that your visitors can see when they open a chat window for support is offline message form. However, it is only visible if your operators aren’t online or your business hours for the day are over. With the use of this form, visitors can still reach out to your brand for support. Plus, you can avoid missing out on support opportunities too.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><b>Self-help Article Links</b>The self-help articles are the latest feature in live chat solutions and isn’t available in all the options you may see below. However, its use is perfect for visitors who’d like to find answers fast and on their own accord. You can add self-help article links to your chat window to enable your visitors to find answers instantly and reduce your support chats and tickets effectively.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>With these two live chat interfaces, we get to see how live chat works for a business. Now, let’s see how to add one to your website in minutes.</p>\n<h2><strong>How to Add Live Chat to Your Website?</strong></h2>\n<p>Every live chat solution has one thing in common &#8211; the installation process.</p>\n<p>To add live chat to your website, you’ll see that all solutions would have most of the steps common. So, let’s lay out those common steps for you and see how to add a live chat to your website in less than five minutes below.</p>\n<p><i>Step #1:</i> It is common across all the live chat solutions &#8211; sign up.</p>\n<p>Before you install a live chat on your website and start giving support, sign up for the solution you think works best according to your business needs.</p>\n<p><i>Step #2:</i> Another common step you’ll notice is to navigate and find the chat code.</p>\n<p>Some may be easily found, others need to be searched for in the settings options.</p>\n<p><i>Step #3:</i> Finally it’s time to visit your website’s source code.</p>\n<p>Once you find the chat code, all you have to do is copy and paste the code in your website’s source code and save. And you are done!</p>\n<p>In a matter of three simple steps, you get to add a live chat software to our website in less than five minutes and you are up and ready to offer support to your visitors in real-time.</p>\n<h2><strong>Why Add Live Chat to Your Website?</strong></h2>\n<p>Well, you may have come across a lot of reasons so far while reading the article on why add a live chat to your website. Let’s summarize them below.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Offer instant, live support to customers in need of a solution</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Monitor visitor behavior and initiate a chat in strategic moments</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Easy to install</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Convenient communication channel for customers as they wait time reduces in comparison to phone support</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Enables both customers and operators to multitask during the support process</li>\n</ul>\n<p>But just in case these reasons aren’t enough for you to get a live chat for your support process, then we’ve got more for you. Let’s take a look at them below.</p>\n<h3><strong>1. Capture Qualified Leads for Your Business</strong></h3>\n<p>To get more business, it is important to capture qualified leads for your business. And thanks to the use of live chat, you get to do that effectively.</p>\n<p>Features like visitor monitoring, pre-chat form, and offline message form help you learn if your target audience has approached your brand or not. And if the answer is yes, then automatically store them to your favorite CRM platform. It will help your sales team to approach them later on.</p>\n<h3><strong>2. Boost Sales</strong></h3>\n<p>We all know that live chat helps you provide instant support to customers. But as per studies it also helps you to boost business revenues.</p>\n<p><i>For customers who chat before making a purchase, there is a </i><a href=\"https://www.proprofs.com/c/customer-support/live-chat-statistics/\"><i>10%</i></a><i> increase in average order value, a 48% increase in revenue per chat hour, and a 40% conversion rate.</i></p>\n<h3><strong>3. Increase Customer Loyalty</strong></h3>\n<p><i>48% would be more likely to return to a website with chat support, and </i><i>41% trust</i><i> the brand more when this option is available.</i></p>\n<p>Another reason why you should get a live chat for your website is that it helps you to boost customer loyalty. Remember that <i>‘loyalty starts with awesome support’</i> and if you can offer that to customers efficiently, then you are likely to see more returning customers too.</p>\n<h3><strong>4. Improve Website Engagement</strong></h3>\n<p><i>For </i><i>41%</i><i> of consumers, online chat, and live support is their preferred channel when it comes to engaging with companies digitally.</i></p>\n<p>Want to make sure you engage better with your website visitors? Add a live chat to your website. Real-time engagement helps you to find and offer relevant product recommendations to your customers, while your customers would find solutions faster. In short, it is a win-win situation for both.</p>\n<h3><strong>5. Improves Operator Performance</strong></h3>\n<p>Live chat also helps you to improve operator performance, which ultimately results in reduced support costs. Let’s see how.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Your operators can manage multiple chats at the same time. Unlike phone support, where agents can take one call at a time, each chat operator gets to manage more than 4 visitors at the same time. This also means that you can hire reps based on how many chats they can answer and run your support process at a lesser cost.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Your operators no longer have to get up from their seats and ask for assistance from their fellow team members for a support request. All they have to do is initiate an operator to operator chat with the one who can best help them resolve a query faster.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Operator performance reports give you insights on who is the star performer of your team and who needs to improve further.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>These are more than convincing reasons to add a live chat to your website. They are also one of the determining factors that help you get the best live chat software for your online business. And to help you do that, we’ve curated a list of top 10 best live chat software solutions that have made a mark successfully in 2020.</p>\n<h2>10 Best Live Chat Software Solutions</h2>\n<p>By the year 2021, <a href=\"https://www.gartner.com/smarterwithgartner/gartner-top-strategic-predictions-for-2018-and-beyond/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">50%</a> of organizations will spend more on the creation of bots and chatbots than developing traditional mobile applications, says a report by Gartner.</p>\n<p>Many companies are letting live chat supersede their email support options. And for a few, it has been working quite well.</p>\n<p>That alone should convince you of why your business needs a robust live chat software.</p>\n<p>Other than that, the use of live chat software allows you to curate the <a href=\"https://qualaroo.com/customer-journey-map-template/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">ultimate customer journey</a> and track them effectively too.</p>\n<p>Now when you are sure about the benefits of this feature-rich and powerful live chat solution, how do you know which live chat for a website is going to be best suited to the needs of your business?</p>\n<p>The questions to ask are:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">What features should you pay attention to?</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">How do you not end up overspending?</li>\n</ul>\n<p>So, if you are ready to start on your quest, here is our pick for the top ten best live chat software for 2020.</p>\n<h3><strong>1. </strong><strong>ProProfs Live Chat</strong></h3>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-173427 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/proprofs-live-chat-software-900x484.png\" alt=\"ProProfs live chat software\" width=\"900\" height=\"484\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/proprofs-live-chat-software-900x484.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/proprofs-live-chat-software-300x161.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/proprofs-live-chat-software-260x140.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/proprofs-live-chat-software.png 954w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.proprofs.com/chat/\">ProProfs Live Chat</a> software is one of the best live chat tools for websites as it provides real-time solutions to customers in seconds. <a href=\"https://www.olark.com/\">Olark</a> is a top live chat software that is very popular in the market. Showcasing a great user interface for both customers and businesses, the chatbots are easy and quick to set-up and functions like a charm, offering a seamless experience to your website visitors. That said, the focus still is very much on ensuring that customer conversions keep going up.</p>\n<p>With advanced customization tools, Olark helps in jumpstarting messaging, personalizing discussions, and communications by adding the conversation tool on specific pages. Targeted messages can be sent automatically depending on the page that the visitor is currently browsing through.</p>\n<p>Generate live chat reports in real-time that are not just limited to chat conversations but also measures customer engagements effectively. Comprehensive reports produced by the system can be used to scrutinize results and use them to make sound business decisions.</p>\n<p><b>Features:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Live chat transcripts</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Custom chatbox forms</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Team management</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Automation</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Security</li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>Benefits:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Make tweaks visually to ensure that your chat box matches with your brand generating trust and credibility among website visitors resulting in more chats, sales, and satisfied customers</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Extract actionable insights on product feedback and information about your customers by accessing chat transcripts archives</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Interact with customers in real-time and give something extra with PowerUp that boosts sales, growth, and customer service</li>\n</ul>\n<p><b>Pricing:</b></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Free trial available for 14 days</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Get started on a $ 19 per agent/month plan</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Cancel at any time</li>\n</ul>\n<h3><strong>8. Heavy on features, the live chat tool has been designed to push customer satisfaction rates by interacting and engaging with clients in real-time.</p>\n<p>Considered as one of the best live chat support software, it provides a top-notch messenger platform that suits businesses of all types and sizes. This level of automation along with working on collaborative team inboxes, targeted messaging all works in tandem to achieve greater standards of customer It drives organizations to leverage all of their customer conversations across domains like support, sales, or marketing to build long-term relationships with their clients.</p>\n<p>Presenting a familiar interface, it highlights robust team collaboration with an intelligent chat distribution system.
