That means that if you<span class=\"s2\">’<span class=\"s1\">re lying in bed late at night and think, &#8216;dang-it, I&#8217;ve gotta have new glasses.&#8221; You don&#8217;t have to toss and turn all night thinking about it &#8212; just hop up and order your new glasses and go back to bed. You don<span class=\"s2\">’<span class=\"s1\">t have to wait for opening hours, lines &#8212; social distancing, nor your COVID mask. </span></span></span></span></span></p>\n<h4><b></b><span class=\"s1\"><b>2. Risk-Free<br />\n</b></span></h4>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">One concern many people have buying glasses (and other items) online &#8212; is regarding what to do if they don<span class=\"s2\">’<span class=\"s1\">t like the item or items they receive. </span></span></span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">To ease these worries, most major online eyewear retailers offer a free returns period (usually between 14 and 30 days). If you aren<span class=\"s2\">’<span class=\"s1\">t happy with your order &#8212; there is an easy return option. What the return policy gives you is a &#8220;free home trial&#8221; period. Try on your new glasses &#8212; you&#8217;ll want to wear them &#8212; enjoy the experience. Wear these beauties to work or school. Within a day or two, you&#8217;ll know how you feel about your new purchase. </span></span></span></p>\n<h4><b></b><span class=\"s1\"><b>3. Keep Your Wallet Happy<br />\n</b></span></h4>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">Prices vary and fluctuate from site to site, but as a general rule of thumb, buying prescription glasses online is going to save you a lot of money compared to brick-and-mortar eyewear stores. </span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">There are several reasons for the significant price variation. The logical reason is simple: It costs a lot more to operate a brick-and-mortar store compared to an online establishment. Online eyewear retailers can offer much better prices &#8212; and the online retailer doesn&#8217;t have the big boss in there putting on extra stress and pressure. </span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">For example, at <a href=\"https://www.glassesusa.com?affid=readwrite-lp1944&#38;utm_source=publisher&#38;utm_medium=readwrite&#38;utm_campaign=052020\"><span class=\"s3\">GlassesUSA.com</span></a>, one of the biggest eyewear online stores in the US &#8212; you can find prescription glasses for as low as $38. The price includes free standard shipping on all orders. Free shipping is something worth paying attention to when you<span class=\"s2\">’<span class=\"s1\">re checking out an online site. Some of the online glasses sites only provide free shipping with a specific order or cost minimum. You may want to get regular glasses and sunglasses at the same time, in this case. </span></span></span></p>\n<h4><b></b><span class=\"s1\"><b>4. High-Quality Frames<br />\n</b></span></h4>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">Another friction point for those hesitant about buying glasses online is worrying about the quality of the product. </span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">Not all online eyewear retailers are homogenous in the selections they offer. The leading players in the online glasses industry offer the same quality of frames and brand names, as you would find at the store. No-worries online &#8212; you&#8217;ll find the light-weight options you are looking for in acetate, metal, and titanium glasses. Best of all &#8212; online &#8212; you&#8217;ll find a much better price. </span></p>\n<h4><b></b><span class=\"s1\"><b>5. Tailor-Made Prescription Lenses<br />\n</b></span></h4>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">As the process goes with online glasses sites &#8212; after you pick a frame, it<span class=\"s2\">’<span class=\"s1\">s time to ,choose the lenses you want. </span></span></span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">In short, you don<span class=\"s2\">’<span class=\"s1\">t have to worry about not finding lenses to handle your prescription. </span></span></span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">Yes, you can easily find single-vision glasses (reading or distance) for any optical power. Yes, you can find those bifocals and progressives, and even prescription sunglasses. GlassesUSA.com offers over 900 eyeglasses to choose from of all kinds. You<span class=\"s2\">’<span class=\"s1\">re not going to have an issue with finding glasses to match what your doctor prescribed. </span></span></span></p>\n<p class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\"><b>What if you don</b><span class=\"s4\">’<span class=\"s1\"><b>t have your prescription at hand when going online to order glasses?</b></span></span></span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">Some sites are offering different variations of prescription scanners &#8212; so if you have a pair of glasses you see well with, you can scan the optical details right from home and use that script to shop online. </span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">The variety doesn<span class=\"s2\">’<span class=\"s1\">t end with prescriptions. There are endless options for customizing your lenses. You can choose thin lenses and a variety of coatings, such as anti-scratch and anti-glare. Right now, the anti-fog options are becoming big &#8212; maybe because of wearing masks or being out when it<span class=\"s2\">’<span class=\"s1\">s cold. Don&#8217;t forget the impact-resistant lenses (Polycarbonate or Trivex) for sports, or the light-adaptive lenses that change from dark to clear, tints, mirrored, polarized, and many more. </span></span></span></span></span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">The very best is that you are in the comfort of your own home &#8212; no pressure &#8212; take your time and enjoy the process.</span></p>\n<h4><b></b><span class=\"s1\"><b>6. Find Exactly What You Need<br />\n</b></span></h4>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">One final advantage of online eyewear stores over traditional brick-and-mortar shops is the inventory. Physical stores are limited in what they can showcase you. Online? You<span class=\"s2\">’<span class=\"s1\">ll find 1000s of styles in every shape, color, and size to explore from the comfort of your home. </span></span></span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">An online store can offer more styles and colors of everything &#8212; including all your favorite designer brands (some sites have more than others) such as Ray-Ban, Oakley, Gucci, Versace, Persol, Michael Kors, and the list goes on and on. </span></p>\n<h4 class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\"><b>What about trying on the frames you want?</b></span></h4>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">Trying on the frames you want is part of the fun of buying new glasses in the first place. Want to try some cat-eyed hot pink glasses? Want to break out of your traditional, always stuck with the same thing mode? Providing a wonderful experience is what &#8220;Virtual Mirrors and Try Ons&#8221; has in mind for you. You can see yourself in any pair of glasses &#8212; in front of your computer or phone. Be anywhere you like &#8212; have a friend over for a &#8220;glasses party.&#8221;</span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">The thing is, the online glasses retailers have your best interest in mind. These online eyeglass companies want you to love this shopping experience so that you&#8217;ll return.</span></p>\n<h4 class=\"p3\"><span class=\"s1\"><b>Final Takeaways </b></span></h4>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">During ordinary times &#8212; or these extraordinary times &#8212; shopping for glasses online is becoming more significant for everyone. Perhaps a few years ago better prices and big discounts were the only selling points of the online glasses crowd &#8212; but times have changed. </span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">Free shipping, innovative and easy virtual shopping experiences and risk-free return policies are just a start. Take a look at the wide variety of high-quality products. You can take as long as you want shopping for your next pair of glasses online. No need to rush with a pressure-point salesperson standing over you. </span></p>\n<p class=\"p1\"><span class=\"s1\">More than ever, now is the time you can relax and find the best pair of glasses you&#8217;ve ever had in your life. </span></p>\n<p><em>_ _ _</em></p>\n<p><em>This article was written in partnership with GlassesUSA.com. Readwrite does not receive any monetary compensation or affiliate revenue from any purchases. We receive sample products from our partner companies in exchange for a review. </em></p>\n<p><em>Top Image Credit: Jack Redgate; Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/20/6-reasons-you-should-start-buying-your-glasses-online/\">6 Reasons You Should Start Buying Your Glasses Online</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 20 May 2020 18:00:10 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/6-Reasons-You-Should-Start-Buying-Your-Glasses-Online.png","linkMd5":"88edd0f55bbd319a5d4438e0788472f0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn28@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-19-512_afbb546e77efb071.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/6-Reasons-You-Should-Start-Buying-Your-Glasses-Online.png","destWidth":723,"destHeight":526,"sourceBytes":566900,"destBytes":30684,"author":"Deanna Ritchie","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/6-Reasons-You-Should-Start-Buying-Your-Glasses-Online-300x218.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn56@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-21-306_450e062098eb43c5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877819},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","title":"6 Strategies for eCommerce Stores to Reduce Fraud","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173523","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/05/6-strategies-for-ecommerce-stores-to-reduce-fraud/\" title=\"6 Strategies for eCommerce Stores to Reduce Fraud\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/6-Strategies-for-eCommerce-Stores-to-Reduce-Fraud-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"ecommerce reduce fraud\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/6-Strategies-for-eCommerce-Stores-to-Reduce-Fraud-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/6-Strategies-for-eCommerce-Stores-to-Reduce-Fraud-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/6-Strategies-for-eCommerce-Stores-to-Reduce-Fraud.jpg 500w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>As an eCommerce store, you want to do all you can to reduce fraud. Whether you are a small business or a big corporation, you want to try and reduce fraud at each of the risk exposure points. Fraudsters are intelligent, trying to come up with new ways to get around security and controls.</p>\n<p>For small businesses especially, <a href=\"https://www.chamberofcommerce.com/business-advice/top-it-concerns-businesses-face\">fighting fraud can be a real struggle</a>. It can be difficult to keep up with the necessary time and resources to get fraud detection and prevention controls in place. As a business owner, though, you can do a lot with minimal resources to fight eCommerce fraud.</p>\n<h2><strong>Use PCI Compliance As a Guide</strong></h2>\n<p>The best thing you can do as an eCommerce store is to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/10/challenges-and-opportunities-for-payment-gateway-integration-challenges-opportunities/\">ensure you are PCI compliant.</a> The Payment Card Industry has a Data Security Standard known as PCI DSS. The set of standards is the best practice for online merchants to put in place to help to prevent fraud, as well as breaches of data.</p>\n<p>There is a PCI Compliance Guide and making sure that you are compliant in each of the steps is paramount. Once you are compliant, it is important to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/05/zoombombing-was-just-the-beginning-securing-your-teams-for-remote-work/\">ensure you maintain compliance </a>to avoid fines. Being a vendor that is PCI compliant can help to deter fraudsters, as they know it will be a much harder road to achieve their goals.</p>\n<h4><strong>Put Controls Around Your Payment Gateway</strong></h4>\n<p>Your payment gateway is the one place where you can put in some simple controls that can go a long way. As an eCommerce store, you want to require Address Verification or AVS, as well as Card Code Verification or CVV.</p>\n<p>The Address Verification or AVS process will check the billing address the individual enters against the billing address with the credit card company. The Card Code Verification or CVV method also requires a security code, to help to prevent card-not-present fraud.</p>\n<p>These are a good starting point but may not go far enough to prevent fraud. Reverse e-mail look-up is another great tool to help fight fraud.  With reverse e-mail look-up, you can analyze an e-mail address against public databases, blacklists, SMTP checks and social media profiles to ensure legitimacy before processing a transaction.</p>\n<h4><strong>Perform Regular Reviews of Activity</strong></h4>\n<p>You can do a lot by looking at the activity that goes through your eCommerce store. Most of the time, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/22/6-emerging-cyber-threats-to-lookout-for-in-2019/\">fraudulent activity</a> is something that will quickly stick out to you, if you know what to look for. There can be some things that you can look out for including fake phone numbers, e-mail addresses that do not look real, as well as addresses that are out of place, such as a zip code not lining up with a state.</p>\n<p>You may also <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/04/01/11-artificial-intelligence-trends-every-business-in-2019-must-know/\">look at your order or transaction history </a>for things such as large orders, or excessive orders of high-priced SKU’s.</p>\n<p>Other things that may look out of place are differences in the billing and shipping address, coinciding with requests for expedited shipping. Being on the lookout through regular reviews can help keep your eCommerce store secure.</p>\n<h4><strong>Reviewing the Billing Address Against the IP Address</strong></h4>\n<p>Where is the customer located in terms of their billing address against their IP address? You can use tools to help to match the two of them up. If you have an <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/04/how-to-ensure-security-with-vpn-connection-and-stay-safe-online/\">IP address that is in a different country</a> in comparison to the billing address, it could be a sign of a fraudulent order.</p>\n<h4><strong>Strong Password Requirements</strong></h4>\n<p>Hackers use automated programs that will quickly run all password permutations until they get into an account. One of the best ways to combat fraud as an eCommerce store is to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2015/03/27/password-strength-weaker-than-you-think/\">require strong passwords</a> for customers. While it may not be convenient to have strong passwords, it can help a lot as it is less likely they&#8217;re stolen. This includes having a high minimum number of characters, requiring a combination of symbols, numbers, as well as capital letters. This type of control can make passwords that much harder to crack.</p>\n<h4><strong>Block Users After Declined Transactions</strong></h4>\n<p>Fraudsters may try to guess, or using software to do the guessing for them, when it comes to credit card numbers. They are hoping they hit a match so that they can continue on with their transaction. You want to set limits on how many times a transaction can be declined.</p>\n<p>When they get multiple declined transactions, there are two steps you need to take to ensure they don’t continue. First you want to keep a log of profiles who have tried multiple declined transactions for future analysis. Next you want to block that profile once the declined transaction count has reached a per-determined threshold.</p>\n<p>Locking out the shopping cart and directing the individual to a phone call with customer service is the best course of action. If they are a legitimate customer who was having trouble typing in the information will contact the business to get it resolved.</p>\n<p><strong>Wrap UP </strong></p>\n<p>As an <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/11/how-is-ai-helping-the-ecommerce-industry/\">eCommerce store</a>, you always need to be thinking about different ways that fraud can take place. Fraudsters are smart and are always trying to think outside the box to get around controls. Security controls need to not only detect fraud but also work to prevent it in the first place.</p>\n<p>As a small business or big corporation, take the time to ensure you are doing your part in fighting eCommerce fraud. Taking it one risk exposure, one control at a time can net positive gains in the long run.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Andrea Piacquadio; Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/05/6-strategies-for-ecommerce-stores-to-reduce-fraud/\">6 Strategies for eCommerce Stores to Reduce Fraud</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 05 Aug 2020 15:01:02 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/6-Strategies-for-eCommerce-Stores-to-Reduce-Fraud.jpg","linkMd5":"550786351b76adb5e5882aff3ba30469","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn68@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-25-215_1e96fe8209a5db9b.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/6-Strategies-for-eCommerce-Stores-to-Reduce-Fraud.jpg","destWidth":500,"destHeight":333,"sourceBytes":23763,"destBytes":21042,"author":"Matt Shealy","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/6-Strategies-for-eCommerce-Stores-to-Reduce-Fraud-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn88@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-20-531_2c32b311122b8f76.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195870976},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","title":"Less Data Transparency Means Less Investor Trust","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170013","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/25/less-data-transparency-means-less-investor-trust/\" title=\"Less Data Transparency Means Less Investor Trust\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Less-Data-Transparency-Means-Less-Investor-Trust-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"data transparency\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Less-Data-Transparency-Means-Less-Investor-Trust-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Less-Data-Transparency-Means-Less-Investor-Trust-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Less-Data-Transparency-Means-Less-Investor-Trust-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Less-Data-Transparency-Means-Less-Investor-Trust-1536x1024.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Less-Data-Transparency-Means-Less-Investor-Trust.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>The business world can take two lessons away from the countries that have been most successful in fighting COVID-19. Data <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2017/06/15/incorporating-machine-learning-enterprises/\">operations</a>, data transparency and clear communications matter. Those are particularly important lessons for asset managers that need <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/03/how-to-ensure-your-data-is-providing-trustworthy-insights/\">trust</a> almost more than anything else right now.</p>\n<h2><strong>Singapore</strong> and data</h2>\n<p>Singapore’s initial response to the coronavirus (COVID-19) has been among the <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2020/03/19/world/coronavirus-flatten-the-curve-countries.html\">better</a> in the world, though they are not out of the woods by any stretch.</p>\n<p>Attention has been focused on what decisions Singapore, as well as South Korea and <a href=\"https://www.foreignaffairs.com/articles/asia/2020-03-20/how-civic-technology-can-help-stop-pandemic\">Taiwan</a>, have made, and when they were made. But more attention should be paid to how those decisions became <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2010/02/03/send-help-disaster-response-from-the-cloud/\">possible</a>, and how they have been communicated. That is true for how these countries and their businesses approach economic contagion as well.</p>\n<p>In many cases, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/07/10/data-lake-vs-data-warehouse-which-is-the-best-data-architecture/\">efficient</a> data operations have been the “how.” It’s a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/13/how-data-analytics-can-save-lives/\">lesson</a> other governments and businesses can learn in order to try to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/15/it-project-management-a-love-affair/\">catch up</a> to what is happening now, what will happen next, and what can happen after that.</p>\n<h2><strong>Data operations</strong></h2>\n<p>A review in The Lancet <a href=\"https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(20)30551-1/fulltext\">found</a> that Singapore’s data and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/15/decoding-the-future-trajectory-of-healthcare-with-ai/\">information</a> handling during the pandemic has been superior relative to the rest of the world. South Korea has admirably rolled out testing and used <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2011/04/13/mapping_geolocation_and_the_future_of_scalable_disaster_response/\">geolocation</a> data to <a href=\"https://www.straitstimes.com/asia/east-asia/south-korea-throws-up-innovative-tech-solutions-in-coronavirus-fight\">identify</a> whom to test.</p>\n<p>China is faulted for not moving fast enough early enough. Transparency continues to be a concern. But once in motion authorities <a href=\"https://theshift.media/features/big-data-china-coronavirus-control\">used</a> mobile apps to support 14-day quarantines and infrared cameras in train stations to quickly identify travelers with fevers. Chinese authorities have to work hard to regain trust. Fears that something is being hidden will turn into more problems.</p>\n<p>Contrast that progress with Europe, where cases in Italy have surpassed those in much-bigger China. European authorities have been <a href=\"https://www.foreignaffairs.com/articles/asia/2020-03-20/how-civic-technology-can-help-stop-pandemic?utm_medium=newsletters&#38;utm_source=fatoday&#38;utm_content=20200320&#38;utm_campaign=FA_TODAY_032020%20Taiwan%27s%20Successful%20Pandemic%20Response%2C%20Trump%27s%20Information%20Crackdown%2C%20How%20Corruption%20Shapes%20the%20World&#38;utm_term=FA%20Today%20-%20112017\">called</a> bureaucratic and often technophobic.</p>\n<h2><strong>Transparent communications</strong></h2>\n<p>It’s not just how data operations have enabled decision-making. It is how information is <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/09/digital-marketing-coronavirus/\">shared</a> rapidly, clearly, consistently, and in detail.</p>\n<p>We’re faced with a public health crisis where well organized and transparent data is crucial. Poorly organized data, shared inconsistently, leaves a vacuum filled by conspiracy and fear.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2016/07/05/south-korea-smart-city-model-cl4/\">South Korea</a> quickly deployed a central<a href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2020/mar/20/south-korea-rapid-intrusive-measures-covid-19\"> tracking</a> app that publicly informs citizens of cases within 100 meters of their current location. Koreans have embraced clear and credible access to information. They want to make informed decisions. Citizens want data transparency. They don&#8217;t want <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2010/12/20/shame_on_democratic_south_korea_for_censoring_face/\">hidden</a> realities.</p>\n<p>Taiwan has shared details quickly and openly with an analysis of COVID-19 mortality rates. These efforts provide every citizen with a war room <a href=\"https://www.wired.com/story/taiwan-is-beating-the-coronavirus-can-the-us-do-the-same/\">dashboard</a> that allows them to feel that nothing is being hidden. Singapore releases detailed information on <a href=\"https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/coronavirus-date-information-sharing-1.5500709\">each</a> COVID-19 case.</p>\n<h2><strong>Lines of communication</strong></h2>\n<p>There has been a longstanding fear in the asset management world of allowing too much transparency. Nobody wants investors trying to grab the steering wheel. Due diligence to earn investment in the first place is one thing. GPs suffer frustration if the questions keep coming after the money has changed hands.</p>\n<p>Allocators have built up their own data teams. They&#8217;ve pushed for more data, faster. To keep up funds and fund administrators have learned to build dashboards and to automate. But it hasn’t been with enthusiasm. There is a worry about setting expectations for data sharing that the fund will regret later.</p>\n<h4>When there’s no good news, there is anxiety over what the LP will believe they see in the data.</h4>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/09/private-equity-job-vs-hedge-fund-job-what-to-choose/\">Funds</a> will do better when they show <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/12/to-bolster-trust-businesses-must-act-with-humanity/\">trust</a> first, share data, and have established the infrastructure to offer transparency. Asset managers will be in for more trouble than they’ve bargained for if they don’t fight disinformation with reliable data.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Savvas Stavrinow; Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/25/less-data-transparency-means-less-investor-trust/\">Less Data Transparency Means Less Investor Trust</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 25 Jun 2020 15:01:06 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Less-Data-Transparency-Means-Less-Investor-Trust.jpg","linkMd5":"e06f236a2841b2d3dcd08b59522e8590","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn11@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-21-793_9152424bbef94c69.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Less-Data-Transparency-Means-Less-Investor-Trust.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1280,"sourceBytes":183160,"destBytes":67922,"author":"Kevin Walkup","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/Less-Data-Transparency-Means-Less-Investor-Trust-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn36@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-23-107_653ba2392e78da17.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195874802},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"Growth Opportunities Available During and After Pandemic Times","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170135","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/18/growth-opportunities-available-during-and-after-pandemic-times/\" title=\"Growth Opportunities Available During and After Pandemic Times\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/economic-growth-during-uncertain-times-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/economic-growth-during-uncertain-times-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/economic-growth-during-uncertain-times-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/economic-growth-during-uncertain-times-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/economic-growth-during-uncertain-times-1536x1025.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/economic-growth-during-uncertain-times.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Uncertainty is the mother of fear, but luckily fear breeds opportunity. This is especially true for those savvy (or lucky) enough to predict where and how the current pandemic situation will affect business going forward. A select few are likely to see expansion during uncertainty while others are more likely to see shrinkage, furlough and contraction.</p>\n<p>Because the days of preparation for a crisis are past, it&#8217;s our current response and reaction to the current uncertainties that will play the biggest role in how we navigate and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/09/digital-marketing-coronavirus/\">thrive during and after events like COVID-19</a>.</p>\n<p><strong>Commodities, staples (and those that serve them)</strong></p>\n<p>What a great time to be selling toilet paper, hand sanitizer, flour, food and liquor! <a href=\"https://www.health.com/condition/infectious-diseases/coronavirus/condom-shortage-due-to-pandemic\">Reports of condom shortages</a> underscore the fact that some services and industries continue in spite of economic reversals.</p>\n<p>Luckily, those who provide both direct and indirect inputs in the form of products and services to certain commodity sectors are so often insulated from other industry implosions. Grocery stores and eCommerce sites that provide such services continue to see peak (and greater) demand as people continue to use the toilet and drink alcohol.</p>\n<p>For instance, we have a current online marketing client in the candy industry who has been crushing his sales thanks to the current situation. With advertising costs down and demand for candy up, his has more than quadrupled the <a href=\"https://roi.me/\">ROI</a> on his ad spend.</p>\n<p>Finding opportunities to work in or service industries that may be providing commodity products to consumers during uncertain times will ensure you can both weather and thrive during economic crisis.</p>\n<p><strong>Access to credit, bailouts and wealthy benefactors</strong></p>\n<p>The recent rushed implementation of the CARES Act and it&#8217;s quick postmortem, confirms that attempts at widespread assistance are never distributed evenly or to those who may actually be in dire need. It becomes the classic case of largess distributed to the &#8220;who you know&#8221; few&#8211;or at least to those familiar with processing credit through the SBA.</p>\n<p>A perfect example is the implementation of the payroll protection loans (PPP) provided in the recent legislation. News feeds have been rife with stories about lack of both fund access and oversight as a small minority of crisis-stricken companies have even been able to get close to the needed funding.</p>\n<p>I know of only two of 20 or so CEOs in my personal network who were able to get the needed funding. Both banked with the same SBA lender and were able to get approved in less than a day with access to the funds in less than a week. Most others in my SMB circles were not nearly so lucky. Some spent an entire day completing forms while others waited with no response from their lender, only to find out from news outlets that the funds had run out in about 10 days.</p>\n<p>Those who have access to reasonably-priced debt and equity during crisis times (especially those not serving commodity sectors) will survive through the current rout. I have personally found that access is more about &#8220;who you know.&#8221; Cultivating those relationships on the finance side through a crisis is critical for survival. For the SMBs out there, start yesterday.</p>\n<p><strong>Growth in contract work while the labor rebound slips</strong></p>\n<p>As with recessions in recent memory, the current situation is also likely to have an even slower job recovery&#8211;or more like a lack of one.</p>\n<p>&#160;</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_170137\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-170137\" style=\"width: 900px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"wp-image-170137 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/job-recovery-during-recessions--900x450.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"900\" height=\"450\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/job-recovery-during-recessions--900x450.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/job-recovery-during-recessions--300x150.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/job-recovery-during-recessions--260x130.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/job-recovery-during-recessions-.png 1200w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-170137\" class=\"wp-caption-text\">Our current situation is more likely to mirror our most recent recession, thanks to more automation and current full-time workers picking up the slack. <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_recessions_in_the_United_States\">Source</a></figcaption></figure></p>\n<p>A slower job recovery means stiff competition for positions, less full-time employment and more expansion of the gig economy. We are seeing this very trend among our <a href=\"https://seo.co/seo-reseller/\">SEO resellers</a>, those who start their own SEO agency using the outsourced resources of other firms. We expect to see similar trends across other services sectors where 1099 employees expand more quickly than W2 full-time work as businesses prefer the flexibility and lack of payroll and healthcare responsibility of full-time workers.</p>\n<p>As many <a href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2017/11/29/automation-could-kill-73-million-u-s-jobs-2030/899878001/\">major media outlets</a> have reported, the further <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/12/how-to-successfully-automate-your-approach-to-guest-blogger-outreach/\">growth of automation</a>, artificial intelligence and outsourcing is likely to continue to squash &#8220;real&#8221; job growth. Recessions unfortunately tend to accelerate creative destruction of jobs.</p>\n<p>As a small business owner in this environment, hunkering down can help, but there are certain sales, finance and operational roles within the organization that are critical to the continued survival of your org. If you have to furlough or let go certain employees, it may be worthwhile to bring them in on a part-time contractual basis to ensure the business operations remain intact through the trough.</p>\n<p>As an un or under-employed individual during this time, it may be wise to begin exploring more contract-based work as we head toward a flat job recovery. The earlier the better ensures you win out to those who may be late to the 1099 party.</p>\n<p><strong>Stay abreast of the latest news</strong></p>\n<p>The proliferation of negative news and information is rampant right now. Yes, it is healthy to avoid the 24-hour news cycle as it can fuel unnecessary anxiety. However, there are huge benefits to staying abreast of what is going on in the world as doing so can serve to benefit your activities and your survival rate going forward. In other words, the pros of staying very current on the news heavily outweigh the cons. The situation is changing rapidly and multiple times a day. Understanding the next moves of companies and governments can serve to protect you physically and financially as we navigate uncharted waters.</p>\n<p>For instance, think of those who could have taken advantage of a PPP or EIDL loan application (you miss 100% of the shots you don&#8217;t take), but missed it due to lack of information. Stay attune, stay abreast, stay safe.</p>\n<p><strong>Prepare to survive, then thrive </strong></p>\n<p>In our current socially-distanced situation, the new reality has created some unlikely winners amid many unexpected losers. For instance, no one would have predicted that those providing home exercise equipment would make a killing in the next recession or that the typically recession-resistant dentists (most of whom have been furloughed through mid-May here in Washington state) would have been hit hard during a recession. Unlikely indeed.</p>\n<p>When it comes to recessions, some will thrive, some will survive and many will fail. Avoiding failure is the best that many business owners can hope for at this juncture. For those that are able to survive the current fray, they are likely to succeed in a greater fashion when the recovery eventually occurs (and it will). The reason: there will be a vacuum void in supply of goods and services that will need to be filled and fewer market leaders to fill the void when demand returns.</p>\n<p>The moral of the story is remain calm, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/23/is-technology-artificially-engineering-panic/\">don&#8217;t panic</a> and work to survive and you will be poised to thrive in the future.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/18/growth-opportunities-available-during-and-after-pandemic-times/\">Growth Opportunities Available During and After Pandemic Times</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 18 Apr 2020 15:21:41 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/economic-growth-during-uncertain-times.jpg","linkMd5":"8108ea27d36bdd5debdd0630e4e92b3a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn28@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-24-079_6c36d2d2d1b45dce.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/economic-growth-during-uncertain-times.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1281,"sourceBytes":276886,"destBytes":238274,"author":"Nate Nead","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/economic-growth-during-uncertain-times-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn55@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-39-103_cfacc33121a86245.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/job-recovery-during-recessions--900x450.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn96@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-14-648_ed6a25c3dd339925.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878328},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"Give a Great Startup Founder and Entrepreneur  Media Interview","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=168161","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/18/give-a-great-startup-founder-and-entrepreneur-media-interview/\" title=\"Give a Great Startup Founder and Entrepreneur  Media Interview\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Give-a-Great-Startup-Founder-and-Entrepreneur-Media-Interview-300x185.jpeg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"startup media interview\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Give-a-Great-Startup-Founder-and-Entrepreneur-Media-Interview-300x185.jpeg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Give-a-Great-Startup-Founder-and-Entrepreneur-Media-Interview-260x160.jpeg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Give-a-Great-Startup-Founder-and-Entrepreneur-Media-Interview.jpeg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>It’s always on the checklist for a business and startup founder &#8212; get media attention. And of course, you want that attention – it will put eyeballs on your product, which may lead to users, which can bring money, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/31/vc-funding-in-2020-what-investors-look-for-in-startups/\">potential investors</a>, and all the other wonderful things that can come from matching the right product with the right audience.</p>\n<p>But once you <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/05/fifteen-podcasts-you-must-listen-to-in-2019/\">land that interview opportunity</a> – what next? How do you actually talk to the media? It can be intimidating, and obviously, you want to hit it out of the park.</p>\n<p>I spent more than a decade in the news business, and a lot of that time was spent talking to people who were <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/10/29/5-misconceptions-you-should-know-about-before-launching-your-tech-startup/\">trying to launch new businesses</a>. They were people with big dreams – to operate their own restaurant or speed-dating service (for real) or to sell an app appealing to recreational golfers. They all had an entrepreneurial streak and a desire to succeed.</p>\n<p>What they weren’t necessarily ready for was how to handle a reporter. Talking with these fine folk could be like pulling teeth. While they were excited about the media attention, once I got them on the phone or in person for a chat, they would clam up. Or they would be unsure how to answer my questions. It might have been a lack of confidence stemming from little experience dealing with media, they might have been wary of how a reporter would interpret their words, or perhaps they were just naturally shy.</p>\n<p>If you are a company or startup founder who has successfully secured the attention of a reporter and you’re nervous about your first real media interview, fear not! We’re here to help with tips to help you prepare for your interview.</p>\n<h3><strong>1. Be Informed</strong></h3>\n<p>This sounds obvious, but you need to go into the interview knowing your stuff. You know how you got to where you are, and you know your product. But you should also make sure you are up to date on your industry, your competitors, and any recent developments or controversies in the marketplace.</p>\n<p>A reporter may try to throw you a tough question or a bit of a curveball just to see if you really know your stuff, especially if your industry was recently in the news. So be prepared to tackle just about any topic revolving around your industry.</p>\n<p>But – and this is important – if you <i>don’t</i> have an answer to something, just admit it! Don’t try to fake it, because the reporter will see right through you. Say you’re not sure, but you’re going to look into it and get back to them in an hour, or later in the day.</p>\n<p>And then, make sure you get back to them as soon as you can. A reporter will appreciate your honesty, and unless they are on the strictest of deadlines, they will likely be willing to give you the extra time to give them an informed answer.</p>\n<h3><strong>2. Be Real</strong></h3>\n<p>Be yourself. If you spend the interview trying to spin or sell, just hammering home how awesome your product or service is and not really answering questions in a sincere way, you’re only going to turn them off, and possibly kill the story before a word is ever written. Reporters have finely tuned “BS detectors,” and they don’t appreciate an attempt at being snowed by anybody.</p>\n<p>You can be <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/09/how-to-make-the-most-of-your-software-developer-interview/\">passionate about your product</a> without being overbearing. And you should absolutely let your passion show – just be careful not to overdo it.</p>\n<p>So relax a bit. Be yourself and be honest. Your story likely includes challenges and failures you’ve endured, so mention those and explain how you were inspired to keep going in the face of adversity. Don’t hesitate and stammer or show that you’re uncomfortable with a particular line of questioning. If you’re prepared, as we’ve already mentioned, you’ll be ready for anything.</p>\n<h4><strong>3. Keep it Simple</strong></h4>\n<p>No doubt, there is a long story behind your company. And you know all the intricacies. Resist the urge to dive into every detail or side tangent. Doing that may water down your narrative and leave you unfocused when you’re talking with the reporter.</p>\n<p>Instead, as <a href=\"https://twitter.com/SocialMktgFella\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Andre Bourque</a> explains <a href=\"http://www.huffingtonpost.com/andre-bourque/3-things-to-do-to-prepare_b_6295132.html\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">here</a>, you should create an outline of your key message so you can keep yourself on track.</p>\n<p>“Many companies make the mistake of saying too much or going off on unrelated tangents which bury the more important information,” Bourque writes. “Create powerful analogies, use precise statistics, and be prepared to provide the reporter with a strong, usable quote.”</p>\n<p>Memorize some highlights in order to remain on point. That doesn’t mean you can’t deviate from your main message based on how the conversation goes and based on what the reporter asks, but if you go in focused with a key message and clear narrative in mind, you’ll be more confident and clear in telling your story.</p>\n<h3><strong>4. But be Colorful</strong></h3>\n<p>“Color” in a story is interesting information or comments beyond the basic, necessary facts.</p>\n<p>When you’re telling your story, give examples to back up what you’re saying. Go in armed with anecdotes about when you started your business, how it has changed, or what you have learned along the way can all add color, or a little extra zest, to your narrative.</p>\n<p>Interesting anecdotes and little details are more likely to interest the reporter and the reader (potential future customers) than the basic history of your company. They can also lead to other, future stories if you’ve really piqued the reporter’s interest.</p>\n<h3><strong>5. Respect the Media’s Role</strong></h3>\n<p>Sure, you want the reporter to write a glowing piece about how amazing your company is and how you are revolutionizing your industry. But that is not their goal, and it’s certainly not their job. The job of the media is to inform their audience about the news that may interest them and to give them the full picture on the topic with a fair, balanced story.</p>\n<p>Putting pressure on a reporter will not work. Respect their role and understand that they have their own goals and their own bosses. Be thankful that you’re being included or being featured; it could snowball into many more opportunities.</p>\n<p>Another tip: it’s OK to ask a reporter when they think a story might run, but refrain from being pushy about it. Don’t email or call them repeatedly to ask about the status of it. You can check in now and again (say, every couple of weeks), but don’t badger them.</p>\n<p>And remember this: if you impress a journalist by being honest, real, informed, and reasonable, you will undoubtedly be a source of information a reporter will return to. As <a href=\"https://twitter.com/ksenia_valley\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Ksenia Chabanenko</a> writes <a href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/246427\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">here</a>, “Next time the journalist has a request, you might be the first founder he/she calls simply because you were the most cooperative and prompt.”</p>\n<p>Like most reporters, I usually had little time to turn around several <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2013/03/11/8-real-world-stories-of-why-startups-fail/\">entrepreneur stories</a> at once. And while I would try to switch things up and interview a wide variety of sources as much as possible, I wouldn’t hesitate in a pinch to call up a source I knew was informed and able to think on their feet.</p>\n<p>You could be that source for a reporter, by sticking to some of the concepts we’ve mentioned here.</p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/18/give-a-great-startup-founder-and-entrepreneur-media-interview/\">Give a Great Startup Founder and Entrepreneur  Media Interview</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 18 Apr 2020 15:00:02 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Give-a-Great-Startup-Founder-and-Entrepreneur-Media-Interview.jpeg","linkMd5":"252a73b20ee4833b710d8780bf7603bf","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn35@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-21-718_b972ea460c6aaf8d.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Give-a-Great-Startup-Founder-and-Entrepreneur-Media-Interview.jpeg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":29061,"destBytes":21190,"author":"Sameer Ahmed","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Give-a-Great-Startup-Founder-and-Entrepreneur-Media-Interview-300x185.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn40@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-19-476_119f06f02283fcfe.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878471},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"How to Fix your Headphones Yourself: A Step-by-Step Guide","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=167074","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/02/how-to-fix-your-headphones-yourself-a-step-by-step-guide/\" title=\"How to Fix your Headphones Yourself: A Step-by-Step Guide\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Fix-your-Headphones-Yourself-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"fix your headphones\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Fix-your-Headphones-Yourself-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Fix-your-Headphones-Yourself-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/How-to-Fix-your-Headphones-Yourself.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>If the music from your headphones sounds only in one ear &#8212; don&#8217;t rush to throw them out. Most people have experienced getting a pair of headphones only to have them stop working &#8212; especially on one side. You&#8217;ll find that your headphones are easy to fix and it&#8217;s quite fun, too. Most damage occurs while your headphones are still good. Here is how to fix your headphones for yourself &#8212; a step-by-step guide.</p>\n<h3><strong>Damaged contacts on your headphones can be sealed &#8212; especially on the plug.</strong></h3>\n<p>Surely you are familiar with this situation: you put on your headphones, anticipating the enjoyment of your favorite tunes &#8211; and that’s all: you don’t hear anything. Or only one earphone works, which is even more annoying.</p>\n<p>If such problems occur, in most cases, you can slightly twitch or tweak the cable at the plug or gently squeezing the base until the sound goes from both channels. This may help for a while &#8212; but you usually have to continually fiddle around with them to keep them working.</p>\n<p>The easiest solution, in this case, is to toss these in the trash and buy new headphones. That option is not bad, but what if the headphones you bought are not some ordinary headphones? What if this time you bought expensive, high-quality headphones, or they&#8217;re your most beloved and wonderful ones?</p>\n<p>There are thousands of headphones to choose from. Research claims that the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2016/10/26/market-hearables-reach-16b-2020-dl4/\">headphones market will reach $16B by the end of 2020</a>. Now, you&#8217;ve bought an earphone by spending hours of your precious time, comparing them, reviewing them and a lot more. Do some careful research before buying a pair of costly earphones because you&#8217;ll likely leave them somewhere, or your buddy will borrow them.</p>\n<h3><strong>Remember that the annoying issues with headphones usually don&#8217;t indicate a breakdown of the headphones themselves.</strong></h3>\n<p>You&#8217;re facing some kind of small damage to the contact, cable or connector plug on your headphones.Replacing the plug is not very difficult and expensive. If you contact the master, you&#8217;ll just be asked for money for fixing your headphones for a simple fix you can do on your own.</p>\n<p><strong>If you do careful work and your hands do not tremble, you can do everything yourself at home.</strong></p>\n<p>You&#8217;ll have a little preparation for the repair. There are a few components you&#8217;ll want to buy &#8212; but then everyone will be coming to you to have their headphones fixed.</p>\n<p>Standard contact plugs are sold in electronics stores for less than $100. A new plug always required a solder to the wire. Of course, there are models that screw and tighten, but for headphones that are used with mobile devices, I don&#8217;t recommend them.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_167076\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-167076\" style=\"width: 758px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture.jpg\"><img class=\"wp-image-167076 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture.jpg\" alt=\"tools to fix headphones\" width=\"758\" height=\"416\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture.jpg 758w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture-300x165.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture-260x143.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 758px) 100vw, 758px\" /></a><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-167076\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><em>Tools you will want to fix your headphones.</em></figcaption></figure></p>\n<p>For repairs, you&#8217;ll want a soldering iron, solder. Read the directions and practice with these so that you&#8217;ll have the skills to work with them. To enhance the effect of the fix, find a piece of heat-shrinkable tube for insulation of live parts. The tube should tightly enclose the cable, while also providing mechanical protection.</p>\n<p>In principle, a heat shrink tube is the same as electrical tape, but it is much more convenient, and the reliability is higher.</p>\n<h2><b>Looking for the cause of the damage.</b></h2>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_167077\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-167077\" style=\"width: 756px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture1.jpg\"><img class=\"wp-image-167077 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture1.jpg\" alt=\"problem where earplugs don't work\" width=\"756\" height=\"418\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture1.jpg 756w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture1-300x166.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture1-260x144.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 756px) 100vw, 756px\" /></a><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-167077\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><em>Look at the bend in the wire by the straight jack.</em></figcaption></figure></p>\n<p>Usually, your headphone cable will be breaking right in the middle, or higher up toward one end. The cause of the breakdown is almost always a plug, which, when used regularly, is subjected to mechanical stress much more often than other elements of the headphones. Just squeeze and pull the wire in the area of ​​the plug.</p>\n<p>If you can hear a sound after manipulating the wire a little, then you have located the malfunction.</p>\n<p>Simply cut off the old plug &#8212; because you will no longer need it. If you find the distance between the cliff and the flexible part of the plug is about a few cms &#8212; there&#8217;s a good chance that it can be fixed.</p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_167078\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-167078\" style=\"width: 742px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture2.jpg\"><img class=\"wp-image-167078 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture2.jpg\" alt=\"tester for wire\" width=\"742\" height=\"413\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture2.jpg 742w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture2-300x167.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture2-260x145.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 742px) 100vw, 742px\" /></a><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-167078\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><em>You&#8217;ll want a tester. They are fun!</em></figcaption></figure></p>\n<p>To accurately determine the location of the gap, you can use the tester in the resistance measurement mode (Ohms).</p>\n<p>Touch one end of either of the pins of the plug (the left or right headphone output is the two extreme pins) and attach a simple needle to the other probe. Then, gently stick the probe into the wire a little further from the intended place of the gap.</p>\n<p>If instead of 1 (one), the tester shows a value of 0 (zero) or a little more than zero (a value with hundredths or tenths), then a gap has occurred in this wire. You have located the problem. This is where you are going to fix your headphones.</p>\n<h2><b>Remove the insulation.</b></h2>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_167079\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-167079\" style=\"width: 756px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture3.jpg\"><img class=\"wp-image-167079 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture3.jpg\" alt=\"plastic covering wires.\" width=\"756\" height=\"420\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture3.jpg 756w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture3-300x167.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture3-260x144.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 756px) 100vw, 756px\" /></a><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-167079\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><em>Slide back the plastic covering the wires.</em></figcaption></figure></p>\n<p>You can get wire strippers at your local hardware store, or just use a small pocket knife. Pickup your sharp pocket knife or wire strippers, and carefully remove the insulation from around the end of the cable. Move slowly and only take off a few centimeters.</p>\n<p>Now, separate the three wires from each other. Take your heated soldering iron &#8212; and for hell sake &#8212; don&#8217;t burn yourself. Burn those three wires &#8212; carefully &#8212; with the soldering iron. You&#8217;ll get a colored insulating coating from their very ends of the wires.</p>\n<h2><b>Prepare the ends of the cable.</b></h2>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_167080\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-167080\" style=\"width: 761px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture4.jpg\"><img class=\"wp-image-167080 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture4.jpg\" alt=\"soldering wire ends\" width=\"761\" height=\"409\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture4.jpg 761w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture4-300x161.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture4-260x140.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 761px) 100vw, 761px\" /></a><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-167080\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><em>Fixing ends of the wire so you can solder. Don&#8217;t worry, it&#8217;s easy.</em></figcaption></figure></p>\n<p>You&#8217;ll want to put on a new plug cartridge, a flexible tube, and the cable. It will be easier to solder if you first individually tear the ends of the wires that you&#8217;ve already stripped.</p>\n<h2><b>Now, solder and fix.</b></h2>\n<p>Before you start soldering, it is useful to study the design of the stereo-pin contact plug. The headphone cable contains three wires: the right channel (usually red), the left channel (green, white or yellow) and the ground (in our case, usually copper).</p>\n<p>On a mono headphone plug, there is no right-left channel separation. Depending on the plug, the solder contacts will be of different sizes. Try not to create electrical connections between the contacts during soldering. Be especially careful with the ground, otherwise, when headphones are connected to the device, it will short-out (called a short circuit). Be mindful not to expose the ends of cables more than you need to for soldering.</p>\n<p>According to the photo below &#8212; solder the three wires to the contacts of the new plug. Then, move to the part of the cable that doesn&#8217;t have insulation. Carefully and slowly heat the insulation around the wire with the soldering iron, until the insulation snugs up, and completely shrinks around the wires.</p>\n<h2><b>Fasten the cartridge.</b></h2>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_167081\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-167081\" style=\"width: 762px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture5.jpg\"><img class=\"wp-image-167081 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture5.jpg\" alt=\"plugging cartridge to wire. \" width=\"762\" height=\"417\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture5.jpg 762w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture5-300x164.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture5-260x142.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 762px) 100vw, 762px\" /></a><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-167081\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><em>Slowly and carefully plug in the cartridge.</em></figcaption></figure></p>\n<p>Next, you&#8217;re going to do the plug cartridge. Hold gently and carefully, so as not to damage the results of the work you&#8217;ve already done. Now, move the wider plastic tube to all the joints. Push the cartridge in place (as seen in the photo) and screw it tightly onto the plug. This needs to be tight enough so that the cartridge won&#8217;t subsequently unscrew spontaneously.</p>\n<h2><b>Now, you&#8217;ll check for quality.</b></h2>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_167082\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-167082\" style=\"width: 757px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture6.jpg\"><img class=\"wp-image-167082 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture6.jpg\" alt=\"headphone check\" width=\"757\" height=\"418\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture6.jpg 757w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture6-300x166.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/Capture6-260x144.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 757px) 100vw, 757px\" /></a><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-167082\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><em>Now you can check headphones to see if you were successful.</em></figcaption></figure></p>\n<p>Upon completion of the operation, you&#8217;ll want to check the performance of your repaired headphones.</p>\n<p>Connect your headphones to any player you usually use them on &#8212; your smartphone or stereo system. Turn up the tunes and enjoy your music.<b></b></p>\n<h4>Conclusion</h4>\n<p>Once you&#8217;ve practiced a little you will become fast at fixing headphones and everyone will come to you. You may have a little freelance business on the side.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/02/how-to-fix-your-headphones-yourself-a-step-by-step-guide/\">How to Fix your Headphones Yourself: A Step-by-Step Guide</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 02 Apr
