first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 07 Jul 2020 14:01:02 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Airweave-Mattress-Advanced.jpg","linkMd5":"e7ecc996827dcc56c79697154553aea0","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn3@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-22-196_8361cfcad95d97fa.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Airweave-Mattress-Advanced.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":48917,"destBytes":37382,"author":"Deanna Ritchie","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Airweave-Mattress-Advanced-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn59@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-17-838_ce2f7a3860942986.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195873768},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:50","title":"The Future of IoT Devices: What it Means for Connectivity","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173514","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/07/the-future-of-iot-devices-what-it-means-for-connectivity/\" title=\"The Future of IoT Devices: What it Means for Connectivity\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Future-of-IoT-Devices-What-it-Means-for-Connectivity-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"iot devices connectivity\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Future-of-IoT-Devices-What-it-Means-for-Connectivity-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Future-of-IoT-Devices-What-it-Means-for-Connectivity-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Future-of-IoT-Devices-What-it-Means-for-Connectivity.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>A shift from the cloud to the edge might signal a real autonomous revolution in IoT connectivity. While previously, we witnessed how cloud computing allowed for centralization and collaboration &#8212; edge devices are all about abilities to work offline, autonomously, without sending data to the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/07/achieving-paperless-operations-and-document-automation-with-ai-and-ml/\">cloud for processing and storage</a>. Here is the future of IoT devices and what it means for connectivity.</p>\n<p>Does edge connectivity mean we&#8217;ll outgrow <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/03/technology-trends-that-are-emerging-post-pandemic/\">Cloud-based connectivity</a> and that we are heading towards the era where edge computing takes central place? Good question.</p>\n<h2>When we say IoT, what do we mean?</h2>\n<p>When the Internet of Things term was first introduced around 20 years ago, it alluded to the Internet, which was a big thing back then.</p>\n<p>The concept of miniature sensors sending and receiving the data from the cloud over WiFi was huge and breathtaking. When talking about the Internet of Things today, we mean a remotely controllable ecosystem of devices connected to the cloud and to each other with some kind of connectivity.</p>\n<p>Most importantly, these devices must be able to perform some actions.</p>\n<p>In terms of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/26/iot-and-home-automation-is-it-the-future/\">smart homes</a>, we talk about smart speakers/voice assistants like Alexa or Google Echo, that can issue commands to switch on the lights, tune the conditioner or order a pizza at the nearest Domino or Pizza Hut.</p>\n<p>The connected-concept can be rigged up to smart systems controlling commercial real estate across a variety of scenarios. When talking about the Industry 5.0 factories and other industrial installations like wind farms, the IoT means an ecosystem of devices capable of communicating with each other and able to perform some actions based on the commands received.</p>\n<p>However, as the technology evolves, the meaning of the terms like IoT and connectivity broadens, and we must take into account this updated image of what connectivity is today — and what it will become in the future.</p>\n<h2>Why IoT is not enough anymore</h2>\n<p>The concept of IoT as an independent development entity centered at the gathering, sending, and receiving data has overstayed its welcome. In short, <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/hodfleishman/2020/01/07/its-2020-lets-stop-saying-iot/#357bb35c73dd\">the IoT, in its original meaning, is long dead</a>.</p>\n<p>Such systems must provide much more business value to be feasible nowadays. They must enable the users to analyze the data gathered and perform meaningful actions based on the results of this analysis.</p>\n<p>The focus of the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/06/25/no-just-connectivity-telecom-must-leverage-the-most-of-iot-to-deliver-value-based-services/\">IoT and connectivity</a> has shifted from the brilliance of myriads of sensors to the value of data they gather. The data, not the sensors, is king. There are surely more sophisticated sensors to come, but their main value is the data they can gather &#8212; and the actions we can perform based on this data.</p>\n<p>Of course, we only need a smart kettle to be simply switched on when we are close to home so that we can get a cup of tea or coffee faster.</p>\n<p>But an autonomous car must be able to react to the changes in the road situation around it, and a smart factory must be able to adjust complex working scenarios should something go awry.</p>\n<p>Therefore, the IoT alone as a concept of Digitally Connected Assets, or DCAs, is not viable. It cannot exist in a vacuum, as such systems must be able to process the data quickly and make use of it either through analytics or through issuing some commands.</p>\n<p>Performing the task in the cloud means too large latency &#8212; so we need something faster. &#8220;Faster&#8221; is where the edge computing concept comes into play.</p>\n<h2>Edge computing &#8212; the next stage of the IoT evolution</h2>\n<p>The <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/28/introducing-the-technologies-set-to-redefine-cloud-computing/\">edge computing term</a> refers to the concept of local computational nodes that form the hearts of the sensor networks in some locations. These sensor networks can be a server node on a factory or in an agricultural complex, an aforementioned Google or Amazon smart home system.</p>\n<p>The system can also be the smart utility control system for commercial real estate like malls or office buildings.</p>\n<p>In short, edge computing provides a Local Area Network connection for sensors, enabling lightning-fast data transmission. It is also <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/28/introducing-the-technologies-set-to-redefine-cloud-computing/\">connected to the cloud</a> to enable centralized data gathering and analysis, storage of historical data, and training of AI/ML models on this data.</p>\n<p>But most importantly, edge computing nodes provide sufficient computing capacity to host Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning algorithms locally, which allows these models to issue the needed commands based on the data received from the sensors.</p>\n<p>Let’s imagine the fully-automated Industry 5.0 factory equipped by various sensors (movement, temperature, humidity, etc.), a fleet of robots, and multiple actuators.</p>\n<p>The robots perform the production operations <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/03/17/efforts-disaster-prediction-take-step-iot-sensors/\">while the sensors monitor the situation</a> &#8212; and one sensor signals the drastic overheating in one of the conveyor belt engines.</p>\n<p>The local edge computing node receives the signal, and the AI/ML algorithm running it enacts one of the response scenarios. The scenario can shut down the engine, apply the coolant if possible, disconnect the engine from the conveyor belt (if there are backup engines &#8211; start them).</p>\n<p>To minimize the production disruption — or reroute the flow of production to other conveyors. All of the functions are done within milliseconds, preventing fire and saving the manufacturer millions in potential damage.</p>\n<h2>To make operations possible, the edge computing nodes must have <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/janakirammsv/2020/06/15/critical-capabilities-for-edge-computing-in-industrial-iot-scenarios/#30fc3b096df9\">three key abilities</a>:</h2>\n<ul>\n<li>To control the processes in the physical world. Edge computing nodes must be able to gather the data, process it, and enact some response actions.</li>\n<li>To work offline. Deep underground mines or sea installations far from the shore can have issues communicating to the cloud, so their systems must be able to operate autonomously.</li>\n<li>Zero-second response time. With automated production or utility operations, a delay in several seconds can results in huge financial losses, so the response scenarios must be enacted and executed immediately.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2>The future of IoT: cyber-physical, contextual and autonomous objects</h2>\n<p>As we can see, the meaning and the value of the IoT have shifted from the ecosystem of interconnected devices for gathering data to the ecosystem of devices able to gather the data, process it, and act based on this data. Therefore, we can define three main categories of existing and future IoT devices:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>\n<h4>Cyber-physical objects.</h4>\n<p>The sensors that collect physical signals and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/02/how-can-ai-and-ml-transform-the-way-we-read-and-understand-data/\">transform them into digital data</a>. Think of smart wearables that track our vitals, digital printers, many machine-to-machine and telematic equipment, various smart home systems like thermostats, etc.</p>\n<p>All the consumer devices that can perform only a single function like switching the light on/off or rolling the blinds up/down also belong to this group.</li>\n<li>\n<h4>Contextual objects.</h4>\n<p>Simple cyber-physical DCAs just provide the data or execute single commands, but more complex systems allow understanding the context in which these sensors and actuators operate and make better decisions.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>As an example, let’s imagine an agricultural complex, where DCAs control the irrigation systems or the location and operations of a fleet of automated machines.</p>\n<p>By supplementing this with an edge computing node, the farmer can consolidate this data to a single dashboard and augment it with weather forecasts and other crucial information, which will help get much more value of the data and control all the systems effortlessly.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Autonomous objects: the highest level of the “gather-process-react” chain, these systems combine the sensor networks, edge computing nodes, and the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/24/how-ai-at-the-edge-other-iot-trends-are-transforming-every-industry/\">AI/ML algorithms</a> to form autonomous objects that take the responsibility from humans to machines. An example is the factory incident we mentioned earlier.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2>Summing up: call it as you wish &#8212; connectivity will not die</h2>\n<p>We must operate in the real world and use the tools available to us. <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/02/demystifying-8-core-myths-that-surround-the-internet-of-things/\">Basic gateway devices</a> provide ample capacities for data gathering, storing, and processing within an edge computing node.</p>\n<p>These nodes enable the ML model in it to take action. Nevertheless, they cannot provide sufficient computing resources for training a model like this, as it requires processing mounds of historical data over hundreds of computational cycles, which can be done only in cloud data centers.</p>\n<p>Connectivity is still crucial for connecting edge computing nodes to the cloud, gathering statistical data, training new AI algorithms, and updating the existing ones. It is an integrated ecosystem, where every component plays its role.</p>\n<h2>What are we going to call this new and exciting ecosystem?</h2>\n<p>IoT 2.0? Cyber-physical edge computing-enabled objects? The terms itself matters little, while we understand what stands behind it. These objects will have the ability to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/13/top-25-podcasts-designed-to-make-you-think-and-grow/\">connect the physical and digital worlds</a>, gather the data with sensors, process it in context with other input, and take actions based on this analysis.</p>\n<p>While this ecosystem works and is feasible, it matters little what we call it.</p>\n<p>Most importantly, connectivity is still crucial for <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/28/introducing-the-technologies-set-to-redefine-cloud-computing/\">connecting edge computing</a> nodes to the cloud, so connectivity will never die.</p>\n<p>What do you think of the future of IoT and the importance of connectivity? Please let us know in the comments below.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/07/the-future-of-iot-devices-what-it-means-for-connectivity/\">The Future of IoT Devices: What it Means for Connectivity</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 07 Aug 2020 18:00:16 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Future-of-IoT-Devices-What-it-Means-for-Connectivity.jpg","linkMd5":"d24b720cfc1cbe5838a69d3c210beff4","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn90@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-09-873_d750ce9ed2d18d2d.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Future-of-IoT-Devices-What-it-Means-for-Connectivity.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":46678,"destBytes":40258,"author":"Sergiy Seletsky","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/The-Future-of-IoT-Devices-What-it-Means-for-Connectivity-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn47@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-17-908_373037de46e2c1e3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195870495},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","title":"IIoT Trends and Challenges to Watch","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170125","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/24/iiot-trends-and-challenges-to-watch/\" title=\"IIoT Trends and Challenges to Watch\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/IIoT-Trends-and-Challenges-to-Watch-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"IIot trends\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/IIoT-Trends-and-Challenges-to-Watch-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/IIoT-Trends-and-Challenges-to-Watch-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/IIoT-Trends-and-Challenges-to-Watch.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">The Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) is the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/18/what-can-we-expect-for-iot-in-2020/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">application of IoT</a> in an industrial setting. IIoT is sometimes referred to as Industry 4.0, though the latter primarily focuses on the manufacturing sector, using upgraded technologies to reduce waste and increase value in this field. Here are the IIoT trends and challenges to watch.<br />\n</span></p>\n<h3><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">IIoT encompasses all areas in which industrial equipment is used.<br />\n</span></h3>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">Like <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/10/how-iot-reshapes-industry-4-0-and-the-effects-of-iot-on-smes/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Industry 4.0</a>, IIoT will revolutionize processes through connected machines that can optimize productivity and revenue. IIoT can be seen in a variety of industries, from transportation to public safety and from energy to, of course, manufacturing. </span></p>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">There are new trends in this space and we need to see why challenges leaders are trying to manage these trends.</span></p>\n<h2><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">Solving for the Influx of data from disparate systems</span></h2>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">More and more data is coming in for anyone using IoT, but this is especially true in the world of IIoT. Operators have become overwhelmed by the massive amount of data, making it difficult to harness its power for decision-making. One reason why it&#8217;s so difficult to make sense of the data is that it comes from so many disparate systems.</span></p>\n<p><strong>Angie Sticher, COO/CPO of UrsaLeo</strong><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">, the only company to offer photorealistic 3D digital twins combined with live sensor data, asset data, maintenance data, notes, &#8220;the varying types of data streams from different systems that don&#8217;t connect to one another and can&#8217;t give a realistic view of what&#8217;s happening in a given environment. </span></p>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">To help manage the deluge of data, technology is being deployed and creating a workflow that moves between these systems giving employees and managers the tools to triage issues quickly and get to problem-solving.</span></p>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">Ultimately this also helps in getting to the resolution phase of an incident more quickly.&#8221;</span></p>\n<h2><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">Manufacturing Success in IIoT</span></h2>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">Though current trends do not indicate an uptick in US manufacturing, some in the IIoT industry think this may change. <em><strong>Joy Weiss, President, and CEO of </strong></em></span><em><strong>Tempo Automation</strong></em><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">, a smart factory startup for printed circuit board assembly (PCBA), has seen this trend come to light. &#8220;We have seen a growing trend among companies preferring to switch to US-based manufacturing partners. </span></p>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">Using these partners instead of contracting overseas for a number of reasons, including the recent global health crisis due to Coronavirus,&#8221; she said. &#8220;Some of these advantages include geographic proximity, added IP and security certifications and standards, as well as the use of US-sourced, authentic components, and parts.&#8221;</span></p>\n<p><em><strong>Christine Kyle-Remmert, CEO and Founder of LoneStarTracking</strong></em><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">, a company that provides telematics solutions that include the latest Cat-M1 cellular technology and cellular-free LoRaWan deployments across North America, explains that power consumption, transmission distance, and price are three factors that play a role in the successful deployment of this technology.</span></p>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">&#8220;As technology progresses, sensors are getting smaller, more lightweight, and more affordable. However, no one has time to run around and replace batteries. Just a couple years ago, IoT sensors would only last 1-2 years; however, today, we are deploying sensors that can last 10+ years on a single coin cell battery,&#8221; Kyle-Remmert explains. </span></p>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">&#8220;Using technology like LoRaWAN, IoT sensors can now communicate 10+km and even further, with very little power. If you can develop a sensor that is a low cost, then there is nothing restricting you from deploying more sensors to get denser coverage.&#8221;</span></p>\n<h2><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">Skills Gap in the World of IIoT</span></h2>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">Like many new technologies, a skills gap permeates through this industry. <em><strong>Ekaterina Lyapina, Solutions Architect and AI and IIoT Consultant at </strong></em></span><em><strong>Zyfra</strong></em><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">, a company that develops industrial digitalization technologies for machinery, metallurgy, mining, and oil and gas notes, &#8220;The qualifications needed to install new smart robots in production lines are often not available in most companies. </span></p>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">Facilities and factories lack free time and robot technicians to update their ongoing production. This leads them to a fall behind AI and IIoT trends, as they are not capable of using the latest robotics technology. They are missing skills in integration, implementation, and debugging artificial intelligence enhanced systems. </span></p>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">So, the hindering factor in AI automation is workers&#8217; qualifications at the foremost front. Especially the training and customization of neural networks require deep specialists&#8217; knowledge to dig the treasures of AI.&#8221;</span></p>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">Sticher offers a potential solution to this skills gap, noting, &#8220;virtualization is driving cost reduction for training in a number of sectors. Digital Twins and 3D Models make it easier to train staff because they mirror real-world environments and shorten the learning curve. </span></p>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">Coupled with combining and scaling data from many systems, digital twins also offer a realistic and readily accessible information hub to an environment&#8217;s current status.&#8221;</span></p>\n<h4>Conclusion</h4>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">Especially with the new order of the world, due to new restrictions and regulations brought on by Covid-19, it will be interesting to see where IIoT stands at the end of 2020. </span></p>\n<p><span data-preserver-spaces=\"true\">While innovation in this industry continues, companies are grappling with the changes and safety precautions that need more immediate attention.</span></p>\n<p><em>Image Credit: Pexels</em></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/24/iiot-trends-and-challenges-to-watch/\">IIoT Trends and Challenges to Watch</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 24 Jun 2020 21:00:49 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/IIoT-Trends-and-Challenges-to-Watch.jpg","linkMd5":"f8be7438210797f10650c0dbe1e81f27","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn60@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-18-905_a6c2e90b2b03fe58.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/IIoT-Trends-and-Challenges-to-Watch.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":54721,"destBytes":47080,"author":"Nora 23:18:07","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:07","title":"Bevy.com raises $15M Series B from Accel for Virtual Event Community Platform","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171577","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/19/bevy-com-raises-15m-series-b-from-accel-for-virtual-event-community-platform/\" title=\"Bevy.com raises $15M Series B from Accel for Virtual Event Community Platform\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"62\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed-300x62.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"Bevy\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed-300x62.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed-900x186.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed-260x54.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed-1536x317.png 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed.png 1600w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Bevy.com                                                                               <strong>FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: </strong> <strong>5/19/2020</strong>    Palo Alto, CA</p>\n<p>&#160;</p>\n<h2><strong>BEVY.COM RAISES $15M SERIES B FROM ACCEL FOR VIRTUAL EVENT COMMUNITY PLATFORM</strong></h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed2.jpg\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-171603 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed2-900x502.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"900\" height=\"502\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed2-900x502.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed2-300x167.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed2-260x145.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed2-1536x856.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed2.jpg 1600w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></a></p>\n<p><em>Palo Alto, California, May 19, 2020</em>. &#8211;In February 2020, Startup Grind’s global in-person community hosted just one virtual event hosted by the Beijing China chapter and broadcast across 30 other Chapters in mainland China. As Covid-19 spread across the world, the shift from in-person events to virtual moved quickly with it. Two months later in April, Startup Grind hosted 250 virtual events with 40,000 online viewers, a 5x increase from the in-person audience a year earlier.</p>\n<p>Brands like Salesforce, Duolingo, Slack, Asana, and Atlassian have seen similar explosive shifts to virtual events opening up new opportunities for brands to reach their communities mostly stuck at home on quarantine. All these community programs are powered by <a href=\"http://www.bevy.com\">Bevy.com</a>’s virtual event community platform.</p>\n<p>Today Bevy announced a $15 million dollar Series B funding round led by Accel Partners with participation from existing investors Upfront Ventures, and Ryan Smith, the CEO and co-founder of Qualtrics. Ryan Smith and Accel’s Ryan Sweeney have joined Bevy’s Board of Directors as part of the funding.</p>\n<p>“It’s been incredible to see how quickly communities adjusted to the virtual explosion we’ve all experienced,” said Derek Andersen, co-founder, and CEO of <a href=\"http://www.bevy.com\">Bevy.com</a>. “Communities that were once focused on in-person events are now only weeks later exploding in a virtual format at an unprecedented scale.”</p>\n<p>Bevy also announced today it released a new end to end virtual product that allows organizers to build, create, and run a virtual event registration and experience all contained in the product. &#8220;Having an end-to-end solution,&#8221; Andersen said, &#8220;allows enterprises to give its community a full experience from inside the browser while still owning the data and maintaining a high level of security.&#8221; The product also supports any other video solution and has a deep integration with Zoom.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed3.jpg\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-171606 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed3-900x502.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"900\" height=\"502\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed3-900x502.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed3-300x167.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed3-260x145.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed3-1536x856.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed3.jpg 1600w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></a></p>\n<p>&#8220;From our experience as early investors in companies that defined the future of work like Atlassian, Slack, and Dropbox, we believe that the team behind Bevy has created a platform that is unmatched in building and growing virtual communities and events at scale,&#8221; said Ryan Sweeney, partner at Accel.</p>\n<p>In the past six weeks, Salesforce’s <a href=\"https://trailblazercommunitygroups.com/\">Trailblazer community</a> hosted 650 virtual events for more than 20,000 people. Duolingo hosted 1,000 over the same period. These virtual events are hosted and led by customers in what is called Customer to Customer (C2C) marketing. Marketers have long tried to harness and unlock word of mouth marketing. “But before Bevy,” Andersen said, “Creating word of mouth in repeatable and scalable ways has always been very expensive, and sometimes impossible. C2C community marketing can generate millions of customer conversations, and is the cheapest and highest quality marketing you can do to build your sales pipeline or increase retention.”</p>\n<p>A recent <a href=\"https://stateofstartups2019.firstround.com/#10-community-moat\">First Round Capital study</a> showed that 80% of founders said building a community is important, and 28% said it was their moat and critical to their success. With Covid-19 forcing people to quarantine around the world, Bevy says they have experienced explosive demand for their virtual event community product.</p>\n<p>“In less than three years, Bevy has built a roster of customers that would take most other enterprise SaaS companies 10+ years to develop.” Qualtrics CEO Ryan Smith said. “Bevy lets companies host a user conference all year long in cities around the world. Building a virtual community with Bevy is the future of field marketing.”</p>\n<p>The new funding is being used to double the <a href=\"https://bevy.com/about/\">distributed company’s team</a> and invest in building and educating the industry via the <a href=\"http://cmxhub.com\">CMX</a> community it acquired in 2019.</p>\n<p>Bevy also recently launched <a href=\"https://bevy.com/bevy4good\">Bevy4Good</a> giving access to Bevy’s platform, at no cost, to health care workers and organizations fighting Covid-19. Recently they publicly shared a program called #give100 where team members were encouraged to give $100 to a friend affected by Covid-19. The only conditions were that it needed to help a friend and they needed to share it publically to encourage more people to give. <a href=\"https://twitter.com/DerekjAndersen/status/1253090492553674752?s=20\">The tweets</a> generated over 100,000 impressions and dozens of stories of more people being helped in the same way.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed4-1.png\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-171609 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed4-1.png\" alt=\"Derek Andersen\" width=\"900\" height=\"381\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed4-1.png 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed4-1-300x127.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed4-1-260x110.png 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></a></p>\n<p>“Bevy’s team understands how fortunate we are to have jobs in a growing and thriving industry, and in that position, we have a responsibility to help others,” Andersen said. “Bevy helps bring purpose to over 7 million people through building community. Doing good is uniquely tied to our core mission. As Bevy grows, I hope our capacity to do good outside the company outpaces the growth we see inside. Helping others is what community building is all about, and we hope to do as much good as possible in the years to come.”</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/19/bevy-com-raises-15m-series-b-from-accel-for-virtual-event-community-platform/\">Bevy.com raises $15M Series B from Accel for Virtual Event Community Platform</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 19 May 2020 14:00:58 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed.png","linkMd5":"88d44e35500635244daddd2d456a1e6d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn84@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-09-948_fa2bf4436c60842f.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed.png","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":330,"sourceBytes":38932,"destBytes":10734,"author":"Brad Anderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed-300x62.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn64@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-18-486_3662e41b5bf39aea.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed2-900x502.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn19@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-09-619_ba9eed5cb4b6c957.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed3-900x502.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn36@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-10-527_7870f895103c3bc2.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/unnamed4-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn15@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-21-931_0188a4aca8ad33c3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195887484},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"How to Build Your Community with Live Video","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171214","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/08/how-to-build-your-community-with-live-video/\" title=\"How to Build Your Community with Live Video\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"279\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Build-Your-Community-with-Live-Video-300x279.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"live video\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Build-Your-Community-with-Live-Video-300x279.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Build-Your-Community-with-Live-Video-172x160.png 172w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Build-Your-Community-with-Live-Video.png 665w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Members of a community share a set of views. They think the same way about at least one thing, whether that’s politics, a football team, a cause, or a favorite choice of toothpaste. A community has at least one thought, issue, feeling, concern, or a goal in common.</p>\n<p>But having and maintaining only one thing is a pretty weak link to bond members of a community together. Communities are stronger when they share not just views but experiences. People who share a political view come together at rallies. Football fans bond when they cheer on their team together. Campaigners make friends at demonstrations and marches. The shared <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/09/19/increasing-customer-engagement-five-tactics-to-use/\">bonding experiences</a> are the types of connection we want to encourage in ourselves and others.</p>\n<h2>For online communities, the issues are deeper and harder to understand and identify.</h2>\n<p>Online, the community members take part in group activities alone. They read and comment on posts in their own time and in isolation. The individuals don’t get to meet, let alone interact with other community members to share an experience.</p>\n<h3>Live video has changed the online experience.</h3>\n<p>Now available on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and a host of other platforms is live video that ensures members of a community can share the same experience at the same time.</p>\n<p>The &#8220;group and fan-base&#8221; might be sitting in different places, but they’re all looking at the same event simultaneously. The viewers can even interact with the broadcaster and with each other. It’s the closest that an online community comes to sharing a common experience.</p>\n<p>There are lots of different ways for communities to make use of these live videos, but three options stand out the best.</p>\n<h4><strong>Interview an Expert</strong></h4>\n<p>One great connection is a live interview with an expert. Your live interview is like running a talk show &#8212; and there are even <a href=\"http://be.live\">tools</a> that allow you to interview someone in a different location. The organizer of a community for people who like Harry Potter, for example, could interview the author of popular Harry Potter fanfiction. As audience members watch, they can use the comment stream to ask questions and talk to each other.</p>\n<p>The chat shows up on the right side of the live streaming &#8212; everyone sees it and can make comments. The live stream then becomes more than an interview. Right there in real-time, the interview turns into a live discussion that’s closer to a book reading than a television show. Because the interview with an expert is interactive &#8212; it&#8217;s even more valued as a personal shared experience.</p>\n<h4><strong>Instructional Videos</strong></h4>\n<p>Interviews require a little preparation. You have to find someone willing to talk and answer questions and arrange a time that suits you, them, and your audience. Finding a bookable timeframe is not a big challenge, but it will require collaboration. Hop on a good Calendar site and coordinate with everyone for a higher participation rate.</p>\n<p>Live instructional videos don’t require the co-operation of others, though they will demand some thought. You’ll need to plan what you’re going to show, and have the ability to walk people through the steps of what you are saying without getting confused or losing your place.</p>\n<p>The result, though, will be the sharing of information with people who value that information. <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/pg/TriangleNurseryUK/videos/\">Triangle Nursery</a>, for example, is a flower and event business in the UK. The company broadcasts regular live videos that show people, keen on flower arrangements, how to make cool bouquets.</p>\n<p>You can see from the <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/TriangleNurseryUK/videos/vl.813003639063896/680884795662686/?type=1\">comments</a> in the videos how well the comments are received, and how classy the interviewers respond. The vid shows how to conduct a great forum for live interaction. The <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/pg/NationalQuiltersCircle/videos\">National Quilters Circle</a> does something similar, bringing together hobbyists to learn and interact with each online.</p>\n<h4><strong>Live Events</strong></h4>\n<p>The third kind of live video is probably the most popular. One of the most common broadcasts on Facebook Live comes from churches that use the feature to bring congregations to their places of worship.</p>\n<p>But a church certainly isn&#8217;t the only event that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/14/in-the-age-of-tech-community-matters-more-than-ever/\">community organizers</a> can use to cement relationships between members of an online community. Even industry events, such as <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/NewBedfordGuide/videos/1283280185161527/\">car shows</a>, can use live broadcasts to show people who can’t attend what they’re missing and let them communicate with the people who are there.</p>\n<p>I&#8217;ve seen significant use of live vid for business teammate connections. There have been some great book groups on Facebook and elsewhere for individuals with all kinds of differing tastes from Business and Self-Help to Sci-Fi. Find one that fits what you are looking for. At this time of the COVID-19 issues &#8212; many teachers and schools are using this same live-stream format or instructional videos to stay in touch with their students.</p>\n<p>Firms as big as Apple have been live-streaming their events for years but live video takes that reach even further by enabling interaction. The organizer of an art fair, for example, can alert members of an art community that they’ll be broadcasting from the event live.</p>\n<p>During the show, the organizers can walk the booths and interview the exhibitors. Inviting viewers to ask questions as they watch the walk-through is the icing on the cake. Exhibitors themselves could broadcast their own videos.</p>\n<p>Art Sherpa, who <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/24/craft-teams-can-ensure-your-people-keep-the-skill-sets-sharp/\">teaches acrylic painting</a>, teamed up with Pix Brix at the New York Toy Fair to <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/TheArtSherpa/videos/612020732968513/\">talk about the company’s new construction toys</a>. You can see how the live audience interaction adds a new degree of depth to what would otherwise be a typical marketing pitch.</p>\n<p>Online communities have always had weaker bonds than real-life communities. Live video has helped to make those bonds much stronger.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/08/how-to-build-your-community-with-live-video/\">How to Build Your Community with Live Video</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 08 May 2020 21:00:04 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Build-Your-Community-with-Live-Video-300x279.png","linkMd5":"b1edb68edf06589be4f021ccf6a6b4fc","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn18@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-07-844_0085f5b66ec44d06.webp","destWidth":300,"destHeight":279,"sourceBytes":129359,"destBytes":11182,"author":"Joel Comm","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/How-to-Build-Your-Community-with-Live-Video-300x279.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn18@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-07-844_0085f5b66ec44d06.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877014},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","title":"6 Skills You Need to Become a Data Analyst","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170489","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/10/6-skills-you-need-to-become-a-data-analyst/\" title=\"6 Skills You Need to Become a Data Analyst\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/6-Skills-You-Need-to-Become-a-Data-Analyst-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"become data analyst\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/6-Skills-You-Need-to-Become-a-Data-Analyst-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/6-Skills-You-Need-to-Become-a-Data-Analyst-900x601.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/6-Skills-You-Need-to-Become-a-Data-Analyst-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/6-Skills-You-Need-to-Become-a-Data-Analyst-1536x1026.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/6-Skills-You-Need-to-Become-a-Data-Analyst.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Data analyst is the process in which the judgment, refining, changing, and modeling data takes place with the aim of making a better conclusion. Data analysis takes part in an important role, it helps in generating scientific conclusions and also increases the regulations in an organization. Here are six skills you need to become a data analyst.</p>\n<h2>Data-Driven Business Strategies</h2>\n<p>Today, with the deepening of the concept of data operation, more and more companies are aware of the value of data-driven business strategies and emphasize the participation of all employees in data operations. Developing the ability to analyze data is also a future trend.</p>\n<p>A data analyst is someone who accumulates data, processes, and performs analysis of data. He or she can interpret numbers and data into simple English in order to help organizations and companies understand how to make better business decisions.</p>\n<p>At its core, data analysis means taking a business question or need and turning it into a data question. Then, you&#8217;ll need to transform and analyze data to extract an answer to that question.</p>\n<p>Companies of today realize how data-driven strategy is important to them and they are in need of talented individuals who can provide insights into a constant stream of collected information.</p>\n<h3><b>Types of Data Analysts</b></h3>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Finance</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Data assurance</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Business Intelligence</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Marketing</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Sales</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The types of data analyst listed above are some of the most challenging fields which require a data analyst in their management.</p>\n<h2><b> Here are 6 skills you need to become a data analyst.</b></h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/data-2.jpg\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-170491 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/data-2.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"400\" height=\"267\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/data-2.jpg 400w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/data-2-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/data-2-240x160.jpg 240w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px\" /></a></p>\n<h4><strong>1. MATHEMATICAL SKILLS<br />\n</strong></h4>\n<p>Mathematical skills are important for making a profession in data analysis, as you have to play with numbers and figures all through the day. Necessary mathematics skills include:</p>\n<p>*One should be good at calculations</p>\n<p>*Measuring and analyzing data</p>\n<p>*Having the ability to organize information</p>\n<p>*One should know how to schedule and budget</p>\n<p>Mathematical skills help in <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/19/5-essential-skills-all-entrepreneurs-need-to-build-success/\">having better problem-solving skills</a> &#8212; and also helps in financing our individual businesses.</p>\n<h4><b>2. ANALYTICAL SKILLS</b></h4>\n<p>As it is called, It is clear that analytical skills are the huge significance of data analysis. These skills include assembling, sorting, and analyzing all kinds of raw data in particular. It also helps you to view provocation or situation from a different angle. Hence, If you want to be a professional data analyst then you need to widen your analytical skills and thinking. Analytical skills help in viewing a challenge or situation from different perspectives. It is one of the most important and efficient parts of the skill you need to become a data analyst.</p>\n<p><strong>3. TECHNICAL SKILLS </strong></p>\n<p>Good computer and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/04/26/the-problem-with-believing-coding-is-no-longer-important/\">technical skills are very important</a>. The main knowledge of statistics is quite helpful as well as producing languages like python or Mat Lab, and analytical languages like R and SAS are very favorable to know as a data analyst.</p>\n<p>The more language you know, the faster and better for you to get your dream job. Examples of technical skills you need to know are:</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Programming languages.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Common operating systems.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Software proficiency.</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Technical writing.</li>\n</ul>\n<p><strong>4. DETAILS SKILLS<br />\n</strong></p>\n<p>Data analyst is all about details, It helps a data analyst to be able to find and see any basic unseen errors and links, that is especially important at the point of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/22/best-business-intelligence-software-and-business-operating-system-options-for-2020/\">solving problems and making decisions</a>.</p>\n<p><img class=\"alignnone size-full wp-image-170494\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/data-3-1.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"400\" height=\"267\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/data-3-1.jpg 400w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/data-3-1-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/data-3-1-240x160.jpg 240w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px\" /></p>\n<h4><b>5. BUSINESS SKILLS<br />\n</b></h4>\n<p>Aside from the technical skills, there are some business skills that one should acquire to function as a Data analyst. Some of which are:</p>\n<p><b>Communication Skills:</b></p>\n<p>As a data analyst, you are expected to work with different sets of people in your team which makes your communication a really important part of your job. Working well together as a team for the benefit of your organization is also one of your main responsibilities and skill.</p>\n<p>You should be able to communicate effectively with the teammates to prepare, present, and explain data. Communication is key in collaborating with your colleagues. For example, in a kickoff meeting with business stakeholders, careful listening skills are needed to understand the analyses they require.</p>\n<p>Similarly, during your project, you may need to be able to explain a complex topic to non-technical teammates.</p>\n<p><b>Time Management and Organizational Skills:</b></p>\n<p>As it is expected of you to work with different people in your team. You should be able to manage your time including your responsibilities, as well as meet your deadlines.</p>\n<p><b> Decision-making and Problem-solving:</b></p>\n<p>These skills are the bottom line of data analysis. The main job of a data analyst is to give the right information for decision-making and problem-solving process. Which is why it occurs to be a perfect skill required to be a data analyst.</p>\n<p>You might need to research a quirk of some software or coding language that you&#8217;re using. Your company might have resource constraints that force you to be innovative in how you approach a problem.</p>\n<p>The data you&#8217;re using might be incomplete. Or you might need to perform some “good enough” analysis to meet a looming deadline.</p>\n<h4><b>6. DOMAIN KNOWLEDGE</b></h4>\n<p>Domain knowledge is understanding things that are specific to the particular industry and company that you work for. For example, if you&#8217;re working for a company with an online store, you might need to understand the nuances of e-commerce. In contrast, if you&#8217;re analyzing data about mechanical systems, you might need to understand those systems and how they work.</p>\n<p>Domain knowledge changes from industry to industry, so you may find yourself needing to research and learn quickly. No matter where you work if you don&#8217;t understand what you&#8217;re analyzing it&#8217;s going to be difficult to do it effectively, making domain knowledge a key data analyst skill.</p>\n<p>Remember that Domain knowledge is certainly something that you can learn on the job, but if you know a specific industry or area you’d like to work in, building as much understanding as you can upfront will make you a more attractive job applicant and a more effective employee once you do get the job.</p>\n<p>Once you have the skills mentioned above &#8212; you can use them to attract attention to yourself so as to get your dream job. These are the criteria you need for the data analyst skills checklist.</p>\n<p><b>Academic Background</b></p>\n<p>A bachelor&#8217;s degree is often necessary, not all the time though. To work as a data analyst you need to acquire a degree in any of these Science courses.</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Economics</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Business information systems</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Mathematics</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Statistics</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Computer science</li>\n</ul>\n<p>As much as the above degrees are important for your success &#8212; what matters the most are the skills that you possess. Right now during the COVID-19 problems may be the time for you to upgrade yourself and your skills.</p>\n<h4><b>Conclusion</b></h4>\n<p>Data analysis is speedily growing field and skilled data analysts are huge in demand throughout the country, in every industry. This means that you would find many opportunities only if you are exceptional and show your excellent data analytic skills.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/OoniKodaPizzaOven.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Until I started researching the product, I had no idea there were this many choices of pizza ovens. Recently, I reviewed the Gozney Roccbox, which did a great job. However, it was during the research that I discovered another popular gas-powered portable pizza oven from Ooni Koda.</p>\n<p>Since we are a pizza-loving family and are somewhat limited to going out and picking up one of our favorite restaurant pies, I grabbed the <a href=\"https://ooni.com/products/ooni-koda\">Ooni Koda pizza oven</a> to do a comparison. Here&#8217;s what I found out.</p>\n<h2>About the Ooni Koda Pizza Oven</h2>\n<p>The Ooni Koda delivers pizzas in a minute. There is no assembly required straight from the box. The gas-tank can also cook other things like fish, meat, and vegetables.</p>\n<p><span id=\"mntl-external-component_1-0\" class=\"comp mntl-external-component\">It&#8217;s important to note that the Ooni Koda is not compatible with natural gas. The oven works with a large propane tank &#8212; (the kind you use with your BBQ grill). This oven also works with the one-pound propane tanks you can grab at a convenience store &#8212; but you will need to have an adapter. </span></p>\n<p><span id=\"mntl-external-component_1-0\" class=\"comp mntl-external-component\">Ooni’s designs are unique &#8212; the Koda resembles a cool looking drone or small flying saucer, so it&#8217;s got the awe-factor working for it.  I particularly like the matte black powder-coated steel shell with silver trim (classy) as well as the aerodynamic feel.<br />\n</span></p>\n<p><figure id=\"attachment_173826\" aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-173826\" style=\"width: 600px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img class=\"wp-image-173826\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/OoniKodaPizzaOvenReview-300x200.jpg\" alt=\"Ooni Koda Pizza Oven\" width=\"600\" height=\"400\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/OoniKodaPizzaOvenReview-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/OoniKodaPizzaOvenReview-900x601.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/OoniKodaPizzaOvenReview-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/OoniKodaPizzaOvenReview.jpg 1500w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /><figcaption id=\"caption-attachment-173826\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><em><strong>Ooni Koda Pizza Oven</strong></em></figcaption></figure></p>\n<h2>What&#8217;s Different?</h2>\n<p>One of the biggest differences compared to the Gozney Roccbox is that the Ooni Koda has a much lower price &#8212; nearly $150 less. However, the Roccbox does come with a couple of unique pizza tools.</p>\n<p>Another difference is the weight and portability. The Ooni Koda is much easier to carry around, lift, and work with, as it only weighs 20 pounds.</p>\n<h2>Pros and Cons</h2>\n<p><span class=\"comp mntl-external-component\"><span class=\"commerce-sc-block-comparisonlist__heading mntl-sc-block-comparisonlist__heading\">There are many pros about the Ooni Koda pizza oven. The oven heats up so quickly to its top cooking temperature of </span></span> 932 degrees and cooks your pizza in only 60 seconds. Another positive is that there is nothing that needs to be assembled &#8212; it looks great and is highly portable &#8212; right now!</p>\n<p>However, the cooking part was a bit tricky and took some time to master, especially at such high heat. It was also a little difficult to rotate the pizza to cook evenly.</p>\n<p>After a few tries, the pizzas came out just like we wanted. I tried cooking other items in the oven, too &#8212; like steak and corn. Again &#8212; it took a few attempts but it worked well after that. I realized that the ability to cook a variety of menus and the portability &#8212; made this ideal for taking on camping trips. A big help was adding their infrared thermometer for $20.</p>\n<p>The Ooni Koda didn&#8217;t have a protective silicon cover like the Gozney, which made me feel more comfortable having the kids near it. Also, the appliance is not fully weatherproof so it&#8217;s important to remember to bring the oven indoors to clean and store when not in use.</p>\n<h2>In the Box</h2>\n<p>The Ooni Koda gas-powered pizza oven also comes with a stone baking board, manual, Ooni Essentials Guide with tips and recipes, and propane tank gas regulator and hose. There is also a three-year warranty.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-173827\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/OoniKodaPortablePIzzaOven-300x300.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"600\" height=\"600\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/OoniKodaPortablePIzzaOven-300x300.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/OoniKodaPortablePIzzaOven-719x719.jpg 719w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/OoniKodaPortablePIzzaOven-160x160.jpg 160w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/OoniKodaPortablePIzzaOven-1536x1536.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/OoniKodaPortablePIzzaOven.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 600px) 100vw, 600px\" /></p>\n<h2>Where to Buy</h2>\n<p>The pizza oven is available from the Ooni Koda website along with its other pizza oven models for $329 along with free delivery. Williams-Sonoma also has this model in their stores and on its website.</p>\n<h2>Overall Thoughts</h2>\n<p>Although the Ooni Koda portable pizza oven is still not the lowest-priced portable pizza oven, it is still a good value and more in the targeted price point range for a special cooking appliance.</p>\n<p>If I had tried this oven first &#8212; I would have chosen The Ooni Koda over the Gozney Roccbox. The Ooni Koda is so much more lightweight and easy to take with us whether that is to the backyard, park, campsite, or beach.</p>\n<p>However, I did purchase the pizza peel, thermometer, and a cover as beneficial accessories to have &#8212; which then pushed the price up closer to the Gozney.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\"
