23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"Microsoft Aims to Kill Chrome Using Chromium with its New Edge Browser","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=168177","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/23/microsoft-aims-to-kill-chrome-using-chromium-with-its-new-edge-browser/\" title=\"Microsoft Aims to Kill Chrome Using Chromium with its New Edge Browser\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Microsoft-Aims-to-Kill-Chrome-Using-Chromium-300x185.png\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"microsoft edge\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Microsoft-Aims-to-Kill-Chrome-Using-Chromium-300x185.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Microsoft-Aims-to-Kill-Chrome-Using-Chromium-260x160.png 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Microsoft-Aims-to-Kill-Chrome-Using-Chromium.png 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p class=\"graf graf--p\">Microsoft released its new Chromium-based browser earlier this year, but what does this new browser mean for the general users and should they give it a try? <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/03/29/evaluating-popular-web-browsers-in-terms-of-security-and-privacy/\">Yes</a>, if you spend a good amount of time browsing the Internet and if you’re a little concerned about your privacy.</p>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">A web browser amongst others is your gateway to the Internet and thus it knows a lot about you and your habits. Every bit of information you exchange on the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2013/04/25/forget-searching-for-content-soon-content-will-be-searching-for-you/\">Internet parses through the web browser</a>. Having a certain degree of control and transparency over your browsing data and its usage must be appreciated.</p>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">The new Edge browser provides you with a simple to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/06/how-iot-monitoring-is-going-to-change-how-we-think-about-privacy-and-security/\">find 3 level privacy management tab</a>: Basic, Balanced and Strict to choose from, depending on how comfortable you are with marketers being able to target you with ads. Unsurprisingly, it is much more difficult to get to this setting tab on Chrome.</p>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">It is much easier for tracking companies to access your information and make money off it if you’re a Chrome user. Even Firefox provides anti-tracking features but Chrome doesn’t.</p>\n<blockquote>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\"><strong><em class=\"markup--em markup--p-em\">With the new Chromium-based Edge browser, Microsoft attempts to revive itself in a space it has been losing for almost a decade. With all the new features and advantages over Chrome, it still faces an uphill battle of winning back its long lost users.</em></strong></p>\n</blockquote>\n<figure class=\"graf graf--figure\">\n<p><figure style=\"width: 800px\" class=\"wp-caption aligncenter\"><img src=\"https://cdn-images-1.medium.com/max/800/1*xdge0qiSgpyhqg4KSn0H3A.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"800\" height=\"441\" data-image-id=\"1*xdge0qiSgpyhqg4KSn0H3A.png\" data-width=\"1685\" data-height=\"929\" /><figcaption class=\"wp-caption-text\">Microsoft edge.</figcaption></figure></figure>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">We should not forget that Google is an Ad company. It invests substantially to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2015/11/16/how-to-build-an-api-amazon-lambda/\">build and maintain a browser</a> which is the most widely used on the planet. But since it relies on your data for revenue, it almost does next to nothing to prevent tracking of your data even by third parties.</p>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">Chrome is and has been <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/09/the-top-work-operating-systems-of-2020/\">the undisputed king</a> in the browser space with a solid engineering team behind the wheels and a loyal user base.</p>\n<h3 class=\"graf graf--h3\">But The Chrome Experience</h3>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">67 percent of all computer-based browsing is done on Chrome as of January 2020. Google leverages this overwhelming lead to its advantage by selling your data while providing you with free personalized apps and services that use this data extensively.</p>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">More than 40 percent of people who buy a Windows machine download Chrome using Internet Explorer as their first major activity on their machine. One of the biggest and less talked about the reason why people switch to Chrome is that they have become used to the look and feel of it and reject anything that feels even scantily different. Kudos to the engineering team at Chrome to manage such patronage.</p>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">This is probably why the previous feature-rich Edge with Microsoft’s edge HTML rendering engine failed miserably. It could also be attributed to Chrome beating Firefox substantially with the later having only 4.7 percent market share globally.</p>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">With the new Edge, Microsoft acknowledges its boo-boo and looks to get back in the browser space albeit some obscurity.</p>\n<h3 class=\"graf graf--h3\">Living on the Edge</h3>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">Since the new Edge is based on Google’s Chromium engine, you get the Chrome browsing experience annulling a major reason for losing users.</p>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">In testing, the rendering time of Edge is found to be faster than Chrome. The RAM consumption of Edge is found to be less than 14 percent of that of Chrome which could be a major respite for a lot of users as Chrome is known for eating up RAM.</p>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">With the seemingly <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2015/04/30/microsoft-edge-annotation-awesome/\">right steps</a> taken by Microsoft using its engineering prowess, it has to win back the users it has lost since the inception of Chromium. The new Edge browser has to outdo Chrome consistently in the time to come and create an ardent user base like it has done recently in a very short time with Visual Studio Code.</p>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\"><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/04/is-the-iot-market-maturing-microsoft-report-and-partners-share-new-trends-opportunities/\">Microsoft uses Windows</a> which accounts for almost 80% of the operating system market to prompt users to switch to Edge. It has done this previously with aggression at times but has come to no avail.</p>\n<h3 class=\"graf graf--h3\">Interesting times ahead</h3>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">By moving to Chromium, Microsoft interestingly <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/25/how-to-create-top-performing-content-on-google-according-to-science/\">plays it in the hands of Google</a>, the owner of the Chromium repository, and hence decides the engineering direction the project takes. It might surprise a few but Microsoft is already invested in Chromium with Visual Studio Code and Microsoft Teams which are based on Electron, a Chromium-based framework.</p>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">While Microsoft would again use Windows alongside other marketing strategies to push its baby in the hands of users, Google has the stewardship on the engineering decisions and a throng of lawyers to monitor any wrong practice by MSFT.</p>\n<p class=\"graf graf--p\">It would be <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2016/04/26/iot-edge-delivery-dl2/\">interesting</a> to see Microsoft market Edge and leverage it for its consumer products while Google tackles this push offering a successful but virtually identical product.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/23/microsoft-aims-to-kill-chrome-using-chromium-with-its-new-edge-browser/\">Microsoft Aims to Kill Chrome Using Chromium with its New Edge Browser</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 23 Apr 2020 15:00:03 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Microsoft-Aims-to-Kill-Chrome-Using-Chromium.png","linkMd5":"5332d53f8e776c722ee4e5dd6f3d4871","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn48@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-25-794_865f62385cd70e32.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Microsoft-Aims-to-Kill-Chrome-Using-Chromium.png","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":212003,"destBytes":11242,"author":"Faisal Khan","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Microsoft-Aims-to-Kill-Chrome-Using-Chromium-300x185.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn52@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-20-339_4bb97f6d93ea2720.webp","https://cdn-images-1.medium.com/max/800/1*xdge0qiSgpyhqg4KSn0H3A.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn67@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-23-723_124f3d298cfd7c86.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878214},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"The Pros and Cons of Founding a Startup During a Recession","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169266","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/01/recession-startup/\" title=\"The Pros and Cons of Founding a Startup During a Recession\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"200\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/recession-startups-300x200.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/recession-startups-300x200.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/recession-startups-900x600.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/recession-startups-240x160.jpg 240w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/recession-startups-1536x1024.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/recession-startups.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>With the economy in an inevitable tailspin toward the first recession in over a decade, there remains ample click bait apocalyptic article titles touting the economy&#8217;s inevitable downfall. The most alarming recent data is the millions that filed for unemployment in a single week&#8211;the largest such black swan event in the history of the country. Further still are the discussions that we may eventually be stuck&#8211;similar to the Great Recession of 2008&#8211;in a recovery that excludes jobs as we emerge from this cluster.</p>\n<p><img class=\"size-full wp-image-169268 aligncenter\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/jobless-recovery.gif\" alt=\"\" width=\"290\" height=\"281\" /></p>\n<p>Touting numbers from the last recession, <a href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/after-the-recession-beware-the-jobless-recovery-202600519.html\">some have opined</a> we are headed into similar waters this time. Alarming indeed.</p>\n<p>If there is a silver lining to all of this, it is that such events are often breeding grounds for innovation, pivots, startups and the birth of new companies. Truly, necessity is the mother of [fill in the blank] in situations like these. <a href=\"https://www.strategy-business.com/article/re00240?gko=c9bcf\">Such was the case during the Great Recession</a>, when startups emerged to fill the employment vacuum.</p>\n<p>But, as any founding entrepreneur will tell you, starting a business in a good economy is tough enough. Starting one on the heels of a major market dip can be more than difficult. Difficulties aside, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2013/07/08/5-startup-lessons-from-the-great-recession/\">many successful startups have emerged</a> from the ashes of financial ruin. Sometimes the dip can be a catalyst for the next big thing.</p>\n<h2>Benefits of Founding a Company During a Recession</h2>\n<p>With millions of displaced workers struggling without a paycheck and unemployment benefits drying up, entrepreneurs often emerge to complete tasks as contractors during periods of economic uncertainty. It is true that larger firms tend to lay-off and/or furlough full-time W2 employees during times of uncertainty, but they also need work done. Large layoffs are typically used as a preservation mechanism for large companies wanting to shield themselves from ultimate demise, but that does not mean the work has dried-up.</p>\n<p>On the contrary. Massive layoffs often create a void in critical task completions internally that still need completed without the workers to engage. In such circumstances, many new or former employees have turned to 1099 contract relationships with new or former employers to complete such projects.</p>\n<p>Such a relationship has a benefit to both the contract laborer and the employer. The employer can rely on the contractor to complete operational tasks that are still critical to the company&#8217;s survival, but do so without the hassle, chains and liability of a full-time W2 staff. It&#8217;s this very &#8220;gig&#8221; type model that made the likes of Upwork and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2015/10/06/uber-employee-contractors-startups/\">Uber so successful</a>. It also de-risked their operational expenses by <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/17/the-diminishing-returns-of-outsourcing-and-the-fallacy-of-automation/\">moving employers to contractors</a>, making the relationship much more flexible. Employers prefer such relationships as they can turn them on and off as-needed without the requirement of a long-term commitment to a salary.</p>\n<p>Founders can often use this to their advantage by slipping back in to former organizations in which they were a part and charging more per hour for tasks they are already comfortable performing, while still looking for other similar gigs and opportunities elsewhere.</p>\n<p>Recessions also fuel opportunity. Where there is pain, there are opportunities for a fix. New startups can quickly arrive to fix real or perceived issues in the economy. Recessions can often change shopping behaviors. In today&#8217;s environment, we&#8217;re not more dependent on Amazon than ever before, shifting us further away from brick-and-mortar reliance.</p>\n<p>In today&#8217;s environment companies, including healthcare related entities, are profiting from medical supplies, remote patient monitoring and similar businesses that immediately service the current crisis. Such businesses will likely emerge as leaders that will help prepare for the &#8220;next big issue&#8221; due to their flash-in-the-pan revenues and quick notoriety.</p>\n<p>In addition, frugal corporate and personal trends in the last recession, fueled the the founding of both Groupon and Uber. Groupon offered regular discounts to commodity-type products and services, driving foot traffic to local businesses while still saving consumers money. Similarly, Uber offered greater efficiency in transportation at a lower cost, while still benefiting its own bottom-line by avoiding a W2 workforce.</p>\n<p>When it comes to founding a startup during a recession, finding and fixing a pain&#8211;including the immediate consumer and corporate pains of cost-savings&#8211;can be perhaps the biggest boon for successfully navigating the difficult waters of a recession-era entrepreneurship.</p>\n<h2>Downsides of Recession-Era Startups</h2>\n<p>Perhaps the biggest downside risk of founding a business during a downturn is the fact that the very budgets a founding entrepreneur may be seeking to tap, simply no longer exist. This lack of budget due to the tightening of the proverbial purse-strings is one of the very definitions of a recession. Both companies and families tend to reduce spending, hunker down and hold-out for larger budgets in the form of corporate spending or a consistent paycheck.</p>\n<p>This is problematic for both self-funded startups looking to grow organically from client/customer revenue as well as<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/18/how-to-bootstrap-your-startup-for-years-without-funding/\"> those seeking private equity or venture capital support to scale</a> a promising, novel concept. With tightened budgets on the corporate side, companies will be less likely to invest in products and services where they don&#8217;t see immediate value. And, if a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/31/vc-funding-in-2020-what-investors-look-for-in-startups/\">founder is seeking investor financing</a>, the probability of investor funding is significantly lower and investors become much more pitch-picky.</p>\n<p>Furthermore, recession-bread startups also have a unique disadvantage to established firms when it comes to branding and marketing. Establishing a brand for organic inbound interest from either the internet or on-going referrals can take a lot of time. As a coworker is wont to say,</p>\n<blockquote><p>The best time to plant a tree was twenty years ago. The second best time is today.</p></blockquote>\n<p>In the world of digital and online marketing, the best time to start your website and perform SEO was two to three years ago. The second best time is certainly today, but that doesn&#8217;t mean there isn&#8217;t an uphill battle.</p>\n<p>Unfortunately for startups with smaller budgets both paid and organic search marketing is less likely to move the needle, at least initially. On the organic online marketing side, <a href=\"https://podcast.seo.co/what-is-the-difference-between-enterprise-seo-and-startup-seo\">startups should not expect to see results</a> (even when they are pushing hard) for at least 6 to 12 months, with major results not hitting until deep into year number two.</p>\n<p>Worse still, pushing too hard can get startups in the equivalent of search engine hot water. Those performing <a href=\"https://seo.co/enterprise/\">enterprise SEO</a> definitely have the advantage over startups. With established websites, large corporations can immediately push harder on SEO campaigns, thereby seeing more rapid results in shorter periods. Be aware that as a startup, unless you have an established website, you are less likely to receive a huge influx of organic interest at the outset unless you:</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Solve an immediate, real problem in the market</li>\n<li>Become a viral success</li>\n<li>Have a unique value proposition</li>\n<li>Partner with a large corporation for distribution and marketing</li>\n</ol>\n<p>As someone who has established and run startups, the biggest problem with startups is not a lack of funding: it&#8217;s a lack of time. Startups tend to run out of runway. Speed to market and speed to revenue are <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/12/how-are-sustainable-startups-like-pela-fighting-plastic-waste/\">critical for startup sustainability</a>.</p>\n<p>Again, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/20/why-we-shouldnt-be-in-love-with-startups/\">establishing a brand-new company is extremely difficult</a> even in the best economic environment. Doing so during a recession further dampens the likelihood of success. But, that doesn&#8217;t mean it&#8217;s not possible and that massive opportunities don&#8217;t exist. It just means greater savvy-ness and scrappy-ness may be required.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/01/recession-startup/\">The Pros and Cons of Founding a Startup During a Recession</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 01 Apr 2020 15:15:49 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/recession-startups.jpg","linkMd5":"c25677148c3be02923381b938e336099","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn15@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-21-316_34817650ee557309.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/recession-startups.jpg","destWidth":1920,"destHeight":1280,"sourceBytes":422583,"destBytes":373076,"author":"Nate Nead","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/recession-startups-300x200.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn83@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-23-782_f71fc7f7428307f6.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/jobless-recovery.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn78@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-22-966_7e665a069f5fad02.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878980},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","title":"What the Next Generation of Smartphones Look Like","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173999","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/11/what-the-next-generation-of-smartphones-look-like/\" title=\"What the Next Generation of Smartphones Look Like\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/What-the-Next-Generation-of-Smartphones-Look-Like-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"next generation of smartphones\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/What-the-Next-Generation-of-Smartphones-Look-Like-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/What-the-Next-Generation-of-Smartphones-Look-Like-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/What-the-Next-Generation-of-Smartphones-Look-Like.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If you ask a computer hardware specialist, &#8220;What is the future of computer hardware?&#8221; the answer for the half century past has been Moore’s Law. But what does the next generation of smartphones look like?<br />\n</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Gordon Moore, co-founder of Intel predicted that the number of transistors per square inch on integrated circuits would double every two years. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Devices that have occupied all our daily life. With no doubts, talking about the next generation of smartphones requires considering both hardware and software.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In simpler words, every two years you can pack two times more processing power in a square inch of a processor. This is all good news for smartphones because smartphones are smaller and lighter. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Meaning that you can have faster and more powerful smartphones (two times faster in fact) every 2 years. Comparing to a supercomputer the size of a room 30 years ago, your smartphone is really smarter.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">But, as they say, nothing lasts forever. Actually, Moore&#8217;s law has been a prediction, not a law of the universe. He was a genius who well thought out about this and it happened over the last 50 years. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Recently, the rate of our processing power being doubled slowed down to once every 2.5 years. Insights do not show an exception for going back to the 2 years rate again. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It&#8217;s all about the possibility limit. The current way of creating processors has come to a limit and it&#8217;s time for something new such as quantum computers.</span></p>\n<h2><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Old phones and current smartphones </span></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Going back to the days when phones were only being used for contacting other people doesn&#8217;t need you to be an aged person. I can still remember those days when we had those kinds of phones. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Nokia first generations had a keyboard full of buttons both numbers and arrows. Having a phone was considered a sign of being a wealthy person those days. You had the ability to contact almost everybody who had a phone wherever you are.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">As time passed more and more companies started producing mobile phones and the prices started falling down. On the other hand, the rate in which the technology of those mobile phones advanced, started to get a pace. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">More and more engineers started working on mobile devices so we could have more and more functionalities aka features.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Below you see a list the things that have changed during the evolution of phones in the last 20 years:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Weight</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Size</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Thickness</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Screen size</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Screen resolution</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">No of buttons</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Touch technologies</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Sensors being used in the phone</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Internet generation (3G, 4G, 5G)</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Connectivity to other devices (Bluetooth, Infrared)</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Battery capacity</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Charging speed</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Cameras (revolutionary)</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Storage</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Sound volume and quality</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Operating System</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Software-wise</span></li>\n</ul>\n<h2><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">What about the latest changes?</span></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If you follow the mobile industry and watch what the flagship phones have inside, you&#8217;ll notice a different strategy compared to the past. There is no more revolutionary thing inside new phones.</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You see the new camera is 5x better than the previous one.</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You see the new screen has more pixels per inch.</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You see the new battery power improved by 20%.</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You see the new internet generation (5G) support being integrated.</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You see the new OS being more powerful than before.</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Okay, I know, you are not expecting a brand-new thing to appear in the phones anymore compared to 5 years ago. You guess that this is all we can have or in fact we currently need to have in a smartphone. </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">But you are always expecting the OS or software inside to be improved over time.</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Let’s just compare the new iPhone 11 Pro with its preview generation iPhone X.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If you read the specifications, you&#8217;ll see that the differences are as below:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">A little bit bigger than iPhone X</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Newer CPU</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">More RAM</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Enhanced brand-new camera</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Better front camera</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">12% more battery capacity</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">   </span> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">More water resistance</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This is all the things you&#8217;ll get if you buy an iPhone 11 Pro. You see the changes are not noticeable and if you work with them, you&#8217;ll literally feel nothing except the camera. What I believe is that the revolution for smartphones has just stopped and here we are with only tiny improvements from time to time.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">But what is going to happen? Are we going to be happy with just tiny improvements? Did it stop going further? I believe there is going to be a revolutionary thing in the near future and I guess it&#8217;s what I&#8217;m going to tell you now.</span></p>\n<h2><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The next generation of smartphones</span></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The next generation of mobile phones is at first about the hardware then only about the software in the long run. What do I mean by this then?</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Let&#8217;s consider the current buying behavior of people closely.</span></p>\n<ol>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Samsung/ Apple introduces its new device.</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There is a long queue waiting to be the first people to own that device.</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">People sell their old devices and buy the new device.</span></li>\n<li><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">They keep each phone for a few years then buy a new one.</span></li>\n</ol>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This is what the mobile producers want you to do. They need to sell more and more devices so they introduce new phones each year even if there is nothing extraordinary about it. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Even if it fails or explodes after a few months. It&#8217;s all about making more money. I&#8217;m not against making more money. I&#8217;m a fan of it in fact. What I believe is that there is not going to be a breakthrough technology in smartphones so that we need to change our phones every year. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The current revolutions are more on software than hardware.</span></p>\n<h2><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Possibility limit of hardware</span></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The hardware industry still has a lot to go but it&#8217;ll end soon. I mean we&#8217;ll get to the finest particle size used in a CPU or capacity in a battery. Hardware will block us one day. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It&#8217;s the matter of possibility. It might not be possible to go deeper from a point; it might not be possible to create smaller cells from a point and that point is not far from current situations. Let me give you an example: If we want to have more storage in our phones, we should go create smaller storage blocks so that we can put more blocks in the same space and have more capacity. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">But there is a possibility limit, we can&#8217;t go smaller than a cell, can we? Now expand this example to other aspects of a phone. There is finally a possibility limit on our way.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Businesses life cycle has 4 phases (introduction, growth, maturity, decline) as they grow. Some of the technologies inside smartphones might have come to their growth phase. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For example, CPUs. They have passed the era of experience of doubling the processing power in the same space and it&#8217;s their maturity phase now. Usually businesses that reach their maturity level will fall into the decline phase if do not make new decisions specially innovations. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Innovations are one rescue for businesses in the decline phase. Maybe the innovation for the next generation of CPUs are quantum processors. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">I don&#8217;t know how early it could happen but it is going to be the basis of new generation of smartphones that revolutionizes the current devices. This is how this we can overtake this possibility limit theory. </span></p>\n<h2><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The need for a new smartphone</span></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Another topic to consider is the real need of people for having a phone with more capacity. Having a phone with more calculation power. Having a phone with more battery power. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Even though it&#8217;s great to have more of everything as a human (we are never satisfied with having more of a thing), do we really need it? Just look at your way of using your new iPhone 11 Pro. Do you use all its performance power? </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Do you feel a difference in the camera? Researchers say that our eyes are equal to a 10-megapixel camera. This means that we cannot understand the difference between a 10 and a 20-megapixel camera by our eyes. Do you really need wide cameras?</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Repeating, it’s great to have a better camera but the previous one is also great for me. This is more of a business thing because those brands create the demand even if there is no need for it. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">We are just part of a game. The game of seeing a new thing, thinking we need it and buying it eventually.</span></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/turned-on-black-iphone-7-displaying-hello-1275929.jpg\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-174004 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/turned-on-black-iphone-7-displaying-hello-1275929-900x675.jpg\" alt=\"next generation of smartphones\" width=\"900\" height=\"675\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/turned-on-black-iphone-7-displaying-hello-1275929-900x675.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/turned-on-black-iphone-7-displaying-hello-1275929-300x225.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/turned-on-black-iphone-7-displaying-hello-1275929-213x160.jpg 213w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/turned-on-black-iphone-7-displaying-hello-1275929-1536x1152.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/turned-on-black-iphone-7-displaying-hello-1275929.jpg 1920w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></a></p>\n<h2><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">What are the next generation of smartphones?</span></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The next generation of smartphones will likely look like this:</span></p>\n<blockquote><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&#8221; You go to a store, buy a white labeled phone with satisfying hardware without any OS on it. You then go home and buy your desired OS and install it on the device.&#8221;</span></p></blockquote>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Possibly you&#8217;ll no longer pay for a brand-new device &#8212; but you&#8217;ll just order your desired OS and enjoy the software functionalities created for you by the OS.</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There might be several questions in your head about cameras, storage, RAM, processors, etc. Let&#8217;s see what happens to each of them in this new world.</span></p>\n<h3><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Cameras in next generations of smartphones</span></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">We know that having a good photo quality is not just about the hardware. Software matters too. Processors do a lot on the photo taken by a camera to make it better. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In the new generation software owns more accountability for the quality than the hardware. With the help of Artificial Intelligence, we&#8217;ll be able to improve image quality in a matter of a second. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">That&#8217;s why we don&#8217;t always need to upgrade our camera hardware. Software can do it all for us. Meaning that you have a normal camera but the photo quality is way more than the ability of that hardware because AI is working on it. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The same goes for video. We talked about how mobile phones can help you do better</span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/05/12/how-these-apps-will-make-you-a-better-photographer/\"> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">photography with a phone</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> which might be interesting for you.</span></p>\n<h3><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> AI and cameras in next generation of smartphones</span></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">AI is the new buzzword not only in photography but also in every sector of the tech industry that has a software related part. A</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">rtificial intelligence (AI) is everywhere. You might not know but without doubts one of your applications on your smartphone is using AI in such a way. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Maybe the AI is the camera, maybe your voice</span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2013/01/15/virtual-personal-assistants-the-future-of-your-smartphone-infographic/\"> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">assistant</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, maybe your anti-virus, etc. For example, when you are taking a photo and it detects the faces in your photo, this is what AI is understanding. Or when you are talking to Siri on your iPhone, it’s an intensive use of AI that can handle your requests. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Also, when you are typing and the keyboard is suggesting words to complete your sentences, it’s AI that understands, interprets and predicts the rest of your sentence. Believe it or not AI is everywhere in your smartphone now. Cameras are also no exception and they are already using it a lot. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Another example of using AI in photos is the photo editing tools that help you edit extensively. You can easily repair skin colors/ shadows, replace colors, remove backgrounds and so many other things by just using an application.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">A good reason for using AI in the next generation of smartphones is the hardware gap. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Not all the cameras on smartphones have several lenses, not all of them have zoom lenses. That’s where you need a software to handle the zooming. “Software is becoming more and more important for smartphones because they have a physical lack of optics, so we’ve seen the rise of computational photography that tries to replicate an optical zoom,” says imaging analyst Arun Gill, Senior Market Analyst at Future Source Consulting. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">“One of the examples is Google Pixel 3 which uses a single camera lens with huge computational photography in order to replicate an optical zoom and also adds various effects. To let you know more, AI has a lot to offer not just in photography but also in </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/26/ai-can-impact-mobile-app-development-and-user-experience/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">improving user experience</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">.</span></p>\n<h2><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Storage </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">in </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">next generation of smartphones</span></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Everybody has heard about Google drive or iCloud. These guys have been around for a while and more and more people are using them nowadays compared to a few years ago when everybody needed to have all his files, photos and videos on their device. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Going beyond the personal files, comes the applications. We are using a lot of applications in the </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2009/08/04/why_cloud_computing_is_the_future_of_mobile/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">cloud</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> every day and we are getting used to it. Meaning that we no longer need to have all the applications installed in our smartphones. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">We just open the URL and boom, it&#8217;s there. This decreases the need for a big storage on our devices. So, the new devices come with small storage because you are going to have everything on a cloud somewhere in the world. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This is all because of cloud technology which is becoming cheaper and cheaper every day. More and more companies and products are fully migrating to clouds or connected to clouds.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> A major advantage of cloud storage is the ability to access your files on any device and not needing to transfer them manually every time you switch to a new phone. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You just upload once and every time you get a new phone or go on a new device regardless of being a smartphone or personal computer, you’ll have all the files there in a second.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There are some smartphones that offer cloud storage as you buy them. Google Pixel is one of the few smartphones that benefit from cloud storage by default. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It offers just 32GB internal storage and it doesn’t have a micro card slot. Google Pixel offers unlimited storage on Google Drive for high-resolution photos and videos for free.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> It has already started being the next generation of smartphones where you are migrating to cloud faster than other phones.</span></p>\n<h2><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">RAM </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">in </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">next generation of smartphones</span></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Application of a RAM is to keep enough data you need handy when opening an application on your phone. This means that if you want to have more applications working at the same time and you don&#8217;t want to experience lag in your device, you need more RAM. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Now let&#8217;s think about having all your applications on clouds. You no longer need to have a big RAM. You just need enough RAM to launch your OS. That&#8217;s why the next generation of phones do not need a huge RAM. Thanks to cloud technology again and again.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Right now, there are a number of smartphones that have 8GB of RAM inside. In fact, 8GB of RAM is not vital for a smartphone. This much RAM is more than enough for almost all computing tasks on a standard work machine. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There aren’t enough tasks you can put into your smartphone to make the most use of all 8GB.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Maybe you are thinking about future proofing your device with this 8GB of RAM, but unfortunately</span> smartphone hardware degrades pretty quickly<span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">. So never try to buy a smartphone with 8GB of RAM solely for that purpose.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> There are smartphones with 12GB of RAM such as Samsung Galaxy S20. But</span><a href=\"https://www.pcmag.com/news/how-much-ram-does-my-smartphone-really-need\"> <span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">tests</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> have shown that phones with more RAM do not necessarily perform better than those with lower RAM. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For example, Apple’s iPhones have 4GB of RAM and perform very well compared to their competitors.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Therefore, it is not a big deal to have more RAM on your device. In the next generations of smartphones, you’ll have the required amount of RAM in your hardware and leave the rest to software to handle it perfectly.</span></p>\n<h2><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Processors </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">in </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">next generation of smartphones</span></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Processors are not an exception. When you don&#8217;t have any applications on your phone, processing is not a big deal because you are leaving all the processes to the cloud.You no longer own a processing unit. All the processes are done in the cloud because all your data is there and all your applications are launched there.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One thing I know based on my research is that we are not using all the power inside the CPU of our smartphone and there is still a lot to do with them. This doesn’t mean the improvement and advancement in CPU technologies would stop while it means software has a lot to consume yet. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With more powerful CPUs, applications are able to perform better and do more complex tasks. Improvement of CPUs creates the space for artificial intelligence works to be done by applications on smartphones. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Also, there is a direct connection between type of CPU and 5G internet. Not all CPUs are able to support 5G at the moment and they should gradually adapt to the new conditions.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The idea of having all our data and applications on the cloud requires a big support of internet bandwidth and computational power which are achievable through a cutting-edge CPU. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">A CPU that supports them both. Considering the next generation smartphones have one of those CPUs with minimum functionality of supporting both 5G and enough computational power for the times there are calculations and computations needed to be run on the device locally.</span></p>\n<h2><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Ports in </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">next generation of smartphones</span></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One thing we always had in mind when buying a new device was connectivity functionality. What I mean by that is how many other devices can be connected to this computer or laptop? This also used to be an important matter when buying a new phone until smartphones came by. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The good point about them is that you can connect almost anything via Bluetooth and Wifi. Apple has its own Airdrop which enables you to connect to all Apple devices and share files with them. You can connect Bluetooth handsfree, Bluetooth speakers, external hard drives, selfie sticks, etc. to your smartphone. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Some phones are now supporting wireless charging and you no longer need to connect a cable for charging your phone. This means that we no longer need the charger hole beneath our smartphones because we can just do it wirelessly.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Recently Apple announced that there would be no charger and ear pods in the iPhone package for the next iPhones anymore. I believe it’s the beginning of removing the current charger port as well. The same as they did with the 3.5mm jack for handsfree. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">But what about the next generation of smartphones? I can guess that there wouldn’t be any ports anymore because everything could be done wirelessly through different technologies. Therefore, do not expect a hole in your next generation of smartphone.</span></p>\n<h2><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Trends of purchasing new smartphones</span></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Apple and other smartphone makers have attributed falling revenues to customers not upgrading their handsets. That’s a growing problem for the industry, but it’s felt more acutely in some regions than others.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In the U.S. and Europe, especially, the life cycle of a smartphone has been steadily increasing, according to data from market research firm Kantar Worldpanel. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">This means that people are keeping their old phones more than before. In 2016, American smartphone owners used their phones for 22.7 months on average before upgrading. By 2018, that number had increased to 24.7.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Users in five European countries tracked by Kantar Worldpanel — France, Germany, Great Britain, Italy and Spain — are keeping their phones for even longer. From 2016 to 2018, the life cycle of a smartphone was extended by nearly three months, from 23.4 to 26.2. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Users in Great Britain logged the longest average of 27.7 months in 2018. This change in behavior is not only due to price-related matters (majority of smartphones prices has increased over the last years) but also due to the fact that people are satisfied with their smartphones and new phones do not have something special to offer.</span></p>\n<h2><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Conclusion </span></h2>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In the next generation of smartphones, you won&#8217;t go and buy a branded phone. You&#8217;ll only buy a white label hardware then choose your desired OS software to install on that hardware.</span></p>\n<blockquote><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&#8221; You go to a store, buy a white labeled phone with satisfying hardware without any OS on it. You then go home and buy your desired OS and install it on the device.&#8221;</span></p></blockquote>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The key here is advancement of technologies in the internet (5G), cloud computing, cloud storage and artificial intelligence which are all revolutionizing the tech industry. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">We are at a point in history when infrastructure is no big deal anymore and everything is <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/08/customer-relationships-the-benefits-of-using-crm-software-for-startups/\">going to rely on software</a> because there is not going to be any limitations in terms of hardware. Phones became smartphones and the next generation would be intelligent phones. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The phones that form based on your requirements, based on your way of using it, based on your situation, based on your budget and based on your profession all with the help of artificial intelligence and clouds. Those smartphones would be fully </span><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/05/personalization-of-mobile-apps-and-ways-to-do-it/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">personalized</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> for you because they are intelligent.</span></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/08/11/what-the-next-generation-of-smartphones-look-like/\">What the Next Generation of Smartphones Look Like</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 11 Aug 2020 15:01:02 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/What-the-Next-Generation-of-Smartphones-Look-Like.jpg","linkMd5":"de29bc9e664ce6f662daf0f5a75aa903","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn76@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-22-999_3ed424828376b77c.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/What-the-Next-Generation-of-Smartphones-Look-Like.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":28383,"destBytes":21752,"author":"Amin Sajedi","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/What-the-Next-Generation-of-Smartphones-Look-Like-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn47@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-21-286_f5d21aedb0118c87.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/turned-on-black-iphone-7-displaying-hello-1275929-900x675.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn72@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-12-927_21ce0d52b95ebbdb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195872257},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:54","title":"7 Content Marketing Trends to Watch Out for in 2020","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=170249","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/05/7-content-marketing-trends-to-watch-out-for-in-2020/\" title=\"7 Content Marketing Trends to Watch Out for in 2020\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/7-Content-Marketing-Trends-to-Watch-Out-for-in-2020-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"marketing trends\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/7-Content-Marketing-Trends-to-Watch-Out-for-in-2020-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/7-Content-Marketing-Trends-to-Watch-Out-for-in-2020-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/7-Content-Marketing-Trends-to-Watch-Out-for-in-2020.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There is no doubting the effectiveness of quality content in driving more clicks &#8212; regardless of what your niche is. </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Nonetheless, since </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">90%</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> (demandmetrics dot com) of all organizations leverage content in their marketing efforts, producing engaging, just informative content is no longer sufficient to cut through the noise.</span></p>\n<h3><strong>It is critical that you learn about what type of content you must create and what channel or what medium you must target to increase exposure and drive more clicks.</strong></h3>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">In 2020, as older trends taper off, and older marketing techniques are rendered ineffective (especially after COVID, the economy, and the riots) your success in marketing is contingent on leveraging current trends to push content to more users.</span></p>\n<p><strong>Here are seven content marketing trends you must watch out for in 2020.</strong></p>\n<h4><b>#1. Podcasting</b></h4>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/CpQhPVE6ZrZ5ZmjsZ1y1yeQBSPFC16EpJ6_FcPLieNeUogg1qbcDEamfaSwbZVwDpjR8o6U5Nh_3U_zt6ysy3qKO70Ec9pQsgybLn7O1uMVE5oOHD0gA4N2cbE-f9jTO3CHWhfs\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"723\" /></p>\n<p><b>Image: Podcasting-Example.png</b><b><br />\n</b><b>Image Source: </b><a href=\"https://www.smartpassiveincome.com/listen/\"><b>https://www.smartpassiveincome.com/listen/</b></a></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Podcasts have exploded in popularity in the past decade. As reported by </span><a href=\"https://www.statista.com/topics/3170/podcasting/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Statista</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">, the number of podcast listeners has almost tripled over the decade, and it is anticipated that the number of podcast listeners in the United States alone will rise to 132 million by 2022!</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With more and more listeners tuning into podcasts across niches every day, it is crucial that you begin to leverage podcasts to expand your reach exponentially. </span><a href=\"https://www.bloggingcage.com/digital-marketing-podcasts/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Digital marketing podcasts</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> are gaining momentum and a lot of experts are sharing their practical tactics to help online companies.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Creating a podcast is of prime importance if your industry demands it. Even if there are already big players in your niche or no podcasts are covering your niche at all—you must put up an informational podcast episode regularly.</span></p>\n<p><b>Similar to blogging, consistency is key to thriving in the podcasting space.</b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">It is also crucial that you create a podcast intentionally. Creating a podcast only for the sake of marketing isn’t going to be effective. You’ll lose traction and plateau at times, and only being passionate about your niche will keep you going. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Lastly, sticking to a particular facet of your niche is essential—since switching subjects will confuse your listeners regarding your area of expertise.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Opined Brendan Hufford of </span><a href=\"http://100daysofseo.com/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">100 Days of SEO</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">.</span></p>\n<p>&#160;</p>\n<h4><b>#2. User-Generated Content </b></h4>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/ABexmibgKQbDxTkRz478rtC_2jQ_OsRFsB0tk_A93uG9Vtqcb4c8Ri8OTRLqKeBNQgrkd7-4jcm0g7GFx55cqSE9_fxxIkT-Gh6q4b7-ekinOwYlLeyGbMHAkcPj9z0a2DY-Mo4\" alt=\"\" width=\"1004\" height=\"1050\" /></p>\n<p>Image: User-Generated-content-example.png<br />\nImage Source: <a href=\"https://www.canva.com/\">https://www.canva.com/</a></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">User-generated content is content created and published by unpaid contributors. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Typically, these contributors are fans that promote a brand based on their own experience with it. The brand does not promote itself. You can find user-generated content on social media, blogs, and forums as comments, images, or testimonials.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">One good example of marketing using user-generated content is Coca Cola’s “Share a Coke” campaign. Users would find a Coke with their name on it and share a picture of it on social media. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Although it may not seem like a huge deal, you must realize that with this campaign, the company managed to create a source of free viral content for the brand—since people were essentially showing off images with their drink.</span></p>\n<p><b>You can leverage user-generated content from the ratings, reviews, and comments from e-commerce sites, blog posts, and social media depending on what suits your business model and niche best.</b></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.expertvoice.com/the-psychology-of-brand-trust-influencer-marketing/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Over 90%</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> of consumers trust the recommendation of another person, even someone they don’t know, over branded content—which is why you must find ways to leverage user-generated content. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Opined Brent Trotter of </span><a href=\"http://cliquestudios.com\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Clique Studios</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">.</span></p>\n<h4><b>#3. Voice-Activated Content</b></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">With the adoption of smart devices proliferating, there is an upsurge in demand for content optimized for voice-activated devices. Voice-activated content</span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> opens up a wealth of opportunities for you to intervene and leverage the newly popular platform. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Many marketers are only now starting to realize the potential for profits of this trend, it is vital that you begin curating voice-optimized content right away, while you still have the upper hand. </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">There is only one thing you must discern to make the most out of the opportunity you have now. </span></p>\n<p><b>You must understand the nuances between how users search for content when they type and when they speak. </b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Gaining mastery over these subtle differences will enable you to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/07/steps-to-building-a-successful-and-scalable-sales-process/\">craft better headlines</a> and focus on including specific long-tail keywords in your content.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Although voice-optimized content must be informative and engaging (just like blog content), the style of writing must be much simpler.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Analyzing patterns and trends in voice searches—similar to what you practice when looking for keywords and content in demand—can potentially amplify your exposure.</span></p>\n<h4><b>#4. Chatbots </b></h4>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/eDpEo0p8GeU2oiHtUifN49yY0HQdtJ2h-RXf-RUSZXx_Q9llXJYK4gY-TY8ncKVJvOjDQaQp_sHA5ISMufSsBFyGw4JNxgEib2-4nwjwGtfKzEY-IpcZUeolPTXsrMzWZf7rH1w\" alt=\"\" width=\"970\" height=\"1054\" /></p>\n<p>Image: Chatbots-example.png<br />\nImage Source: <a href=\"https://www.intercom.com/customizable-bots\">https://www.intercom.com/customizable-bots</a></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Introducing a chatbot to your site has a range of benefits—which is why you will notice a surge in its adoption.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">By setting up a chatbot on your site, you can engage your visitors in conversation. Hooking in your visitors in this way enables you to</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">learn more about their persona,</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">understand their intents and goals when they visit your site, and</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">analyze their specific needs.</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Asking visitors to fill in a form is now a dated marketing tactic and is largely considered tedious. A chatbot is a sophisticated tool that enables you to accomplish all the same objectives faster, all while keeping your visitor engaged in stimulating conversation. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/12/trends-driving-the-loyalty-marketing-industry/\">Conversational marketing</a>, in the form of a chatbot, also minimizes the downtime throughout your relationship with the visitor. This increase in efficiency, in turn, allows you to achieve the following:</span></p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Minimize the time needed to learn about your target audience</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Minimize gaps between engagements </span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Minimize the time and effort needed on the visitor’s end</span></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Minimize costs (since you don’t need to hire anybody)</span></li>\n</ul>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Chatbots minimize costs, time, and effort required to understand the goals and intentions of your visitors. </span></p>\n<p>They are so effective because, unlike when using forms, a chatbot makes the user feel as if they’re being treated as an individual.</p>\n<p>Opined Daniel Cooper of <a href=\"http://lolly.co/\">Lolly.co</a>.</p>\n<h4>#5. Augmented Reality</h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">While AR content is an entirely new form of content, it opens up scores of opportunities for you to use it to revivify your content marketing campaign. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Companies like Starbucks, Facebook, Google, Sephora, Ikea, Apple, and Microsoft are already putting the new technology to good use.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Ikea launched Ikea Place—an AR application that improves the customer’s shopping experience by showing them exactly how a product will look and fit in their room.</span></p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/7VdAIOSURsPIXY06yuUl_dxhSm3F6HClZrdIxFXq0_UbH4HLGdwENb3okYP3HjhwKXp_Lm6p-Z4cBsmxvwQ-eAh6ko3LGjt-O3CoDDNQbXHtmiUW5yb1uT46eKAoWwTAuRgk_Nw\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"816\" /></p>\n<p>Image: Augmented-Reality-Ikea-Place.png<br />\nImage Source: <a href=\"https://www.ikea.com/us/en/\">https://www.ikea.com/us/en/</a></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">On the other hand, Sephora has <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/15/how-will-iot-improve-the-way-startups-do-business-in-2020/\">an AR-supported app</a> that enables customers to try on eyelashes, lipsticks, eye shadows, and all kinds of other beauty products without needing to purchase them first.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">AR still remains to be a largely untapped avenue for marketing, with only mainstream companies diving in headfirst. </span></p>\n<p><b>Regardless if you blog, run an e-commerce store, or market products for others, you must remember that the only lapse in AR marketing is currently on the marketers’ end.</b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Almost all devices on the market are AR-ready, and adaptation to it is only increasing. With only a few companies leveraging it to market products, altering your content marketing strategy to involve AR can help drive more traffic and sales. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Opined </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Isaac Hammelburger of </span><a href=\"http://searchpros.co\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">SearchPros.co</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">.</span></p>\n<h4><b>#6. Video and Live-Stream Content</b></h4>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/oBRkOF3p4jKW3kdDW-BVJIToTTqYzsFibQPydkcm5H6MJQwCzZwt-7DFJyqe495FTpkenpkKROpyCQ8UW-vN6xe8DfwFCjGTKN0akN2do8bi55DJKRkuwwp4RzJpZIV6hYVUT0Q\" alt=\"\" width=\"1600\" height=\"837\" /></p>\n<p>Image: Live-stream-content.png</p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The modern customer increasingly expects to receive video content from their favorite brand. Video content also tends to keep users engaged for a longer time than written content.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Posting videos on YouTube, Vimeo, Facebook, LinkedIn, and your own website is a great way of engaging customers for longer periods. While you do have their attention, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/06/the-impacts-of-covid-19-on-sustainability-and-technology/\">marketing products and services</a> shouldn’t be too difficult anymore.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">On the other hand, you can upload short videos on platforms like Snapchat, TikTok, and Instagram and supply snack-sized content with high potential to go viral. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You can also leverage these platforms to create user-generated content. Sending your products to reviewers and having them create a video is an excellent tactic that almost always brings in more customers.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You can also leverage live-streaming platforms in your content marketing campaign. Now, more consumers prefer to watch long-form video streams than read a blog post. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Holding Q&#38;A sessions, webinars, product demos, or interviews are some of the best ways to create engaging long-form content.</span></p>\n<p><b>Regardless of what platform or video style you decide to leverage, remember that more exposure translates to more sales. </b></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Opined James Norquay &#8211; Content Marketing Director </span><a href=\"https://prosperitymedia.com.au\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Prosperity Media</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">.</span></p>\n<h4><b>#7. Google Snippets</b></h4>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">About </span><a href=\"https://www.searchenginejournal.com/seo-zero-click-searches/286401/\"><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">62.5%</span></a><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> of Google searches on mobile now end without a click. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Ever since Google (and other search engines) introduced the SERP snippet that has featured content, users tend not to click on links since they’ve already found what they were searching for. </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">If you want your web page to stand out from the competition and be featured in the snippet, you must create content that stands out. </span></p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/nsHXgPyI0x7XBFHGaBLVgUfD89b3QCrXID8EKo-xdXiVid8TamxHB6UvkEAvTA1wPZ3yeKJmen6Xa3o8k8WGEEk0kyJ5vOVW6cJ5feTfNuK4v2Rof_g8ZgwZafn44XGPGBzsXCg\" alt=\"\" width=\"1458\" height=\"484\" /></p>\n<p>Image: Google-Snippets.png</p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Users now know that using long-tail keywords will almost always cause Google to answer their questions in the form of the snippet. </span>Therefore, you must focus on creating solution-focused, long-form content that can answer the audience’s questions.<span style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> </span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Targeting “How do I…” questions in your niche is one of the easiest ways to get your content featured on the snippet. </span><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Also, you must make sure that your content is straightforward and that you’re not rambling. If you must choose between straightforwardness and cleverness, always go the straightforward route.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Another important <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/20/complete-guide-to-influencer-marketing-in-2020/\">characteristic of quality content</a> is that it attracts both “no-click” and “click-happy” users. If you write engaging content, there’s a good chance that you will drive more clicks.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Regardless of which trend you decide to hop on and take advantage of, you must <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/22/predictive-analytics-how-to-turbocharge-your-digital-marketing-strategy/\">remember that analytics</a> is just as important as the content in content marketing.</span></p>\n<p><span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">You must aim to deliver content on the basis of your analysis of search intent. Furnishing quality content that’s already in demand will help you drive more clicks to your site, which will translate to more sales. </span></p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/05/7-content-marketing-trends-to-watch-out-for-in-2020/\">7 Content Marketing Trends to Watch Out for in 2020</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" 23:17:58","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:58","title":"5 SEO Writing Tools for Optimizing your Content","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=169388","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/26/5-seo-writing-tools-for-optimizing-your-content/\" title=\"5 SEO Writing Tools for Optimizing your Content\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"206\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/5-SEO-Writing-Tools-for-Optimizing-your-Content-300x206.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"tools for content\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/5-SEO-Writing-Tools-for-Optimizing-your-Content-300x206.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/5-SEO-Writing-Tools-for-Optimizing-your-Content-900x617.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/5-SEO-Writing-Tools-for-Optimizing-your-Content-233x160.jpg 233w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/5-SEO-Writing-Tools-for-Optimizing-your-Content-182x125.jpg 182w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/5-SEO-Writing-Tools-for-Optimizing-your-Content.jpg 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Anyone who has been a marketer for a while now knows that SEO is an ever-changing field and what works today might not be the solution one year down the line. However, throughout all changes in the SEO field, the one thing that remains constant is content. Here are five SEO writing tools for optimizing your content.</p>\n<p>Content and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/24/l1ght-spotlights-the-shortfalls-of-manual-and-automated-content-moderation/\">search engine optimization go hand in hand</a> because people use search engines to find content that meets them at their points of need.</p>\n<p>When you’re creating content, you should focus on how well you’re conveying the message to your audience. Another thing to make sure of is that your content is actually easy to find. You cannot achieve the outcome you desire if your target audience has a hard time finding your website.</p>\n<p>As a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/04/managed-wordpress-hosting/\">content creator or blogger</a>, ensure that your content offers value to the audience as well. No one wants to read irrelevant content no matter how readily available it is. Take your time to research your audience and ensure you write on topics they’re interested in.</p>\n<p>To top it off, your <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/27/how-will-ai-change-the-future-of-seo/\">article should be SEO-friendly</a>. Friendly means it gives Google and other search engines an easy time. You should understand that there is a very big difference between creating relevant content for your audience, and optimizing your articles for SEO.</p>\n<p>A search engine complaint article is one that can be ranked on the first page of Search Engine Result Pages (SERPs). After all, when you rank high, you have an easy time reaching your audience. This guide will look at everything you need to know about SEO and content creation.</p>\n<h2><b>Understanding the Meaning of SEO-Friendly Content</b></h2>\n<p>Before you can write impressive content that is optimized for SEO, you first need to understand the meaning of SEO-friendly content. We’ve already established that creating such content gives search engines an easy time in ranking your website.</p>\n<p>Ranking means that search engines can easily locate, interpret information from your website. Search engines have algorithms that help them decide the chronological order in the content ranking.</p>\n<p>When your article checks more boxes based on the algorithms, you rank higher and vice versa.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/09/10/4-ways-to-optimize-your-site-to-rank-on-google-in-2019/\">Optimizing content for search engines</a> is not a complex endeavor as many might assume. All you have to do is ensure your articles meet your target audience at their point of need. Search engines rank articles based on how well they address the issues readers are trying to solve.</p>\n<p>Google will first establish how important your site is, and then estimate your website authority based on how made sites have linked back to you. On the internet, links work the same way as ballots during elections. The more sites that link back to you, the more authority your site has.</p>\n<h3><b>Finding Interesting and Effective Topics to Write About</b></h3>\n<p>People with no blogs might think that finding something to write about is as easy as picking a card at a Tarot reader’s place. Well, it’s not as easy, especially when you’ve been blogging for a while.</p>\n<p>Since there are so many blogs today talking about the same thing, you might find yourself repeating something that another blogger had addressed. Blogging is like a comedy scene; you can reuse a joke. Just make sure that you recreate it and make it more interesting.</p>\n<p>You should strive to have a list of significant topics to write about so you’re consistent in uploading blogs on your site. Remember that frequency matters in keeping your blog relevant and having a solid online presence.</p>\n<p>Here are useful ways to help you come up with ideal topics to discuss;</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Use of<a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/01/how-to-do-keyword-research-for-seo/\"> keywords</a></li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Address trending topics</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Make use of blog topic generators</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Rewriting old blog posts</li>\n</ul>\n<h3><b>Search Engine Optimization Tools </b></h3>\n<p>Well, to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/01/important-keyword-research/\">create SEO-friendly content</a>, you need to arm yourself with the right tools. With such tools, you can succeed in getting your business on the map without spending too much money on marketing. Be sure and read all of the reviews on these options.</p>\n<ol>\n<li>\n<h4><b>Google Search Console</b></h4>\n</li>\n</ol>\n<p>If you’ve been wondering how to increase traffic to your website, you should know that you’re not alone. Many website owners have gotten to a point where getting traffic is pretty much a pipe dream.</p>\n<p>Most bloggers think that those who have traffic achieved it from months and months of hustling when the reality is there are tools designed to get you traffic. Many do not believe they have when they need to get traffic at the tip of their fingertips.</p>\n<p>This magic wand I’m talking about is<a href=\"https://search.google.com/search-console/about\"> Google Search Console</a> (GSC). It is a completely free resource that used to be called Google Webmaster Tools. If you find that name familiar, then you won’t have a hard time using GSC.</p>\n<p>It is a mega-powerful tool that’s considered one of Google’s gems. Even though it’s not as popular as Google Analytics, I can guarantee that it packs a punch.</p>\n<p>Besides, one of the tools GSC offers is called Search Analytics and you can use it to get more traffic on your site.</p>\n<p>This is a tool that helps bloggers track the progress of their sites. It is an innovative tool that ensures you don’t sit back when your blog is going on a downward spiral.</p>\n<p>As a blogger, you need to track your progress to see what you’re doing right or wrong.
