As you know, marketing is a continuous process because bloggers should strive to be better than they were yesterday.</p>\n<p>GSC is a one-stop-shop for all the tools you need to keep your website on the map. When you sign up for Search Console, you get to see how Google views your site. This allows you to optimize your performance and maintain your site’s presence on Google’s search results.</p>\n<p>As a site owner, this is a must-have resource because it allows you to see what needs tweaking and improving. Signing up gives Google an easy time when accessing your content and you can easily restrict the content you want to appear on search results.</p>\n<p>GSC also has features to help you sort out malware issues to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/25/iot-can-put-your-data-at-risk-heres-how/\">keep your site clean and secure</a>. That’s to say with this application, you can get the answers to these essential questions;</p>\n<ul>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Which search queries allowed your site to appear on search results</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">How much traffic did you get from each search query?</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">What aspect of your business is highlighted in rich search results?</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://moz.com/blog/find-competitor-backlinks-next-level\">Which sites are linking back to your site</a>?</li>\n<li style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Is your mobile site performing as well as your website?</li>\n</ul>\n<p>The biggest advantage of using GSC is that it is a suite of tools that you need to keep up with your site’s performance. The Search Analytics tool is the most important because it gives you a report on how often your site appears on SERPs.</p>\n<p>It also categorizes data related to your site so you have an easy time tracking your progress. You also get to find out where your traffic is coming from and this is valuable data. You can use these insights to create relevant content and keep your audience coming back for more.</p>\n<h4><b>2. Hemingway App</b></h4>\n<p>The Hemingway app that’s mainly designed to help you boost the readability of your blog posts. Before you publish an article on your site, run it through this application to ensure it is readable and that it doesn’t have grammatical errors.</p>\n<p>An application made to work for many content creators. It is a rigorous editor that leaves no stone unturned. The app highlights all sentences that you need to work on and an explanation of what needs to be done.</p>\n<p>It even comes with a score reading and tells you how well you’re doing. The higher the score, the more work your article needs. With just a few adjustments, you achieve the kind of article that will get your audience reading all the way to the end.</p>\n<p>Ideally, you should strive for a reading score of 8 or 9. As a technical writer, you need this application because you don’t want to post something that people won’t understand. Hemingway app helps you break down your sentences and makes them simple and easy to digest.</p>\n<p>Readability plays a huge role in how much traffic your website will get. You should avoid using long and convoluted sentences because it discourages your audience from reading. You can achieve articles presented in bite-size chunks for better consumption.</p>\n<p>Aside from boosting your readability, Hemingway app also helps you edit your article based on all grammatical perimeters. As you know, writing without editing is like building a house without walls. Anyone who is serious about writing will ensure their article is properly edited before they publish it.</p>\n<p>If your reading audience keeps correcting your sentences as they read your article, they’ll not take you seriously. The quality of your blog posts is the perimeter that prospects use to determine your overall professionalism. If you’re offering goods and services as well, they will shy away from transacting with you.</p>\n<p>Hemingway app comes with a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/08/14/the-relationship-between-graphical-and-voice-user-interfaces/\">user-friendly interface</a> to make editing easy for you. You can either create within the app or paste your work here. You’ll get highlights in different colors and a reading score to show you the quality of your article.</p>\n<p>You can then get down to making the necessary changes until you get your ideal score. The thing about this tool is that the more you use it, the better you will get at creating content. Soon you won’t need Hemingway to write a highly readable article.</p>\n<h4><b>3. WriteWords</b></h4>\n<p>WriteWords Editorial is a service that helps you tell your story the best way possible. This service offers a variety of tools that aim to better your communication. You can easily target your audience and ensure every blog post you upload is relatable and engaging.</p>\n<p>The WriteWords app is a service suitable for website owners with a well-established brand. When you leave the writing to the professionals, you get to focus on the core responsibilities of running a blog. The experts will work with your rough ideas to deliver succinct articles that hit the nail on the head.</p>\n<p>You need to work with a team that has an easy time figuring out what you want to say. As you know, it’s very important that you maintain your brand voice throughout all your blog posts. Everything you publish should be in line with what you stand for.</p>\n<p>Professional writers with years of experience will accurately reflect the message you’d like to put across.</p>\n<p>The forum is for writers that allows for interaction and learning from each other. Talking to fellow writers allows you to learn about new hacks to better position your articles to rank high on SERPs.</p>\n<p>The platform gives you the opportunity to learn from experts who’ve been blogging for years. You can learn how other bloggers achieve professional and authoritative articles.</p>\n<h4><b>4. BuzzSumo</b></h4>\n<p>BuzzSumo is the tool that will <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/20/complete-guide-to-influencer-marketing-in-2020/\">take your marketing strategy</a> to the next level. This is a must-have tool for modern-day marketers because it gives you insights on how to strategically push your content through the clutter and position it in front of your target audience.</p>\n<p>As you know, there are so many blogs out there talking about the same things day in day out. If you want Google and other search engines to rank you, you need to stand out from the crowd.</p>\n<p>With BuzzSumo, you get intel on the ideal topics to write about. It’s not always easy to determine the best course of action if you don’t have a tool that helps you with the decision-making process. This tool helps you prioritize which topics are most important so you don’t waste time writing an article that people won’t bother to read.</p>\n<p>Even though this tool won’t make things magically happen, it will arm you with the information you need to turn things around. With BuzzSumo, you’ll be smarter because you’ll be channeling your efforts in the right direction.</p>\n<p>If you need to know what is trending, Buzzsumo has got your back. This is an application that helps you determine the marketability of a topic you want to write on. You’ll know trending topics at any given time and which ones will work in your favor.</p>\n<p>Writing about the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/06/14/what-these-7-brands-can-teach-you-about-ux/\">right topic and the right time</a> is the key to increasing traffic to your site. It gives you the upper hand and search engines will rank you high for it.</p>\n<h4><b>5. Buffer Publish</b></h4>\n<p>Buffer Publish helps monitor the performance of your website. It is a tool that keeps track of the activity on your site.</p>\n<p>You can also use it to plan your publications to maintain frequency. Remember that you can use this on your PC, as well as on your mobile device. It’s compatible with both Android and iOS devices.</p>\n<p>You get to publish articles whenever you want, as well as plan for social media comments. Basically, Buffer Publish accords you more control over your website and social media pages.</p>\n<h3><b> Conclusion </b></h3>\n<p>It takes a lot of effort to keep your blog ranking high on SERPs. Make sure that you use the appropriate tools to track the progress of your blog and find relevant topics to write on.</p>\n<p>Remember that Google and other search engines prioritize articles that meet people at their point of need. As a blogger, you should strive to offer your audience value.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/26/5-seo-writing-tools-for-optimizing-your-content/\">5 SEO Writing Tools for Optimizing your Content</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 26 May 2020 15:00:17 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/5-SEO-Writing-Tools-for-Optimizing-your-Content.jpg","linkMd5":"78a63b3cac03ed36cc8f1ef8343dec85","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn83@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-19-122_c9283e81fb36d385.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/5-SEO-Writing-Tools-for-Optimizing-your-Content.jpg","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":878,"sourceBytes":84191,"destBytes":43836,"author":"Bailey Anderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/5-SEO-Writing-Tools-for-Optimizing-your-Content-300x206.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn40@2020_1/2020/08/23/15-18-16-644_c0376cb463f530d2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195878528},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","title":"COVID-19: Kicking Digital Transformation into Overdrive","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171453","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/17/covid-19-kicking-digital-transformation-into-overdrive/\" title=\"COVID-19: Kicking Digital Transformation into Overdrive\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Kicking-Digital-Transformation-into-Overdrive-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"digital transformation\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Kicking-Digital-Transformation-into-Overdrive-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Kicking-Digital-Transformation-into-Overdrive-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Kicking-Digital-Transformation-into-Overdrive.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>While many businesses considered going digital, the COVID-19 <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/14/how-will-the-pandemic-impact-the-future-of-work/\">pandemic</a> has served as a massive accelerant. Businesses have moved operations <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/30/best-collaboration-tools-to-manage-remote-workers/\">remotely</a>, with <a href=\"https://www.gallup.com/workplace/288722/keep-remote-worker-wellbeing-high.aspx\">43% of U.S. workers working off-site</a> some or all of the time. However, many are experiencing major disruptions due to the unexpected and forced adoption of remote work, as they must quickly scale to meet the demands of customers and a decentralized workforce. Here is how COVID-19 is kicking digital transformation into overdrive.</p>\n<h4>Many businesses are now realizing that investments into digital transformation are no longer simply an option; it’s vital to survival.</h4>\n<p>While digital adoption or moving to remote working conditions typically takes months or even years to implement &#8212; businesses of all sizes have been thrust into digital transformation whether they planned for it or not.</p>\n<p>Businesses should devise contingency plans and strive to continually innovate to improve customer experiences and ensure steady growth. As remote work and reformed social practices are forced upon us, digital transformation is the solution to changed employee and customer expectations across all industries.</p>\n<h2><strong>The New Digital Normal</strong></h2>\n<p>In the new normal, digital will rule as the world operates with significantly less physical interaction. To sustain remote work, companies need to modernize outdated, overwhelmed tech stacks. Busines and equip themselves with a digital toolbox that facilitates communication, scheduling, project management, file sharing, and storage to drive success.</p>\n<h4>Cloud infrastructure and apps.</h4>\n<p>Remote work is largely enabled by <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/05/the-cloud-is-the-future-of-software-delivery/\">cloud infrastructure</a> and apps such as Teams, Slack, or Chanty for messaging. You&#8217;ll need a platform for your calls and digital meetings like Hangouts, Zoom, or Skype for video calls. What will you do for contracts? Get that set it up &#8212; Formstack Sign, HelloSign, or DocuSign for closing contracts digitally.</p>\n<p>For companies that have not already established a system for digital work, this can be an enormous overhaul for operations and can significantly impede, and even halt workflow. It&#8217;s essential that you make your solutions easy-to-use and easy to understand and adopt. Help your team with any required technical skills &#8212; and use platforms and apps so even non-tech savvy users can learn and adapt quickly.</p>\n<p><strong>Use simple, practical solutions so your organization can quickly scale to meet the demands of a remote workforce and changing customer behaviors.</strong></p>\n<p>Some vital digital transformation steps include moving all paper processes to digital, automating workflows, and digitizing every customer and supplier interaction.</p>\n<p>For example, business leaders looking to transition back into physical offices are monitoring cases of coronavirus across their organizations with a digital COVID-19 self-declaration form. Healthcare workers are using online forms and routing to streamline the drastic spike in COVID-19-related requests, prioritize those most at risk, and routing them to the appropriate people to triage.</p>\n<p>Higher education administrations are using digital surveys to collect student concerns on the transition to remote learning and apply that feedback to upcoming school year planning.</p>\n<p>Businesses are also re-evaluating what is essential travel and what can be accomplished through virtual meetings. In lieu of annual in-person conventions previously used as touchpoints and opportunities for networking and new business, companies will have to connect virtually.</p>\n<h2><strong>The Shift in Customer Expectations</strong></h2>\n<p>Unfortunately, organizations that refuse to digitize or believe they can “switch back to normal” after the crisis is over will be left in the dust. Companies that made the investments in automation and moving work to the cloud are meeting the touchless, digital customer’s needs and will ultimately earn the trust and loyalty beyond the pandemic.</p>\n<p><strong>Conversely, businesses that require in-person transactions will lose out to competitors that are making it easier for customers to transact digitally from anywhere.</strong></p>\n<p>Reduced in-person customer interactions are significantly impacting brick-and-mortar businesses. <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/09/how-businesses-are-planning-to-bring-workers-back-after-coronavirus.html\">CNBC</a> shared that U.S. retailers expect an enduring shift to ecommerce, meaning brick-and-mortar stores should prepare for potentially continued lower foot traffic.</p>\n<p>But retailers aren’t alone. Businesses across all sectors – from healthcare to retail – must invest in digital, contactless experiences or services to continue to engage with customers. Smart restaurants are pivoting to offer take-out and delivery.</p>\n<p>Healthcare organizations are turning to telehealth and virtual consultations. They’re doing what is necessary to respond rapidly to changing business circumstances and increased operations, and simultaneously changing customer expectations.</p>\n<p>Now that customers are experiencing what is possible through digital offerings, they will expect these convenient services to continue long into the future. Organizations that fail to shift to digital or cease supporting digital processes post-pandemic will ultimately lose value to their customers.</p>\n<h2><strong>The Future of the Workplace is Hybrid</strong></h2>\n<p>Even after the world emerges from the pandemic, digitization and remote work are here to stay. Employees and customers will have experienced new digital processes and services and want to continue enjoying the benefits. Though physical interactions will always be valuable, all stakeholders are learning the value of digital transformation through this crisis.</p>\n<p>Moving forward, it will be key for organizations to provide a hybrid offering that prioritizes efficiency, convenience and safety across in-person and digital services.</p>\n<h4>Digitization is necessary for businesses to quickly adapt to remote work, it will also play an important role in helping return employees to the office.</h4>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.forrester.com/report/Returning+To+Work+How+To+Prepare+For+Pandemic+Recovery/-/E-RES160660?objectid=res160660\">Forrester Research</a> reported that businesses will be turning to technology to make the employee transition back to the office as seamless and safe as possible. With the delayed return to in-person education and child-care services, parents will be required to continue working from home, even as others may begin to return to workplaces.</p>\n<p><strong>Working outside of a secured office setting underscores the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/05/securing-the-digital-workplace-amidst-the-covid-19-pandemic/\">need to adopt secure</a> and efficient digital solutions to support a partial, if not continued, remote workforce.</strong></p>\n<p>To optimize safety, businesses will likely reconsider office layouts to increase space between workers and install devices that scan temperatures. They’ll also need to monitor cases of coronavirus across their organization with a digital self-reporting system &#8212; and control the number of people in an office at once through staggered work schedules.</p>\n<h3>Another factor to be considered is how workers commute.</h3>\n<p>Those employees that rely on public transit may need additional flexibility to work from home to decrease exposure to high traffic areas.</p>\n<p>Through all of these transitions &#8212; companies have learned that workers can work productively from home to sustain businesses. Businesses can use digital transformations and they are offering the most holistic solutions to address the multitude of issues the world is <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/16/thanks-covid-remote-work-is-now-mandatory/\">facing in this evolving environment</a>.</p>\n<p>An investment in digital will be the strongest way organizations can arm themselves to not only persevere the pandemic but also continue thriving into the future.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/17/covid-19-kicking-digital-transformation-into-overdrive/\">COVID-19: Kicking Digital Transformation into Overdrive</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 17 Jun 2020 18:01:02 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Kicking-Digital-Transformation-into-Overdrive.jpg","linkMd5":"129497618074e6b065c60f1fc3b1185b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn20@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-25-681_149f9d2238f053a4.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Kicking-Digital-Transformation-into-Overdrive.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":35878,"destBytes":21782,"author":"Chris Byers","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Kicking-Digital-Transformation-into-Overdrive-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn72@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-12-099_d345d5a7eb43aba5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195875352},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:52","title":"Playing “Whack a Mole”: Law Enforcement Response to DDoS as a Service","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=172301","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/18/playing-whack-a-mole-law-enforcement-response-to-ddos-as-a-service/\" title=\"Playing “Whack a Mole”: Law Enforcement Response to DDoS as a Service\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Law-Enforcement-Response-to-DDoS-as-a-Service-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"law enfrocement to DDoS\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Law-Enforcement-Response-to-DDoS-as-a-Service-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Law-Enforcement-Response-to-DDoS-as-a-Service-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Law-Enforcement-Response-to-DDoS-as-a-Service.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks pose a serious threat to an organization’s ability to serve its customers. A DDoS attack can knock a company’s web presence offline, making it incapable of responding to legitimate requests from customers. And as DDoS attacks become cheaper and easier to perform &#8212; an attack or threat of this type &#8212; is growing. Here is law enforcement response to DDoS as a service.</p>\n<p><strong>Cybercriminals are increasingly offering DDoS attacks for hire, expanding the number and types of businesses that could be targeted by these attacks.</strong></p>\n<p>Law enforcement has acknowledged the problem, and some organizations are actively working to take down DDoS marketplaces. However, they are fighting a losing battle as new sites are created when others are taken down. Companies must protect themselves from this threat by deploying DDoS protection (imperva dot com). solutions.</p>\n<h2><strong>The Growing Threat of DDoS Attacks</strong></h2>\n<p>DDoS attacks are relatively easy for an attacker to perform. Unlike many types of cyberattacks, they require no vulnerabilities or security errors on the victim’s systems.</p>\n<p>Instead, DDoS attacks take advantage of the fact that all systems have a finite maximum number of requests that they can process or data that they can store, transmit, and process. A DDoS attack involves sending more data or requests than this maximum number, either degrading the system’s ability to respond to legitimate requests or knocking it completely offline.</p>\n<p>In order to achieve the amount of traffic needed for these attacks, DDoS attackers use multiple Internet-connected systems. These often include Internet of Things (IoT) devices (known for their poor security), cloud computing instances (which offer computational power for lease), and mobile devices (infected via malicious apps).</p>\n<p>As the adoption of these new technologies grows, so does the potential threat of DDoS attacks.</p>\n<p>In recent years, attacks have grown in number, scale, and sophistication as cybercriminals take advantage of the ability to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/05/27/5-threats-smart-devices-and-the-iot-could-pose/\">transform a simple vulnerability</a> (like the use of weak passwords on IoT devices) into a chance to impact an organization’s operations and potentially demand a ransom to stop an attack.</p>\n<p><strong>Cybercriminals operating DDoS botnets have also taken advantage of another opportunity to monetize their attacks by offering DDoS as a Service.</strong></p>\n<p>The low cost associated with performing a DDoS attack (thanks to modern technology) means that cybercriminals can offer attacks at a very reasonable price while still making a tidy profit.</p>\n<p>As a result, the range of organizations potentially targeted by DDoS attacks has expanded dramatically as anyone with a grievance and the willingness to break the law can target an organization of their choice.</p>\n<h2><strong>Law Enforcement Takedowns Aren’t Enough</strong></h2>\n<p>DDoS attackers’ pivot to offering attacks “as a Service” provides some advantages to law enforcement. With a cybercriminal operating completely on their own and pursuing their own goals, there may be little or no opportunity for law enforcement to target their infrastructure.</p>\n<p>While a DDoS botnet requires command and control (C2) servers, the use of domain generation algorithms (DGAs) and similar tools could allow an <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/20/whats-video-phishing-and-how-do-you-protect-yourself/\">attacker to move their infrastructure faster</a> than law enforcement could identify it and take it down.</p>\n<p>With DDoS as a service, on the other hand, law enforcement can take advantage of single points of failure in the business model. For customers to be able to engage with a DDoS service provider, they need a means of contacting them and providing payment. These marketplaces provide a target for law enforcement takedowns.</p>\n<p>Some law enforcement agencies have worked to address the DDoS threat by shutting down “booter” sites and arresting their operators. The Dutch police have made multiple efforts to take down booter sites, including <a href=\"https://www.darkreading.com/vulnerabilities---threats/dutch-police-shut-down-15-ddos-for-hire-services/d/d-id/1337551\">shutting down 15 sites and making an arrest in April 2020</a>, and the <a href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2018/12/20/fbi-ddos-booter-sites-offline/\">FBI made a similar effort in December 2018</a>.</p>\n<h3>Despite all these efforts, the DDoS as a Service industry is still going strong.</h3>\n<p>The reason for this is that the targets that law enforcement can access (i.e., the booter sites and the people that operate them) are not essential to the service. Service providers can easily set up a new website when needed. Arrests and incarceration are intended to be a deterrent, but the poor track record of convictions for cybercrimes (and the jurisdictional issues) mean that many DDoS service providers are undeterred.</p>\n<p>These takedowns rarely impact the actual botnets used in the attack, making it easy for the cybercriminal (or another one who compromises the same devices) to continue operations with a new domain.</p>\n<h4><strong>Protecting Against the DDoS Threat</strong></h4>\n<p>DDoS attacks are an ever-growing threat to organizations’ ability to <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/08/detecting-and-protecting-against-ransomware-best-practice-for-2020/\">maintain the availability of their web services</a> and maintain “business as usual.”</p>\n<p>The pace of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/29/12-lesser-known-iot-protocols-you-wished-you-knew-about-earlier/\">adoption of new technology</a>, such as IoT, mobile, and the cloud, is outpacing the ability (and potential willingness) of their manufacturers to properly secure them against exploitation. As a result, the number and size of DDoS botnets in operation continues to grow.</p>\n<p>Law enforcement organizations, such as the Dutch police and the FBI, are making an effort to fight DDoS attacks, but trying to stop DDoS attacks via booter site takedowns and arrests is a losing battle.</p>\n<p><strong>Attribution is difficult, and websites are easy to replace, making it possible for attackers to quickly continue business as usual.</strong></p>\n<p>Organizations must take protection against DDoS attacks into their own hands. As DDoS attacks become more well-known, widespread, and affordable, the range of organizations targeted by them is likely to continue to expand.</p>\n<p>Deploying a DDoS protection solution that is capable of identifying and blocking attacks with extremely high traffic and data volumes, is an essential component of any <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/04/cyber-security-modern-technology-and-business-threats/\">organization’s cybersecurity strategy</a>.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/07/18/playing-whack-a-mole-law-enforcement-response-to-ddos-as-a-service/\">Playing “Whack a Mole”: Law Enforcement Response to DDoS as a Service</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 18 Jul 2020 15:01:03 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Law-Enforcement-Response-to-DDoS-as-a-Service.jpg","linkMd5":"186db8b60b5cb0931ac41eab956ffa16","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn8@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-26-858_dd4365a7dce52838.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Law-Enforcement-Response-to-DDoS-as-a-Service.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":64238,"destBytes":56938,"author":"Richard Parker","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Law-Enforcement-Response-to-DDoS-as-a-Service-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn12@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-10-921_15d2241d8ab36ca2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195872187},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","title":"Omni Pixel Eyewear: Designer Computer Glasses","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=168170","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/17/omni-pixel-eyewear-designer-computeglasses/\" title=\"Omni Pixel Eyewear: Designer Computer Glasses\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Omni-Pixel-Eyewear-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"Omni Pixel Eyewear\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Omni-Pixel-Eyewear-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Omni-Pixel-Eyewear-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Omni-Pixel-Eyewear.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Computer glasses have provided many computer users with welcome relief for their eyes after spending countless hours on the computer for work or gaming. During optometry visits, I would inquire about the cost of purchasing an additional pair of prescription glasses just to use while I worked on the computer.  The costly price was a deterrent.</p>\n<p>Then, I found Pixel Eyewear, which are glasses designed to help minimize eye strain while working on the computer or other electronic devices. Here&#8217;s my review of the <a href=\"https://www.pixeleyewear.com/collections/amber-glasses/products/omni-amber?variant=30701952860244\">Omni Pixel glasses</a>.</p>\n<h2>Issues With Blue Light</h2>\n<p>To understand how Pixel glasses help, it&#8217;s important to first understand the health issues caused by our dependence on electronic devices. These digital devices, including computer screens, mobile devices, and television, continuously emit a blue light. Over an extended time, this blue light can cause eye fatigue, blurred vision, and headaches. The blue light can also cause problems with our circadian rhythm, which regulates melatonin, and therefore tends to disrupt sleep quantity and quality.</p>\n<h2>What Makes Pixel Glasses Different?</h2>\n<p>To help ease eye strain from exposure to blue light, Pixel created lens technology that it uses in all of its eyeglasses. Pixel lenses filter 50% of blue light, including as much as 95% at the strongest wavelengths without the yellow tint. The lenses help do this through an anti-reflective coating. In contrast, other computer glasses are typically yellow and offer low transparency. The glasses also have UV protection</p>\n<p>What also sets Pixel apart is that the glasses have a combination of the latest coating technologies. There is a super-hydrophobic outer layer, which is nanotechnology made to reduce smudges and repels water and dust. The coating technologies also remove color and image distortion.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-168173 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Omniprescriptionglasses-900x450.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"900\" height=\"450\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Omniprescriptionglasses-900x450.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Omniprescriptionglasses-300x150.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Omniprescriptionglasses-260x130.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Omniprescriptionglasses-1536x768.jpg 1536w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Omniprescriptionglasses.jpg 2000w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px\" /></p>\n<h2>About Omni Pixel Glasses</h2>\n<p>The Omni style is made for men or women. It has a straight brow and keyhole bridge, offering a medium-wide width. Two-color choices include Smolder (tortoiseshell color) and Crystal (clear plastic look).</p>\n<h2>What I Like and What Could Be Better</h2>\n<p>All of the Pixel glasses have a clear lens, so they look like a standard pair of glasses. The frames used by Pixel contain cellulose acetate, which is used by most high-end eyewear brands. If you don&#8217;t like the Omni style, you can also choose from a wide selection of other eyeglass frame styles. They have an online size guide to help you pick the right size.</p>\n<p>The Pixel glasses are now also available as part of getting your prescription glasses. The company gives you a 30-day risk-free trip for its regular computer glasses. It also offers free U.S. shipping, returns, and exchanges. Another positive about Pixel is that they are affordably priced, making them accessible to a larger group of computer users.</p>\n<p>The glasses arrived quickly and were carefully packaged. I checked their customer service response and found them to be quick, friendly, and knowledgeable. It was good to know that they were available should I need assistance.</p>\n<p>Other than feeling a bit heavier on my face than my other prescription eyeglasses, it is difficult to find fault with these computer and gaming glasses.</p>\n<p><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-168182 size-large\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/pixeleyeglasses-404x719.jpg\" alt=\"\" width=\"404\" height=\"719\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/pixeleyeglasses-404x719.jpg 404w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/pixeleyeglasses-169x300.jpg 169w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/pixeleyeglasses-90x160.jpg 90w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/pixeleyeglasses-864x1536.jpg 864w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/pixeleyeglasses.jpg 1125w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 404px) 100vw, 404px\" /></p>\n<p>&#160;</p>\n<h2>In the Box</h2>\n<p>Each pair of Pixel glasses comes with a cleaning cloth, a soft pouch, and a case.</p>\n<h2>Purchase Options</h2>\n<p>You can purchase these glasses through the Pixel website or through most optometrists and eyeglass retailers. Some styles are also available on Amazon.</p>\n<h2>Overall Thoughts</h2>\n<p>Since purchasing and wearing my Omni Smolder prescription glasses, I have not experienced eye strain or headaches, nor have I required eye drops to help with dry eyes. They are comfortable, stylish, and fairly priced. I would recommend Pixel glasses, including the Omni style, to anyone that spends countless hours on their laptop, smartphone, and/or gaming device.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/17/omni-pixel-eyewear-designer-computeglasses/\">Omni Pixel Eyewear: Designer Computer Glasses</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 17 Mar 2020 15:00:18 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Omni-Pixel-Eyewear.jpg","linkMd5":"d8a384d608d9d5a051997060d0a110e5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn96@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-21-683_78111a145f561951.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Omni-Pixel-Eyewear.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":16827,"destBytes":12812,"author":"Brad Anderson","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Omni-Pixel-Eyewear-300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn4@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-14-768_996b004080b200f0.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/Omniprescriptionglasses-900x450.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn4@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-27-986_3f15258d997d9b9f.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/pixeleyeglasses-404x719.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn55@2020_6/2020/08/23/15-18-15-977_9c675aa1a2a2844f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195880351},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:55","title":"5 Product Discovery Tips for Building Solutions Customers Will Buy","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=172308","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/24/5-product-discovery-tips-for-building-solutions-customers-will-buy/\" title=\"5 Product Discovery Tips for Building Solutions Customers Will Buy\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"179\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Tips-for-Building-Solutions-Customers-Will-Buy-300x179.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"solutions customers buy\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Tips-for-Building-Solutions-Customers-Will-Buy-300x179.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Tips-for-Building-Solutions-Customers-Will-Buy-900x536.jpg 900w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Tips-for-Building-Solutions-Customers-Will-Buy-260x155.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Tips-for-Building-Solutions-Customers-Will-Buy.jpg 1280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Products aren’t made… They’re discovered.</p>\n<p>It doesn’t matter if you <em>think</em> you have a “brilliant” idea &#8211; what matters is if the <em>customer</em> thinks so, too, and is willing to pay for it.</p>\n<p>You see, customers don’t buy anything they don’t want. So the question is, how do you figure out what customers want and give it to them? <strong>Product discovery.</strong></p>\n<p><strong>Here&#8217;s how product discovery works, why it matters, and some tips for pumping out products your customers are virtually guaranteed to buy.</strong></p>\n<p>Let’s start with a brief explanation.</p>\n<h2>&#x200d;What Is Product Discovery?</h2>\n<p>Product discovery is a process of rooting into the mind and emotions of your target market to understand exactly who they are, what they care about, and all of the problems they wished they could solve.</p>\n<p>Those problems will lead you to discover the solutions they require and the products that must be created to deliver them.</p>\n<h2>&#x200d;Why Does Product Discovery Matter?</h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/technology-and-business.jpg\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-170273 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/technology-and-business.jpg\" alt=\"visual technology and business\" width=\"626\" height=\"354\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/technology-and-business.jpg 626w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/technology-and-business-300x170.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/technology-and-business-260x147.jpg 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 626px) 100vw, 626px\" /></a></p>\n<p>&#160;</p>\n<p>Product discovery matters because creating products that don’t serve customers will ruin a business. And so do products that make customers say “meh.”</p>\n<p>Businesses don’t survive that long with apathetic customers settling for 10th best in a competitive market.</p>\n<h4>What you should be aiming for is to hear the customer say, “This is what I&#8217;ve been waiting for!”</h4>\n<p>And the only way to get that kind of reaction is by identifying your markets’ genuine needs. Too often, products are built on assumptions made by your team and company &#8211; instead of your customers’ preferences.</p>\n<p>Products should be evidence-based and informed by listening to customer desires, which is the process behind product discovery.</p>\n<h2>&#x200d;How Does Product Discovery Work?</h2>\n<p>The “what” of product discovery is straightforward, but the “how” is a little trickier to grasp.</p>\n<p>The first step is challenging your assumptions as we mentioned in the last section. If your executive team pushes product initiatives forward, then you have to challenge the assumptions they’re making about customers’ likes and dislikes. If your product team suggests features based on past experiences, they need to be closely examined.</p>\n<p>Regardless of where product ideas come from, they must be weighed against fresh customer insights and reliable data.</p>\n<p>What you think you “know” about your customers should be rephrased as what you “hypothesize” about your customers. And then move to the next step:</p>\n<h3>Conduct empirical research.</h3>\n<p>There are 2 types of data you can collect for empirical research:</p>\n<ul role=\"list\">\n<li>Qualitative</li>\n<li>Quantitative</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Qualitative data is subject and is all about how your customers and prospects feel about your brand and products.</h3>\n<p>Customer surveys such as <a href=\"https://www.getcloudapp.com/blog/net-promoter-score\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Net Promoter Score (NPS)</a> and <a href=\"https://www.getcloudapp.com/blog/customer-satisfaction-score-csat\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Customer Satisfaction (CSAT)</a> help you understand the way customers <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/13/startup-essentials-stop-overcomplicating-your-processes/\">currently view you and your solutions</a>. It helps you empathize with your customers and see their journey through their eyes &#8211; allowing you to develop better customer experiences and products.</p>\n<h3>Quantitative data is all about the numbers.</h3>\n<p>Did customers <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/11/28/increase-ecommerce-sales-with-adaptive-ecommerce/\">open the onboarding emails</a> after they subscribed to your app? Did you get more sales from customers who bought products in the last 6 months or the last 12 months? How many customer complaints have you received after rolling out a new feature?</p>\n<p>This kind of data and much more like it will give you direct insights into customer behavior, and when cross-checked with qualitative data, will begin to form a clear picture of who your customer is and exactly what they want.</p>\n<p>Again, every assumption must be challenged and compared to real data.</p>\n<p>Once armed with this data, you can create “living” documents that are updated as you learn more about your customers.</p>\n<p>The first document we recommend creating is a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/30/personalizing-your-customer-service-with-6-strategies/\">customer persona</a>. This is a list of demographics, psychographics, and verified behavior of your customers.</p>\n<p>Another worthwhile document to have is the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/11/how-do-you-create-an-effective-journey-map-for-your-customers/\">customer journey map</a>. It documents the path prospects follow to become customers. It usually starts with some kind of &#8220;first contact&#8221; and ends in a renewal of service or another purchase.</p>\n<p><strong>And then there’s the empathy map.</strong></p>\n<p>It helps you to visualize the behaviors and attitudes of the user in a way UX teams can follow and reference when thinking about how and why a user interacts with their products.</p>\n<p><strong>Create those three documents to give you and your company the best progression-growth-map to follow.</strong></p>\n<p>There are plenty more progression-growth-map-docs you may wish to produce as you go through the product discovery process.</p>\n<h2>&#x200d;5 Tips for Effective Product Discovery</h2>\n<p><a href=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/employee-engagement.png\"><img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-172205 size-full\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/employee-engagement.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"750\" height=\"400\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/employee-engagement.png 750w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/employee-engagement-300x160.png 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/employee-engagement-260x139.png 260w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 750px) 100vw, 750px\" /></a></p>\n<p>The product discovery process is messy, sometimes confusing, and different for every business and market. That doesn’t mean there aren’t a few fundamentals you can use to make it easier and more effective.</p>\n<h3>&#x200d;Begin by Empathizing With Your Audience</h3>\n<p>Empathy should always be the starting point in product discovery. It forces you to look through your customers’ eyes and see the world as they do. The goal is to eliminate projection, assumption, and “intuition” and replace them with accurate observation and genuine understanding.</p>\n<h4>The key is to get specific.</h4>\n<p>Imagine just one customer. Describe everything you know about that one customer.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>What’s their perspective?</li>\n<li>What are their hopes and dreams, needs and desires?</li>\n<li>What are the fears and pains tormenting them?</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Fill this one customer with all the attributes and characteristics you’ve discovered about your real customers.</p>\n<p>The process will give you a robust image you can use to pinpoint the problem they need to be solved, the solution they require, and the right way to package it into a product they would buy.</p>\n<h3>&#x200d;Constantly Uncover Customer Problems</h3>\n<p>Product discovery isn’t linear, neat, or tidy. It’s chaotic.</p>\n<p>The only way to get the data you’re looking for is to embrace the mayhem. This is especially true when it comes to discovering your customers’ problems.</p>\n<p>There is always more to learn, and the day you stop is the day new products won’t be discovered. You have to remain hyper-curious about all the challenges your customers want to overcome because if you don’t, your competitors will.</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Survey your customers.</li>\n<li>Conduct customer interviews.</li>\n<li>Monitor social media.</li>\n<li>Collect reviews.</li>\n<li>Listen to customer complaints.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>&#x200d;Map Everything</h3>\n<p>We already mentioned empathy and customer journey maps, but you can map virtually anything to help you visualize each step and how they fit together.</p>\n<ul role=\"list\">\n<li>A customers typical day.</li>\n<li>Specific customer experience.</li>\n<li>The Customer’s journey to discovering your product and using it.</li>\n<li>Map out your own processes running behind the scenes that support your customer’s journey.</li>\n</ul>\n<p>Drawing visual maps <a href=\"https://www.producttalk.org/2016/01/why-drawing-maps-sharpens-your-thinking/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">help you think</a>. The visual map externalizes complex and abstract mental concepts and makes them concrete, easily understood, and more “real.”</p>\n<p>The added benefit is that once it’s out of your head, you’re not spending time thinking of the map while maintaining it in your mind &#8211; you can just think about the map you’re looking at, freeing up critical mental energy.</p>\n<p>I&#8217;d encourage everyone on your team to draw maps of processes, strategies, concepts, and ideas. If you want to see an explosion of growth &#8212; at the very least, have managers and decision-makers draw this visual map.</p>\n<h3>&#x200d;Don’t Settle for the First Solution You Devise</h3>\n<p>Coming up with an idea to solve your customer’s problem is easy… The first time.</p>\n<p>But that initial idea is probably not the right one to make into a product. It’s really easy and feels really good to move forward on the first idea presented (especially if it’s yours), but you have to verify that it matches more than one dimension of what the customer wants.</p>\n<p>Map your solution idea to the opportunities you find by analyzing the market and your customers. The act of identifying and drawing the map is a reminder of the customer’s actual needs and mitigates the risk of teams running with an idea and forgetting about the preferences of the people they’re building the solution for in the first place.</p>\n<ol>\n<li>Map many solutions.</li>\n<li>Generate tons of ideas.</li>\n<li>Mash them together and pull them apart.</li>\n</ol>\n<p>That’s how you find the idea that sticks out as the true solution and the viable product for your customers.</p>\n<h3>&#x200d;Break Your Team out of Their Silos</h3>\n<p>Everyone on your team specializes in something:</p>\n<ul role=\"list\">\n<li>Marketing</li>\n<li>Designing</li>\n<li>Coding</li>\n<li>Selling</li>\n</ul>\n<p>In your team&#8217;s specializations, they’re expected to perform the function of their role without assuming the tasks or responsibilities of anyone else’s role &#8211; a buzzing hive of perfectly divided labor. You’ll need all hands on deck when figuring out which product to make.</p>\n<p>Encourage teams to pull everyone out of their silos and come together during product discovery to leverage each other’s perspectives and unique knowledge.</p>\n<p>It’s also helpful to get everyone’s opinion on what product to move forward with building, first. The type of heavy collaboration this involves isn’t easy.</p>\n<p>There will be plenty of disagreements and arguments, but if you can work past them, you’ll tend to develop better products that your entire organization believes in &#8211; inspiring them to work even harder to make the product as perfect for the customer as they can.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/06/24/5-product-discovery-tips-for-building-solutions-customers-will-buy/\">5 Product Discovery Tips for Building Solutions Customers Will Buy</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 24 Jun 2020 18:01:05 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Tips-for-Building-Solutions-Customers-Will-Buy.jpg","linkMd5":"2e7389a661b494968a1eb3514502e572","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn47@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-24-324_8689c06fc00920ca.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Tips-for-Building-Solutions-Customers-Will-Buy.jpg","destWidth":1280,"destHeight":762,"sourceBytes":175820,"destBytes":87526,"author":"Joe Martin","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Tips-for-Building-Solutions-Customers-Will-Buy-300x179.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn95@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-11-583_15ba9c7ee7ebc22b.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/04/technology-and-business.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn23@2020_2/2020/08/23/15-18-14-988_da049279b80d6e6c.webp","https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/employee-engagement.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn72@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-21-519_ce8f2b217c4f65cf.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195875109},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:57","title":"Can AI Be Fairer Than a Human Judge in the Judicial System?","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=171218","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/14/can-ai-be-fairer-than-a-human-judge-in-the-judicial-system/\" title=\"Can AI Be Fairer Than a Human Judge in the Judicial System?\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Can-AI-Be-Fairer-Than-a-Human-Judge--300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"AI as a robot judge\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Can-AI-Be-Fairer-Than-a-Human-Judge--300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Can-AI-Be-Fairer-Than-a-Human-Judge--260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Can-AI-Be-Fairer-Than-a-Human-Judge-.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Artificial intelligence has become an integral part of everything from <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/23/can-artificial-intelligence-replace-the-role-of-doctors/\">medical diagnostics</a> technology to systems that analyze electoral candidates and provide accurate information to voters.</p>\n<p>However, there are still many AI skeptics, and especially those who question <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2018/03/07/ais-role-driving-sales-experience/\">the role of AI</a> in the justice system. Many legal leaders and institutions are curious about the efficiency benefits AI brings to the field. But the big question is: can AI help make the judicial system fairer?</p>\n<h2>The current landscape.</h2>\n<p>Many claim that the <a href=\"https://home.ubalt.edu/shapiro/rights_course/Chapter2text.htm\">United States&#8217; judicial system</a> is one of the most robust in the world. It has a Judicial Commission responsible for dictating policies to other federal courts.</p>\n<p>The Judicial body is made up of the president of the Supreme Court and 26 judges who represent the authority figures in courts, corresponding to courts of the first instance and the federal courts of appeal.</p>\n<p>The U.S also has a state judicial system so that each state can focus on its own cases based on state law.</p>\n<p>Each of these structures has a role in the United States judicial system, and each player knows what he or she has to do within it. However, due to the vastness of these systems, information management is cumbersome, especially when judges must decide which cases to attend and which aspects of the law they must take into account.</p>\n<h2>Error cases.</h2>\n<p>The American justice system is not without flaws, and a number of cases have exposed them.  Judges have condemned innocent people because the information used to convict them was imprecise and poorly analyzed.</p>\n<p>One such case concerns a man named Richard Anthony Jones, <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2018/08/30/us/kansas-doppelganger-richard-jones.html\">who spent almost two decades in jail for a crime he didn&#8217;t commit. </a>His crime: having facial features similar to those of a criminal. Despite finding no evidence or DNA matches that conclusively identified Jones as the robber, several witnesses identified him after police showed them a series of photographs.</p>\n<h2>The failure of the judicial system.</h2>\n<p>Seventeen years later, the justice system managed to identify Anthony&#8217;s “double,” a man who actually committed the robbery that Jones served time for. The &#8220;other&#8221; man, nicknamed &#8220;Ricky,&#8221; fled, but witnesses identified Jones &#8212; who bore an incredible resemblance to Ricky &#8212; as the guilty party.</p>\n<p>Once it was proven that the wrong man had been imprisoned, the judge confirmed that the procedures used in the original trial had not been the best. Jones was released, and as a &#8220;refund of his freedom,&#8221; he was offered a million dollars.</p>\n<h2>Will that money pay for 17 years of life in prison?</h2>\n<p>Craig Coley, 71, of Simi Valley, California, was also a victim of judicial inaccuracy and remained in jail for 38 years after he was mistakenly accused of the murder of his former partner and son in 1978.</p>\n<p>Coley was released in November 2017 after DNA tests showed that he was not linked to the case. <a href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-47355907\">He received $21 million in compensation</a>.</p>\n<h2>What can AI do for the judicial system?</h2>\n<p>As we can see, weaknesses in both human memory and the judicial system can lead to a person being wrongly imprisoned for decades on the basis of flimsy evidence.</p>\n<p>These obvious weaknesses <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/03/ais-man-behind-the-curtain/\">are where AI comes in</a>. Algorithms and machine learning-based tools can collect any volume of information, analyze evidence, and help identify people. Thanks to AI technology, patterns, and anomalies &#8212; such as the inconsistencies in the DNA of Jones and Coleigh – might have been quickly and accurately identified. The cases could have been classified and written sooner.</p>\n<p>Likewise, <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/11/evolving-relationship-between-artificial-intelligence-and-big-data/\">big data</a> can also help analyze crimes, since data can come not only from private sources such as the police but also from public sources on the web. Algorithms can detect various correlations and patterns, and meticulously analyze extensive data sets.</p>\n<p>Big data can be a great help in court trials all over the country in real-time and help assess the individual performance of judges.</p>\n<p>But not everything about AI is rosy.</p>\n<h2>AI error biases.</h2>\n<p>AI-based <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/12/history-of-facial-recognition-technology-and-its-bright-future/\">facial recognition systems</a> can monitor and recognize defendants. AI can support sentencing and bail decisions, and train <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/12/when-it-comes-to-neural-networks-weve-only-scratched-the-surface/\">neural networks</a> to help better assess the evidence.</p>\n<p>However, AI technology is constantly evolving, and some judicial entities have applied facial recognition systems that proved to be less-than-precise identity verification tools.</p>\n<p>Details such as skin color, facial features can wrongly identify an innocent person as guilty. This has happened in recent tests of Rekognition, Amazon&#8217;s facial recognition technology, which is being used by official entities in the United States.</p>\n<h2>The future of AI in the judicial system.</h2>\n<p>Although there is still a long way to go before the U.S. has a model judicial system that incorporates artificial intelligence, some observers believe that goal is getting closer.</p>\n<p>In Australia, a team of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/25/is-artificial-intelligence-racial-bias-being-suppressed/\">artificial intelligence experts</a> and lawyers has begun to develop the Split-Up system, which uses use rule-based reasoning and neural networks to predict the results of property disputes in divorces and other family law cases.</p>\n<p>The United Kingdom is implementing a &#8220;Predictive Crime Map,&#8221; which uses Big Data to pinpoint <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/04/11/online-id-verification-a-primer-for-fintech-businesses/\">areas that are most prone to crime</a>.</p>\n<p>The United States has also applied the power of Big Data in several cities. In Los Angeles, it helped reduce robberies and violent crimes by 10% to 30%.</p>\n<h2>In Estonia, the future is already here.</h2>\n<p>Estonia is one of the most innovative countries in the field of AI. There, artificial intelligence is much more than a tool that will help optimize and improve the judicial system. The country is betting on making AI the judge, and not just the tool.</p>\n<p>The Estonian case raises and develops the <a href=\"https://www.wired.com/story/can-ai-be-fair-judge-court-estonia-thinks-so/\">idea that robots can act as virtual judges</a>.</p>\n<p>It should be noted that this AI program raises robot judges who can make decisions in minor cases. A <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/11/ai-startups-need-data-and-the-government-needs-help/\">robot judge for small cases</a> would undoubtedly help manage paperwork, decision-making and make judicial services much more efficient.</p>\n<p>Ott Velsberg, the Estonian government’s Chief Data Officer, was tasked with designing an <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/02/21/3-tech-solutions-that-will-help-you-survive-baby-boomer-brain-drain/\">AI tool to deal with backlogged</a> court cases. The tool he came up with analyses the documentation presented by the parties and issues a judgment.</p>\n<p>In this way, Estonia seeks to deal with dozens of cases that judges and court clerks cannot currently deal with.</p>\n<p>Despite being a country of 1.3 million people, Estonia has made great advances in AI that are helping to automate government functions. Maybe other countries will follow suit if Estonia has success in this area.</p>\n<p>As expected, advances in AI have reduced the number of government jobs. However, Estonia has also developed an application that feeds the CVs of laid-off workers into a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/10/why-multicultural-marketing-needs-machine-learning-and-facial-tracking/\">machine learning system</a> that matches their skills with employers’ needs.</p>\n<p>Using AI and Machine Learning together is a great tool to help workers to land new jobs that align with their skill set.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/05/14/can-ai-be-fairer-than-a-human-judge-in-the-judicial-system/\">Can AI Be Fairer Than a Human Judge in the Judicial System?</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com\">ReadWrite</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 14 May 2020 21:00:38 +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Can-AI-Be-Fairer-Than-a-Human-Judge-.jpg","linkMd5":"a88e65f9e7045d643838cfaea01a3711","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn11@2020_3/2020/08/23/15-18-19-466_224676644cbfae30.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Can-AI-Be-Fairer-Than-a-Human-Judge-.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":44700,"destBytes":39148,"author":"Rana Rajput","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Can-AI-Be-Fairer-Than-a-Human-Judge--300x185.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn95@2020_4/2020/08/23/15-18-18-910_b11d417f37e7b2d4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598195877196},{"createdTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:18:00","title":"What Can Your Company Learn from Fast-Growing Startups?","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=168052","description":"<div><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/11/what-can-your-company-learn-from-fast-growing-startups/\" title=\"What Can Your Company Learn from Fast-Growing Startups?\"><img width=\"300\" height=\"185\" src=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/What-Can-Your-Company-Learn-from-Fast-Growing-Startups-300x185.jpg\" class=\"attachment-medium size-medium wp-post-image\" alt=\"fast growing companies\" style=\"margin-bottom: 15px;\" srcset=\"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/What-Can-Your-Company-Learn-from-Fast-Growing-Startups-300x185.jpg 300w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/What-Can-Your-Company-Learn-from-Fast-Growing-Startups-260x160.jpg 260w, https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/What-Can-Your-Company-Learn-from-Fast-Growing-Startups.jpg 825w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 300px) 100vw, 300px\" /></a></div><p>Startup businesses continue to find creative ways to evolve rapidly and <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/10/why-multicultural-marketing-needs-machine-learning-and-facial-tracking/\">adapt to market changes</a> with limited resources. They spend a great deal of time and effort researching innovative techniques, finding and testing the best management methods, and implementing the right tools for their teams.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://www.techrepublic.com/article/project-managers-playing-larger-role-in-organizational-agility/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">32 percent</a> of executives claim that choosing the right technologies is crucial to achieving future success and growth. Furthermore, <a href=\"https://www.techrepublic.com/article/project-managers-playing-larger-role-in-organizational-agility/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">49 percent</a> of executives believe that investing in technology and embracing digital transformation are key areas to focus on within the next three to five years.</p>\n<p>The truth is that many medium-sized and enterprise-level businesses can learn from fast-growing startups that have successfully leveraged resources in cost-effective ways. Such ways allow them to spread out their <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/18/how-to-bootstrap-your-startup-for-years-without-funding/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">already limited resources</a> without sacrificing overall growth.</p>\n<p>In this article, we will discuss the top five ways that your company can learn from fast-growing startups, companies as well as some actionable tips to take them to the next level.</p>\n<h2><b>5 Innovative Tips from Startups for Growing Companies</b></h2>\n<h3><b>1. Streamline Communications</b></h3>\n<p>High-profile startups like GitLab, InVision, Zapier, Buffer, and Basecamp are choosing to build remote-first teams. The number of people working remotely in the United States has risen by nearly <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2014/03/08/your-money/when-working-in-your-pajamas-is-more-productive.html?_r=0\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">80 percent</a> between 2005 and 2012. And the trend continues to grow.</p>\n<p>The benefits of a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/12/05/remote-working-culture-the-facts-business-owners-need-to-know/\">remote-first workforce</a> are clear. Although there’s one huge caveat. For a <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/10/22/the-boundaryless-era-the-time-for-distributed-teams/\">distributed team</a> to be successful, you must streamline communications.</p>\n<p>Streamlining communications includes internal communication with team members and external communication with clients, suppliers, and stakeholders. Businesses that don’t have a solid communication plan and tools to streamline it will struggle with growing and scaling.</p>\n<p>Furthermore, the risks of miscommunication and misinterpretation can result in project delays. They can even hurt sales and customer relationships over the long term.</p>\n<p>The good news is that you can keep the lines of communication open and even streamline communication across multiple channels and applications.</p>\n<p>For the majority of companies, email remains the main source of external communications. With the right tools in hand, you can turn email into the teamwork hub. While bringing together internal and external communications, you can also let each team member work from a preferred platform, whether it’s Gmail, Slack, or Trello.</p>\n<h3><b>2. Minimize Resource Waste</b></h3>\n<p>Many larger businesses make the all-too-common mistake of <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/29/the-5-most-common-pr-mistakes-and-how-to-avoid-them/\">wasting resources</a>. Mainly time, money, tools, and even talent. Proper resource allocation is a common challenge among many businesses today.</p>\n<p>Furthermore, many businesses purchase software or subscribe to the newest, shiniest platform or tool only to discover that <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/13/startup-essentials-stop-overcomplicating-your-processes/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">communication and processes became more complicated</a> rather than easier. Many businesses don’t end up using those tools to the full extent, which ends up being a waste of money.</p>\n<p>Large companies can learn from <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/07/17/teach-me-10-things-about-running-a-successful-crowdfunding-campaign/\">fast-growing startups</a> too. Let’s take Buffer, for example, the San Francisco-based social media analytics and scheduling services company. It’s a small tech startup with a remarkable open-book policy. It has published its financial data since its inception in <a href=\"https://www.inc.com/magazine/201602/victoria-finkle/buffer-startup-spending-analysis.html\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">2010</a>.</p>\n<p>To cut costs, Buffer closed its offices and moved to a distributed workforce. While it still pays for co-working space for the employees that want it, it’s still a significant saving to a physical office.</p>\n<p>Savings can be found throughout your business. For instance, before you sign up for the next latest and greatest software, consider your organizational goals. What are you trying to achieve?</p>\n<p>Then, find the <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/19/software-pre-launch-checklist-6-things-you-have-to-do/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">tools and resources that help you achieve those goals</a>. In the easiest and most cost-effective way possible. Remember, tools and platforms are designed to help support your existing workflow. And not to find workarounds to fit the tool.</p>\n<h3><b>3. Build an Agile Culture</b></h3>\n<p>Many companies today—both small and large—are realizing the benefits of organizational agility. Building an agile organizational culture has proven to help improve collaboration, encourage design thinking, and spark innovation.</p>\n<p>According to the <a href=\"https://www.stateofagile.com/#ufh-i-521251909-13th-annual-state-of-agile-report/473508\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">State of Agile Report</a>, the reasons cited for adopting an agile culture include accelerating software delivery, increased productivity, and a reduction in costs.</p>\n<p>The adoption of an agile culture is the secret to adapting, evolving, and maintaining a competitive edge in today’s fast-paced market. And more and more companies of various shapes, sizes, scope, and industries are beginning to understand that.</p>\n<p>Furthermore, <a href=\"https://www.techrepublic.com/article/project-managers-playing-larger-role-in-organizational-agility/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">53 percent</a> of executives claim that they are hyper-focused on building organizations that embrace change.</p>\n<p>Building an agile culture involves adopting innovative techniques and practices. Specific standards will encourage and support collaboration, new ideas, creative thinking and problem-solving, adaptable work styles, and flexible work environments.</p>\n<h3><b>4. Break Down Silos</b></h3>\n<p>Silos are by-products of a working model far less cross-functional than today’s needs. The individual work structures pose many risks to companies, including increasing work, decreasing productivity, and even duplicating work efforts.</p>\n<p>However, startups have worked to break down work silos. Instead of working individually, teams can work together on similar projects and initiatives, by <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/09/the-top-work-operating-systems-of-2020/\">adopting a more collaborative</a>, agile work environment and atmosphere.</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/01/10/7-teamwork-trends-that-will-impact-your-business/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Cultivating a collaborative work environment</a> can help ensure that all team members are aware of what others are working on. It can also help complete tasks and projects faster to grow further and even speed up the decision-making process.</p>\n<p>Leveraging certain communication tools and project management platforms can allow companies to break down work silos and improve collaboration. Regular project iterations or “sprints” are also helpful.</p>\n<h3><b>5. Leverage Automation</b></h3>\n<p>Time is another limited resource for businesses. Therefore, any technique or tool that can be implemented to make performing tasks easier will help minimize the amount of resource waste.</p>\n<p>The best way to do this is to build automation or leverage AI capabilities. Like those specific tasks and projects can function on “autopilot.” Taking a few minutes to set up automation to streamline certain tasks can save hours of time.</p>\n<p>Leveraging automation can be a massive time-saver for companies. Automated tools can save team members time, reduce labor costs, reduce risks, increase efficiency and productivity, and reduce waste.</p>\n<p>The good news is that automation-powered tools don’t require having a full-time tech department or a team of developers to implement and support.</p>\n<p>For example, Gmelius offers a wide range of tools that can continue with other tools to help build automation. The tools are a way each member of a team can get work done without constantly switching from platform to platform to perform tasks.</p>\n<h2><b>Growth Is a Mindset</b></h2>\n<p>As an established business, you might have a plan for how to grow your company. However, it is likely that by learning from fast-growing startups there is some <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/02/04/startups-dont-need-to-be-revolutionary-they-need-to-be-different/\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">room for change</a> that just might make growth much more achievable.</p>\n<p>All in all, many small businesses and startups have gotten creative in how they <a href=\"https://readwrite.com/2019/11/15/it-project-management-a-love-affair/\">manage teams</a>, projects, and processes. It ensures that they extend all their resources as much as possible without incurring budget overruns.</p>\n<p>Many have also adopted new leadership and management techniques to encourage high-level innovative thinking that allows them to further grow, scale, and reach their goals.</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://readwrite.com/2020/03/11/what-can-your-company-learn-from-fast-growing-startups/\">What Can Your Company Learn from Fast-Growing Startups?</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" +0000","feedId":271,"bgimg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/What-Can-Your-Company-Learn-from-Fast-Growing-Startups.jpg","linkMd5":"f637479c1f5b43fa2912d7147d71fbfe","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn10@2020_5/2020/08/23/15-18-09-662_1b049e298bb9e85a.webp","metaImg":"https://images.readwrite.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/What-Can-Your-Company-Learn-from-Fast-Growing-Startups.jpg","destWidth":825,"destHeight":510,"sourceBytes":51181,"destBytes":43312,"author":"Ermias 23:17:49","updatedTime":"2020-08-23 23:17:49","title":"The 7 Best Treadmills for Home (2020)","link":"https://readwrite.com/?p=173781","description":"<div><a
